AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
835 PM EST FRI DEC 31 2010

UPDATED TO ISSUE A HIGH WIND WARNING.

.DISCUSSION...UPGRADE WIND ADVISORY TO A WARNING. LATEST NAM AND
LOCAL WRF MODEL SHOWS INCREASING 850MB WINDS TO 60KTS+ LATE TONIGHT
AND SATURDAY. SITUATION IS NOT IDEA FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH
WINDS...BUT FEEL WINDS STRONG ENOUGH TO DOWN TREES AND POWER LINES
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND FOOTHILLS. MAY NEED TO ISSUE AN
ADVISORY FOR WINDS LATER TONIGHT FOR THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

MODELS SHOW STRONG DYNAMIC FORCING MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
LATE TONIGHT AND SATURDAY. BROAD DIVERGENCE ALOFT...AGEOSTROPHIC
VERTICAL CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF
JET...AND FRONTOGENETIC LIFT ALONG FRONT WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD
RAIN. ENOUGH ELEVATED INSTABILITY ALONG WITH STRONG DYNAMIC LIFT TO
INCLUDE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EST FRI DEC 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STRONG UPPER LOW PROGGED
BY MODELS TO CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH THE UPPER PLAINS
STATES THROUGH 12Z SATURDAY. AS LOW MOVES NORTHEAST...SURFACE COLD
FRONT WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH TENNESSEE ON SATURDAY...MAKING IT TO
THE PLATEAU-CHATTANOOGA LINE BY AROUND 00Z SUNDAY.

IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...STRONG LOW LEVEL SOUTH-SOUTHWEST WIND FLOW
WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT...WITH POTENTIAL CONDITIONS SETTING UP FOR
A MINIMAL MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS IN EAST TENNESSEE.
WILL BE ISSUING A WIND ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS DUE TO THE HIGHER
WINDS/GUSTS EXPECTED.

LATEST HPC GUIDANCE ALONG WITH MODELS PRECIP GUIDANCE ALSO
INDICATES THAT GENERALLY PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL RANGE FROM THREE
QUARTERS TO GENERALLY AT OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE AN INCH ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES ARE MUCH HIGHER AND
ABOVE TWO INCHES ACROSS THE AREA...THUS WILL NOT BE GOING WITH A
FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME FOR SATURDAY.  

HAVE INTRODUCED MENTION OF THUNDER FOR PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE COUNTIES DUE TO PROXIMITY OF EXPECTED BETTER
LIFT/INSTABILITY AND TIMING WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY ON SATURDAY
AFTERNOON. TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY GOOD THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...AND
WILL NOT BE MAKING MUCH MORE INVOLVING CHANGES TO FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...GENERALLY DRY AND 
TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH THE LONG TERM FOLLOWING 
DEPARTING SATURDAY SYSTEM AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL. MINOR 
SHORT WAVES PROJECTED TO TRANSLATE THROUGH THIS ZONAL FLOW...BUT 
ONLY SOME INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER EXPECTED WITH THESE WEAK FEATURES 
AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS...WHICH SHOULD GENERALLY AVERAGE CLOSE TO 
CLIMO...DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

857 
FXUS64 KMRX 310818
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST FRI DEC 31 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AND WEAKEN OVER THE AREA. A COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE EAST INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE TONIGHT. WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL 
INCREASE IN STRENGTH. TEMPERATURES ABOUT 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
TODAY AND WELL ABOVE NORMAL TONIGHT. PERIODS OF SUNSHINE TODAY WITH 
CLOUDY SKIES TONIGHT. LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST 
MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CONCERN CONTINUES TO 
BE A SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE REGION ON SATURDAY.  WITH STRONG 
WARMING WITH THE SYSTEM...TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB INTO THE 50S 
ACROSS THE CWA FOR AN ALL RAIN EVENT.  PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE 
FROM A HALF INCH TO AN INCH...AND WITH SNOW REMAINING AT HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...THE COMBINATION OF SNOWMELT AND RUNOFF COULD BE AN 
ISSUE.  THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD MOVE THROUGH FAIRLY 
QUICKLY WITH SHOWERS LINGERING SATURDAY EVENING AND ENDING 
OVERNIGHT.  WILL MOVE INTO A DRY PERIOD BEHIND THE SYSTEM.  FLOW 
ALOFT BECOMES ZONAL BY MONDAY FOR A GENERALLY DRY FORECAST THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER...THERE ARE A COUPLE OF WEAK 
WAVES MOVING THROUGH DURING THE PERIOD...ONE ON TUESDAY AND ANOTHER 
ON THURSDAY.  THE ONE OF TUESDAY IS VERY WEAK WITH LITTLE MOISTURE 
AND ONLY EXPECT TO SEE A BRIEF INCREASE IN CLOUDS AS IT MOVES 
THROUGH.  THE SHORT WAVE PROGGED INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY IS 
STRONGER WITH DECENT MOISTURE...BUT MAIN ENERGY SHOULD STAY TO OUR 
SOUTH.  IF THIS WAVE TRACKS A BIT FARTHER NORTH...IT COULD BRING 
SOME PRECIP INTO THE AREA.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST THU DEC 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK UPPER RIDGE WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY WITH LOW LEVEL SOUTHWEST 
FLOW CONTINUING. THIS WILL RESULT IN CONTINUED WARMING ACROSS THE 
AREA WITH TEMPS MUCH ABOVE NORMAL FOR FRIDAY. SCATTERED TO BROKEN 
LOW-MID CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO ALSO STREAM NORTHEAST INTO THE 
REGION WITH SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS THROUGH FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE 
WITH PARTLY SUNNY FORECAST FOR FRIDAY BASED UPON EXPECTED TRENDS. 
WILL ALSO GO CLOSER TO GFS TEMPS ACROSS THE AREA. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CONCERN FOR THE 
LONG TERM CONTINUES TO BE THE POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM ON 
SATURDAY. LATEST MODEL RUNS CONTINUE TO SHOW UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
SIGNIFICANTLY AMPLIFYING IN ADVANCE OF THE SYSTEM WITH STRENGTHENING 
SOUTHERLY FLOW. TIMING REMAINS REASONABLY CONSISTENT. WITH TEMPS 
PROJECTED TO CLIMB TO OVER 10 DEGREES C AT 850 MB ON SATURDAY...AND 
WITH QPFS IN THE 0.5 TO 1.0 INCH RANGE...SNOW MELT/RUNOFF COULD 
BECOME AN ISSUE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. ABOUT THE ONLY UNCERTAINTY
WITH THIS EVENT IS HOW FAST IT WILL EXIT WITH THE NAM CONTINUING TO
KEEP SOME PRECIP IN THE AREA INTO EARLY SUNDAY.

REMAINDER OF FORECAST APPEARS GENERALLY TRANQUIL AT THIS TIME AS 
UPPER FLOW DEAMPLIFIES INTO A FAST...NEARLY ZONAL FLOW. MINOR 
SHORTWAVES TRANSLATE THROUGH THIS FLOW...BUT NONE ARE SIGNIFICANT 
ENOUGH TO WARRANT POPS. THUS CONTINUED DRY FORECAST FROM SUNDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY. TEMPS SHOULD RANGE NEAR CLIMO IN THIS REGIME. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED SLIGHTLY COOLER HPC VALUES.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

CHANCE POPS FOR FORECAST AREA INTO THE AFTERNOON WITH SOUTHWEST

INCH ACROSS THE AREA. LAST FEW IR SATELLITE IMAGES WERE CONTINUING
TO HINT AT BREAKS IN THE LOW-MID CLOUDS ACROSS NORTH ALABAMA THAT
SHOULD ADVECT NORTHEAST INTO THE AREA IN DECENT SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST THU DEC 30 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SHORT WAVE TROF WILL TRAVERSE 
THE AREA TODAY. IN ADDITION TO WEAK LIFT...THE SYSTEM HAS LIMITED 
AVAILABILITY TO MOISTURE IN THE LOWER LEVELS. THEREFORE...VIRGA MAY

OR FREEZING DRIZZLE CONCEPT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AS 
TEMPERATURES ARE HOVERING RIGHT AROUND THE FREEZING MARK OR A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW. STAYED WITH THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THIS 
POSSIBILITY BUT IT SHOULD BE RATHER LIMITED AS PRECIPITATION WILL BE 
VERY LIGHT AND WARMER AIR STREAMING IN ALOFT SHOULD BOOST SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES ABOVE FREEZING IN THIS AREA FAIRLY QUICKLY THIS 
MORNING. MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN INTO THE AFTERNOON BUT 
NOT HOPEFUL THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL PRODUCE ANYTHING MORE THAN SPOTTY 
LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE. KEPT A DRY FORECAST GOING TONIGHT AS RIDGING 
STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN INCREASING SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL TRANSPORT WARMER TEMPERATURES AND GULF MOISTURE INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. HIGHS WILL REACH THE 55 TO 60 RANGE IN 
MOST SPOTS FRIDAY. LIFT WILL INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER JET 
ON THE EAST SIDE OF AN UPPER LOW IN THE PLAINS MOVES INTO THE MS/OH 
VALLEY REGION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TIMING...AND POPS 
RISE TO CATEGORICAL BY SATURDAY MORNING. STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE 
ACTING ON SOME WEAK ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF THUNDERSTORMS TO WESTERN AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS SATURDAY MORNING. 
STRONG MOISTURE TRANSPORT AND GOOD LIFT COMBINED WITH A SLOW-MOVING 
FRONT SHOULD MEAN A POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAIN...WITH OVER 1 INCH QPF 
EXPECTED IN SOUTHERN AREAS. A SOUTHERLY 850 MB JET AROUND 50 KTS MAY 
ALSO BRING A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT LATE FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING. 

PRECIP SHIFTS EAST OF THE AREA...WITH DECREASING POPS SATURDAY 
NIGHT. THE UPPER FLOW CONTINUES TO BE FROM THE SW...SO THE PUSH OF 
COLD AIR LAGS THE SURFACE FRONT. THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH ON 
SUNDAY WILL BRING STRONGER COLD ADVECTION...AND TEMPS MAY FALL 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON DESPITE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. A ZONAL FLOW WILL 
DEVELOP FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. MODELS INDICATE SOME 
SHORTWAVES PASSING THROUGH THE FLOW...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LACKING IN 
THESE FEATURES...SO WILL KEEP MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY DRY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  34  58  46  57 /  30  10  10  80  80

AND FOR THE AREAS MENTIONED IN OUR SPS.

454 
FXUS64 KMRX 292011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST WED DEC 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE AT 500
MILLIBARS MOVING NORTHEAST THROUGH ARKANSAS WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD
WARM ADVECTION...LOW-MID CLOUDS AND SCATTERED LIGHT PRECIP TOWARD
THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THURSDAY AND INTO THURSDAY AFTERNOON.
RECENT 988-D RETURNS FROM AREA RADARS DO INDICATE SOME LIGHT PRECIP
MOVING NORTHEAST THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE AS OF 1830Z THIS
AFTERNOON. 

MODELS DIFFER IN PRECIP TIMING TONIGHT...WITH GFS BEING A LITTLE
MORE AGRESSIVE IN MOVING LIGHT PRECIP NORTHEAST TOWARD THE FORECAST
AREA...COMPARED TO SLOWER NAM. WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE. BELIEVE
THAT TIMING WILL BE CLOSE IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA COUNTIES...AND WILL KEEP IN MENTION OF LIGHT MIXTURE OF
RAIN/FREEZING RAIN. AT THIS TIME...WILL NOT GO AHEAD WITH WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY...BUT WILL HANDLE WITH A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT
TO HIGHLIGHT CHANCE OF SOME MIXED INITIAL PRECIP. TEMPS HAVE A
COUPLE OF HOURS TIME PERIOD TOWARD 12Z WHERE THEY WILL BE AROUND 32
DEGREES IN TRI/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...BUT WILL NOT BE MAKING MUCH IN
WAY OF GOING FORECAST CHANGES...AS FEEL THAT CURRENT FORECAST IS IN
PRETTY GOOD SHAPE. 

WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY...WITH SYSTEM MOVING THE
REST OF THE WAY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY AROUND/SHORTLY AFTER
18Z TIME FRAME.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A STRONG RIDGE WILL BE 
OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH A CLOSED 
LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL ROCKIES AND TRACKING NORTHEASTWARD 
TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. THE LOW WILL DEPRESS THE RIDGE AND ALLOW THE 
FOLLOWING DEEP TROUGH TO MOVE EAST. THIS WILL PLACE THE TN VALLEY 
REGION IN A DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW...RESULTING IN ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES. 

ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW FOLLOWS THE UPPER LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES, 
AND SURFACE FRONT EXTENDS SOUTH OVER SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY EARLY 
SATURDAY. THE FRONT SHOWS SIGNS OF WEAKENING IN THE CENTRAL PORTIONS 
OVER THE TN VALLEY REGION, WHICH IMPLIES IN THE GFS A BIT OF A 
LOWERING OF QPF AMOUNTS.

PRECIP CHANCES WILL BEGIN RISING FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS GULF MOISTURE 
TRANSPORT INCREASES AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. GENERAL MODEL CONSENSUS 
HAS SLOWED THE FRONT AND HENCE THE PRECIP CHANCES HAVE BEEN RAISED A 
BIT FOR SATURDAY. LOOKS LIKE BEST TIMING FOR HEAVIEST RAIN WILL BE 
FROM ABOUT SATURDAY 12Z TO ABOUT SUNDAY 12Z. P

BIGGEST ISSUE RIGHT NOW IS SNOW PACK IN THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA LINE AND IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THIS WILL 
MELT QUITE A BIT BETWEEN NOW AND WHEN THE WEEKEND RAINS HIT, BUT THE 
SOIL WILL LIKELY BE QUITE MOIST, PROVIDING A BIT OF A FLOOD 
POTENTIAL. IF THE SNOW DOES NOT MELT AND LEAVES A SUBSTANTIAL PACK, 
THE WE MIGHT HAVE A PROBLEM, ESPECIALLY IN SMALLER STREAMS COMING 
OUT OF THE MOUNTAINS. WILL ADVISE FOLLOWING SHIFTS TO BE AWARE OF 
POSSIBLE STATEMENTS OR WATCHES.

POPS END BY SUNDAY WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS...BUT AS UPPER LOW 
SPEEDS ON EAST...A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS AND SHOULD MEAN 
TEMPS CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. 

PREVIOUS SUPPORT FOR A TUESDAY SYSTEM SOUTH OF US HAS ALL BUT ERODED 
AND BUT ON THURSDAY ANOTHER FRONT LOOMS ON THE FAR HORIZON. PUT SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE LOW CHANCE IN EARLY THURSDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST WED DEC 29 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING EAST 
TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI/OHIO VALLEY WILL CONTINUE ON ITS TREK ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH TODAY AND TONIGHT. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
TODAY IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS SYSTEM. ATMOSPHERE MOISTENS 
SUFFICIENTLY ALONG WITH AN INCREASE IN ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR SOME 
LIGHT RAIN PRODUCTION MAINLY AFFECTING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE 
WARM/MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL GENERATE LIQUID PRECIP ALOFT BUT MAY 
BE IN THE FORM OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN THE LOCATION OF THE COLDEST MIN TEMPS AROUND 
FREEZING OR JUST BELOW. WEAKENING SHORT WAVE PRESSES STEADILY EAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY MID DAY. TRENDED CHANCE POPS 
BACK THROUGH THE DAY IN SYNC WITH MODEL DEPICTION OF DECREASING 
MOISTURE/LIFT AS FORECAST AREA AWAITS STRONGER LATE WEEK SYSTEM. 
STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A STRONG RIDGE WILL BE 
OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH A CLOSED 
LOW TRACKING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE PLAINS. THIS WILL PLACE THE TN 
VALLEY REGION IN A DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW...RESULTING IN ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES. 

PRECIP CHANCES WILL BEGIN RISING FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS THE CLOSED LOW 
TRACKS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES AND GULF MOISTURE TRANSPORT INCREASES 
AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT NEAR THE MS VALLEY. GENERAL MODEL CONSENSUS IS 
FOR THE BEST LIFT TO BE OVER OUR AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
MORNING. WILL RAISE POPS THIS TIME PERIOD TO LIKELY. THE COLD FRONT 
IS SLOW TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA DUE TO A SW FLOW ALOFT...SO PRECIP 
CHANCES LINGER INTO SATURDAY NIGHT. POPS END BY SUNDAY WITH SLIGHTLY 
COOLER TEMPS...BUT A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT SHOULD MEAN TEMPS CLOSE 
TO NORMAL FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. 

THE GFS HINTS AT A WEAK SYSTEM DEVELOPING TO OUR SOUTH ON 
TUESDAY...BUT THIS HAS NO SUPPORT FROM THE ECMWF AND THERE IS 
CONSIDERABLE SPREAD AMONG GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS...SO WILL KEEP 
TUESDAY DRY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 PM EST TUE DEC 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL REMAIN TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. ON 
WEDNESDAY...RIDGING WILL MOVE EAST ALLOWING FOR INCREASING SOUTHERLY 
WINDS ALOFT WILL PULL MOISTURE BACK INTO THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. SKY WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT PRODUCING SCATTERED LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION BEGINNING WEDNESDAY NIGHT. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE IS QUITE WARM...BUT SURFACE TEMPERATURES AT OR BELOW 
FREEZING WILL PRODUCE AREAS OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN-ICING. 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT AND DO NOT SEE A BIG CONCERN AT 
THIS TIME.

PRECIPITATION BECOME ALL RAIN FOR THURSDAY. COVERAGE REMAINS
SCATTERED WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE WESTERN COUNTIES.

WILL FOLLOW GFS MOS TEMPERATURES CLOSELY.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PREVIOUS REASONING FOR 
INCREASING POPS ON SATURDAY SEEMS VERY LIKELY TO OCCUR AS MODELS 
HAVE FRONT LOOKING RATHER POTENT. GFS SOUNDINGS HAVE AMPLE MOISTURE 
FOR SATURDAY, WITH PW'S WELL OVER AN INCH IN THE SOUTH AND EVEN IN 
THE CENTRAL VALLEY, AND NEAR AN INCH OR JUST OVER IN THE NORTH. THIS 
IS MUCH HIGHER THAN NORMAL FOR THE DATE. MODEL SOUNDINGS BASICALLY 
SATURATED ON SATURDAY SO HAVE INCREASED POPS AND SWEPT THIS INCREASE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FROM WEST TO EAST...IN THE FORM OF A NARROW 
BAND OF LIKELY POPS FROM AROUND 14Z SATURDAY THROUGH ABOUT 08Z 
SUNDAY. THIS SYSTEM RAPIDLY EXITS THE AREA FOR SOME DRYING ON MONDAY 
WITH A LITTLE FOLLOW ON SYSTEM EARLY TUESDAY WHICH WILL MAINLY 
AFFECT THE SOUTH AND MOUNTAINS. SATURATED SOUNDINGS AND HIGH K 
INDICES INDICATE THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINS BUT SPEED OF SYSTEM 
MIGHT ACT TO PRECLUDE TOO MUCH IN ONE PLACE. ALSO, LOW LEVEL 
INVERSION KEEPS CAPE VALUES TO ZERO. EXPECT LOW CLOUDS AND DRIPPY 
RAIN ALL DAY FOR NEW YEAR'S DAY. 

KEPT TEMPS CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE.

&&

001 
FXUS64 KMRX 280843
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EST TUE DEC 28 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL EXTEND NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN CONUS TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL 
PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND WARMER TEMPERATURES. BY WEDNESDAY 
HIGH TEMPS WILL BE CLOSER TO NORMAL...IN THE 40S TO NEAR 50. 

ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS TO THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...AND A MID/UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVE EAST ACROSS 
TX AND THE GULF COAST. WARM ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF 
THIS TROUGH WILL BRING A CHANCE OF RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SURFACE 
TEMPS WILL BE CLOSE TO FREEZING AT THE ONSET WITH A STRENGTHENING 
WARM NOSE ALOFT...SO THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SOME FREEZING RAIN 
IN NORTHEAST SECTIONS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BUT IT SHOULD BE 
FLEETING AS WARM ADVECTION TAKES OVER BY THURSDAY MORNING. A DEEP SW 
FLOW AND A GULF MOISTURE FEED WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF RAIN ACROSS THE 
AREA THROUGH THURSDAY...THOUGH FORCING LOOKS WEAK. TEMPERATURES WILL 
NUDGE A BIT ABOVE NORMAL...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO 00Z ECMWF DEPICTION OF THIS PERIOD.
TRIMMED BACK POPS A BIT THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. FORECAST AREA
MAY ALREADY BE IN THE WARM SECTOR OF CENTRAL U.S. SYSTEM AND MODELS
SHOWED HIGHER MEAN RH AND LIFT ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO
THE CENTRAL LAKES CLOSER TO THE SURFACE COLD FRONT. HIGHLY
AMPLIFIED SYSTEM PRESSES SLOWLY EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION BY SATURDAY AND ADJUSTED POPS FOR SHOWERS A LITTLE HIGHER AS
THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. SLOWED THE FRONTAL
PUSH DOWN A LITTLE BY INCREASING POPS TO A SMALL DEGREE SATURDAY
NIGHT AS UPPER TROF RIPS NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES WITH THE
SOUTHERN END OF THE TROF TRAILING WELL BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST ACROSS
THE CENTRAL PLAINS. IF THIS SCENARIO OCCURS...FRONT MAY BE VERY
SLOW IN ITS TRANSIT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST AND MAY HAVE TO ADJUST
POPS UP A LITTLE FOR SUNDAY. FOR NOW JUST STAYED WITH A SLIGHT
CHANCE POP ON SUNDAY AS UPPER LEVEL FLOW PARALLELS FRONT. WAS ABLE
TO KEEP THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PRECIP FREE AS DRIER WESTERLY
FLOW BUILDS IN WITH SURFACE RIDGE SETTLING SOUTH ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA.

SURFACE OVER AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. RIDGE STARTS TO BUILD INTO 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY, WITH NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHING AREA. FRIDAY 
THE GRADIENT TIGHTENS UP GOOD AND WITH IT COMES INCREASING SOUTHERLY 
FLOW WHICH WILL CREATE A DRAMATIC WARMUP OVER THE FRIGIDITY WE'VE 
HAD LATELY. WILL SEEM TROPICAL BY COMPARISON. WITH FRONT COMES 
INCREASED CHANCE FOR PRECIP, MAINLY RAIN, OVER THE WEEKEND. HAVE 
OPTED TO GO GANG BUSTERS OVER THE POPS SO FAR IN ADVANCE AND WILL 
ISSUE A MOVE CONSERVATIVE "CHANCE" WORDING. ANOTHER FLAT RIDGE AND 
SFC HIGH COMES IN FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.

537 
FXUS64 KMRX 270848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EST MON DEC 27 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
DECREASING MOISTURE DEPTH AND WARMING MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES WILL 
BRING AN END TO THE NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW EVENT THROUGH TODAY. THE 
FETCH OF THE GREAT LAKES WILL BE SHIFTED TO OUR NORTH THROUGH THE 
DAY...CUTTING OFF OUR MOISTURE SOURCE. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL STILL BE 
PRETTY STRONG...25-30 KTS IN THE 925-850 MB LAYER. THERE SHOULD BE 
ENOUGH LIFT AND MOISTURE THROUGH THE MORNING TO PRODUCE ANOTHER INCH 
OR TWO IN THE WARNING AREA...SO WILL KEEP THAT GOING UNTIL 18Z. 
WINDS WILL BE MARGINAL FOR ADVISORY CRITERIA...BUT WILL LEAVE THAT 
GOING AS WELL UNTIL 18Z. ALL PRECIP SHOULD END BY MIDNIGHT AS A 
BUILDING RIDGE PROVIDES A DRY AND STABLE AIR MASS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION PROVIDING DRY FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. WILL KEEP THE 
CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. BASED ON 
SOUNDINGS...MAY SEE A LITTLE SNOW DEVELOPING ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS MAINLY NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS. BUT 
SHOULD RETURN TO RAIN BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. A WEAKER SHORTWAVE 
TRACKS THROUGH ON FRIDAY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE SO KEPT FRIDAY DRY 
FOR NOW. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON SATURDAY AND LINGERS INTO 
SUNDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. PRECIPITATION TYPE SHOULD BE ALL RAIN FOR THE BOTH DAYS. 
SHOULD SEE A WARMING TREND FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

235 PM EST SUN DEC 26 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...DEEP UPPER TROUGH 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHAINS AND ASSOCIATED STRONG CYCLOGENESIS 
OFF THE MID-ATLANTIC COASTS WILL MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON-EVENING AS SYSTEM MOVES 
EAST AND CONTINUES TO INTENSIFY. GOOD OROGRAPHIC LIFT EXPECTED OVER 
THE NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. 

LATEST SATELITE SHOWS CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE INTO THE 
SOUTHERN PLATEAU. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE EFFECT THE SOUTHERN 
PLATEAU THROUGH EARLY EVENING. ANOTHER ENHANCEMENT NOTED ACROSS EAST 
KENTUCKY. THIS AREA WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. WILL MAINTAIN CURRENT WSW CONFIGURATION. 
HEAVY SNOWS LIKELY OVER THE MOUTNAINS WITH 1 INCH OR LESS PLATEAU 
AND CENTRAL VALLEY AND 1 TO 2 INCHES FOR NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND 
SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS.

INCREASING 850MB WINDS OF 25-30KTS LATE THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THE 
NIGHT...SO WILL ALSO MAINTAIN WIND ADVISORY.

MODELS DEPICTION OF 850-925MB MOISTURE SHOW A SLOW EROSION OF LOW 
CLOUDS MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. WILL NOT FOLLOW MOS FOR CLOUD 
FORECAST. GENERALLY FOLLOWED MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...THEN WILL MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLE PATTERN.  
MODEL CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN RATHER POOR AND CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW 
FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER...CURRENT TREND IS FOR AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TO MOVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  
MOISTURE AND ENERGY SUFFICIENT ENOUGH OF CHANCE POPS.  SHOULD SEE A 
BRIEF BREAK BETWEEN SYSTEMS AND HAVE WENT DRY ON FRIDAY.  A COLD 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH DURING THE WEEKEND AND FOR NOW...HAVE LEFT 
HIGHEST POPS ON SATURDAY.  WARMER TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED.

EXACTLY WHEN THE SNOW WILL BE HEAVIER AT AN AIRPOTS IS BEYOND OUR
SKILL LEVEL...AND LATER TAFS CAN AMEND AS NEEDED. CHANCES OF SNOW
SHOULD DECREASE TONIGHT. WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO BECOME GUSTY FROM
THE NW AS LOW PRESSURE STRENGTHENS OFF THE CAROLINA COAST.

219 
FXUS64 KMRX 260908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EST SUN DEC 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE TRANSITION TO A NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW EVENT HAS BEGUN AS THE 
850-700 MB TROUGH AXIS SHIFTS TO OUR EAST AND A SURFACE LOW BOMBS 
OFF THE CAROLINA COAST. THE POSITION OF THE LOW OFF THE COAST WILL 
CREATE A 925-850 FLOW FROM DUE NORTH THIS MORNING...TURNING TO A 
MORE NW DIRECTION AND INCREASING TO 20+ KTS THIS AFTERNOON AS THE 
LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST. STEEP LAPSE RATES UNDER THE 500 MB CIRCULATION 
WILL GENERATE SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA TODAY. THE 
MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER LOW TO THE EAST WILL DECREASE SYNOPTIC LIFT 
AND INSTABILITY TONIGHT...SO AFTER 00Z MOST OF THE SNOW ACCUMULATION 
IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND PLATEAU SHOULD END. DECREASING MOISTURE 
DEPTH AND DIMINISHING NW FLOW SHOULD BRING AN END TO MOST OF THE 
ACCUMULATING SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SW VA MONDAY AFTERNOON. 

SOME VALLEY LOCATIONS IN THE ADVISORY COULD PICK UP AN ADDITIONAL 
1-3 INCHES TODAY...DEPENDING ON WHERE THE HEAVIER SHOWERS HIT. 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE WARNING AREA COULD SEE 3-6 INCHES 
TODAY...AND ANOTHER 3-6 TONIGHT AS THE STRONG NW FLOW PERSISTS. THE 
NAM SHOWS INSTABILITY AND DEEP MOISTURE PERSISTING IN THE NORTH PAST 
00Z MON...SO THE ADVISORY FOR NE TN AND SW VA WILL BE EXTENDED TO 
MIDNIGHT. THE REST OF THE ADVISORY AREA AND THE WINTER STORM WARNING 
WILL REMAIN AS IS. WITH THE STRENGTHENING NW FLOW THIS AFTERNOON...A 
WIND ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS...FROM 21Z TO 18Z 
MONDAY. WIND CHILLS WILL ALSO REACH DANGEROUS VALUES...AND WILL 
HIGHLIGHT THIS IN THE CURRENT WSW PRODUCT. 


.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
ON MONDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING 
HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ACROSS THE REGION PROVIDING DRY FOR 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE. A WEAKER 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH ON FRIDAY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE SO KEPT ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON SATURDAY 
SO WILL CONTINUE THE LOW CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SATURDAY. SHOULD 
SEE A WARMING TREND FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 252009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST SAT DEC 25 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...DEEP CYCLOGENESIS 
CONTINUES TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH UPPER 
TROUGH DIGGING SOUTH OVER THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH FRONTOGENETIC BAND OVER THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES 
MOVING NORTHEAST ALLOWING WARNING TO BE CANCELLED FOR THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY.  WILL MAINTAIN WARNING UNTIL 00Z FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA.  

ANOTHER AREA OF SNOW (GENERALLY LIGHT) IS MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO THE UPPER TROUGH AND 
DEFORMATION ZONE. MODELS SHOW THIS FEATURES PULLING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS EVENING. THERE MAY BE A CAP BETWEEN 
PRECIPITATION AREAS LATE THIS AFTERNOON-EARLY EVENING...BUT WILL 
EXTEND ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY...PLATEAU...AND 
LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA INTO THE NIGHT.

FOR LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...NORTHWEST BOUNDARY FLOW 
STRENGTHENS AS STRONG SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OFF THE EAST COAST. THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC LIFT...DEEP MOISTURE...UPPER LOW SWINGS 
ACROSS THE AREA...AND ASSOCIATED COLD AIR ALOFT INCREASING LAPSE 
RATES WILL PRODUCE A GOOD DEAL OF SNOW FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
(ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD BE 
1 TO 1 1/2 FEET).  THE HEAVIEST NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWS WILL OCCUR 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY MORNING.

DUE TO THE STEEP LAPSE RATES PRODUCING SNOW SHOWERS (SQUALLS) CAN 
ALSO BE EXPECTED IN THE VALLEY...THUS THE ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 
SUNDAY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...CONTINUE TO TREND COLDER THAN GUIDANCE HIGHS 
DUE TO THE PRECIPITATION...CLOUDS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THOUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN  
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY FOR TRANQUIL WEATHER.  THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES 
IN FOR THE LAST PART OF THE EXTENDED.  MODEL CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN 
POOR WITH THE HANDLING OF THE SYSTEM AND CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW.  FOR 
NOW...WILL LEAVE THINGS IN AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN AND KEEP POPS 
AT 20 TO 30 FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES... 
SHOULD SEE A WARMING TREND THROUGH THE PERIOD.

660 
FXUS64 KMRX 250916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
416 AM EST SAT DEC 25 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
LIGHT SNOW IS MOVING INTO THE AREA...ASSOCIATED WITH LARGE SCALE 
LIFT AHEAD OF THE NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH NOW MOVING INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY. PRECIP FALLING INTO DRY AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS WILL COOL 
SURFACE TEMPS CLOSE TO FREEZING...SO THE MAJORITY OF PRECIP WILL BE 
SNOW. THE SOUTHERN STREAM CIRCULATION OVER EAST TX WILL BECOME A 
MORE SIGNIFICANT PLAYER LATER TODAY. MODELS HAVE CONVERGED ON A 
SOLUTION THAT SHOWS THE DEFORMATION ZONE TO THE NORTH OF THIS 
CIRCULATION STRENGTHENING...SETTING UP A BAND OF FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING OVER NORTHERN GA/SE TN/SW NC/UPSTATE SC BY THE AFTERNOON. SO 
WHILE NORTHERN AREAS MAY SEE THE MOST ACCUMULATIONS THIS 
MORNING...SOUTHERN AREAS ARE LIKELY TO SEE MORE THROUGH THE DAY. THE 
FORECAST WILL BE ADJUSTED TO RAISE ACCUMULATIONS OVER SW NC. WILL 
KEEP AMOUNTS WITHIN ADVISORY CRITERIA...UNDER 4 INCHES...BUT GREATER 
AMOUNTS ARE CERTAINLY POSSIBLE DEPENDING ON WHERE THE FRONTOGENESIS 
ZONE SETS UP. WILL EXTEND THE END TIME OF THE WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY TO 00Z SUN.  

THE PASSAGE OF THE 850-700 MB TROUGH AXIS TONIGHT WILL SIGNAL A 
TRANSITION TO A NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW EVENT. ACCUMULATIONS OVERNIGHT 
MAY BE RELATIVELY LIGHT AS THE FLOW IS NEARLY FROM DUE NORTH AT 
AROUND 15 KTS. BUT AS CYCLOGENESIS BEGINS NEAR THE NC COAST...THE 
925-850 MB FLOW WILL TURN TO THE NORTHWEST AND STRENGTHEN TO 20-30 
KTS...IDEAL FOR UPSLOPE-ENHANCED SNOW SHOWERS. STEEP LAPSE RATES AND 
LOW LEVEL CAPE NEAR 50 J/KG WILL GENERATE ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND INTO SUNDAY EVENING...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA. DECREASING MOISTURE AND A WEAKENING NW FLOW 
SHOULD LEAD TO SHOWERS TAPERING OFF MONDAY. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FROM 
THE NW FLOW EVENT WILL VARY CONSIDERABLY DEPENDING ON ELEVATION. THE 
SMOKIES AND NE TN MOUNTAINS WILL RANGE FROM 5-12 INCHES...WITH SW VA 
RANGING FROM 3-9 INCHES. CONSIDERED UPGRADING TO A WARNING FOR THIS 
AREA...BUT SINCE THE NW FLOW SNOW DOES NOT BEGIN IN EARNEST UNTIL 
AFTER 12Z SUNDAY...THE CURRENT WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE MAINTAINED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
ON MONDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING 
HOURS.  HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ACROSS THE REGION PROVIDING DRY FOR 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA THURSDAY THAT LINGERS 
INTO FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS. SHOULD 
SEE A WARMING TREND FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

&&

292 
FXUS64 KMRX 241948
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EST FRI DEC 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...INTERESTING FORECAST WITH 12Z 
MODEL RUN NOT HELPING OUT WITH CONFIDENCE. PER NCEP DISCUSSION...12Z 
MODEL RUN HAD A GOOD DEAL OF INITIALIZATION ERRORS WITH SOME MAJOR 
DIFFERENCES FOR THE FIRST 24 HOURS FOR THE FORECAST AREA. NAM IS 
MUCH MORE AGRESSIVE IN RESPECT TO DYNAMICS (FRONTOGENETIC) THAN THE 
GFS...THUS PRINTS NEARLY 2/10THS INCH OF PRECIPITATION WHILE THE GFS 
IS LARGELY DRY THROUGH 18Z SATURDAY. THE PRECIPITATION MAY BEGIN AS 
A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW OVER THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES BEFORE 
CHANGING TO SNOW. PLAN ON GOING WITH PERSISTENCE...WHICHS FOLLOWS 
HPC SNOWFALL GUIDANCE WITH 1 TO 2 INCHES MAXIMUM FOR HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS INCLUDING THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND 1/2 TO 1 INCH FOR THE 
LOWER ELEVATIONS. THE SNOWFALL FALLS IN THE LOWER END OF ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...BUT DUE TO THE HOLIDAY TRAVELING WILL ISSUE AN ADVISORY 
AREA-WIDE FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CHRISTMAS DAY.

THERE WILL LIKELY BE A LULL IN THE SNOWFALL MID-DAY...BUT AS SURFACE 
LOW STRENGTHS OVER THE GULF THEN RIDES NORTHEAST...STRENGTHENING 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL DEVELOP FOR LATE SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY 
MORNING. ALSO...UPPER TROUGH WILL RIDE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS PRODUCING ADDITIONAL INSTABILITY WITH FAIRLY STEEP 
LAPSE RATES. CROSS-SECTIONS SHOW STRONG OROGRAPHIC LIFT DEVELOPING 
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH GOOD OMEGA IN THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE. WILL 
CALL FOR AN ADDITIONAL 6 TO 12 INCHES FOR THE FAVORED NORTHWEST 
FACING SLOPES OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN...THUS WILL ISSUE AN WINTER 
STORM WATCH.

DUE TO THE STEEP LAPSE RATES PRODUCING SNOW SHOWERS (SQUALLS) IN THE 
VALLEY...WE MAY NEED TO RE-ISSUE ANOTHER ADVISORY FOR THE NORTHERN 
AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...CONTINUE TO TREND COLDER THAN GUIDANCE HIGHS 
DUE TO THE PRECIPITATION...CLOUDS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...OTHER THAN A FEW 
LINGERING FLURRIES OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS MONDAY NIGHT...EXPECT HIGH 
PRESSURE TO DOMINATE WITH DRY AND WARMING CONDITIONS FOR THE FIRST 
PART OF THE EXTENDED.  THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM MOVES IN AROUND THE 
THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME.  CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON TIMING AND 
DETAILS OF THE SYSTEM...SO 20 TO 30 POPS REASONABLE FOR NOW.  AS FAR 
AS TEMPS...GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

&&

205 
FXUS64 KMRX 240901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EST FRI DEC 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
MODEL TRENDS FOR THE WEEKEND ARE PUTTING MORE EMPHASIS ON THE 
NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH DEVELOPING INTO A CLOSED UPPER LOW...WHILE 
THE SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH REMAINS SEPARATE AND FARTHER SOUTH OF OUR 
AREA. THIS WILL LIKELY TRANSLATE INTO LESS MOISTURE AVAILABILITY 
AND A FASTER-MOVING SYSTEM...WHICH SHOULD HELP LIMIT SNOW 
ACCUMULATION. 

THE FIRST STAGE OF THE EVENT WILL BEGIN FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY...AND AN UPPER LEVEL JET 
STRENGTHENS OVER MIDDLE TN TO THE CENTRAL APPALCHIANS. THIS PERIOD 
OF SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL BE SHORT-LIVED...OCCURRING MAINLY BETWEEN 
MIDNIGHT AND SUNRISE. WIDESPREAD SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL LIKELY BE 
LESS THAN 2 INCHES IN BOTH THE VALLEY AND MOUNTAINS...WHICH IS UNDER 
ADVISORY CRITERIA. A DRY SLOT UNDER THE EASTWARD-MOVING JET AND THE 
LOSS OF SYNOPTIC FORCING SHOULD RESULT IN DECREASING PRECIP CHANCES 
THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY...WITH ANY ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
BEING VERY LIGHT. 

THE CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL TRACK SLOWLY ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT...AND THE EVENT WILL TRANSITION TO A 
NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN THAT PERSISTS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL 
MEAN LITTLE IF ANY ACCUMULATION FOR THE VALLEY AND GREATER 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS. NORTHWESTERLY 850 MB WINDS WILL 
INCREASE FROM ABOUT 15 KTS SATURDAY NIGHT TO AROUND 25 KTS SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. COOLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS SUNDAY AFTERNOON WILL ALSO PRODUCE 
STEEP LAPSE RATES FOR SNOW SHOWERS. THE TN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA COULD SEE ACCUMULATIONS ON THE ORDER OF 3-6 
INCHES FROM THE NW FLOW...BUT BECAUSE IT IS OVER A 36 HOUR 
PERIOD...WILL NOT ISSUE A WATCH. ADVISORIES MAY BE NEEDED IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AS WE GET CLOSER TO THIS PORTION OF THE EVENT.

THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT WILL BE CONTINUED TO MENTION LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE VALLEY THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH THE 
MOUNTAINS SEEING GREATER ACCUMULATIONS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW EAST OF THE AREA BY 
MONDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES 
FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN ON 
MONDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS.  
HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ACROSS THE REGION PROVIDING DRY FOR TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA THURSDAY. WITH STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL ADD ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW.  
SHOULD SEE A WARMING TREND FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

638 
FXUS64 KMRX 232009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST THU DEC 23 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LOW CLOUDS REMAIN ACROSS
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF CLOUDS WILL
SLOWLY ERODE...BUT GIVE WAY TO INCREASING MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS
CURRENTLY OVER THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION.

MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS DEVELOPING DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE
EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. NAM IS VERY WEAK WITH THIS SYSTEM
WHILE THE ECMWF AND LATEST GFS ARE COMING TO AGREEMENT. THE SYSTEM
IS QUITE COMPLEX WITH A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM COMPONENT. THE
AMOUNT OF PHASING BETWEEN THE TWO WAVES IS THE BIG QUESTION. THE
ENERGY FROM THE NORTHERN WAVE WEAKENS AS IT MOVES TOWARD THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH THE SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE BECOMING
DOMINANT SYSTEM. HOWEVER...ENOUGH SYNOPTIC FORCING AND MOISTURE TO
PRODUCE 1 TO 3 INCH SNOWFALLS ACROSS THE AREA (GENERALY 1 TO
POSSIBLY 2 INCHES VALLEY AND 2 TO 3 INCHES HIGHER ELEVATIONS)

SOUTHERN STREAM PRODUCES CYCLOGENESIS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED
STATES WITH LOW MOVING OFF THE MID-ATLANTIC COASTS SUNDAY AND
MONDAY. NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND THIS SYSTEM AND UPPER TROUGH OVER THE
EASTERN UNITED STATES WILL CONTINUE SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF 3 TO 6 INCHES
FOR FAVORED NORTHWEST FLOW UPSLOPE AREAS TO DUSTING TO 1 INCH VALLEY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...CONTINUED TREND OF GOING A CAT OR TWO BELOW
GUIDANCE HIGHS DUE TO THE PRECIPITATION...CLOUDS...AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THOUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS 
OR FLURRIES MAY CONTINUE INTO MONDAY NIGHT ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
AS THE WEEKEND/S WEATHER SYSTEM CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY.  BEHIND THE 
SYSTEM...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BRINGING 
A RETURN TO QUIET WEATHER.  CONFIDENCE LOW BY THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED WITH SOME MODELS TRENDING TOWARD MOVING THE NEXT SYSTEM 
INTO THE AREA FOR THURSDAY.  FOR NOW...WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY.  
GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             26  47  31  38  26 /   0   0  60  70  30

WITH BREAKING OUT CLEARING DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY THURSDAY 
AS IT APPEARS LOW DECK MAY HANG AROUND FOR A FEW HOURS BEFORE 
BREAKING OUT TO SOME SUNSHINE. SUCKER HOLES HAVE APPEARED IN THE 
CLOUDS BUT SEEM TO EVENTUALLY FILL IN, HOWEVER. "SUNSHINE" MAY BE 
TOO STRONG A WORD BUT "DISCERNIBLE SHADOWS" WILL NOT FIT INTO THE 
FORECAST.

REMOVED ALL MENTION OF PRECIP FROM ZONES TODAY AND LOWERED POPS FROM 
17 TO 14 IN FAR NORTHEAST PORTION OF FORECAST AREA IN SOUTHWEST VA 
IN ORDER TO REMOVE SUCH WORDING.

OTHER ITEM OF INTEREST IS THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHICH IS GOOD UNTIL 7 AM. WILL PROBABLY LET IT 
EXPIRE THEN AS LATEST OBS SHOW WEAKENING WINDS AND LITTLE GUSTINESS, 
AND MODELS AGREE WITH REALITY FOR ONCE.

TEMPS LOOK IN GOOD AGREEMENT AS LONG AS THE BLEND IS USED...SO WENT 
WITH THIS.


.LONG TERM...(CHRISTMAS EVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...23/00Z RUN OF NAM
AND GFS FLIPPING BACK TO MORE MOISTURE AVAILABLE FOR CHRISTMAS DAY
...AS SECOND SHARPER UPPER TROUGH CREATES AN INVERTED SURFACE
TROUGH AXIS INTO THE FORECAST AREA...WHILE MAIN SURFACE LOW IS
STILL INDICATED ALONG THE GULF COAST. ECMWF KEEPS SURFACE LOW TO
OUR SOUTH WITHOUT THE INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH FEATURE...SO LESS
MOISTURE THIS FAR NORTH. ECMWF HAS SHORTWAVES MORE IN PHASE AND
LESS AMPLIFIED...AND SEEMS TO BE MODEL CHOSEN BY HPC FOR WINTER
WEATHER OUTLOOK FOR DAY 3 (12Z CHRISTMAS DAY THRU 12Z SUNDAY).

ALL OF THIS...ESPECIALLY FLIP-FLOP OF NAM-GFS FROM RUN TO RUN...
CREATES A GREAT DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY IN HOW MUCH SNOW COULD FALL
ON CHRISTMAS DAY INTO SUNDAY. THE OVERALL TRACK OF THE SURFACE TO
850 MB LOW LOOKS CONSISTENT AND GENERALLY NE UP THE ATLANTIC COAST 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. THIS LENDS CREDENCE TO KEEPING A LIGHT
TO MODERATE AMOUNT OF SNOW FOR THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS EAST
INTO WRN NC...NRN GA AND NW SC...AS A GOOD FETCH OF ATLANTIC
MOISTURE FLOWS INTO THESE REGIONS. PLUS SOME PROLONGED SNOW SHOWERS
ON BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM...AS GREAT LAKES MOISTURE AND COLD AIR
FLOW SOUTHWARD.

MINOR FORECAST GRID CHANGES...SUCH AS NUDGING SNOW AMOUNTS UP
ACROSS OUR SW NC COUNTIES AND ALSO JUST A BIT FOR SMOKIES AND NRN
MTNS OF EAST TN. CONSENSUS WAS NO WATCH YET UNTIL MODELS FALL INTO
BETTER AGREEMENT...SO WILL ISSUE OUR SPS AGAIN...AND LET DAY SHIFT
WATCH FOR SOME RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY FROM MODELS.  

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST WED DEC 22 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST 
THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. LONG WAVE TROF 
TONIGHT. HAD TO APPLY A SLIGHT/SMALL CHANCE FOR SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS AS THIS FEATURE AND HEALTHY COLD AIR ADVECTION AIDS LIFT 
OVERNIGHT. ALSO PLACED SOME SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY
WHERE A FEW CRYSTALS MAY BE SEEN. WAS LESS OPTIMISTIC THAN MODELS 
WITH BREAKING OUT CLEARING DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY THURSDAY 
AS IT APPEARS LOW DECK MAY HANG AROUND FOR A FEW HOURS BEFORE 
BREAKING OUT TO SOME SUNSHINE. HELD ONTO A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
DURING THE MORNING AS THE OROGRAPHIC LIFT WANES. OTHER ITEM OF 
INTEREST IS THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE WHERE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL BOOST WINDS FOR A 
PERIOD TONIGHT ABOVE 20 MPH. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS DURING 
THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN FORECAST CHALLENGE
IS DEVELOPING CYCLOGENESIS ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF COAST...THEN STRENGTH
AND PROXIMITY OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE EAST COAST. ECMWF MODEL IS THE 
STRONGEST AND FARTHEREST WEST WITH THE SURFACE LOW...WHILE THE GFS 
IS WEAKER AND EAST. NCEP IS TRENDING TOWARD A COMPROMISE AND WILL 
FOLLOW.

THE NORTHERN STREAM AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE BEGIN TO PHASE TOGETHER 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING LIGHT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURE PROFILE SUGGEST 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE ALL SNOW. WILL NOT GET AS AGGRESIVE AS THE ECMWF
FOR SNOWFALL AMOUNTS...BUT WILL CALL FOR A 1 TO 3 INCH SNOW 
ACCUMULATION AREA-WIDE. LATER MODIFICATIONS LIKELY.

SYNOPTIC LIFT MOVES EAST OF THE APPALCHIAN MOUNTAINS LATE SATURDAY 
AS SURFACE LOW STRENGTHENS OFF THE CAROLINA COASTS. AS CLOSED UPPER 
TROUGH AND WEAK-MODERATE NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS SUNDAY AND 
CONTINUES THROUGH MONDAY...SNOW ACCUMULATION IS LIKELY OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS 
ANTICIPATED ACROSS THE VALLEY AND MAINLY ALONG AND NORTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS OUT FOR MID-WEEK WITH MODERATING TEMPERATURES AND 
DRY CONDITIONS.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL UNDER-CUT GUIDANCE FOR THE WEEKEND AND 
EARLY NEXT WEEK DUE TO THE SNOW...CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST WED DEC 22 2010

.AVIATION...A SURFACE LOW CENTER WILL MOVE ALONG A COLD FRONT AND 
EXIT THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...TOWARD THE EAST. THE FRONT WILL 
QUICKLY LEAVE THE REGION BUT COLD AIR WILL STREAM IN BEHIND IT, SO 
THAT TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE A HARD RISING MUCH ABOVE PRESENT VALUES. 
AMPLE MOISTURE, BUT VERY SHALLOW, WILL KEEP LOW CIGS AND VISBY MOST 
OF THE DAY, ALONG WITH OCCASIONAL DRIZZLE OR VERY LIGHT RAIN...WITH 
FLURRIES POSSIBLE IN HIGHER TERRAIN AND NORTH OF TRI.

TYS AND TRI EXPECT TO HAVE PRECIP, BUT CHA FAR LESS LIKELY. VSBYS 
WILL IMPROVE FASTER THAN CIG BUT STILL EXPECT A SLOW IMPROVEMENT 
FROM LIFR TO MVFR. CIGS MAY NOT GO VFR UNTIL WAY AFTER DARK. 

WINDS WILL BE GENERALLY LESS THAN 10 MPH AT TAF SITES, BUT IN 
VICINITY OF MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AFTER ABOUT 00Z 
TONIGHT, EXPECT THEM TO BE STEADY FROM THE NORTHWEST ABOVE 20-25 
MPH, WITH GUSTS TO 40 ALONG RIDGETOPS THROUGH ABOUT 12Z THURSDAY.

FOR THE WEEKEND OUTLOOK...SOME UNCERTAINTY STILL ABOUT TRACK OF LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM AND AMOUNT OF MOISTURE, BUT SOME COMPUTER MODELS ARE 
COMING CLOSER TO EACH OTHER ON A SNOWY CHRISTMAS DAY AND SUNDAY. 
STAY TUNED.

972 
FXUS64 KMRX 220823
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST WED DEC 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW APPROACHING AREA 
THIS MORNING WILL TURN WINDS TO NORTHWEST SOONER THAN LATER WITH 
COLD ADVECTION GOING TO AFFECT THE REGION RIGHT OFF THE BAT. THIS 
WILL MEAN THAT TEMPS WILL STRUGGLE TO RISE ABOUT 5 DEGREES FROM 
PRESENT TO FORECAST HIGH, BUT I THINK THEY CAN DO IT BEFORE THEY 
EITHER GO STEADY OR BEGING DROPPING THE REST OF THE DAY. SHALLOW 
MOISTURE WILL PREVENT MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION OF EITHER RAIN 
OR SNOW. MAIN PRECIPITATION WILL BE EITHER DRIZZLE, VERY LIGHT RAIN 
OR FLURRIES WITH TEMPS DOWN AROUND FREEZING IN THE NORTHERN TWO 
THIRDS OF THE AREA. 

THE MOISTURE KEEPS GETTING SHALLOWER AS THE LOW MOVES OUT TO THE 
EAST AND SO POPS DROP FROM SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH AND LOW CHANCE NORTH 
TO BASICALLY NONE SOUTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE  NORTH BY THURSDAY.

OTHER ISSUE IS STRENGTH OF PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN ABOUT 2500 FEET 
AND 6000 FEET MSL. EXPECT WINDS TO TURN NORTHWEST AND RISE TO ABOVE 
25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO OVER 40 BETWEEN 00Z AND 12Z THURSDAY. WILL 
ISSUE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS FOR THAT 
TIME PERIOD. AS LOW MOVES EAST, GRADIENT WILL SLACKEN AND WINDS 
SHOULD EASE UP AFTER THAT.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MOST ATTENTION SPENT ON
FINE TUNING FORECAST GRIDS FROM FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.
MODELS (GEM-GFS-ECMWF-NAM) SEEM IN FAIR AGREEMENT AND WITH SOME
CONTINUITY...ON A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING SE FROM THE MID
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSURE
DEVELOPING ALONG THE GULF COAST REGION. A SOUTHERN TRACK OF THE
SURFACE AND 850 MB LOW...SHOULD KEEP LOW LEVEL TEMPS AND THICKNESSES
VERY FAVORABLE FOR SNOW ON CHRISTMAS DAY. LOW IS PROGGED TO TRACK
ENE INTO THE ATLANTIC SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN TRACK NE JUST OFF THE
MID ATLANTIC COAST ON SUNDAY. THIS WOULD INDICATE PLENTY OF
MOISTURE FROM THE GULF INITIALLY...THEN AN INFLUX OF ATLANTIC
MOISTURE SATURDAY NIGHT...AND A FETCH OF GREAT LAKES MOISTURE INTO
SUNDAY NIGHT.

IF MODELS STAY CONSISTENT WITH THIS TRACK...A WINTER STORM WATCH
MAY BE IN ORDER SHORTLY. HOWEVER...PER COORDINATION WITH NWS
NEIGHBORS...WILL CONTINUE TO HIGHLIGHT THIS POTENTIAL SNOWFALL IN
AN SPS FOR NOW. I DID INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY FOR CHRISTMAS DAY AND 
ALSO KEPT MAX TEMPS BELOW GFSX MOS FOR BOTH CHRISTMAS DAY AND
SUNDAY. MAX AND MIN TEMPS FOR LATER PERIODS ALSO NUDGED DOWNWARD IN
LINE WITH LATEST MOS GUIDANCE...AND ALSO TO MESH BETTER WITH
ADJACENT GRIDS.

.DISCUSSION...
LOW PRESSURE IS CENTERED NEAR MEM...WITH AN ASSOCIATED FRONT
EXTENDING ACROSS MIDDLE TN THEN SOUTHEAST ACROSS NE AL AND NW GA.
THIS FRONT HAS REMAINED NEARLY STATIONARY FOR THE PAST SEVERAL
HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES IS EXTENDING
SOUTHWARD...CREATING WEAK COLD AIR DAMMING IN THE TN VALLEY. THE
LOW WILL TRACK EAST BUT THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN NEARLY
STATIONARY TO OUR SOUTH...SO THE CURRENT CONDITIONS OF
CLOUDS...FOG...AND DRIZZLE WILL PERSIST OVERNIGHT. THE CURRENT
FORECAST IS ON TRACK...SO NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EST TUE DEC 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AHEAD TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP 50-60 PERCENT POPS FOR 
TONIGHT WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE EVENING HOURS. TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE INDICATES PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE IS SHALLOW SO PROBABLY WON'T SEE MUCH RAIN WITH 
THE SYSTEM SO KEPT LIGHT RAIN AND SPRINKLES. THE FRONT EXITS THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY SO KEPT HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE MORNING HOURS.  
STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY FOR 
TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...VERY INTERESTING 
FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND...AS POTENTIAL EXISTS FOR SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACROSS THE AREA.  FIRST...MAY BE SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS OR VERY 
LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN...THEN 
EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS THU AND THU NIGHT.  MODELS STILL DO NOT AGREE 
ON DETAILS OF WEEKEND SYSTEM.  GFS IS FARTHER NORTHWEST AND 
FASTER...BUT HAS TRENDED TOWARD THE MORE CONSENSUS ECMWF
SOLUTION. AT THIS POINT WILL GO WITH A MORE OF BLEND OF THE 00Z
ECMWF/12Z GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN TRACK...BUT CONFIDENCE LOW ON THE
DETAILS OF THIS SYSTEM.  WILL CARRY CHANCE WEST AND SLIGHT CHANCE
ELSEWHERE FRIDAY AFTERNOON...THEN LIKELY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO
SATURDAY. PRECIP TYPE DIFFICULT THIS FAR OUT...BUT AT THIS POINT
LOOKS LIKE PRECIP MAY BEGIN AS RAIN OR A MIX...ESPECIALLY
SOUTH...THEN TRANSITION TO MAINLY SNOW BY SATURDAY MORNING. SHOULD
SEE SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING BEHIND THIS SYSTEM AS COLDER AIR PUSHES
IN FOR SUNDAY AND PERHAPS MONDAY...AND MAY BE MORE SIGNIFICANT SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS ESPECIALLY IN THE NORMALLY FAVORED HIGHER ELEVATION
AREAS. MODEL AGREEMENT POOR FOR TUESDAY SO CONFIDENCE LOW...BUT FOR
NOW WILL GO DRY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1116 AM EST TUE DEC 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO WARM. ANY AREAS OF 
FREEZING RAIN LEFT WILL BE MINIMAL AND SWITCH TO ALL RAIN SHORTLY AS 
WARMER AIR ARRIVES. CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD. PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE 
LIGHT RAIN. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
UPDATE ZONE FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED. 

..PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...INITIAL BAND OF PRECIPITATION
THAT MOVED SE ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN MAY HAVE BEEN ENHANCED BY
JET DYNAMICS. GOT A FEW REPORTS OF GENERALLY A DUSTING OF NEW SNOW
FROM WISE COUNTY VIRGINIA AND THE TRI CITIES AREA...AS THIS APPEARS
TO BE THE MAIN AREA WHERE PARTIAL THICKNESS AND SURFACE TEMPS
SUPPORT SOMETHING OTHER THAN RAIN.

ISENTROPIC LIFT IS CREATING ANOTHER AREA OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) TO 
OUR WEST...WHICH HAS REACHED OUR PLATEAU AND LAKEWAY COUNTIES. THIS 
IS VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION GENERALLY IN THE FORM OF SPRINKLES OR 
FLURRIES INITIALLY. FURTHER LIFT/WARMING SHOULD CREATE MOSTLY LIGHT 
RAIN OR DRIZZLE LATER TODAY...AND INTO TONIGHT. THUS...I RAISED POPS 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT CLOSER TO A MOS BLEND...BUT KEPT RAIN AMOUNTS 
ON THE LIGHT SIDE. COLUMN WARMS TOO MUCH AND THE DEPTH OF MOISTURE 
DECREASES TOO MUCH...TO SUPPORT ANY TYPE OF WINTRY PCPN FOR TONIGHT.
REMOVED SNOW FROM GRIDS AND ADJUSTED MIN TEMPS UP CONSIDERABLY IN 
LINE WITH LATEST MOS.

FOR TEMPS...NAM MOS LOOKS MUCH TOO COOL FOR HIGHS TODAY...GIVEN FACT 
THAT CURRENT TEMPS WERE ALREADY CLOSE TO FORECASTED HIGHS FROM THE 
NAM. MAY UPDATE OUR SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT...DEPENDING ON HOW 
TEMPS RISE OVER SW VA AND NE TIP OF TN OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GOING LARGELY WITH GEM 
MODEL AND GEM/GFS IN LATTER PART OF PERIOD. SHALLOW RH WEDNESDAY 
ASSOCIATED WITH EXITING SFC LOW WILL PROVIDE LOW CHANCE POPS 
NORTHEAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTHWEST. TEMPS WARM ENOUGH FOR 
RAIN BUT NOT MUCH ON AMOUNTS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY THURSDAY 
DIURNAL TEMP DROP WILL PERMIT SOME LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES IN 
NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA. AGAIN, NEGLIGIBLE AMOUNTS.  

SHORT UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH SETTLE IN FOR THURSDAY FOR A 
BREAK IN THE PRECIP. SOME DISAGREEMENT AMONG MODELS AND SURROUNDING 
OFFICES AS TO TIMING OF FOLLOWING SYSTEM FOR FRIDAY. WENT WITH GEM 
WHICH HOLDS SYSTEM BACK AND INTENSIFIES THIS SYSTEM WITH FAIRLY 
TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENTS AND DEEPENING SURFACE LOW. HAVE OPTED TO 
USE CHANCE WORDING ON FRIDAY WITH SNOW IN THE MORNING MOSTLY TURNING 
TO RAIN IN THE AFTERNOON. SATURDAY IN THE 00Z TO 06Z TIME FRAME 
GEM/GFS HAVE THIS BODACIOUS SURFACE LOW DEEPENING IN DIXIE AND 
MOVING FAIRLY QUICKLY EAST. THIS PUTS AN INVERTED SFC TROUGH UP INTO 
UPPER TN VALLEY AND BRINGS COLD AIR FROM NORTHEAST INTO AREA. BIG 
STORY IS CHRISTMAS EVE AND DAY WHEN WEAK WARM FRONT CLIPS EASTERN 
SECTIONS WHICH WILL PRODUCE MAINLY RAIN IN THE MOUNTAINS AND 
ADJACENT FOOTHILL/VALLEY AREAS FOR A FEW HOURS. BUT...THICKNESSES 
DROP RAPIDLY BEHIND SFC TROUGH. THE 540 LINE ENTERS THE FORECAST 
AREA AROUND 06Z SATURDAY...AND THE 528 LINE BY 00Z SUNDAY. PLENTY OF 
WRAP AROUND RH WILL ENABLE PRECIP TO TURN TO ALL SNOW PRETTY 
QUICKLY. EVEN THIS FAR AHEAD OF SATURDAY...WENT WITH A BAND OF 
LIKELY POPS FROM WEST TO EAST ON SATURDAY. IT'S POSSIBLE FOR SOME 
ACCUMULATION TO OCCUR CHRISTMAS DAY...BUT THAT IS STILL FOUR DAYS 
FROM NOW. STAY TUNED.

THE SURFACE RAPIDLY DEEPENS AND BOMBS OUT IN THE GFS/GEM AND HEADS UP 
THE EAST COAST ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH SOME LINGERING RH BEHIND IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW OF THE ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH. BUT POPS RAPIDLY 
DROP OFF DUE TO SPEED OF EXITING SFC LOW.

TEMPS WERE A LITTLE DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN. STARTED WITH GFS TEMPS 
AND THEN ADJUSTED FOR CLOUDS AND PRECIP. MOSTLY JUST MASSAGES TO 
PREVIOUS TEMPS. 

ONE THING TO WATCH AND WILL PASS THIS ON TO SUBSEQUENT SHIFTS IS THE 
CHANCE FOR INCREASING WINDS AS THE SURFACE LOW DEEPENS MID-LATE WEEK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  43  53  29  50 /  50  50  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  39  48  27  45 /  50  50  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  39  46  27  46 /  50  50  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              40  35  44  21  44 /  50  60  30  20  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMRX 211430
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EST TUE DEC 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE TEMPERATURES BEGINNING TO WARM A BIT.  WILL 
UPDATE ZONE FORECAST TO REMOVE EARLY MORNING GROUP. 

..PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...INITIAL BAND OF PRECIPITATION
THAT MOVED SE ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN MAY HAVE BEEN ENHANCED BY
JET DYNAMICS. GOT A FEW REPORTS OF GENERALLY A DUSTING OF NEW SNOW
FROM WISE COUNTY VIRGINIA AND THE TRI CITIES AREA...AS THIS APPEARS
TO BE THE MAIN AREA WHERE PARTIAL THICKNESS AND SURFACE TEMPS
SUPPORT SOMETHING OTHER THAN RAIN.

ISENTROPIC LIFT IS CREATING ANOTHER AREA OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) TO 
OUR WEST...WHICH HAS REACHED OUR PLATEAU AND LAKEWAY COUNTIES. THIS 
IS VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION GENERALLY IN THE FORM OF SPRINKLES OR 
FLURRIES INITIALLY. FURTHER LIFT/WARMING SHOULD CREATE MOSTLY LIGHT 
RAIN OR DRIZZLE LATER TODAY...AND INTO TONIGHT. THUS...I RAISED POPS 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT CLOSER TO A MOS BLEND...BUT KEPT RAIN AMOUNTS 
ON THE LIGHT SIDE. COLUMN WARMS TOO MUCH AND THE DEPTH OF MOISTURE 
DECREASES TOO MUCH...TO SUPPORT ANY TYPE OF WINTRY PCPN FOR TONIGHT.
REMOVED SNOW FROM GRIDS AND ADJUSTED MIN TEMPS UP CONSIDERABLY IN 
LINE WITH LATEST MOS.

FOR TEMPS...NAM MOS LOOKS MUCH TOO COOL FOR HIGHS TODAY...GIVEN FACT 
THAT CURRENT TEMPS WERE ALREADY CLOSE TO FORECASTED HIGHS FROM THE 
NAM. MAY UPDATE OUR SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT...DEPENDING ON HOW 
TEMPS RISE OVER SW VA AND NE TIP OF TN OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GOING LARGELY WITH GEM 
MODEL AND GEM/GFS IN LATTER PART OF PERIOD. SHALLOW RH WEDNESDAY 
ASSOCIATED WITH EXITING SFC LOW WILL PROVIDE LOW CHANCE POPS 
NORTHEAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTHWEST. TEMPS WARM ENOUGH FOR 
RAIN BUT NOT MUCH ON AMOUNTS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY THURSDAY 
DIURNAL TEMP DROP WILL PERMIT SOME LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES IN 
NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA. AGAIN, NEGLIGIBLE AMOUNTS.  

SHORT UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH SETTLE IN FOR THURSDAY FOR A 
BREAK IN THE PRECIP. SOME DISAGREEMENT AMONG MODELS AND SURROUNDING 
OFFICES AS TO TIMING OF FOLLOWING SYSTEM FOR FRIDAY. WENT WITH GEM 
WHICH HOLDS SYSTEM BACK AND INTENSIFIES THIS SYSTEM WITH FAIRLY 
TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENTS AND DEEPENING SURFACE LOW. HAVE OPTED TO 
USE CHANCE WORDING ON FRIDAY WITH SNOW IN THE MORNING MOSTLY TURNING 
TO RAIN IN THE AFTERNOON. SATURDAY IN THE 00Z TO 06Z TIME FRAME 
GEM/GFS HAVE THIS BODACIOUS SURFACE LOW DEEPENING IN DIXIE AND 
MOVING FAIRLY QUICKLY EAST. THIS PUTS AN INVERTED SFC TROUGH UP INTO 
UPPER TN VALLEY AND BRINGS COLD AIR FROM NORTHEAST INTO AREA. BIG 
STORY IS CHRISTMAS EVE AND DAY WHEN WEAK WARM FRONT CLIPS EASTERN 
SECTIONS WHICH WILL PRODUCE MAINLY RAIN IN THE MOUNTAINS AND 
ADJACENT FOOTHILL/VALLEY AREAS FOR A FEW HOURS. BUT...THICKNESSES 
DROP RAPIDLY BEHIND SFC TROUGH. THE 540 LINE ENTERS THE FORECAST 
AREA AROUND 06Z SATURDAY...AND THE 528 LINE BY 00Z SUNDAY. PLENTY OF 
WRAP AROUND RH WILL ENABLE PRECIP TO TURN TO ALL SNOW PRETTY 
QUICKLY. EVEN THIS FAR AHEAD OF SATURDAY...WENT WITH A BAND OF 
LIKELY POPS FROM WEST TO EAST ON SATURDAY. IT'S POSSIBLE FOR SOME 
ACCUMULATION TO OCCUR CHRISTMAS DAY...BUT THAT IS STILL FOUR DAYS 
FROM NOW. STAY TUNED.

THE SURFACE RAPIDLY DEEPENS AND BOMBS OUT IN THE GFS/GEM AND HEADS UP 
THE EAST COAST ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH SOME LINGERING RH BEHIND IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW OF THE ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH. BUT POPS RAPIDLY 
DROP OFF DUE TO SPEED OF EXITING SFC LOW.

TEMPS WERE A LITTLE DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN. STARTED WITH GFS TEMPS 
AND THEN ADJUSTED FOR CLOUDS AND PRECIP. MOSTLY JUST MASSAGES TO 
PREVIOUS TEMPS. 

ONE THING TO WATCH AND WILL PASS THIS ON TO SUBSEQUENT SHIFTS IS THE 
CHANCE FOR INCREASING WINDS AS THE SURFACE LOW DEEPENS MID-LATE WEEK.

636 AM EST TUE DEC 21 2010

.AVIATION...WINTRY PRECIPITATION HAS BECOME QUITE SPOTTY AND VERY 
LIGHT IN INTENSITY...ALTHO CEILINGS HAVE FALLEN. CHA STARTING OUT 
MVFR WITH TYS AND TRI BRIEFLY VFR THIS MORNING. EXPECT A CONTINUED 
DOWNWARD TREND FOR REMAINDER OF TAF PERIOD FOR ALL 3 TAF SITES. 
WARM AIR FLOWING OVER COOLER SURFACE AIRMASS SHOULD EQUATE TO IFR OR 
WORSE CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...SUFFICIENT WARMING WILL KEEP 
TYPE AS LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST MON DEC 20 2010

.DISCUSSION...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH THE AREA TONIGHT.  
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE AND LOWER AND A STRAY VERY 
LIGHT SNOW OR SLEET...POSSIBLY MIXED WITH SOME FREEZING RAIN IS 
EXPECTED OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS BY SUNRISE.  PRECIP AMOUNT WILL BE 
LIGHT AND NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.  HOWEVER...EVEN MINIMAL 
FREEZING RAIN CAN CAUSE ROADS TO BECOME SLICK AND HAZARDOUS...SO AN 
SPS HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE CWA.  ALL ON TRACK 
IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

FXUS64 KMRX 202304 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
604 PM EST MON DEC 20 2010

.AVIATION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE ANCHORED OVER OHIO AND WV TONIGHT AND
TOMORROW...EXTENDING SOUTH INTO THE TN VALLEY. ADVECTION OF WARM
MOIST AIR ABOVE THE SURFACE WILL LEAD TO INCREASING CLOUDS LATE
TONIGHT...WHICH WILL LOWER TO MVFR AT ALL TAF SITES TOMORROW
MORNING. THE MOISTURE REMAINS RELATIVELY SHALLOW...AND WITH LIFT
BEING WEAK...ANY PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BE VERY LIGHT TOMORROW. WILL
MENTION AS DRIZZLE IN THE TAFS. IF PRECIP MOVES IN EARLIER THAN
FORECAST WHEN TEMPS ARE STILL BELOW FREEZING...THERE COULD BE SOME
LIGHT ICE ACCUMULATING AT TRI AND TYS...ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE IS TOO
LOW TO MENTION IN THE TAF FOR NOW. CEILINGS MAY APPROACH IFR LEVELS
LATE IN THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL SITES.

FXUS64 KMRX 202041
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST MON DEC 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...FRONT ENTERING THE AREA TONIGHT 
AND TUESDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE HOLDS OFF UNTIL LATE TONIGHT...SO WILL 
KEEP A DRY FORECAST DURING THE EVENING HOURS. SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
FREEZING RAIN AND SNOW POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY 
MORNING ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. ONLY VERY 
LIGHT PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING...SO 
WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY. WILL KEEP HIGH CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
TUESDAY...BUT PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID BY THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS. WITH CLOUDS INCREASING TONIGHT...STAYED ABOVE GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...TUESDAY NIGHT STARTS 
ON THE TAIL END OF A COLD FRONT WITH WEAK NORTHWEST FLOW AND LIMITED 
MOISTURE BY THE TIME WEDNESDAY FINISHES UP. SHORT UPPER RIDGE AND 
SURFACE HIGH SETTLE IN FOR THURSDAY FOR A BREAK IN THE PRECIP. SOME 
DISAGREEMENT AMONG MODELS AND SURROUNDING OFFICES AS TO TIMING OF 
FOLLOWING SYSTEM FOR FRIDAY. WENT WITH GFS WHICH HOLDS SYSTEM BACK 
AND INTENSIFIES THIS SYSTEM WITH FAIRLY TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENTS AND 
DEEPENING SURFACE LOW. HAVE OPTED TO USE CHANCE WORDING IN 
FRIDAY-EARLY SUNDAY WITH DECREASE FROM WEST ON SUNDAY AS LOWS 
POTENTIALLY DEEPENS AND SLOWS. PLUS...THIS IS MONDAY AND FRIDAY, 
SATURDAY, AND SUNDAY ARE A LONG WAY OFF. THERE IS AN OUTSIDE CHANCE 
FOR A BRIEFLY WHITE CHRISTMAS IN THE MORNING BEFORE IT WARMS UP 
ENOUGH TO TURN TO RAIN. WE'LL KEEP AN EYE ON THIS. 

THE SURFACE RAPIDLY DEEPENS AND BOMBS OUT IN THE GFS AND HEADS UP 
THE EAST COAST ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH SOME LINGER RH BEHIND IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW OF THE ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH. POPS RAPIDLY DROP 
OFF THEN.

TEMPS WERE A LITTLE DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN. STARTED WITH GFS TEMPS 
AND THEN ADJUSTED FOR CLOUDS AND PRECIP. MOSTLY JUST MASSAGES TO 
PREVIOUS TEMPS. 

ONE THING TO WATCH AND WILL PASS THIS ON TO SUBSEQUENT SHIFTS IS THE 
CHANCE FOR INCREASING WINDS AS THE SURFACE LOW DEEPENS MID-LATE 
WEEK. 

&&

767 
FXUS64 KMRX 201549
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1049 AM EST MON DEC 20 2010

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE OBS INDICATING SCATTERED FLURRIES TRACKING 
ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VA. SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THE 
AREA THIS MORNING SO WILL HANDLE WITH NOWCASTS. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED FOR TODAY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE TO 850 MB RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY...WITH UPPER RIDGE AXIS 
ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. THIS WILL RESULT IN DRY WEATHER FOR TODAY 
AND THE BULK OF TONIGHT. LOW CLOUD LAYER MAY SPREAD INTO SW VA AND 
NE TN EARLY TODAY...THEN INCREASING HIGH TO MID LAYER CLOUDS COME IN 
TONIGHT. HUGE MOS POP DIFFERENCES COME INTO PLAY FOR TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH NAM MOS POPS AT LEAST 2 TO 3 TIMES THAT OF THE 
DRIER GFS MOS POPS. HOWEVER...NEITHER MODEL PRODUCES MUCH IN THE WAY 
OF PRECIPITATION LATE TONIGHT...SO I TRIMMED OUR POPS BACK SOME FOR 
TONIGHT. TYPE OF PRECIPITATION IS A WINTRY MIX...BUT QPF WOULD BE 
EXTREMELY LIGHT (NOT MUCH MORE THAN 0.01 INCH).  

WENT CLOSER TO THE MILDER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS FOR SE TN AND SW NC...
WITH SIMILAR MOS MAXES GOOD FOR REST OF E TN AND SW VA. MINS TONIGHT 
SHOULD OCCUR AROUND MIDNIGHT...THEN TEMPS SHOULD HOLD STEADY OR 
SLOWLY RISE TOWARD DAYBREAK AS MODERATE LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION 
KICKS IN.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WITH MODELS SLOWING NEXT
SYSTEM DOWN SLIGHTLY TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO ABOVE FREEZING
ACROSS ALL OF FORECAST AREA BY MID MORNING. FREEZING RAIN THREAT
SHOULD ONLY LAST A FEW HOURS TUESDAY MORNING BEFORE WARM AIR
OVERRUNS AREA AS WARM FRONT MOVES NE INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS.
MODELS INDICATE ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS AS FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO
TN VALLEY TUESDAY. KEPT POPS ABOUT THE SAME AROUND 50 PERCENT AND
GRADUALLY DECREASE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS FRONT MOVES
EAST AND LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS
BUILDS SE INTO FORECAST AREA. NAM HANGS ON TO MOISTURE WITH SNOW
SHOWERS INTO THURSDAY MORNING BUT PREFER BLEND WHICH KEEPS A SLIGHT
CHANCE NE SECTIONS WITH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE. RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO
SNOW BY EARLY WEDNESDAY BUT MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH NOT MUCH
CHANCE LOWER ELEVATIONS AS DRIER AIR MOVES IN FROM NW. LOWS TUESDAY
NIGHT MOSTLY 30S AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY SIMILAR TO TUESDAYS. THURSDAY
THERE WILL BE A BRIEF BREAK IN PRECIPITATION AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE LINGER OVER THE
EASTERN TN VALLEY. MODELS HAVE SLOWED NEXT SYSTEM SO THAT GFS WHICH
IS FASTER THAN ECMWF BRINGS LOW PRESSURE AREA INTO TN BY 00Z
SATURDAY WITH WARMING AND RAIN SPREADING INTO REGION DURING THE DAY
FRIDAY THEN COLD AIR WITH UPPER TROUGH CHANGING RAIN TO SNOW
SATURDAY. NW FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP THREAT FOR SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH
SUNDAY. ECMWF ABOUT 12 HOURS SLOWER WITH SYSTEM. WILL FOLLOW FASTER
GFS FOR NOW. MORE SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF SNOW WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH
COLDER AIR MASS BEHIND THE FRONT SO WILL HAVE TO WATCH CLOSELY AS
IT MAY AFFECT WEEKEND TRAVEL.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 200924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EST MON DEC 20 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE TO 850 MB RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY...WITH UPPER RIDGE AXIS 
ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. THIS WILL RESULT IN DRY WEATHER FOR TODAY 
AND THE BULK OF TONIGHT. LOW CLOUD LAYER MAY SPREAD INTO SW VA AND 
NE TN EARLY TODAY...THEN INCREASING HIGH TO MID LAYER CLOUDS COME IN 
TONIGHT. HUGE MOS POP DIFFERENCES COME INTO PLAY FOR TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH NAM MOS POPS AT LEAST 2 TO 3 TIMES THAT OF THE 
DRIER GFS MOS POPS. HOWEVER...NEITHER MODEL PRODUCES MUCH IN THE WAY 
OF PRECIPITATION LATE TONIGHT...SO I TRIMMED OUR POPS BACK SOME FOR 
TONIGHT. TYPE OF PRECIPITATION IS A WINTRY MIX...BUT QPF WOULD BE 
EXTREMELY LIGHT (NOT MUCH MORE THAN 0.01 INCH).  

WENT CLOSER TO THE MILDER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS FOR SE TN AND SW NC...
WITH SIMILAR MOS MAXES GOOD FOR REST OF E TN AND SW VA. MINS TONIGHT 
SHOULD OCCUR AROUND MIDNIGHT...THEN TEMPS SHOULD HOLD STEADY OR 
SLOWLY RISE TOWARD DAYBREAK AS MODERATE LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION 
KICKS IN.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WITH MODELS SLOWING NEXT
SYSTEM DOWN SLIGHTLY TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO ABOVE FREEZING
ACROSS ALL OF FORECAST AREA BY MID MORNING. FREEZING RAIN THREAT
SHOULD ONLY LAST A FEW HOURS TUESDAY MORNING BEFORE WARM AIR
OVERRUNS AREA AS WARM FRONT MOVES NE INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS.
MODELS INDICATE ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS AS FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO
TN VALLEY TUESDAY. KEPT POPS ABOUT THE SAME AROUND 50 PERCENT AND
GRADUALLY DECREASE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS FRONT MOVES
EAST AND LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS
BUILDS SE INTO FORECAST AREA. NAM HANGS ON TO MOISTURE WITH SNOW
SHOWERS INTO THURSDAY MORNING BUT PREFER BLEND WHICH KEEPS A SLIGHT
CHANCE NE SECTIONS WITH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE. RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO
SNOW BY EARLY WEDNESDAY BUT MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH NOT MUCH
CHANCE LOWER ELEVATIONS AS DRIER AIR MOVES IN FROM NW. LOWS TUESDAY
NIGHT MOSTLY 30S AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY SIMILAR TO TUESDAYS. THURSDAY
THERE WILL BE A BRIEF BREAK IN PRECIPITATION AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE LINGER OVER THE
EASTERN TN VALLEY. MODELS HAVE SLOWED NEXT SYSTEM SO THAT GFS WHICH
IS FASTER THAN ECMWF BRINGS LOW PRESSURE AREA INTO TN BY 00Z
SATURDAY WITH WARMING AND RAIN SPREADING INTO REGION DURING THE DAY
FRIDAY THEN COLD AIR WITH UPPER TROUGH CHANGING RAIN TO SNOW
SATURDAY. NW FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP THREAT FOR SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH
SUNDAY. ECMWF ABOUT 12 HOURS SLOWER WITH SYSTEM. WILL FOLLOW FASTER
GFS FOR NOW. MORE SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF SNOW WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH
COLDER AIR MASS BEHIND THE FRONT SO WILL HAVE TO WATCH CLOSELY AS
IT MAY AFFECT WEEKEND TRAVEL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EST SUN DEC 19 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS 
SLOWLY FROM EASTERN KENTUCKY TO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THROUGH 
MONDAY. DRY CONDITIONS PERSIST WITH HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING INTO 
THE AREA IN UPPER NW FLOW ON MONDAY. COOL AIR AND BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AND MONDAY. ELEVATED WARM FRONT NOSES INTO AREA 
MONDAY NIGHT. CLOUD COVER INCREASES AS WEAK SHALLOW ISENTROPIC LIFT 
GET GOING MONDAY NIGHT. MIN TEMPS WILL LIKELY OCCUR AROUND MIDNIGHT 
WITH STEADY OR RISING TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT. VERY LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION ADVANCES INTO AREA FROM WEST. PCPN AREA WILL BE 
COINCIDENT WITH RISING FREEZING LEVEL. LEADING EDGE MAY HAVE SOME 
FREEZING RAIN OR SNOW BUT MAJORITY OF PCPN WILL BE LIQUID. CLOUDS 
AND VERY LIGHT RAIN CONTINUE THROUGH MUCH OF TUESDAY AND SPEED MAX 
MOVES EAST THROUGH OH RVR VLY AND WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES LATE 
TUESDAY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LOW LINGERS INTO 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO 
KEPT HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN ZONES. COULD SEE 
RAIN CHANGE TO SNOW MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT SHOULD BE BACK TO RAIN FOR 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER 
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ENTER THE 
REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE GOING WITH THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES ON FRIDAY. IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT 
THEN SWITCH TO SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY MORNING. IT 
THEN SHOULD SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. UPPER LOW 
TRACKS INTO THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. IT SHOULD BEGIN AS 
RAIN ON FRIDAY NIGHT THEN SWITCH TO SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO 
SATURDAY. IT THEN SHOULD SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 
SOME SNOW MAY LINGER ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. UPPER LOW EXITS 
THE AREA ON SUNDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN 
ZONES. COULD SEE MORE SNOW ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  WITH THE 
BEST FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY. WITH COLD AIR LINGERING...MEX GUIDANCE APPEARED ON THE 
WARM SIDE FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD...SO GENERALLY STAYED NEAR TO BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES AND FOLLOWED NEAR HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST SUN DEC 19 2010

.DISCUSSION...LOW LEVEL CAPPED ACROSS NE TN/SW VA THIS MORNING.
CLOUD COVER WILL PERSIST INTO AFTN HOURS THOSE AREAS. OTHERWISE
TWEAKED MAX TEMP DOWN A DEGREE. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDS LINGER OVER SE KY INTO 
SW VA AND NRN MOST PARTS OF E TN THIS MORNING...AS A WEAK SURFACE TO 
850 MB TROUGH PASS ACROSS THE REGION. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD GIVE WAY 
TO PLENTY OF SUNSHINE BY MID MORNING...BUT NORTHERLY FLOW BEHIND 
THIS TROUGH WILL ADVECT COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION. MOS GUIDANCE WAS 
SEVERAL DEGREES TOO COOL FOR SATURDAY MAXES...SO I TRENDED WITH A 
MOS BLEND SW VA/NE TN TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOS FOR HIGHS ACROSS SE TN 
AND SW NC. 

HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL JET MAY SPREAD INTO THE 
REGION LATE TONIGHT...SO TWEAKED SKY COVER TO PARTLY CLOUDY LATE. 
SOME DEGREE OF CLOUDS TONIGHT LENDS SUPPORT TO MOS BLEND OVER PURE 
COOLER GFS MOS MINS.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST AND 
FRONTAL SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. TEMPERATURES WILL 
WARM SEVERAL DEGREES FROM TODAYS. MONDAY NIGHT CLOUDS WILL LOWER WITH
PRECIPITATION MOVING INTO THE REGION BY MORNING. EXPECT RAIN THE 
PREDOMINANT PRECIP TYPE AS TEMPERATURES WARM SLOWLY OVERNIGHT. SOME 
LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET IS POSSIBLE NE TN AND SW VA AS COLD AIR 
TRAPPED IN VALLEYS WILL STAY BELOW FREEZING UNTIL MID MORNING 
TUESDAY. SLIGHT ICING POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT EARLY TUESDAY BUT NOT 
EXPECTING ANY SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION UNTIL TEMPERATURES WARM 
TUESDAY. COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH LATE TUESDAY WITH COLDER AIR 
MASS SPREADING IN WEDNESDAY. AIR MASS WILL HAVE DRIED OUT WITH ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS. HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN 
THURSDAY WITH RIDGING BRINGING MORE TRANQUIL WEATHER. ON CHRISTMAS 
EVE A DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE MS VALLEY WILL MOVE A LOW PRESSURE 
AREA ACROSS THE TN VALLEY SPREADING RAIN INTO THE REGION. CHRISTMAS 
DAY COLDER AIR MASS AND NW FLOW WILL ALLOW THE RAIN TO CHANGE TO 
SNOW ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF MOUNTAINS AND SW VA AND 
CONTINUING THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EST SAT DEC 18 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH JUST 
EAST OF MRX CWA. UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE AREA 
TONIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FROM THE NW THROUGH 
MONDAY. SKIES WILL SLOWLY CLEAR TONIGHT AND REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY ON 
SUNDAY. STRONG MID AND UPPER NW FLOW WILL BRING SOME HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA MAINLY SUN NIGHT AND MONDAY. BELOW TEMPS WILL 
CONTINUE WITH LIGHT WINDS. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FRONT ENTERS THE 
REGION ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MODELS FAIRLY AGREEABLE ON 
TIMING. BASED ON TEMPERATURES...IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN ON MONDAY 
NIGHT THEN SWITCH TO SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO TUESDAY MORNING. 
IT THEN SHOULD SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. UPPER LOW 
LINGERS INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS 
NORTH...SO KEEP HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN ZONES. 
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY. A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ENTER THE REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY. WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE GOING WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON 
FRIDAY. IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT THEN SWITCH TO 
SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY MORNING. IT THEN SHOULD SWITCH 
BACK TO RAIN BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. UPPER LOW TRACKS THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN ON FRIDAY NIGHT THEN 
SWITCH TO SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO SATURDAY. IT THEN SHOULD 
SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. SOME SNOW MAY LINGER  
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH COLD AIR LINGERING...MEX GUIDANCE 
APPEARED ON THE WARM SIDE FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD...SO GENERALLY 
STAYED BELOW GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES AND FOLLOWED NEAR HPC FOR 
TEMPERATURES

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.AVIATION...PATCHY LIGHT FREEZING RAIN AND SNOW MOVING EAST AT ABOUT

DRIER AND SO A LOT OF IT IS FALLING AS VIRGA. CIGS AND VSBYS HAVE 
BEEN VFR BUT THIS IS GOING TO CHANGE A BIG AS THE AIR BECOMES MORE 
MOIST WITH PRECIPITATION. EXPECT CIGS TO DROP TO MVFR DURING 
PRE-DAWN TO MID MORNING PERIOD...APPROXIMATELY 15Z.  AFTER THAT, 
DISTURBANCE CAUSING THE PRECIP SHOULD BEGIN TO EXIT THE REGION AND 
PRECIP CHANCE START TO DECREASE, THOUGH ISOLATED SHOWERS, MAINLY 
RAIN WILL LINGER THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. SKIES WILL REMAIN CLOUDY BUT 
CIGS SHOULD BE VFR LATER IN THE TAF PERIOD. TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE 
FREEZING BY MID TO LATE MORNING SO PRECIP WILL BE LIQUID THEN. WINDS 
SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT.

309 
FXUS64 KMRX 180905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST SAT DEC 18 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVERRIDDEN 
BY WARMER AIR FROM WEST-SOUTHWEST IS PRODUCING PATCHY LIGHT FREEZING 
DRIZZLE AND SNOW OVER PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. RADAR SHOWS 
MODERATELY STRONG ECHOES BUT EVEN WHEN MOVING DIRECTLY OVER 
OBSERVING SITES, LITTLE TO NO PRECIP IS REPORTED. SOME PASSED 
DIRECTLY OVER WFO AND DID PRODUCE INTERMITTENT FREEZING RAIN AND A 
DUSTING OF SNOW, WHICH IS RAPIDLY MELTING. THIS SITUATION WILL 
CONTINUE UNTIL SURFACE TEMPS WARM TO ABOVE FREEZING ABOUT MID 
MORNING. HAVE THEREFORE UPDATED FORECAST AND CARRIED THIS INTO THE 
MID MORNING ON CURRENT PACKAGE. WILL HANDLE THIS WITH SHORT TERM 
FORECASTS. DO NOT BELIEVE THE VERY SPOTTY NATURE OF THE 
FREEZING/FROZEN PRECIP WARRANTS A SPECIAL STATEMENT AT THIS TIME. 
WILL, HOWEVER, MONITOR CONDITIONS AND PASS THIS THINKING ON TO DAY 
SHIFT. 

AFTER THE WARMING, HAVE LEFT IN A CHANCE FOR LIGHT RAIN 
THROUGH AFTERNOON WITH A TAPERING OFF INTO EVENING AND THEN 
VIRTUALLY ELIMINATED POPS OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. 

LOWERED MAX TEMPS TODAY BECAUSE OF CLOUD COVER RESULTING IN SLOW 
WARMING. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CLEAR
SKIES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY BUT WITH UPPER TROUGH PASSING
THROUGH TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COOL FROM A START IN THE 20S.
HIGHS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY
SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY PASSES ACROSS THE
OHIO VALLEY. LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT AGAIN SIMILAR TO SATURDAY NIGHT.
MONDAY RIDGING AND THE MOVEMENT OF HIGH PRESSURE TO THE EAST COAST
WILL WARM HIGHS SEVERAL DEGREES. NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES INTO
THE MS VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TUESDAY. PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN LATE MONDAY
NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MOSTLY RAIN TUESDAY BUT SOME SNOW
POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT NORTHERN SECTIONS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM MORE
HIGH ELEVATION SNOW POSSIBLE. HIGH PRESSURE AND RIDGING ALOFT WILL
WARM MOST AREAS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. A STRONGER SYSTEM WILL
DEVELOP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MS VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND
SPREAD INTO THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY. THIS SYSTEM AGAIN LOOKS WARM
ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY RAIN BUT WILL DRAG IN COLDER AIR BY SATURDAY SO
THE RAIN WILL LIKELY CHANGE TO SNOW IN THE NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 172026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EST FRI DEC 17 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...ALMOST ZONAL FLOW ACROSS AREA. 
SURFACE HIGH CREEPING IN FROM WEST. IN THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF THE 
SURFACE HIGH APPEARS A WEAK LITTLE TROF WHICH WILL CREEP THROUGH THE 
AREA DURING THE NIGHT TONIGHT AND THEN OUT BEFORE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. WITH HIGH RH VALUES ACROSS AREA DUE TO COLD TEMPS THIS 
WILL EKE OUT LOW POPS FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF FORECAST AREA 
AND THE MOUNTAINS UP TO ABOUT GREEN COUNTY. BEST POPS WILL BE IN 
SOUTH IN POLK, MONROE, CHEROKEE AND CLAY, BUT EVEN THEN NOT OUT OF 
THE 30S. ADJACENT FOOTHILLS WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP AND 
THEN VALLEY LOCATIONS NOT MUCH AT ALL. PRECIP MAY BE FLURRIES  OR A 
MIX IN THE WEE HOURS TONIGHT AND THEN SWITCH OVER TO SPRINKLES/LIGHT 
RAIN BY AFTERNOON BEFORE DEPARTING AS UPPER LEVEL WEAK SHORT WAVES 
MOVES EAST. 

ADJUSTED TEMPS UP A LITTLE ON MINS WITH CLOUD COVER NOT MOVING MUCH. 
LEFT MAXES LARGELY AS IS SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE 
EXPECTED...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY EVENING. 
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A 
FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MODELS FAIRLY 
AGREEABLE ON TIMING. BASED ON TEMPERATURES...IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN 
ON MONDAY NIGHT THEN SWITCH TO SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO 
TUESDAY MORNING. IT THEN SHOULD SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON. UPPER LOW LINGERS INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO KEEP HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN ZONES. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY 
WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO 
ENTER THE REGION ON FRIDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL 
ADD ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR 
RAIN. WITH COLD AIR LINGERING...MEX GUIDANCE APPEARED ON THE WARM 
SIDE FOR THE PERIOD...SO GENERALLY STAYED BELOW GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES AND FOLLOWED NEAR HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.
