AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1240 PM EST FRI DEC 17 2010

.AVIATION...MODELS NOT HANDLING THE CLOUD SHIELD OVER AREA VERY 
WELL, SO A LITTLE SHOOTING FROM THE HIP HERE WITH CIGS. HAVE MORE 
CONFIDENCE IN WINDS AND VISIBILITY. NEXT SYSTEM IS OVER THE CENTRAL 
US AND NOT EXPECTED TO AFFECT THIS FORECAST PERIOD...EXCEPT FOR 
PUMPING CLOUDS INTO THE AREA.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING OVER AREA AND THIS WILL KEEP TEMPS 
COLD-ISH WHICH MEANS HIGHER HUMIDITIES AND BETTER CHANCE TO KEEP 
CLOUDS IN PLACE. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE PRETTY SHALLOW, BUT THE 
TEMPERATURE INVERSION OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL KEEP IT TRAPPED 
AND TEND TO KEEP MVFR CEILINGS LONGER TODAY.

A DRY LAYER ABOVE THAT WILL LIKELY PROVIDE A SPACE ABOVE THE CIGS, 
BUT THEN MIDDLE AND HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING INTO AREA FROM SOUTHWEST 
ABOVE THE DRY LAYER. 

FOR CHA, SOME CLEARING IS EVIDENT FROM THE SOUTH AS AS LOW CLOUDS 
DISSIPATE. HAVE OPTED TO GO VFR THERE EARLIER.

FOR TYS AND TRI, DIFFERENT STORY WITH LOW CLOUDS NOT APPEARING TO 
MAKE ANY PROGRESS AWAY. WILL KEEP LOWER CIGS IN THERE UNTIL AFTER 
00Z BUT EVEN THEN NOT VERY CONFIDENT THAT THEY WILL ACTUALLY GO 
AWAY. 

TEMPERATURES AT TAF SITES WILL DROP BELOW FREEZING AGAIN AFTER ABOUT 
00Z, TOO.

FXUS64 KMRX 170828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 AM EST FRI DEC 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LIKELY TO 
REMAIN TRAPPED UNDER INVERSION KEEPING LOW CLOUDS AROUND FOR 
TODAY...ALTHOUGH MAY BE LESS CLOUDS IN THE MOUNTAINS.  TONIGHT WILL 
SEE INCREASE IN MID LEVEL MOISTURE AS NEXT WAVE APPROACHES. OTHER 
THAN THE MENTION OF FLURRIES IN SW VA AND NORTHERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS EARLY TODAY...PLAN TO HAVE A PRECIP FREE FORECAST BOTH 
PERIODS. HAVE SEEN NO REPORTS OF DRIZZLE THUS FAR...SO PLAN TO LET 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY EXPIRE.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO JUST A FEW TWEAKS PLANNED.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...CURRENT SYSTEM OVER NEW 
MEXICO WILL SPREAD MOISTURE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE 
LOWER MS VALLEY AND TN VALLEY BY SATURDAY MORNING AS LOW PRESSURE 
MOVES NE OUT OF THE GULF ALONG FRONT TO THE SOUTH IN GA AND AL. 
THESE TWO AREAS WILL MERGE OVER THE CAROLINAS SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND 
NIGHT. A LITTLE RAIN OR SNOW WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THIS TIME BUT THE AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT AS THE STRONGEST PART 
OF THE SYSTEM STAYS TO THE SOUTH. ONLY EXPECTING A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF 
PRECIPITATION. TEMPERATURES SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 30S TO MID 
40S WITH NO SNOW ACCUMULATION AT THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AND ONLY MINOR 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS. THE SYSTEM WILL MOVE QUICKLY EAST 
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING AND SKIES CLEARING. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 20S SATURDAY NIGHT. SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BUT SKIES WILL BE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH AS MOISTURE MOVES ACROSS FROM SHORTWAVES MOVING 
ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE NW. TEMPERATURES STAY COOL NORTH BUT WARM 
TO THE SOUTH AS WEAK RIDGING BUILDS IN. FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHORTWAVE ENERGY BREAKS OFF FROM WEST COAST TROUGH. 
CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW THROUGH THE PERIOD. PUSHED TEMPERATURES UP A 
FEW DEGREES WITH MOSTLY RAIN SOUTH AND A MIXTURE NORTH AT NIGHT AND 
DURING EARLY MORNING HOURS. THURSDAY AIR MASS DRIES OUT WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER AREA FROM THE WEST. KEPT THURSDAY DRY FOR 
NOW.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

MOVES NE OUT OF THE GULF ALONG FRONT TO THE SOUTH IN GA AND AL. 
THESE TWO AREAS WILL MERGE OVER THE CAROLINAS SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND 
NIGHT. A LITTLE RAIN OR SNOW WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THIS TIME BUT THE AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT AS THE STRONGEST PART 
OF THE SYSTEM STAYS TO THE SOUTH. ONLY EXPECTING A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF 
PRECIPITATION. TEMPERATURES SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 30S TO MID 
40S WITH NO SNOW ACCUMULATION AT THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AND ONLY MINOR 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS. THE SYSTEM WILL MOVE QUICKLY EAST 
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING AND SKIES CLEARING. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 20S SATURDAY NIGHT. SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BUT SKIES WILL BE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH AS MOISTURE MOVES ACROSS FROM SHORTWAVES MOVING 
ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE NW. TEMPERATURES STAY COOL NORTH BUT WARM 
TO THE SOUTH AS WEAK RIDGING BUILDS IN. FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHORTWAVE ENERGY BREAKS OFF FROM WEST COAST TROUGH. 
CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW THROUGH THE PERIOD. PUSHED TEMPERATURES UP A 
FEW DEGREES WITH MOSTLY RAIN SOUTH AND A MIXTURE NORTH AT NIGHT AND 
DURING EARLY MORNING HOURS. THURSDAY AIR MASS DRIES OUT WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER AREA FROM THE WEST. KEPT THURSDAY DRY FOR 
NOW.           

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  28  45  24  45 /   0  10  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  26  42  23  40 /  10  10  30  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       37  24  41  22  40 /  10  10  30  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              37  24  40  22  36 /  10  10  30  20  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

LDW/TD

.AVIATION...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA FOR
TODAY...THEN SOME MID CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN. EXPECT MVFR CIGS ALL
SITES FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD. THESE MAY FINALLY BREAK UP LATER
TODAY OR EARLY TONIGHT. SOME FOG WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY
AT TRI...AND WHILE LOWER CONDITIONS CERTAINLY POSSIBLE...FOR NOW
WILL JUST KEEP THINGS MVFR.

350 
FXUS64 KMRX 170159
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH SUB FREEZING 
AIR BEHIND IT OVER KY. THIS SUB FREEZING AIR SHOULD SLOWLY ADVECT 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...WITH TEMPS SLOWLY FALLING BACK 
BELOW FREEZING AFTER MIDNIGHT IN MOST AREAS. MODELS AGREE THAT A 
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL TRIGGER SOME LIGHT DRIZZLE OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SO WILL LEAVE THE WINTER WX ADVISORY 
IN EFFECT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME FREEZING DRIZZLE...ESPECIALLY 
LATER AFTER MIDNIGHT. ALTHOUGH AN EXTENSIVE CLOUD DECK WILL LINGER 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...THE RECENT PRECIP SHOULD HELP TO 
KEEP THE LOW LEVELS MOIST ENOUGH FOR SOME FOG FORMATION. WITH A 
LIGHT WIND FLOW EXPECTED TO PERSIST OVERNIGHT...THINK THAT THIS FOG 
SHOULD BE PATCHY IN NATURE.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MAKE A FEW TWEAKS 
TO PRECIP WORDING ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS. OTHERWISE... 
CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK THIS EVENING AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO UPDATE FURTHER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   30  41  28  45  24 /  10   0  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     29  38  26  42  22 /  10   0  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             29  39  25  41  22 /  10   0  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    28  36  23  40  20 /  10   0  10  20  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...
     SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.
&&

UNDER THE LOW CLOUD DECK. DON'T BELIEVE IT WILL BECOME DENSE. POOR

UNTIL 20Z AT TRI.

486 
FXUS64 KMRX 162044
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 PM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SURFACE WARM FRONT IS SLOWLY MOVING
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN-CENTRAL VALLEY. TEMPERATURES AT TYS 
ARE IN THE 50S WHILE MORRISTOWN REMAINS NEAR 40 AND TRI IN THE LOWER 
AND MID 30S. WARMER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO PULL NORTH THROUG THIS 
EVENING UNTIL COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. AREA OF RAIN AND
FREEZING WILL PULL EAST THIS EVENING...BUT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL
REMAIN. NORTHWEST ORGOGRAPHIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE SHOWERS OVER THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT.

SINCE THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE WILL BE QUITE SHALLOW AND WARMER 
THAN THE DENDRITIC SNOW GROWTH (WARMER THAN -8)...WILL CALL FOR A 
MIXTURE OF FREEZING RAIN-FREEZING DRIZZLE-RAIN FOR MAINLY THE 
UPSLOPE LOCATIONS. HAVE ISSUED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH 09Z FRIDAY.

AREAS OF FOG...SOME LOCALLY DENSE...CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED OVERNIGHT.

DRIER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION LATE TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...BUT 
SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRY WEATHER EXPECTED BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT. A SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL KEEP ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A FRONT ENTERS 
THE REGION ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MODELS FAIRLY AGREEABLE ON 
TIMING AND STRENGTH. BASED ON TEMPERATURES...IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN 
THEN SWITCH TO SNOW WITH SNOW CONTINUING INTO TUESDAY MORNING THEN 
SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. UPPER LOW LINGERS INTO 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO KEEP 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN ZONES. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY 
ON TIMING...WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW. STAYED NEAR MEX//HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             30  41  28  45  24 /  10  10  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  38  26  42  22 /  20  10  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       29  39  25  41  22 /  10  10  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              29  36  23  40  20 /  20  10  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...
     SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1235 PM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.AVIATION...PLENTY OF MOISTURE AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE 
PLATEAU WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE IFR/LIFR CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIY. 
AS A COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING...CEILING WILL 
REMAIN IFR...BUT WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST AT 5 TO 7KFTS. AS 
DRIER AIR MOVES INTO THE REGION FRIDAY MORNING CEILING WILL SLOW 
LIFT TO MVFR CONDITIONS.

PERIODS OF RAIN SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE UNTIL 23-01Z WITH DRIZZLE 
CONTINUING THROUGH 04-06Z.

FXUS64 KMRX 161504
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1004 AM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER SOUTHERLY JET IS PULLING
WARMING TEMPERATURES INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH MOST HIGHER
ELEVATION OBSERVATIONS WELL ABOVE FREEZING. HOWEVER...THE MAIN
PROBLEM ARE THE LOW-LYING SHELTERED AREAS...WHICH REMAIN AT OR JUST
BELOW FREEZING OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL
CONTINUE WITH BOTH THE WARNING AND ADVISORIES UNTIL 17Z.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST TRICKY TODAY. STRONG WARM SOUTHERLY WINDS
ACROSS ALABAMA AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE...BUT SHALLOW COLD AIR IN THE
VALLEY WILL BE HARD TO ERODE. THE WARMEST TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY
BE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SUCH AS THE PLATEAU. WILL MAKE
SOME MINOR CHANGES TO FORECAST HIGHS.

STRONG LOW LEVEL JET IS ALSO PRODUCING WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA WINDS
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  32  42  27  46 /  90  20  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  31  40  25  40 / 100  20  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       43  30  39  24  41 / 100  20  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  28  36  21  40 / 100  30  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL NOON EST TODAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: HAMBLEN...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...NW BLOUNT...
     NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...ROANE.

     WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON EST TODAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SCOTT TN...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...UNION...WASHINGTON TN.

     MONROE.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL NOON EST TODAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: HAMBLEN...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...NW BLOUNT...
     NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...ROANE.

     WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON EST TODAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SCOTT TN...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...UNION...WASHINGTON TN.

     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
621 AM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.AVIATION...WARM FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION EARLY THIS MORNING.  THE ASSOCIATED STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN WILL CONTINUE...WITH FREEZING RAIN TRANSITIONING OVER TO 
RAIN DURING THE MORNING HOURS. THE LOW VISIBILITIES AND CEILINGS AND 
MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS WILL IMPROVE DURING THE AFTERNOON AS THE 
FRONT EXITS THE AREA. A COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE REGION 
TOWARDS SUNSET...WITH WINDS SHIFTING TO THE WEST AND CEILINGS AND 
VISIBILITIES FINALLY RISING. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     BRADLEY...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST MONROE...WEST POLK.

     WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE.

FXUS64 KMRX 160807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 AM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A STRONG WARM FRONT CONTINUES TO 
ADVANCE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE...REACHING ABOVE FREEZING BEFORE SUNRISE IN 
LOCATIONS SOUTH OF I40...AND BY NOON AT SW VA LOCATIONS.  UNTIL 
THEN...PRECIP WILL REMAIN A WINTRY MIX...WITH FREEZING RAIN 
PREDOMINATE OVER TN AND NC COUNTIES AND A MIX OF SNOW...SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN ACROSS VA.  AFTER SURFACE TEMPS REACH 32 DEGREES... 
PRECIP WILL SWITCH TO RAIN.  A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AND WARNING 
ARE IN EFFECT THROUGH 7AM AND NOON RESPECTIVELY.  ADDITIONALLY 
STRONG WINDS ALOFT ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL INCREASE WINDS OVER 
THE SMOKY MOUNTAIN AREA TO ADVISORY LEVELS AND AN NPW HAS BEEN 
ISSUED THROUGH 20Z.  BY THE AFTERNOON...ALL PRECIP SHOULD HAVE 
TRANSITIONED OVER TO RAIN AND WILL SLOWLY PULL OUT OF THE AREA 
DURING THE DAY AND WILL END OVERNIGHT.  WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE WARM 
FRONT...AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES SHOULD REACH INTO THE 40S AT MOST 
LOCATIONS...AND OVERNIGHT LOWS ONLY FALLING INTO THE MID 20 TO LOWER 
30S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN OF A PERSISTENT MEAN EAST COAST 
TROUGH...BUT LESS AGREEMENT AND POOR RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY IN 
HANDLING THE DETAILS OF ANY WAVES MOVING THROUGH THIS MEAN TROUGH.  
THUS THIS IS A BELOW AVERAGE CONFIDENCE FORECAST FOR THE PERIOD.  
MODELS HAVE GENERALLY BACKED OFF ON MOISTURE/SIGNIFICANT PRECIP 
BEING PULLED NORTH INTO THE AREA FROM SOUTHEAST SYSTEM AS SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY APPROACHES.  GIVEN MODEL SOLUTION INSTABILITY WILL NOT REMOVE 
PRECIP ENTIRELY...BUT WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE FRI NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...AND LATER SHIFTS MAY PULL PRECIP ENTIRELY FROM THOSE 
PERIODS.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...THEN ANOTHER 
SYSTEM MAY AFFECT THE AREA BY MON NIGHT AND TUESDAY...WITH LINGERING 
SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY NORTH AND MOUNTAINS TUE NIGHT AND 
WED.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  32  42  27  46 /  90  20  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  31  40  25  40 / 100  20  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  30  39  24  41 / 100  20  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  28  36  21  40 / 100  30  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ THIS MORNING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     BRADLEY...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST MONROE...WEST POLK.

     WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
100 AM EST THU DEC 16 2010

.AVIATION...WARM FRONT IS STRETCHED SOUTHEAST ACROSS WEST TN AND 
NORTHERN AL. A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WILL CONTINUE 
OVERNIGHT...WITH A FEW MORE HOURS OF FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED AT KCHA 
AND KTYS. A PERIOD OF LIGHT SNOW IS EXPECTED INITIALLY AT 
KTRI...BEFORE CHANGING OVER TO FREEZING RAIN BEFORE SUNRISE. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT PRECIP SHOULD GRADUALLY CHANGE TO RAIN BEFORE SUNRISE 
AT KCHA...AROUND SUNRISE AT KTYS...AND AFTER SUNRISE AT KTRI. AS 
THIS WARM FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION THIS MORNING... VISIBILITIES 
AND CEILINGS SHOULD LOWER INTO THE IFR RANGES...AND WILL LIKELY 
REMAIN LOW THROUGH THE DAY ON THURSDAY AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES OVER THE TAF SITES. A COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE 
REGION TOWARDS SUNSET ON THURSDAY...WITH WINDS SHIFTING TO THE WEST 
AND CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES FINALLY RISING. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     BRADLEY...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST MONROE...WEST POLK.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST WED DEC 15 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT STRETCHING 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS NORTHERN MS AND CENTRAL AL. RECENT REPORTS FROM THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA (GENERALLY SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE) 
HAVE INDICATED A BRIEF PERIOD OF SNOW BEFORE CHANGING QUICKLY OVER 
TO FREEZING RAIN. WHILE IT APPEARS THAT THE WARM 850 MB LAYER IS 
QUICKLY PROGRESSING OVER THE FORECAST AREA...VERY DRY AIR IN THE 
LOWER LEVELS (AS EVIDENCED BY THE LOW DEWPOINTS IN THE TEENS) WILL 
CONTINUE TO CREATE SOME STRONG EVAPORATIVE COOLING THIS EVENING. 
THUS...EXPECT WINTRY PRECIP (MAINLY IN THE FORM OF FREEZING RAIN) TO 
CONTINUE FOR SEVERAL HOURS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. GFS AND NAM MODELS AGREE THAT A COLDER...SUB-FREEZING AIR MASS 
IS DEEPER ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHERE 
PRECIP WILL LIKELY REMAIN AS SNOW FOR A LONGER PERIOD BEFORE 
GRADUALLY TRANSITIONING OVER TO FREEZING RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
ALSO...MODELS AGREE THAT PRECIP WILL FURTHER INTENSIFY OVER THE 
WARNING AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH SIGNIFICANT ICE ACCUMS STILL 
APPEARING LIKELY ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...NORTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. IT APPEARS FROM THE RECENT TRENDS AND MODEL 
DATA THAT THE CHANGEOVER TO ALL RAIN SHOULD OCCUR AFTER MIDNIGHT 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...TOWARDS SUNRISE ACROSS 
CENTRAL EAST TN...AND AROUND LATE MORNING AFTER SUNRISE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU...NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. 

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MAKE A FEW TWEAKS 
TO PRECIP WORDING ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS. OTHERWISE... 
CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK THIS EVENING AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO UPDATE FURTHER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   27  47  32  44  30 / 100  90  20  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     26  43  31  43  28 / 100 100  20  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             25  42  30  42  27 / 100 100  20  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    21  40  31  43  25 / 100 100  20  10  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     BRADLEY...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST MONROE...WEST POLK.

     WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON EST THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SCOTT TN...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...UNION...WASHINGTON TN.

VA...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON EST THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE

THUS...EXPECT WINTRY PRECIP (MAINLY IN THE FORM OF FREEZING RAIN) TO 
CONTINUE FOR SEVERAL HOURS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. GFS AND NAM MODELS AGREE THAT A COLDER...SUB-FREEZING AIR MASS 
IS DEEPER ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHERE 
PRECIP WILL LIKELY REMAIN AS SNOW FOR A LONGER PERIOD BEFORE

ALSO...MODELS AGREE THAT PRECIP WILL FURTHER INTENSIFY OVER THE

TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. IT APPEARS FROM THE RECENT TRENDS AND MODEL

CENTRAL EAST TN...AND AROUND LATE MORNING AFTER SUNRISE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU...NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. 

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MAKE A FEW TWEAKS 
TO PRECIP WORDING ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS. OTHERWISE... 
CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK THIS EVENING AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO UPDATE FURTHER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
629 PM EST WED DEC 15 2010

.AVIATION...ISENTROPIC LIFT EVIDENT STRENGTHENING ACROSS THE LOWER
TENNESSEE VALLEY NORTHWEST INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE EARLY THIS
EVENING. SOME LIGHT SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN CURRENTLY FALLING IN
THIS AREA OF LIFT AND WILL GRADUALLY SPREAD EAST ACROSS THE TAF
SITES TONIGHT LOWERING FLIGHT CONDITIONS FROM MVFR TO IFR FROM
AROUND 03-04Z AT CHA TO AROUND 09Z AT TRI. PRECIP MAY BE IN THE
FORM OF LIGHT SNOW FOR SEVERAL HOURS AT TRI WHERE THE EFFECTIVE
WARM NOSE WILL ARRIVE CLOSER TO DAYBREAK CHANGING PRECIP TO SLEET
AND FREEZING RAIN. PUSHED BACK THE CHANGEOVER TO LIQUID PRECIP
ABOUT ONE TO TWO HOURS AT BOTH TYS AND TRI. BELIEVE MODELS STILL A
LITTLE TOO OPTIMISTIC ABOUT SUCH AN EARLY SCOURING OF COLD DENSE
NEAR SURFACE AIR OVER WIDESPREAD SNOW COVER IN CENTRAL TO NORTHERN
REACHES OF THE GREAT VALLEY.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST WED DEC 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND 
COLD AIRMASS HOLDING ON THIS EVENING. SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE ENE INTO 
TN RVR VLY EARLY THURSDAY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THU 
AFTN. GOOD LAYER MOISTURE AVAILABLE IN UPPER NW FLOW. LIGHT SNOW 
WILL ADVANCE INTO THE AREA THIS EVENING. WEAK LIFT WILL AID IN PCPN 
RATE AS WARM FRONT MOVES NE INTO MRX CWA TONIGHT. DEPTH OF WARM 
LAYER INCREASES OVERNIGHT WORKING ITS WAY DOWN FROM AROUND 700 MB. 
INITIAL SNOW WILL BECOME MIXED WITH SLEET THEN RAIN AS WARM LAYER 
EXPANDS TO SURFACE. SHALLOW POCKETS OF SUB FREEZING TEMPERATURES 
WILL LIKELY RESULT IN DANGEROUS ICE CONDITIONS EARLY THU. COLD 
SURFACE CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST IN NE TN/SW VA INTO THE MID MORNING
HOURS. NW FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AS SURFACE LOW PASSES THROUGH THE AREA.
LIGHT LIQUID PCPN WILL LINGER MUCH OF THE DAY THU. GFS MODEL APPEARS 
TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH WARM UP THU. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...GENERALLY TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS PROJECTED THROUGH THE LONG TERM PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS. HOWEVER...EASTERN CONUS LONG WAVE TROUGH REMAINS MORE OR 
LESS IN PLACE FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE KEEPING REGION IN MAINLY 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH MINOR IMPULSES TRANSLATING THROUGH THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW. A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WILL PASS MAINLY SOUTH OF 
OUR REGION ON SATURDAY. BUMPED UP POPS SLIGHTLY FOR SATURDAY BUT 
KEPT THEM IN CHANCE CATEGORY FOR NOW. NOT EXPECTING ANYTHING 
SIGNIFICANT FROM THIS EVENT AND NO SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS ARE 
ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM. TEMPS EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN BELOW CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG TERM HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...TENDED 
TO FAVOR A BLEND OF THE GUIDANCE VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1236 PM EST WED DEC 15 2010

.AVIATION...RAPIDLY DETERIORATING CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH TAF
PERIOD. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND COLD DRY AIRMASS REMAINS IN PLACE
AT ONSET OF TAF PERIOD. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL TRACK ENE INTO TN
VLY BY THU MORNING. LAYER MOISTURE INCREASES IN ADVANCE OF LOW.
ELEVATED WARM FRONT WITH WEAK LIFT WILL ADVANCE INTO THE AREA THIS
EVENING. LIFT PICKS UP OVERNIGHT. PCPN WILL BECOME WIDESPREAD
ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT. PCPN TYPE WILL TRANSITION FROM SNOW TO
SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN...BEFORE CHANGING TO A COLD RAIN THU
MORNING. CONDITIONS WILL REDUCE TO MVFR WITH PERIODS OF IFR
CONDITIONS MAINLY IN THE LATER HALF OF THE TAF PERIOD. ICY SURFACE
CONDITIONS A GOOD BET. SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY RISE ABOVE
FREEZING IN THE LATER QUARTER OF THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 151531
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST WED DEC 15 2010

.DISCUSSION...MINOR ADJUSTMENT TO T/TD FOR TODAY. TWEAKED DOWNWARD
A COUPLE OF DEGREES. MAX TEMP WILL OCCUR NEAR MIDNIGHT. TEMP CURVE
WILL WARM MOST AREAS OVERNIGHT. VIRGA AND VERY LIGHT PCPN WILL WORK 
ITS WAY INTO MRX CWA FROM THE SW THIS AFTN. NO CHANGE TO OVERNIGHT 
WINTRY WEATHER AT THIS TIME. SON 

SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...TOUGH FORECAST FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.  A STRONG WARM FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY.  A VERY COLD AIR MASS WILL REMAIN IN PLACE TODAY FOR 
CONTINUED WELL BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES.  PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE INCOMING FRONT MAY REACH INTO SOUTHERN LOCATIONS LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON.  PRECIP WILL BEGIN OVER SOUTHERN AREAS AS SNOW OR A 
SNOW/SLEET MIX.  THE PRECIP WILL SPREAD NORTHWARD ACROSS THE MRX CWA 
DURING THE EVENING.  AS WARMER AIR SLOWLY PUSHES IN...PRECIP WILL 
SLOWLY TRANSITION FROM SNOW AND SLEET TO FREEZING RAIN...THEN 
EVENTUALLY TO ALL RAIN BY THURSDAY MORNING.  SOME ICE AND SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED AND A WINTER WEATHER WARNING/ADVISORY ARE 
IN EFFECT. WARMER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE IN FOR THURSDAY WITH ALL 
AREAS EXPECTED TO REACH ABOVE FREEZING.  HOWEVER...WINDS WILL 
INCREASE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAY BE SOME LINGERING 
RAIN EARLY THURSDAY NIGHT AS FIRST SYSTEM DEPARTS....THEN BY LATE 
FRIDAY MAY SEE SOME PRECIP STARTING TO WORK BACK INTO THE AREA. 
WHILE MODELS IN SLIGHTLY BETTER AGREEMENT FOR THIS WEEKEND...ENOUGH 
DIFFERENCES TO KEEP CONFIDENCE LOW.  HOW MUCH TROUGH WILL DIG AND 
HOW MUCH DEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR WITH LOW MOVING FROM GULF COAST TO 
UP OFF THE CAROLINA COAST IS PROBLEMATIC. THE GFS HAS BACKED OFF 
FROM EARLIER AND ECMWF IS A BIT MORE BULLISH.  WILL INCREASE POPS TO 
CHANCE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  RAIN/SNOW LINE MAY BE 
FLUCTUATING OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH GRADUAL TREND TOWARD 
MORE SNOW AS COLDER AIR FILTERS IN.  RIGHT NOW DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A 
BIG WINTER WEATHER EVENT...BUT GIVEN UNSTABLE MODELS SOLUTIONS WILL 
CERTAINLY BEAR WATCHING.   WILL LIKELY BE SOME SNOW SHOWERS AT LEAST 
NORTH AND MOUNTAINS SAT NIGHT THROUGH SUN NIGHT.  LOTS OF 
UNCERTAINTY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  MAY SEE SOME ADDITIONAL SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY BRINGING MORE SNOW SHOWERS...BUT WILL KEEP CURRENT 
FORECAST OF DRY CONDITIONS FOR NOW THAT FAR OUT.


&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       31  29  44  35  42 /  20 100  80  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
625 AM EST WED DEC 15 2010

.AVIATION...CONTINUED VERY COLD TODAY WITH VFR CONDITIONS.  A MID 
CLOUD DECK STRETCHED FROM BNA TO CHA WILL SLOWLY MOVE NORTH AND EAST 
DURING THE DAY.  SIGNIFICANT CHANGES EXPECTED FOR THE LATER HALF OF 
THE PERIOD AS A WARM FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA. ASSOCIATED PRECIP 
ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL BEGIN AS SNOW...REDUCING VIS AND 
LOWERING CLOUDS.  EXPECT AREAS OF MVFR OR EVEN IFR CONDITIONS AFTER 
00Z AS PRECIP BECOMES A MIXED BAG LATE IN THE PERIOD WITH A 
COMBINATION OF SNOW...SLEET...FREEZING RAIN AND RAIN.

AFTERNOON.  PRECIP WILL BEGIN OVER SOUTHERN AREAS AS SNOW OR A 
SNOW/SLEET MIX.  THE PRECIP WILL SPREAD NORTHWARD ACROSS THE MRX CWA 
DURING THE EVENING.  AS WARMER AIR SLOWLY PUSHES IN...PRECIP WILL 
SLOWLY TRANSITION FROM SNOW AND SLEET TO FREEZING RAIN...THEN 
EVENTUALLY TO ALL RAIN BY THURSDAY MORNING.  SOME ICE AND SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED AND A WINTER WEATHER WARNING/ADVISORY ARE 
IN EFFECT. WARMER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE IN FOR THURSDAY WITH ALL 
AREAS EXPECTED TO REACH ABOVE FREEZING.  HOWEVER...WINDS WILL 
INCREASE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAY BE SOME 
LINGERING RAIN EARLY THURSDAY NIGHT AS FIRST SYSTEM DEPARTS....THEN 
BY LATE FRIDAY MAY SEE SOME PRECIP STARTING TO WORK BACK INTO THE 
AREA. WHILE MODELS IN SLIGHTLY BETTER AGREEMENT FOR THIS 
WEEKEND...ENOUGH DIFFERENCES TO KEEP CONFIDENCE LOW.  HOW MUCH 
TROUGH WILL DIG AND HOW MUCH DEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR WITH LOW MOVING 
FROM GULF COAST TO UP OFF THE CAROLINA COAST IS PROBLEMATIC. THE GFS 
HAS BACKED OFF FROM EARLIER AND ECMWF IS A BIT MORE BULLISH.  WILL 
INCREASE POPS TO CHANCE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  RAIN/SNOW 
LINE MAY BE FLUCTUATING OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH GRADUAL 
TREND TOWARD MORE SNOW AS COLDER AIR FILTERS IN.  RIGHT NOW DOES NOT 
LOOK LIKE A BIG WINTER WEATHER EVENT...BUT GIVEN UNSTABLE MODELS 
SOLUTIONS WILL CERTAINLY BEAR WATCHING.   WILL LIKELY BE SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS AT LEAST NORTH AND MOUNTAINS SAT NIGHT THROUGH SUN NIGHT.  
LOTS OF UNCERTAINTY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  MAY SEE SOME ADDITIONAL 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY BRINGING MORE SNOW SHOWERS...BUT WILL KEEP CURRENT 
FORECAST OF DRY CONDITIONS FOR NOW THAT FAR OUT.


&&

.AVIATION...QUIET WEATHER FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE TAF PERIOD WITH

STRETCHED FROM BNA TO CHA WITH MAINLY CLEAR SKIES OVER TRI AND TYS.

FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA.  THE CLOUD DECK WILL SLOWLY SHIFT NORTH 
AND EAST AND WARMER AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
ASSOCIATED PRECIP ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL BEGIN AS 
SNOW...REDUCING VIS AND LOWERING CLOUDS.  EXPECT AREAS OF MVFR OR 
EVEN IFR CONDITIONS AFTER 00Z AS PRECIP BECOMES A MIXED BAG LATE IN

841 
FXUS64 KMRX 141942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST TUE DEC 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SKIES CLEARED THIS MORNING AS 
UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE FROM THE GREAT LAKES SHIFTED EAST. 
WINDS HAVE ALSO DECREASED TO 5 TO 10 MPH LOWER ELEVATIONS WITH 
NORTHERN SECTIONS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS AROUND 10 MPH WITH SOME 
HIGHER GUSTS. TEMPERATURES WERE SLOW TO RISE BUT REACHED A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER NE SECTIONS DUE TO MORE SUN AND ARE NOW MIDDLE TEENS 
TO UPPER 20S. ONE MORE CLEAR AND VERY COLD NIGHT TONIGHT ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND EASTERN TN VALLEY AS DRY COLD 
AIRMASS...LIGHTER WINDS AND SNOW COVER MAKES FOR IDEAL RADIATIONAL 
COOLING. DEW POINTS HAVE BEEN IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TODAY. 
FORECASTING A RECORD TYING 9 DEGREE LOW AT TRI CITIES WHICH MIGHT 
EVEN BE TO WARM WITH THE LOW DEW POINTS. ELSEWHERE SINGLE DIGITS AND 
TEENS. WEDNESDAY A DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES MOVES 
INTO THE PLAINS WITH A WARM MOIST AIRMASS ADVANCING FROM THE WEST 
SOUTHWEST. MODELS ARE NOW A LITTLE SLOWER THAN BEFORE AND DO NOT 
EXPECT AND PRECIPITATION TO SPREAD INTO SW AND WEST SECTIONS UNTIL 
AFTERNOON. WARM AIR ALOFT WILL SPREAD IN RAPIDLY WEDNESDAY BUT 
TEMPERATURES AT THE SURFACE WILL WARM MORE SLOWLY ONLY REACHING THE 
UPPER 20S TO UPPER 30S FROM A COLD START AND GRADUALLY INCREASING 
CLOUDS. A MIXTURE OF SNOW AND SLEET WILL START IN THE WESTERN 
SECTIONS AND POSSIBLY FREEZING RAIN OR RAIN IN THE AFTERNOON. ONLY 
SLIGHT ACCUMULATIONS OF A HUNDREDTH OR TWO OF PRECIPITATION ARE 
EXPECTED SO NOT LIKELY TO AFFECT TRAVEL SIGNIFICANTLY AS BULK OF 
SYSTEM MOVES IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT 
THEN DIVERGE FOR THE WEEKEND. A WARM FRONT...ASSOCIATED WITH A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH A STRONG WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. GFS MODEL IS A 
LITTLE WARMER THAN THE NAM MODEL ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT THE 
VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILES OF BOTH MODELS INDICATE THAT LIGHT SNOW 
SHOULD DEVELOP INITIALLY OVER THE AREA BY EARLY WEDNESDAY EVENING. A 
STRONG AND WARM 850 MB LAYER WILL THEN PUSH NORTHWARD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...CAUSING THIS SNOW TO CHANGE OVER TO SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN...BEFORE ULTIMATELY BECOMING ALL RAIN BY THURSDAY. IT 
APPEARS THAT THE CHANGEOVER TO ALL RAIN SHOULD OCCUR AROUND MIDNIGHT 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...AROUND SUNRISE THURSDAY 
MORNING ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN...AND AROUND LATE MORNING ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. THE RECENT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY 
SLOW THE STRONG WARMING THAT IS PROGGED BY THE MODELS (ESPECIALLY IN 
THE PROTECTED VALLEY AREAS)...BUT THE MODELS AGREE THAT THE MORE 
NORTHERLY TRACK OF THE LOW (ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND SOUTHERN WV ON 
THURSDAY MORNING) SHOULD BRING ALL AREAS ABOVE FREEZING ON THURSDAY. 
RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT SOME ICE ACCUMS OF 0.10-0.20 INCHES WILL 
BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT IN THESE 
AREAS. MODELS NOW INDICATE QPF AMOUNTS AROUND 0.25 INCH OR GREATER 
ALONG THE TN/KY BORDER AND SOUTHWEST VA BY 12Z THURSDAY...SO WILL 
ISSUE A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR THESE AREAS WHERE 0.25 INCH OF ICE 
ACCUMS (AS WELL AS 1 TO 3 INCHES OF SNOW) WILL BE POSSIBLE. 

A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL THEN MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SOME RAIN/SNOW DURING THESE PERIODS. BY THE WEEKEND...THE LATEST GFS 
MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO INDICATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRONG PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OFF THE CAROLINA COAST ON SATURDAY...WHICH WOULD SPREAD 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE FORM OF SNOW OR RAIN. ECMWF 
MODEL CONTINUE TO INDICATE THAT THIS LOW WILL FORM FURTHER EAST OVER 
THE ATLANTIC OCEAN...WITH GENERALLY DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS FOR 
THE FORECAST AREA. ALTHOUGH THE ECMWF MODEL HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT 
(AND USUALLY VERIFIES BETTER)...WILL LEAN TOWARDS THE GFS MODEL 
SINCE ITS SOLUTION APPEARS TO BE WHAT NORMALLY HAPPENS THIS TIME OF 
YEAR.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EST TUE DEC 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES INTO 
TODAY...BUT MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE.  PLAN TO ALLOW WINTER 
STORM WARNING TO EXPIRE ON SCHEDULE AT 11Z...BUT STILL WILL INCLUDE 
SOME FLURRIES VALLEY AND SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS SW VA AND MOUNTAINS 
TODAY.  MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE ESPECIALLY SOUTHWEST TONIGHT 
AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM...BUT DO NOT EXPECT ANY PRECIP OVERNIGHT.

CHANGES THERE. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL...SO JUST SOME 
MINOR TWEAKS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DIFFICULT FORECAST FOR 
THE FIRST PART OF THE EXTENDED.  A WARM FRONT WILL LIFT FROM SOUTH 
TO NORTH ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...CREATING STRONG 
ISENTROPIC LIFT AND WARM ADVECTION AND PROVIDE AND MIX OF 
PRECIPITATION.  WITH COLD AIR ALREADY ENTRENCHED ACROSS THE 
REGION...INITIAL PRECIP WILL FALL AS SNOW.  CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW ON 
TIMING OF WARM AIR MOVING IN AND EFFECT IT WILL HAVE ON PRECIP.  
CURRENT THINKING IS LIGHT SNOW WILL MOVE IN WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
SOUTH...WEDNESDAY EVENING NORTH...THEN WILL BECOME A MIX OF 
SNOW...SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND TURNING OVER TO 
ALL RAIN FOR THURSDAY.  AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW AND SOME ICE 
ACCUMULATION OF AROUND .10 OF AN INCH IS POSSIBLE.  TEMPERATURES 
WARM A BIT BUT SHOULD REMAIN BELOW NORMAL BEHIND THE FRONT AS A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE MOVES IN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  THIS WILL BRING A 
ROUND OF LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW.  WILL MOVE INTO A QUIETER WEATHER 
PATTERN WITH DRY CONDITIONS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

INTO THE EVENING HOURS.

OTHERWISE...VFR RETURNS ON TUESDAY FOR THE REGION WITH MUCH LIGHTER 
WESTERLY WINDS IN GENERAL.

780 
FXUS64 KMRX 132022 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED LONG TERM SECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST MON DEC 13 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WINTER STORM WINDING DOWN ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA AS DEEPER MOISTURE SHIFTS EAST WITH UPPER 
LOW NOW ALONG THE NE COASTAL STATES. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE 
STRONG ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND CONTINUE SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY 
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY MORNING. HAVE CANCELLED THE 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHEAST TN AND NC MOUNTAINS...NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND MUCH OF THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TN AS SKIES HAVE 
BEGUN TO BREAKOUT EXCEPT THE FOOTHILLS OF THE SMOKIES WHERE RADAR 
INDICATES SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING AND ALSO ACROSS NE TN VALLEYS. 
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE ADVISORY AREAS WILL BE LIGHT. 
HOWEVER IN THE MOUNTAINS ANOTHER COUPLE INCHES ARE POSSIBLE 
OVERNIGHT SO KEPT WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM. AS 
SKIES SLOWLY CLEAR AND WITH SNOW COVER LOWS TONIGHT ARE EXPECTED TO 
DROP TO 5 TO 15 DEGREES. AS HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL TUESDAY 
SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS AND NE BUT 
GRADUALLY CLEAR THERE DURING THE DAY. WENT ON LOW SIDE OF GUIDANCE 
FOR HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE TEENS TO UPPER 20S. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY 
DECREASE TONIGHT EXCEPT REMAIN STRONG FROM THE NORTHWEST IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS WHERE WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 
11 AM TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH FRIDAY...BUT THEN 
DIVERGE FOR THE WEEKEND. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED WARM 
FRONT MOVING NORTH ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT... 
AS THIS LOW MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. GFS AND NAM 
MODELS BOTH AGREE THAT THIS LOW WILL MOVE A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH... 
WITH A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...THE COLD AIR AT THE SURFACE 
WILL BE SLOW TO RETREAT...SO A WINTRY MIX OF SNOW...SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN APPEARS LIKELY BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THE RECENT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY SLOW THE STRONG WARMING THAT IS PROGGED BY 
THE MODELS...IT APPEARS THAT PRECIP SHOULD BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN 
AREA WIDE BY THURSDAY. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT SOME ICE ACCUMS 
OF 0.10-0.20 INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ALONG WITH 
SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES. MODELS THEN INDICATE THAT A 
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOME 
RAIN/SNOW DURING THESE PERIODS. BY THE WEEKEND...ECMWF MODEL 
INDICATES THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST WILL 
DEVELOP A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC...WITH 
GENERALLY DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST 
GFS MODEL RUN HAS COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ECMWF MODEL... 
BUT EARLIER GFS RUNS HAD INDICATE THAT THIS LOW WOULD DEVELOP CLOSER 
TO THE EAST COAST...WITH SOME WINTRY PRECIP AFFECTING THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. FOR NOW...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE ECMWF 
SOLUTION WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS FOR SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY...BUT THIS COULD EASILY CHANGE IN LATER FORECASTS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   14  29  21  36  35 /  10   0  10  50  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     12  25  17  35  33 /  10   0  10  40  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN             11  26  18  35  33 /  10   0  10  40  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    11  20  12  32  27 /  20  10  10  30  70 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...NW 
     BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST 
     COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...SULLIVAN...WASHINGTON TN.

     WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

     WIND CHILL ADVISORY UNTIL 11 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...

     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1027 AM EST MON DEC 13 2010

.DISCUSSION...SNOWFALL HAS BEGUN TAPERING OFF THIS MORNING WITH
PARTIAL CLEARING ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY.  
TEMPERATURES HAVE BOTTOMED OUT IN THE TEENS AND LOWER 20S.
EXPECTING ONLY A FEW DEGREES WARMING WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION
CONTINUING THROUGHOUT THE DAY. LOWERED HIGHS A DEGREE OR TWO MOST
LOCATIONS. UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THIS AFTERNOON AND
TONIGHT IN FAVORED AREAS WITH MODEL GUIDANCE SHOWING TWO TO FOUR
INCHES BY THIS EVENING AND HIGHEST ELEVATIONS PROBABLY SIX INCHES.
LOWER ELEVATIONS IN ADVISORY AREAS MAY ONLY GET A DUSTING TO AROUND
TWO INCHES. CURRENT GRIDS HAVE THESE AMOUNTS ALREADY STATED SO NO
CHANGES THERE. CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD. NO CHANGES TO WIND CHILL
ADVISORY. UPDATE OUT SOON.

&&

658 
FXUS64 KMRX 130923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST MON DEC 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WITH TROUGH SHIFTING OUT OF THE 
AREA...WILL BE TRANSITIONING TO MORE OF A PURE UPSLOPE EVENT. 
MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY BECOME MORE SHALLOW...BUT STILL LOOKS LIKE 
ENOUGH MOISTURE ALONG WITH STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES TO SUPPORT 
CURRENT ADVISORIES/WARNINGS...SO NO CHANGES PLANNED THERE.  SNOW 
SHOWERS SHOULD BE DIMINISHING QUITE A BIT BY LATE TONIGHT...SO 06Z 
STOP TIME LOOKS REASONABLE FOR THE WARNING.  MAY BE BORDERLINE FOR A 
WIND ADVISORY IN SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN TODAY...BUT WILL 
CONTINUE TO JUST MENTION WINDS IN THE OTHER PRODUCTS.  WIND CHILLS 
WILL ALSO BE QUITE LOW...AND CURRENT WIND CHILL ADVISORY ALSO LOOKS 
GOOD.  OVERALL NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC 
SNOWFALL SHOULD CONTINUE OVER THE TERRAIN FEATURES ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ON TUESDAY BEFORE ENDING LATER IN 
THE DAY. LITTLE REST FOR THE WEARY BEHIND THE EARLY WEEK SNOWSTORM 
AS MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW TROFINESS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE CENTER 
PORTION OF THE NATION ON WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN 
THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES. THIS SETS THE STAGE FOR A MID WEEK STORM 
SYSTEM THAT PROMISES TO BRING A PERIOD OF MIXED PRECIPITATION AS THE 
SURFACE LOW SHIFTS EAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. 
ATMOSPHERIC STRUCTURE STILL COLD ENOUGH FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT 
SNOW ON WEDNESDAY AS MOISTURE SPREADS IN ALOFT. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY THERE WILL BE A FAIRLY DECENT CHANCE OF SLEET...FREEZING 
RAIN AND SNOW AS WARMER AIR BUILDS IN ALOFT. SUFFICIENT WARMING MAY 
BE REALIZED BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
PRECIPITATION TO CHANGE ENTIRELY TO RAIN. DROPPED POPS BACK THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY WITH RAIN CHANGING TO SOME LIGHT SNOW AS THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES AWAY TO THE EAST. KEPT A DRY PERIOD FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS ANOTHER 
DEEPENING UPPER TROF OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. BY SUNDAY APPLIED 
OROGRAPHIC SNOW IN THE FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS AS THE 
NORTHWESTERLY COMPONENT BRINGS MOISTURE OUT OF THE LAKES ALONG WITH 
STRENGTHENING COLD AIR ADVECTION. 


&&

603 
FXUS64 KMRX 130229
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
929 PM EST SUN DEC 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...LOW PRESSURE BRINGING SNOW...WIND AND COLD TEMPERATURES 
TO THE CWA. CURRENT WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES STILL LOOK REASONABLE. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
THE CENTER OF THE 500 MB CIRCULATION WILL BE PASSING OVER THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA BETWEEN 21Z AND 06Z. SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE 
INCREASING DURING THIS WINDOW. AFTER 06Z...850 MB WINDS INCREASE TO 
AROUND 40 KTS AND TURN TO NW...AND IDEAL SETUP FOR UPSLOPE 
ENHANCEMENT OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. VERY COLD 
TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL GENERATE STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES THIS 
EVENING THROUGH MONDAY...WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE IN THE DENDRITE 
GROWTH ZONE FROM A GREAT LAKES CONNECTION. THE GOOD INSTABILITY AND 
DEEP MOISTURE WILL MEAN THAT VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL SEE ACCUMULATING 
SNOW AS WELL. 

NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST REASONING...AND FEW 
CHANGES WILL BE NEEDED. SLIGHT UPWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO SNOWFALL 
AMOUNTS WILL BE MADE BASED ON TRENDS OF RADAR AND UPSTREAM 
OBSERVATIONS...BUT ACCUMULATIONS WILL STILL BE WITHIN THE PREVIOUSLY 
FORECAST RANGES. WARMING MIDLEVEL TEMPS MONDAY NIGHT SHOULD BRING AN 
END TO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS...SO WSW END TIMES LOOK GOOD. 

ONE ADDITION TO THE WSW PRODUCT WILL BE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY. 
EXPECTED WIND CHILL VALUES IN THE TN MOUNTAINS WILL BE EASILY WITHIN 
ADVISORY CRITERIA OF -5 TO -14 DEGREES FROM 00Z MONDAY TO 16Z 
TUESDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST PEAKS EVEN LOWER. THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
SW VA WILL ALSO SEE WIND CHILLS IN THIS RANGE...BEGINNING 09Z 
TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. WIND SPEEDS IN THE MOUNTAINS WILL 
BE MAINLY 20 TO 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 40 MPH...WHICH IS CLOSE TO WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA...BUT SPEEDS ABOVE THAT RANGE SEEM ISOLATED AND 
BRIEF ENOUGH NOT TO ISSUE ONE AT THIS TIME.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
DID NOT CHANGE LOW CHANCES FOR OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS  
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER TUESDAY AS NW FLOW OFF THE GREAT LAKES WINDS DOWN. 
TEMPERATURES REMAIN FRIGID WITH EXPECTED SNOW COVER AND ESPECIALLY 
WITH WIND CONTINUING. PRESSURE GRADIENT DECREASES LATER IN THE DAY 
SO WINDS WILL DROP OFF. ANOTHER VERY COLD NIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT WITH 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND SNOW COVER. PLACES IN THE NE WILL LIKELY BE A 
FEW DEGREES COLDER. WEDNESDAY PATTERN BECOMES MORE ZONAL AS TROUGH 
EXITS THE NE STATES. A DEVELOPING SYSTEM ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
WILL BRING MOISTURE BACK OVER THE COLD AIRMASS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
AND NIGHT BRINGING A MIXTURE OF PRECIPITATION TYPES WITH FREEZING 
RAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
NORTHERN SECTIONS WILL LIKELY SEE SNOW AND SLEET WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
CHANGING TO FREEZING RAIN AND RAIN THURSDAY. HIGHS WEDNESDAY SHOULD 
REACH THE MID 30S TO NEAR 40 SOUTH AND MID 20S TO LOWER 30S NORTH. 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE STEADY OR SLOWLY RISE. THURSDAY 
SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER IN THE UPPER 30S TO UPPER 40S. AS 
LOW PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST WITH THURSDAY SYSTEM AND TROUGH DEVELOPS 
AGAIN ACROSS THE EAST THE RAIN SHOULD CHANGE BACK TO SNOW ACROSS 
NORTHERN SECTIONS THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY. PRECIPITATION ENDS WITH 
COLDER TEMPERATURES FOR THE WEEKEND. BUT TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMER 
THAN BEHIND THIS EARLY WEEK COLD BLAST.        

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              19  22  12  23   8 / 100  90  20  10  10

618 PM EST SUN DEC 12 2010

.AVIATION...EXTENSIVE LOW CLOUD LAYER EXTENDS WEST TO ALONG THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER EARLY THIS EVENING...WITH STRONG CYCLONIC FLOW 
ALOFT AND COLD AIR ADVECTION LIKELY TO KEEP THESE CLOUDS IN FOR THE 
NIGHT AND MOST OF MONDAY FOR SW VA AND NE TN (TRI). LOW LEVEL W-NW 
MODERATE TO STRONG UPSLOPE WINDS WILL KEEP PERIODS OF LIGHT TO 
MODERATE SNOW...WITH MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS FOR CHA AND TYS...WHILE
CONDITIONS BOTTOM OUT AT TRI WITH BELOW ALTERNATE MINIMUMS FOR THE 
NEXT 12 TO 15 HOURS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1208 PM EST SUN DEC 12 2010

.AVIATION...
A DEEP MIDLEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK ACROSS NE TN AND SW
VA THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO SNOW
SHOWERS INCREASING OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS...IN BOTH COVERAGE AND
INTENSITY...ESPECIALLY AT TRI. THE TAFS WILL TREND CEILINGS AND
VISIBILITIES DOWNWARD THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE
CHANCES OF SNOW INCREASE. TRI WILL HAVE IFR CONDITIONS...WITH MVFR
AT TYS AND CHA. THESE CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST THROUGH TONIGHT...AND
MAY IMPROVE SLIGHTLY AFTER 12Z. WINDS WILL ALSO BE A CONCERN...WITH
W TO NW WINDS SUSTAINED 15-20 KTS GUSTING TO 25-30 KTS THROUGH THE
TAF PERIOD.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...
     HAMBLEN...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...
     MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...ROANE...SCOTT TN...
     SULLIVAN...UNION...WASHINGTON TN.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ MONDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MARION...
     MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...
     WEST POLK.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: EAST POLK.

859 
FXUS64 KMRX 121455 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EST SUN DEC 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...
TEMPERATURES ARE FALLING SHARPLY OVEREAST AND MIDDLE TN AS A SHARP
850 MB TEMP GRADIENT IS OVER THE AREA. PLATEAU COUNTIES HAVE
CHANGED OVER TO SNOW...ALONG WITH SOME OBSERVATIONS IN LEE AND WISE
COUNTIES IN VIRGINIA. ANY SNOW SHOWERS IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS SHOULD
REMAIN SCATTERED AND LIGHT AS SOME DIRER AIR ALOFT MOVES
OVERHEAD BEHIND THE UPPER JET...BUT WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY AS
THE 500 MB LOW MOVES OVERHEAD...SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE INCREASING
THIS AFTERNOON IN BOTH COVERAGE AND INTENSITY.

SOME EARLY SNOWFALL REPORTS INDICATE THAT 2-4 INCHES HAS ALREADY
ACCUMULATED IN THE MOUNTAINS...WITH 7 INCHES REPORTED AT NEWFOUND
GAP. A MORE COMPLETE SNOW REPORT WILL BE ISSUED AROUND 11 AM. 

THE FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK.NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE
PLANNED AT THIS TIME. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE JUST TO FRESHEN THE
WORDING.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM EST 
     MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...
     HAMBLEN...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...
     MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...ROANE...SCOTT TN...
     SULLIVAN...UNION...WASHINGTON TN.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ MONDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MARION...
     MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...
     WEST POLK.

GOING THROUGH THE END OF THE TAF AS VERY COLD AIR ALOFT BUILDS IN
GENERATING SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SUN DEC 12 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...FRONT WILL EXIT THE 
AREA EARLY...THEN UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION LATER 
TODAY INTO TONIGHT.  PRECIP CHANCES WILL ALSO BE ENHANCED TONIGHT AS 
WEAK LOW LEVEL TROUGH ROTATES THROUGH.  BETTER UPSLOPE WIND 
DIRECTION WILL SET UP LATER TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...ALTHOUGH 
MOISTURE WILL BECOME MUCH SHALLOWER BY MONDAY NIGHT.  EXPECT ANY 
RAIN TO QUICKLY CHANGE OVER TO ALL SNOW THIS MORNING...THEN SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY BEFORE BEGINNING TO TAPER OFF.  
SNOW AMOUNTS PROBLEMATIC AS ALWAYS...ESPECIALLY GIVEN EXPECTED HIGH 
LIQUID TO SNOW RATIOS.  HOWEVER...WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM 
CURRENT FORECAST AMOUNTS.  WILL ADD A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR 
SOUTHEAST TN...AND LEAVE OTHER AREAS IN CURRENT ADVISORIES/WARNINGS.
WINDS HAVE DIMINISHED IN THE MOUNTAINS...SO WILL END WIND ADVISORY A 
COUPLE OF HOURS EARLY.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT/LOW 
CHANCE FOR OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWERS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MUCH 
OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER ON TUESDAY AS 
THE NORTHWEST TRAJECTORY OFF LAKE MICHIGAN REMAINS IN PLACE WHILE 
WEAKENING THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA ENJOYS A 
BRIEF DRY PERIOD EXTENDING FROM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING 
AS THE UPPER LEVEL PATTERN TRANSITIONS TO A MORE ZONAL CONFIGURATION 
WITH THE DEPARTURE OF THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF. THE NEXT 
SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY AS SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY STREAMS BACK INTO THE EASTERN U.S. THE ARCTIC AIRMASS 
RESIDING OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL NOT MODIFY SIGNIFICANTLY 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS MUCH OF THE NORTHERN HALF WHERE THE FRIGID AIR AND 
SNOW COVER WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPERATURES AROUND FREEZING OR BELOW AS 
LATE AS WEDNESDAY. MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL COOL BELOW 
FREEZING WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND AS THE MILD AND MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW BUILDS IN OVER THE COLD SURFACE...FREEZING RAIN MAY DEVELOP. 
THE THREAT MAY LAST THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING AS TEMPERATURES ONLY 
SLOWLY RISE ABOVE 32 DEGREES. THE RAIN WOULD LIKELY TRANSITION BACK 
TO SNOW SHOWERS LATER THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS COLD AIR FLOWS 
BACK INTO THE REGION BEHIND A DEPARTING FRONTAL SYSTEM. THE MODELS 
ARE HINTING AT MORE NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY AS ANOTHER UPPER TROF BUILDS INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
TRENDED TEMP FORECAST TOWARD NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

640 PM EST SAT DEC 11 2010

.AVIATION...PRECIPITATION WORKING SLOWLY EAST THIS EVENING AND 
MAINLY AFFECTING CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AT TAF ISSUANCE. CEILINGS REMAIN

OR WORSE FOR CHA BY MIDNIGHT...AND ALSO DOWN TO AT LEAST MVFR FOR

TRI CEILING VFR UNTIL TOWARD DAYBREAK.

OTHERWISE...STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL PRODUCE LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR 
FOR CHA AND TYS...AND MONITORING FOR TRI AS WELL LATER TONIGHT. 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION AFTER 12Z-15Z SUNDAY WILL CREATE MAINLY 
LIGHT SNOW OR MODERATE SNOW SHOWERS AT TIMES. GUSTY WESTERLY WINDS 
ALSO EXPECTED FROM AROUND 16Z SUNDAY ON.

674 
FXUS64 KMRX 112002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST SAT DEC 11 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER IA WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS TO PORTIONS OF THE AREA LATE TONIGHT THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT. RAIN WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREA THROUGH THE 
EVENING...ASSOCIATED WITH STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE EXIT REGION 
OF A JET STREAK AT THE BASE OF THE CLOSED UPPER LOW. WARM ADVECTION 
AHEAD OF THE ADVANCING COLD FRONT SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE 
MOUNTAINS ABOVE FREEZING...OFFSETTING EVAPORATIVE COOLING BY PRECIP 
INTO DRY AIR. 

THE QUESTION IS WHETHER PRECIP WILL CHANGE TO SNOW BEFORE THE DEEP 
MOISTURE AND STRONG FORCING EXIT. WHILE THE MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT OVERALL...THEIR SOUNDINGS DIFFER IN THE TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE BELOW 800 MB...WITH THE GFS BEING NEAR-FREEZING 
ISOTHERMAL...AND THE NAM SHOWING A MORE DISTINCT 3C WARM NOSE. LEAN 
MORE TOWARD THE NAM GIVEN THE STRONG S-SW FLOW AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT...BUT IF THE GFS IS CORRECT...SNOW AMOUNTS TONIGHT COULD BE 
HIGHER. TEMPS ALOFT DROP SHARPLY WITH FROPA SUNDAY MORNING...GOING 
BELOW FREEZING FIRST IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AROUND 10Z...THEN IN 
THE VALLEY AROUND 15Z. HOWEVER THE DRY SLOT CUTS OFF DEEP MOISTURE 
SUNDAY MORNING...SO THERE WILL LIKELY BE A LULL IN THE PRECIP ONCE 
THE COLD AIR MOVES IN. THERE COULD BE A COUPLE INCHES OF 
ACCUMULATION IN THE MTNS TONIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING...WITH A DUSTING IN 
THE PLATEAU AND SW VA. ANY SNOW WILL LIKELY BE VERY WET...WITH A LOW 
LIQUID/SNOW RATIO.

AS THE DEEP 500 MB CLOSED LOW TRACKS ACROSS KY AND INTO WV 
SUNDAY...THE EVENT WILL TRANSITION TO A NW FLOW SNOW EVENT. STEEP 
LAPSE RATES UNDER THE LOW WILL GENERATE SNOW SHOWERS SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. NEAR-SATURATION IN THE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE 
AND STRENGTHENING NW WINDS WILL MEAN IDEAL CONDITIONS FOR 
SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN...AND PERSISTENT SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE VALLEY. WINDS IN THE 900-850 MB LAYER REMAIN BETWEEN 
25-35 KTS FROM THE NW SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. VERY HIGH 
LIQUID/SNOW RATIOS ARE LIKELY IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH THESE 
CONDITIONS. BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW WILL BE LIKELY...AND WIND 
ADVISORIES MAY BE NEEDED. NEAR-BLIZZARD CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED 
AT TIMES IN THE MTNS. ANOTHER CONCERN IS WIND CHILLS...WHICH WILL BE 
IN THE -5 TO -15 RANGE IN THE MTNS AND SW VA. 

A WINTER STORM WARNING WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS...WHERE 8 
TO 14 INCH AMOUNTS WILL BE COMMON...WITH GREATER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE IN 
THE HIGHEST TERRAIN. A WARNING WILL ALSO BE ISSUED FOR SW VA...WITH 
AMOUNTS IN THE 5 TO 10 INCH RANGE. HIGH KNOB COULD SEE OVER 12 
INCHES. WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE NORTHERN 
AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY...THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND SW NC. AMOUNTS 
IN THESE AREAS ARE EXPECTED TO RANGE FROM 3 TO 6 IN THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND TRI-CITIES AREA AND MOUNTAINS OF SW NC...AND 1 TO 3 IN 
THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND KNOXVILLE AREA. ANOTHER CONCERN IS THE VERY 
COLD TEMPERATURES...WHICH WILL LIKELY HELP MAKE THE ROADS MORE 
HAZARDOUS THAN USUAL FOR SUCH LOW SNOW AMOUNTS. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
DEEP UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST INTO THE NE STATES TUESDAY
WITH ONLY A FEW LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS TUESDAY MORNING NE TN
MOUNTAINS AND SW VIRGINIA AND MINOR ACCUMULATIONS. TEMPERATURES
WILL STILL BE VERY COLD AS SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY BUT WITH
ANTICIPATED SNOW COVER HIGHS LESS THAN 20 MOUNTAINS AND 20S TO
LOWER 30S ELSEWHERE. HEIGHTS INCREASE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY
BUT SNOW COVER WILL ALLOW FOR MAXIMUM COOLING TUESDAY NIGHT.
SOUTHERN LOWER ELEVATION AREAS SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER WHERE
SNOW COVER IS NOT EXPECTED BUT OTHERWISE LOWS SINGLE DIGITS TO
LOWER TEENS LIKELY. WEDNESDAY WARMING COMMENCES IN EARNEST BUT AT
THE SAME TIME AN UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS STATES WITH
A LOW PRESSURE AREA AND COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. LIGHT RAIN DEVELOPS AS EARLY AS
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND VALLEY AREAS AND
SPREADS NE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST AREAS MAY
EXPERIENCE SOME LIGHT FREEZING RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY
THURSDAY BEFORE THE COLD AIR IS SCOURED OUT. THURSDAY PRECIPITATION
SHOULD STAY AS RAIN AS WARMING CONTINUES. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT
WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND A BROADER TROUGH SETTLES OVER
THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. COLDER AIR AND LINGERING
MOISTURE BRINGS SOME SNOW TO HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NORTHERN
SECTIONS THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS
IN SATURDAY SO KEPT LAST DAY DRY. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY CONCERNING
MOISTURE DEPTH AND TIMING OF THURSDAY SYSTEM SO FORECAST COULD
CHANGE OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

&&

709 
FXUS64 KMRX 111452 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
952 AM EST SAT DEC 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY AHEAD OF A
200 MB JET STREAK LOCATED ACROSS TX/AR/MS. LIFT IN THE LEFT EXIT
REGION OF THIS JET IS GENERATING PRECIP ACROSS WEST TN THIS
MORNING. DRY AIR BELOW 850 MB SEEN IN 12Z OHX SOUNDING WILL LIKELY
KEEP MUCH PRECIP FROM REACHING THE GROUND IN OUR AREA BEFORE 21Z.
AS THE JET MOVES EAST...UPPER DIVERGENCE ANDISENTROPIC UPGLIDE
SHOULD CREATE ENOUGH LIFT FOR PRECIP TO OVERCOME THIS DRY
LAYER...SO OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES MAY SEE SOME LIGHT RAINFALL LATE
THIS AFTERNOON. THE CURRENT POP/WX FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. OBSERVED
TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE FORECAST TEMPS...BUT
BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM RISING VERY
MUCH. 06Z MOS GUIDANCE HAS HIGH TEMPS BELOW THE CURRENT FORECAST.
THE UPDATE WILL ADJUST HIGH TEMPS DOWNWARD A LITTLE AND UPDATE
HOURLY TEMPS/DEWPOINTS.

THE 12Z NAM APPEARS TO HAVE CHANGED LITTLE FROM THE PREVIOUS RUN
FOR THE COMING WINTER STORM. THE MOST CHALLENGING ASPECT OF THIS
EVENT WILL BE THE TRANSITION TONIGHT FROM RAIN TO SNOW...AND HOW
THE TIMING OF THIS TRANSITION ALIGNS WITH THE STRONGEST LIFT AND
DEEPEST MOISTURE. THE NAM AND THE GFS DO SEEM TO BE IN BETTER
AGREEMENT WITH TIMING THAN YESTERDAY. IF ALL REMAINS ON
TRACK ONCE THE 12Z MODEL RUNS ARE CLOSELY EXAMINED...EXPECT THAT
WINTER STORM WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES WILL BE ISSUED THIS AFTERNOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...HANCOCK...
     HAWKINS...MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...
     SCOTT TN...SULLIVAN...WASHINGTON TN.

630 
FXUS64 KMRX 110923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST SAT DEC 11 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WARM/MOIST ADVECTION WITH
INCREASING CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM OVER THE
CENTER OF THE NATION WILL KEEP SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY TODAY.
STAYED WITH A SMALL/SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR THE WESTERN PART
OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS AFTERNOON AS A STRONG COLD FRONT
RACES EAST ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. DECENT WARMING AHEAD OF
THE FRONT SHOULD BOOST TEMPERATURES INTO THE UPPER 40S AND LOWER
50S ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION.

RAIN WILL OVERSPREAD ENTIRE AREA TONIGHT AS SYSTEM MOVES IN.  LOOKS 
LIKE THERE COULD BE A BRIEF PERIOD THAT FAVORS MOUNTAIN WAVES WITH 
STRONG WINDS IN THE USUAL HIGHER ELEVATION AND FOOTHILLS AREAS...BUT 
CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO PUT ANY WIND PRODUCTS OUT AT THIS 
TIME. FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH...WITH ARRIVAL OF COLDER AIR LATER 
TONIGHT...BUT STILL SOME DIFFICULTY TIMING CHANGEOVER TO SNOW.  
LOOKS LIKE HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE SOME SNOW LATER TONIGHT...AND 
MAY BEGIN TO MIX EVEN IN VALLEY LOCATIONS TOWARD SUNRISE.  MUCH 
COLDER AIR WILL MOVE IN SUNDAY...AND ALL PRECIP WILL CHANGE TO SNOW 
SHOWERS.  WIND CHILL VALUES WILL DROP SHARPLY...WITH VERY COLD 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED BY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.  DEEP UPPER TROUGH 
WILL DIG IN SUNDAY...ENHANCING CHANCES FOR SNOW SHOWERS SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY NIGHT.  NORTHWEST FLOW AND COLD ADVECTION 
SHOULD KEEP SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING THROUGH MONDAY.  LOOKS LIKE THIS 
SHOULD BE A BIG EVENT FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND EVEN VALLEY 
LOCATIONS ESPECIALLY NORTH AND CENTRAL MAY SEE ACCUMULATING SNOWS.  
SOME QUESTION ABOUT WHETHER NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS WILL REACH HEAVY 
SNOW WARNING CRITERIA IN ANY 12 OR 24 HOUR PERIOD...BUT FOR NOW WILL 
LEAVE WATCH AS IS.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROF WILL MOVE 
VERY SLOWLY EAST AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE WILL BE IN PLACE DURING THIS PERIOD FOR 
A CONTINUATION OF NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS THE 
SMOKY MOUNTAINS. THIS EVENT FINALLY COMES TO AN END BY TUESDAY NIGHT 
AS THE TROF SHIFTS FAR ENOUGH AWAY TO THE EAST. BUILDING HEIGHTS 
LATER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WILL ALLOW FOR AN APPROXIMATE TEN 
TO TWELVE DEGREE WARMING IN MAX TEMPS WEDNESDAY BUT THIS WILL NOT BE 
ENOUGH TO SAVE THE FORECAST AREA FROM A THREAT FOR FREEZING RAIN 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING AS THE MODELS SHOW AN UPPER 
TROF DEVELOPING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES WITH SUFACE WAVE 
DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. WARM AND MOIST AIR 
WILL OVERRIDE THE SUBFREEZING AIRMASS NEAR THE GROUND SETTING THE 
STAGE FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING RAIN. STILL A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
UNCERTAINTY CONCERNING MOISTURE DEPTH AND TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM SO 
THIS FORECAST COULD CHANGE OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. THE LATE PORTION 
OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD IS RATHER MURKY WITH LARGE DIFFERENCES IN 
THE EXTENDED MODELS BUT STAYED CLOSE TO THE NEIGHBORING WFO 
DEPICTION OF LOW TO MEDIUM CHANCE FOR RAIN THURSDAY WITH DECREASING 
PROBABILITY ON FRIDAY. TRENDED TEMP FORECAST TOWARD IF NOT A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW MEX MOS GUIDANCE DUE TO ARCTIC AIR MASS AND EXPECTED 
SNOW COVER.

008 
FXUS64 KMRX 101955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST FRI DEC 10 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
HIGH CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AHEAD OF A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
AND APPROACHING UPPER JET. A LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ALLOW 
TEMPS TO WARM INTO THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S IN MOST SPOTS TOMORROW.

A CLOSED LOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS SATURDAY WILL TRACK ACROSS THE 
LOWER GREAT LAKES ON SUNDAY. THE UPPER JET ROUNDING THE BASE OF THE 
LOW WILL BE POSITIONED OVER AR/WEST TN...GIVING STRONG UPPER 
DIVERGENCE IN OUR AREA. THIS ALONG WITH MOISTURE TRANSPORT FROM A 
STRENGTHENING LLJ WILL BRING PRECIP TO THE AREA BEGINNING SATURDAY 
EVENING. THE QUESTION IS WHETHER TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH 
FOR SNOW SATURDAY NIGHT. EXPECT THAT COLD ADVECTION THROUGH THE 
NIGHT WILL CHANGE THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO SNOW AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...THEN DOWN TO THE VALLEY BY SUNRISE. THERE WILL LIKELY BE 
PERIODS OF RAIN/SNOW MIX OR TRANSITIONS DEPENDING ON THE PRECIP 
RATE. ANY SNOW WILL LIKELY BE A VERY WET SNOW WITH LOW LIQUID/FROZEN 
RATIOS. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE A COUPLE INCHES SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WITH THE VALLEY SEEING MAYBE A DUSTING TO 1 INCH.

VERY COLD TEMPS ALOFT MOVE IN QUICKLY SUNDAY MORNING...AND WE 
TRANSITION INTO A NW FLOW SNOW EVENT. ALL PRECIP WILL BE SNOW BY 
SUNDAY...BUT IT SHOULD BE LIGHT AS MOISTURE BECOMES MORE SHALLOW. AS 
THE LOW TO THE NORTH DEEPENS...THE NW FLOW PICKS UP TO AROUND 40 KTS 
BY SUNDAY EVENING. A FEED OF MOISTURE OFF LAKE MICHIGAN PERSISTS 
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN OUR MOUNTAINS AND IN SW VA. VERY COLD TEMPS SHOULD 
ALSO GIVE HIGH LIQUID/FROZEN RATIOS. BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW WILL 
BE A PROBLEM GIVEN THE STRONG WINDS...AND WIND CHILL VALUES WILL 
APPROACH -10 DEGREES IN THE MOUNTAINS SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.

A WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS...SW 
VA...NE TN INCLUDING TRI-CITIES...AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. MOUNTAINS ARE LIKELY TO BE IN THE 6-12 INCH RANGE FOR THE 
WHOLE EVENT. SW VA IS EXPECTED TO SEE AMOUNTS BETWEEN 5 AND 10 
INCHES...WITH GREATER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE AT HIGH KNOB. NE TN AND THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ARE EXPECTED TO SEE AMOUNTS IN THE 3 TO 
6 INCH RANGE. OTHER VALLEY LOCATIONS AND THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU ARE 
EXPECTED TO SEE 0-3 INCHES.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL TO CONTINUE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
MORNING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND IN THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING
NORTH CAROLINA MONDAY NIGHT. ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL WILL LIKELY
TAPER OFF IN THESE AREAS DURING THIS TIME. VERY COLD AIR AND SNOW
ON THE GROUND IN MOST AREAS WILL BRING LOW TEMPERATURES DOWN TO
NEAR 0 MOUNTAINS AND SINGLE DIGITS NORTHEAST SECTIONS WITH
10 TO 15 DEGREES ELSEWHERE. WIND CHILL TEMPERATURES MONDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY TUESDAY WILL LIKELY BE BELOW ZERO IN NE SECTIONS AND
HIGHER ELEVATION MOUNTAINS AT TIMES. TUESDAY THE UPPER TROF SHIFTS
FARTHER EAST AWAY FROM THE APPALACHIANS WITH DRIER AIR BEGINNING TO
SPREAD IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. WENT ON THE COLD SIDE FOR HIGHS NE
AND MOUNTAINS WITH STILL SOME CLOUDS AROUND IN THE MORNING. HIGHS
MOSTLY 20S TO LOWER 30S BUT TEENS HIGHER MOUNTAINS SW VA AND EAST
TN. TUESDAY NIGHT UNDER CLEAR SKIES ANOTHER VERY COLD NIGHT IN THE
SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS. WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY A WARMING TREND
COMMENCES AS FLOW FLATTENS OUT. BOTH HIGHS AND LOWS WILL BE
CONSIDERABLY WARMER. A WEAK SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE REGION
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. SOME FROZEN PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. WILL
NOT INCLUDE FREEZING RAIN JUST YET BECAUSE RIGHT NOW LOOKS TO BE
BRIEF. AS THIS NEXT SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH COLDER AIR BEHIND IT COULD
BRING WINTER PRECIPITATION BACK TO HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS LATE
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
948 AM EST FRI DEC 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...
FOR THE MORNING UPDATE...THIN HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA
ASSOCIATED WITH AN EASTWARD-MOVING VORT MAX OVER OKLAHOMA. THESE
CLOUDS SHOULD REMAIN THIN AND THE MOSTLY SUNNY FORECAST LOOKS ON
TRACK. TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK AS WELL...SO NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED.

INITIAL THOUGHTS ON THE COMING WINTER STORM THIS WEEKEND...THE MAIN
FORECAST CONCERN IS THE TIMING DIFFERENCE OF THE ONSET OF COLD AIR
BETWEEN THE GFS AND THE NAM. THE 06Z GFS IS MUCH FASTER WITH THE
COLD AIR...RESULTING IN NEAR-FREEZING TEMPS IN THE MOUNTAINS DURING
THE PERIOD OF STRONGEST LIFT SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS WOULD MEAN AN ALL
SNOW EVENT FOR THE MOUNTAINS...WHICH WOULD INCREASE SNOW AMOUNTS
SIGNIFICANTLY. THIS WOULD ALSO PRODUCE GREATER SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE
VALLEY. THE SLOWER NAM SHOWS A TRANSITION FROM RAIN TO SNOW IN THE
MOUNTAINS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT...TOWARD THE BACK END OF THE STRONGER
LIFT. THE 12Z NAM HAS TRENDED SLIGHTLY FASTER THAN THE 06Z
NAM...BUT IS STILL BEHIND THE 06Z GFS. WILL AWAIT THE 12Z GFS
BEFORE FINAL DECISIONS ARE MADE...BUT EXPECT THAT WINTER STORM
WATCHES WILL BE ISSUED WITH THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

DGS



442 
FXUS64 KMRX 100944
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
444 AM EST FRI DEC 10 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
NORTHEAST WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND INTO THE AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM.  
SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL HELP TO ENHANCE HIGH CLOUDS AT 
TIMES...BUT SHOULD BE BETWEEN THESE FOR TODAY ALLOWING MOSTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS BEFORE CLOUDS INCREASE AGAIN TONIGHT.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR 
FROM MAV TEMPS...ALTHOUGH WILL TWEAK MOST LOCATIONS UP SLIGHTLY 
TONIGHT FOR MINS.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE IN 
DEPICTION OF THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. HOWEVER...STAYED MORE IN 
LINE WITH THE ECMWF THROUGH THE PERIOD. DEEP UPPER TROF DROPS 
SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE UPPER MIDWEST ON SATURDAY AND MODELS GENERALLY 
IN AGREEMENT ON A SLOWER PROGRESSION OF MOISTURE/LIFT DURING THE 
DAY. THEREFORE...LOWERED POPS BACK TO LOW CHANCE OR SLIGHT CHANCE 
WITH BEST BET FOR A FEW SPRINKLES AHEAD OF THE ADVANCING SYSTEM 
BEING ACROSS THE WESTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. DEEPENING UPPER 
TROF WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM PRESS EAST INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT AND APPLIED 90 PERCENT POP 
AREAWIDE WITH HEALTHY INFLUX OF MOISTURE AHEAD OF FRONT. RATHER 
DECENT RAINFALL AMOUNTS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD THREE QUARTERS OF AN 
INCH POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONG SYSTEM. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BUILD IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT TOWARD SUNDAY MORNING AND WITH CHILLY AIR STREAMING 
IN ALOFT...THE RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS 
PRIMARILY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WITH SOME MINOR ACCUMULATION 
POSSIBLE BY 12Z SUNDAY AS THE MOISTURE AXIS ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD 
FRONT SHIFTS EAST. THERE COULD BE A BRIEF PERIOD AFTER 12Z SUNDAY 
WHERE PRECIP BECOMES LIGHTER AS NARROW DRY SLOT MOVES IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT. HOWEVER...MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE DEEPER MOISTURE BUILDS 
IN ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE MEAN UPPER TROF WITH RAPIDLY FALLING 
THICKNESS DURING THE DAY SUNDAY SO RAIN SHOWERS WILL MIX WITH OR 
CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS WITH LIKELY SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. ANOTHER LONGER TERM NORTHWEST FLOW 
SNOWFALL EVENT MAY TAKE SHAPE BEGINNING ON SUNDAY WITH CONTINUATION 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL LIKELY IN THESE 
AREAS THROUGH THIS PERIOD WHILE STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY PRESENT 
CONCERNING ANY SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AT 
THIS TIME. BY TUESDAY THE EVENT SHOULD BE OVER AS THE UPPER TROF 
WILL HAVE SHIFTED FARTHER EAST AWAY FROM THE APPALACHIANS WITH DRIER 
AIR ADVECTION IN THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW. FORECAST AREA ENJOYS 
APPROXIMATELY TWO DAYS OF DRY WEATHER ALONG WITH A MODEST WARMING 
TREND. WEAK SHORTWAVE TROF BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY BUT 
DUE TO TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE LOWERED POPS TO SLIGHT OR 
LOW CHANCE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.    


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  26  52  35  37 /   0   0  20  90  60

353 
FXUS64 KMRX 100303
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST THU DEC 9 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. THICKENING
HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS WITH APPROACH OF UPPER TROUGH. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
MID LEVEL RIDGE WILL BE WEAKENING OVERNIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. THE VORTICITY AXIS WITH THE TROUGH
PASSES JUST TO OUR NORTH...AND MOISTURE IS CONFINED TO ABOVE 600
MB. HIGH CLOUDS WILL BECOME BROKEN TO OVERCAST TONIGHT...BUT NO
PRECIP IS EXPECTED.

WEAK RIDGING BETWEEN SYSTEMS WILL PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES ON FRIDAY...WITH TEMPERATURES RISING INTO THE 40S IN 
MOST SPOTS. CLOUDS INCREASE FRIDAY EVENING ASSOCIATED WITH ANOTHER 
WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH. MOISTURE IS DEEPER WITH THIS TROUGH...AND 
MID LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT IS GREATER. WHILE FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A 
DRY LAYER FROM THE SURFACE TO AROUND 900 MB...SOME LIGHT PRECIP MAY 
REACH THE GROUND LATE FRIDAY NIGHT ONCE THE LOW LEVELS BEGIN TO 
MOISTEN. TEMPS AT THIS TIME WILL LIKELY BE NEAR OR BELOW 
FREEZING...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. NO ICE ACCUMULATION 
IS EXPECTED AS ANY PRECIP THAT MAY FALL WILL BE VERY LIGHT.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
BIG CHANGES IN THE CURRENT TRANQUIL PATTERN SATURDAY AS DEVELOPING 
SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS SPREADS RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
TEMPERATURES NEAR FREEZING EARLY IN THE MORNING MAY CAUSE SOME OF 
THE RAIN TO FREEZE INITIALLY BUT RAPID WARMING WILL WARM 
TEMPERATURES INTO THE UPPER 40S TO THE MID 50S. MODELS BRING COLD 
FRONT INTO MIDDLE TN BY 00Z SUNDAY WITH RAINFALL INCREASING ACROSS 
EAST TN. PREFER ECMWF SOLUTION FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY 
TIME FRAME. AS FRONT PASSES THROUGH AREA SUNDAY MORNING TEMPERATURES 
WILL FALL BELOW FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION WITH RAIN 
CHANGING TO SNOW. SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL IS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. FOR THE VALLEY 
AREAS LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL INCREASE WINDS SUNDAY INTO MONDAY PRODUCING LOW 
WIND CHILLS. SKIES WILL BEGAN CLEARING MONDAY NIGHT BUT SNOW SHOWERS 
WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY IN THE MOUNTAINS AS NW FLOW CONTINUES. 
WEDNESDAY BRIEF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BUT ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION. SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT LOWS WILL DROP TO THE TEENS. MOST HIGHS 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY WILL BE BELOW FREEZING. ANY CHANGE IN THE TRACK 
OF THIS NEXT SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE AMOUNT OF SNOW EXPECTED SO LATER 
SHIFTS MAY NEED TO CHANGE THE CURRENT THINKING.       

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             25  48  32  53  38 /   0   0  20  60  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  23  46  29  53  37 /   0   0  20  50  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       23  46  28  51  36 /   0   0  20  60  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              22  44  28  50  34 /   0   0  10  40  80
