855 
FXUS64 KMRX 090855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST THU DEC 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. SKY SHOULD REMAIN 
MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY BUT INCREASING UPPER LEVEL CLOUDS EXPECTED 
TONIGHT AHEAD OF A WEAK SHORTWAVE. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A BIT 
WARMER TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH UPPER LEVELS BECOME MORE ZONAL. BUT 
WITH THE COLD LOWER LEVELS..SHOULD STILL BELOW BE BELOW NORMAL FOR 
TODAY. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY WERE SIMILAR SO 
DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR. SOME DIFFERENCES IN TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT. 
WITH THE INCREASE IN CLOUDS...WENT ABOVE MAV GUIDANCE AND STAYED 
CLOSER TO THE MET/MAV BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN STORY BEING THE AMPLIFYING UPPER-LEVEL 
PATTERN FOR THE WEEKEND. THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL GRADUALLY BECOME 
A LITTLE SOUTHWESTERLY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY...WITH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATING ISENTROPIC LIFT 
INCREASING OVER THE FORECAST AREA...POSSIBLY RESULTING IN SOME VERY 
LIGHT PRECIP AFTER MIDNIGHT ON FRIDAY NIGHT. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO 
BE HOVERING AROUND THE FREEZING MARK...IT APPEARS THAT SOME LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN MAY BE POSSIBLE AROUND SUNRISE ON SATURDAY MORNING... 
BUT RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT AMOUNTS SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT. ON 
SATURDAY...THE GFS...NAM AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE TRACK OF A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...BUT NOW INDICATE THAT IT 
WILL BE A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES REGION. IN 
ADDITION...THE GFS MODEL IS A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE NAM OR ECMWF 
MODELS WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT... 
WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE PROGGED TO BE AROUND MIDNIGHT (BUT AROUND 
SUNRISE ACCORDING TO THE NAM AND ECMWF MODELS). ALL THREE MODELS 
ALSO INDICATE A WEAKER LOW-LEVEL 850 MB JET OVER THE REGION SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WITH WINDS POSSIBLY REMAINING SOUTHWESTERLY AHEAD OF THE COLD
FRONT. THUS...THE POSSIBILITY OF A HIGH WIND EVENT DUE TO MOUNTAIN 
WAVES FOR SATURDAY NIGHT APPEARS TO BE DIMINISHING. RAIN SHOULD 
GRADUALLY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 
MIDNIGHT ON SATURDAY NIGHT...AS NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE 
REGION ON SUNDAY RESULTING IN A SCENARIO THAT APPEARS VERY SIMILAR 
TO THE ONE FROM EARLIER THIS WEEK (WITH THE GREAT LAKES PROVIDING 
ADDITIONAL MOISTURE FOR SNOW DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA). 
ANOTHER FRIGID AND UNSEASONABLY COLD ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL SETTLE 
ACROSS THE REGION BY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...BUT THE GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS INDICATE A RAPID WARMING TREND DEVELOPING BY THE MIDDLE 
OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS 
MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  23  48  31  50 /   0   0   0  20  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       39  24  48  31  50 /   0   0   0  20  60

418 
FXUS64 KMRX 090258
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST WED DEC 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR SOUTH WILL BE MOVING OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COASTLINE TONIGHT. HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL DECREASE THIS 
EVENING AS TEH SYSTEM DEPARTS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A MID/UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST. MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT WILL DROP TEMPS INTO THE TEENS...AND ALLOW HIGH 
TEMPS TOMORROW TO REACH INTO THE 40S SOUTH AND MID/UPPER 30S NORTH. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN FORECAST CONCERN 
IS STRONG UPPER TROUGH MOVING FROM THE PLAINS STATES INTO THE 
EASTERN UNITED STATES. THERE ARE SOME DISSAGREEMENTS BETWEEN THE 
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS WITH THE GFS THE FARTHER SOUTH AND STRONGEST 
WITH THE SYSTEM. THE ECMWF HAS A NORTHERN TRACK ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY. WILL FOLLOW NCEP ADVICE AND ENSEMBLES WITH A COMPROMISE. 

ISENTROPIC PRECIPITATION WILL START LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
MORNING. BOUNDARY LAYER AIRMASS WILL BE COLD ENOUGH TO START AS 
FREEZING RAIN AND/OR SLEET...THEN CHANGE TO ALL LIQUID DURING THE 
DAY SATURDAY. ONLY MINOR ICE ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

FAIRLY STRONG FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING ALONG WITH LARGE SCALE FORCING IN THE FORM 
OF Q-VECTORS CONVERGENCE AND AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION.

AS FRONT MOVES EAST AND CYCLOGENESIS INTENSIFIES OFF THE 
MID-ATLANTIC COASTS...STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS. GFS SHOWS 
NORTHWEST WINDS AT 850MB UP TO 40KTS+...WHICH IS LIKELY 
OVERDONE...BUT WILL BE STRONG. MODELS SHOWS STRONG NORTHWEST 
BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW CONTINUING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING-NIGHT. ONLY 
LIMITING FACTOR IS DEPTH OF MOISTURE. AT TIMES...MOISTURE DEPTH IS 
ONLY UP TO 850-800MB. HOWEVER...THE -12 TO -18C LAYER REMAINS 
SATURATED THROUGH MOST OF MONDAY NIGHT. A MOISTURE PLUME IS ALSO 
OBSERVED BY MODELS FROM THE GREAT LAKES WHICH WILL ENHANCE LOW-LEVEL 
INSTABILITY. SIGNIFICANT UPSLOPE NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT IS ANTICIPATED 
FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST BY TUESDAY. GFS SHOWS ANOTHER WEAK 
SYSTEM BY WEDNESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE VERY LOW...SO WILL REMAIN DRY 
FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             19  44  25  49  31 /   0   0   0   0  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  16  39  22  47  29 /   0   0   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       16  40  23  47  30 /   0   0   0   0  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              13  35  18  45  26 /   0   0   0   0  20

EVENING AS TEH SYSTEM DEPARTS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A MID/UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST. MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT WILL DROP TEMPS INTO THE TEENS...AND ALLOW HIGH 
TEMPS TOMORROW TO REACH INTO THE 40S SOUTH AND MID/UPPER 30S NORTH. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERN IS STRONG UPPER TROUGH MOVING FROM THE PLAINS STATES INTO 
THE EASTERN UNITED STATES. THERE ARE SOME DISSAGREEMENTS BETWEEN THE 
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS WITH THE GFS THE FARTHER SOUTH AND STRONGEST 
WITH THE SYSTEM. THE ECMWF HAS A NORTHERN TRACK ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY. WILL FOLLOW NCEP ADVICE AND ENSEMBLES WITH A COMPROMISE. 

ISENTROPIC PRECIPITATION WILL START LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
MORNING. BOUNDARY LAYER AIRMASS WILL BE COLD ENOUGH TO START AS 
FREEZING RAIN AND/OR SLEET...THEN CHANGE TO ALL LIQUID DURING THE 
DAY SATURDAY. ONLY MINOR ICE ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

FAIRLY STRONG FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING ALONG WITH LARGE SCALE FORCING IN THE FORM 
OF Q-VECTORS CONVERGENCE AND AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION.

AS FRONT MOVES EAST AND CYCLOGENESIS INTENSIFIES OFF THE 
MID-ATLANTIC COASTS...STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS. GFS SHOWS 
NORTHWEST WINDS AT 850MB UP TO 40KTS+...WHICH IS LIKELY 
OVERDONE...BUT WILL BE STRONG. MODELS SHOWS STRONG NORTHWEST 
BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW CONTINUING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING-NIGHT. ONLY 
LIMITING FACTOR IS DEPTH OF MOISTURE. AT TIMES...MOISTURE DEPTH IS 
ONLY UP TO 850-800MB. HOWEVER...THE -12 TO -18C LAYER REMAINS 
SATURATED THROUGH MOST OF MONDAY NIGHT. A MOISTURE PLUME IS ALSO 
OBSERVED BY MODELS FROM THE GREAT LAKES WHICH WILL ENHANCE LOW-LEVEL 
INSTABILITY. SIGNIFICANT UPSLOPE NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT IS ANTICIPATED 
FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST BY TUESDAY. GFS SHOWS ANOTHER WEAK 
SYSTEM BY WEDNESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE VERY LOW...SO WILL REMAIN DRY 
FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 080825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST WED DEC 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING TO NORTH 
OF THE CWA TODAY AND TONIGHT. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH SO NOT 
EXPECTING PRECIPITATION FROM THE DISTURBANCE. A TROUGH TRACKS WELL 
TO THE SOUTH OF AREA TODAY. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION SHOULD 
PROVIDE DRY WEATHER TODAY AND TONIGHT. NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE 
REGION SHOULD CONTINUE THE WELL BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY WERE SIMILAR SO 
DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR FOR TODAY. BIGGER DIFFERENCES IN TEMPERATURES 
FOR TONIGHT. WITH THE MOSTLY CLEAR SKY EXPECTED TONIGHT...STAYED A 
LITTLE BELOW MAV GUIDANCE AND WENT CLOSER TO THE MET/MAV BLEND FOR 
TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH THE 
MAIN STORY BEING THE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN BECOMING HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
FOR THE WEEKEND RESULTING IN A STRONG SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SLIDE 
EASTWARD...WITH A WARMING TREND DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A 
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
ON FRIDAY...BUT MODELS AGREE THAT ANY PRECIP WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL 
STAY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. ON SATURDAY...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK OF THE STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WHICH WILL BRING A GOOD 
CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL SOME INDICATIONS FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF 
A HIGH WIND EVENT DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES ON SATURDAY NIGHT AROUND THE 
MOUNTAINS...WITH A DEEP SURFACE-BASED STABLE LAYER AND A STRONG 850 
MB SOUTHERLY JET DEVELOPING. BY SUNDAY...ANOTHER FRIGID AND 
UNSEASONABLY COLD ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL MOVE BACK INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA...WITH STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW CREATING SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE 
REGION...ESPECIALLY IN THE UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.

SAT MORNING. GULF MOISTURE STREAMS INTO TN VLY IN ADVANCE OF 
DEVELOPING LOW. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES ACROSS DEEP SOUTH AND 
TN VLY SAT NGT. WIDESPREAD PCPN SHOULD PROGRESS ACROSS THE REGION. 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY COULD REACH SW AREAS BY SUN MORNING. DRY SLOT 
AND BREAK IN PCPN POSSIBLE SUN MORNING BEFORE STRONG COLD FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH AREA SUN AFTN. LARGE PATCH OF MODERATE SNOWFALL 
EXPECTED TO WRAP AROUND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. CURRENT PROGS KEEP 
MAJOR SNOW AREA NORTHWEST AND NORTH OF MRX CWA. SOUTHERN SHIFT IN 
LOW POSITION WITH FUTURE RUNS WOULD RESULT IN GOOD SYNOPTIC SNOW 
EVENT LOCALLY. STRONG NW WINDS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION MOVE IN BEHIND 
THE FRONT. GOOD SET UP FOR UPSLOPE SNOW EVENT INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK.   WENT BELOW GUIDANCE ON TEMPS BEHIND FRONT. WIND CHILL VALUES 
BELOW ZERO LIKELY IN THE MOUNTAINS. H85 TEMPS FALL TO AT OR BELOW 
-15C.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST TUE DEC 7 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS...BRINGING 
PERSISTENT NORTHWEST WINDS AND A COLD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THESE NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BRING MOISTURE FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH UPSLOPE 
FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS PRODUCING NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS. THE VERY COLD 
TEMPS OVER THE REGION HAVE EVIDENTLY CREATED VERY HIGH SNOW RATIOS 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WITH LIQUID TO SNOW RATIOS OF 1 TO 40 
OBSERVED IN A FEW AREAS. AREA RADARS CURRENTLY REVEAL SOMEWHAT OF A 
LULL IN THE SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY THIS MORNING...WITH SCATTERED 
FLURRIES OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...AN 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY IS PROGGED 
TO SWING OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 
SUNRISE...TRIGGERING SOME ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES. 
THUS...WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR 
SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 10 AM. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THIS NORTHWEST FLOW UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO BECOME MORE 
ZONAL THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT...SO EXPECT SNOW SHOWERS TO 
GRADUALLY DIMINISH THIS AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM MOS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION KEEPING THE DISTURBANCES TO THE NORTH AND SOUTH PROVIDING DRY 
WEATHER TO OUR AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A WEAK COLD FRONT 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY. MOISTURE AND LIFT IS LIMITED SO 
KEPT ONLY FLURRIES AND SPRINKLES IN THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY. AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE TRACKS THROUGH REGION ON SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. 
HIGHEST CHANCES EXPECTED SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY AS THE LOW TRACKS 
THROUGH CWA. PRECIPITATION SHOULD BEGIN AS MAINLY RAIN ON SATURDAY 
THEN SWITCH TO SNOW ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY AS COLD AIR FILTERS 
IN. PRECIPITATION TYPE SHOULD REMAIN MAINLY SNOW ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY.

889 
FXUS64 KMRX 061955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EST MON DEC 6 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...PERSISTENT CYCLONIC 
CIRCULATION AROUND A DEEP UPPER LOW OVER FAR NORTHEAST UNITED STATES 
REMAINS THE MAIN FEATURE FOR THE FORECAST AREA. A SERIES OF 
SHORT-WAVES ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE 
PERIODS OF ENHANCED MOISTURE AND LIFT. ONE SUCH WAVE IS MOVING INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH ANOTHER FOR LATER TONIGHT. MAIN CONCERN IS 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO WEST TO NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES. WE CONTINUE TO 
RECEIVE REPORTS OF LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. DUE TO HIGH SNOW TO LIQUID RATIOS...MARGINAL 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALLS...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WSW.

OCCASIONAL FLURRIES ANTICIPATED IN THE VALLEYS...BUT ONLY A DUSTING 
AT BEST ANTICIPATED.

NEXT CONCERN IS WIND CHILLS. A FEW AREAS ACROSS THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS WILL EXPERIENCE WIND CHILLS BELOW -10F...BUT COVERAGE 
AREA IS VERY LIMITED...SO WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY.

CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY ERODE FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST TONIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY...BUT TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN MUCH BELOW NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD CONTINUES THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. WEAK WARM UP THURSDAY AS LOW LEVEL FLOW TURNS SW IN 
ADVANCE OF APPROACHING FRONT. LIGHT PCPN WILL BEGIN LATE THU AND 
CONTINUE FRI. LOW LEVEL REMAINS DRY SO AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE 
LIGHT WITH SNOW BECOMING LIGHT RAIN. STRONG SYSTEM TAKING SHAPE FOR 
NEXT WEEKEND. GOOD WAA PATTERN FOR SAT. EXPECT SHOWERS BUT THUNDERSTORM
ACTIVITY MAY GET INTO THE AREA DEPENDING ON SYSTEM EVOLUTION. 
TEMPERATURES PLUMMET SAT NIGHT WITH FROPA. UPSLOPE PATTERN LOOKS 
VERY FAVORABLE AT THIS TIME SUN AND MONDAY. H85 WINDS NW 45 KTS WITH 
TEMPS FALLING TO NEAR -15C. GFS DEPICTS VERY COLD TEMPS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH BELOW ZERO WIND CHILLS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             21  38  18  39  21 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  19  30  16  35  19 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       19  32  16  35  18 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              16  24  14  31  16 /  10  10  10  10   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: RUSSELL...WASHINGTON...WISE.

TO MODERATE SNOW. LATEST MODELS SHOWS ANOTHER WAVE OF MOISTURE AND
OROGRAPHIC LIFT TO CONTINUE TO PRODUCE PERIODS OF SNOW.

WILL ALSO CONTINUE WITH SNOW FLURRIES FOR THE VALLEYS ALONG AND
NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40.

HAVE ALSO LOWERED HIGHS TODAY MOST LOCATIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 061124
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
625 AM EST MON DEC 6 2010

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS...CREATING A COLD AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS SOME MID-LEVEL CLOUDS 
LINGERING ALONG THE WESTERN SLOPES OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
RESULTING FROM A MOIST NORTHWEST FLOW FROM THE GREAT LAKES REGION. 
THESE NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE TAF 
PERIOD...AND SHOULD BECOME GUSTY BY LATE MORNING AND INTO THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. AREA RADARS CONTINUE TO REVEAL SOME SNOW FLURRIES 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT DO NOT EXPECT THESE FLURRIES TO LOWER 
VISIBILITIES MUCH AT THE TAF SITES. OTHERWISE...CEILINGS SHOULD 
REMAIN IN THE VFR CATEGORY THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE 
TAF SITES. 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000
FXUS64 KMRX 060756
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EST MON DEC 6 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS...BRINGING COLD 
AND DRY AIR OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED 
FLURRIES OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING... 
RESULTING FROM A MOIST NORTHWEST FLOW FROM THE GREAT LAKES REGION. 
THIS HIGH WILL REMAIN CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS THROUGH TONIGHT... 
BRINGING A PERSISTENT NORTHWEST WIND FLOW OVER THE APPALACHIANS. 
WITH A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE REMAINING AROUND 850 MB...EXPECT 
SCATTERED FLURRIES AND/OR SNOW SHOWERS TO CONTINUE ACROSS MAINLY THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH IN NORTHEAST 
PRODUCING NORTHWEST FLOW OVER AREA AND THIS PERSISTS THROUGH ABOUT 
THURSDAY...WHEN THE FLOW BEGINS TO STRAIGHTEN OUT AND TEND TOWARD 
ZONAL. H10-H5 THICKNESSES ARE FAIRLY LOW...LOW ENOUGH FOR SNOW 
EVERYWHERE...BUT AIRMASS IS PRETTY DRY TOO...SO HAVE LIMITED POPS TO 
CHANCE AT BEST...EVEN IN FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS ALL WEEK. EVEN THEN 
EXPECT MAINLY FLURRIES WITH SPRINKLES IN WARMEST AREAS TO THE SOUTH. 
BY FRIDAY A FRONT APPROACHES WITH A QUITE IMPRESSIVE SURFACE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT...AND SO WINDS WILL TURN SOUTHERLY AND THICKNESSES 
WILL BEGIN RISING AGAIN FOR A LITTLE WARM UP ON THE WEEKEND. 
SATURDAY SHOULD SEEM QUITE TROPICAL COMPARED TO THE ICEBOX WE WILL 
HAVE BEEN IN FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK. LOOKS ALSO LIKE A 
CHANCE FOR SOME MODERATE RAIN ON THE WEEKEND. WILL NOT GO OVERBOARD 
WITH THE POPS THIS FAR OUT. BUT STAY TUNED. ADJUSTED THE MAX TEMPS 
DOWN NEARLY EVERYWHERE IN THE FIRST PART OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS 
LATEST GFS IS COLDER THAN LAST FORECAST PACKAGE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   38  21  37  18  40 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     34  19  30  16  36 /  10  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             34  19  31  16  36 /  10  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    29  16  24  14  32 /  10  20  10  10  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

000
FXUS64 KMRX 052212 RRA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST SUN DEC 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LACK OF PRODUCTS AND
GUIDANCE TODAY DUE TO DEGRADED AWIPS SBN...BUT FORTUNATELY JUST
BASICALLY A COLD DAY WITH NOT MUCH MORE THAN FLURRIES. NOT GETTING
MUCH NEW ACCUMULATION PER CALLS...AND RADAR RETURNS APPEAR RATHER
WEAK. THUS...OPTED TO CANCEL THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WITH THE
AFTERNOON PACKAGE. THANKS TO NWS NEIGHBORS FOR COORDINATION.

WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS IN MY UPSLOPE/HORSESHOE AREA FOR TONIGHT TO
BLEND WITH NEIGHBORS HIGHER CHANCE TO LOW LIKELY POPS. MOIST LAYER
IS QUITE SHALLOW AND IT WILL BE HARD FOR ANY LOCATION TO GET MORE
THAN A TRACE TO BARELY 0.01 INCH LIQUID EQUIVALENT. CARRIED MAINLY
FLURRIES OUTSIDE OF THE CHANCE POP AREAS...BUT KEPT SE TN AND SW NC
DRY FOR TONIGHT. CLOUDS HOLD STRONG 

OTHERWISE...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT LINGERS FOR THESE PERIODS...AS
DOES THE COLD NORTHERLY FLOW FROM THE COLD DOME OF SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE. MODELS SUGGEST ANOTHER SHOT OF VORTICITY IN THE NW FLOW
AND PERHAPS A FETCH OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE GREAT LAKES...
PROBABLY LATE MONDAY OR MONDAY NIGHT. THUS...KEPT SOME LOW CHANCE
POPS FOR SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES IN THE MIX. SHOULD SEE FLURRY
ACTIVITY DIMINISH OR END BY TUESDAY. MOS GUIDANCE...AS AVAILABLE...
LOOKED GOOD AS TEMPS STAY BELOW NORMAL. LATER SHIFTS MIGHT NEED
WIND CHILL ADVISORY...DEPENDING ON STRENGTH OF WINDS.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW MOISTURE 
FINALLY FADES TUESDAY NIGHT INITIATING AN EXTENDED DRY PERIOD. 
NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES DEEP INTO THE FORECAST PERIOD AND ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE TROF EVEN DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES PUSHING 
A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON 
FRIDAY. THEREFORE APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AT THAT 
TIME WITH SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE 
SHORTWAVE EXITS. UPPER FLOW GOES ZONAL SATURDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE 
PRODUCES A STRENGTHENING UPPER TROF WHICH BUILDS SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE MIDWEST SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY PRODUCING A MIX OF RAIN AND 
SNOW ON THE FRONT SIDE OF THE SYSTEM AND LIKELY SNOW SHOWERS ON THE 
BACK SIDE SUNDAY NIGHT AS COLDER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THE DEEP 
EXITING TROF. THERE IS SOME QUESTION AS TO THE DEPTH AND TRACK OF 
THIS STORM SYSTEM AS MODEL SOLUTIONS SHOWED A GREAT DEAL OF VARIANCE 
DURING THIS EXTENDED PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             24  38  21  38  19 /  10   0  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  24  34  19  33  17 /  20  10  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       23  34  19  34  17 /  10  10  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              21  29  18  28  13 /  30  20  20  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 052007

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST SUN DEC 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LACK OF PRODUCTS AND
GUIDANCE TODAY DUE TO DEGRADED AWIPS SBN...BUT FORTUNATELY JUST
BASICALLY A COLD DAY WITH NOT MUCH MORE THAN FLURRIES. NOT GETTING
MUCH NEW ACCUMULATION PER CALLS...AND RADAR RETURNS APPEAR RATHER
WEAK. THUS...OPTED TO CANCEL THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WITH THE
AFTERNOON PACKAGE. THANKS TO NWS NEIGHBORS FOR COORDINATION.

WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS IN MY UPSLOPE/HORSESHOE AREA FOR TONIGHT TO
BLEND WITH NEIGHBORS HIGHER CHANCE TO LOW LIKELY POPS. MOIST LAYER
IS QUITE SHALLOW AND IT WILL BE HARD FOR ANY LOCATION TO GET MORE
THAN A TRACE TO BARELY 0.01 INCH LIQUID EQUIVALENT. CARRIED MAINLY
FLURRIES OUTSIDE OF THE CHANCE POP AREAS...BUT KEPT SE TN AND SW NC
DRY FOR TONIGHT. CLOUDS HOLD STRONG 

OTHERWISE...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT LINGERS FOR THESE PERIODS...AS
DOES THE COLD NORTHERLY FLOW FROM THE COLD DOME OF SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE. MODELS SUGGEST ANOTHER SHOT OF VORTICITY IN THE NW FLOW
AND PERHAPS A FETCH OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE GREAT LAKES...
PROBABLY LATE MONDAY OR MONDAY NIGHT. THUS...KEPT SOME LOW CHANCE
POPS FOR SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES IN THE MIX. SHOULD SEE FLURRY
ACTIVITY DIMINISH OR END BY TUESDAY. MOS GUIDANCE...AS AVAILABLE...
LOOKED GOOD AS TEMPS STAY BELOW NORMAL. LATER SHIFTS MIGHT NEED
WIND CHILL ADVISORY...DEPENDING ON STRENGTH OF WINDS.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW MOISTURE 
FINALLY FADES TUESDAY NIGHT INITIATING AN EXTENDED DRY PERIOD. 
NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES DEEP INTO THE FORECAST PERIOD AND ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE TROF EVEN DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES PUSHING 
A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON 
FRIDAY. THEREFORE APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AT THAT 
TIME WITH SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE 
SHORTWAVE EXITS. UPPER FLOW GOES ZONAL SATURDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE 
PRODUCES A STRENGTHENING UPPER TROF WHICH BUILDS SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE MIDWEST SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY PRODUCING A MIX OF RAIN AND 
SNOW ON THE FRONT SIDE OF THE SYSTEM AND LIKELY SNOW SHOWERS ON THE 
BACK SIDE SUNDAY NIGHT AS COLDER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THE DEEP 
EXITING TROF. THERE IS SOME QUESTION AS TO THE DEPTH AND TRACK OF 
THIS STORM SYSTEM AS MODEL SOLUTIONS SHOWED A GREAT DEAL OF VARIANCE 
DURING THIS EXTENDED PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 050750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EST SUN DEC 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH A LARGE DOME OF 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE HIGH PLAINS. AREA RADARS REVEAL ONLY 
VERY LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND FURTHER UPSTREAM OVER 
EASTERN KY...SO WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE WINTER WX ADVISORY EARLY 
THIS MORNING FOR AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. THE LARGE HIGH OVER 
THE PLAINS WILL REMAIN OVER THE MUCH OF THE CENTRAL PART OF THE 
NATION TODAY AND TONIGHT...CREATING A PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THESE NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CREATE AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS OVER THE REGION...ALONG WITH SOME 
UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS. MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE 
WILL BE SHALLOW OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...BUT UPSLOPE 
FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS MAY SQUEEZE OUT SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR THE 
SMOKY MOUNTAIN AND NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS FOR TODAY. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES REMAIN 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM BEFORE 
DETERIORATING INTO GENERAL DISAGREEMENT. UPPER LONG WAVE TROUGH 
PERSISTS THROUGH MID WEEK BEFORE DEAMPLIFYING INTO NEARLY ZONAL 
FLOW. THIS WILL RESULT IN SLOW MODERATION OF TEMPS ALTHOUGH TEMPS IN 
GENERAL WILL REMAIN BELOW CLIMO. BIGGEST UNCERTAINTY RESULTS FROM 
SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES BY LATE WORK WEEK. ECMWF MODEL DEPICTS FAIRLY 
SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WHILE GFS DEPICTS RATHER 
INSIGNIFICANT NORTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WITH LIMITED IMPACTS ON 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. DUE TO LOW CONFIDENCE WITH THIS 
EVENT...HAVE NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1029 PM EST SAT DEC 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...LOW PRESSURE AREA HAS NOW MOVED EAST OF THE
APPALACHIANS THIS EVENING. HAVE EXTENDED WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY
HEADS SOUTHEAST FROM KY INTO NE TN AND SW VA. TEMPERATURES WARMED
SEVERAL DEGREES THIS EVENING ALL THE WAY TO THE VA BORDER BUT HAVE
BEGUN DROPPING BACK DOWN TO NEAR TO JUST ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND PARTS OF SW VA. AREA RADARS SHOWING BANDS OF
MOISTURE MOVING IN FROM THE WEST AND NW ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS
AND SW VA. THINK WITH THE NW FLOW STAYING STRONG OVERNIGHT THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE ADVISORY AREA WILL LIKELY GET AN INCH OR 2
MORE OF SNOW BY DAYBREAK. UPDATED TEMPERATURE AND DEW POINT DATA
DUE TO THE EVENING WARMING. ALSO UPDATED WINDS BUT DID NOT CHANGE
LOWS OR POPS FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 042038
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 PM EST SAT DEC 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE LOW JUST WEST OF TRI
AT MID AFTERNOON WITH MUCH OF THE LARGE PRECIPITATION SHIELD MOVING
OUT OF ALL BUT SW VA AND THE NE CORNER OF TN. STARTING TO SEE THE
EFFECTS OF COLDER AIR MOVING IN...WITH SURFACE OBSERVATIONS NOTING A
SNOW...SLEET AND RAIN MIX AGAIN...AFTER MOSTLY RAIN OUTSIDE OF THE
ADVISORY AREA AND SNOW IN THE ADVISORY AREA. CALLS MADE TO ADVISORY
AREA WERE SENT OUT VIA LSRS...AND AMOUNTS IN GENERAL LOOKED IN LINE
WITH CURRENT FORECAST...AND OF COURSE USUALLY DIFFICULT TO GET A
LOT OF REPORTS OUT OF THE HIGHEST TERRAIN AREAS.

FORCING WILL PRIMARILY BE COLD AIR ADVECTION AND LOW LEVEL NW
UPSLOPE FLOW FROM THIS EVENING INTO OVERNIGHT. RUC AND NAM 12KM MODELS
SHOW SOME UPSLOPE SNOW DEVELOPING IN THE SMOKIES...SO I ADDED THAT
AREA TO THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. WILL LET EVENING SHIFT WATCH FOR
UPSLOPE SNOW DEVELOPMENT...AND EXTEND THE ADVISORY IF NEEDED.

OTHERWISE...MADE LITTLE CHANGES TO FORECAST GRIDS FOR SUNDAY...AS 
THIS EVENT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A STRONG NW FLOW EVENT. THUS...POPS
ONLY FOR UPSLOPE AREAS LOOKED GOOD. FAVORED A MOS BLEND FOR MINS
TONIGHT AND COLDER MOS FOR HIGHS SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST. LONG WAVE TROUGH OVER EASTERN NOAM WILL AFFECT 
OUR WEATHER FOR MOST OF THE LONG RANGE PERIOD. NORTHWEST FLOW SHOWER 
WITH COLD AIR WILL PROVIDE FOR MOSTLY SNOW SHOWERS, ALBEIT LIGHT, 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY. THEN AIRMASS DRIES OUT BUT STAYS 
COLD THROUGH MID-WEEK. SOME RISING THICKNESSES AS LATE PERIOD FRONT 
APPROACHES BUT STILL IN THE 540'S FOR A CHILLY PERIOD. ALL IN ALL, 
AN UNSETTLED PERIOD BUT NOTHING SERIOUS. ADJUSTED TEMPS IN EARLY 
PART OF PERIOD TOWARD THE BLEND FIGURES.

LOOKS GOOD.

TODAY...AS THERE REMAINS JUST ENOUGH WARM AIR ADVECTION TO PREVENT 
MUCH OF A MIX OR ANY SNOW/ICE ACCUMULATIONS. HOWEVER...INITIAL PLANS 
WILL BE TO LIKELY ADD THE SMOKIES TO THE WINTER WX ADVISORY WITH THE 
AFTERNOON PACKAGE...AS COLD AIR ADVECTION KICKS IN AFTER SUNSET AND
NW LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPS OVERNIGHT.

462 
FXUS64 KMRX 041142
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
640 AM EST SAT DEC 4 2010

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE OZARKS 
REGION...WITH A WEAK WARM FRONT EXTENDING EAST OF IT ACROSS MIDDLE 
TN. AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT LIGHT PRECIP AHEAD OF THIS WARM FRONT IS 
EXPANDING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SO WILL INCLUDE A 
MENTION OF MVFR CONDITIONS AT KTRI FOR THIS MORNING. THIS SNOW MAY 
MIX WITH RAIN AT KTRI THIS AFTERNOON AS TEMPS WARM...BUT TEMPS FOR 
TODAY SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY RAIN AT KTYS AND KCHA. FOR 
NOW...WILL MENTION MVFR VISIBILITIES WITH THIS PRECIP...BUT IFR 
CONDITIONS MAY TEMPORARILY DEVELOP WITH ANY OF THE HEAVIER PRECIP 
THIS AFTERNOON. SINCE THESE TEMPORARY CONDITIONS ARE BEYOND THE 
FIRST SIX HOURS...WILL LEAVE IT OUT OF THE TAFS FOR NOW. THE COLD 
FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE TAF SITES 
AROUND SUNSET...WITH NORTHWESTERLY WINDS BEHIND IT BRINGING DRIER 
AIR WHICH SHOULD GRADUALLY RAISE CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES INTO VFR 
RANGES.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...NORTHWEST 
     CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST

769 
FXUS64 KMRX 040756
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EST SAT DEC 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS...WITH A WEAK WARM FRONT 
EXTENDING SOUTHEAST OF IT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. AREA RADARS REVEAL A 
LARGE AREA OF LIGHT SNOW OVER KY AND THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WHICH 
EXTENDS SOUTHWARD OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VA. MODELS 
AGREE THAT THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TODAY...BRINGING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF PRECIP INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA. GFS AND NAM MODELS AGREE THAT THE RAIN/SNOW LINE 
SHOULD GENERALLY BE ALONG A LONDON KY TO GREENEVILLE TN LINE (OR 
HALFWAY BETWEEN THE KNOXVILLE AND TRI-CITIES AREAS). WITH THIS IN 
MIND...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR NORTHEAST TN 
AND SOUTHWEST VA FOR TODAY AND INTO THIS EVENING. IT APPEARS THAT THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE IN THE WARM SECTOR OF THIS 
SYSTEM...WHERE MOSTLY RAIN SHOULD OCCUR UNTIL SUNSET WHEN THE COLD 
FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM PASSES THROUGH. AFTER THIS COLD 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH AROUND SUNSET...RAIN SHOULD GRADUALLY CHANGE TO 
SNOW FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...MOST OF THE 
MOISTURE WITH THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO HAVE MOVED EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING...SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH ACCUMULATIONS 
OUTSIDE OF THE ADVISORY AREA. ONE EXCEPTION MAY BE THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS WHERE SOME UPSLOPE FLOW MAY CREATE SOME ADVISORY LEVEL 
ACCUMULATIONS THIS EVENING...BUT WILL LET THE DAY SHIFT DECIDE IF AN 
ADVISORY IS NEEDED LATER FOR THIS AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES FOR 
TODAY...AND WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW THE COOLER NAM NUMBERS DUE TO THE 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...GENERALLY DRY...ALBEIT 
ANOMALOUSLY COLD...CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO PREVAIL THROUGH MOST OF 
THE LONG TERM AS UPPER LONG WAVE TROUGH PERSISTS OVER THE EASTERN 
CONUS. SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED TO LINGER IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE 
NORTHEASTERN ZONES INTO EARLY WORK WEEK WHEN UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES...
ENFORCING COLD REGIME. UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY DEAMPLIFIES THROUGH THE
BALANCE OF THE WORK WEEK ALLOWING HEIGHTS TO RISE AND TEMPS TO
SLOWLY MODERATE BY WEEK'S END. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DEPICT SYSTEM
APPROACHING SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM.
HOWEVER...THEY DIFFER WITH RESPECT TO TIMING AND INTENSITY OF
SYSTEM. HAVE INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY...BUT
CONFIDENCE TOO LOW TO GO ANY HIGHER AT THIS POINT. FOR TEMPS...
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

547 
FXUS64 KMRX 032016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST FRI DEC 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...COMMS PROBLEMS WITH AWIPS
SBN LIMITED MODEL AND MOS DATA FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE. HOWEVER
THERE WAS SOME CONTINUITY AND HELP FROM NATIONAL GUIDANCE...PLUS
PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE ON TRACK AND GOOD COORDINATION WITH ADJACENT
NWS OFFICES. NAM 12Z MODEL DATA WAS AVAILABLE AND SEEMS THAT LATEST
NAM RUN WAS WARMER THAN THE PREVIOUSLY COLDER 00Z AND 06Z...WHICH
SUGGESTED HEAVIER SNOWS FOR SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN (IN LINE WITH
HPC WWD GRAPHICS). HPC PREFERED A BLEND OF NAM WITH GFS AND
ESPECIALLY ECMWF...WHICH LED ME TO QUESTION THOSE HEAVIER NAM SNOW
AMOUNTS. 

GFS MODEL WAS TRICKLING IN AT ISSUANCE TIME...BUT NO MOS DATA WAS
IN FROM EITHER NAM OR GFS...WHICH CAUSED ME TO BE CAUTIOUS AND NOT
ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY JUST YET. DID MENTION SNOW AMOUNTS
IN FAVORED AREAS OF SW VA AND NE TN AND COVERED THIS EVENT FOR NOW
IN A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT (SPS). TRACK AFFECTS 850 MB TEMPS
AND LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES...AS WELL AS TIMING...SO MIDNIGHT SHIFT
SHOULD GET A BETTER FEEL FOR ISSUING WINTER WEATHER PRODUCTS.

DID NOT PLAY UP SNOW POTENTIAL BEYOND SUNDAY MORNING...AS NAM MODEL
SHOWED ARCTIC AIRMASS WITH VERY SHALLOW MOIST LAYER...AND NOT MUCH 
INSTABILITY AT ALL FOR DAYTIME SUNDAY (20 J/KG OR LESS). NW UPSLOPE
FLOW AND STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION SHOULD CONTINUE TO SQUEEZE OUT
FLURRIES.

OTHERWISE...NO MOS GUIDANCE TO PONDER...SO STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS
MIN/MAX TEMP GRIDS AND NEIGHBORS GRIDS.
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE BIG CHILL WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST AS AN UPPER TROF PARKS 
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. FOR SEVERAL DAYS. A MORE ZONAL CONFIGURATION 
DEVELOPS BY THURSDAY/FRIDAY BUT THE ARCTIC AIRMASS WILL BE SLOW TO 
MODIFY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
IN CLIPPER FASHION EARLY IN THE PERIOD BRINGING A FEW SNOW SHOWERS 
TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND A SMALL PART OF THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BEFORE 
DRY ADVECTION ENDS THE CHANCE FOR SNOW. SUNSHINE RETURNS IN FULL BY 
MID WEEK WHILE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S.

THREAT OF ACCUMULATING SNOW STILL APPEARS TO BE ACROSS SWRN VA AND

THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. THE ARCTIC AIRMASS SLIPS IN SUNDAY MORNING 
AND THE MOISTURE DEPTH GREATLY DECREASES...WITH LATEST NAM NOT 
REALLY SHOWING MUCH INSTABILITY ON SUNDAY TO HELP GENERATE SNOW 
SHOWERS OUTSIDE OF THE FAVORED UPSLOPE PEAKS AND RIDGES. 

BEST SNOW GROWTH POTENTIAL SHOULD BE OVER SWRN VA SATURDAY NIGHT
WHERE WE HAVE LIKELY POPS AND A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION MENTIONED.
THIS LOOKS GOOD FOR NOW...AND I PLAN TO ISSUE AN SPS THIS AFTERNOON 
AFTER VIEWING ALL 12Z MODEL DATA AND COORDINATING WITH ADJACENT NWS 
OFFICES.

FXUS64 KMRX 030743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 AM EST FRI DEC 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NEAR THE CONFLUENCE OF THE MS AND OHIO 
RIVERS...WITH A COLD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH AREA RADARS REVEALING SOME 
LIGHT ECHOES OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. HOWEVER...OB SITES 
HAVE NOT REPORTED ANY MEASURABLE PRECIP...WHICH WOULD SUGGEST THAT 
THE OBSERVED DRY LOW-LEVEL AIR MASS IS CAUSING MOST OF THIS MOISTURE 
TO EVAPORATE BEFORE REACHING THE GROUND. MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE 
WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TODAY...RESULTING 
IN MAINLY SOME CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. CLOUDS SHOULD INCREASE 
SOME MORE TONIGHT AS MOISTURE AHEAD OF ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE HIGH PLAINS QUICKLY MOVES TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. WILL 
PLAN TO CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN/SNOW 
AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS AGAIN REVEAL A DRY 
LOW-LEVEL AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WHICH WOULD SUGGEST THAT 
MOST OF THIS MOISTURE MAY EVAPORATE BEFORE REACHING THE GROUND. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...REGION REMAINS IN CYCLONIC 
NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM. A SERIES OF 
WEAK SHORT WAVES WILL TRANSLATE THROUGH THE FLOW RESULTING IN 
SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED WEATHER. INITIAL SYSTEM ON SATURDAY APPEARS MOST 
SIGNIFICANT OF THESE DISTURBANCES AT THIS TIME. POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
SNOW ACCUMULATION SATURDAY NIGHT ALTHOUGH THAT SHOULD BE CONFINED 
MAINLY TO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AND HIGHER TERRAIN. ANOTHER WEAK 
SYSTEM APPROACHES BY EARLY WEDNESDAY. UPPER FLOW AMPLIFIES BY EARLY 
NEXT WORK WEEK REINFORCING COLD AIR REGIME BEFORE SLOWLY 
DEAMPLIFYING BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM. OVERALL...DID NOT MAKE ANY 
MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EST THU DEC 2 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CLOUDS HAVE BEEN 
THICKENING THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHO STILL MAINLY MID AND HIGH CLOUDS 
OVER OUR FORECAST AREA. MAIN LIFT APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
LEFT FRONT QUAD OF THE UPPER LEVEL JET (CENTRAL PLAINS TO MID MS 
VALLEY) AND SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC FORCING. MAIN SURFACE WEATHER NOTED 
WAS LIGHT SNOW AT BOWLING GREEN KY...WITH LOCAL WRF MODEL SUGGESTING 
LIGHT PRECIPITATION OVER MAINLY SW VA LATE TONIGHT. OPTED TO CARRY A 
LOW POP FOR NRN PLATEAU...SW VA AND NE TN FOR TONIGHT...AND A 
MENTION OF SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES FOR CENTRAL VALLEY AND SMOKIES.

OTHERWISE...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT IS SETTING UP AND A SURFACE LOW 
APPROACHES BY SATURDAY MORNING. 850 MB LOW IS TO OUR NORTH SO THAT 
WE STAY IN A BRIEF WARM SECTOR...AND SHOULD THEREFORE EXPERIENCE 
MAINLY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY AND POSSIBLY INTO EARLY SATURDAY 
EVENING. I DID NUDGE POPS UP TO LIKELY BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

MOS TEMPS CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED...EXCEPT I DID CHOOSE TO 
UNDERCUT EVEN THE COOLER MOS HIGHS FOR SATURDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY 
CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION HAS ENJOYED ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES DEEP INTO 
LATE FALL. THIS PERIOD WILL BE CHARACTERIZED BY WELL BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES AS MEAN UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING FORMS OVER THE EASTERN 
U.S. THE FIRST SHORTWAVE WILL BE EXITING SATURDAY NIGHT TAKING 
DEEPER MOISTURE EAST OF THE REGION BY SUNDAY MORNING. CHILLY AIR 
WILL STREAM INTO THE REGION ON STRENGTHENING NORTHWEST FLOW 
RESULTING IN LIGHT RAIN CHANGING TO VERY LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THIS WILL BE THE 
BEGINNING OF A LENGTHY PERIOD OF COLD AIR ADVECTION OROGRAPHICALLY 
INDUCED SNOW SHOWERS. AS IS USUALLY THE CASE IN THIS TYPE OF PATTERN 
EFFECTIVE SNOWFALL WILL BE MAINLY LIMITED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS. SOME UNCERTAINTY IN COLD AIR ARRIVAL AND DEEPER MOISTURE 
DEPARTURE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY BUT THE HIGHER TERRAIN COULD 
PICK UP AROUND AN INCH OF SNOW BY 12Z SUN WITH AN ADDITIONAL HALF 
INCH BY 00Z MON WITH A DUSTING IN THE LOWEST ELEVATIONS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. HELD ONTO SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SUNDAY NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY AS THE NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES WITH MOIST FETCH OFF THE 
GREAT LAKES. MODELS PICK UP ON ANOTHER SHORTWAVE FEATURE FOR LATER 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. THEREFORE APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR SNOW SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES INCLUDING 
THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND HIGHER TERRAIN IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. OROGRAPHICS COULD ALLOW FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION IN 
THESE AREAS. THE NORTHWEST FLOW FINALLY WEAKENS AND DRIES OUT BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS HIGH TEMPERATURES ONLY SLOWLY 
MODERATE.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  54  34  52  34 /  10   0   0  40   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  26  49  32  48  30 /  10  10  10  50  10

AGAIN TRENDING TOWARD A COLDER FORECAST. FRIDAY UPPER RIDGING HAS 
SUPPRESSED COMPARED TO PREVIOUS RUNS SO WARM UP NOT AS PRONOUNCED.
SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW. 
STRENGTHENING SHORT WAVE PUNCHES INTO THE AREA LATE FRI/EARLY SAT. 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE NICELY UP TO .5 PWS AS THE SHORT WAVE MOVES 
THROUGH INTO SUNDAY. SUFFICIENT RH IN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION. 
TRENDED FORECAST FOR SNOW UPWARD FOR THE WEEKEND AND MAY BE UNDONE. 
TIMING AND DAYTIME WARM UP REMAIN IN QUESTION AND ODDS ARE SNOW 
POTENTIAL MAY INCREASE WITH FUTURE MODEL RUNS. WEAK SURFACE LOW 
TRAVELS ALONG FRONT AND MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON SAT. LARGE HIGH 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WITH REINFORCING COLD AIR ADVECTION BUILDS IN BEHIND 
LOW. SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES WILL LINGER ACROSS NE TN/SW VA/SMOKIES
INTO THE MID WEEK. HAVE DOWNPLAYED THIS ACTIVITY FOR NOW.

APPEARS REASONABLE WITH THIS PATTERN. BASIC CHANGES TO FORECAST WAS

FROM THE SW THU. SHORT WAVE DIG SSE THROUGH TN VLY AND S 
APPALACHIANS LATE THU EARLY FRI BRINGING SOME CLOUD COVER. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE REINFORCED FROM THE NW. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE 
MOVES SE THROUGH NE TN/SW VA SAT. THIS FEATURE WILL BRING MORE 
MOISTURE AND DRAG A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. LIGHT SHOWERS WILL 
CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS NE TN/SMOKIES/SW VA INTO SUN MORNING. 
COLD TEMPS AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL FOLLOW AND SHOULD PREVAIL INTO 
NEXT WEEK.

ZONES AND IS EXPECTED TO SHIFT INTO THE EASTERN ZONES BY EARLY IN 
THE FIRST PERIOD. LINGERING PRECIP CURRENTLY DEPICTED ON RADAR IN 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE IN VICINITY OF FRONT. THUS EXPECT PRECIP TO LINGER 
INTO THE FIRST PERIOD ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MUCH 
OF THE EVENING WITH PRECIP ENDING WEST TO EAST OVERNIGHT. TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO DROP QUICKLY AS FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH THE AREA. THUS 
PRECIP MAY END AS SNOW ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. HOWEVER... 
MOISTURE BEHIND FRONT DECREASES RAPIDLY...SO NO SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED AT THIS TIME. PROJECTED WIND DIRECTION ALSO 
NOT IDEAL FOR UPSLOPE FLOW EVENT. DRY...ALBEIT MUCH COOLER 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR WEDNESDAY. WILL CANCEL HIGH WIND WARNING 
WITH ISSUANCE OF AFTERNOON PACKAGE AND REPLACE WITH ADVISORY AS
850 MB WINDS ARE PROJECTED TO CONTINUE TO DECREASE AND CONTINUE TO
SHIFT TO A SOUTHWESTERLY DIRECTION. FOR TEMPS...MAV/MET GUIDANCE
CLOSE AND LOOKS REASONABLE. GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV
VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE PRIMARY WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD WILL BE A 
CLOSED LOW THAT WILL BE NEARLY STATIONARY OVER NEW ENGLAND AND 
EASTERN CANADA...WITH A NORTHWEST FLOW OVER OUR AREA. THE 
GFS...ECMWF...AND CANADIAN MODELS AGREE ON THIS GENERAL 
PATTERN...THOUGH THE FINER DETAILS AND TIMING OF SHORTWAVES MOVING 
AROUND THE LOW ARE DIFFERENT AMONG THE MODELS. THE GFS APPEARS TO BE 
THE OUTLIER OF THE MODELS...AND HAS LITTLE SUPPORT FROM ITS ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS...SO WILL LEAN TOWARD THE ECMWF/CANADIAN SOLUTION.

THE FIRST SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO AFFECT THE AREA WILL PASS THROUGH ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY. MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED...AND SO WILL KEEP 
THE FORECAST DRY. 850-500 MB TEMPS FALL SLIGHTLY WITH THIS TROUGH 
PASSAGE...MAINLY IN NORTHERN SECTION...SO HIGHS WILL ONLY BE IN THE 
40S FOR MUCH OF THE AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. A WEAK RIDGE WILL MEAN 
SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPS FOR SATURDAY BEFORE THE NEXT TROUGH ARRIVES ON 
SUNDAY. DEEPER MOISTURE AND A STRONGER POLAR JET STREAM OVER THE 
AREA WILL MEAN BETTER PRECIP CHANCES THAN THE FIRST TROUGH...MAINLY 
IN NORTHERN SECTIONS...FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. WILL HAVE JUST 
A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH DUE TO MODEL DISCREPANCIES. A SIGNIFICANT PUSH 
OF COLD AIR FOLLOWS THIS TROUGH FOR MONDAY AS A STRONG SURFACE HIGH 
MOVES FROM CENTRAL CANADA TO THE PLAINS. HIGHS WILL ONLY BE IN THE 
30S AND 40S FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. CLOUDS MAY BE INCREASING ON 
TUESDAY IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING SOUTHERN STREAM LOW DEPICTED BY 
THE ECMWF.


&&

.DISCUSSION...MAIN AXIS OF MOSTLY STRATIFORM RAIN CURRENTLY

RECEIVING HEAVIEST RAINFALL. EXPECT THIS AXIS TO CONTINUE TO SLOWLY
DRIFT EASTWARD THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. WILL CANCEL WIND
ADVISORY EARLY AS WINDS HAVE DIMINISHED TO BELOW CRITERIA PER AREA
OBS AND ARE PROJECTED TO CONTINUE TO DIMINISH THROUGH THE REMAINDER
OF THE DAY. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE HIGH WIND WARNING FOR MOUNTAINS
AS CAMP CREEK OB CONTINUES TO REPORT GUSTS ABOVE CRITERIA. WILL
ALSO TWEAK TEMPS AS DOWNSLOPE COMPONENT DECREASES AS WINDS SHIFT
MORE TO THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

CEILINGS AT MVFR. CIGS WILL DROP TO IFR AT CHA AND OCCASIONALLY AT

MODERATE RAINFALL WILL MOVE INTO CHA AROUND 12Z TYS AROUND 14Z AND 
TRI BY 17Z. ISOLATED THUNDER IS POSSIBLE. WESTERLY FLOW WILL FILL IN 
BEHIND FRONT WITH IMPROVEMENT IN VSBY AND CEILING BUT STILL MOST 
LIKELY IN AN MVFR CATEGORY.

FXUS64 KMRX 300838
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EST TUE NOV 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE IN ANTICIPATED SHORT 
TERM WEATHER. UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
BY TONIGHT. STRONG MID LEVEL JET EAST OF TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH 
MIDDLE TN TODAY AND CONTINUE EAST WITH JET AXIS OVER SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY END OF PERIOD. LONG FETCHED N-S COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
EAST THROUGH MRX CWA TODAY. SURFACE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH INTO 
SOUTHERN MRX CWA BRIEFLY THIS MORNING. STRONG H85 JET AND GOOD 
MOISTURE TRANSPORT WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA IN ADVANCE OF THE 
COLD FRONT. LOW LEVEL STABLE LAYER HINDERING PERSISTENT STRONG WINDS 
ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS PRESENTLY. WINDS EXPECTED TO MIX DOWN AND 
BECOME GUSTY IN NATURE WITH SPEEDS MEETING ADVISORY CRITERIA ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE MRX CWA. THE SET UP FOR A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT HAS BEEN 
REALIZED AND WILL CONTINUE TODAY. RADAR AND SAT PICS INDICATE 
DOWNSLOPING SIGNATURES ALONG WEST SIDE OF SMOKIES. COVE MNT OBS HAS 
BEEN REPORTING GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 70 KTS OVERNIGHT. LOW LEVEL JET 
WILL REMAIN STRONG IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT INTO THE EARLY AFTN 
HOURS. SOLID LINE OF CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE IN ADVANCE OF FRONT 
AND WILL MARCH ACROSS MRX CWA TODAY. BULK SHEAR AND INCREASING PWS 
REMAIN MOST IMPRESSIVE FEATURES PROGGED TO ACCOMPANY LINE. HOURLY 
RAINFALL RATE BETWEEN .5-.75 WILL BE COMMON ALONG THE LINE. STORM 
TOTAL AMOUNTS UP TO TWO INCHES REMAINS LIKELY. MINOR FLOODING 
PROBLEMS CAN BE EXPECTED BUT WIDESPREAD FLOODING NOT ANTICIPATED.
HELICITY ALONG AND SOUTH OF WARM FRONT COULD AID IN DEVELOPMENT OF 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS OR ISOLATED TORNADOES BUT MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY 
SHOULD REMAIN S OF MRX CWA. MAX TEMPS MAY SPIKE BRIEFLY ALONG 
FOOTHILLS DUE TO DOWNSLOPING WINDS BUT OVERALL TEMPS MODERATED BY 
CLOUD COVER AND PCPN. POST FRONTAL WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST AND 
DECREASE BELOW ADVISORY AND WARNING LIMITS WILL REMAINING BREEZY 
FROM THE WEST. CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE IN THE EVENING HOURS MAINLY 
ACROSS EASTERN AREAS. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION COMMENCES AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. TEMPS WILL FALL SHARPLY WITH FREEZING LEVEL DROPPING TO 
NEAR THE SURFACE BY DAYBREAK. MOISTURE WILL BE VERY LIMITED BY THIS 
TIME SO SNOWFALL NOT EXPECTED TO AMOUNT TO MUCH.   

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE EAST
OF THE APPALACHIANS EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING BUT UPPER TROUGH WILL
PASS ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE
MORNING SO HAVE KEPT CHANCE OF LIGHT PRECIP WEDNESDAY MORNING.
UPSLOPE FLOW WITH STRONG COLD ADVECTION AT THE LOWER LEVELS MAY
KEEP SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH THE MORNING ESPECIALLY IN THE
MOUNTAINS...BUT WITH LITTLE ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION AS DRY AIR
ALOFT MOVES IN BEHIND THE COLD FRONT BY AFTERNOON. SKIES SHOULD
CLEAR MOST OTHER AREAS OUTSIDE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY BUT
BECAUSE OF COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL RISE ONLY 5 TO 10 DEGREES FROM
MORNING LOWS. BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER FORECAST
AREA WITH FLOW FROM THE NW AND WINDS DYING DOWN WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 20S AREA WIDE...EVEN COLDER TEENS IN
THE MOUNTAINS. THURSDAY HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO THE SOUTH AND
WEAK SYSTEM IN NW FLOW WILL KEEP SOME CLOUDS OVER REGION BUT WARMER
TEMPERATURES. FRIDAY ABOUT THE SAME TEMPERATURES BUT A LITTLE MORE
SUN AS WEAK SYSTEM PASSES TO EAST. SATURDAY A NEW SYSTEM APPROACHES
FROM THE WEST AND NORTHWEST SO WILL INTRODUCE LOW POPS WITH COLD
AIR CHANGING RAIN TO SNOW SATURDAY NIGHT. SUNDAY AND MONDAY TROUGH
DEEPENS ACROSS THE EAST BEHIND SATURDAY SYSTEM. VARIABLE CLOUDINESS
AS WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. WILL LEAVE DRY
FOR NOW BUT MAY NEED TO ADD CHANCE PRECIPITATION WITH LATER RUNS
WHEN TIMING OF SYSTEMS IS BETTER.

368 
FXUS64 KMRX 300147
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST MON NOV 29 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
NORTHEAST PRODUCING A COLD AIR DAMMING SCENARIO OVER THE CAROLINAS. 
THE RESULTING TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THESE TWO SYSTEMS WAS 
PRODUCING A STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 50 KT) OVER THE REGION...WHICH 
IS PROGGED TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN UP TO AROUND 70 TO 75 KT AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. EARLIER OBSERVATIONS FROM THE NOAA WIND TOWER AT CAMP 
CREEK IN SOUTHEAST GREENE COUNTY REPORTED WIND GUSTS UP TO 74 MPH... 
WITH THE COVE MOUNTAIN WIND TOWER IN THE NATIONAL PARK REPORTING 
WIND GUSTS UP TO 54 MPH. EARLIER SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALED SOME 
NARROW BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER PARALLEL WITH THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVE ACTIVITY...BUT CURRENT IMAGERY 
SHOWS HIGH CLOUDS OBSCURING THESE NARROW BREAKS. OVERALL...HIGH WIND 
WARNING FOR THE MOUNTAIN AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FOOTHILLS APPEARS TO BE 
ON TRACK...AND EXPECT THESE WINDS TO FURTHER INTENSIFY OVERNIGHT 
WITH GUSTS POSSIBLY UP TO 80 OR 90 MPH AFTER MIDNIGHT. ELSEWHERE... 
WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY BECOME BREEZY IN THE VALLEY AREAS...WITH THE 
ADVISORY-CRITERIA WINDS (IN EXCESS OF 25 MPH) MAINLY CONFINED TO THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SOME OF STRONGER SHOWERS THAT ARE ABLE TO PULL 
DOWN SOME OF THE STRONG 850 MB WINDS INTO THE VALLEY AREAS. 

AREA RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF RAIN SPREADING NORTHEAST ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...BUT THINK THAT DOWNSLOPING 
SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS SHOULD LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF RAINFALL OVER THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS TONIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY MORNING. 
THUS...WHILE RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES MAY OCCUR 
OVERNIGHT ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC (WITH STORM TOTALS OF 
TWO TO THREE INCHES BY TUESDAY NIGHT)...WILL NOT PLAN TO ISSUE A 
FLOOD WATCH WITH THIS SYSTEM SINCE FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES ARE 
RELATIVELY HIGH (FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR) AND THIS RAINFALL SHOULD 
OCCUR OVER SEVERAL HOURS. HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO MENTION 'RAINFALL 
MAY HEAVY AT TIMES' WORDING IN THE FORECAST. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL 
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN LATER 
TONIGHT...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION SOME TSTORMS IN THE FORECAST FOR 
THESE AREAS. WILL ALSO PLAN TO MAKE SOME TWEAKS TO THE TEMP FORECAST 
FOR TONIGHT DUE TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

ON TUESDAY...AM BECOMING INCREASINGLY CONCERNED WITH THE PROSPECTS 
FOR DAMAGING WINDS WITH A POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE LINE DEVELOPING ALONG 
THE COLD FRONT DURING THE AFTER SUNRISE HOURS OF THE MORNING. NAM 
MODEL CONTINUES TO INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME WEAK INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT...WHICH MAY ONLY RESULT IN A LINE OF 
SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONT. HOWEVER...WITH A STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 
60 TO 70 KT) IN PLACE AND THE LOW-LEVEL STABLE LAYER EXPECTED TO 
HAVE ERODED AWAY AFTER SUNRISE...THINK THAT SOME OF THESE UPPER- 
LEVEL STRONG WINDS MAY BE PULLED DOWN TO THE SURFACE WITH THESE 
SHOWERS. ALSO...WITH SUCH STRONG WIND DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM 
(RESULTING IN HIGH HELICITY VALUES)...EVEN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME 
MINOR INSTABILITY MAY BE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE A FEW SUPERCELLS AND/OR 
ISOLATED TORNADOES. THIS POSSIBILITY OF SOME WEAK INSTABILITY 
APPEARS TO MAINLY BE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN DURING LATE MORNING HOURS. 
WILL PLAN TO ADDRESS THESE CONCERNS IN A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT 
AND IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. WILL ALSO PLAN TO MAKE SOME 
CHANGES TO THE TEMP FORECAST FOR TOMORROW...SINCE THE STRONG 
DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS SHOULD CAUSE TEMPS TO RISE SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE THE MOS GUIDANCE VALUES ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN AREAS OF THE GREAT TN VALLEY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     47  68  33  42  25 /  80 100  70  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             47  60  33  43  25 /  80 100  60  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    46  64  36  40  20 /  50 100 100  30  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
648 PM EST MON NOV 29 2010

.AVIATION...POWERFUL STORM SYSTEM MAKING ITS WAY INTO THE EASTERN
U.S. THIS EVENING WITH NARROW AREA OF SHOWERS CONTAINING MODERATE
TO EVEN HEAVY RAIN AT TIMES. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET REQUIRES USE OF
LLWS DURING THE EVENT. THIS JET IS SCOURING OUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
AT TYS AND TRI LEAVING CEILINGS AT SEVEN THOUSAND FEET OR HIGHER
HERE. IT WILL BE INTERESTING TO SEE WHAT IMPACT THE BAND OF SHOWERS
MOVING RAPIDLY NORTHEAST AT THESE TERMINALS. SUSPECT THERE WOULD BE
VERY LITTLE IMPACT AT TRI DUE TO THE LONG FETCH ACROSS MOUNTAIN
TERRAIN HERE. MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS WITH MODERATE RAINFALL WILL MOVE
INTO CHA AROUND 12Z TYS AROUND 14Z AND TRI BY 17Z WITH WESTERLY
FLOW FILLING IN BEHIND FRONT WITH IMPROVEMENT IN VSBY AND CEILING
BUT STILL MOST LIKELY IN AN MVFR CATEGORY.

FXUS64 KMRX 291930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST MON NOV 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MAJOR SYSTEM CURRENTLY 
DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL CONTINUE TO HEAD EAST 
EXERTING INCREASING INFLUENCE ON THE FORECAST AREA AS IT PROGRESSES. 
CONDITIONS STILL APPEAR GENERALLY FAVORABLE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT 
WITH LOW-LEVEL FLOW APPROACHING 70 KNOTS...SURFACE-BASED INVERSION 
TO AROUND 850 MB AND VEERING WIND PROFILE. WILL UPGRADE HIGH WIND 
WATCH TO A WARNING AND INCLUDE REMAINDER OF FORECAST AREA IN WIND 
ADVISORY. ANOTHER FACET OF THIS EVENT IS POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT 
RAINFALL WITH QPFS APPROACHING TWO INCHES GENERALLY. WILL HOLD OFF 
ON ISSUING ANY FLOOD PRODUCTS AT THIS TIME AS MOST OF RAINFALL IS 
EXPECTED TO OCCUR DURING SECOND PERIOD BUT CAN'T TOTALLY RULE OUT
POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING IN SOME LOCATIONS. TEMPS CONTINUE TO BE
PROBLEMATIC IN DOWNSLOPE FLOW REGIME. TENDED TO FAVOR A BLEND OF
THE GUIDANCE VALUES OVERNIGHT WHILE STAYING CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE
IN THE SECOND PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE PRIMARY SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE 
TUESDAY NIGHT PERIOD. THE FRONT SHOULD PUSH MOST OF THE SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIP OUT OF THE AREA BY 12Z. HOWEVER THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER 
TROUGH LAGS THE FRONT BY SEVERAL HOURS...SO THERE MAY BE A PERIOD OF 
LIGHT PRECIP WEDNESDAY MORNING. UPSLOPLE FLOW AND STRONG COLD 
ADVECTION AT 850 MB MAY RESULT IN A PERIOD OF SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS 
LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT WITH LITTLE 
ACCUMULATION EXPECTED AS VERY DRY AIR ALOFT MOVES IN BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH. 

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL BE 
OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD...WITH THE POLAR JET LOCATED FROM 
MINNESOTA TO THE CAROLINAS. THIS WILL KEEP PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ACROSS OUR AREA. A BUILDING 
RIDGE IN THE PROGRESSIVE PATTERN WILL MEAN A SLIGHT WARMING TREND 
FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. A FAST-MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGH MAY BRING 
ADDITIONAL CLOUDS FOR SUNDAY...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS TOO LIMITED FOR 
PRECIP. THE UPPER JET STRENGTHENS AND PUSHES SOUTHWARD AGAIN FOR 
MONDAY AS A CLOSED LOW DROPS OVER THE GREAT LAKES...ACCORDING TO THE 
GFS. THE 00Z ECMWF SHOWS THE CLOSED LOW MUCH FARTHER 
SOUTH...RESULTING IN SNOW OVER OUR ENTIRE AREA. CONSIDERABLE SPREAD 
AMONG GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SUGGESTS TAKING THE MORE CAUTIOUS ROUTE 
AT THIS POINT. WILL START MONDAY OFF DRY BUT WITH FALLING TEMPS AND 
INCREASING CLOUDS.

.DISCUSSION...RATHER TRICKY FORECAST FOR TODAY WITH A COUPLE OF
COMPETING PROCESSES AT WORK AS MAJOR SYSTEM DEVELOPS AND APPROACHES
FROM THE WEST. LATEST VIS SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW CLOUD DECK
ADVANCING INTO THE CWA. HOWEVER...STRENGTHENING LOW-LEVEL SE FLOW
IN ADVANCE OF DEVELOPING SYSTEM IS DOWNSLOPING IN NATURE AND THUS
SHOULD TEND TO INHIBIT NOT ONLY CLOUD DEVELOPMENT BUT PRECIP ONSET
FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. OVERALL...FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK
AND NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME. NEVERTHELESS...POTENTIAL
FOR MAJOR DISCREPANCIES POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS
DEPENDING ON WHICH OF THE COMPETING PROCESSES PREVAIL. WILL
CONTINUE WIND PRODUCTS AS CURRENTLY CONFIGURED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 AM EST MON NOV 29 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...STRONG UPPER TROF MOVING 
EAST THROUGH CENTRAL CONUS TODAY. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVES NE 
THROUGH NATIONS MID SECTION. PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS BETWEEN LOW 
AND STOUT RIDGE OVER NE U.S. H85 JET DEVELOPS OVER CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU TODAY AND INCREASES TONIGHT TO NEAR 75 KTS. FLOW SOMEWHAT 
LESS AND SOUTHEASTERLY ACROSS THE SMOKIES. THIS SETS UP WELL FOR 
DOWNSLOPING WINDS ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS INTO TUESDAY. MAX TEMPS ALONG 
THE FOOTHILLS COULD EXPERIENCE A BIG JUMP THIS AFTERNOON AND MAY BE 
UNDERDONE. NAM MODEL MOS POPS LOOK OVERDONE AND EXPECT PCPN TO MOVE 
INTO SW AREA LATER THIS AFTN. STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION COMMENCES IN 
THE H85-H70 LAYER TONIGHT. PCPN SHOULD BECOME WIDESPREAD BY LATE 
TONIGHT. LAYER SHEAR IS MODERATELY STRONG BUT INSTABILITY IS LACKING 
AS SFC WARM FRONT HANGS SOUTH OF THE AREA. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHERN AND WESTERN AREAS INTO TUESDAY MORNING. 
SEVERE PARAMETERS APPEAR LIMITED AT THIS TIME. STRONG WINDS CONTINUE 
TUESDAY MORNING AND PWS INCREASE TO NEAR 1.50 ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS. 
WESTERN AND SOUTHERN AREAS COULD SEE SOME MINOR FLOODING. SURFACE 
COLD FRONT SWINGS THROUGH MRX CWA TUESDAY AND TEMPS WILL LIKELY FALL 
IN THE AFTN EXCEPT FOR NE AREAS. UPPER TROUGH BECOMES NEGATIVELY 
TILTED AND MOVES NE THROUGH THE AREA. AVAILABLE MOISTURE DROPS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. FREEZING LEVEL WILL DROP TO NEAR 2500 FEET BY LATE TUESDAY 
NIGHT SO ANY ONGOING PCPN WILL SWITCH TO SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. INITIAL GROUND TEMPS SHOULD HINDER SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATIONS. 

..LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE PULLING 
AWAY FROM THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...BUT STILL EXPECTED TO SEE SOME 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE GENERATING A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OVER FAR 
NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS.  WITH THE COOLER AIR SLIDING IN AS 
WELL...A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW IS EXPECTED OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  WILL 
MOVE INTO A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED AS 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  COULD SEE A WEAK DISTURBANCE 
TRACKING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW LATE IN THE PERIOD...BUT CONSISTENCY 
QUITE POOR AND CONFIDENCE LOW.  THEREFORE...HAVE KEPT THINGS DRY 
THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.

457 
FXUS64 KMRX 290156
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EST SUN NOV 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
DEVELOPING IN THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES. CURRENT INFRARED SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS SOME LOW CLOUDS BEGINNING TO DEVELOP OVER SOUTHEAST 
GA...AND THESE LOW CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO EXPAND NORTHWARD OVERNIGHT 
TOWARDS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC BY SUNRISE. CURRENT FORECAST 
OF SKY CONDITIONS AND TEMPS FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. 
HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THAT CONDITIONS WILL SLOWLY BECOME FAVORABLE 
FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF MOUNTAIN WAVES ALONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE 
MOUNTAINS LATER TONIGHT INTO MONDAY. MODELS INDICATE THAT WINDS WILL 
BECOME SOUTHEASTERLY LATER TONIGHT...AND SLOWLY INCREASE ON 
MONDAY...ESPECIALLY AT THE 850 MB LEVEL. WITH A SURFACE-BASED 
INVERSION IN PLACE...EXPECT ADVISORY-CRITERIA WINDS AROUND THE 
MOUNTAINS AND THEIR FOOTHILLS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS BEGINNING LATE TONIGHT AND CONTINUING INTO 
EARLY MONDAY EVENING.

...OUTLOOK FOR MAJOR SYSTEM ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...

MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT CONDITIONS WILL BECOME 
FAVORABLE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF HIGH WINDS DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES BY 
LATE MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. NAM MODEL INDICATES 
THAT A VERY STRONG (70 TO 75 KT) SOUTHEASTERLY 850 MB JET OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL APPROACH THE MOUNTAINS BY LATE MONDAY EVENING 
AND INTO TUESDAY. IN ADDITION...MODEL SOUNDINGS LOCATED UPSTREAM OF 
THE MOUNTAINS REVEAL A SURFACE-BASED INVERSION EXTENDING UP TO 
AROUND 800 MB...AND A STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE THAT INCREASES 
WITH HEIGHT. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT A HIGH END WIND EVENT DUE TO 
MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE FOOTHILLS BY LATE MONDAY 
EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL ISSUE A 
HIGH WIND WATCH FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FOOTHILLS. THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY BY 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON...WITH THE LOW-LEVEL STABLE LAYER ERODING AWAY AS 
WELL. THUS...WILL HAVE THE HIGH WIND WATCH END AT NOON ON TUESDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   34  54  47  59  35 /   0  30 100 100  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     30  55  44  59  36 /   0  10  70 100  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN             29  53  44  54  36 /   0  10  90 100  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    22  52  40  62  39 /   0  10  50 100  70 
&&

NC...NONE.

     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...

TRACK TO AFFECT SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. IN ADDITION TO A SIGNIFICANT RAIN 
EVENT...SYSTEM WILL ALSO INDUCE STRONG WINDS ESPECIALLY IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW ON THE FRONT SIDE OF THE SYSTEM 
MAY POTENTIALLY RESULT IN MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
TUESDAY. ALL MODELS...SREF AND GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS CONTINUE TO 
DEPICT EVENT TOTAL QPFS GENERALLY IN EXCESS OF ONE INCH. SYSTEM 
DEPARTS QUITE RAPIDLY ON WEDNESDAY ALTHOUGH SOME WRAP-AROUND 
MOISTURE MAY RESULT IN LINGERING PRECIP MAINLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN 
ZONES. REMAINDER OF FORECAST CONTINUES TO LOOK DRY AT THIS TIME WITH 
SLOWLY MODERATING TEMPS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE 
SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST SUN NOV 28 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST OF 
THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH TONIGHT. AFTER A COLD START...TODAYS 
TEMPERATURES WILL RISE TO NEAR NORMAL UNDER SUNNY SKIES. EVENING 
TEMPS WILL FALL FAST IN DRY AIRMASS. SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE IN THE 
H85 LAYER TONIGHT. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE A WARM UP LATE TONIGHT 
AS WARM AIR ADVECTION GETS UNDERWAY. A CLOUD LAYER WILL ALSO ADVANCE 
NORTH INTO SOUTHERN AREAS LATE TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL BE 
AFFECTING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
EXTENDED.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY REACH INTO OUR FAR WESTERN AREAS LATE 
MONDAY.  DEEP MOISTURE AND GOOD LIFT ACCOMPANYING THE SYSTEM WILL 
BRING A LARGE BAND OF RAIN SHOWERS IN MONDAY NIGHT...AND CONTINUE 
OVER THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY.  COOLER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT...AND WILL EXPECT SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE TO CONTINUE 
AFFECTING AREA WEATHER THROUGH WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THIS 
COMBINATION WILL ALLOW FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVER FAR NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS AND ACROSS OUR HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  THE SYSTEM MOVES OFF 
AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

THAT APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE LATE MONDAY 
TO EARLY TUESDAY TIME FRAME REMAINS THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE LONG 
TERM. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES REMAIN IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THIS EVENT...WITH ONLY MINOR RUN-TO-RUN AND MODEL-TO-MODEL TIMING 
DIFFERENCES. THE GFS...CANADIAN AND ECMWF MODELS ALONG WITH ALL 12 
MEMBERS OF THE GEFS ENSEMBLES PROJECT EVENT TOTAL QPFS OF ONE TO TWO 
INCHES GENERALLY. AM TEMPTED TO BUMP UP POPS FOR TUESDAY TO 
CATEGORICAL BUT HAVE CONTINUED WITH HIGH LIKELY POPS BECAUSE OF 
MINOR TIMING UNCERTAINTIES. THERE ARE SOME MODEL INCONSISTENCIES IN 
THE AMOUNT OF WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE BEHIND SYSTEM ON WEDNESDAY AS 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA. BUMPED UP POPS SOMEWHAT 
FOR WEDNESDAY ESPECIALLY OVER THE EASTERN ZONES. BALANCE OF LONG 
TERM APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME WITH ANOTHER COLD SHOT BEHIND 
TUESDAY'S SYSTEM. TEMPS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY MODERATE BY LATE WORK 
WEEK AS UPPER TROUGH PULLS AWAY. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT 
DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

.AVIATION...A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SITS DIRECTLY ON TOP OF

STATES. PRESSURE GRADIENT IS WEAK UNDER THE RIDGE THIS MORNING SO

SOMEWHAT TO 5-10 KNOTS FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHWEST. ATMOSPHERE IS 
QUITE DRY SO EXPECT CLEAR SKIES AT CHA AND TYS. THERE IS A PATCH OF 
DECREASING STRATOCUMULUS IN THE FAR NORTH THAT IS BOTH MOVING EAST 
AND DIMINISHING IN EXTENT. THIS WILL MOVE AWAY FROM TRI AS MORNING 
PROGRESSES. CIG/VSBY AT TRI IS STILL VFR NOW, BUT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
WILL DOMINATE LATER. WINDS WILL PICK UP AT TRI MOST TODAY, WITH 
AROUND 10 KNOTS IN THE AFTERNOON.

WINDS DIE OFF AFTER SUNSET.

OVERNIGHT/SATURDAY...ALTHOUGH WILL STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DRY AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS WITH SLOWLY MODERATING TEMPS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH 
THE EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES REMAIN IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT A SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE REGION 
BY LATE MONDAY WITH THE PEAK OF THE EVENT OCCURRING AROUND 12Z 
TUESDAY. BUMPED UP POPS TO LIKELY FOR THE WESTERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE 
CWA FOR THE MONDAY NIGHT PERIOD AND CONTINUED LIKELY POPS ON TUESDAY 
FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. DRY WEATHER RETURNS FOR THE LATTER 
PORTION OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...UNDERCUT MEX GUIDANCE 
MAX DAYTIME TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY BASED ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS...BUT 
OTHERWISE DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX VALUES.

830 
FXUS64 KMRX 260753 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EST FRI NOV 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...POTENT COLD FRONT NOW 
EXITING FORECAST AREA VIA THE MOUNTAINS LONG NC LINE. STRONG 
PRESSURE GRADIENT AHEAD OF FRONT PRODUCED WIND GUSTS INTO ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...BUT GRADIENT BEHIND FRONT IS LESS TIGHT AND SO WINDS HAVE 
DROPPED OFF TO MERELY GUSTY AT TIMES AND WILL ALLOW WIND ADVISORY 
FOR MOUNTAINS TO EXPIRE NORMALLY WITH FORECAST ISSUANCE. 

OTHER ISSUE AT HAND IS LARGE BUT MOTTELY RAIN SHIELD OVER AREA. THE 
AREA IS MOVING EAST MORE SLOWLY THAN THE RAIN ELEMENTS ARE MOVING 
NORTHEAST WITHIN IN IT. THE COLD AIR BEHIND THE FRONT PRODUCED SOME 
MOMENTARY LIGHT SNOW IN NORTHWEST TN DURING THE NIGHT. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SHOW A NEARLY SATURATED COLUMN TO ABOUT 700 MB WITH TEMPS 
MAINLY BELOW FREEZING. BELIEVE THIS WILL AFFECT MAINLY THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND POSSIBLE LEE AND WISE COUNTIES IN VA, SO HAVE INCLUDED 
ISOLATED MIXED RW/SW IN THOSE AREAS FOR THIS MORNING. THE CLOUD 
SHIELD WILL MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS THE AREA AND BACK EDGE WILL 
GRADUALLY MOVE OUT OF THE REGION TODAY PROVIDING INCREASINGLY SUNNY 
SKIES LATER TODAY BUT TEMPS WILL DROP LIKE A ROCK AND THE HIGHS HAVE 
ALREADY OCCURRED FOR THE DAY. AFTERNOON TEMPS WILL NOT EXCEED THE 
40S AND THERE WILL STILL BE A BIT OF BREEZINESS MAKING BLACK FRIDAY 
A BIT RAW. 

OVERNIGHT TEMPS WILL PLUMMET TO THE 20S MOST AREAS IN COLD 
ADVECTION, WITH TEENS IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN AS SKIES CLEAR AND 
WINDS DIE DOWN A BIT. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
REGION WILL KEEP THINGS DRY AND COOL FOR THE WEEKEND.  A FEW SHOWERS 
OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING FRONT MAY REACH INTO OUR WESTERN 
COUNTIES LATE MONDAY.  THE MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  THE UPPER LOW 
WILL STAY WELL TO OUR NORTH...BUT MAY CONTINUE TO PULL A FEW SHOWERS 
INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY CONDITIONS RETURN 
FOR THURSDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK 
REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  50  28  54  31  59 /  60  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    48  27  49  29  55 /  70  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN            49  27  50  29  56 /  60  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   49  26  45  25  53 /  70  10   0   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY

130 AM EST FRI NOV 26 2010

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT DRAPED ACROSS EAST TN SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST, 
MOVING SLOWLY EAST. HAS PASSED ALL TAF SITES AND ENTERING MOUNTAINS 
NOW. SHOULD BE OUT OF AREA SOON. SPOTTY RAIN ELEMENTS MOVING 
NORTHEAST QUICKLY. PERIODS OF +RA HITTING ESP CHA, BUT MAY AFFECT 
TYS AND TRI, TOO. WIND ADVISORY FOR MOUNTAINS WITH GUSTS OVER 45KT 
BUT DROPPING OFF RAPIDLY AFTER FROPA. EXPECT WINDS TO STAY WEST TO 
NORTH AT LESS THAN 15 AND GUSTINESS TO CONTINUE TO DIMINISH AS SFC 
HIGH MOVES CLOSER TODAY. BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS IS ALREADY TO 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND PROGGED TO REACH CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY ABOUT 
12Z. WILL KEEP PERIODS OF MVFR VSBY AND CIGS OFF AND ON UNTIL EARLY 
TO MID-MORNING AND THEN RAPIDLY AT CHA, LATE MORNING TO EARLY AFTN 
AT TYS AND TRI. 

OTHER ISSUE: TEMPS WILL DROP AFTER FROPA AND NOT RISE THE 40S AGAIN 
TODAY, AND THEN DROP BELOW FREEZING TONIGHT. THIS MAY POSSIBLY 
AFFECT RUNWAY OPS WITH WET CONDITIONS AND FREEZING TEMPS. COLD AND 
DRY CONDITIONS IN MIDWEST WILL MODIFY BY THE TIME THEY GET HERE. MAY 
GET SOME FOG FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING, WELL PAST CURRENT 
TAF PACKAGE. STAY TUNED.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL

FAVORABLE FOR A HIGH WIND EVENT...THUS NO WIND ADVISORY/WARNINGS AT 
THIS TIME.  WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS.     

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN FOCUS FOR THE
LONG TERM IS DOMINATED BY POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM THAT
APPROACHES BY MONDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO WEDNESDAY. MODELS AND
ENSEMBLES IN GOOD ENOUGH AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM TO CONTINUE
LIKELY POPS FOR TUESDAY. UPPER TROUGH AXIS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
SYSTEM SWINGS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FAIRLY
QUICKLY ALLOWING A RAPID RETURN TO DRY ALBEIT COOLER WEATHER BY
LATE IN THE LONG TERM. EARLY PORTION OF LONG TERM CONTINUES TO BE
DRY WITH SLOWLY MODERATING TEMPS. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FOLLOW MAV
GUIDANCE CLOSELY FOR THE EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM BEFORE
SLIGHTLY UNDERCUTTING MEX GUIDANCE FOR DAYTIME MAX TEMPS FOR MUCH
OF THE LATTER PORTION DUE TO TRENDS IN ENSEMBLE DATA.

AND TRI TO STAY VFR. THE LOW LEVEL JET ABOVE A LIGHT SURFACE WIND
WILL REQUIRE THE USE OF LLWS AT THE SITES FOR THE FIRST FEW HOURS

SOUTHWEST WHICH WILL KEEP THINGS WARM AND A BIT HUMID TODAY. HIGH RH 
ALOFT WILL ALSO TEND TO KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY TO OVERCAST SKIES IN 
PLACE THROUGH TONIGHT. 

EXPECT WINDS TO INCREASE INTO TONIGHT AS STRONG COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM WEST. FRONTOGENISIS WITH THIS FEATURE ARE IMPRESSIVE 
AND WINDS WILL APPROACH LAKE WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA, BUT FOR NOW 
WILL KEEP "BREEZY" WORDING IN ZONES FORECASTS. WILL CONSIDER LWA 
LATER THIS MORNING IF THINGS PICK UP. MAIN AREAS TO WATCH WILL BE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AS 50KT+ LLJ MOVES INTO AREA. 

H7 OMEGA IS ALSO MODERATE BUT THIS IS GOING TO MAINLY FROM LOW LEVEL 
FORCING ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT AND SOME WEAK SPEED CONVERGENCE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE LLJ. HENCE, SHOWERS TURNING TO RAIN OVER NIGHT, 
TAPERING OFF LATER FRIDAY. NO THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED. 

FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH AREA AND COLD ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT 
WILL BE A RUDE AWAKENING AFTER THIS WARM MUGGY PERIOD. BACK TO 
AUTUMN. IT IS ALMOST DECEMBER, AFTER ALL.

AFTER FROPA FRIDAY LATE-ISH, DRIER AIR ADVECTS IN AND SKIES BEGIN TO 
CLEAR FRIDAY NIGHT. 

WENT WITH A MAV/MET BLEND ON THE TEMPS THROUGH PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FORECAST AREA WILL BE IN 
BETWEEN WEATHER SYSTEMS OVER THE WEEKEND WITH WEST NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW ALOFT TRANSITIONING TO THE SOUTHWEST BY THE BEGINNING OF THE 
WORK WEEK. SUNSHINE WILL RETURN UNDER THE STRENGTHENING RIDGE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT BUT TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL EVEN WITH THE INSOLATION ON SATURDAY. BY SUNDAY TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD REBOUND BACK TO NORMAL. UPPER TROF BUILDS EAST INTO THE 
MIDDLE PART OF THE NATION ON MONDAY WITH MOISTURE ON THE INCREASE 
AHEAD OF ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. LOWERED POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON MONDAY WHILE KEEPING LIKELY TO MEDIUM CHANCE FROM WEST TO 
EAST MONDAY NIGHT. FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION ON TUESDAY SO KEPT 
LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS AREAWIDE AT THIS TIME. MODELS SHOWED BETTER 
AGREEMENT ON ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE ENERGY DROPPING INTO THE BACK OF 
THE DEPARTING UPPER TROF TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY SO HELD ONTO 
CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS DURING THIS PERIOD. LATER WEDNESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS COLDER AIR STREAMS SOUTHEAST...SOME OF THE RAIN 
MAY MIX WITH OR CHANCE TO SNOW...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 241929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EST WED NOV 24 2010

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...WEAK FRONT TO OUR SOUTH WILL 
PUSH NORTH OVERNIGHT...BUT LOOKS LIKE MAINLY CLOUDS FOR OUR AREA. 
MAY BE ENOUGH WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT MAINLY SOUTH FOR SOME LIGHT 
PRECIP...SO WILL WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE...CONTINUING 
INTO MORNING SOUTHEAST ZONES.  SHOULD BE IN THE WARM SECTOR 
THURSDAY...SO EXP

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FAIRLY ACTIVE 
EXTENDED FORECAST WITH TWO STRONG SYSTEMS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA. 
FIRST SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH THRUSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH ASSOCIATED 
FROPA EARLY FRIDAY MORNING. BROAD UPPER DIVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH A 
STRONG 130KT 300MB JET OVER THE MID-WEST AND FRONTOGENESIS WITH 
FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL BE THE MAIN FORCING PRODUCING A BAND OF SHOWERS.
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY...BUT NOT SUFFICIENT FOR THUNDERSTORMS.

STRONG 50KT+ 850MB JET WILL PRODUCE WINDY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY.

UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND WITH 
COOL AND DRY CONDITIONS.

NEXT MORE POWERFUL LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH BECOMES ESTABLISHED ACROSS 
THE ROCKIES SUNDAY...THEN LIFT OUT MONDAY. ANOTHER AREA OF SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE GREAT LAKES LATE MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT PULLING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY 
TUESDAY MORNING. ANOTHER 140KT+ JET AT 300MB WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
MID-WEST AND OHIO VALLEY PRODUCING MODERATELY STRONG UPPER 
DIVERGENCE ALONG WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. ANOTHER BAND OF SHOWERS 
ANTICIPATED. AGAIN...INSTABILITY SEEMS QUITE LIMITED SO WILL KEEP 
MENTION OF THUNDER OUT. STRONGER COLD AIR ADVECTION AND ANOTHER 
SHORT-WAVE BEHIND FROPA MAY PRODUCE A PERIOD OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND RAIN
SHOWERS IN THE VALLEY.
