577 
FXUS64 KMRX 240904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST WED NOV 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FORECAST AREA SHOULD ENJOY A MILD 
LATE NOVEMBER DAY TODAY AS THE SOURCE REGION FEEDING THE LOCAL 
ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES TO BE THE PACIFIC OCEAN. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE ABOUT TEN DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR MOST LOCATIONS. THE DAY WILL 
START OUT A LITTLE ON THE FOGGY SIDE. DENSE FOG ADVISORY WAS ISSUED 
TUESDAY EVENING AS THE SURFACE SATURATED RATHER EASILY DUE TO THE 
SOAKED GROUND AND LOSS OF MID DECK. VISIBILITY AND CEILING HAVE BEEN 
BOUNCING AROUND FOR A FEW HOURS WITH THE APPEARANCE OF A GENERAL 
IMPROVING TREND IN THE SATURATED NEAR SURFACE LAYER AS DRIER AIR 
FILTERS INTO THE REGION FROM THE NORTH. LARGE DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS 
NOTED ON THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA ON THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU SO REMOVED THIS AREA FROM THE ADVISORY. 11-3.9 MICRON 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS FOG STILL PREVALENT ACROSS LARGE SECTIONS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AND DESPITE SOME IMPROVEMENT...FOG ADVISORY 
ALREADY IN PLACE AND STILL A FEW HOURS OF RADIATION LEFT BEFORE 
SUNRISE FOR TIGHTENING DEWPOINT DEPRESSION. THEREFORE WILL LEAVE THE 
ADVISORY AS IS. WARM FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TODAY WITH ARRIVAL TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE BEST 
MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE TONIGHT AND EVEN THEN...NOT MUCH TO GET 
EXCITED ABOUT. THEREFORE...REMOVED POPS FOR SHOWERS TODAY AND KEPT 
AT SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS TONIGHT WHEN THE 
BOUNDARY RETURNS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE CWA WILL BE SOLIDLY IN 
THE WARM SECTOR ON THURSDAY...ALLOWING TEMPS TO WARM INTO THE UPPER 
60S TO LOWER 70S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. THERE APPEARS TO BE VERY 
LITTLE LIFTING MECHANISMS FOR PRECIP ON THURSDAY...AND MOS GUIDANCE 
SHOWS SINGLE-DIGIT POPS...SO WILL REMOVE PRECIP FROM THURSDAY. 
MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT PRECIP WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL THURSDAY 
NIGHT...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. A STRONG 850 MB JET...NEAR 50 
KTS...WILL BE OVER THE AREA AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
THURSDAY NIGHT...AND EXPECT THAT WIND ADVISORIES WILL BE NEEDED IN 
THE MOUNTAINS WITH FUTURE UPDATES. THE STRONGEST LIFT WITH THE FRONT 
AND UPPER TROUGH CROSS THROUGH AROUND 12Z FRIDAY...AND MODELS SEEM 
TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THIS. WILL RAISE POPS TO CATEGORICAL LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY MORNING. DRIER AIR ARRIVES QUICKLY 
BEHIND THE FRONT/UPPER TROUGH...AND WILL END ALL RAIN CHANCES BY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON. STRONG COLD ADVECTION WILL RESULT IN TEMPERATURES 
FALLING THROUGH THE DAY. THERE APPEARS TO BE ENOUGH OF A TIME LAG 
BETWEEN THE EXIT OF MOISTURE AND ONSET OF FREEZING TEMPS TO REMOVE 
THE MENTION OF SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS. 

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WILL FEATURE DRY CONDITIONS WITH CLEAR SKIES 
UNDER A BUILDING RIDGE ALOFT. TEMPS GRADUALLY WARM FROM HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 40S TO MID 50S ON SATURDAY...TO UPPER 50S TO MID 60S BY MONDAY 
AS A DEEP S-SW FLOW DEVELOPS BEHIND THE RIDGE AXIS. A CLOSED LOW 
TRACKING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND GREAT LAKES WILL BRING 
ANOTHER STRONG COLD FRONT TO THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT/TUESDAY. THERE 
IS REASONABLE AGREEMENT AMONG GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS WITH THIS 
TIMING...THOUGH THE ECMWF IS SLOWER THAN THE GFS. WILL RAISE POPS TO 
A HIGH CHANCE FOR THIS EVENT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  46  70  45  48 /   0  10  20  80  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  47  70  43  47 /  10  10  20  80  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              63  39  68  46  49 /   0  10  10  80  80

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST TUE NOV 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...THE COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED 
CONVECTIVE SHOWERS WILL PUSH OUT OF THE AREA THIS EVENING FOR 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT.  THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO STALL TO 
OUR SOUTH AND EAST...THEN BEGIN TO LIFT BACK INTO THE AREA AS A WARM 
FRONT.  TIMING OF THIS REMAINS A QUESTION...BUT SHOULD SEE CLOUDS 
INCREASE AND POSSIBLY SOME INITIAL SHOWERS BY LATE IN THE DAY 
WEDNESDAY. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS COMING INTO 
BETTER AGREEMENT ON TIMING OF LONGWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT FOR LATE THANKSGIVING DAY INTO FRIDAY...WITH MY GRIDS DRAWN IN 
LINE WITH A GFS/ECMWF BLEND (NAM SLOWEST AND NOT PREFERRED). 
THUS...POPS WERE CUT BACK SHARPLY FOR THURSDAY WITH THURSDAY NIGHT'S 
LIKELY POPS CONTINUED. COLD AIR ARRIVES GENERALLY IN THE 12Z TO 16Z 
TIME PERIOD FRIDAY...AND THERE IS NO WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE...SO SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL BE LIMITED TO HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN. 
LIKELY TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW SHOWERS UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY FOR THE 
SMOKIES...BUT I DID NUDGE POPS UP TO LIKELY IN OUR FAR ERN COUNTIES 
ON FRIDAY DUE TO THE SLOWER TIMING. 

PREVIOUS TEMP GRIDS WITH SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS LOOKED VERY GOOD. OTHER
ITEM OF CONCERN WILL BE WINDS ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... 
GIVEN STRENGTH OF THE LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY JET. LET PRECIPITATION MIX 
WITH SNOW SHOWERS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...AS TEMPS FALL...BUT WON'T 
HIT SNOW AMOUNTS VERY HARD FOR NOW...SINCE THIS IS A 6TH PERIOD 
EVENT.

DRY WEATHER RETURNS FOR THE WEEKEND COURTESY OF RIDGING...THEN UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES EAST FROM THE PLAINS ON MONDAY...AND SOUTHERLY LOW 
LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS INTO TUESDAY. THIS WARRANTS SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
CHANCE POPS FOR LATE DAY 6 INTO DAY 7. OTHERWISE...12Z GFSX MOS 
TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE TO 00Z MOS AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

212 
FXUS64 KMRX 230830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST TUE NOV 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
EXTRAPOLATION BRINGS THE CONVECTIVE LINE MOVING INTO MIDDLE TN TO 
OUR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES AROUND 12Z...AND TO A TRI-TYS LINE 
AROUND 15Z. EXPECT THE LIGHTNING ACTIVITY TO DIMINSH AS IT 
APPROACHES...BUT WILL STILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
THROUGH THE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON AS MODELS DO SHOW SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY. BREEZY CONDITIONS CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED THIS MORNING 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...BUT WINDS SHOULD STAY BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA 
IN MOST SPOTS. THE CONVECTIVE LINE AND COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH 
QUICKLY...SO POPS WILL BE DECREASING BY THE AFTERNOON. THE FRONT 
STALLS JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA TONIGHT AS THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES 
NEARLY ZONAL. A DRIER/COOLER AIR MASS BEHIND THE FRONT WILL ALLOW 
TEMPS TO DROP INTO THE 30S TO LOWER 40S TONIGHT UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKIES. 

A BUILDING RIDGE ALONG THE EAST COAST AND LOW PRESSURE MOVING ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL PUSH THE FRONT BACK TO THE NORTH LATE 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS WARM FRONTAL PASSAGE MAY BRING A 
FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE CWA WILL BE SOLIDLY IN THE 
WARM SECTOR FOR THURSDAY...GIVING TEMPS IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70 SOUTH. 
WHILE THE GFS AND ECMWF INDICATE THAT THE BULK OF THE PRECIP WITH AN 
APPROACHING FRONT WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT...WILL HAVE 
JUST CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS 
PRE-FRONTAL SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE WARM SECTOR.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MORE INFLUENTIAL UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL DRIVE
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THERE WILL BE
A HIGH LIKELIHOOD OF SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT WITH POPS TAPERING A
BIT ON FRIDAY AS THE COLD FRONT PUSHES EAST OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. TIMING OF THE FROPA NOT CERTAIN AT
THIS TIME RANGE BUT WENT CLOSER TO THE SLOWER ECMWF DEPICTION. IT
WILL BE A RACE TO SEE IF THE COLDER AIR CAN BUILD INTO THE REGION
SOON ENOUGH PRIOR TO THE DEPARTURE OF THE MOIST AXIS FOR THE
POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS. THERE COULD BE
A FEW FLAKES IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN LATER IN THE AFTERNOON BEFORE
THE PRECIP SHUTS OFF WITH MUCH DRIER AIR FLOWING INTO THE REGION.
DRY NORTHWEST TRAJECTORY CONTINUES THROUGH SUNDAY ALLOWING FOR A
BETTER WEEKEND COMPLETE WITH SUNSHINE. TEMPERATURES OVER THE
WEEKEND WILL BE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL IN THIS REGIME. BY
MONDAY THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES SOUTHWESTERLY AGAIN AS ANOTHER
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER
LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS ISENTROPIC LIFTING
STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF YET ANOTHER MID WEEK FRONTAL SYSTEM.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...WILL SEE A PATTERN

TUESDAY.  EXPECTED A FEW RESIDUAL SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO THE

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TRICKY FORECAST FOR MID WEEK 
THROUGH FRIDAY GIVEN MODEL DIFFERENCES. I THINK THAT SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY AS WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH...BUT 
MAINLY TO OUR WEST AND ACROSS NRN MOST PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
DEEPER TROUGH AND STRONGER COLD FRONT HAVE BEEN SLOWED DOWN...WITH 
NAM THE SLOWEST. HPC PREFERS A NON-NAM SOLUTION...WHICH LENDS 
SUPPORT TO THE GFS AND/OR ECMWF...THUS POPS WERE ADJUSTED DOWN FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THANKSGIVING DAY. SHOWERS SHOULD SPREAD INTO 
WRN MOST AREAS BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON...AND I DID ALSO ADD A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF TSTMS. BLENDED INTO OHX AND JKL LIKELY POPS FOR THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON...THEN WENT LOWER END OF LIKELY (SHOWERS) FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT...PREFERRING NOT TO GO ANY HIGHER JUST YET FOR THAT FAR OUT. 

COLDER AIR ARRIVES FRIDAY MORNING...AND PRECIPITATION MAY LINGER 
LONG ENOUGH FOR A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON 
FRIDAY. FORECAST GRIDS REFLECT THIS...BUT TOO FAR OUT FOR MUCH 
DETAIL TO SHOW UP IN THE TEXT PRODUCTS AT THIS TIME. LATER SHIFTS 
CAN WATCH MODELS FOR CONTINUITY AND DETERMINE IF A GREATER CHANCE OF 
SNOW IS JUSTIFIED...AND HIGHLIGHT AS NEEDED. 

UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW 
RETURNING ON MONDAY...AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR NOW ON NEW 
DAY 7. SLIGHT TEMP ADJUSTMENTS MADE IN LINE WITH LATEST GFS/NAM/GFSX 
MOS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A WARM ADVECTION PATTERN WILL CONTINUE TODAY AND TONIGHT AS HIGH 
PRESSURE REMAINS ANCHORED OFF THE NC COAST. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT 
BEGINS TO TIGHTEN TODAY AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS AND 
MOVES TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. SCATTERED TO BROKEN CIRRUS NEAR THE 
UPPER JET WILL MEAN PARTLY SUNNY SKIES TODAY. LOOK FOR HIGH TEMPS 
LOOK TO CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL...REACHING THE UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. CLOUDS WILL BE 
INCREASING TONIGHT AS A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY 
REGION...SO LOWS WILL ONLY BE IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. BOTH THE 
NAM AND THE GFS INDICATE THAT PRECIP AHEAD OF THE FRONT SHOULD STAY 
WEST OF THE AREA UNTIL AFTER 12Z TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS AGREE ON BRINGING A 
COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EXIT 
THE CWA BY TUESDAY EVENING. WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS FOR 
TUESDAY AND CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES 
DURING THE EVENING HOURS. THE MODELS DIVERGENCE A BIT ON WEDNESDAY.  
THE GFS AND NAM KEEP THE THE FRONT FURTHER SOUTH WHILE THE ECMWF 
BRINGS PRECIPITATION BACK IN THE AREA. WILL GO WITH THE DRIER GFS 
AND NAM AND WENT WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. THE FRONT TRACKS 
NORTH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN. ANOTHER 
FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY. WILL 
CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH DAYS WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCE ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT WHEN THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT ARRIVES. WITH THE 
COLDER AIRMASS EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT...MAY SEE SNOW ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON THURSDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD WITH A COOL 
DOWN BY THE END OF THE WEEK...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

AREA OVERNIGHT AND MOST OF MONDAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM AND JETSTREAM. CLOUDS MAY BECOME BROKEN AT 5KFT
AFTER 00Z TONIGHT AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES. THE PRESSURE
GRADIENT WILL ALSO TIGHTEN TODAY...WITH A S-SW FLOW INCREASING TO
AROUND 10 KTS. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

889 
FXUS64 KMRX 212000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST SUN NOV 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC... 
WITH A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE MID WEST. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A MID LEVEL INVERSION LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT ANY 
VERTICAL MIXING OF THE MOISTURE TRAPPED BENEATH IT. THUS...WILL PLAN 
TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC THAN THE MODELS WITH CLOUD COVER THROUGH 
TUESDAY. MODELS AGREE THAT A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TUESDAY...BEFORE A COLD 
FRONT MOVES INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. GFS MODEL IS FASTER THAN THE 
NAM MODEL WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT...AND HAS 
IT ENTERING THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TUESDAY MORNING. THIS GFS 
MODEL SOLUTION APPEARS TO HAVE MORE SUPPORT FROM THE CANADIAN AND 
ECMWF MODELS...SO WILL FOLLOW ITS FASTER PROGRESSION. IF THE SLOWER 
NAM MODEL SOLUTION VERIFIES...IT APPEARS THAT TSTORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE LATER IN THE AFTERNOON DUE TO MORE LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE BEING 
ABLE TO MOVE NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT SHOULD 
BECOME STALLED-OUT AROUND THE MOUNTAINS BY TUESDAY NIGHT...AS THE 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM MOS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... 
AND WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS DUE TO THE 
HIGH DEWPOINTS ALREADY IN PLACE AND THE EXPECTED CONTINUATION OF THE 
WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN THROUGH TUESDAY. ON TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL 
PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY WITH THE 
FRONTAL LOCATION BY THEN.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN WEATHER MAKER OF THE 
EXTENDED CONTINUES TO BE A FRONT THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH AND CONTROL 
AREA WEATHER WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. CONTINUE TO SEE DIFFERENCES IN 
MODEL DETAIL...AND HAVE KEPT 20 TO 40 POPS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. 
MUCH COOLER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT AND ANY SHOWERS THAT 
LINGER INTO THURSDAY NIGHT COULD SWITCH TO SNOW OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. FOR FRIDAY AND THE WEEKEND...HIGH PRESSURE RULES FOR DRY 
AND COOL WEATHER CONDITIONS.
&&

415 AM EST SUN NOV 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

PRODUCING BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUD COVER ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA 
THIS MORNING. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW THAT THE INVERSION WILL REMAIN 
IN PLACE THROUGH THE DAY...SO EXPECT THAT THERE WILL NOT BE QUITE AS 
MUCH CLEARING AS MOS GUIDANCE SUGGESTS. STILL...WE WILL BE IN A WARM 
ADVECTION PATTERN WITH HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR EAST PRODUCING A SW FLOW 
IN THE LOW LEVELS. LEANED TOWARD THE COOLER GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES...THOUGH HIGHS WILL BE A BIT HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY 
EVERYWHERE...LOWER 60S NORTH TO UPPER 60S SOUTH. PATTERN WILL NOT 
CHANGE MUCH TONIGHT...SO THE TREND OF WARMER NIGHTTIME TEMPS WILL 
CONTINUE AS WELL...LOWS MAINLY IN THE 40S ARE EXPECTED TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCES 
POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHEN THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT 
ARRIVES. THE LATEST MODELS SLOW THE EXIT TIME OF THE FRONT INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT...SO WILL ADD LOW POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. WITH THE 
COLDER AIRMASS EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT...MAY SEE SNOW ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE 
FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD WITH A COOL DOWN BY THE END OF THE 
WEEK...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

WITH MINS EACH NIGHT. WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE SHIFTED 
TO THE EAST ON MONDAY BUT WILL PROVIDE ONE MORE DAY OF DRY 
CONDITIONS AND WARM DAYTIME HIGHS. THE WEATHER PATTERN MOVES INTO AN 
UNSETTLED PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. A COLD FRONT WILL 
AFFECT THE AREA TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW...ESPECIALLY IN REGARDS TO TIMING. MOST MODELS/ 
RUNS INDICATE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL MOVE 
IN ON WEDNESDAY. SO FOR NOW...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR TUESDAY... 
HIGHEST POPS ON WEDNESDAY WITH SOME LINGERING SHOWERS INTO THURSDAY. 
THE SYSTEM SHOULD EXIT THE AREA BY FRIDAY FOR A RETURN TO DRY 
CONDITIONS.

THE SECOND PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE 
SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE STILL LOOKS
TO BUILD FROM FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WHILE SURFACE RIDGE
MOVES ACROSS THE REGION THEN SLIPS JUST TO OUR SE. THUS...TIME
HEIGHTS SHOW A DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE WITH SEASONAL LOW TEMPS AND MAX
TEMPS SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR
THESE PERIODS WITH VERY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE SOME BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH ECMWF
GENERALLY MORE AMPLIFIED ALOFT...AND GFS A BIT WEAKER AND MORE
PROGRESSIVE. DESPITE THESE DIFFERENCES...TREND IS STILL FOR BETTER
CHANCE OF SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY...AND SAFE TO KEEP MONDAY INTO
TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW. ECWMF IS SUGGESTING DIMINISHING RAIN CHANCES
FOR THANKSGIVING DAY...WHILE GFS ADVERTISES LINGERING LIGHTER
SHOWERS FOR THE HOLIDAY. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY WITH THE OVERALL
PATTERN...I ONLY NUDGED RAIN CHANCES UP BY ABOUT 10 PERCENT ON
WEDNESDAY. WILL LET DAYSHIFT PONDER THIS AS THEY ADD GRIDS OUT TO
THANKSGIVING NIGHT...AFTER VIEWING ANOTHER MODEL RUN.

976 
FXUS64 KMRX 170800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST WED NOV 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION RESULTING IN TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. LATEST MODEL RUNS HAVE SLOWED DOWN 
PROGRESSION OF MINOR SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES LATE IN THE SHORT TERM. 
THIS COUPLED WITH DRY LAYERS PERSISTING IN THE LOWER LEVELS HAS 
PROMOTED REMOVAL OF POPS LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. FOR TEMPS... 
GUIDANCE VALUES ARE FAIRLY CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. GENERALLY 
DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SRN STREAM SHORTWAVE
TROUGH IS ADVERTISED AS WEAKER AND SLIGHTLY SLOWER TO ARRIVE ON
THURSDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY BY NAM AND GFS (ECMWF STILL FASTER
AND A BROADER AREA OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION). MODEL SOUNDINGS AND
PARTIAL THICKNESSES TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY MORNING
ANYWAY. THUS...GIVEN THESE TRENDS...I OPTED TO REMOVE POPS FROM ALL
BUT EXTREME WRN MOST COUNTIES AT DAYBREAK THURSDAY. KEPT LOW POPS
FOR RAIN SHOWERS AS BEFORE FROM 15Z THURSDAY ON...WITH SRN VALLEY
INTO SW NC COUNTIES DRY. 

OTHERWISE...A DRY EXTENDED EXCEPT FOR TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY (NEW
DAY 7)...AND I SAW NO REASON TO TINKER WITH POPS FOR TUESDAY OR
TUESDAY NIGHT THIS FAR OUT. TIMING NOW WOULD FAVOR A GOOD CHANCE OF
RAIN LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. 

SLIGHT MAX/MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS IN LINE WITH LATEST NAM/GFS/GFSX
MOS GUIDANCE...AND TO MESH WITH NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS. DEWPOINT TEMPS
AND WINDS FRESHENED WITH LATEST NAM12 AND MOS GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
626 PM EST TUE NOV 16 2010

.AVIATION...
A COLD FRONT IS PUSHING THROUGH THE AREA...WTIH SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND GUSTY SW WINDS AHEAD OF IT. SHOWERS ARE MOST LIKELY TO AFFECT
TYS AND TRI IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS...AND VIS/CIGS MAY LOWER TO MVFR
AT TIMES WITH THE SHOWERS. LOW CLOUDS WILL ADVECT INTO THE AREA
BEHIND THE FRONT...AND OBSERVED CIGS OVER MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL ARE
BETWEEN 1-2 KFT. EXPECT THESE CIGS TO PERSIST AT OUR TAF SITES FOR
MOST OF TONIGHT...UNTIL DRIER AIR ERODES THE CLOUDS AROUND SUNRISE.
WINDS WILL GRADUALLY DIMINNISH THIS EVENING WITH A SHIFT TO THE
WEST BEHIND THE FRONT.

012 
FXUS64 KMRX 162005
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST TUE NOV 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
OUT OF THE REGION EARLY TONIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR 
THE EVENING HOURS. IT WILL BE BREEZY EARLY TONIGHT AS THE LOW EXITS 
THE AREA...BUT NOT STRONG ENOUGH FOR AN ADVISORY. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY. LOWS TEMPERATURES FOR 
TONIGHT SHOULD BE NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH 
FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION.  WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY EXPECTED FOR 
WEDNESDAY GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOKED REASONABLE SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO 
FAR.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
OHIO AND NORTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THE MAIN SYNOPTIC FORCING WILL 
BE MAINLY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT DUE TO PROXIMITY 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WILL EXPERIENCE THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN. LOW 
PRESSURE AND ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE AREA 
THURSDAY MORNING WITH WEAK NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC LIFT FOR THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. CLOUDS WILL CLEAR THURSDAY NIGHT AND WITH 
SUNNY SKY FOR FRIDAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...MODELS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER RIDGING OVER THE REGION...AND HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE...SHOULD KEEP THINGS FAIRLY TRANQUIL THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  
ALTHOUGH SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS...LOOKS LIKE BY 
TUESDAY NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING...SO WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY.  

&&

274 
FXUS64 KMRX 161510
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST TUE NOV 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A LARGE AREA OF RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE LOW APPROACHING CWA. CURRENT POPS STILL ON TRACK. STILL A BREEZY 
DAY EXPECTED AS WELL. WILL TWEAK TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTH A 
BIT...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW NOW OVER SW MS THIS
MORNING IS PROGGED TO TRACK NE TODAY. AREAS OF LIGHT TO MODERATE
RAIN CONTINUE TO SPREAD NE INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS.
WILL CONTINUE WITH NEAR 100 PERCENT POPS FOR TODAY...WITH A FEW
TWEAKS OF RAINFALL/QPF AMOUNTS...TAKING 06Z TO 12Z AMOUNTS DOWN A
BIT. HEAVIER AMOUNTS WILL FALL DURING THE 12Z TO 18Z PERIOD TODAY
WITH APPROACH OF THE SURFACE LOW...THEN TAPER OFF AND SPREAD MORE
OVER NRN 1/2 OF THE FORECAST AREA. SOME WRAP-AROUND LIGHT AMOUNTS
LATER TONIGHT AS UPPER LOW LIFTS NE OF THE REGION. GRIDS WERE
GENERALLY ON TRACK WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANGES.

SOME CONCERN THAT WIND SPEEDS AND/OR GUSTS MAY REACH ADVISORY
CRITERIA AS THE GRADIENT TIGHTENS AND SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET
INCREASES THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...CLOUD COVER...PRECIPITATION AND
LACK OF INSTABILITY SHOULD KEEP WIND SPEEDS BELOW NAM12 VALUES.
WIND SPEEDS AND GUSTS WERE TRIMMED BACK SOME...MORE OF A BLEND
BETWEEN NAM12 AND GFS. WILL LET DAY SHIFT WATCH THIS UNFOLD AND
INCREASE SPEEDS IF NEEDED.

OTHERWISE...KEPT MAX TEMPS A BIT BELOW SIMILAR MOS HIGHS...AND
FAVORED A BLEND OF MOS FOR MINS DUE TO SOME WIND TONIGHT. 

 
.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...OTHER THAN SYSTEM ON 
THURSDAY...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT DRY AND 
TRANQUIL CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE LONG TERM AS 
LOW-AMPLITUDE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION. THROUGH THAT APPROACHES 
LATE WEDNESDAY CONTINUES TO APPEARS RATHER INSIGNIFICANT AT THIS 
TIME. CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY TIME FRAME. TEMPS WILL MODERATE TO 
ABOVE CLIMO AGAIN BY THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG TERM AS WEAK 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN. GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  40  56  37  56 / 100  30  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  39  57  38  56 / 100  30  10  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
640 AM EST TUE NOV 16 2010

.AVIATION...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE HAS MOVED NE TO NEAR TUPELO MS...

AND ALSO JUST RECENTLY AT TYS. RAIN AND LOW CLOUDS STILL TO AFFECT 
CHA FOR NEXT SEVERAL HOURS...AND I ALSO EXPECT CLOUDS AND VISBY TO 
LOWER AGAIN AT TYS AND TRI LATER THIS MORNING. 

OTHER CONCERN FOR AVIATION WILL BE SHIFTING SURFACE WINDS AS LOW 
TRACKS NE ACROSS MIDDLE TN. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT TO SW AND 
WEST LATER TODAY...WITH SOME GUSTINESS POSSIBLE AS WELL.

WENT OPTIMISTIC WITH CEILING/VISBY FOR SOME IMPROVEMENT AFTER 02Z 
WEDNESDAY...AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LIFTS NE OF THE REGION AFTER

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING

NUMBERS. BUT WITH THE CLOUDS AND RAIN EXPECTED ON TUESDAY... 
UNDERCUT MAV GUIDANCE AND STAYED MORE TOWARD THE BLEND FOR 
TEMPERATURES FOR TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...RAIN WILL EXIT THE 
REGION TUESDAY NIGHT AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY.  HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BRIEFLY ALONG WITH DRIER AIR FOR 
WEDNESDAY...BUT A WEAK AND FAST MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
SWING BY JUST TO OUR NORTH BRINGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA 
FRIDAY.  MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT SHOULD SEE 
SOME LIGHT PRECIP AROUND MAINLY NORTH AND CENTRAL.  SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE AND LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD IN AND SHOULD 
CONTROL OUR WEATHER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. 
MODELS/ENSEMBLES IN BETTER THAN AVERAGE AGREEMENT WITH THIS 
SCENARIO...SO THIS IS AN ABOVE AVERAGE CONFIDENCE FORECAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 151505
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST MON NOV 15 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING LARGE AREA OF RAIN MOVING UP FROM  
THE SOUTH WHICH SHOULD EVENTUALLY SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA BEGINNING 
IN THE SOUTH. WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS WITH HIGHEST CHANCES IN 
THE SOUTH. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDS AND AREAS OF FOG LINGER 
ACROSS BULK OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...AS WEAK COLD FRONT 
HAS SLIPPED JUST EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. FRONTAL BOUNDARY LYING 
ROUGHLY FROM NEAR ATLANTA TO GSP TO ROANOKE AT 08Z...WITH ALREADY 
SOME RAIN DEVELOPING FROM EAST CENTRAL AL TO WEST CENTRAL GA...AND 
MOVING NE TOWARD THE CAROLINAS. CLOUDS SEEM TO BE KEEPING FOG FROM 
BECOMING VERY DENSE...SO WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVER WRN GULF 
COAST STATES LATER TODAY...WHICH WILL LIFT THE BOUNDARY NORTH AS A 
WARM FRONT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SHOULD SEE A LARGE AREA OF 
LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER TAKE ALL BUT SW VA BY 22Z TODAY...WITH 
THIS RAIN SPREADING NORTH OVERNIGHT. SEEMED PRUDENT TO NUDGE POPS UP 
TO NEAR CATEGORICAL LATE TODAY MOST AREAS...AND 90 PERCENT OR SO 
TONIGHT. VERY DRY MONTH SO FAR...SO WON'T PANIC AND WORRY ABOUT ANY 
FLOODING POTENTIAL JUST YET.

WENT VERY NEAR THE SLIGHTLY COOLER GFS MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY...AND 
CLOSER TO THE MILDER GFS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA 
ALONG STATIONARY FRONT OVER N MS AND AL TUESDAY MORNING EXPECTED TO 
MOVE NE INTO MIDDLE TN AND NORTH TO THE OH VALLEY BY TUESDAY EVENING 
PRODUCING MORE RAIN AND ENDING LATE TUESDAY TONIGHT. ANOTHER ONE 
HALF TO ONE INCH OF RAIN POSSIBLE TUE DAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGHER 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN WEDNESDAY BUT ANOTHER FAST MOVING SYSTEM 
MOVING INTO THE CENTRAL STATES WILL DEEPEN TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN 
STATES AND ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY RIDGING 
ALOFT WILL ALLOW HIGH PRESSURE TO TAKE CONTROL AND MAKE FOR A NICE 
WEEKEND WITH HIGHS WARMING FROM MOSTLY THE 50S FRIDAY TO THE 60S ON 
THE WEEKEND.  

&&

AFTERNOON. PERIODS OF MODERATE OR HEAVIER RAIN AND DEEP MOISTURE 
WILL LEAD TO BELOW IFR CONDITIONS BY THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.

ROUGHLY FROM NEAR ATLANTA TO GSP TO ROANOKE AT 08Z...WITH ALREADY 
SOME RAIN DEVELOPING FROM EAST CENTRAL AL TO WEST CENTRAL GA...AND 
MOVING NE TOWARD THE CAROLINAS. CLOUDS SEEM TO BE KEEPING FOG FROM 
BECOMING VERY DENSE...SO WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVER WRN GULF 
COAST STATES LATER TODAY...WHICH WILL LIFT THE BOUNDARY NORTH AS A 
WARM FRONT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SHOULD SEE A LARGE AREA OF 
LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER TAKE ALL BUT SW VA BY 22Z TODAY...WITH 
THIS RAIN SPREADING NORTH OVERNIGHT. SEEMED PRUDENT TO NUDGE POPS UP 
TO NEAR CATEGORICAL LATE TODAY MOST AREAS...AND 90 PERCENT OR SO 
TONIGHT. VERY DRY MONTH SO FAR...SO WON'T PANIC AND WORRY ABOUT ANY 
FLOODING POTENTIAL JUST YET.

WENT VERY NEAR THE SLIGHTLY COOLER GFS MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY...AND 
CLOSER TO THE MILDER GFS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA 
ALONG STATIONARY FRONT OVER N MS AND AL TUESDAY MORNING EXPECTED TO 
MOVE NE INTO MIDDLE TN AND NORTH TO THE OH VALLEY BY TUESDAY EVENING 
PRODUCING MORE RAIN AND ENDING LATE TUESDAY TONIGHT. ANOTHER ONE 
HALF TO ONE INCH OF RAIN POSSIBLE TUE DAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGHER 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN WEDNESDAY BUT ANOTHER FAST MOVING SYSTEM 
MOVING INTO THE CENTRAL STATES WILL DEEPEN TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN 
STATES AND ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY RIDGING 
ALOFT WILL ALLOW HIGH PRESSURE TO TAKE CONTROL AND MAKE FOR A NICE 
WEEKEND WITH HIGHS WARMING FROM MOSTLY THE 50S FRIDAY TO THE 60S ON 
THE WEEKEND.

CLEAR...WINDS LIGHT AND NEAR NORMAL OVERNIGHT LOWS.  ALL ON TRACK IN 
THE CURRENT FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

BY END OF PERIOD. COLD FRONT MOVES SLOWLY EAST INTO E TN BY SUN.
GOOD OMEGA AND Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE INDICATED EARLY ON SUNDAY. 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED TO LOWER LEVELS AND PWS PEAK NEAR .70 SO 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT WITH THIS SYSTEM.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A BOUNDARY LINGERS ACROSS 
THE REGION ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY...SO KEEPING CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE ARRIVES. DRY WEATHER RETURNS 
ON WEDNESDAY. UPPER LOW TRACKS TO THE NORTH ON THURSDAY. THE BEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH SO WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW. HIGH 
PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES ARE 
NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

126 
FXUS64 KMRX 121544
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EST FRI NOV 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. LOOKING HARD FOR 
WEATHER STORY UNDER LAYER RIDGING. MORNING INVERSION AROUND 2500 
FEET RESULTED IN RELATIVELY WARM MIN TEMPS ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS
OF SW VA AND E TN. MOST MINS ABOVE THE THERMAL LAYER STAYED IN THE 
40S THIS MORNING. TEMPS HAVE JUMPED NEARLY 20 DEGREES IN TWO HOURS 
ACROSS SW NC IN DRY AIRMASS. WARM AFTERNOON ON TRACK. SON  

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGING HOLDING FROM CENTRAL GULF 
COAST NORTH INTO TN VALLEY...THEN NE THRU THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
AND NE STATES. CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS HAVE ALLOWED TEMPS TO 
FALL BELOW MOS AND PREVIOUS GRIDS THIS MORNING...IN THIS DRY AIR MASS.
MY WARMER THAN MOS HIGHS DO STAY BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR THIS DATE.

SEE NO REASON WHY MAX TEMPS WON'T TOP OUT AROUND THURSDAY'S HIGHS
GIVEN THE PLENTIFUL SUNSHINE AND DRY AIR. THUS...WENT ABOUT 1 TO 2 
DEGREES ABOVE THE WARMER MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY. SURFACE WINDS STAY 
LIGHT AND VARIABLE TONIGHT WITH NO CLOUDS AT ANY LEVEL...SO FAVORED 
LOWER MINS WITH ABOUT A 35 DEGREE OR SO DIURNAL RANGE FROM MAX TO 
MIN TEMPS AGAIN.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN 
CONTROL SATURDAY AS WEAKENING FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO MS VALLEY. 
AS MAIN LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES TRAILING FRONT 
WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE 
SLOWLY ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY WITH LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING NEAR NEW 
ORLEANS AND MOVE UP ALONG THE FRONT MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. BEST RAIN 
CHANCES WILL BE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE 
TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY AS BROAD UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE NORTH 
CENTRAL STATES. A SECONDARY FRONT MAY PASS THROUGH THURSDAY BUT FOR 
NOW WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY. WARM TEMPERATURES CONTINUE SATURDAY AND 
DRY AIR WILL ALLOW STRONG COOLING SATURDAY NIGHT CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN 
LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN SUNDAY. COOLER 
TEMPERATURES STILL MONDAY AND TUESDAY BUT NEAR NORMAL FOR THIS TIME 
OF YEAR.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             75  42  73  42  65 /   0   0  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  73  40  71  38  65 /   0   0  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       74  41  71  41  64 /   0   0  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              70  33  70  35  66 /   0   0   0  10  20

MUCH PRECIP WITH THE WEAK COLD FRONT THAT IS FORECAST TO PUSH INTO 
THE AREA BY SUNDAY...AS MODELS CONTINUE TO BE SLOWER AND LESS 
BULLISH WITH THIS SYSTEM.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
IN FOR SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT.  FAIRLY CONFIDENT THAT SOUTHERN STREAM 
SYSTEM WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT RAIN TO THE AREA EARLY IN THE 
WEEK...BUT QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY ABOUT TIMING GIVEN MODEL 
DISAGREEMENT.  FOR NOW WILL USE MORE OF A GFS/ECMWF BLEND FOR 
TIMING.  WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE WED.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO 
WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 AM EST WED NOV 10 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN 
CONTROL FOR ANOTHER WARM AND SUNNY DAY TODAY AND...A CLEAR AND COOL 
NIGHT.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL HOLD OVER 
THE REGION THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...KEEPING TRANQUIL AND UNSEASONABLY 
WARM CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA.  UNCERTAINTY HIGHER FOR THE 
WEEKEND.  A WEAK COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH IN DURING THE 
WEEKEND.  THIS MAY BRING SOME SHOWERS TO THE AREA AS EARLY AS 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON WESTERN ZONES...AND ELSEWHERE SATURDAY NIGHT.  
HOW FAR AND HOW FAST THIS FRONT MOVES IS UNCERTAIN AS MODELS DO NOT 
AGREE.  STILL MAY BE SOME SHOWERS AROUND SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT IF 
SLOWER ECMWF IS MORE CORRECT...AND GIVEN UNCERTAINTY WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BOTH PERIODS.  HIGHER CONFIDENCE THAT MORE 
SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM WILL BRING RAIN TO THE AREA EARLY IN THE 
WEEK...ALTHOUGH EXACT TIMING STILL UNCERTAIN...SO WILL CARRY CHANCE 
POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  WILL TWEAK SOME GFS MOS TEMPS UP A BIT 
MAINLY THE FIRST SEVERAL PERIODS...BUT WILL NOT STRAY FAR OVERALL.


&&

460 
FXUS64 KMRX 091932
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST TUE NOV 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE REMAINS 
STRONG TODAY AND WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY. CURRENT 
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S WITH LIGHT WINDS AND 
LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES. DRY AIRMASS WILL KEEP MOST AREAS CLEAR WITH 
PATCHY FOG NEAR RIVERS AND LAKES ALTHOUGH NOT SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH TO 
PUT INTO FORECAST. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER. 
PREFER COOLER MAV GUIDANCE WITH LOWS ONLY NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW 
FREEZING IN COLDER VALLEYS OF SW NC AND NE TN. ELSEWHERE LOWS MID 
30S TO MID 40S. ONLY PATCHY FROST AS WELL SIMILAR TO THIS MORNING. 
HIGHS WEDNESDAY WITH FULL SUNSHINE SIMILAR TO TODAY IN THE UPPER 60S 
TO MID 70S WHICH COINCIDES WITH A MAV/MET BLEND.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH MAINTAINING AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...RESULTING IN TRANQUIL AND UNSEASONABLY 
WARM CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT...AND THEN 
BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND THE MOUNTAINS ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS 
THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. IT 
APPEARS THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AND UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS WILL 
BE WEAK WITH THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY UNTIL MONDAY...SO WILL MENTION 
ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT. ON MONDAY...BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL A 
STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFYING OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS... 
RESULTING IN STRONG CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THIS PATTERN SHOULD RESULT IN A GOOD 
COVERAGE OF RAIN FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO WILL RAISE POPS SOME FOR 
THE MONDAY AND TUESDAY TIME FRAME. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE 
TO THE GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   39  75  39  73  41 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     36  71  37  71  39 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             35  72  38  71  40 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    30  69  33  69  35 /   0   0   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 AM EST TUE NOV 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND UPPER 
RIDGE WILL DOMINATE OUR WEATHER THROUGH THE PERIOD.  THE ATMOSPHERE 
WILL REMAIN QUITE DRY...SO SHOULD BE CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR 
THROUGHOUT PERIOD.  MAV TEMPS HAVE BEEN PRETTY GOOD SO FAR IN THIS 
REGIME...AND CONTINUE TO LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THOUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
MUCH OF THE EXTENDED...AS STRONG HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THROUGH THE 
FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD.  THIS WILL RESULT IN CONTINUED CLEAR 
SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND SEASONALLY WARM DAYTIME TEMPERATURES.  A 
WEAK FRONT SLIDES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY.  WITH 
LITTLE MOISTURE OR ENERGY ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT...HAVE KEPT POPS 
LOW...GENERALLY IN THE 20S TO NEAR 30. CONFIDENCE DIMINISHES BY HE 
END OF THE EXTENDED...ESPECIALLY IN REGARDS WITH THE TRACK OF AN 
APPROACHING LOW.  THEREFORE...LEFT POPS AS THEY WERE...LOW CHANCE.

726 
FXUS64 KMRX 090224
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
924 PM EST MON NOV 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE 
PROVIDING A CLEAR SKY AND DRY WEATHER TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE  
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND 
ALOFT HAS TAKEN CONTROL OF PATTERN OVER THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. WARMING ALOFT HAS BROUGHT TEMPERATURES UP TO THE UPPER 
50S AND 60S. DRY AIR MASS HAS DROPPED RH VALUES TO THE TEENS AND 20S 
AT MOST LOCATIONS. WINDS HAVE BEEN GENERALLY LIGHT BUT 10 TO 15 MPH 
IN THE NE AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT TONIGHT IN 
PROTECTED VALLEYS NE SECTIONS AND SW NC WITH LOWS IN THE MID AND 
UPPER 20S BUT 10 TO 15 DEGREES WARMER HIGHER ELEVATION RIDGE TOPS 
WITH SW FLOW ALOFT. TUESDAY ANOTHER WARM DAY WITH TEMPERATURES MID 
60S TO MID 70S WELL BELOW RECORDS BUT 5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. 
WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL AGAIN BE 
MOSTLY FROM ABOUT 15 TO 25 PERCENT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY THROUGHOUT THE WEEK...RESULTING IN TRANQUIL AND 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
SATURDAY. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT...AND THEN BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY 
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS ON SUNDAY AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES 
PARALLEL TO THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ALONG WITH WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS UNTIL MONDAY...SO WILL MENTION 
LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT. BY MONDAY...A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY 
OVER THE PLAINS...RESULTING IN STRONG CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH 
THE EXACT TRACK OF THIS SURFACE LOW ON MONDAY (AND THE RESULTING 
AMOUNT OF PRECIP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY). FOR NOW...WILL MENTION 
CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...WHICH IS A SIMILAR IDEA TO 
THE MORE NORTHERLY TRACK OF THE LATEST ECMWF MODEL RUN. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH ARE CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   37  72  38  75  39 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     34  68  36  72  37 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             34  69  36  72  37 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    28  65  30  69  31 /   0   0   0   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 AM EST MON NOV 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO SLOWLY BUILD IN.  
THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN QUITE DRY...SO SHOULD BE CLEAR TO MOSTLY 
CLEAR THROUGHOUT PERIOD.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO 
WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE LATER 
PERIODS OF THE FORECAST WITH THE GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS STILL A 
LITTLE QUICKER THAN THE ECMWF TO BRING WEAK SHORT WAVE NORTHEAST 
INTO THE GREAT LAKES SATURDAY/SUNDAY WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
BUILDING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON SUNDAY. KEPT MOST 
OF THE FORECAST PERIOD UNCHANGED WITH NEAR ZERO PROBABILITY OF 
PRECIP IN MAJOR AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WHICH KEEPS RIDGING 
GOING ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. WITH SFC-85H RIDGE BASICALLY SHUTTING 
DOWN ANY SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE RETURN OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO UNTIL 
SATURDAY/SUNDAY. BACKED POPS UP TO SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY AND 
USED A SLIGHT CHANCE AS UNCERTAINTY EXISTS WITH APPARENT 
CONTINUATION OF SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AS UPPER LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS 
ON THE BACK SIDE OF SOUTHWESTERN STATES TROF. STAYED RELATIVELY 
CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

SUNNY TOMORROW. WINDS WILL BE LIGHT BUT WILL TAKE ON A MORE WESTERLY 
COMPONENT AS THE SURFACE HIGH DRIFTS EAST AND ANTI-CYCLONIC FLOW 
RE-ASSERTS ITSELF IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER. TWEAKED MINS TONIGHT MORE 
IN LINE WITH THE MET GUIDANCE. OTHERWISE NO REAL CHANGES FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE WITH 
CURRENT FORECAST THIS WEEK AS UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG AND 
TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. TROUGH OVER THE WEST 
MOVES SLOWLY EAST DURING THE WEEK. GFS SHOWS WEAK FRONT ACROSS THE 
PLAINS WEDNESDAY THAT MOVES INTO THE WESTERN LAKES AND UPPER MS 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. RIDGE HOLDS OVER THE SOUTHEAST. 
THEN NEW SYSTEM DIGS INTO THE 4 CORNERS THURSDAY AND DEVELOPS COLD 
FRONT OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS FRIDAY. THIS SYSTEM DOES NOT REACH 
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY UNTIL LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. KEPT SLIGHT 
CHANCE EARLY SATURDAY BUT THINK MAIN RAIN CHANCES WILL BE SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. FOLLOWED LOWER MAV GUIDANCE AT TRI MONDAY NIGHT 
BUT FOLLOWED BLEND ELSEWHERE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT 
MET GUIDANCE ON THE WARM SIDE SO KEPT LOWS COOLER. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES FOR THE MOST PART WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AHEAD OF 
FRONT WITH LIMITED CLOUDS. COOLER TEMPERATURES ON THE WEEKEND WITH 
CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             33  66  37  71  40 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  31  64  35  69  38 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       30  64  36  69  39 /   0   0   0   0   0

AXIS BUILDS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. INCREASING MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF PLAINS STATES UPPER TROF WILL SLOW DOWN THE WARM UP BY 
FRIDAY. TWEAKED POPS BACK A BIT FOR FRIDAY TO BETTER MATCH SLOWER 
MODEL TRENDS. PLACED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT WHILE EXTENDING 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FOR SATURDAY AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT 
ADVANCES TOWARD THE REGION.

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE 
EAST AND HIGH PRESSURE STRENGTHENS OVER THE EASTERN US...CENTERED ON 
AREA. PATCHY LOW TO MID CLOUDS WILL GIVE WAY OVERNIGHT AND CLEAR 
SKIES SET IN BY MORNING. PROCESS WILL BE SLOWER IN THE NORTHEAST. 
WITH MORE CLOUDS THAN ORIGINALLY THOUGHT, HAVE INCREASED MINS A 
DEGREE OR TWO ALL LOCATIONS...HENCE THE SMALL GRADIENT BETWEEN THE 
FAR NORTHEAST AND FAR SOUTHWEST. KEPT VERY SMALL POPS...10 
PERCENT...FOR FAR NORTHEASTERN HIGHER TERRAIN TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STRONG RIDGING TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
OVER THE EASTERN STATES MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
WITH OHIO RIVER SYSTEM MOVES NE OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. GFS TRIES TO BRING THE SYSTEM THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA FRIDAY WITH ECMWF ABOUT 24 HOURS SLOWER. CURRENT FORECAST 
BRINGS SHOWERS IN FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH 
SATURDAY. WILL KEEP ABOUT THE SAME TREND FOR NOW. WARMING 
TEMPERATURES MONDAY TO ABOVE NORMAL AND CONTINUE THROUGH AT LEAST 
FRIDAY OF THE EXTENDED AFTER ANOTHER COLD NIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT. 
SATURDAY TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES COOLER WITH CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS FROM NEXT SYSTEM.

AROUND EASTERN MOUNTAIN AND FAR NORTH ZONES EARLY...BUT THESE SHOULD 
DECREASE AND THEN END THIS AFTERNOON.  EXPECT A MAINLY CLEAR AND 
COLD NIGHT TONIGHT.  WILL LET ADVISORY END AS MOST OF THE ACCUMULATING 
SNOWS WILL HAVE ENDED BY 5 AM.  JUST A FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AMPLIFIED WEATHER PATTERN TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE LONG TERM FORECAST PERIOD AS NICE UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN STATES. AT LEAST THREE SHORTER WAVELENGTH 
SYSTEMS WILL RIDE RAPIDLY NORTHEAST THROUGH THE MEAN WESTERN U.S. 
UPPER TROF WELL NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. USED A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE MUCH FASTER GFS AND SLOWER ECMWF WITH 
PROGRESSION OF THE MEAN UPPER TROF TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. A MOST 
PLEASANT LATE FALL WEATHER FORECAST IS IN STORE IN THIS AMPLIFIED 
REGIME. LOTS OF SUNSHINE...SUBSIDENCE AND WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL 
LEAD TO A WARMING TREND WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND 
SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. BACKED OFF ON TIMING OF POPS ON FRIDAY 
WITH FRONTAL PRECIP ARRIVING MAINLY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY 
MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 PM EDT FRI NOV 5 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A FEW ISOLATED ECHOES WITH THE UPPER 
TROUGH PASSING TONIGHT. WILL LEAVE CURRENT ADVISORY AS IS. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC LIFT...
FAIRLY DEEP MOISTURE UP TO 700MB...AND LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY 
PRODUCING SCATTERED-BROKEN SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING.
REPORTS FROM THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS PARK SHOWS 6 INCHES OF 
SNOWFALL AT MOUNT LECONTE THIS AFTERNOON WITH CONTINUED HEAVY SNOWS. 
CURRENT WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR 3 TO 6 INCHES WITH HEAVIER 
AMOUNTS ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS LOOKS GOOD.

DUE TO LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL WEAKEN THIS 
EVENING AS WELL AS SNOWFALL. WILL ALLOW ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 5 AM.

NAM AND GFS CONTINUED TO SHOW PLENTY OF WRAP-AROUND CU AND STRATO-CU 
FOR AREAS ALONG AND NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40 THROUGH MOST OF SATURDAY 
WITH CLOUDS DECREASING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA TOMORROW. WILL FOLLOW GFS MOS TEMPERATURES CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH 
SLIDES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE 
STRENGTHENS. WITH SKIES EITHER CLEAR OR BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR AND 
WINDS BECOMING LIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD. SHOULD BE THE 
COLDEST NIGHT OF THE FALL WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND TEENS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. SUNDAY RIDGING ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS EDGES EAST 
TO START A WARMING TREND. HIGHS SUNDAY SHOULD BE ALMOST 10 YEARS 
WARMER THAN SATURDAY IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60. MONDAY UPPER RIDGE 
SHIFTS A LITTLE FARTHER EAST TO THE MS VALLEY AND TEMPERATURES WARM 
ANOTHER 10 DEGREES. FOR THE TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY PERIOD RIDGE 
PARKS OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
ABOVE NORMAL DURING THE DAY WITH HIGHS 60S TO LOWER 70S AND NEAR 
NORMAL AT NIGHT WITH LOWS MID 30S TO MID 40S. NEXT TROUGH DEVELOPS 
ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES EARLY NEXT WEEK AND A COLD FRONT SLOWLY 
MOVES EAST INTO THE MS VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY. RIDGE STAYS STRONG ALONG 
THE EAST COAST WITH MOISTURE FROM THIS SYSTEM TRACKING INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY THURSDAY AND WEAKENING. NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS THURSDAY LOOKS A LITTLE STRONGER AND FARTHER SOUTH 
THAN THE FIRST. WILL GO WITH SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION KEEPING POPS OUT 
OF FRIDAY ALTHOUGH CLOUDS MAY INCREASE ACROSS REGION.     

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT FRI NOV 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC LIFT...
FAIRLY DEEP MOISTURE UP TO 700MB...AND LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY 
PRODUCING SCATTERED-BROKEN SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING.
REPORTS FROM THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS PARK SHOWS 6 INCHES OF 
SNOWFALL AT MOUNT LECONTE THIS AFTERNOON WITH CONTINUED HEAVY SNOWS. 
CURRENT WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR 3 TO 6 INCHES WITH HEAVIER 
AMOUNTS ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS LOOKS GOOD.

DUE TO LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL WEAKEN THIS 
EVENING AS WELL AS SNOWFALL. WILL ALLOW ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 5 AM.

NAM AND GFS CONTINUED TO SHOW PLENTY OF WRAP-ARND CU AND STRATO-CU 
FOR AREAS ALONG AND NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40 THROUGH MOST OF SATURDAY 
WITH CLOUDS DECREASING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA TOMORROW. WILL FOLLOW GFS MOS TEMPERATURES CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH 
SLIDES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE 
STRENGTHENS. WITH SKIES EITHER CLEAR OR BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR AND 
WINDS BECOMING LIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD. SHOULD BE THE 
COLDEST NIGHT OF THE FALL WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND TEENS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. SUNDAY RIDGING ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS EDGES EAST 
TO START A WARMING TREND. HIGHS SUNDAY SHOULD BE ALMOST 10 YEARS 
WARMER THAN SATURDAY IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60. MONDAY UPPER RIDGE 
SHIFTS A LITTLE FARTHER EAST TO THE MS VALLEY AND TEMPERATURES WARM 
ANOTHER 10 DEGREES. FOR THE TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY PERIOD RIDGE 
PARKS OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
ABOVE NORMAL DURING THE DAY WITH HIGHS 60S TO LOWER 70S AND NEAR 
NORMAL AT NIGHT WITH LOWS MID 30S TO MID 40S. NEXT TROUGH DEVELOPS 
ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES EARLY NEXT WEEK AND A COLD FRONT SLOWLY 
MOVES EAST INTO THE MS VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY. RIDGE STAYS STRONG ALONG 
THE EAST COAST WITH MOISTURE FROM THIS SYSTEM TRACKING INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY THURSDAY AND WEAKENING. NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS THURSDAY LOOKS A LITTLE STRONGER AND FARTHER SOUTH 
THAN THE FIRST. WILL GO WITH SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION KEEPING POPS OUT 
OF FRIDAY ALTHOUGH CLOUDS MAY INCREASE ACROSS REGION.

ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS.

WITH STRONG COLD ADVECTION CONTINUING THIS AFTERNOON...TEMPS SHOULD
BE NEARLY STEADY AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
359 AM EDT FRI NOV 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE AREA 
WILL SHIFT SLOWLY EAST...AND COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH IN.  
LAPSE RATES WILL BE RATHER STEEP WITH THE VERY COLD AIR IN 
MIDLEVELS...AND WITH FAIRLY DEEP MOISTURE AND NORTHWEST LOW LEVEL 
FLOW SHOULD SEE SHOWERS AROUND TODAY...WITH SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. PRECIPITATION WILL BE DIMINISHING TONIGHT AND 
WILL TREND MORE SNOW OVERNIGHT AS TEMPS FALL. STILL LOOKS LIKE SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS OF 3 TO 6 INCHES DURING 24 HOURS POSSIBLE AT 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET...SO WILL KEEP SNOW ADVISORY AS IS FOR 
NOW.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROF SLOWLY 
LIFTS OUT ON SATURDAY. STILL A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE IN PLACE 
DURING THE MORNING FOR UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
WITH 85H TEMPS AROUND -6 TO -8 DEGREES C. FOR SATURDAY MORNING 
STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND MUCH OF THE HIGH TERRAIN BORDERING NORTH 
CAROLINA. ELEVATIONS ABOVE THREE THOUSAND FEET MAY PICK UP AN 
ADDITIONAL HALF TO ONE INCH OF SNOW ON SATURDAY. IN THE HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED PATTERN UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD SIGNIFICANTLY SUNDAY THROUGH 
MID WEEK WITH A MOST PLEASANT RIDGE AXIS BUILDING ACROSS THE 
APPALACHIANS MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS ONLY SLOWLY 
EAST WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS A SHORT WAVE TROF MOVES RAPIDLY 
NORTHEAST FROM THE INTERMOUNTAIN WEST ACROSS THE PLAINS IN TRANSIT 
TO THE GREAT LAKES. THUS...THE FORECAST AREA MAY BE ABLE TO HANG 
ONTO A FANTASTIC REBOUND IN WEATHER CONDITIONS WITH PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE ALONG WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING BACK CLOSE TO NORMAL BY 
MONDAY. THE WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MID WEEK WITH HIGHS 
IN THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 60S EVERYWHERE BUT THE MOUNTAINS.

FXUS64 KMRX 050233
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EDT THU NOV 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. AREAL COVERAGE OF PRECIPITATION
WILL INCREASE AS THE NIGHT WEARS ON AND LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE 
NORTHWESTERLY. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)... A SURGE OF VERY COLD 
MID LEVEL AIR (-30C AT 500 MB) WILL BE PUSHING ACROSS OUR AREA THIS 
EVENING...CREATING STEEP LAPSE RATES. WITH A NORTHWEST 850 MB FLOW 
AROUND 20 KTS...CONDITIONS WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR SNOW SHOWERS 
TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
NORTHWEST-FACING SLOPES OF EAST TN AND SW VA. MOISTURE FOR SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL BE SUPPLIED FROM A NORTHERLY FETCH OFF THE GREAT LAKES 
FOR A DURATION OF ABOUT 24 HOURS...BEGINNING LATE TONIGHT AND 
CONTINUING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. 24-HOUR ACCUMULATIONS OF 3-6 
INCHES ARE EXPECTED IN THE MOUNTAINS ABOVE 3000 FT. HIGH KNOB IN 
WISE COUNTY COULD SEE 2-5 INCHES. A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE 
ISSUED FOR THESE AREAS. THE NORTHERN TN VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU COULD SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS...BUT WITH TEMPS STAYING ABOVE 
FREEZING...NO ACCUMULATION ABOVE 1 INCH IS EXPECTED. DECREASING 
MOISTURE AND WARMING MID LEVEL TEMPS SHOULD LEAD TO MOST PRECIP 
TAPERING OFF LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS AIR MASS IS VERY COLD...WITH 
HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW ONLY IN THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS...AND LOWS FRIDAY 
NIGHT IN THE 20S TO LOWER 30S.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NW FLOW PATTERN CONTINUES 
INTO SATURDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING SOUTHEAST TWO THIRDS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. ACROSS THE SW VA AND NE TN AREAS STILL A CHANCE OF 
SNOW SHOWERS...POSSIBLY CHANGING TO RAIN SHOWERS BEFORE ENDING BY 
AROUND 18Z. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COLD IN THE 30S MOUNTAINS AND 
40S TO NEAR 50 VALLEYS. BIG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OVER THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY SUNDAY. FULL 
RADIATIONAL COOLING SATURDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS MAINLY 20S AND A FEW 
TEENS HIGHER MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS. NICE WARM UP SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
REACHING THE 50S SUNDAY AND 60S MONDAY. LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT AGAIN NEAR 
OR JUST BELOW FREEZING. FOR THE PERIOD TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY HIGH 
PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST AND FORECAST AREA WILL STAY WARM. NEW TROUGH 
DEVELOPS ACROSS CENTRAL STATES BY MIDWEEK. DEEPER MOISTURE AND 
SHOWERS LOOK TO STAY TO THE EAST OF FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 AM EDT THU NOV 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...
BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS AND PRECIP BETWEEN CSV AND BNA IS ALIGNED WITH
THE 700 MB TROUGH AXIS...WHICH WILL BE MOVING ACROSS OUR AREA
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. THE CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD TO CAPTURE
THE END OF THE RAIN AND THE CLEARING SKIES. STRONG COLD ADVECTION
WILL KICK IN AND KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND 50S. ONLY MINOR
ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE MADE BASED ON THE LATEST OBSERVATIONS...AND TO
REMOVE MORNING WORDING.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

DGS

209 
FXUS64 KMRX 040807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
407 AM EDT THU NOV 4 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA BRINGING RAIN TO THE AREA EARLY TODAY. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO 
EXIT THE CWA BY THIS AFTERNOON. SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR 
PRECIPITATION FOR THE MORNING HOURS IN THE EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
CWA. MOST OF THE RAIN SHOULD OUT OF THE AREA BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
BUT UPPER TROUGH IS EXPECTED MOVE INTO THE AREA TONIGHT WITH COLD 
AIR FILTERING IN BEHIND THE FRONT. WITH MOISTURE STILL LINGERING... 
COULD SEE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WHERE THE BEST UPSLOPE IS EXPECTED. WILL CONTINUE THE SPS FOR SNOW 
GOING FOR NOW. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED BOTH DAYS... 
STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN ON 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WHICH WILL BRING AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. WHILE THE MODELS REVEAL STEEP 
LAPSE RATES AND A DECENT NORTHWESTERLY UPSLOPE WIND FLOW RESULTING 
IN SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE APPALACHIANS... 
THEY STILL REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH. YESTERDAY'S RUN OF 
THE NAM MODEL WAS WETTER THAN THE GFS MODEL...BUT TODAY'S MODEL RUNS 
REVEAL THE LATEST NAM LOOKING LIKE YESTERDAY'S GFS WHILE THE LATEST 
GFS LOOKS LIKE YESTERDAY'S NAM. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL CONTINUE TO 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO MODELS WITH POPS AND PRECIP AMOUNTS...BUT 
IT STILL APPEARS THAT SEVERAL INCHES OF SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS (GENERALLY ABOVE 2500 FEET) BY FRIDAY NIGHT. 
THIS DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY EXIT THE REGION 
ON SATURDAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE QUICKLY BUILDING ACROSS THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY EARLY NEXT WEEK RESULTING IN A WARMING 
TREND FOR NEXT WEEK. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT 
ANOTHER LESS-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA AROUND WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY...BUT FOR NOW...WILL KEEP 
THE EXTENDED FORECAST DRY FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  39  51  30  50 /  30  20  20   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  38  48  30  47 /  50  50  50  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  38  49  30  48 /  50  50  40  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  37  45  27  44 /  80  70  60  40  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

510 
FXUS64 KMRX 040144
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT WED NOV 3 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. DECENT LIFT
WILL ACCOMPANY COLD FRONT AS IT SLIDES INTO THE AREA OVERNIGHT. 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE IN PLACE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT IS PRODUCING LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
EASTERN HALF OF TN AND NORTHERN AL/GA. MOISTURE DEPTH AND LIFT WILL 
INCREASE THIS EVENING AS THE UPPER TROUGH TO OUR WEST APPROACHES AND 
THE 300 MB JET OVER WV STRENGTHENS. CONVERGENCE WITH THE 850 MB 
TROUGH AND DIVERGENCE IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET MOVES 
OVER EAST TN AROUND MIDNIGHT. AVERAGE RAINFALL AMOUNTS AROUND A HALF 
INCH CAN BE EXPECTED. DRIER AIR MOVES IN QUICKLY BEHIND THE SURFACE 
COLD FRONT AND MIDLEVEL TROUGH...BRINGING A QUICK END TO MOST OF THE 
PRECIP THURSDAY MORNING. SW VA AND NE TN MOUNTAINS MAY HANG ONTO 
SOME SHOWERS AS THE FLOW ALOFT TURNS TO A MORE FAVORABLE UPSLOPE 
DIRECTION. THE 500 MB THERMAL TROUGH MOVES INTO THE AREA IN THE 
AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD KEEP PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES IN PLACE 
WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS NORTHEAST. COLD ADVECTION THROUGH THE DAY 
WILL KEEP TEMPS ONLY IN THE 50S TOMORROW WITH 40S IN THE MOUNTAINS. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
ALL OF THE ACTION FOR THE EXTENDED WILL OCCUR EARLY WITH A DEEP
UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPING ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. FOR
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC FLOW
WILL DEVELOP WITH 850MB WINDS AROUND 25KTS PRODUCING MODERATE OMEGA
OVER THE NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES. MOISTURE IS FAVORABLE AND DEEP
ENOUGH (UP TO 700MB) TO PRODUCE OROGRAPHIC PRECIPITATION.
ALSO...NOTICE A TONGUE OF MOISTURE EXTENDING FROM THE GREAT LAKES.

COLD AIR ALOFT FROM DEEP UPPER TROUGH AND RELATIVELY WARM GROUND 
WILL PRODUCE FAIRLY STEEP LAPSE RATES AND CAPES OF 100-150 
J/KG...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE INSTABILITY WILL 
PRODUCE FAIRLY VIGOROUS SHOWERS FOR LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
FRIDAY EVENING.

LAST PIECE OF THE PUZZLE IS PRECIPITATION EFFICIENCY DURING THE 
EVENT. FAVORABLE DENDRITIC SNOW GROWTH EVIDENT BY FRIDAY WHICH WILL 
ENHANCE SNOWFALL RATES ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE SHOWS AIRMASS COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...GENERALLY 3500 FEET OR HIGHER...BUT WILL DROP TO 2500 
FEET BY THE END OF THE EVENT. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE TRICKY DUE TO 
THE RELATIVELY WARM GROUND...BUT DO EXPECTED 24 HOURS SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS OF 3 TO 6 INCHES FOR THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS... 
GENERALLY ABOVE 3500 FEET. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO ISSUE A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN...SUCH AS THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS AND ROAN MOUNTAINS STATE PARK.

ELSEWHERE...PERIODS OF RAIN SHOWERS ANTICIPATED THURSDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. OTHERWISE...CLOUDY AND CHILLY WEATHER IS ON TAP.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH CLOUDS 
ERODING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. COLD NIGHT IS ON TAP FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE RIDING PRODUCES CLEAR SKY...CALM 
WIND...AND COLD AIRMASS FOR TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S MOST 
LOCATIONS...SOME TEENS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL RULE FOR THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK 
PRODUCING CLEAR SKY AND A WARMING TREND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  59  37  50  30 / 100  20  20  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  57  38  46  30 / 100  40  50  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  58  38  47  30 / 100  20  50  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              48  55  37  45  28 / 100  80  70  50  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
725 PM EDT WED NOV 3 2010

.AVIATION...
LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA THIS 
EVENING. PRECIP INTENSITY SHOULD BEGIN TO INCREASE AROUND MIDNIGHT 
AS AN UPPER TROUGH ENHANCES LIFT OVER THE AREA. WITH THE HEAVIER 
PRECIP WILL COME IFR CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES AT ALL TAF SITES. 
EXPECT PREDOMINANTLY IFR CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT WITH PERIODS OF LIFR 
POSSIBLE IN HEAVIER SHOWERS. CONDITIONS SHOULD IMPROVE AFTER SUNRISE 
ONCE THE RAIN ENDS AND THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES EAST...WITH VFR 
CONDITIONS AT ALL SITES BY AROUND NOON. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO 
NORTHWEST AND MAY BECOME GUSTY TOMORROW.

.DISCUSSION...

THE CAROLINAS AND INTO THE DEEP SOUTH...TO A WARM FRONT LOCATED
NEAR THE GULF COAST. NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT...WEAK ISENTROPIC
LIFT IN THE 295-305 K LAYER WILL PRODUCE LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS
EAST TN THROUGH THE DAY. SINCE LIFT IS WEAK...PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL
BE LIGHT...AROUND A TENTH OF AN INCH OR LESS IN MOST SPOTS THROUGH
00Z. STRONGER LIFT WITH THE UPPER JET AND TROUGH WILL PRODUCE
GREATER AMOUNTS TONIGHT.

MADE TO TEMPERATURES AND POPS FOR THE UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT WED NOV 3 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. MOISTURE ON THE INCREASE AS AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE NEARS. WILL GO WITH LIKELY CHANCES FOR THE SOUTHERN AREAS 
WHERE THE DEEPER MOISTURE IS EXPECTED. HIGHEST CHANCES FOR RAIN 
SHOULD BE TONIGHT AS THE SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION. WITH 
CLOUDS AND RAIN EXPECTED...TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A BIT COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY. STAYED NEAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN 
THROUGH SATURDAY...WHICH WILL BRING UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR ACROSS THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THE MAIN DISCREPANCY INVOLVES THE AMOUNT 
OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE ON FRIDAY WITH THE STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
THAT SWINGS ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS AND PRODUCES NORTHWESTERLY 
UPSLOPE FLOW. VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILES INDICATE THAT IT WILL BE 
COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE 
(DEPENDING ON THE AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE). FOR NOW...WILL KEEP 
POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORIES WITH THE HIGHEST POPS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL QUICKLY EXIT THE REGION ON 
SATURDAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE QUICKLY BUILDING ACROSS THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
AGREE THAT A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL THEN DEVELOP BY THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW BRINGING A WARMING TREND ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD... WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

034 
FXUS64 KMRX 021905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE NOV 2 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SOUTHERN PLAINS UPPER LOW 
SHIFTING SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO LATE 
THIS AFTERNOON. THROUGH MODEL DEPICTION...THIS FEATURE APPEARS TO 
HAVE ONLY LIMITED IMPACT ON THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY 
MORNING WITH A SMALL CHANCE OF A SHOWER ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. HOWEVER...STRONG UPPER LEVEL 
TROF DIVING SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA WILL HELP TO DRAW MOISTURE FROM 
THE GULF BACK ACROSS THE PARCHED SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL GENERATE SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY WITH AN INCREASING CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGHOUT THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AS 
FRONTOGENESIS DEVELOPS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. SYSTEM COLD FRONT DRIVES RAPIDLY EAST INTO THE 
CAROLINAS EARLY THURSDAY BRINGING AN END TO THE RAINFALL. WRAP 
AROUND MOISTURE AND TRAILING ENERGY BUILDING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
BASE OF THE SHARP UPPER LEVEL TROF MAY LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
DURING THE AFTERNOON. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO THE MIDDLE OF 
GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH DIGS 
SOUTH ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES EARLY IN THE PERIOD. WRAP 
AROUND MOISTURE AVAILABLE FOR NW FLOW PCPN EVENT THROUGH FRIDAY. 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE DROPS OFF FRIDAY NIGHT. H85 WINDS NW~20 WITH 
TEMPS FALLING TO AROUND -7C. FREEZING TEMPS WILL COVER THE AREA BY 
SATURDAY MORNING WITH WIND CHILL READINGS IN THE 20S COMMONPLACE. 
AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW ACCUMULATION A GOOD BET ACROSS THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA RESULTING IN 
A RELATIVELY COLD WEEKEND. UPPER HEIGHTS BEGIN TO RISE ON SUNDAY 
BEGINNING A SLOW WARMING TREND INTO NEXT WEEK. 


&&

DEVELOP OVER MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER

ONLY MENTION SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR TONIGHT AND MAINLY OVER THE 
SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND LOOK REASONABLE.

TRACKING INTO THE AREA BRINGING CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY

COLDER AIR FILTERING IN WITH THE SHORTWAVE ALONG WITH SUFFICIENT 
MOISTURE TO PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. COULD SEE MINOR ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS IN THE UPSLOPE AREAS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE WEEKEND. WITH THE CLOUDS AND COLD 
AIRMASS EXPECTED...SHOULD HAVE BELOW TEMPERATURES FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY...BUT OTHER PERIODS SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

604 
FXUS64 KMRX 011906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT MON NOV 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...PLAINS UPPER TROF SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY DEEPEN WHILE SHIFTING SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TOWARD 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...EVENTUALLY STRENGTHENING SUFFICIENTLY 
FOR THE FORMATION OF A CLOSED CENTER OF LOW PRESSURE. IN 
RESPONSE...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH INVERTED CONFIGURATION NORTHEAST INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY ON TUESDAY. SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT IN THIS PATTERN 
WILL BE MAINLY LIMITED TO THE DEEP SOUTH WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
LACKING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL A MORE SOUTHERLY COMPONENT 
DEVELOPS ON WEDNESDAY. SO...KEPT SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY 
OF PRECIP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT. BY WEDNESDAY GREAT LAKES UPPER LEVEL TROF WILL 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WITH SURFACE COLD FRONT 
BUILDING TOWARD THE MID SOUTH. UNCERTAINTY EXISTS IN TIMING OF THE 
TRAILING UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONT AND JUST HOW MUCH MOISTURE 
WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR LIFTING ON WEDNESDAY. THEREFORE JUST STAYED 
THE COURSE WITH LOW THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AT THIS 
TIME. GENERALLY USED A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES IN THE SHORT 
TERM.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT FORECAST. TRENDED COOLER FOR LATER PART OF FORECAST.

MAJORITY OF THE DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEM REMAINS SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND PREFER THE GFS 
MODEL SOLUTION AND POPS.

AS NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED 
STATES THROUGH FRIDAY...ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY. SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL 
ACCOMPANY FRONT. 

AS UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD AIR ADVECTION DEEPENS...AIRMASS 
WILL DESTABILIZE AND COMBINE WITH UPSLOPE NORTHWEST FLOW TO PRODUCE 
LIGHT SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. VERTICAL PROFILE WILL 
BECOME COLD ENOUGH BY FRIDAY MORNING TO PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...SUCH AS 
MOUNT LECONTE.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST INTO NEXT WEEK WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING.
&&

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 010647
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT MON NOV 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH ONLY A 
FEW HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH IT. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
CONTINUE SLOWLY MOVING SOUTH TODAY...WITH HIGH CLOUDS INCREASING 
TODAY AND TONIGHT AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE PLAINS. 
THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL DEVELOP A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY BY TONIGHT...WITH AN INVERTED SURFACE 
TROUGH DEVELOPING NORTHEAST OF IT AND EXTENDING INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA. HOWEVER...MODELS AGREE THAT THE AIR MASS OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY WILL BE TOO DRY TONIGHT FOR ANY PRECIP DEVELOPMENT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...TWO MAIN SYSTEMS WILL EFFECT 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED. FIRST IS THE SOUTHERN STREAM 
UPPER TROUGH THAT CLOSES OFF ACROSS TEXAS THEN MOVES EAST ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN GULF BEFORE BECOMING PART OF THE MAIN NORTHERN STREAM UPPER 
TROUGH THAT DEVELOP OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION.

MAJORITY OF THE DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEM REMAINS SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND PREFER THE GFS 
MODEL SOLUTION AND POPS.

AS NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED 
STATES LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH SYSTEM TO PRODUCE LIGHT SHOWERS THROUGH THURSDAY 
MORNING.

AS UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD AIR ADVECTION DEEPENS...AIRMASS 
WILL DESTABILIZE AND COMBINE WITH UPSLOPE NORTHWEST FLOW TO PRODUCE 
SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE THURSDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. VERTICAL PROFILE WILL BECOME 
COLD ENOUGH BY FRIDAY MORNING TO PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...SUCH AS MOUNT LECONTE.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST INTO NEXT WEEK WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING.

529 
FXUS64 KMRX 311931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EDT SUN OCT 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE WINDS SHIFTING TO
WESTERLY ACROSS NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...AND THE WEAK COLD
FRONT WILL LIKELY DRIFT THROUGH EARLY TONIGHT. HOWEVER...LITTLE TO
NO CHANGE IN OUR WEATHER OVERNIGHT...AND I WENT FOR MINS CLOSE TO
PERSISTENCE. LIGHT NE WINDS BEHIND THE FRONT SHOULD KEEP ENOUGH
MIXING FOR NOT ENOUGH FROST TO MENTION...AND LITTLE IF ANY CROPS
REMAIN ACROSS THE REGION.

CLOUDS LOOK TO HOLD OFF UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT...ALTHO HIGH CLOUDS MAY
ARRIVE ON MONDAY AND TAKE A FEW DEGREES OFF MAX TEMPS FROM HIGHS
TODAY. LONGWAVE TROUGH OVER SRN PLAINS AND LOWER MS VALLEY REGION
WILL EVENTUALLY THICKEN CLOUDS ON TUESDAY...BUT MODELS CONTINUE TO
SHUNT SHOWERS TO OUR SW...SO I TRIMMED POPS BACK A BIT ON TUESDAY.

OTHERWISE...MOS POPS AND TEMPS WERE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SHORT WAVE TROF/CLOSED 
UPPER LOW WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO 
THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WHILE A MAJOR LEAGUE UPPER TROF AMPLIFIES SOUTH ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
U.S. THIS WILL LEAD TO THE CONTINUATION OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LOW LEVEL 
LIFT WILL BE PROVIDED INITIALLY BY AN INVERTED SURFACE TROF IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH THE LEADING WAVE. THE TRAILING UPPER TROF DEEPENS 
AS IT DIGS FARTHER SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WHILE 
DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY MORNING. 
THE UPPER TROF WILL NOT BE GOING ANYWHERE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS 
WITH A NEVER ENDING SUPPLY OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING SOUTH AND 
EAST AROUND THE BASE OF THE TROF. A TREMENDOUS AMOUNT OF COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL ENSUE IN THIS TYPE OF PATTERN AND TEMPS WILL BE COLD 
ENOUGH FOR SNOW SHOWERS WITH CHARACTERISTIC UPSLOPE FLOW. INITIALLY 
IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN WILL BE IN A POSITION THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY MORNING TO SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS. THEN THE COMBINATION OF 
MODESTLY DEEP MOISTURE AND SHORT WAVE/OROGRAPHIC LIFT ACROSS MUCH OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA WILL ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT 
RAIN SHOWERS POSSIBLY CHANGING TO LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING BEFORE THE PRECIP FINALLY SHUTS 
OFF AS THE UPPER TROF EDGES ONLY SLOWLY EAST. THEREFORE...MUCH OF 
SATURDAY SHOULD BE DRY WITH SOME IMPROVEMENT IN SKY CONDITION WITH A 
SLIGHTLY BETTER SUNDAY RETURNING AS AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE APPROACHES 
THE EASTERN U.S.  

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 310700
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT SUN OCT 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHEAST...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND MID WEST. THIS WEAK COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...BUT WITH A 
VERY DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE...IT SHOULD ONLY BRING A SLIGHT INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS AND A MINOR WIND SHIFT. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY AGREE ON OVERALL PATTERN THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG 
TERM...BUT CONTINUE TO STRUGGLE WITH DETAILS. THE TRACK AND STRENGTH 
OF THE SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES BY MID WEEK IS ONE OF
THE MAIN SOURCES OF UNCERTAINTY. CONTINUED POPS PRETTY MUCH AS
DEPICTED IN PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST...BUT ANY DEVIATION OF
PROJECTED TRACK/STRENGTH HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PROFOUNDLY AFFECT
POPS. MODELS ALSO AGREE THAT UPPER FLOW WILL RAPIDLY TRANSITION
FROM NEARLY ZONAL TO HIGHLY AMPLIFIED BY LATE WORK WEEK.
HOWEVER...BOTH THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS DEPICT A MUCH MORE
AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS THAN THE
GFS...AND ALSO KEEP THE TROUGH AXIS FARTHER WEST. TENDED TO FAVOR
LESS EXTREME GFS MODEL. EVEN THEN...SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER TEMPS IN
STORE WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR PRECIP TO END AS SNOW IN THE HIGHER
TERRAIN FRIDAY NIGHT. TEMPS PROJECTED TO FALL TO BELOW CLIMO BY
LATE IN THE LONG TERM.
