853 
FXUS64 KMRX 301925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT OCT 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...ENJOYING CHAMBER OF
COMMERCE TYPE FALL WEATHER TODAY...COURTESY OF HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
AND SW LOW LEVEL WINDS. TEMPS ALREADY IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S
ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. A DRY COLD FRONT APPROACHES SW VA
TOWARD DAYBREAK...WHICH WILL KEEP WINDS UP A BIT OVERNIGHT. THIS
PLUS WARM TEMPS ALOFT...SHOULD RESULT IN SLIGHTLY MILDER MINS
TONIGHT. HOWEVER...PATCHY FROST MAY OCCUR IN SOME OF OUR SHELTERED
VALLEYS.

SURFACE RIDGE TO OUR NORTH WILL BRING NE WINDS ON SUNDAY...BUT
PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AGAIN TO REACH VERY CLOSE TO HIGHS LIKE TODAY. 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS SLOWER TO DEVELOP TO OUR SOUTHWEST...SO I 
KEPT THE FORECAST DRY INTO MONDAY. ALSO...SLOWED DOWN THE INCREASE
OF CLOUDS A BIT ON MONDAY. 

OTHERWISE...A MOS BLEND LOOKED BETTER FOR MINS EACH NIGHT...BUT I
CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS EACH DAY. 
 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NEW MODEL RUNS INDICATE 
EARLY WORK WEEK SYSTEM WILL BE A LITTLE SLOWER TO TAKE SHAPE WITH 
SYNOPTIC LIFT DISPLACED FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. 
KEPT POPS IN LOW CHANCE OR SLIGHT CHANCE LATER MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY AS LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES 
SLOWLY SOUTHEAST INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO. A STEADY SUPPLY OF SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY WILL HELP TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEEPEN A LONG WAVE TROF OVER 
THE EASTERN U.S. THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE WILL 
ROTATE SOUTH AND EAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ALONG WITH THE 
SHORT WAVE LIFT. IN ADDITION TO THE LARGE SCALE LIFT...AN UPSLOPE 
COMPONENT WILL AID THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW SHOWERS DURING THIS 
PERIOD ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND MUCH OF 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND EVEN A FEW SNOW SHOWERS...MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...AS STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURS OVER THE REGION. 
THE DEEP TROF INCHES AWAY TO THE EAST FRIDAY NIGHT INTO THE WEEKEND 
WITH DRY WEATHER EXPECTED AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

684 
FXUS64 KMRX 300640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT SAT OCT 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH A 
COOL AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE SLIDING TO THE EAST TODAY...WITH SOUTHERLY 
WINDS DEVELOPING BY THIS AFTERNOON...BRINGING WARMER AND MORE MOIST 
AIR. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
LATE TONIGHT...BUT WITH A DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE...THIS FRONT SHOULD 
JUST BRING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LONG TERM FORECAST HAS TAKEN A 
TURN TOWARD LESS CERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM 
WHICH APPROACHES EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK AS MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE 
SUFFERING FROM POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY AND GENERAL DISAGREEMENT. 
AFTER HAVING ADVERTISED THE SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM AFFECTING THE 
REGION BY LATE MONDAY...THE LATEST RUN OF THE GFS NOW DEPICTS THIS 
SYSTEM TO STAY GENERALLY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY MINOR 
EFFECTS FROM THE NORTHERN FRINGE OF THIS SYSTEM EXPERIENCED IN OUR 
CWA. THE ECMWF STILL HAS THIS SYSTEM MUCH FARTHER NORTH...BRINGING 
LIGHT TO MODERATE PRECIP INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY. MODELS ALSO HAVING TROUBLE WITH THE PLACEMENT OF HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH THAT DEVELOPS SOMEWHERE OVER THE NORTHEASTERN 
CONUS BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD. WITH LACK OF AGREEMENT AMONG 
THE MODELS...HAVE NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST. WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPMENT AND STRONG 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT...APPEARS TEMPS WILL FALL TO BELOW CLIMO BY 
LATE IN THE LONG TERM.

139 
FXUS64 KMRX 291900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI OCT 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A CLEAR AND FROSTY NIGHT
AHEAD AS SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES SE ACROSS THE SRN
APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT. MOS MINS RANGING FROM MID 20S TO MID/UPR
30S LOOKED ON TRACK. NOTHING GROWING ACROSS OUR REGION ANY LONGER
SO OUR FROST/FREEZE PROGRAM IS NO LONGER IN EFFECT. HOWEVER...I DID
MENTION AREAS OF FROST IN THE GRIDS AND ZFPMRX.

ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND A QUICK SHIFT TO S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL
ALLOW FOR A GREAT WEEKEND. RESULTS WILL BE A GOOD WARM-UP TO
ABOVE SEASONAL NORMS ON HIGHS AND VERY CLOSE TO NORMAL ON MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DID NOT MAKE MAJOR 
CHANGES TO THE FORECAST WHILE USING A BLEND OF THE ECMWF AND GFS. 
APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AS AN UPPER TROF DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS EN ROUTE TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY TUESDAY. 
KEPT BEST CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE TROF 
STRENGTHENS AS IT CONTINUES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE WESTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ON WEDNESDAY AS 
SOUTHERN TROF/UPPER LOW DESCENDS FURTHER SOUTH INTO THE GULF WHILE 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY DRIVES SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA. AT LEAST A COUPLE 
OF WAVES WILL RIDE SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY HELPING TO AMPLIFY A DEEP TROF OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. IN THIS PATTERN THERE WILL BE A CONTINUED CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER ACROSS THE REGION ON THURSDAY...MAINLY AFFECTING HIGHER 
TERRAIN FEATURES ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF FORECAST AREA BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL START NEAR NORMAL BUT WILL END UP 
BELOW NORMAL IN THE LAST HALF OF THE PERIOD AS THE EASTERN STATES 
TROF STRENGTHENS. HAD TO ADJUST THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS DOWN A FEW 
DEGREES BASED ON THE UPCOMING COOL WEATHER PATTERN.

FXUS64 KMRX 290655
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT FRI OCT 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OFF THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND OZARKS REGION BUILDING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE CLOUD DECK OVER EASTERN 
KY AND SOUTHWESTERN VA...WHICH WAS SLOWLY MOVING EASTWARD. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT THESE CLOUDS WILL AFFECT SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN 
FOR A FEW MORE HOURS THIS MORNING...BUT SHOULD MOVE EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND 
DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND LOOK REASONABLE. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER 
CONDITIONS IN THE OFFING THROUGH THE FIRST SEVERAL PERIODS OF THE 
LONG TERM PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES 
NEARLY ZONAL. MODELS ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
CONDITIONS WILL START TO DETERIORATE BY LATE MONDAY AS AN UPPER 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THUS 
HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS INTO MID WEEK. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE 
CONSIDERABLY BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM HOWEVER WITH GFS PROJECTING 
RELATIVELY TRANQUIL CONDITIONS IN NORTHWEST FLOW WHILE THE ECMWF 
DEPICTS A SIGNIFICANT UPPER LOW TO DEVELOP IN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
REGION BY THURSDAY...KEEPING CONDITIONS SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED THROUGH 
THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM. THE ECMWF SOLUTION HAS SOME SUPPORT 
FROM A FEW OF THE GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. HOWEVER DUE TO  
UNCERTAINTY...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS 
GRIDS/FORECAST FOR THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE.

320 PM EDT THU OCT 28 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING

TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
UNCERTAINTY IN THIS PORTION OF THE FORECAST...ESPECIALLY LATE IN THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD AS MODELS HANDLE AMPLIFICATION OF NEXT WEEK'S 
EASTERN STATES LONG WAVE TROF DIFFERENTLY. TRIED TO TREND THE 
FORECAST CLOSER TO GFS BY TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY BUT VEERED AWAY TO 
A MORE PROGRESSIVE SOLUTION...PERHAPS CLOSER TO THE ECMWF BY 
THURSDAY AS GFS TRIES TO STALL OUT AN UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AT THIS TIME. THE EARLY PART OF THE LONG TERM 
INCLUDING SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY WILL REMAIN DRY AS THE 
ATMOSPHERE OFFERS A TREND TOWARD ZONAL FLOW COMPLETE WITH DRY 
ADVECTION AND SOME SURFACE RIDGING. PATTERN BEGINS TO CHANGE ABOUT 
MONDAY AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY SPILLS SOUTHEAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY WITH SURFACE WAVE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. CRANKED 
POPS UP FROM SLIGHT CHANCE MONDAY NIGHT TO MEDIUM AND HIGH CHANCE  
BY LATE TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AS UPPER TROF AMPLIFIES FORMING A 
CLOSED LOW OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY TUESDAY NIGHT. 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE ADVECTION OFF THE GULF IN THIS SCENARIO WITH LOW 
LEVEL CONVERGENCE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS INVERTED 
SURFACE TROF EXTENDS NORTHEAST INTO THE REGION. GRADUALLY DROPPED 
POPS BACK FROM MEDIUM CHANCE WEDNESDAY TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT WHILE FOLLOWING A MORE PROGRESSIVE PATTERN. DROPPED POPS ON 
THURSDAY WITH DRIER NORTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPING BEHIND DEPARTING UPPER 
TROF.

446 
FXUS64 KMRX 281412
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1012 AM EDT THU OCT 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN PROVIDING A MOSTLY SUNNY AND 
DRY DAY TODAY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. 
WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE THE BECOMING AND THE AFTERNOON 
WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT LIES TO THE
SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA NOW FAR
TO THE NORTH OVER QUEBEC NEAR HUDSONS BAY AND MOVING NORTHEAST.
HIGH PRESSURE WAS CENTERED OVER THE ROCKIES AND WILL MOVE EAST
INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY THIS AFTERNOON. THE FORECAST AREA LIES
BETWEEN THESE SYSTEMS WITH A VERY WEAK GRADIENT EARLY THIS MORNING.
LEFT OVER MOISTURE FROM THE PRECIPITATION FROM THE PAST FEW DAYS AND 
LIGHT WINDS HAVE CREATED AREAS OF DENSE FOG. THE FOG WILL CONTINUE 
INTO MID MORNING SO WILL KEEP DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 900 AM. 
OTHERWISE DRIER AIR WILL FILTER IN TO THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING 
FROM THE OHIO AND MISSISSIPPI VALLEYS AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST. 
WINDS WILL INCREASE FROM THE NORTHWEST AND HOLD HIGH TEMPERATURES 
INTO THE 60S TO LOWER 70S AFTER LOWS IN THE LOWER 50S TO LOWER 60S. 
TONIGHT EXPECTING BIG COOL DOWN INTO THE 30S WITH UPPER 20S 
MOUNTAINS AS NW FLOW BRINGS COLD AIR INTO THE EAST TN VALLEY. WINDS 
WILL STAY UP FOR MUCH OF THE NIGHT SO NOT EXPECTING WIDESPREAD FROST 
BUT IN SHELTERED AREAS FROST WILL BE POSSIBLE AROUND SUNRISE FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN U.S. BECOMING CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY SAT MORNING. RIDGE SUPPRESSES SE ON SUN AS 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES ESE ACROSS NATIONS MID SECTION. MONDAY 
WEAKEN SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAG SE INTO 
MRX CWA. LARGE RIDGING WILL DEVELOP OVER THE SW U.S. MODELS HAVE NOT 
COME INTO AGREEMENT ON LOCATION AND STRENGTH OF TROFFING ACROSS EAST 
CENTRAL U.S. INTO NEXT WEEK. CHANCE OF RAIN BEGINS ACROSS N AREA ON 
MONDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH MID WEEK. TRENDED MIN TEMPS DOWN WITH 
SURFACE RIDGE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MONDAY SHOULD BE ABOVE NORMAL 
THEN TEMPS TREND TO NORMAL NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  36  60  34  65 /  10   0   0   0   0

944 
FXUS64 KMRX 271927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT WED OCT 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUE 
TO TRACK NE NEAR AND ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AFFECTING MAINLY 
OUR EASTERN MOST COUNTIES. THIS AREA SHOULD BE THE PRIMARY LOCATIONS 
FOR LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY TONIGHT...BUT I KEPT AT LEAST SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR ALL BUT OUR EXTREME WRN COUNTIES. PARTIAL CLEARING 
HAS OCCURRED OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND A SIMILAR DECREASING 
CLOUD TREND WAS KEPT IN FORECAST GRIDS. MOS MINS CLOSE EXCEPT FOR 
LNP AND RHP...AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. MY POPS WERE CLOSE TO A BLEND 
OF MOS NUMBERS.

FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPS SE AWAY FROM OUR REGION THURSDAY...AND A 
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BUILD GRADUALLY EAST INTO FRIDAY. WESTERLY 
SURFACE WINDS THURSDAY MAY ALLOW SOME DOWNSLOPING INTO NRN AND 
CENTRALS VALLEY OF E TN...PROBABLY WHY MOS IS WARMER FOR HIGHS FOR 
TRI THAN CHA. ANYWAY...MOS GUIDANCE MAXES LOOKED GOOD. COOLER 30S 
FOR THE MOST PART THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WINDS SHOULD STAY UP TO 
PREVENT ANY WIDESPREAD FROST (ALSO FROST/FREEZE PROGRAM WAS DROPPED 
AS OF MONDAY THE 25TH). DRY AIR AND RIDGING FOR FRIDAY...BUT A 
NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW AND 850 MB COLD AIR ADVECTION...SO 50S AND 
60S ON TAP FOR FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  A FRONT 
TRACKS IN THE REGION WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT TO 
KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY.  A CUTOFF LOW DEVELOPS ALONG THE  
FRONT CONTINUING THE RAIN CHANCES INTO WEDNESDAY. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED EARLY IN THE PERIOD THEN BECOME MORE 
SEASONAL AS THE INCREASED CLOUDS AND RAIN ENTERS THE AREA BY THE END

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

420 AM EDT WED OCT 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT HAS MOVED TO JUST
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS EARLY THIS MORNING AND HAS SLOWED OR
BECOME STATIONARY. DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA CONTINUES ALONG THE
US AND CANADIAN BORDER WITH VERY BROAD UPPER TROUGH EXTENDING SOUTH
AND SOUTHWEST INTO THE CENTRAL STATES. LOW PRESSURE OVER SOUTH TEXAS
ALONG THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE UP ALONG THE BOUNDARY TODAY AND
TONIGHT AND THEN MOVE INTO NC BY 12Z THURSDAY. STEADY RAINS HAVE
ENDED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BUT SHOWER ACTIVITY CONTINUES TO
DEVELOP SOUTH AND WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA ALONG AND NORTH OF THE
FRONT AND MOVE NE ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND APPALACHIANS.
SOME LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL IN SHOWER ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE THIS
MORNING WITH MAINLY URBAN FLOODING CONCERNS. KEPT OVERALL QPF
VALUES LOW FOR THE DAY TIME HOURS. AS THE FRONT MOVES LITTLE TODAY
SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE
50S TO THE LOWER 60S. FOR HIGHS TODAY WILL STAY CLOSER TO THE
WARMER MAV GUIDANCE...WITH ANY BREAKS TEMPERATURES SHOULD RISE INTO
THE 70S BY EARLY AFTERNOON. START TODAY WITH LIKELY POPS AND THEN
LOWER TO SLIGHT CHANCE TONIGHT AS FRONT STARTS TO MOVE AGAIN AND
DRIER AIR MASS MOVES IN. RAISED LOWS TONIGHT A FEW DEGREES BUT KEPT
TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE. SKIES SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY
CLEAR BY MORNING ALL AREAS WITH WINDS BECOMING LIGHT BY MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO 
THE AREA FROM THE WEST THROUGH SUNDAY. AIR MASS SHOULD DRY OUT 
QUICKLY. CLOUDS WILL BE SCARCE. DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE SHOULD
BECOME 30+ MOST AREAS BY THE WEEKEND WITH COOL MORNINGS AND WARM 
DAYS. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE RESOLVING DEVELOPING TROF AND EVENTUAL
CUTOFF LOW NEXT WEEK. BY END OF PERIOD CUTOFF LOW MOST LIKELY OVER E 
TX. THIS WOULD SET UP FOR A WET PERIOD BY MID WEEK. STAYED ON THE 
DRY SIDE AND NEAR CLIMO FOR NEXT WEEK PENDING SYSTEM EVOLUTION.

WARNINGS AS CURRENTLY CONFIGURED/SCHEDULED AS WINDS SHOULD START TO 
DIMINISH BEHIND CONVECTIVE BAND.

12Z NAM RUN DEPICTS FRONT SLOWING SIGNIFICANTLY AS IT APPROACHES THE 
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS WITH SERIES OF WAVES TRANSLATING ALONG 
BOUNDARY...KEEPING PRECIP LINGERING IN THE CWA THROUGH AT LEAST A 
PORTION OF SECOND PERIOD. GFS LESS DISTINCT ABOUT THIS PROCESS AND 
HAS SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER QPF VALUES THAN NAM. CANADIAN MODEL TENDS TO 
SUPPORT NAM WHILE THE SREF IS SOMEWHAT IN BETWEEN NAM AND GFS 
SOLUTION. HAVE TENDED TO FAVOR HPC QPF WHICH APPEARS TO BE A 
REASONABLE COMPROMISE. CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY IMPROVE DURING 
THE SECOND PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY SATED CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE 
ALTHOUGH IT DIFFERS SIGNIFICANTLY FROM COOLER MET GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
COLD ADVECTION SETS IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA. HIGHS THURSDAY WILL BE IN THE 60S WITH 
BREEZY CONDITIONS. LOW LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE AND AN UPPER LEVEL ZONAL 
FLOW WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES THROUGH 
SUNDAY. 

A CLOSED LOW DIVES SOUTH OVER THE PLAINS FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT 
WEEK. WARM ADVECTION AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM KICKS IN ON MONDAY. MODELS 
DIFFER IN THE PLACEMENT OF THE UPPER LOW...BUT GENERALLY AGREE ON A 
TUESDAY TIME FRAME FOR PRECIP WITH THE SYSTEM. WILL INTRODUCE 
TUESDAY WITH A CHANCE POP.

MNTS AS G50+ ALREADY BEING REPORTED AT COVE MNT. WARNING MAY NEED TO 
BE EXPANDED NORTHWARD LATER TODAY. STRONG WAA ADVECTION WILL PUSH 
TEMPS NEAR RECORD VALUES TODAY. UNCERTAINTY OF EXTENT/DURATION OF 
CLOUD COVER ONLY LIMITING FACTOR. LEANED TOWARD MUCH WARMER NAM MOS 
MAX TEMPS. STAYED CLOSE TO NAM FOR TIMING OF DEEP CONVECTION. BULK 
SHEAR VERY IMPRESSIVE TO THE NW TODAY. ABOVE NORMAL INSTABILITY WILL 
BE IN PLACE PRIOR TO ONSET OF CONVECTION LATER THIS AFTN. SEVERE 
THREAT FOR DAMAGING WINDS VERY REAL. ISOLATED TORNADOES ALSO 
POSSIBLE. A HISTORY OF SEVERE WEATHER SHOULD ALREADY BE WRITTEN 
UPSTREAM BEFORE ACTIVITY MOVES INTO MRX CWA THIS EVENING. STRONG 
WINDS TODAY SHOULD BE A GOOD HEADS UP TO THE SERIOUS SEVERE THREAT 
LATER TODAY. FRONT MOVES THROUGH AROUND MIDNIGHT. DEEP CONVECTION 
WILL BE ONGOING OVERNIGHT ALONG AND BEHIND FRONT AS LIFT AND DRY 
SLOT REMAIN NW OF THE AREA. LOCALIZED FLOODING COULD BECOME A 
PROBLEM. MIN TEMPS REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORT RANGE MODELS IN
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH COLD FRONT EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY 12Z
WEDNESDAY. SHOWERS SHOULD PROGRESS EAST DURING THE DAY ENDING BY
AFTERNOON WEST AND EARLY EVENING EASTERN MOUNTAINS BUT A FEW SW NC
EVENING. TEMPERATURES STILL WARM WITH NO SIGNIFICANT COLD AIR
ADVECTION AS SECONDARY FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST OUT OF DEEP LOW
PRESSURE AREA ALONG THE CANADIAN BORDER. THE SECONDARY FRONT IS
EXPECTED TO BE DRY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY BUT WILL DROP
TEMPERATURES ANOTHER 10 DEGREES WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FROM THE WEST AS COLD UPPER LOW ALONG THE
CANADIAN BORDER AND NORTH OF THE GREAT LAKES WILL MOVE EAST AND
THEN NORTHEAST INTO QUEBEC WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. LOWS THURSDAY
NIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT EXPECTED TO DROP INTO THE 30S WITH BELOW
FREEZING TEMPERATURES AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FRIDAY COLD AIR
ADVECTION WILL KEEP HIGHS IN THE 50S TO MID 60S. HIGH PRESSURE
BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST OVER THE WEEKEND BUT SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO BE
MOSTLY CLEAR. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY A NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL
MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND OHIO VALLEY. NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN
COMES MONDAY NIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES.

RIVER VALLEY BRINGING UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS. SHORT-

559 
FXUS64 KMRX 251840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT MON OCT 25 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...BRIEF LULL IN ACTIVITY 
ANTICIPATED THROUGH MOST OF THE SHORT TERM AS UPPER SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH DEPARTS AND WEAK UPPER RIDGING BUILDS IN. UPPER FLOW 
PROGRESSIVE ENOUGH FOR MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW TO CREATE POTENTIAL 
FOR A FEW SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. THUS HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AREA-WIDE 
OVERNIGHT. NEXT SYSTEM...POTENTIALLY EVEN MORE SIGNIFICANT THAN 
TODAY'S EVENT...APPROACHES BY LATE TOMORROW. MODELS IN REASONABLE 
AGREEMENT THAT LINE OF CONVECTION SHOULD BE ENTERING PLATEAU BY 00Z 
WED. HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY POPS FOR ROUGHLY THE WESTERN HALF OF THE 
CWA IN ANTICIPATION OF THIS SYSTEM. WINDS ALSO A POTENTIAL FACTOR BY 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT 50+ KNOT LOW-LEVEL 
JET PRECEDING ADVANCING SYSTEM. FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT AND LOOKS REASONABLE. DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WILL BE MAINTAINED AFTER 00Z WEDNESDAY DUE TO 
VERY STRONG LOW LEVEL FRONTOGENESIS ENHANCED BY AGEOSTROPHIC 
CIRCULATIONS. THE BEST LIFT IN OUR AREA WILL BE BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z. 
THE COMBINATION OF VERY HIGH HELICITY AND MLCAPE OF 500-1000 J/KG 
WILL PRODUCE A THREAT OF TORNADIC SUPERCELLS TUESDAY EVENING. EXPECT 
THAT DISCRETE CONVECTION IN THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY WILL 
MERGE INTO A QLCS AS IT TRACKS EASTWARD TUESDAY EVENING...WITH THE 
THREAT TRANSITIONING TO PRIMARILY STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS. CONFIDENCE IS 
HIGH OF SEEING WIDESPREAD WIND DAMAGE TOMORROW...SO WILL MENTION 
DAMAGING WINDS IN THE ZONE FORECAST.

THE SURFACE COLD FRONT IS NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL 
FLOW...SO EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE PRECIP WILL BE SLOW...AND 
TRAINING CELLS WILL BE POSSIBLE. QPF AMOUNTS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT COULD 
EXCEED 2 INCHES IN SOME LOCATIONS...CREATING A FLASH FLOOD THREAT AS 
WELL. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE MENTIONED. 

DUE TO THE SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND SLOW FRONTAL MOVEMENT...SHOWERS 
WILL LIKELY LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY. THE 850 MB FLOW TURNS TO A MORE 
WESTERLY DIRECTION WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...AND PRECIP SHOULD EXIT AT 
THAT TIME. HOWEVER THE 850 MB THERMAL BOUNDARY DOES NOT ARRIVE UNTIL 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S WEDNESDAY WILL 
DROP TO THE 60S FOR THURSDAY.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE 
SURFACE THROUGH THE UPPER LEVELS WILL BE TRACKING FROM THE PLAINS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND...PROVIDING DRY WEATHER AND 
GRADUALLY WARMING TEMPERATURES. HIGHS TEMPS WILL GO FROM THE MID 50S 
TO MID 60S FRIDAY TO UPPER 60S TO MID 70S BY MONDAY. THE ECMWF SHOWS 
A DEEP CLOSED LOW TRACKING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY ON MONDAY...BUT 
THE GFS MAINTAINS A MORE ZONAL FLOW ACROSS THE REGION UNTIL TUESDAY. 
WILL INTRODUCE MONDAY DRY BUT WITH INCREASING CLOUDS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  80  59  76  48 /  20  60 100  60  10

CWA. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION HAD DEVELOPED EAST OF APPROACHING SHORT 
WAVE CURRENTLY MOVING INTO LOWER MS RVR VLY. NE MOVING JET SEGMENT 
EAST OF APPROACHING TROF HAS AIDED IN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
OVERNIGHT. THIS SEGMENT SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT CONTINUES OFF TO THE NE 
EARLY TODAY. ANOTHER DEVELOPING JET SEGMENT WILL TAKE SHAPE OVER 
MS/AL AND MOVES INTO GA TODAY. THIS WILL SUPPLY ONGOING LIFT AND A 
FAVORABLE SHEAR PROFILE FOR CONTINUED CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA 
THROUGH MID DAY. DAMPENING SHORT WAVE AXIS WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS 
AFTERNOON AND PCPN WILL TAPER OFF. SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
TONIGHT WITH CONVERGENT SWRLY FLOW IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING FRONT. 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL BE IN AN UNSETTLED 
WEATHER REGIME FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED AS ONE SYSTEM 
EXITS THE AREA AND ANOTHER PUSHES IN.  THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY WITH A FRONTAL PASSAGE AND 
MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION MOVING THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.  ALSO 
ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL BE A STRONG WIND FIELD...WHICH WILL 
INCREASE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA BOTH TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.  
SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION.  THERE CONTINUES TO BE DISCREPANCIES IN THE MODELS BY THE 
END OF THE EXTENDED THOUGH GENERALLY TREND INTO A DRIER PATTERN BY 
THE WEEKEND.

THE REGION BY NEXT WEEKEND WHILE THE ECMWF KEEPS THE REGION IN 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT ON THE BACKSIDE OF A PERSISTENT TROUGH OVER 
THE NORTHEAST. GEFS ENSEMBLES TEND TO SUPPORT THE GFS SOLUTION...SO 
TRENDED TOWARD ITS SOLUTION AND THE ASSOCIATED MEX GUIDANCE 
ESPECIALLY WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS.

.DISCUSSION...

THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE CURRENTLY OVER 
THE ARKLATEX REGION WAS GENERATING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY AND WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY. THE 
AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA IS CURRENTLY STABLE...BUT MODELS 
INDICATE THAT IT WILL BECOME MARGINALLY UNSTABLE TOWARD SUNRISE. IN 
ADDITION...A FAIRLY STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 40 TO 50 KT) IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...SO IT APPEARS 
THAT A FEW ISOLATED STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE OVERNIGHT 
WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING WINDS. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE 
ALREADY UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO REFLECT THIS 
POTENTIAL. 

AREA RADARS INDICATE THAT PRECIP IS CURRENTLY MOVING INTO THE 
SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL PLAN TO UPDATE 
THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO FRESHEN THE PRECIP WORDING. 
OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL 
NOT PLAN TO CHANGE THIS EVENING.

MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES FOR THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY PERIODS. 
REMAINDER OF FORECAST APPEARS GENERALLY DRY AT THIS TIME ALTHOUGH 
RATHER PROFOUND DIFFERENCES IN UPPER FLOW NOTED BETWEEN GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS WITH GFS DEPICTING A LOW AMPLITUDE RIDGE BUILDING INTO 
THE REGION BY NEXT WEEKEND WHILE THE ECMWF KEEPS THE REGION IN 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT ON THE BACKSIDE OF A PERSISTENT TROUGH OVER 
THE NORTHEAST. GEFS ENSEMBLES TEND TO SUPPORT THE GFS SOLUTION...SO 
TRENDED TOWARD ITS SOLUTION AND THE ASSOCIATED MEX GUIDANCE 
ESPECIALLY WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS. 


&&

LEAD TO A SIGNIFICANT TEMP CONTRAST BETWEEN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
AND THE VALLEYS. WINDS IN THE VALLEYS SHOULD DECOUPLE OVERNIGHT AND 
BECOME CALM...BUT WILL NOT MENTION ANY FOG SINCE THERE SHOULD BE A 
TEMP-DEWPOINT SPREAD WITH THE HIGH CLOUDS AND SOUTHERLY WINDS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA.

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO TWEAK THE TEMPS AND WINDS A LITTLE.

RELATIVELY VIGOROUS SYSTEMS PASSING THROUGH THE REGION. FIRST SYSTEM

QUITE AGGRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH QPFS APPROACHING ONE 
INCH...AND EVEN EXCEEDING ONE INCH IN THE SOUTHERN TIER. NAM QPFS 
SOMEWHAT LOWER. DID NOT GO QUITE AS AGGRESSIVE WITH QPFS AS THE 
GFS...BUT DID BUMP UP POPS TO CATEGORICAL FOR MONDAY. ALSO CONTINUED 
TO MENTION THUNDER. ANOTHER SYSTEM FOLLOWS ON WEDNESDAY. DETAILS NOT 
YET CLEAR WITH THIS SYSTEM THUS KEPT POPS IN CHANCE CATEGORY. THINGS 
BEGIN TO SETTLE DOWN BY THURSDAY WITH RAPIDLY IMPROVING CONDITIONS 
BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM AND TEMPS DROPPING BACK TO NEAR CLIMO. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE.

.SHORT TERM...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE

MINS SHOULD NOT BE AS LOW TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND FOR A QUIET START TO THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER...A 
CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN WILL BRING UNSETTLED WEATHER TO THE 
REGION FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  MODELS REMAIN IN POOR 
AGREEMENT AND CONFIDENCE LOW BUT OVERALL A SERIES OF WEATHER SYSTEMS 
ARE PROGGED TO TRACK ACROSS THE AREA.  THOUGH WITH CONFIDENCE SO LOW 
ON DETAILS...ESPECIALLY TIMING...MADE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF CHANGES 
TO THE FORECAST.  THIS KEEPS THE HIGHEST CHANCE POPS ON MONDAY...LOW 
POPS FOR MID WEEK...AND INCREASE TO CHANGE POPS AGAIN FOR THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT THU OCT 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN 
DURING THE PERIOD. SKY WILL GENERALLY BE CLEAR.  WITH WINDS BECOMING 
CALM TO LIGHT FOR MUCH OF THE AREA...SHOULD SEE SOME AREAS OF FROST 
TONIGHT.  WILL ISSUE FROST ADVISORY ALL BUT FAR SOUTHWEST 
ZONES...WHERE EXPECT MORE MIXING AND SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPS.  WILL 
STILL MENTION PATCHY FROST IN THOSE AREAS.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM 
MAV TEMPS.   

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRY AND PLEASANT 
WEATHER IN STORE FOR THE UPCOMING WEEKEND PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. HOWEVER...CONDITIONS SET TO DETERIORATE BY EARLY NEXT WEEK 
AS RIDGE RETREATS AND UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. THIS 
WILL INCREASE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALONG WITH TRANSPORT OF 
INCREASINGLY MOIST AIR. MEDIUM-RANGE MODELS DISAGREE QUITE A BIT BY 
THEN AS GFS BRINGS FRONT THROUGH ON MONDAY WHILE EUROPEAN MODEL 
KEEPS FRONT NORTH AND WEST OF REGION. GEFS ENSEMBLES TEND TO SUPPORT 
GFS THUS CONTINUED LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY...ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE NOT 
HIGH WITH THIS EVENT. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM ALSO LOW CONFIDENCE AS 
MEDIUM-RANGE MODELS CONTINUE THEIR DISAGREEMENT. DID NOT MAKE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS GIVEN UNCERTAINTY. CONSENSUS 
OF MODELS/ENSEMBLES DEPICT HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH WILL 
APPROACH BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM WITH VERY MOIST FEED FROM GULF OF 
MEXICO. INTRODUCED CHANCE POPS FOR NEXT THURSDAY BASED ON THIS 
SCENARIO. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE.

830 
FXUS64 KMRX 210742
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT THU OCT 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH STILL IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION AND THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL ALLOW A DRY COLD FRONT TO WORK ITS WAY INTO 
THE REGION DURING THE AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABLE TO WARM 
INTO THE LOWER AND MIDDLE 70S ACROSS A GOOD PART OF THE FORECAST 
AREA PRIOR TO FRONT ARRIVAL. THERE COULD BE A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS 
AROUND IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FROPA. SHOULD BE A BIT OF A GRADIENT 
IN PRESSURE TODAY WITH RIDGING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
LOWER PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A 
HEALTHY BREEZE MAINLY AFFECTING SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AS WELL AS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 30S 
ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION. WITH THE FLOW DECOUPLING ESPECIALLY AT 
LOWER ELEVATION INCLUDED PATCHY FROST FORMATION AFTER MIDNIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A SURGE OF COLD AIR OVER THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA FRIDAY MORNING WILL GIVE WAY TO A 
BUILDING RIDGE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. THUS TEMPS WILL BE TRENDING 
WARMER HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND. CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING ON SUNDAY 
AS A DEEP SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING 
UPPER TROUGH. 

MODELS HAVE CONVERGED ON A SOLUTION FOR THE GENERAL PATTERN FOR 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...SHOWING A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSING THE 
AREA ON MONDAY. THE BEST LIFT AND UPPER JET POSITION IS CENTERED 
AROUND 12Z MONDAY...SO WILL RAISE POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. STRONG 
UPPER DIVERGENCE...A NEGATIVE LIFTED INDEX...AND 30+ KT LLJ SHOWN BY 
THE GFS SUGGEST A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS ON MONDAY. GIVEN THE 
CONVERGING MODEL SOLUTIONS AND LESS SPREAD IN THE ENSEMBLES...WILL 
RAISE POPS TO LIKELY ON MONDAY WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDER MENTIONED. 

THE MAIN CLOSED UPPER LOW STAYS WELL TO OUR NORTHWEST FOR 
MONDAY...AND TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES ON TUESDAY. THE GFS 
INDICATES THAT THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE WESTERLY...RESULTING IN A 
FRONT STALLING SOMEWHERE NEAR OUR AREA. THE ECMWF SHOWS A MORE 
AMPLIFIED PATTERN AND STRONGER ATLANTIC RIDGE. EITHER SCENARIO LOOKS 
LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL...BUT CONFIDENCE OF PRECIP 
CHANCES IS LOW...SO WILL KEEP LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

&&

990 
FXUS64 KMRX 201910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT WED OCT 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN DURING 
THE PERIOD...ALONG WITH DRIER AIR. WILL SEE A MAINLY CLEAR SKY BOTH 
PERIODS. THERE MAY BE SOME PATCHY FROST TONIGHT IN THE NORMALLY 
COLDER VALLEY LOCATIONS...BUT DOES NOT LOOK SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH FOR A 
FROST ADVISORY SO WILL JUST INCLUDE IN DATABASE AND MENTION IN ZFP. 
WILL STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE COMING 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN UNSETTLED PATTERN 
FOR NEXT WEEK...BUT STILL REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE EXACT 
DETAILS. SINCE THE ECMWF MODEL HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT (AND USUALLY 
VERIFIES BETTER) THAN THE GFS MODEL IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WILL 
TREND THE FORECAST TOWARDS THE ECMWF MODEL. ALSO...THE LATEST 12Z 
GFS MODEL RUN HAS TRENDED CLOSER TO THE ECMWF MODEL...SO FEEL BETTER 
ABOUT THE ECMWF SOLUTION. WITH THIS IN MIND...IT APPEARS THAT HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE REGION THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH A MAJOR 
SHIFT IN THE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN TO A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME 
BEGINNING BY SUNDAY (LEADING TO A RAPID RISE IN TEMPS AND MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE REGION). MODELS AGREE THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY...WITH SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY COMBINING TO PRODUCE SOME SCATTERED CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH AT LEAST A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS THROUGH WEDNESDAY. A 
STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY...WHICH WILL LIKELY BRING A SIGNIFICANT AND 
CONVECTIVELY-ACTIVE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE 
LATEST GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS WHICH ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

THESE SITES BACK TO VFR FAIRLY QUICKLY AS THE DRIER ATMOSPHERE
FILTERS IN THIS MORNING.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

592 
FXUS64 KMRX 200724
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT WED OCT 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT WAVE TROF WILL MAKE PROGRESS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS BY LATE MORNING BRINGING 
AN END TO THE LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SHOULD SEE 
SUNSHINE THROUGH BREAKS IN THE MID DECK ESPECIALLY WESTERN SECTIONS 
THIS MORNING WITH A CLEARING TREND DEVELOPING ACROSS THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON. CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED 
TONIGHT AS DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW FILLS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTED UPPER 
TROUGH. TRENDED MAX/MIN TEMPS TOWARD THE WARMER GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A SURGE OF COLDER AIR WILL 
ARRIVE THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE JET STREAM DIPS DOWN INTO THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIAN REGION. THIS SHOULD BRING SOME COOLER TEMPS TO 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...WITH SOME SPOTS POSSIBLY GETTING 
CLOSE TO FREEZING UNDER CLEAR SKIES. A BUILDING RIDGE WILL BRING 
WARMER TEMPERATURES FOR FRIDAY...WITH A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPING BEHIND THE RIDGE AXIS FOR SATURDAY WILL PROVIDE ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPS AND INCREASING CLOUDS.

THE GFS HAS SHOWN POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY BEYOND 96 HOURS...AND 
HAS SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES WITH THE ECMWF AND THE CANADIAN MODELS. 
THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN SHOW A SHORTWAVE TROUGH BRINGING A CHANCE OF 
RAIN SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. THE GFS SHOWS A CLOSED SOUTHERN STREAM 
LOW TRACKING ACROSS TEXAS AND THE DEEP SOUTH...PRODUCING A LOT OF 
PRECIP FOR US ON TUESDAY. IT DOES APPEAR THAT WITH EITHER 
SCENARIO...WE WILL BE SOLIDLY IN THE WARM SECTOR FOR THE BEGINNING 
OF THE WEEK...WITH TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL. SINCE CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW...WILL NOT MAKE MUCH OF A CHANGE TO THE LAST THREE DAYS OF 
THE FORECAST...WILL JUST INCREASE TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  42  73  40  70 /  20   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  42  73  40  70 /  20   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              68  37  70  33  64 /  20   0   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 200219
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 PM EDT TUE OCT 19 2010

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE FRONT SHIFTING QUICKLY SE IN RESPONSE TO LEE 
SIDE LOW TO THE EAST. BEST UPPER SUPPORT OVER WEST TN WILL MOVE OVER 
E TN OVERNIGHT. PCPN WILL LIKELY BROADEN ALONG AND WEST OF FRONT AS 
UPPER FEATURE MOVES INTO THE AREA. PCPN COVERAGE ALONG SW MRX CWA 
BORDER MORE WIDESPREAD THAN EXPECTED SO MOVED UP TIMING OF LIKELY 
POPS ACROSS THE CWA. COOLER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE E TN VALLEY LATE 
SO COOLISH MINS LOOK OK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT.  ASSOCIATED SHOWERS WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE FRONT AND BRING WIDESPREAD LIGHT SHOWERS TO THE AREA.  
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL AVERAGE BELOW A QUARTER OF AN INCH WITH 
RAINFALL EXITING THE AREA EARLY IN THE MORNING.   BEHIND THE 
FRONT...SKIES WILL CLEAR.  ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 60S AND 70S ACROSS 
MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. 

LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...INITIALLY SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE AND NORTHWEST FLOW WILL RESULT IN CLEAR SKIES AND 
SEASONABLE TEMPS THROUGH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. WILL NEED TO CONTINUE 
TO WATCH TEMPS ON THURSDAY NIGHT IN SHELTERED AREAS...BUT STILL 
BELIEVE THAT TEMPS SHOULD BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S 
AT MOST LOCATIONS. 

UPPER RIDGING WILL SET UP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND TENNESSEE
VALLEY BY SATURDAY IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH...PROGGED BY 
GFS/ECMWF TO BE ACROSS THE UPPER PLAINS BY 12Z SATURDAY. WITH WARM 
ADVECTION IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND...EXPECT A SLOW
INCREASE IN MID-HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE BY SUNDAY.

A SHORT WAVE AT 500 MILLIBARS WILL MOVE THROUGH WESTERN AND SOUTH
CENTRAL KENTUCKY ON SUNDAY...PLACING THE FORECAST AREA IN A GOOD
PVA AREA BY SUNDAY...ALTHOUGH MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING. WILL FOR
NOW JUST KEEP IN GOING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AND WILL ALLOW FOR LATER
MODEL RUNS TO SEE IF WE HAVE CONSISTENCY BEFORE INCREASING PRECIP
CHANCES FOR THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. 

A SECOND SHORT WAVE ALONG SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED BY
GFS/ECMWF TO PUSH EASTWARD ACROSS THE AREA ON MONDAY. GFS MODEL HAS
INCREASED POPS FOR FORECAST AREA INTO THE LIKELY CATEGORY...BUT
AGAIN WILL NEED TO HAVE AT LEAST ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR SO TO ACCOUNT
FOR CONSISTENCY BEFORE INCREASING POPS MUCH. WITH POTENTIAL FOR
MORE CLOUDS BY LATTER PART OF THE FORECAST PERIODS...WILL CONTINUE
WITH SLIGHTLY TRENDED TEMPS A LITTLE LOWER THAN GFS TEMPS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

IMPROVE WITH SKIES CLEARING BY THE END OF THE TAF PERIOD.  AS FOR

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT TUE OCT 19 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A FRONT THAT HAS BEEN STATIONARY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PUSH 
SOUTHWARD TODAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH PROGRESSES FROM THE FROM THE 
PLAINS TO THE APPALACHIANS. TODAY SHOULD BE DRY BUT WITH INCREASING 
HIGH AND MIDLEVEL CLOUDS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW THE LOW LEVELS 
REMAINING QUITE DRY UNTIL AFTER 00Z. THE FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AROUND 00Z. MOST OF THE PRECIP LOOKS 
TO BE LOCATED BEHIND THE FRONT...ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE IN 
THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET AND 500 MB PVA. THE BEST LIFT 
OCCURS IN A WINDOW BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS 
IN THIS TIME FRAME. PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT WITH THE 
PROGRESSIVE UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONT...LESS THAN A QUARTER 
INCH ON AVERAGE. DRY AIR SHOULD QUICKLY FOLLOW THE PASSAGE OF THE 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS WEDNESDAY MORNING...WITH CLEAR SKIES BY THE 
AFTERNOON. COLD ADVECTION SHOULD KEEP TEMPS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 
70S IN MOST SPOTS WEDNESDAY.

A DRY NORTHWEST FLOW AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING EAST OVER THE MS 
VALLEY WILL PROVIDE CLEAR SKIES FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT. LOWS COULD APPROACH FREEZING BOTH NIGHTS IN SHELTERED 
VALLEYS...BUT MOST SPOTS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF LIFTS OUT ON FRIDAY ALLOWING FOR
RISING HEIGHTS AND TEMPERATURES AS THE MEAN FLOW STRENGTHENS OUT OF
THE SOUTHWEST. MOISTURE STARTS TO INCREASE IN THIS FLOW PATTERN BY
SUNDAY/MONDAY. AT LEAST A COUPLE SHORT WAVE FEATURES WILL RIDE
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THIS PERIOD
INCREASING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS. PLACED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP
SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INCREASING TO LOW CHANCE
PROBABILITY ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. TRENDED TEMP FORECAST
TOWARD BUT NOT QUITE AS WARM AS NEW MEX MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT MON OCT 18 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS IT SLOWLY SHIFTS 
AWAY FROM THE REGION.  HOWEVER...UPPER AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL

WILL INHIBIT TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY...THOUGH TUESDAY HIGHS WILL STILL 
BE ABOVE NORMAL...REACHING INTO THE 70S TO NEAR 80 ACROSS MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE 
EAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. NAM MODEL IS MORE AGRESSIVE WITH 
THE UPPER SUPPORT WITH A MUCH STRONGER AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL 
CIRCULATION DUE TO THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. WILL TREND TOWARD THE 
WEAKER GFS SINCE THE THERE SINCE TO BE LESS INTERACTION FROM THE 
NORTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. HOWEVER...WILL
CONTINUE WITH A HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS.

SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE EARLY BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH AN UPPER 
TROUGH BECOMING ESTABLISHED OVER THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR THE 
LATER HALF OF THE WEEK. DRY NORTHWEST FLOW AND SURFACE RIDGING WILL 
PRODUCE MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WITH NEAR-SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES.

FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...A SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES INTO THE SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES WITH RIDGING SURFACE 
AND ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHEAST. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE (MAINLY MID AND 
HIGH LEVEL) FOR THIS WEEKEND. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY. WILL INCLUDE LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY...BUT OVERALL UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS 
WILL BE THE RULE FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
418 AM EDT MON OCT 18 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
ANOTHER DRY AND MILD DAY IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE AREA AS WEAK HIGH 
PRESSURE LINGERS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A FRONT WILL REMAIN 
STALLED TO OUR NORTH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...WHILE AN UPPER LEVEL 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL APPROACH FROM THE WEST. THIS TROUGH WILL BRING 
SCATTERED TO BROKEN CIRRUS TODAY...BUT SHOULD NOT BE SIGNIFICANT 
ENOUGH TO DETER A CONTINUED WARMING TREND. HIGHS WILL REACH THE 
LOWER 80S IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...WITH MID TO UPPER 70S IN MOST 
OTHER SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE IN THE 40S 
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS FAIRLY SIMILAR ON A 
FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA. FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION QUICKLY ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT BRINGING THE RETURN OF DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. MODELS INDICATING A FRONT ENTER THE AREA 
FOR THE WEEKEND. WITH CONSIDERABLE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE GFS AND 
THE ECMWF ON TIMING AND LOCATION OF THE DEEPEST MOISTURE...WILL KEEP 
A DRY FORECAST GOING FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY FOR NOW. TEMPERATURES 
STILL SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

928 
FXUS64 KMRX 171839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN OCT 17 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS 
PROGGED TO BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
ON MONDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. THIS COLD FRONT 
SHOULD THEN SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BEGINS TO AMPLIFY SOME. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER 
THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON...WITH 
SCATTERED SHOWERS DEVELOPING AREAWIDE ON TUESDAY NIGHT AS AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. NAM MODEL REVEALS 
MORE MOISTURE THAN THE GFS MODEL FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...AND FOR NOW 
WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAXES THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS. WILL PLAN TO TREND 
TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ISOLATED SHOWERS SHOULD 
CONTINUE INTO WEDNESDAY AS A WEAK COLD FRONT BEGINS TO PULL AWAY 
FORM THE REGION. A SURFACE HIGH FILLS IN BEHIND THE FRONT AND WILL 
DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. THIS WILL RETURN US 
TO A DRY AND QUIET WEATHER PATTERN. MODEL CONSISTENCY QUITE POOR BY 
THE END OF THE PERIOD...ESPECIALLY IN REGARDS TO AN APPROACHING 
SYSTEM. WITH CONFIDENCE IN TIMING SO LOW...WILL KEEP THINGS DRY ON 
SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SAT OCT 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY 
AND MID WEST. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...AND BECOME QUASI- 
STATIONARY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND SOUTHEAST KY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE VERY LIMITED 
ALONG THIS FRONT...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL 
SOME LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS...AND WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS 
THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS WHICH HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY. WITH 
CURRENT DEWPOINTS IN THE 30S ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...THINK 
THAT TEMPS FOR TONIGHT SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S AREAWIDE AS THE HIGH 
PRESSURE AREA BECOMES CENTERED OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH MINS 
TONIGHT EXPECTED TO BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN THIS 
MORNING...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE ANOTHER FROST ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE 
ACROSS THE REGION AROUND THE TUESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. SOME 
DISCREPANCY IN TIMING REMAINS AS MODELS TRENDING A BIT FASTER. FOR 
NOW...HAVE ADDED LOW POPS IN OUR NORTHWEST LATE TUESDAY WITH HIGHEST 
POPS REMAINING IN PLACE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TO LINGER 
SHOWERS INTO WEDNESDAY...THOUGH PRECIP MAY EXIT AT LEAST WESTERN 
LOCATIONS BY THIS TIME. SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR 
A DRY AND QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD. GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS STILL ON TRACK AND REMAINED CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SAT OCT 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER MIDDLE TN TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...WITH A DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THIS WILL RESULT IN CLEAR 
SKIES WITH LIGHT WINDS THROUGH THE PERIOD. MAIN FORECAST ISSUE WILL 
BE TEMPERATURES. LEANED A LITTLE TOWARD THE WARM SIDE OF MOS 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS TODAY AS HIGHS YESTERDAY WERE A BIT ABOVE MOS. 
WENT SLIGHTLY ABOVE GFS MOS FOR LOW TEMPS TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD 
AGAIN BE IN THE MID 30S IN SOME SPOTS. ANOTHER FROST ADVISORY MAY BE 
NEEDED...AND ISOLATED SHELTERED VALLEYS COULD GET TO FREEZING. 
ALTHOUGH AFTERNOON MINIMUM RELATIVE HUMIDITIES SHOULD BE UNDER 30 
PERCENT...LIGHTER WINDS SHOULD REDUCE THE FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS FROM 
YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHERS INTO TUESDAY. MODELS FAIRLY SIMILAR ON 
TRACKING A WEAK FRONT THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL KEEP ONLY 20-40 PERCENT 
CHANCE POPS GOING...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON TUESDAY NIGHT. FRONT 
IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION QUICKLY ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING 
THE RETURN OF DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN. TEMPERATURES STILL ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT FRI OCT 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.
CLEAR SKY AND LIGHT-CALM WINDS WILL BE THE RULE WITH DRY AIRMASS
LOWERING AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES BACK INTO THE 20S. WILL CONTINUE RFW
FOR THIS EVENING...BUT LIGHT WINDS FOR SATURDAY WILL KEEP AREA OUT
OF RFW CRITERIA FOR TOMORROW.

THESE CONDITIONS COMBINED WITH TEMEPRATURES IN THE 30S WILL ALLOW
SCATTERED FROST TO DEVELOP OVERNIGH-SATURDAY MORNING...SO HAVE
ISSUED A FROST ADVISORY AREA-WIDE. SOME STEAM FOG IS POSSIBLE NEAR
AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO 
FLATTEN OVER THE AREA...BECOMING ZONAL BY MONDAY.  THIS WILL PROVIDE 
CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED.  A 
WEAK COLD FRONT SLIDES THROUGH THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY 
FOR OUR ONLY CHANCE OF PRECIP DURING THE EXTENDED.  MOISTURE AND 
LIFT LIMITED AND WILL HAVE POPS AT 20 TO 30.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT FOR A RETURN TO A QUIET AND DRY WEATHER PATTERN FOR 
THE REST OF THE PERIOD.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND DIDN/T 
STRAY MUCH.

541 
FXUS64 KMRX 150735
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT FRI OCT 15 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE ONGOING FROST ADVISORY WILL BE CONTINUED...THOUGH IT APPEARS 
THAT THE THREAT OF FROST WILL BE FAIRLY ISOLATED. THE COLDEST 
TEMPERATURES IN THE ADVISORY AREA ARE IN THE UPPER 30S...AND CURRENT 
DEWPOINTS SUGGEST THAT TEMPS WILL DROP NO LOWER THAN THE MID 30S. 
THE 8 AM END TIME FOR THE ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD AND WILL NOT BE 
CHANGED.

LOW PRESSURE OVER NORTHERN IN WILL DROP SOUTHEAST TO NC THROUGH THE 
DAY...WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE AREA AROUND 
MIDDAY. SATELLITE TRENDS AND MODEL MOISTURE PROFILES SUGGEST SOME 
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS IN NORTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE FROPA...OTHERWISE SKIES 
WILL BE SUNNY. WINDS WILL BE GUSTY...AROUND 30 MPH...AND SHIFT FROM 
SW IN THE MORNING TO W-NW AFTER FROPA. RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL BE IN 
THE 25-30 PERCENT RANGE...POTENTIALLY CREATING SOME FIRE CONCERNS. 
WILL COORDINATE WITH STATE FORESTRY OFFICIALS LATER THIS MORNING ON 
THE NEED FOR ANY FIRE DANGER STATEMENTS. 

TEMPS AND WINDS WILL DROP OFF QUICKLY AT SUNSET AS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. TEMPS TONIGHT SHOULD DROP AT LEAST AS 
LOW IF NOT LOWER THAN THIS MORNING...SO A FROST ADVISORY WILL LIKELY 
BE NEEDED AGAIN...WITH POSSIBLY MORE COUNTIES INCLUDED. WILL DEFER 
TO THE DAY SHIFT TO ISSUE ANY ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT. CANNOT RULE OUT 
A FREEZE IN SOME AREAS TOO...BUT CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH ENOUGH YET 
TO ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHERS INTO TUESDAY. MODELS FAIRLY 
SIMILAR ON TRACKING A WEAK FRONT THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL KEEP ONLY 20 PERCENT 
CHANCE POPS GOING FOR NOW. FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION 
QUICKLY ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING THE RETURN OF DRY WEATHER ON 
THURSDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. TEMPERATURES STILL ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  

&&

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              66  35  67  35  72 /   0   0   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EDT THU OCT 14 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BE THE DOMINATE WEATHER MAKER FOR THE SHORT-TERM. ANOTHER WEAK 
SHORT-WAVE WILL ROTATE AROUND NORTHEAST UPPER TROUGH...BUT 
ASSOCIATED CLOUDS AND SHOWERS WILL BE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA.

MAIN CONCERN WILL BE AREAS AND PATCHY FROST OVERNIGHT. HAVE ISSUED A 
FROST ADVISORY FOR THE PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE...FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA.

CLEAR SKY AND LIGHT-CALM WINDS MAY PRODUCE AREAS OF FOG NEAR AREA 
LAKES AND STREAMS...SO HAVE INCLUDED PATCHY FOG IN THE FORECAST AS 
WELL FOR TONIGHT-EARLY FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
CENTRAL U.S. EARLY IN THE PERIOD WILL PUT THE MRX CWA IN DRY 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.  THE RIDGE SLOWLY DAMPENS OVER THE REGION 
DURING THE WEEKEND WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING ZONAL BY MONDAY.  THIS 
WILL BE A DRY AND QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE AREA.  A WEAK FRONT 
SLIDES INTO THE AREA LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE AND LIFT 
MINIMAL...SO HAVE KEPT POPS LOW FOR FRONTAL PASSAGE.  DRIER AIR 
MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS FOR 
THURSDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOKS REASONABLE 
AND STAYED CLOSE.

FXUS64 KMRX 140711
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EDT THU OCT 14 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT AND ACCOMPANYING PRECIP 
CURRENTLY SWINGING THROUGH THE EAST TENNESSEE REGION. MODELS 
GENERALLY AGREE THAT FRONT WILL PUSH RAPIDLY EASTWARD AND MAINLY OUT 
OF THE AREA BY DAYBREAK. HAVE RETAINED SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS 
FOR THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS THROUGH THE MORNING 
HOURS WITH ALL AREAS DRY BY AFTERNOON AS AXIS OF AMPLIFIED UPPER 
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
DOMINATES THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE SHORT TERM. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE FROM MAV GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...EXTENDED FORECAST GRIDS
WERE GENERALLY RIGHT ON TRACK WITH JUST A FEW TWEAKS TO FRIDAY AND
ALSO LATE TUESDAY. SHORTWAVE DROPPING ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN ON
FRIDAY...AND THE TIGHT SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT ON BACK SIDE OF
DEPARTING LOW PRESSURE...WILL CREATE BREEZY TO WINDY CONDITIONS
FRIDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT. SPEEDS MAY REACH WIND ADVISORY
CRITERIA FOR SW VA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NE TN...WHICH LATER
SHIFTS CAN ISSUE AS/IF NEEDED. I ALSO SUSPECT THAT THESE WINDS MAY
KEEP MIN TEMPS UP A BIT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...SO I TRENDED TOWARD THE
MILDER NAM MOS MINS OVER THE COOLER GFS MINS.

OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGE STILL ADVERTISED TO FLATTEN ON MONDAY WITH
AN EAST TO WEST SLOW MOVING WEAK COLD FRONT PROGGED TO SAG
SOUTHWARD ON TUESDAY. LATEST GFS AND ECMWF LET THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
EASE INTO FORECAST AREA BY LATE TUESDAY...SO I ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS FOR ALL BUT FAR SOUTHERN COUNTIES ON TUESDAY NIGHT. TIMING OF
SUCH A WEAK FRONT IN THE NEAR ZONAL FLOW ALOFT DOES NOT JUSTIFY
INCREASING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AT THIS TIME.

MAX AND MIN TEMPS ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY IN LINE WITH THE LATEST MOS
GUIDANCE AND NEIGHBORS GRIDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 131905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT WED OCT 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING. A SOUTHERN STREAM JET OVER THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY COMBINED WITH AND A NORTHERN STREAM JET ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY WILL PRODUCE STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE. THE BEST 
DIVERGENCE WILL BE OVER EAST KENTUCKY...WEST VIRGINIA...AND OHIO. 
ALSO...LARGE SCALE ASCENT ASSOCIATED WITH Q-VECTOR FORCING WILL MOVE 
ACROSS EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. 

ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL PULL ACROSS THE AREA AS WELL 
TONIGHT-EARLY THURSDAY. MAIN LIMITING FACTOR IS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
DUE TO RIDING INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO. HOWEVER...ENOUGH 
MOISTURE-MARGINAL INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
SCATTERED-ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS AS FRONT AND UPPER DYNAMICS MOVES 
THROUGH THE AREA. BEST CHANCES WILL BE OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA DUE TO THE CLOSER PROXIMITY TO THE UPPER DYNAMICS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE FORECAST AREA ENJOYS 
THE PROTECTIVE INFLUENCE OF DRY ADVECTION AND RIDGING THROUGH A GOOD 
PORTION OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN ON TUESDAY AS 
PRESSURES START TO FALL ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN CANADA. UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. TOWARD MID WEEK AND 
INCREASING NORTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS FEATURE WILL HELP 
TO DRIVE COOLER AIR INTO THE MID SOUTH. MOISTURE WILL POOL AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT AND LIFTING WILL ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THEREFORE ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE NEW 
MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EDT WED OCT 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW WEAKENS AND PULLS 
AWAY FROM THE REGION TODAY LEAVING RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE BUT ONLY 
WEAK LIFT. HAVE CUT BACK POPS TO CHANCE IN ALL BUT THE NORTHEASTERN 
ZONES WHERE LIKELY POPS STILL APPEAR REASONABLE. COLD FRONT STILL 
POISED TO APPROACH OVERNIGHT TONIGHT PROVIDING SOMEWHAT BETTER LIFT 
ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. INCLUDED CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
THAT AREA TAPERING TO LIKELY POPS IN THE CENTRAL ZONES AND CHANCE IN 
THE SOUTHERN ZONES. FRONT DEPARTS AREA THURSDAY MORNING WITH ABRUPT 
DECREASE IN MOISTURE FOLLOWING FRONT AS TROUGH AXIS SWINGS THROUGH. 
TEMPS EXPECTED TO COOL SIGNIFICANTLY BY THURSDAY.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...DRY WEATHER RETURNS
WITH SEASONABLY COOLER TEMPERATURES. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE DROPS
QUICKLY SE THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY...BUT TOO DRY FOR ANY
PRECIPITATION. W TO NW LOW LEVEL FLOW ON FRIDAY...NORTHERLY ON THE
WEEKEND...THEN A SHIFT TO WEAK S-SW BY MONDAY AND TUESDAY. HEIGHTS
RISE THROUGH THE PERIOD AS UPPER RIDGE OVER THE PLAINS STATES
BUILDS EASTWARD. 

THIS KEEPS TEMPS GENERALLY NEAR NORMAL FOR MID OCTOBER...WITH
HIGHS IN THE 60S AND 70S...AND LOWS IN THE 30S AND 40S.
HOWEVER...I CAN'T RULE OUT A STRAY 80 DEGREE OR ABOVE ON MONDAY.
JUST MINOR TEMP AND DEW POINT TEMP ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO PREVIOUS
GRIDS.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 PM EDT TUE OCT 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW OVER WEST TN IS PROGRESSING SLOWLY TO THE EAST. A LINE OF
SHOWERS OVER SRN MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL WILL AFFECT OUR AREA AFTER
MIDNIGHT. EXPECT THIS LINE TO WEAKEN AS THE ATMOSPHERE STABILIZES A
BIT AFTER SUNSET...BUT THUNDER WILL REMAIN A POSSIBILITY OVERNIGHT
AS MODELS INDICATE ELEVATED INSTABILITY IN OUR SOUTHERN SECTIONS.
THE CURRENT FORECAST END THE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS AT
MIDNIGHT...BUT WILL UPDATE TO EXTEND THIS CHANCE IN SOUTHERN AREAS
THROUGH THE NIGHT. HOURLY TEMPERATURES WILL NEED SOME
ADJUSTMENT...BUT FORECAST LOWS LOOK REASONABLE AND IN LINE WITH
LATEST GUIDANCE.

812 
FXUS64 KMRX 121918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT TUE OCT 12 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW TRACKING THROUGH THE 
REGION TONIGHT. DEEPEST MOISTURE SHOULD MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE 
TONIGHT SO WILL KEEP HIGHEST CHANCES AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. MODELS 
INDICATING SOME INSTABILITY TONIGHT. WILL ADD LOW CHANCE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR TONIGHT. NO SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED TONIGHT. 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ALL SIMILAR SO STAYED CLOSE. THE AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE MOVES OUT OF THE AREA EARLY WEDNESDAY WHICH IS FOLLOWED 
CLOSELY BY A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 
WITH DEEP MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS INTO WEDNESDAY. 
SOME INSTABILITY IS ALSO EXPECTED SO WILL ADD THUNDER FOR WEDNESDAY. 
NO SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED. WITH THE EXTRA CLOUDS...STAYED MORE 
TOWARD BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR HIGHS ON WEDNESDAY.  



.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN
DECENT AGREEMENT THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH MORE SOLUTION
DIVERGENCE LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD. COLD FRONT WILL PUSH EAST
OF THE AREA BY EARLY THURSDAY...AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN. WILL BUMP
POPS UP TO CATEGORICAL NORTH...WITH LIKELY FOR MOST OF THE
REMAINDER OF THE AREA WED NIGHT. ALSO LOOKS UNSTABLE ENOUGH TO
INCLUDE THUNDER FOR WED NIGHT. AFTER SOME LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY
THURSDAY NORTHEAST ZONES...SHOULD SEE CLEARING AS COLDER/DRIER AIR
WORKS IN. APPEARS SECONDARY ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER TROUGH
WILL STAY TO OUR SOUTH...SO LOOKS DRY THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH AT
LEAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. ECMWF TRIES TO BRING WEEK FRONT INTO THE
AREA BY TUESDAY...WHILE GFS SHOWS MORE VIGOROUS/SLOWER SYSTEM THAT
ARRIVES AFTER TUESDAY. FOR NOW WILL KEEP THINGS DRY MONDAY AND
TUESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE LOWER FOR LAST FEW PERIODS OF THE
FORECAST.

&&

295 
FXUS64 KMRX 121413
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1013 AM EDT TUE OCT 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS TRACKING ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN AHEAD THE UPPER LOW. WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE IN THE LOW 
LEVELS...PROBABLY WON'T SEE MUCH MEASURABLE RAIN TODAY...BUT WILL 
UPDATE FORECAST TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE CWA FOR TODAY. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF FORECAST ON TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW SPINNING OVER SE 
KANSAS THIS MORNING WITH INCREASING MID AND HIGH CLOUDS ON THE SE 
SIDE OF THE UPPER LOW. HOWEVER...SKY COVER STILL CLEAR TO PARTLY 
CLOUDY ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA. SPOTTY SHOWERS NOTED OVER MIDDLE TN 
BUT I DON'T EXPECT MUCH CHANCE OF MEASURABLE RAIN UNTIL LATE THIS
AFTERNOON...AND MORE SO OVERNIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. TIME HEIGHTS AND 
SOUNDINGS FROM 12/00Z MODELS SHOW AIRMASS STAYING RATHER DRY FOR THE 
FIRST PERIOD BELOW 700 MBS. THE ECMWF DOES NOT PRODUCE MEASURABLE 
RAINS UNTIL LATE TONIGHT AND BEYOND. HOWEVER...I DID ADD SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SE TN LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND ALSO NUDGED POPS UP 
JUST A BIT FOR TONIGHT. 

OTHERWISE...TEMPS START A DOWNWARD TREND TODAY AS CLOUDS GRADUALLY 
THICKEN AHEAD OF THE UPPER LOW. STAYED CLOSE TO GFS OR JUST A SLIGHT 
BLEND WITH COOLER NAM MOS FOR HIGHS. MOS MINS REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT 
AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE IN 
REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE LONG TERM. UPPER FLOW 
AMPLIFIES EARLY IN THE LONG TERM AS TROUGH DIGS INTO THE EASTERN 
CONUS. THIS FEATURE IS PROJECTED TO PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE LATE WEDNESDAY TO EARLY THURSDAY TIME 
FRAME. HAVE BUMPED UP POPS FOR BOTH WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS 
THIS PROCESS UNFOLDS. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM APPEARS DRY AT THIS 
TIME AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AND UPPER FLOW SLOWLY 
DEAMPLIFIES THROUGH THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID 
NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
WILL KEEP HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IN 
AVAILABLE. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED FOR PERIOD WHICH 
IS INDICATED BY THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS...SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A CHANGE IN THE 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  THIS WILL BRING A 
CHANCE OF PRECIP TO THE AREA...THOUGH MOISTURE IS LIMITED AND WILL 
KEEP POPS AT 20 TO 30.  THE ACCOMPANYING UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY FROM 
THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND WITH DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SETTING UP 
ONCE AGAIN.  THIS WILL PROVIDE DRY AND COOL CONDITIONS FOR 
SATURDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE ESTABLISHES ITSELF ONCE AGAIN BY THE END OF 
THE WEEKEND WITH A BIT WARMER AND CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS FOR 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

497 
FXUS64 KMRX 111335
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 AM EDT MON OCT 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION PROVIDING A WARM AND DRY TODAY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST 
OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SAME PERSISTENT SURFACE AND UPPER 
RIDGE WILL PROVIDE YET ANOTHER SUNNY AND WARM DAY FOR THE REGION...
WITH RECORD HIGHS POSSIBLE IN A FEW SPOTS. CHA MOST LIKELY SPOT... 
WHERE THE RECORD HIGH OF 87 DEGREES IN 1954 LOOKS IN JEOPARDY. WILL 
INCLUDE NEAR RECORD HIGH WORDING FOR ALL GROUPS AS OTHER MOS SITES 
WOULD APPEAR TO ALSO BE CLOSE. TYS RECORD IS 86 IN 1954...AND TRI
RECORD IS 85 SET IN 1954 AND 1970. 

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS SUGGEST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MAINLY HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS OR PATCHY MID DECK BEFORE DAYBREAK TUESDAY. OTHERWISE...
MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED QUITE GOOD FOR TODAY AND WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 
GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT ONCE AGAIN LOOKED TOO COOL...SO I STAYED 
CLOSER TO A BLEND WITH THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CHANGES WITH CURRENT WEATHER
PATTERN WILL BEGIN TUESDAY. UPPER LOW NOW OVER CENTRAL PLAINS MOVES
EAST WITH MOISTURE SPREADING INTO THE TN VALLEY. CLOUDS WILL BE
INCREASING AND HIGHS SHOULD BE HELD DOWN A FEW DEGREES EXCEPT
POSSIBLY IN FAR EASTERN AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS. UPPER LOW OPENS UP 
AS NEW TROUGH DIGS SOUTH ACROSS EASTERN STATES. LOW PRESSURE AREA AND
WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES INTO WESTERN TN VALLEY BY TUESDAY EVENING.
ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS LOW AND COLD
FRONT WEAKENS AS NEW TROUGH DEVELOPS TO THE NW AND DIGS SOUTH INTO
OHIO VALLEY. NEW STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH EARLY
THURSDAY WITH RAIN CHANCES ENDING BY EVENING. MUCH COOLER
TEMPERATURES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE AND NW FLOW MOVES
INTO FORECAST AREA. SUNNY AND SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES CONTINUE
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  53  85  55  81 /   0   0  10  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  52  82  54  78 /   0   0  10  20  30

WOULD APPEAR TO ALSO BE CLOSE. TYS RECORD IS 86 IN 1954...AND TRI
RECORD IS 85 SET IN 1954 AND 1970. 

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS SUGGEST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MAINLY HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS OR PATCHY MID DECK BEFORE DAYBREAK TUESDAY. OTHERWISE...
MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED QUITE GOOD FOR TODAY AND WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 
GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT ONCE AGAIN LOOKED TOO COOL...SO I STAYED 
CLOSER TO A BLEND WITH THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CHANGES WITH CURRENT WEATHER
PATTERN WILL BEGIN TUESDAY. UPPER LOW NOW OVER CENTRAL PLAINS MOVES
EAST WITH MOISTURE SPREADING INTO THE TN VALLEY. CLOUDS WILL BE
INCREASING AND HIGHS SHOULD BE HELD DOWN A FEW DEGREES EXCEPT
POSSIBLY IN FAR EASTERN AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS. UPPER LOW OPENS UP 
AS NEW TROUGH DIGS SOUTH ACROSS EASTERN STATES. LOW PRESSURE AREA AND
WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES INTO WESTERN TN VALLEY BY TUESDAY EVENING.
ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS LOW AND COLD
FRONT WEAKENS AS NEW TROUGH DEVELOPS TO THE NW AND DIGS SOUTH INTO
OHIO VALLEY. NEW STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH EARLY
THURSDAY WITH RAIN CHANCES ENDING BY EVENING. MUCH COOLER
TEMPERATURES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE AND NW FLOW MOVES
INTO FORECAST AREA. SUNNY AND SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES CONTINUE
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  53  85  55  81 /   0   0  10  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  52  82  54  78 /   0   0  10  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  52  83  53  78 /   0   0  10  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  45  82  49  76 /   0   0  10  10  20

FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND INTO 
THURSDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL KEEP ONLY LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN 
THE NORTH. FRONT TRACKS OUT OF THE AREA QUICKLY ON THURSDAY NIGHT 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN BEHIND IT RESULTING IN DRY WEATHER 
FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED AT 
THE ONSET OF THE PERIOD...THEN BECOME MORE SEASONAL. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

330 
FXUS64 KMRX 101458
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1102 AM EDT SUN OCT 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE STILL DOMINATING OUR WEATHER...WITH ANOTHER PLEASANT AND 
MILD FALL DAY IN STORE. PERSISTENCE FOR TEMPS...ESPECIALLY FOR MAXES 
WITH CHA POSSIBLY REACHING A RECORD HIGH FOR THIS DATE OF 88 
DEGREES. TREND HAS BEEN FOR EACH MOS SITE TO WARM ABOUT 1 OR 2 
DEGREES EACH DAY...WHICH MAKES GFS MOS HIGHS TOUGH TO BEAT.

MINS AND DEW POINT TEMPS A BIT TOUGHER CALL...WITH GFS MINS STILL 
OVERALL ON THE COOL SIDE. I DID MAKE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO PREVIOUS 
MIN TEMP GRID...BASED ON LOWS THIS MORNING AND TREND OVER THE PAST 
FEW DAYS...WITH CLOSER TO A BLEND OF MOS THE BETTER CHOICE. DEW 
POINT TEMPS HAVE BEEN DROPPING SOME DURING THE DAY DUE TO MIXING... 
THEN RECOVERING OVERNIGHT. A FEW TWEAKS OF PREVIOUS DEW POINT TEMPS 
WAS FAVORED OVER POPULATING WITH LATEST MOS GUIDANCE.

OTHERWISE...WOULD NOT RULE OUT SOME PATCHY VALLEY FOG NEAR/ALONG 
AREA LAKES AND STREAMS...BUT NOT WIDESPREAD OR DENSE ENOUGH TO 
MENTION THIS MORNING.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...PERSISTENT PATTERN CONTINUES 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER FORECAST AREA. 
ELSEWHERE CUTOFF UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES INTO SOUTHERN PLAINS AS UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES INTO NE STATES. THE UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST 
INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY TUESDAY. INCREASING MOISTURE WILL SPREAD 
SOME CLOUDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH 
MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE UPPER LOW WITH SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT. PREFER 
SLOWER ECMWF WHICH OPENS UP UPPER LOW AND MERGES WITH TROUGH MOVING 
INTO THE EASTERN STATES WEDNESDAY. THEN COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND 
PASSES THROUGH THURSDAY. MUCH ABOVE NORMAL HIGH TEMPERATURES TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY THEN SLIGHTLY COOLER WEDNESDAY AND MUCH 
COOLER THURSDAY AS COLD FRONT BRINGS COLDER AIR MASS INTO REGION. 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  52  87  53  85 /   0   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  49  83  52  82 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  49  83  52  83 /   0   0  10  10  10

095 
FXUS64 KMRX 091457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SAT OCT 9 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
EXTENDING FROM THE SRN OHIO VALLEY INTO THE SRN APPALACHIANS THIS 
MORNING...WHILE UPPER RIDGE HOLDS FROM THE UPPER MS VALLEY REGION 
ACROSS THE SE STATES. VERY DRY AIR MASS AND LIGHT WINDS ALLOWING 
TEMPS TO DROP CLOSER TO THE MILDER NAM 12Z MOS MINS...LEAVING THE 
GFS MOS MINS MUCH TOO COOL.

PERSISTENCE FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK WITH LOTS OF SUNSHINE...AFTER
SOME PATCHY FOG AND LOW CLOUDS NEAR BODIES OF WATER ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. ADDED A DEGREE OR TWO TO FRIDAY MAX 
TEMPS...MUCH IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS. GFS MOS LOOKS SEVERAL 
DEGREES TOO COOL FOR MINS TONIGHT...ALTHO A DRY AIRMASS AND NEAR 
CALM WINDS CONTINUE. TRENDED CLOSE TO OR JUST BELOW THE NAM MOS 
MINS. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH PERSISTENT WARM TEMPERATURES EACH 
DAY AND LOWS IN THE 40S TO THE TO THE LOWER 50S. UPPER LOW MOVES 
INTO CENTRAL STATES BY TUESDAY WITH RIDGE STILL IN PLACE ACROSS TN 
VALLEY STILL NOT MUCH CHANGE IN TEMPERATURES. TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MOISTURE INCREASES AS UPPER LOW OPENS AS UPPER TROUGH 
DROPS INTO EASTERN STATES. ADDED POPS INTO WESTERN AREAS WEDNESDAY 
AND CONTINUE POPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. GFS SHOWS THIS 
SYSTEM MOVING IN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY BUT ECMWF SHOWS 
STRONGER PART OF SYSTEM WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. FOLLOWED 
CLOSER TO ECMWF TRENDS. CLEARING SKIES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AND 
COOLER TEMPERATURES BEHIND FRONT.

&&

OF NORTH AMERICA TODAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL FOR THE 
PERIOD. LIGHT WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE. MOS TEMP 
GUIDANCE SOMEWHAT BAFFLED WITH WHAT APPEARS TO BE NEARLY PERSISTENT 
FORECAST. NAM MOS A TAD COOL DURING THE DAY AND GFS APPEARS TOO COOL 
AT NIGHT. LEANED TOWARD A WARM FORECAST WITH MAX TEMPS DOUBLE DIGITS 
ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER THROUGH INTO THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. 
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  
DEEPEST REMAINS NORTH SO WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRY. A WEAK FRONT FOLLOWS 
ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE 
EXPECTED...WILL KEEP ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH. FRONT TRACKS OUT OF 
THE AREA QUICKLY ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH DRY WEATHER RETURNING ON 
FRIDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED AT THE ONSET OF THE 
PERIOD...THEN BECOME MORE SEASONAL. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  87  53  87  51 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  83  51  83  50 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  84  50  84  49 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              42  81  43  83  45 /   0   0   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1054 AM EDT FRI OCT 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING AWESOME 
FALL WEATHER...AS CLEAR SKIES DOMINATE AND TEMPS CONTINUE A SLOW 
RISE. MAXES YESTERDAY LED ME TO GO CLOSER TO THE MILDER MAXES FOR 
TODAY...WHILE THE GFS MOS MINS LOOK SEVERAL DEGREES TOO COOL FOR 
TONIGHT. THE NAM MOS MINS SEEMED A TAD TOO HIGH...SO I COMPROMISED 
CLOSER TO A BLEND MESH WITH OUR LATEST MIN TEMP GRID.  

OTHERWISE...NO REAL CONCERNS EXCEPT FOR POSSIBLY SOME PATCHY EARLY 
MORNING FOG NEAR LAKES/STREAMS/ETC.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
FROM SUNDAY THROUGH MID WEEK WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES. UPDATED FORECAST TO REMOVE RAIN CHANCES MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY. UPPER LOW DEVELOPS OVER NORTH CENTRAL STATES SUNDAY BUT 
MOVES ONLY VERY SLOWLY SOUTH. BY WEDNESDAY TROUGH MOVES INTO CENTRAL 
STATES. COLD FRONT DEVELOPS AHEAD OF TROUGH AND MOVES INTO MS VALLEY 
WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM PROGRESSES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
INCREASING THURSDAY. DID NOT CHANGE HIGH TEMPERATURES MUCH SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY BUT RAISED HIGHS MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS NOW LESS 
CLOUD COVER AND WEAK RIDGE STILL IN PLACE UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY. 
FOLLOWED WARMER MET GUIDANCE FOR LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT AS MAV GUIDANCE 
HAS BEEN RUNNING TO COOL.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

738 AM EDT THU OCT 7 2010

.DISCUSSION...FROST AND FOG NO LONGER A PROBLEM THIS MORNING. WEAK

SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PATCHY FROST POSSIBLE EARLY THIS 
MORNING AND A FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 13Z.  
OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD IN WITH DRY 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.  THE RESULT OF THIS WILL BE CLEAR AND DRY 
CONDITIONS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WILL AID A 
WARMING TREND WITH HIGHS EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE 70S ACROSS MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS.  

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL BE IN 
CONTROL THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH TRANQUIL WEATHER IN STORE AND 
TEMPS ON THE WARM SIDE.  UPPER TROUGH MOVING IN BY MONDAY...BUT 
MODELS DIVERGING A BIT ON TIMING AND HOW MUCH OF AN IMPACT IT WILL 
HAVE.  FOR NOW WILL MAKE NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE LATER 
PERIODS...WITH LOW POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. HIGH LEVEL OF 
UNCERTAINTY FOR WEDNESDAY...AS SURFACE COLD FRONT MAY BE APPROACHING 
OR MOVING THROUGH...SO FOR NOW WILL JUST BEEF UP CLOUDS A BIT AND 
KEEP THINGS DRY. GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY 
SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
859 PM EDT WED OCT 6 2010

.DISCUSSION...
MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS THE POSSIBILITY OF FROST THURSDAY MORNING.
SURFACE RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL ALLOW WINDS TO 
DECOUPLE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SHELTERED VALLEYS. A FAIRLY WIDE
OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPERATURE RANGE IS EXPECTED. EVEN THOUGH MOST OF
THE AIRPORT STATIONS MAY NOT SEE TEMPERATURES BELOW 40 DEGREES...
OUTLYING AREAS (ESPECIALLY SHELTERED VALLEYS) WILL LIKELY
EXPERIENCE LOWS IN THE MID AND UPPER 30S...WHICH WILL ALLOW FROST
TO FORM.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND NO CHANGES PLANNED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT WED OCT 6 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...WEAK UPPER TROF MOVES SE 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. TRAILING LOWER LEVEL TROF MOVES INTO THE 
AREA THURSDAY. A FEW CLOUDS MAY ACCOMPANY H85 TROF TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE CLEAR TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ON TAP. TEMPERATURE 
FORECAST A CHALLENGE. MODELS APPEAR TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH WARM UP 
TONIGHT IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING TROFS. MOUNTAIN TOPS MAY BE A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER TONIGHT. OTHERWISE WENT BELOW GUIDANCE ON TEMPS 
EXPECTING GOOD RADIATION CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT. LOW LAYING VALLEYS 
SHOULD DECOUPLE ALLOWING TEMPS TO FALL ENOUGH FOR SOME FROST 
FORMATION IN OUTLAYING AREAS. METRO AREAS MAY STAY IN THE LOW 40S.   

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE REMAINS 
ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS THROUGH THE UPCOMING WEEKEND 
PER MODELS AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS PROVIDING TRANQUIL CONDITIONS WITH 
TEMPS WARMING TO WELL ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
APPROACHES BY LATE MONDAY BUT MODELS DISAGREE ON THE SIGNIFICANCE OF 
THIS SYSTEM. TENDED TO BE CONSERVATIVE WITH POPS AT THIS TIME GIVEN 
THE MODEL INCONSISTENCIES. TEMPS WILL FALL TO NEAR CLIMO AS UPPER 
TROUGH PERSISTS THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM.

FXUS64 KMRX 061305
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 AM EDT WED OCT 6 2010

.DISCUSSION...PATCHY FROST THIS MORNING MAINLY IN THE NORTHERN
OUTLAYING AREAS. WARMING TREND BEGINNING AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
FROM THE WEST. MAX TEMPS IN LINE TODAY. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...IT WILL BE A COLD START TO THE 
DAY WITH LOWS INTO THE UPPER 30S AND 40S ACROSS MANY LOCATIONS.  A 
FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 13Z.  OTHERWISE...AN UPPER 
LOW WILL CONTINUE TO PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION TODAY...ALLOWING 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD IN.  THIS WILL PROVIDE A DRY...CLEAR 
DAY AND BEGIN A WARMING TREND ACROSS THE AREA.  IT WILL BE ANOTHER 
COLD NIGHT BUT MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD REMAIN IN THE 40S AND AT THIS 
POINT DO NOT EXPECT ANOTHER FROST ADVISORY WILL BE NEEDED.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN AND THE ATMOSPHERE STAYING RATHER DRY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  AN UPPER TROUGH IS FORECAST TO DIG INTO THE 
REGION EARLY IN THE WEEK...SO WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE 
POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS. 


&&

.AVIATION...A FEW MID LEVEL CLOUDS MAY LINGER OVER TRI AREA THIS

THE LOW MOVES AWAY...WINDS WILL INCREASE TO 10 TO 15 MPH WITH AN 
OCCASIONAL GUST POSSIBLE AT TAF SITES.  OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN DURING THE PERIOD FOR CLEAR SKIES AND VFR CONDITIONS.

DEVELOPING AT TRI. AREAS OF FROST LIKELY TOWARD MORNING AS SKIES 
CLEAR AND WINDS BECOME NEAR CALM.

THROUGH AND BEYOND THIS TAF ISSUANCE.
