AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT TUE OCT 5 2010

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS CONTINUE TO ROTATE SOUTHWARD ON BACK SIDE OF 
DEPARTING UPPER LOW...BUT SPOTTY SHOWERS HAVE DISSIPATED. THESE 
CLOUDS WILL AFFECT SW VA AND NE TN AREAS...WHERE DECREASING CLOUDS 
ARE FORECAST. 

THE CLOUDS AND LIGHT NORTHERLY WINDS ARE TEMPORARILY KEEPING CURRENT 
TEMPS SLIGHTLY ABOVE HOURLY GRIDS...BUT WITH CLEARING AND DECOUPLING 
OF WINDS...THE FROSTY MIN TEMP FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK.

MAY TWEAK HOURLY GRIDS BEFORE 11 PM EDT AND UPDATE AFFECTED WEB 
PRODUCTS...PLUS REMOVE AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING IN ZFPMRX.

FXUS64 KMRX 051825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT TUE OCT 5 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW STILL HANGING TO THE 
NORTHEAST AND ROTATING SPOKES OF CLOUDS AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY CAUSING 
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA THIS AFTERNOON. PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES ARE SEEN ON VISIBLE SATELLITE PICTURES CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN AREAS WITH CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS IN THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. 
TEMPERATURES ARE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN MONDAYS FROM LOW TO MID 
50S NE...TO UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S CENTRAL AND MID TO UPPER 60S 
SOUTHWEST. SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS NE SECTIONS NEXT SEVERAL 
HOURS...INTO THE EVENING. CLOUDS WILL DECREASE EARLY THIS EVENING IN 
ALL BUT THE NE AREAS WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING QUICKLY AFTER 
SUNSET. GUIDANCE SHOWING MID 30S TO MID 40S. CLOUDS ACROSS THE NE 
MAY HOLD ON UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT BUT DECREASE AND TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD LOWER TO 40 OR LESS BEFORE SUNRISE. HAVE ALREADY ISSUED FROST 
ADVISORY AND HAVE GONE CLOSE TO COOLER MAV GUIDANCE WITH LOWS 
GENERALLY MID TO UPPER 30S. A FEW PLACES MAY REACH LOWER 30S HIGHER 
MOUNTAINS AND NORMALLY COLDER VALLEYS BUT NOT ENOUGH COVERAGE FOR A 
FREEZE WARNING.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...
AND REVEAL A TYPICAL FALL PATTERN OF STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRY AND QUIET WEATHER THROUGH MONDAY. BY MONDAY NIGHT... 
BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN 
WILL BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED...RESULTING IN THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW 
SHOWERS BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...A 
WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1033 AM EDT TUE OCT 5 2010

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN ACROSS THE MIDDLE
APPALACHIANS WITH CLOUDS ROTATING SOUTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA.
CLOUD COVER NOT AS WIDESPREAD THIS MORNING WITH AREAS OF
FOG...LOCALLY DENSE ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN NOW LIFTING.
TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN GUIDANCE BUT
RELUCTANT TO CHANGE HIGHS WITH CLOUDS MOVING IN FROM THE NORTH AT
THIS TIME. EXPECT A FEW SHOWERS NE THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON AND
POSSIBLY EVENING BEFORE UPPER LOW FINALLY SHIFTS NE AWAY FROM THE
REGION LATER TONIGHT. WITH LOWS TONIGHT EXPECTED IN THE MID TO
UPPER 30S...LOCALLY NEAR FREEZING. WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY
AREA WIDE SHORTLY.

     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY PULL AWAY 
DURING THE PERIOD.  ANOTHER DAY WITH MORE CLOUDS NORTH THAN 
SOUTH...AND POSSIBILITY OF SOME LIGHT SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH.  CLOUDS 
WILL DECREASE BY EARLY TONIGHT...AND WITH LIGHT WINDS TEMPS WILL 
FALL INTO THE MID TO UPPER 30S IN MANY AREAS.  WILL MENTION FROST 
ALL ZONES. MAY NEED A FROST ADVISORY IN PARTS OF THE AREA...BUT WILL 
DEFER TO DAY SHIFT IF ANY ADVISORY IS NEEDED.  JUST A FEW TWEAKS TO 
MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WILL BE IN A QUIET WEATHER 
PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THE 
REGION.  THE RESULT WILL BE CLEAR SKIES AND DRY CONDITIONS WITH A 
BIT OF A WARMING TREND THROUGH THE PERIOD.

779 
FXUS64 KMRX 050120
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT MON OCT 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA AS THE UPPER LOW IN THE LINGERS TO THE 
NORTH. WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK. WILL EXPAND THE AREA OF PATCHY FROST 
A BIT MORE...BUT STILL TOO ISOLATED FOR ADVISORY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH A 
ISOLATED SHOWERS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. TEMPERATURES STILL VERY 
COOL SW VA AND NE TN IN THE UPPER 40S AND LOWER 50S TO MID AND UPPER 
50S EAST CENTRAL TN TO LOWER TO MID 60S SOUTHERN AREAS AT MID 
AFTERNOON. UPPER LEVEL LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN JUST TO THE NORTH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA AND AS IT DOES CLOUDS CONTINUE TO ROTATE AROUND IT 
WITH LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS AS WELL. SKIES WILL GRADUALLY CLEAR SOUTH 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON OR EARLY THIS EVENING...BUT STAY MOSTLY CLOUDY 
NORTH TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. TUESDAY AFTERNOON CLEARING SHOULD 
MOVE A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH. OVERNIGHT IN THE SOUTH AND POSSIBLY 
WEST ON THE PLATEAU BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
FALL TO THE MID AND UPPER 30S WITH PATCHY FROST POSSIBLE. VARIABLE 
CLOUD COVER WILL PRECLUDE WIDESPREAD FROST. BUT THE EVENING 
FORECASTER MAY WANT TO CHECK LATEST CLOUD TRENDS. EXPECTING HIGHS 
TUESDAY TO BE ABOUT 3 TO 5 DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAYS WITH A FEW 
LESS CLOUDS AS UPPER LOW SHIFTS NE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...
AND REVEAL A TYPICAL FALL PATTERN OF STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRY AND QUIET WEATHER. BY TUESDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER-LEVEL 
LOW IS PROGGED TO BE LOCATED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES AND WILL 
BE MOVING NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. AS A 
RESULT...CLEARING SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL 
INTO THE 30S OVER MANY AREAS WITH PATCHY FROST POSSIBLE. 
AFTERWORDS...A GRADUAL WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED FOR THE REST OF THE 
WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   43  72  41  73  45 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     41  65  40  70  44 /  10  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             40  65  40  70  44 /  10  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    40  60  36  65  39 /  20  20   0   0   0

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER WV THIS
MORNING CONTINUES TO BRING MOISTURE IN THE FORM OF LOW CLOUDS AND
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS SOUTH INTO SW VA AND NE TN. LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS
WERE BEGINNING TO MOVE BACK INTO SW VA THIS MORNING. CLOUD COVER
HAD DECREASED OVERNIGHT ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE MID
30S IN A FEW SPOTS BUT MAINLY 40S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.
EXPECTING THE CLOUDS TO INCREASE ACROSS CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA BUT STAY MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH.
MODIFIED GRIDS TO RAISE TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY. WITH UPWARD TREND AT
CHA WILL RAISE HIGHS A COUPLE DEGREES THERE. FOR TONIGHT THINK
THERE WILL BE A DECREASING CLOUD TREND AS UPPER LOW SHIFTS A LITTLE
FARTHER NORTHEAST. WILL UPDATE HWO TO PUT IN POSSIBLE FROST AND FOR
AFTERNOON WILL LIKELY HAVE FROST ADVISORY SOUTHERN THIRD OF
FORECAST AREA. STILL QUESTIONING CENTRAL SECTIONS DUE TO
UNCERTAINTY WITH CLOUD COVER TONIGHT. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 040741
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 AM EDT MON OCT 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
CENTERED JUST TO OUR NORTH NEAR WEST VIRGINA THROUGH THE PERIOD...SO 
NOT MUCH CHANGE TO THE PATTERN FOR THE SHORT TERM.  WILL CONTINUE TO 
SEE MORE CLOUDS NORTH THAN SOUTH...ALONG WITH SOME ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH.  TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE ON THE 
COOL SIDE AS WELL.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY 
SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...OHIO VALLEY UPPER LOW WILL
CONTINUE TO PLAGUE THE FORECAST AREA WITH BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS THROUGH
TUESDAY NIGHT. SHORT WAVE FEATURES WILL ROTATE AROUND THE LOW
PRESSURE CIRCULATION GENERATING SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ON TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY...THE
UPPER LOW WILL HAVE DRIFTED A LITTLE FARTHER NORTHEAST ALLOWING FOR
A SLOW IMPROVEMENT TO MILDER AND DRIER WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA. HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS ACROSS THE
HIGHER TERRAIN IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE
AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL STILL BE POSITIONED ACROSS THIS REGION DUE
TO THE PROXIMITY OF THE LOW. BY THURSDAY THE LOW WILL HAVE SHIFTED
FAR ENOUGH AWAY FROM THE AREA FOR REMOVAL OF POPS ALONG WITH A
LITTLE MORE SUNSHINE. MODEL PROGS DO SHOW A WEAK COLD FRONTAL
BOUNDARY SLIPS SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE THURSDAY
AND THURSDAY NIGHT SO THERE COULD BE A FEW CLOUDS IN ASSOCIATION
WITH THIS FRONT. DON'T EXPECT ANY PRECIP WITH THE FROPA HOWEVER.
STAYED WITH THE IDEA OF A GREAT FALL WEEKEND COMPLETE WITH A
WARMING TREND AS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE
EASTERN U.S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  40  64  40  69 /  10  10  10  10  10

278 
FXUS64 KMRX 040130
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT SUN OCT 3 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR INDICATING 
ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA NEARER 
THE LOW...SO WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A CLOSED LOW WILL REMAIN IN THE VICINITY OF EASTERN KY AND WV OVER 
THE NEXT 24 HOURS. AS A RESULT...EXPECT LITTLE CHANGE IN THE 
SENSIBLE WEATHER THIS PERIOD. CLOUDY SKIES AND SCATTERED TO ISOLATED 
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS CAN BE EXPECTED TONIGHT AND TOMORROW IN NORTHERN 
AREAS UNDERNEATH THE UPPER LOW. SOUTHERN SECTIONS SHOULD SEE SOME 
DECREASE IN CLOUDS OVERNIGHT AS THAT AREA IS NOT UNDER THE 500 MB 
THERMAL TROUGH. TEMPERATURES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL LIKELY 
GET DOWN TO THE UPPER 30S...MAYBE A FEW MID 30S IN THE HIGHEST 
PEAKS. HIGHS TOMORROW WILL AGAIN BE CHILLY NORTH...IN THE 50S...WITH 
SOME SUN ALLOWING SOUTHERN AREAS TO WARM TO THE MID TO UPPER 60S.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
STILL LOOKING AT THE EFFECTS OF THE CLOSED LOW MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE GENERALLY IN CONSENSUS THAT IT DOES NOT 
PULL AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST UNTIL WEDNESDAY. WILL MAINTAIN MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES NORTHEAST MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS NE AND SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL WITH ONLY PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES SW. DECREASING CLOUDS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT ABOUT THE SAME AS TONIGHT AND HIGHS 
TUESDAY ONLY A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN MONDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY TO CLEARING SKIES ACROSS THE NORTHEAST...LOWS WILL 
LIKELY DROP INTO THE MID 30S POSSIBLY LOWER IN A FEW SPOTS. MAY BE 
SOME FROST BUT HAVE LEFT OUT FOR NOW DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH CLOUD 
COVER. HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
WEDNESDAY WITH SKIES BECOMING CLEAR AREAWIDE BY EVENING AND A NICE 
WARMING TREND FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES CONTINUING THROUGH FRIDAY. 
LITTLE CHANGE TO PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH NEAR SEASONAL 
HIGHS AND LOWS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  67  44  70  42 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  60  41  65  40 /  10  10  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 031407 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EDT SUN OCT 3 2010

.DISCUSSION...
A MID TO UPPER LEVEL CLOSED LOW WILL BE MOVING ACROSS EASTERN KY
AND WEST VIRGINIA THROUGH THE DAY. FALLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS ARE
GENERATING SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS IN NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA
THIS MORNING. CLOUDY SKIES AND ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL
PERSIST THROUGH THE DAY AS THE LOW MOVES SLOWLY EAST. HOWEVER
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ARE SEEING A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUN THIS
MORNING. CLOUDS SHOULD BECOME BROKEN THERE BY THE AFTERNOON...BUT
TEMPS ARE RUNNING ABOVE FORECAST...AND WILL NEED AN UPWARD
ADJUSTMENT. OTHERWISE THE FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK.

315 AM EDT SUN OCT 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO DROP 
SOUTH EARLY...THEN WILL STALL AND LINGER OVER THE REGION.  COLDER

ON THE COOL SIDE.  WILL GENERALLY GO WITH OR SLIGHTLY BELOW MAV 
TEMPS TODAY...AND WILL GENERALLY ACCEPT MAV TEMPS FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS 
FORECAST DURING THE LONG TERM AS MODELS FAIRLY CONSISTENT IN 
DEPICTION OF UPPER LOW DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY WHILE GRADUALLY LIFTING NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE 
REGION BY WEDNESDAY. HELD ONTO AN INCREASING POP GRADIENT FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST KEEPING SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE DRY THROUGH THE 
EVENT WITH HIGHEST POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE WHERE STRONGER LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE WILL RESIDE. FIRST 
HALF OF THE LONG TERM SHOULD BE RATHER COOL WITH TEMPERATURES 
SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. HOWEVER THERE WILL BE A NICE REBOUND 
WITH A WARMING TREND DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE FORECAST PERIOD 
AS HEIGHTS BUILD BEHIND THE DEPARTING UPPER TROF. HIGH TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE BACK IN THE 70S WITH LOWER 80 DEGREE WARMTH POSSIBLE ACROSS 
EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT SAT OCT 2 2010

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT PASSING THROUGH CWA...BUT MOISTURE IS 
SHALLOW WITH IT...SO WILL KEEP THE CURRENT 20 POPS AS IS. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A COLD FRONT WILL BE PUSHING ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING. THE
FROPA WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS AND A WIND SHIFT TO NORTH...BUT
VERY LITTLE PRECIP. BEST CHANCES OF A LIGHT SHOWER WILL BE IN THE
NORTHERN HALF TONIGHT...AND WILL CARRY JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP.
BETTER PRECIP CHANCES MAY COME TOMORROW ONCE THE UPPER LOW GETS
CLOSED OFF OVER ERN KY. COLD TEMPS ALOFT WITH THIS LOW SHOULD
PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS IN NORTHERN SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES
TOMORROW WILL ALSO BE QUITE CHILLY WITH THE UPPER LOW
OVERHEAD...LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION...AND PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER.
WENT ON THE COLD SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS...ESPECIALLY
NORTH.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVING OVER EASTERN KY SUNDAY NIGHT 
WILL KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVER THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THE COLDER AIR COMING 
SOUTH AROUND THIS SYSTEM WILL ALSO KEEP LOWS CHILLY SUNDAY NIGHT 
UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. THIS UPPER LOW STAYS OVER EASTERN KY AND 
WESTERN WV MONDAY AND THEN SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS TO THE MID ATLANTIC COAST BY LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY 
NIGHT. FOLLOWED MAV/MET BLEND MONDAY FOR HIGHS A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE 
SUNDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE SHOWERS CENTRAL AND NORTH MONDAY 
THEN DECREASING TO SLIGHT CHANCE MONDAY NIGHT. ONLY EXTREME NE WILL 
HAVE SHOWERS TUESDAY AS UPPER LOW MOVES NE. FOR TUESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST WITH RISING HEIGHTS. 
GRADUALLY WARMING TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE 70S WITH LOWS GRADUALLY 
WARMING TO MID 40S TO MID 50S BY THE END OF THE EXTENDED.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT FRI OCT 1 2010

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER 
TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE REGION WILL MEAN CLEAR SKIES AND 
CALM WINDS OVERNIGHT. TEMPS WILL DROP QUICKLY WITH SUNSET...AND 
BOTTOM OUT IN THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH SOME UPPER 30S IN 
SHELTERED VALLEYS. A FEW SPOTS OF FROST CANNOT BE RULED OUT...BUT 
SHOULD BE VERY ISOLATED AND NOT ENOUGH FOR A FROST ADVISORY. FOG MAY 
ALSO BE AN ISSUE NEAR BODIES OF WATER AND IN VALLEYS. WILL HOLD OFF 
ON ANY FOG ADVISORY FOR NOW AND LET LATER SHIFTS MONITOR TRENDS. 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE 70S ARE EXPECTED AGAIN TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
NOT MANY CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST AS UPPER TROF AMPLIFIES INTO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. AS UPPER
TROF DEEPENS AND CLOSES OFF SUNDAY NIGHT JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST
AREA THIS SHOULD COINCIDE WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
CONTINUE INTO MONDAY. THE UPPER LOW IS EXPECTED TO PULL OFF TO THE
NORTHEAST STARTING MONDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT. BY WEDNESDAY THE SYSTEM WILL MOVE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA AND
SKIES SHOULD CLEAR EVEN ACROSS THE NE. DRIER AND WARMER AIR MASS
BUILDS IN WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE DEVELOPS
OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FRIDAY. COOL TEMPERATURES WITH UPPER TROF
AND UPPER LOW SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. LOWS WILL BE IN THE
UPPER 30S TO MID 40S AND HIGHS MID 50S SW VA TO NEAR 70 AT CHA.
SKIES SUNNY SOUTHWEST TO PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTHEAST. WARMING
DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD IN BEHIND DEPARTING UPPER LOW.  DRIER AIR WILL MOVE 
IN...PROVIDING A MAINLY CLEAR TO CLEAR SKY FOR THE PERIOD.  WILL 
MAKE A FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...MAINLY UP A BIT SOME LOCATIONS 
TONIGHT...BUT OVERALL WILL STAY CLOSE.  COULD BE SOME PATCHY FROST 
IN A FEW OF THE NORMALLY COLDER VALLEY LOCATIONS NORTH AND EASTERN 
MOUNTAIN ZONES INCLUDING SW NC...BUT WILL LEAVE OUT FOR NOW AND LET 
DAY SHIFT EVALUATE.    

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...LATEST GFS RUN HAS COME 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH ECMWF WITH UPPER TROF AMPLIFICATION INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER SATURDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. TROF 
DEEPENS AND CLOSES OFF BY SUNDAY EVENING OVER EASTERN KENTUCKY. THE 
UPPER LOW MEANDERS OVER THE TRI-STATE AREA INCLUDING KY/SW VA/NE TN 
DURING THIS EARLY PART OF THE FORECAST BEFORE LIFTING SLOWLY 
NORTHEAST THROUGH THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY. DID NOT 
MAKE ANY MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS MAINTAINING SLIGHT THROUGH LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH HIGHEST POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. REDUCED COVERAGE 
OF SLIGHT CHANCE POP ON WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER LOW GRADUALLY LIFTING 
NORTH AND EAST AWAY FROM THE REGION. KEPT PRECIP OUT OF THE FORECAST 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WITH DRIER AIR FINALLY 
BUILDING ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. TRENDED TEMPERATURE 
FORECAST TOWARD THE 00Z FRI MEX MOS GUIDANCE.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

121 
FXUS64 KMRX 010152
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT THU SEP 30 2010

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NE OF THE 
AREA OVERNIGHT. LIGHT SPRINKLES SHOULD END BY MIDNIGHT AND
CLOUD COVER WILL TAPER OFF OVERNIGHT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
CLOSED LOW TO OUR SOUTH WILL TRANSITION TO AN OPEN TROUGH AND LIFT
NORTHEAST THROUGH THE EVENING. AS THE HAPPENS...DRIER AIR WILL
ADVECT IN FROM THE WEST...AND SKIES WILL BECOME CLEAR LATE TONIGHT.
A 850 TO 700 MB RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA TOMORROW...PROVIDING
SUBSIDENCE AND CLEAR SKIES. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN
TONIGHT AS THE REMNANTS OF NICOLE MOVE ALONG THE CAROLINA COAST AND
A SURFACE HIGH MOVES OVER MISSOURI. A 30 KT LLJ ABOVE THE NOCTURNAL
INVERSION WILL DEVELOP TONIGHT. CONSIDERED A WIND ADVISORY IN THE
MOUNTAINS...BUT WIND SPEEDS SHOULD STAY BELOW CRITERIA IN MOST
SPOTS FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT. DAYTIME MIXING WILL BRING 20-30 KT
WINDS DOWN TO THE SURFACE...SO BREEZY AND GUSTY CONDITIONS CAN BE
EXPECTED...MAINLY IN THE MORNING...AND WINDS SHOULD DECREASE IN THE
AFTERNOON AS NICOLE'S REMNANTS MOVES FARTHER AWAY.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN FROM THE WEST AND
NORTHWEST FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. ALSO UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL
DIG SOUTH THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES SATURDAY AND BRING INCREASING
MOISTURE IN COMBINATION WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY INTO NORTHERN
SECTIONS AS EARLY AS SATURDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE SUNDAY THROUGH
MONDAY NIGHT AT LEAST. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS WILL BE NORTHEAST
HALF OF FORECAST AREA. ECMWF HAS STRONGER SYSTEM THAN GFS AND
SLOWER. HAVE FOLLOWED SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION WHICH CLOSES OFF AN
UPPER LOW TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND KEEPS
THIS FEATURE IN THE SAME AREA OR OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH
WEDNESDAY BEFORE SHIFTING IT GRADUALLY EAST THURSDAY. AS A RESULT
HAVE BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE
SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY PERIOD WITH SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE SHOWERS
NORTHEAST THIRD TO TWO THIRDS OF THE AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             54  79  49  76  50 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  75  47  73  47 /  10   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  75  46  74  46 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  72  41  70  43 /  10   0   0   0  10

SURFACE INVERSION WILL BE AROUND 35 KTS. THIS COULD RESULT IN SOME

MIXING COULD PRODUCE SOME GUSTY WINDS AT THE SURFACE TOMORROW

THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...BUT ANY PRECIP WILL BE VERY LIGHT.

258 
FXUS64 KMRX 300752
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
352 AM EDT THU SEP 30 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE REGION TRIGGERING SHOWERS THIS MORNING. WILL KEEP LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR TODAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS  
WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS EXPECTED. WITH ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER 
EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE DAY...STAYED NEAR THE BLEND TEMPERATURES 
FOR AFTERNOON HIGHS. THE DISTURBANCE LINGERS INTO EARLY TONIGHT...SO 
WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR ONLY THE EVENING HOURS FOR THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS THE CWA. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN LATE TONIGHT WITH DRY 
WEATHER RETURNING. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE FOR TONIGHT ALL SIMILAR SO 
STAYED CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH 
DRY CONDITIONS AND SEASONAL TEMPS EXPECTED. UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS 
AMPLIFIED OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION DURING THE WEEKEND... 
WITH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEALING SOME DISCREPANCIES IN THEIR 
HANDLING OF THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH. ECMWF MODEL IS THE MORE 
AMPLIFIED AND WETTER OF THE TWO MODELS...AND ITS SCENARIO RESULTS IN 
A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WHICH THEN 
LINGERS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. SINCE IT APPEARS THAT THE ECMWF MODEL 
HAS MORE SUPPORT FROM THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND HAS BEEN MORE 
CONSISTENT THAN THE GFS MODEL...WILL TREND THE EXTENDED FORECAST 
TOWARDS THE ECMWF SOLUTION BUT WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE THE ECMWF SOLUTION 
INDICATES A COOL PATTERN FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

475 
FXUS64 KMRX 300150
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT WED SEP 29 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE UPPER LEVEL CLOSED LOW OVER NORTHERN AL TODAY IS SHOWN BY THE
MODELS TO DROP SOUTHEAST TOWARD CENTRAL GA TONIGHT...WHILE THE LOW
LEVEL CIRCULATION TRACKS FROM THE SC COAST ACROSS EASTERN NC. THIS
SHOULD RESULT IN A DEEPER EASTERLY WIND COMPONENT OVER THE
APPALACHIANS...ALLOWING PRECIP TO MOVE INTO OUR EASTERN COUNTIES
THIS EVENING. THERE ARE FAIRLY LARGE DIFFERENCES IN POP BETWEEN THE
NAM AND GFS MOS. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WETTER NAM AND HAVE LIKELY
POPS IN THE EASTERN-MOST COUNTIES...DECREASING QUICKLY TO NO POPS
IN THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. THE UPPER LOW LIFTS NORTHWARD ACROSS THE
APPALACHIANS ON THURSDAY. WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN THE
NORTH AND EAST AS THE LOW DEPARTS AND DRIER AIR MOVES IN. THERE
SHOULD BE A BIG DIFFERENCE IN HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW FROM NORTH TO
SOUTH DUE TO CLOUD COVER...HIGHS WILL BE NEAR 80 AT CHATTANOOGA TO
THE 60S IN SW VA.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
WELL ADVERTISED UPPER CLOSED LOW WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AND POPS TAIL OFF THROUGH THE WEEKEND,
PRETTY MUCH. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR LATER SUNDAY AND MONDAY. DRYING
TREND AGAIN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. TEMPS/WINDS LOOK
GOOD, WILL LEAVE ALONE.

QUESTION ON EVERYONE'S MIND: WILL THE TROPICAL STORM AFFECT THE 
AREA. ANSWER: NO. CAVEAT: SOME CLOUDS PERHAPS IN THE FAR EASTERN 
SECTIONS FROM RUSSEL COUNTY, VA DOWN TO ABOUT JOHNSON COUNTY, TN. DO 
NOT EXPECT WINDS OR RAINFALL TO BE EXTREME AT ALL. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
714 PM EDT WED SEP 29 2010

.AVIATION...
EAST TN IS EXPECTED TO BE IN A TRANSITION ZONE FROM A VERY MOIST 
TROPICAL AIR MASS TO THE EAST TO A DRY AIR MASS TO THE WEST. THUS 
THE SITE WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES OF SEEING FLIGHT RESTRICTIONS AND 
PRECIP IS TRI. WILL FORECAST MVFR CONDITIONS WITH SHOWERS 
THERE...BUT A PERIOD OF IFR WITH HEAVIER RAIN CANNOT BE RULED OUT. 
TYS SHOULD BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DOWNSLOPE FLOW...WHICH SHOULD 
DELAY THE ONSET OF LOW CLOUDS UNTIL WINDS ALOFT TURN TO A MORE 
NORTHEAST DIRECTION...WHICH IS EXPECTED TO HAPPEN LATE TONIGHT. MVFR 
CEILINGS COULD DEVELOP THERE. CHA SHOULD BE FAR ENOUGH WEST TO 
REMAIN VFR THROUGH THE PERIOD. WIND SHEAR AROUND 7000 FEET COULD 
CAUSE LIGHT CHOP.

.DISCUSSION...

TROPOPAUSE FOLDING ON THE CYCLONIC SIDE OF THE JET IS PROVIDING DRY
AIR ALOFT EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS AS SEEN IN THE 12Z OHX
SOUNDING. DEEP MOISTURE WILL REMAIN EAST OF THE JET TODAY...THOUGH
MODELS SHOW THE 850 MB FLOW VEERING TO A MORE SE DIRECTION TONIGHT
THAT WILL INCREASE CLOUDS AND BRING A CHANCE OF RAIN TO OUR EASTERN
COUNTIES. THE CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO HANDLE THIS SITUATION
WELL...SO NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING A DRY DAY 
TODAY. AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS INTO THE AREA FROM THE SOUTH 
LATE TODAY. WITH DRY AIR IN THE LOWER LEVELS...WILL KEEP TODAY DRY 
AND HOLD OFF RAIN CHANCES UNTIL TONIGHT. THE DISTURBANCE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE EAST 
OF THE AREA SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE APPALACHIANS AND 
LESSER CHANCES FOR THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU. FORECAST TEMPERATURES 
SIMILAR SO STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
WHICH ARE JUST SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL 
PULL SOME OF THE TROPICAL MOISTURE OVER THE CAROLINAS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. AS A RESULT...WILL INCREASE POPS FOR 
THURSDAY...MAINLY OVER THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
THIS UPPER LOW WILL THEN MOVE NORTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT PUSHING A STRONG HIGH AND ITS 
COOLER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. UPPER-LEVEL FLOW 
REMAINS AMPLIFIED ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...WITH A DEEP UPPER TROUGH RESULTING IN ANOTHER CUT-OFF 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS DISAGREE 
WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE FOR PRECIP WITH THIS UPPER 
LOW...BUT FOR NOW...WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BEGINNING SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROF REMAINS IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION AND SHORT WAVE FEATURES 
CONTINUE TO ROTATE SOUTHEAST AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROF. ONE 
OF THESE SYSTEMS WILL BUILD SOUTHEAST FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY DEEPENING THE LONG WAVE TROF INTO ANOTHER CLOSE LOW OVER 
NORTHWEST GEORGIA ON WEDNESDAY. THE NAM WAS DISCOUNTED DURING THE 
SHORT TERM BECAUSE IT KEEPS THIS LOW TOO FAR SOUTHWEST THROUGH TIME. 
THE UPPER LOW WILL DIG SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WHILE PULLING TROPICAL MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH TD 16 NORTHWARD INTO 
THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. MODELS PROG A FAIRLY TIGHT EAST THROUGH WEST 
GRADIENT IN MOISTURE/LIFT IN THIS SCENARIO AND THEREFORE HAD TO ADD 
SOME SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS TO EXTREME EASTERN SECTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. TRIED TO 
STAY IN THE MIDDLE OF TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE FAVORING SLIGHTLY COOLER 
MINS/WARMER MAXES WEST DUE TO THE MOISTURE GRADIENT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN WEAKLY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. UPPER NW FLOW BECOMES ZONAL 
BRIEFLY BEFORE BECOMING SWRLY IN ADVANCE OF UPPER TROF THAT DROPS 
INTO TN VLY OVER THE WEEKEND. WEAK SURFACE FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA 
LATE ON SATURDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE SUNDAY WITH ECMWF AND GEM 
MAINTAINING DEEP TROFING WEST OF THE AREA WITH INVERTED SURFACE TROF 
OR WAVE ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY VCNTY MRX CWA EARLY MONDAY. STAYED 
CLOSER TO ONGOING FORECAST WITH A DRIER SOLUTION LEANING TOWARD 
REINFORCING COOL DRY AIR BUILDING IN ON MONDAY AND ESPECIALLY 
TUESDAY. MODELS HAVE BEEN GRADUALLY TRENDING COOLER SO HAVE BUMPED 
TEMPS AND DP'S DOWNWARD.

THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY. AREA OF LOW PRESSURE

INDICATING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE OVER THE CWA WHILE THE BULK OF 
THE MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE EAST OF THE CWA ON THE LATEST RUNS OF 
BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF. SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. SHORTWAVE TRACKS INTO THE REGION 
ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. GFS KEEPS DEEPEST MOISTURE FURTHER NORTH THAN 
THE ECMWF. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON STRENGTH AND TIMING OF THE 
FEATURE...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

SOUTH ACROSS THE PLATEAU ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE UPPER LOW. SKIES
ARE CLEAR ACROSS WEST TN. FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT SHOWERS WILL
CONTINUE TO DECREASE WITH THE THREAT OF THUNDER DIMINISHING. PATCHY
FOG IS FORMING IN SOME PLACES AND MAY BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD AS
UPPER LOW SHIFTS EAST AND CLOUDS DECREASE. EXPECT REFORMATION OF
LOW CLOUDS AND FOG LATE TONIGHT AS TRAPPED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND
COOLING TEMPERATURES SATURATE THE AIR MASS. UPDATE OF FORECAST TO
LOWER POPS MORE AND CHANGE THUNDERSTORM WORDING TO ISOLATED ACROSS
MAINLY NE AHEAD OF UPPER LOW. UPDATED FORECAST OUT SOON.

THE AIR-MASS...ESPECIALLY SOUTHERN AREAS...WITH A STRONG STORM OVER
NORTHERN GEORGIA. EVEN THOUGH CAPES WILL BE LIMITED (GENERALLY 500
J/KG)...LOW FREEZING LEVELS MAY PRODUCE MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL WITH
THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY. ALSO...SOME TRAINING OF SHOWERS-STORMS WILL
PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

ACTIVITY ENDS TUESDAY MORNING WITH THE RETURN OF SUNSHINE IN THE AFTERNOON.

BESIDES THE CONVECTION...PLENTY OF MOISTURE WILL PRODUCE PATCHY OR
AREAS OF FOG OVERNIGHT. SOME MAY BE LOCALLY DENSE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER TROF AXIS WILL 
MOVE EAST THROUGH THE AREA EARLY WEDNESDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BUILD IN FROM THE NW. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AND TROPICAL 
MOISTURE SHOULD STAY SE OF THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. THE NEXT SHORT 
WAVE MOVES SE BEGINNING TO CARVE EAST U.S. LONG WAVE TROF. WEAK 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH AND COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN FOR THE 
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK.

882 
FXUS64 KMRX 270709
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT MON SEP 27 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE GREAT TN VALLEY...EMANATING FROM A WEAK 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER CENTRAL GA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A STRONG CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER WEST TN WILL DRIFT 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY. THIS UPPER LOW WILL 
CREATE STRONG DIVERGENCE ALOFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH WILL 
IN TURN STRENGTHEN THE SURFACE LOW AS IT MOVES OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. MODELS INDICATE A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...SO WILL MENTION SCATTERED TSTORMS... 
BUT EXPECT SHOWERS TO BE THE DOMINANT PRECIP TYPE. WITH A LONG- 
DURATION SOAKING RAINFALL EXPECTED...WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE FLOOD 
WATCH FOR SOUTHWEST NC SINCE RAINFALL AMOUNTS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE 
HIGH ENOUGH (OR OCCUR QUICKLY ENOUGH) TO WARRANT ANY FLOODING 
CONCERNS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS UPPER LOW WILL MOVE 
NORTHEAST TONIGHT...WITH THE COVERAGE OF RAIN SLOWLY DECREASING FROM 
THE SOUTHWEST. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE A CATEGORY 
COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS WITH MAXES TODAY...AND WILL PLAN TO 
FOLLOW CLOSE TO THEM SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY. 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A PRETTY STABLE MERIDIONAL 
PATTERN HAS ESTABLISHED ITSELF OVER THE CONTINENT...WITH THE UPPER 
TROF OVER THE EAST AND STRONG RIDGE OVER THE WEST. UPPER TROF HAS 
BEEN PRETTY TIGHT...BUT IS OPENING UP AND WILL CONTINUE TO DO SO 
DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD. THE RIDGE DOES NOT...IN FACT...APPEAR TO 
MAKE MUCH PROGRESS TOWARD OUR AREA...IN THE GFS. THE ECMWF TOWARDS 
NEXT WEEKEND DOES DIG ANOTHER DEEP TROF OVER US...BUT WE'LL LET THAT 
TAKE CARE OF ITSELF WHEN WE GET CLOSER. FOR NOW...THE GFS HAS DONE A 
PRETTY GOOD JOB OF DEPICTING TIMING. THE RAINS WE DID GET DID NOT 
MEASURE UP TO THE COPIOUS AMOUNTS ADVERTISED...AND THE MODELS ARE 
SHOWING A RAPIDLY DEPARTING TROF AND ASSOCIATED RH...SO I HAVE 
DECREASED THE POPS AGAIN FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...AND REMOVED 
THEM ALTOGETHER ON WEDNESDAY. ALSO REDUCED QPF VALUES. TEMPS ARE A 
LITTLE DIVERGENT IN THE MODELS...AND I HAVE ACTUALLY RAISED THE 
MAXES A HAIR EARLY ON FOR THE AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE I EXPECT. STILL... 
WITH FALL HERE AND EXPECTING TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A FAIRLY 
STRONG SURFACE HIGH...I PULLED BACK ON THE STRENGTH OF THE WARMING 
TREND DEPICTED IN THE MOS GUIDANCE. WITH A SERIES OF OFFSHORE LOWS 
ZIPPING UP THE COAST...AND THE SURFACE TO OUR WEST...IT LOOKS LIKE A 
GOOD POSSIBILITY OF A TIGHT-ISH SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT...AND IT 
MIGHT GET A TAD BREEZY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   72  56  76  52  79 /  80  30  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  55  75  51  77 /  90  60  30  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             71  56  74  49  77 /  80  60  30  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    69  52  71  48  74 / 100  80  40  20  10

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE GREAT TN 
VALLEY...EMANATING FROM AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER CENTRAL GA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT THE BULK OF THE RAINFALL ASSOCIATED WITH 
THIS SYSTEM HAS BEEN CONFINED EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS...WITH ONLY SOME 
LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER... 
MODELS AGREE THAT HEAVIER RAIN SHOULD BEGIN TO SPREAD ACROSS KTYS 
AND KTRI LATER THIS MORNING...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER WEST TN 
MOVES FURTHER SOUTH AND STRENGTHENS THE SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS RAIN SHOULD PRODUCE IFR CEILINGS AT KTYS AND 
KTRI TOWARDS SUNRISE...WITH NOT MUCH IMPROVEMENT EXPECTED THROUGH 
THE EVENING HOURS AS THE UPPER LOW SWINGS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
MODELS INDICATE THAT SOME DRIER AIR IN THE MID LEVELS OVER SOUTHEAST 
TN WILL KEEP CEILINGS FROM DROPPING BELOW MVFR CONDITIONS AT KCHA... 
AND ANY RAINFALL SCATTERED ENOUGH TO ONLY MENTION VCSH IN THE KCHA 
TAF.

DIVERGENCE ALOFT THEN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

346 PM EDT SUN SEP 26 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW IS MOVING
SLOWLY SOUTH TOWARDS THE LOWER MS VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. OVERCAST
SKIES AND COOL TEMPERATURES PERSISTED ALL DAY WITH TEMPERATURES AT
MID AFTERNOON ONLY IN THE 60S. PERIODS OF RAIN GAVE THE REGION A
FEW HUNDREDTHS NORTHERN PLATEAU TO AN INCH OR MORE ACROSS THE
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. WET PERIOD THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HOURS AS UPPER LOW
MOVES EAST AND DEEPENS. MONDAY THE UPPER LOW MOVES CLOSER AND LOW
PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPING ALONG FRONT TO THE SOUTH WILL MOVE NORTH
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS
ENHANCING RAINFALL ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS. HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE
TONIGHT MOUNTAINS AND SPREADING NE INTO SW VA BY MORNING. THERE HAS
BEEN A DECREASING TREND LAST COUPLE HOURS AS CONVECTION FIRES ALONG
THE FRONT IN GA. STILL UNCERTAIN ABOUT PROLONGED HEAVY RAIN AFTER
TONIGHT FARTHER NORTH SO DID NOT EXTEND FLOOD WATCH NORTH FOR NOW.
MONDAY NIGHT RAIN TAPERS OFF AS UPPER LOW WEAKENS AND MOVES NE.
TUESDAY STILL SHOWERS POSSIBLE NE HALF CLOSER TO UPPER LOW. TEMPERATURES
WILL REMAIN COOL MONDAY AND TUESDAY. SLIGHTLY WARMER TUESDAY WITH
SOME PARTIAL CLEARING SOUTH.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY WILL BE DROPPING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF EASTERN STATES UPPER 
TROF TUESDAY NIGHT BUT THIS FEATURE IS MOVING SEVERAL HOURS FASTER 
THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST THINKING SO REDUCED POP TO SLIGHT CHANCE AND 
APPLIED ONLY TO THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. WAS ABLE 
TO KEEP THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY AS THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
WILL NOT BE TERRIBLY ACTIVE IN TERMS OF THE PASSAGE OF SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH SYSTEMS AND THERE SHOULD NOT BE A TREMENDOUS AMOUNT OF 
CLOUD COVER DURING THE PERIOD. MORE ACTIVE WEATHER WILL OCCUR 
SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA AS A CUT OFF LOW DEVELOPS OVER 
SOUTHERN GEORGIA AND NORTHERN FLORIDA. TEMPERATURES WILL FEEL MORE 
FALL LIKE IN THE EXTENDED PART OF THE FORECAST DUE TO THE LENGTHY 
PERIOD OF NORTHERLY WIND FLOW.

737 
FXUS64 KMRX 260737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT SUN SEP 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
OVER NORTHEAST GA AND UPSTATE SC. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION WILL DEEPEN INTO A CUT-OFF LOW ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY 
TONIGHT. THIS UPPER LOW WILL PRODUCE STRONG UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS AND 
SYNOPTIC-SCALE LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN 
A FAIRLY WIDESPREAD AND LONG-DURATION RAINFALL. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
REVEAL A FAIRLY STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN MOSTLY SHOWERS. HOWEVER...THE 
STRONG UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL LIKELY CREATE SOME 
SCATTERED TSTORMS WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IN 
SOME AREAS. IN FACT...SEVERAL INCHES OF RAIN APPEAR TO BE POSSIBLE 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST NC...ESPECIALLY IF THE WETTER GFS MODEL SOLUTION 
VERIFIES. ALTHOUGH FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES ARE VERY HIGH ACROSS 
THIS AREA (DUE TO THE RECENT ABNORMALLY DRY CONDITIONS)...WILL PLAN 
TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR THIS AREA SINCE A WIDESPREAD AND LONG- 
DURATION RAINFALL OF TWO TO FOUR INCHES APPEARS LIKELY...WITH SOME 
LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE WITH A FEW TSTORMS. AS FOR TEMPS... 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...WHICH SEEMS ODD CONSIDERING THE GFS 
IS THE WETTER OF THE TWO MODELS. WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE 
TWO WITH MAXES TODAY...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS MINS 
FOR TONIGHT WITH DEWPOINTS ALREADY HIGH AND NO COLD AIR ADVECTION 
EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST. EXPECT UPPER TROF TO DEPART SLOWLY TO THE 
NORTHEAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WOULD DEPART MORE QUICKLY...BUT FOR A 
VORT LOBE DOWN THE WEST SIDE OF TROF WHICH WILL DIG OVER AREA 
THROUGH THURSDAY. AIR MASS WILL BE DRY AND NOT ABLE TO SUSTAIN 
PRECIP PAST WEDNESDAY BUT DESPITE LACK OF MOISTURE...DIGGING TROF 
WILL PREVENT A STRONG WARMING TREND.

STILL LOOKING FOR SOME MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS MONDAY... 
TAPERING OFF TUESDAY. STREAMFLOWS ARE DOWN FOR THE MOST PART AND SO 
ONLY LOCALIZED FLOODING A POSSIBILITY. IN FACT..WITH A D-ZERO 
ABNORMAL DRYNESS IN THE MOUNTAINS...AND EVEN SOME D1 MINOR DROUGHT 
AREAS...THIS RAIN IS GOING TO BE WELCOME.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 251925

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT SEP 25 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT NOW LIES
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND EXTENDS INTO
NORTHERN AL. SKIES HAVE BEEN MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
MOST OF THE DAY BUT ARE BEGINNING TO SHOW BREAKS ACROSS THE
NORTHERN SECTIONS. COMPLEX FORECAST THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS FRONT
MOVES A LITTLE FARTHER EAST AND THEN DIGGING TROUGH OVER THE MIDWEST
FORMS AN UPPER LOW THAT DROPS SOUTH INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND
THAN SLOWLY MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. LOW PRESSURE IS
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TO THE SW OF THE FORECAST AREA ALONG THE
STALLED FRONT AND THEN DEEPEN AS IT MOVES EAST AND THEN NE. THE
UPPER LOW WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AT THE SAME
TIME AND ENHANCE THE LIFT SUNDAY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND NE
SECTIONS WITH HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE BY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.
NEXT FORECAST CYCLE MAY NEED TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR THAT TIME
PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD AT NIGHT AND MUCH COOLER DURING
THE DAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED A BLEND OF MAV/MET FOR ALL PERIODS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW WILL WEAKEN 
AS IT SHIFTS NORTHEAST FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE INTO THE EASTERN LAKES 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING. ACCORDINGLY DROP OFF POPS 
FOR SHOWERS GRADUALLY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS MODELS INDICATE SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY BUILDING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROF WHICH WILL SLOW 
ITS DEPARTURE. HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY 
MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE TROF AXIS 
FINALLY SHIFTS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DRIER 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BUILDS IN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD SO WAS ABLE TO KEEP MENTION OF RAIN OUT OF THE FORECAST 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. GENERALLY UNDERCUT MEX MOS MAX TEMP GUIDANCE 
WHICH APPEARED TO BE A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES TOO WARM DURING MOST 
OF THE LONG TERM.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  78  63  77  59 /  50  70  80  70  30

223 
FXUS64 KMRX 250649
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT SAT SEP 25 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH A LINE OF 
SHOWERS AND A FEW TSTORMS OCCURRING ALONG IT. MODELS AGREE THAT THIS 
LINE OF CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH THIS MORNING AS IT SLOWLY PUSHES 
INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS CONVECTION 
SHOULD BECOME ISOLATED AND CLOUDS SHOULD SCATTER BY THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS...AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE CAROLINAS. UPPER-LEVEL FLOW 
THEN BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY 
TONIGHT...WITH A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE MID MS VALLEY 
BY SUNRISE SUNDAY MORNING. AS A RESULT...MODELS REVEAL STRENGTHENING 
DIVERGENCE ALOFT INCREASING THE LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...WITH SHOWERS AND A FEW EMBEDDED TSTORMS EXPECTED TO 
SLOWLY INCREASE IN COVERAGE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS MOS NUMBERS WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT NOW OVER MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE WILL ENTER AND EXIT THE AREA BY SUNDAY. THIS WILL REDUCE 
TEMPS BACK TO MORE NORMAL VALUES...BUT NOT MUCH ELSE FOR NOW. UPPER 
TROF OVER MIDWEST WILL DESCEND INTO AREA...DEPENDING ON WHETHER YOU 
LIKE THE EUROPEAN OR GFS...BY LATE SUNDAY OR MONDAY. GFS IS NOT AS 
DEEP CORED...BUT DOES DIG FURTHER SOUTH. GFS HAS STRONGER RETURN 
FLOW IN FORM OF INVERTED TROF MOVING NORTH ON MONDAY...AND WILL GO 
WITH THIS IDEA. COPIOUS TROPICAL MOISTURE BECOMES AVAILABLE WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...AND SO WILL STAY WITH IDEA OF COVERAGE WORDING INSTEAD 
OF POSSIBILITY WORDING FOR POPS MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE IDEA OF A 
HUGE FORECAST BUST HAS COME UP WITH THE POPS INTO THE LIKELY/ 
NUMEROUS CATEGORY FOR THIS PERIOD. CONFIDENCE IS MIDDLING FOR THIS 
PERIOD...BUT FEELING IS THAT SOME ADVANCE NOTICE IS WARRANTED ON 
POSSIBLE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION LEADING TO LOCALIZED FLOODING... 
RATHER THAN WAITING UNTIL THE LAST MINUTE AND SUDDENLY SPRINGING 
THAT FORECAST ON EVERYONE. KEPT TEMPS ABOUT AS THEY WERE...A LITTLE 
HIGHER THAN THE BLEND GUIDANCE DUE. COLD FRONT IS WEAKER THAN 
THOUGHT...AND WE'VE BEEN IN THE RECORD HIGH RANGE.
&&

622 
FXUS64 KMRX 241924 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT FRI SEP 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT WAS FOUND 
AROUND 18Z ACROSS WRN KY SW TO NE AR/W TN...WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS 
BUT LITTLE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY. NAM AND GFS SIMILAR WITH HOW MUCH 
PRECIPITATION (PCPN) DEVELOPS OVERNIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY...AND I 
TRENDED MUCH IN LINE WITH THE MORE CONSISTENT NAM 12KM MODEL. HIGHER 
CHANCE POPS SEEM IN ORDER FOR LATE TONIGHT JUST INTO SATURDAY 
MORNING ...THEN DECREASING POPS SHARPLY FROM THE NW FOR REST OF 
SATURDAY. NOT MUCH IF ANY UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...LIMITED 
INSTABILITY...AND BEST FRONTOGENESIS IS TO OUR EAST AND SOUTHEAST BY 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON...SO WENT BELOW THE PREVIOUS 50 PERCENT POPS. 

UPPER LOW APPROACHING QUICKLY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...SO RAIN 
CHANCES INCREASE AFTER PERHAPS A BRIEF BREAK FOR LATE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR THOSE TWO 
PERIODS...BUT I DID DOWNPLAY THUNDERSTORMS AND HIGHLIGHTED SHOWERS 
MORE SO ON SUNDAY. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS A THREAT...BUT PREFER TO WAIT 
BEFORE MENTIONING JUST YET.

OTHERWISE...MOS MINS CLOSE EACH PERIOD AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED. FOR MAX 
TEMPS...TRENDED CLOSER TO A BLEND GIVEN THE CHANGING PATTERN WITH 
LOTS OF CLOUDS AND PCPN. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...STAYED CLOSER TO ECMWF 
FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WHICH FEATURES AMPLIFYING SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST FROM ALBERTA INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST ON SATURDAY. 
AS THIS UPPER TROF CONTINUES MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY SUNDAY NIGHT THE SYSTEM WILL DEEPEN INTO A 
CLOSED LOW ENCOURAGING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE 
DEEP SOUTH. INCREASING LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL LEAD TO A 
BROADENING AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THE UPPER 
LOW WILL SHIFT STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY 
KEEPING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS QUITE HIGH WELL 
INTO THE EVENING HOURS. DUE TO THE LIKLIEHOOD OF CONVECTIVE 
PRECIPITATION AND THE EXTENDED PERIOD OF RAINFALL...USED GENEROUS 
QPF FOR THE BIG EVENT. HAD TO HOLD ONTO CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY 
TAPERING TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY WEDNESDAY AS ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY DROPS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF SLOWLY DEPARTING UPPER TROF. WAS 
FINALLY ABLE TO REMOVE POPS ON THURSDAY AS DRIER AIR FILTERS IN FROM 
THE NORTHWEST. HOWEVER...THIS DRY PERIOD MAY BE SHORT LIVED AS 
MODELS HINT AT ANOTHER...WEAKER NORTHWEST FLOW SYSTEM MOVING INTO 
THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. APPLIED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. ADJUSTED MAX/MIN TEMPS 
DOWNWARD FOLLOWING MEX MOS SUGGESTION THAT NEXT WEEK WILL BE MUCH 
CLOSER TO NORMAL. IT WILL FINALLY START TO FEEL MORE LIKE FALL DUE 
TO THE SLOW MOVING UPPER LOW AND SUBSEQUENT NORTHWEST FLOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  86  64  78  61 /  40  40  40  60  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  83  62  76  61 /  30  40  40  60  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  82  60  76  60 /  40  30  30  50  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              60  81  57  71  55 /  30  30  30  60  70

TEMP? 

12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS WARMING ALOFT DUE TO SUBSIDENCE FROM BUILDING 
UPPER RIDGE...WHILE MODIFIED 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS BOTH SHOW 
MUCH LESS POSITIVE CAPE THAN YESTERDAY (500 J/KG OR SO). ANY 
CONVECTION SHOULD MAINLY HOLD OFF UNTIL LATER TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE 
WEAK COLD FRONT.

LATEST NAM MODEL STILL QUITE DRY WITH THE FRONT AND EVEN THE 06Z GFS 
MODEL RUN SHOWS THE WEAK NATURE OF THE APPROACHING FRONT...SO DON'T 
EXPECT A LOT OF MOISTURE CONVERGENCE. BEST RAIN CHANCES OVER OUR 
AREA SHOULD BE LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY...THEN SHIFTING 
QUICKLY TO THE EAST AND SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. WILL VIEW 12Z MODEL RUNS AND RE-EVALUATE POPS FOR 
OVERNIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE. 

OTHERWISE...FORECAST GRIDS LOOK ON TRACK WITH NO REASON TO UPDATE 
THE ZFPMRX OR ANY OTHER WEB PRODUCTS AT THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT FRI SEP 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC CREATING A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE OHIO AND 
TN RIVER VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON...AND THEN MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT. MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY LIMITED WITH 
THE FRONT...SO WILL CONTINUE MENTIONING LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
TONIGHT...AND MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. ANOTHER UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY 
IS EXPECTED TODAY...WITH CLOUDS GRADUALLY INCREASING THROUGHOUT THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE FRONT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...CHANGE OF PATTERN FROM HOT 
AND DUSTY TO MORE UNSETTLED, WITH A RATHER WEAK COLD FRONT LATE 
SATURDAY INTO EARLY SUNDAY, BUT THEN AN INVERTED TROF MOVES NORTH 
INTO THE AREA LATER SUNDAY AND MONDAY BRINGING ATLANTIC MOISTURE 
INTO THE REGION FROM THE EAST.

HAVE ALMOST DOUBLED POPS DURING THE FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD AS THE 
MODELS HAVE COME MUCH CLOSER IN AGREEMENT. THAT SAID, THE GFS 
APPEARS TO ME TO BE THE BEST LOOK AT PRECIP AMOUNTS AND LOCATIONS, 
SO WENT WITH IT, LARGELY, WITH SOME ADJUSTMENTS DOWN ON QPF AMOUNTS. 
STILL, THINK THAT MOST OF SUNDAY/MONDAY WILL BE RATHER WET, CLOUDY, 
AND LOOK A LOT LIKE AN OCCLUDED AIRMASS. SOME INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW 
FOR THUNDERSTORMS. RATHER THAN GET FANCY WITH WORDING THAT FAR OUT, 
WENT WITH UNCERTAINTY WORDING THROUGH SATURDAY/EARLY SUNDAY, AND 
THEN COVERAGE WORDING SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

TEMPS? ADJUSTED A DEGREE OR TWO DOWN OR UP DEPENDING ON PERIOD TO 
MATCH GUIDANCE A LITTLE BETTER, BUT DID NOT CHANGE CATS.

DID NOT ADJUST GRIDS PERCEPTIBLY FROM WEDNESDAY ON OUT, AS BEHAVIOR 
OF TROPICAL SYSTEM WILL HAVE TO BE WATCHED CLOSELY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

804 
FXUS64 KMRX 231921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT THU SEP 23 2010

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...RANDOM FLAT CUMULUS CLOUDS 
DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE EASTERN MTNS AND PLATEAU AREAS.
WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS SHOW DRY AIR SPREADING IN AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS ALOFT TODAY...SO KEPT FORECAST DRY FOR TONIGHT. MAY 
SEE A FEW SPOTS OF FOG ALONG/NEAR BODIES OF WATER...AS ALREADY NOTED 
IN FORECAST GRIDS. A MOS BLEND LOOKED GOOD FOR MINS TONIGHT.

WEAK SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT COME INTO PLAY BY LATE 
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...THEN THE FORECAST BECOMES MUCH MORE COMPLEX 
AS THE UPPER LOW DROPS INTO MID MS VALLEY AND CLOSES OFF. THE 12Z 
GFS/00Z ECMWF ARE PREFERRED MODELS IN THE MEDIUM RANGE...WITH THE 
12Z NAM THE DRIEST WITH THE WEAK SHORTWAVE/FRONT FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. IF NAM SOLUTION IS CORRECT...THEN ALMOST NO CONVECTION 
OCCURS FRIDAY NIGHT OR SATURDAY. HOWEVER...GFS AND ECMWF SUGGEST 
SCATTERED WEAKENING CONVECTION FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN SOME DEVELOPMENT 
AGAIN DURING PEAK HEATING ON SATURDAY. THUS...I KEPT 20 TO 30 
PERCENT POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND 30 TO 40 PERCENT POPS FOR SATURDAY 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

FRIDAY WOULD APPEAR TO BE PERHAPS ONE OF THE LAST CHANCES TO REACH 
90 DEGREES OR HIGHER...AS MOISTURE REMAINS QUITE SHALLOW UNTIL 
FRIDAY NIGHT. DEEPENING MOISTURE ON SATURDAY AND BEYOND SHOULD DROP 
MAX TEMPS TO NEAR CLIMO AFTER 80S ON SATURDAY. MOS GUIDANCE WAS 
CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD SHOULD BE 
RATHER UNSETTLED. WENT CLOSER TO THE GFS ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE 
FORECAST. SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE ON 
THE INCREASE AS UPPER TROUGH/CLOSED LOW DROP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. AS THE UPPER 
LOW DEEPENS AND SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST...A SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT 
WILL DRIVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. ADJUSTED POPS FROM 
MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE BY SUNDAY NIGHT MONDAY IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
THESE FEATURES' SLOW PROGRESSION TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
UPPER TROF MAINTAINING THE DEPTH OF THE LOW AND SLOWING ITS TREK 
ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. USED A GRADUAL DROP IN PROBABILITIES FROM 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS THIS LARGE PRESSURE SYSTEM LUMBERS 
EAST. ANOTHER NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROF WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
THE WESTERN CANADIAN PROVINCES INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST BY MIDWEEK 
PUSHING MORE COOL AIR TOWARD THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. APPLIED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR POSSIBLE CONVECTION AHEAD OF THIS FRONT ON THURSDAY. 
COULD BE ANOTHER WET PERIOD AS A TROPICAL SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO SHIFT 
NORTH INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO TOWARD THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

COMPROMISE BETWEEN MORE SWRLY GFS AND MORE NORTHERLY ECMWF. SUNDAY 
ONWARD SETS UP AS A WET PERIOD WITH SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND UPPER 
DIFFLUENCE ALOFT. AT THE SURFACE AN INVERTED TROF WILL DEVELOP 
NOSING NORTHWARD INTO OR WEST OF MRX CWA. KEEP POPS RELATIVELY LOW 
SINCE BETTER CHANCES REMAIN SW-E OF THE AREA. BOUTS OF HEAVY RAIN A 
GOOD POSSIBILITY BUT TIMING CAN NOT BE DETERMINED UNTIL SYSTEM TAKES 
SHAPE. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL AND BE MODERATED BY CLOUD 
COVER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
433 AM EDT WED SEP 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE BOTH AT THE
SURFACE AND ALOFT HAS SHIFTED A LITTLE FARTHER EAST...OFF THE NORTH
CAROLINA COAST THIS MORNING. THIS HAS ALLOWED INCREASING GULF
MOISTURE TO STREAM NORTH FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH AL AND GA

THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED OVERNIGHT ACROSS MAINLY THE PLATEAU
COUNTIES BUT IN THE PAST HOUR NEAR CHA. SKIES ARE PARTLY CLOUDY
WITH SOME PATCHY FOG AND MILD TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 60S TO MID
70S. ACTUALLY VERY WARM FOR THIS TIME OF MORNING IN LATE SEPTEMBER.
HARD TO BELIEVE FALL STARTS TONIGHT.

WILL CONTINUE ISOLATED TO CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TODAY.
ALSO RAISED MAX TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES TO RECORD OR NEAR RECORD
READINGS IN THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S ABOUT THE SAME AS TUESDAY
NORTH AND A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER SOUTH DUE TO MORE CLOUD COVER.
WITH SUCH A WARM START THIS MORNING AND HIGH DEW POINTS IN THE MID
60S IT MAY NOT TAKE LONG FOR TEMPERATURES TO REACH THE MID 80S AND
HIGHER. NO REAL CHANGES TONIGHT WITH A FEW SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE EVENING BEFORE CLEARING SKIES. LOWS TONIGHT
SHOULD BE COOLER AS TEMPERATURES DROP TO NEAR THE DEW POINT. DID
NOT PUT FOG IN BUT THIS MAY HAVE TO BE ADDED. QPF AMOUNTS NOT
EXPECTED TO BE HEAVY BUT SOME PLACES HAVE RECEIVED LOCALLY HIGH
AMOUNTS WITH SLOW MOVING THUNDERSTORMS ALREADY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...RIDGING FROM THE ATLANTIC 
WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE AREA THU AND FRI. WELL ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE WITH DRY CONDITIONS. LARGE SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES RAPIDLY THROUGH THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES FRI 
AND SAT. TRAILING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES SE 
THROUGH THE TN RVR VLY AND ARRIVE IN E TN LATE FRI/EARLY SAT. 
CONVECTION WILL BECOME SCATTERED AND IT MOVES THROUGH WITH THE 
FRONT. VERY LOW CONFIDENCE WITH REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. MODEL 
SOLUTIONS HUNDREDS OF MILE APART. LEANED TOWARD GEM WHICH IS CLOSE 
TO A 21/12Z ECMWF 22/00Z GFS BLEND. GFS CONTINUES WARM EARLY NEXT 
WEEK WHILE ECMWF DRIVES CANADIAN AIRMASS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 220515
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
115 AM EDT WED SEP 22 2010

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
WESTERN ATLANTIC...CREATING A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW AND AN INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT... EXPECT PATCHY FOG 
TO DEVELOP THIS MORNING IN THE SAME GENERAL AREAS AS LAST NIGHT. 
THUS...WILL MENTION TEMPORARY IFR VISIBILITIES AT KTRI TOWARDS 
SUNRISE WITH VFR CONDITIONS AT KCHA AND KTYS. THIS INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION SHOULD ENCOURAGE SCATTERED CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS...SO WILL MENTION VCTS AT ALL 
THREE TAF SITES. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE 
TAF PERIOD (OUTSIDE OF TSTORMS).
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

329 
FXUS64 KMRX 220057
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT TUE SEP 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE WESTERN ATLANTIC...BRINGING A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW AND AN 
INCREASE IN MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT... 
ISOLATED CONVECTION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP AROUND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU AND ADJACENT VALLEY AREAS THIS EVENING. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THIS ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT...AS AN AXIS OF 
WEAK INSTABILITY LINGERS OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION ISOLATED SHOWERS 
OVERNIGHT ALONG WITH SOME PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT IN 
THE SAME GENERAL AREAS AS LAST NIGHT. WILL ALSO PLAN TO RAISE MINS A 
LITTLE...SINCE TONIGHT'S MINS SHOULD BE FAIRLY SIMILAR (OR SLIGHTLY 
HIGHER) TO LAST NIGHT'S MINS.
&&

621 
FXUS64 KMRX 211835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT TUE SEP 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MODELS/SREF REMAIN IN 
REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO GENERALLY PERSIST THROUGH TONIGHT AS REGION 
REMAINS UNDER INFLUENCE OF UPPER RIDGING. UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
SLOWLY SHIFT EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH TOMORROW RESULTING IN 
INCREASINGLY MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. MODELS DEPICT CHANCE OF 
DIURNAL CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN THIS REGIME MAINLY IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. THUS HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR MOUNTAINS WITH 
ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR VALLEY LOCATIONS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID 
NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE PERSISTENT RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS WILL PROVIDE A COUPLE 
MORE DAYS OF HOT AND DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. HIGHS WILL 
CONTINUE WELL ABOVE NORMAL...IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S IN MOST 
SPOTS. THE RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN ON FRIDAY NIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACH THE AREA. THE EAST-WEST 
ORIENTATION OF THE DEPARTING RIDGE WILL PREVENT GULF MOISTURE FROM 
BEING TAPPED AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED. WILL 
CONTINUE TO HAVE CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AND A SLIGHT CHANCE 
SATURDAY NIGHT. 

MODELS HAVE CONVERGED ON A PATTERN OF A CLOSED LOW OVER THE EASTERN 
CONUS SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...BUT DIFFER SIGNIFICANTLY ON THE 
POSITION OF THAT LOW. THE 06Z AND 12Z GFS ARE OUTLIERS...PUTTING THE 
CLOSED LOW WEST OF THE MS RIVER AND BRINGING A LOT OF PRECIP TO OUR 
AREA FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. THE 
CANADIAN/GEM...ECMWF...UKMET...AND THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN PUT THE 
CLOSED LOW IN THE VICINITY OF THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WITH A GOOD 
PUNCH OF COLDER CANADIAN AIR BEHIND IT. WILL GO WITH THE MODEL 
CONSENSUS OF A CLOSED LOW TO OUR NORTHEAST...LEADING TO A DRIER AND 
COOLER FORECAST. HOWEVER CONFIDENCE IS LOW AS MODELS TEND NOT TO 
HANDLE THESE TYPES OF TRANSITIONAL PATTERNS VERY WELL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  92  66  93  66 /  10  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  90  65  91  64 /  10  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  91  65  91  64 /  10  20  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  89  59  88  58 /  10  20  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

287 
FXUS64 KMRX 210822
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EDT TUE SEP 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LAYER RIDGING SHIFTS EAST THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. FLOW BECOMES SOUTHWESTERLY WITH PW'S CREEPING UP ABOVE 1.0
ACROSS SOUTHERN AND WESTERN AREAS. SURFACE DEW POINT RECOVERY NOT 
VERY IMPRESSIVE BUT THICKNESS HEIGHTS RISE AND TEMPS WILL INCH UP A 
DEGREE OR TWO TODAY AND CONTINUE WARM OVERNIGHT. VERY SMALL CHANCE 
PCPN ACROSS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TONIGHT BUT CHANCE FOR MEASURABLE 
PCPN BELOW 20 PERCENT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
STILL IN CONTROL WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER MOISTURE INCREASE AROUND
SURFACE HIGH THAT SHIFTS EASTWARD AND WEAK IMPULSES IN SW FLOW WILL
HELP TRIGGER ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS VALLEYS AND A
BETTER CHANCE MOUNTAINS. MORE CLOUD COVER WILL HOLD HIGHS DOWN A
FEW DEGREES ALTHOUGH STILL ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE END OF CLIMATOLOGICAL
SUMMER. RIDGE RESTRENGTHENS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH MUCH ABOVE
NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND ABUNDANT SUNSHINE. SATURDAY COLD FRONT
AHEAD OF TROUGH MOVING INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST WILL
BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WHICH WILL LINGER
INTO SUNDAY AS MODELS BRING A CLOSED LOW INTO THE UPPER OHIO
VALLEY. THIS WILL ALSO BRING A CONSIDERABLE DROP IN TEMPERATURES.
HIGHS SHOULD FEEL MORE FALL LIKE AS THEY DROP INTO THE 70S MOST
PLACES FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

&&

772 
FXUS64 KMRX 201835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT MON SEP 20 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE FORESEEN IN 
GENERALLY TRANQUIL CONDITIONS IN SHORT TERM AS UPPER RIDGING 
CONTINUES TO BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT EAST...ALLOWING RETURN 
FLOW BY TUESDAY. THIS WILL PROMOTE SOME INCREASE IN MOISTURE INTO 
THE AREA BUT ONLY SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER ANTICIPATED AT THIS 
TIME. TEMPS WILL REMAIN WELL ABOVE CLIMO. MAV GUIDANCE APPEARS 
REASONABLE SO DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
WITH THE RIDGE POSITIONED OVER THE CAROLINAS...A SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST 
LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL TRANSPORT GREATER MOISTURE TOWARD THE AREA 
BEGINNING TUESDAY NIGHT. AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL ALSO 
APPROACH THE AREA...PROVIDING SOME WEAK LIFT ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS 
ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT SHOWING PRECIP STARTING AS EARLY AS 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WILL HAVE SLIGHT TO 
LOW CHANCE POPS IN THIS TIME FRAME.

THE LOW TO MIDLEVEL RIDGE TO OUR EAST REMAINS NEARLY 
STATIONARY...WHILE AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA FROM 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS SHOULD KEEP DRY WEATHER AND CONTINUED HOT 
TEMPERATURES FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. A FAIRLY STRONG COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES ON SATURDAY AS THE RIDGE GIVES WAY TO A DEEPENING TROUGH 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THE CANADIAN AND GFS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN AND HAVE SHOWN SOME RUN-TO-RUN 
CONSISTENCY...PUSHING THE FRONT THROUGH ON SATURDAY WITH 
COLDER/DRIER AIR BEHIND. BUT THE ECMWF SHOWS A DEEP CLOSED LOW 
DROPPING WAY SOUTH OVER THE PLAINS...STALLING THE FRONT TO NORTH AND 
PRODUCING COPIOUS AMOUNTS OF PRECIP OVER OUR AREA SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...WHICH LOOKS SUSPICIOUS. GIVEN THE LARGE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN 
THE GFS AND ECMWF...CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR DAYS 6 AND 7...SO WILL GO 
DRY ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  95  69  90  65 /   0   0  20  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  91  66  89  65 /   0   0  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  91  67  89  65 /   0  10  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  87  62  87  61 /   0  10  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMRX 200717
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT MON SEP 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE CENTERED 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES WITH AXIS WEST OF THE AREA TODAY. UPPER RIDGE 
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE PERIOD. SURFACE RIDGE 
SLIDES SE TO OVER MID ATLC STATES. THICKNESS VALUES RISE AND WILL 
SEE A CONTINUATION OF THE WARMING TREND. DAYTIME TEMPS DOUBLE DIGITS 
ABOVE NORMAL.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES 
THROUGH THE OH VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY. A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN PARTS OF MRX CWA. VERY LOW CHC FOR PCPN 
MAINLY WED AFT/EVE. DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS RETURN THROUGH FRIDAY. 
MODELS SOLUTIONS DIVERGE TRYING TO RESOLVE SHORT WAVE AND DEVELOPING 
SURFACE LOW THAT MOVE THROUGH GREAT LAKES ON SAT. SURFACE FRONT 
WILL LIKELY LOSS STRENGTH AND AVAILABLE MOISTURE AS IT MOVES SE INTO 
AREA SAT. LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST SUNDAY BUT BEST CHANCE CALLS FOR A 
DRY FORECAST.

679 
FXUS64 KMRX 191841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EDT SUN SEP 19 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM. VERY WEAK 
COLD FRONT WILL SAG TOWARD OUR AREA BEFORE DISSIPATING...PERHAPS 
EVEN INTO OUR NORTHERN ZONES...BUT SHOULD NOT BE MUCH OF A FACTOR.  
EXPECT A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND TEMPS CONTINUING ABOVE SEASONAL 
NORMS.  WILL GO ABOVE MAV TEMPS FOR LOWS TONIGHT...BUT WILL STAY 
CLOSE TO MAV FOR HIGHS TOMORROW.    

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS/ENSEMBLES 
DETERIORATE FROM GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FIRST PORTION OF THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD TO PROFOUND DISAGREEMENT BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. 
MAIN DISAGREEMENT REVOLVES AROUND TIMING/SIGNIFICANCE OF FRONT THAT 
MIGRATES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SOMETIME NEXT 
WEEKEND. GFS MUCH FASTER AND STRONGER WITH THIS FEATURE THAN THE 
ECMWF MODEL. AS A RESULT...HAVE OPTED TO SPREAD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS SEVERAL PERIODS TO ACCOUNT FOR UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING. 
OTHERWISE...GENERALLY BENIGN WEATHER REGIME EXPECTED TO CONTINUE 
WITH ONLY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION CONFINED MAINLY TO THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN POSSIBLE AS MOISTURE INCREASES IN RESPONSE TO SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  95  64  95  68 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  89  63  92  65 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  91  62  92  65 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  87  58  88  58 /   0   0   0   0  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

CEILINGS FOR TRI OVERNIGHT. KEPT TYS AND CHA VFR OVERNIGHT...BUT 
WILL NEED TO WATCH TYS OVER THE REST OF THE EVENING TO DETERMINE IF 
THE NEARLY 2/10THS OF AN INCH OF RAIN WILL AFFECT CEILING AND VSBY.

OTHERWISE...EARLY FRIDAY FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL SHIFT WINDS TO THE 
W-NW THEN NORTHERLY LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON. ANY MORNING CLOUDINESS 
WILL DECREASE BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS...WITH VFR CONDITIONS RETURNING.

&&

HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

SYSTEM WILL DRIFT SLOWLY EASTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST CONUS THROUGH

OF THE QUICKER SPEED OF THE FRONT HAVE REMOVED POPS OUT OF FRIDAY
MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY BUILD IN FROM THE OHIO
VALLEY. LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT WILL BE MILD WITH INCREASED CLOUD
COVER ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT. MODELS HAVE LITTLE COLD AIR
ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT EVEN WITH A SHIFT IN WINDS TO THE NORTH AND
NORTHWEST. WITH THIS IN MIND HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOUT THE
SAME AS THURSDAY EXCEPT A FEW DEGREES COOLER NORTH. RIDGING ALOFT
WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL FROM SATURDAY THROUGH MID WEEK OVER THE
SOUTHEAST STATES. GFS SHOWS A SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY
SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WHICH MIGHT INCREASE CLOUDS AS UPPER RIDGE
CENTER STAYS FARTHER WEST. PREFER TO FOLLOW ECMWF MODEL WHERE UPPER
RIDGE CENTER IS FARTHER EAST AND KEEPS THIS SYSTEM MUCH FARTHER
NORTH. NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES WEDNESDAY BUT WILL KEEP
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. LOWS WILL STAY NEAR NORMAL BUT HIGHS WILL BE
ABOVE NORMAL WITH STRONG RIDGE AND DRY AIR MASS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW CLOUDS STILL BUILDING

SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND 
FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...BY THURSDAY HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BE CENTERED OFF THE CAROLINA COASTLINE...WITH A RIDGE AXIS 
EXTENDING ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. MEANWHILE A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL 
BE CROSSING THE GREAT LAKES...WITH AN UPPER JET STREAK OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY. MODELS HAVE TRENDED SLIGHTLY FASTER WITH THIS TROUGH AND ITS 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. PLATEAU COUNTIES COULD SEE SHOWERS STARTING 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON. BEST LIFT WILL BE THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE TROUGH 
AXIS MOVING THROUGH AND THE POSITIONING OF THE UPPER JET OVER 
VIRGINIA TO ENHANCE UPPER DIVERGENCE. BUT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED 
DUE TO THE ORIENTATION OF THE RIDGE AXIS TO OUR SOUTH...PREVENTING 
GULF MOISTURE FROM BEING TAPPED. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE...AND REMOVE POPS FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 

THE REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS BENIGN AS A LARGE RIDGE SETTLES OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND THE SOUTHEAST. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WELL 
ABOVE NORMAL...WITH HIGHS EACH DAY IN THE 80S TO AROUND 90.

422 
FXUS64 KMRX 150214
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EDT TUE SEP 14 2010

.DISCUSSION...SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING.
MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE SE. SKIES WILL CLEAR AND TEMPS 
WILL DROP NICELY OVERNIGHT IN DRY AIRMASS. WARM WATERS WILL RESULT 
IN FOG FORMATION ACROSS WATERWAYS EARLY WEDNESDAY. NO UPDATE PLANNED. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...AN AREA OF MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS OVER THE 
WESTERN HALF OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA THIS 
EVENING...BUT OVERALL MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL PREVAIL. THE CLEAR SKY 
AND CALM WINDS WILL ONCE AGAIN PRODUCE GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING. DUE 
TO THE RELATIVELY WARM WATER TEMPERATURES FROM AREA LAKES AND 
STREAMS...STEAM FOG WILL LIKELY FORM AGAIN OVERNIGHT-WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. HAVE INCLUDED PATCHY DENSE FOG.

OTHERWISE...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP DRY AND UNSEASONABLY
WARM CONDITIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A DRY FORECAST STILL 
APPEARS TO DOMINATE THESE PERIODS...OUTSIDE OF A BRIEF CHANCE OF 
RAIN LATE THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY. TIMING STILL A BIT UNCERTAIN 
...BUT THE STRONGER AND SLOWER 12Z NAM MODEL IS NOT FAVORED OVER 
REST OF MODEL SOLUTIONS/ENSEMBLES. HOWEVER...WITH BEST DYNAMICS WELL 
TO OUR NORTH CLOSER TO THE ACTUAL SHORTWAVE TRACK ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGIONS...PLUS FAVORED SURFACE LOW ALSO TO OUR 
NORTH...RAIN CHANCES OF ONLY 20 TO 30 PERCENT ARE JUSTIFIED FOR NOW. 
MAIN CHANGE I MADE WAS TO INTRODUCE POPS FOR NRN PLATEAU AND THE 
SEQUATCHIE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON...THEN TO REMOVE POPS FROM 
THE NW AREAS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 

FOR REST OF THE EXTENDED...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE...ESPECIALLY 
OVER THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...AS A LARGE UPPER RIDGE 
SPREADS ACROSS THE SRN TWO-THIRDS OF THE NATION. THIS SHOULD KEEP 
HURRICANE IGOR OVER THE ATLANTIC OCEAN. SURFACE HIGH AND THE DRY AIR 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR A LARGE DIURNAL RANGE...WITH MIN TEMPS JUST A BIT 
ABOVE CLIMO...WHILE HIGHS RUN ABOUT 8 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO EACH 
DAY.

OTHERWISE...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP DRY AND UNSEASONABLY
WARM CONDITIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A DRY FORECAST STILL 
APPEARS TO DOMINATE THESE PERIODS...OUTSIDE OF A BRIEF CHANCE OF 
RAIN LATE THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY. TIMING STILL A BIT UNCERTAIN 
...BUT THE STRONGER AND SLOWER 12Z NAM MODEL IS NOT FAVORED OVER 
REST OF MODEL SOLUTIONS/ENSEMBLES. HOWEVER...WITH BEST DYNAMICS WELL 
TO OUR NORTH CLOSER TO THE ACTUAL SHORTWAVE TRACK ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY REGIONS...PLUS FAVORED SURFACE LOW ALSO TO OUR 
NORTH...RAIN CHANCES OF ONLY 20 TO 30 PERCENT ARE JUSTIFIED FOR NOW. 
MAIN CHANGE I MADE WAS TO INTRODUCE POPS FOR NRN PLATEAU AND THE
SEQUATCHIE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON...THEN TO REMOVE POPS FROM 
THE NW AREAS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 

FOR REST OF THE EXTENDED...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE...ESPECIALLY 
OVER THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...AS A LARGE UPPER RIDGE 
SPREADS ACROSS THE SRN TWO-THIRDS OF THE NATION. THIS SHOULD KEEP 
HURRICANE IGOR OVER THE ATLANTIC OCEAN. SURFACE HIGH AND THE DRY AIR 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR A LARGE DIURNAL RANGE...WITH MIN TEMPS JUST A BIT 
ABOVE CLIMO...WHILE HIGHS RUN ABOUT 8 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO EACH 
DAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  92  63  90  66 /   0   0   0  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  89  61  87  64 /   0   0   0  10  20

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

SUNSET. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE MENTIONING 'LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL 
POSSIBLE' AREAWIDE FOR THIS EVENING. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
ALONG WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS ACROSS THE CENTRAL U.S...PLACING THE MRX CWA IN DRY 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THIS AND A SURFACE HIGH IN PLACE WILL 
PROVIDE A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. SO...DRY 
WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MODELS 
BRING A COLD FRONT THROUGH AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME. TIMING OF 
THIS FEATURE IS IN QUESTION...BUT WILL HAVE 20 TO 30 POPS FOR FRIDAY 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR A 
RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY.

AND CURRENT CONVECTIVE TRENDS INDICATE THAT THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY 
SHOULD BECOME MORE SCATTERED BY THE AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH THE 
UNSTABLE AND MOIST AIR MASS SHOULD ENCOURAGE ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT 
OF CONVECTION AS THE WARM FRONT SLOWLY MOVE NORTH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. A COLD FRONT IS STILL EXPECTED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...AND WILL LIKELY TRIGGER 
ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING PRECIP 
WORDING...AND TO MENTION THAT RAINFALL COULD POSSIBLY BE HEAVY AT 
TIMES THIS AFTERNOON. WILL ALSO TWEAK TEMPS AND POPS A LITTLE 
ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

315 AM EDT SAT SEP 11 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
AN AREA OF RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH A MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL 
CROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. WILL CARRY 
CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE NORTHERN HALF THIS MORNING. 

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES A SURFACE WARM FRONT LOCATED ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TO SE KY. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS FRONT WILL 
PUSH NORTH ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. HIGH PRESSURE OVER PA/NY EXTENDS 
SOUTH ALONG THE APPALACHIANS...CREATING A SHALLOW COLD AIR DAMMING 
PATTERN IN THE TN VALLEY TODAY. MORNING RAIN WILL FURTHER ENFORCE 
THE SURFACE COLD POOL...WHICH WILL LIKELY DELAY THE NORTHWARD 
PROGRESS OF THE WARM FRONT MORE THAN THE MODELS INDICATE. WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE COOLER NAM GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS TODAY IN THE NORTH...WITH A 
BLEND OF GUIDANCE SOUTH. SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
SHOULD BE IN THE WARM SECTOR AROUND 18Z. INCREASING INSTABILITY IN 
THE AFTERNOON AND SOME SURFACE HEATING IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WILL 
RESULT IN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING...AND AN UPPER JET 
NOSING INTO THE AREA WILL ENHANCE UPPER DIVERGENCE. WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE 850/700 MB TROUGH WILL 
BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...ADVECTING DRIER AIR 
ALOFT AND TAPERING POPS BACK TO A CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE LATE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE... 
WILL KEEP ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MODELS 
ADVERTISING A FRONT TRACKING INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY. WITH STILL 
SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND STRENGTH...WILL ADD ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED FOR MOST OF PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 PM EDT FRI SEP 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. WARM FRONT
MOVING SLOWLY NORTH INTO MRX CWA. PCPN FAVORS N AREAS OVERNIGHT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A WARM FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH...WITH THE REMNANTS OF 
TROPICAL DEPRESSION HERMINE NEAR THE CONFLUENCE OF THE OHIO AND 
MISSISSIPPI RIVERS. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF HERMINE WILL COMBINE WITH 
STRENGTHENING ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING WARM FRONT TO 
PRODUCE AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF RAINFALL ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA LATER 
TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT. SINCE FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES ARE FAIRLY 
HIGH IN THIS AREA AND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO BE LOCATED 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AFTER MIDNIGHT...WILL NOT ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH AT 
THIS TIME BUT WILL MENTION 'RAIN POSSIBLY HEAVY AT TIMES' IN THE 
FORECAST. MODELS AGREE THAT A MUGGY AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...AS THE WARM FRONT MOVES 
NORTHWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...TRIGGERING ADDITIONAL 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE AND NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR SUNDAY AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...WITH THE EXCEPTION OF MAXES ON 
SATURDAY. WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE SINCE TEMPS WILL BE HIGHLY 
DEPENDENT ON THE AMOUNT OF CONVECTION THAT ULTIMATELY DEVELOPS.

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AND WILL 
CONTROL AREA WEATHER THROUGH MUCH FOR THE EXTENDED. THIS WILL 
PROVIDE DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WITH NEAR SEASONAL 
TEMPERATURES. THE ONLY CONCERN IS AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT THAT MAY 
REACH INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY. WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR NOW BUT 
WILL MONITOR TIMING OF THIS FEATURE.
