RAIN CHANCES GOING THROUGH TONIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS 
NORTHERN AREAS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY TODAY AND WILL BE HIGHLY 
DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. EXPECT THAT MOST 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN LOCATIONS WILL BE BROKEN TO OVERCAST...HOLDING 
TEMPS MAINLY IN THE 70S TO NEAR 80. SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS IN 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO REACH THE MID TO UPPER 80S.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE WILL KEEP 50-60 POPS GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS. UPPER TROUGH 
FOLLOWS ON SUNDAY MORNING. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE...WILL KEEP 
ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

REMNANTS OF HERMINE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA THROUGH SATURDAY...ALTHOUGH THE NAM MODEL REMAINS FAIRLY DRY 
UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS 
AREAWIDE ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY WITH THE APPROACH OF A WARM FRONT. MODELS 
INDICATE A FAIRLY STABLE AIR MASS ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL MENTION SHOWERS WITH TSTORMS 
CONFINED TO SOUTHEAST TN. THE WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...BRINGING MUGGY CONDITIONS AND AN 
INCREASING COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. MODELS AGREE A COLD FRONT WILL 
THEN MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...SO WILL PLAN TO 
RAISE POPS INTO THE LIKELY CATEGORY AREAWIDE FOR SATURDAY EVENING. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD...BUT WILL STAY ON THE WARM SIDE WITH MINS SINCE 
THIS HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER 
THE AREA EARLY SUNDAY AS A COLD FRONT PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION. 
OTHERWISE...AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. 
PUTTING THE MRX CWA IN DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THE RESULT WILL 
BE GENERALLY A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND FAIRLY 
SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

911 
FXUS64 KMRX 090700
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT THU SEP 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BOTTOM LINE: PLUG OF MOISTURE FROM 
TD HERMINE STILL AFFECTING REGION SO THAT DEWPOINTS HAVE NOT FALLEN 
OFF. WITHIN A FEW DAYS THEY WENT FROM LOW 40S TO UPPER 60S. BLUE 
SKIES TO HEAVY RAINS. FRONT HAS EXITED AREA AND BEEN REPLACED BY 
HIGH PRESSURE, WITH RIDGE ALOFT, BUT RIDGE IS DIRTY AND HAS SMALL 
WAVES MOVING OVER TOP OF IT, LIKELY ASSOCIATED WITH THE PATHETIC 
REMNANTS OF HERMINE. THERE IS ENOUGH RH TO KEEP CLOUDS IN BUT NOT 
ENOUGH LIFT AND SUPPORT FOR SHOWERS. AMS WILL BE MUGGY AND WARM WITH 
LIGHT WINDS. BECAUSE OF RAGGED HOLES IN THE CLOUD COVER IN THE 
CENTRAL THIRD HAVE ADDED SOME PATCH FOG THIS MORNING. IN THE 
NORTHEAST THIRD, AREAS OF DENSE FOG. TOO MANY CLOUDS IN THE 
SOUTHWEST THIRD FOR FOG. EXPECT WARM BLEND TEMPS TODAY AND UNDERCUT 
BLEND TEMPS TONIGHT BY A DEGREE OR SO.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...EARLY PERIODS ARE DEPENDENT 
ON THE REMNANT MOISTURE FROM TROPICAL STORM HERMINE...WITH GFS AND 
NAM LIKELY TOO DRY FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...NOT ACCOUNTING FOR 
THIS MOISTURE. A BLEND OF THE 12Z ECMWF/UKMET/CANADIAN ARE FAVORED 
BY HPC...AND THE ECMWF DOES ADVECT MOISTURE (HIGH SURFACE TO 850 MB 
THETA-E) EASTWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY.
THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...SUCH 
THAT STEERING WINDS WOULD SEND ANY CONVECTION E OR SE TOWARD OUR 
REGION. THUS...IN SPITE OF LOW 09/00Z MOS POPS...I KEPT PREVIOUS 
POP/WX GRIDS INTACT WITH CHANCE POPS FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT.

GREATEST RAIN CHANCES (TSRA) SHOULD OCCUR BY SATURDAY EVENING AS 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACH...AND I WAS 
TEMPTED TO NUDGE POPS UP TO LIKELY FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...
STAYING BELOW 60 PERCENT WAS A BETTER MESH WITH NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS
SO KEPT POPS AT 50 PERCENT WITH SCATTERED WORDING FOR NOW. EXPECT 
GENERAL NON-SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS...UNLESS UPPER TROUGH WERE TO 
AMPLIFY MORE. DRY FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...AS A FLAT W-NW FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS...AND WEAK NORTHERLY 
LOW LEVEL FLOW OCCURS WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE.  

TEMPS WERE TWEAKED SLIGHTLY AS NEEDED...IN LINE WITH 09/00Z GFSX
MOS AND NEIGHBORS GRIDS.

UPPER 60S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHWARD AND BE COMPLETELY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY 
SUNSET...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE NATION. THUS...WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. DRIER 
AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
THURSDAY...WITH HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE REMNANTS OF HERMINE CONTINUING 
TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. WITH THESE REMNANTS 
REMAINING UPSTREAM OF THE REGION THROUGH FRIDAY...WILL PLAN TO BE A 
LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER THAN THE MODELS. GFS MODEL 
INDICATES SOME LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS OVER SOUTHEAST TN ON THURSDAY... 
BUT WITH A VERY DRY BOUNDARY LAYER OBSERVED ON THE SOUNDINGS...WILL 
HANDLE THIS BY ONLY MENTIONING MORE CLOUDS WITHOUT ANY PRECIP. GFS 
AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF HERMINE 
WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...ALTHOUGH THE NAM 
MODEL REMAINS FAIRLY DRY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL PLAN 
TO CONTINUE WITH SMALL CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY 
NIGHT...AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY WITH 
THE APPROACH OF A WARM FRONT. MODELS INDICATE A FAIRLY STABLE AIR 
MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL 
MENTION ONLY SHOWERS. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD...AND LOOK REASONABLE. THE 
ONLY EXCEPTION BEING TONIGHT...WHERE THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS APPEAR 
BETTER DUE TO THE SLOW SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT OF THE COLD FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL PROGS SHOW UPPER 
TROF SHIFTING EAST FROM THE PLAINS STATES ON SATURDAY TO THE 
ATLANTIC COAST BY SUNDAY NIGHT. INITIALLY...A WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL BE PULLED NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. 
MAINTAINED A MEDIUM CHANCE POP FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FORMING AHEAD OF THIS BOUNDARY. THE COLD FRONT ARRIVES 
LATER SATURDAY NIGHT AND MODEL DEPICTION APPEARED TO MOVE THE COLD 
FRONT THROUGH MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z SUNDAY. TO BLEND WITH 
ADJACENT WFO'S USED A SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POP EARLY IN THE DAY 
DROPPING MENTION OF RAIN DURING THE AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT AND 
ASSOCIATED MOISTURE AXIS WILL BE WELL SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY WITH A NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW CONTINUING THROUGH MID WEEK. MODELS TRY TO BRING A WEAK COLD 
FRONT TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY BUT THE FEATURE 
APPEARS RATHER WEAK WITH LIMITED ACCOMPANYING MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE/LIFT. THEREFORE STAYED WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR NOW 
AWAITING BETTER MODEL RESOLUTION IN THE COMING DAYS.

ENOUGH FOR HEAVY RAIN IN SHOWERS. PATCHY CHARACTER OF SHOWERS WILL 
MEAN OPENINGS IN CIGS AND RESPITES FROM RAINS. BASICALLY WHEN IT 
DOES RAIN, IT WILL POUR. OCCASIONAL POSITIVE LIGHTNING STRIKES WILL 
BE POWERFUL AND BE ASSOCIATED WITH HEAVIER RAINS. 

WINDS WILL BE GENERALLY FROM WEST TO NORTHWEST AT LESS THAN 10 
KNOTS, BUT WILL VARY IN DIRECTION AND GUST TO POSSIBLY LOW 20S IN 
VICINITY OF THUNDERSTORMS/SHOWERS. 

EXPECT MAINLY VFR CONDITIONS EXCEPT IN HEAVY SHOWERS, WHEN 
CONDITIONS WILL DROP TO MVFR. DO NOT EXPECT LIFR CONDITIONS, BUT 
WILL MONITOR. CONFIDENCE IN THIS IS NOT THAT HIGH CONSIDERING HEAVY 
NATURE OF RAINS SO FAR THIS MORNING.


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

BB



569 
FXUS64 KMRX 080647
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 AM EDT WED SEP 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK FRONT WILL ENTER THE AREA 
TODAY AND MOVE OUT OF THE AREA OVER NIGHT.  ATMOSPHERE IS SLOWLY 
MOISTENING UP AGAIN IN ADVANCE OF IT. THE BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION 
SHOULD OCCUR THIS AFTERNOON IN PROXIMITY, PARTLY FIRED BY AFTERNOON 
WARMTH.  TOTAL QPF VALUES WILL BE ON THE LOWISH SIDE. EVEN THOUGH 
THE MODELS ARE INCREASING THE POPS, THEY APPEAR TO BE INCREASING 
THEM TOO RAPIDLY, WITH SOME LIKELIES. HAVE THEREFORE KEPT THEM IN 
THE CHANCE RANGE. WITH THE CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS 
TODAY...LEANED TOWARD THE BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR BOTH PERIODS. 
DEWPOINTS WILL HAVE REBOUNDED OVER THE LAST FEW DRY DAYS AND SO THE 
MUGGINESS OF LATE SUMMER IS BACK.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS TRENDING DRIER NOW 
FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT STILL 
DRY BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. LATEST ECMWF STILL GENERATING SOME 
SIGNIFICANT MESOSCALE CONVECTION THAT WOULD AFFECT OUR AREA BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT THE AMOUNT OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) LOOKS SUSPECT 
TO ME UNDER THE BUILDING UPPER RIDGE AT THAT TIME. THUS...I TRIMMED 
POPS BACK FOR FRIDAY...BUT KEPT CONTINUITY FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR ALL OF THOSE PERIODS. 
NO CHANGES FOR MONDAY OR TUESDAY FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS...AS SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDS OVER THE REGION. 

OTHERWISE...MADE A FEW SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO MAX/MIN TEMP GRIDS... 
ESPECIALLY ON FRIDAY WHEN POPS WERE LOWERED...AND ALSO FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT WHEN GFS AND NAM DIFFER ON AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER.

TERM PERIOD. NAM DOES PUSH WEAK COLD FRONT FURTHER SOUTH THAN
GFS...AND SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT IF IT EVER MAKES IT SOUTH OF OUR
AREA. HOWEVER...APPEARS DEEPER MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT SHOULD
EXIT...SO WILL GO DRY WED NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT FOR NOW. HOW
FAR NORTH THE REMNANTS OF HERMINE GO BEFORE ROUNDING THE RIDGE AND
DROPPING SOUTHEAST STILL PROBLEMATIC...BUT LOOKING MORE LIKELY THAT
AT LEAST NORTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA BE AFFECTED IN THE
FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. UNSETTLED WEATHER WILL CONTINUE
INTO THE WEEKEND AS FRONTAL SYSTEM AFFECTS THE AREA. LOOKS LIKE
FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT...SO WILL GO DRY MONDAY
AND TUESDAY.

351 
FXUS64 KMRX 071340
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EDT TUE SEP 7 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION PROVIDING A WARM AND DRY DAY UNDER A SUNNY SKY. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES 
NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS
CONTINUE TO SHOW A VERY DRY AIRMASS OVER MOST OF THE SE STATES 
THIS MORNING...AS THE UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS PLANTED
ACROSS THE REGION. SURFACE RIDGE HAS MOVED A LITTLE EAST...AND A
WEAK SOUTH TO SW LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL DEVELOP BY TONIGHT...AHEAD OF
A WEAK COLD FRONT.

HOWEVER...EXPECT A SUNNY AND WARM TO HOT DAY AGAIN WITH SIMILAR MOS
MAX TEMPS CLOSELY FOLLOWED...AND MANY SPOTS LOOK TO JUST TOP 90
DEGREES YET AGAIN.

NOT REALLY SOLD ON ANY SIGNIFICANT RAINS LATE TONIGHT...AND I DID
PREFER THE DRIER GFS MODEL SOLUTION. HOWEVER...KEPT CONTINUITY WITH
PREVIOUS GRIDS WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. THIS ALSO MESHES BETTER WITH NEIGHBORING GRIDS. WENT
WITH A BLEND OF MOS FOR MINS WHERE DIFFERENCES OF 2 TO 4 DEGREES
WERE NOTED. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHES 
INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY...MOSEYS SOUTH OF THE AREA WED NIGHT.  POPS 
NOT THAT IMPRESSIVE IN MODELS, A LITTLE SPOTTY, BUT IT'S A 
CONVECTIVE EVENT AND NOT STRATIFORM SO WILL JUST HAVE TO BROADBRUSH 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY. TOTAL QPF AMOUNTS ALSO A BIT QUESTIONABLE, SO 
WILL LEAVE ON THE LIGHT SIDE, DESPITE THIS MOISTURE BEING FROM A 
DECAYED TROPICAL STORM. DRYING, CLEARING PERIOD AFTER THIS FRONT 
LEAVES, BUT ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES IN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH A 
CHANCE FOR POPS AGAIN. THIS FRONT OUGHT TO BE OUT OF HERE BY MONDAY, 
BUT BY THEN THE ENSEMBLES ARE WIDELY DISPERSED SO VERY HIGH
UNCERTAINTY, AS IS TYPICAL THAT FAR OUT. MADE A FEW TWEAKS TO TEMPS
BUT NOTHING MAJOR.

LIKE THIS WILL MOVE BY TO OUR WEST AND NORTH...BUT ENOUGH OF A 
MOISTURE INCREASE INDICATED FOR OUR AREA TO COMBINE WITH THE FRONT 
TO OUR SOUTH MOVING BACK NORTH AND THEN ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVING IN 
FROM NORTHWEST TO GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR THE WEEKEND.  FRONT SHOULD 
BE SOUTH OF THE AREA BY MONDAY...ALLOWING FOR A DRY DAY...BUT GIVEN 
SPREAD IN MODEL SOLUTIONS UNCERTAINTY VERY HIGH BY DAY 7.  GFS MOS 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME TWEAKS.

977 
FXUS64 KMRX 061332
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 AM EDT MON SEP 6 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER. MAX TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A VERY NICE LABOR DAY AHEAD FOR 
THE REGION WITH PLEASANT MORNING TEMPS IN THE 40S TO MID/UPR 50S.
UPPER RIDGE SPREADING EAST OVER THE AREA TODAY...WHILE SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGE IS MOVING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. THIS WILL ALLOW 
FOR A WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP (ESPECIALLY FOR OUR 
PLATEAU COUNTIES)...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW MAX TEMPS TO CLIMB INTO 
MOSTLY THE 70S TO MID OR UPPER 80S...AS MAX SUNSHINE IS ALSO 
EXPECTED. 

GENERALLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT WITH MILDER MIN TEMPS...PROBABLY A BIT 
CLOSER TO THE COOLER GFS MOS NUMBERS. THESE MINS WILL BE COOLER THAN 
CLIMO...BUT NOT ANYWHERE NEAR RECORD LOWS FOR SEP 7TH. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGING ALOFT CONTINUES
TUESDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. TUESDAY NIGHT MOISTURE
INCREASES FROM THE MS VALLEY INTO THE TN VALLEY AS COLD FRONT
APPROACHES. CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY INCREASE. LOWS WILL BE MUCH WARMER
IN THE 60S. WEDNESDAY COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA.
MOST OF THE DEEPER MOISTURE STAYS TO THE WEST. WEDNESDAY NIGHT
SHOULD BE DRY WITH FRONT SOUTH. THURSDAY FRONT MOVES BACK TOWARD
THE FORECAST AREA AS A WARM FRONT. WARMER AND MOIST AIR MASS WILL
STAY OVER THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY WITH RAIN CHANCES CONTINUING. THE
BEST CHANCE SATURDAY AS NEW COLD FRONT APPROACHES. TEMPERATURES
SLIGHTLY COOLER THURSDAY BUT WILL STAY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE
EXTENDED.

&&

FOR A WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP (ESPECIALLY FOR OUR 
PLATEAU COUNTIES)...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW MAX TEMPS TO CLIMB INTO 
MOSTLY THE 70S TO MID OR UPPER 80S...AS MAX SUNSHINE IS ALSO 
EXPECTED. 

GENERALLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT WITH MILDER MIN TEMPS...PROBABLY A BIT 
CLOSER TO THE COOLER GFS MOS NUMBERS. THESE MINS WILL BE COOLER THAN 
CLIMO...BUT NOT ANYWHERE NEAR RECORD LOWS FOR SEP 7TH. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGING ALOFT CONTINUES
TUESDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. TUESDAY NIGHT MOISTURE
INCREASES FROM THE MS VALLEY INTO THE TN VALLEY AS COLD FRONT
APPROACHES. CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY INCREASE. LOWS WILL BE MUCH WARMER
IN THE 60S. WEDNESDAY COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA.
MOST OF THE DEEPER MOISTURE STAYS TO THE WEST. WEDNESDAY NIGHT
SHOULD BE DRY WITH FRONT SOUTH. THURSDAY FRONT MOVES BACK TOWARD
THE FORECAST AREA AS A WARM FRONT. WARMER AND MOIST AIR MASS WILL
STAY OVER THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY WITH RAIN CHANCES CONTINUEING. THE
BEST CHANCE SATURDAY AS NEW COLD FRONT APPROACHES. TEMPERATURES
SLIGHTLY COOLER THURSDAY BUT WILL STAY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE
EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             89  60  92  67  90 /   0   0  10  10  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  86  60  90  65  88 /   0   0  10  10  20

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
418 AM EDT FRI SEP 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE HOLDING ACROSS THE REGION 
BETWEEN THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT TO THE WEST...AND HURRICANE EARL 
JUST OFF THE NC COAST. HIGH CLOUDS MAY INCREASE TOWARD DAYBREAK... 
BUT LACK OF MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT LOOKS TO LIMIT RAIN 
CHANCES TODAY. SUBSIDENCE OVER REGION EARLY TODAY AND WESTERLY LOW 
LEVEL FLOW...USUALLY NOT FAVORABLE FOR MUCH PRECIPITATION. SOME 
INSTABILITY AND LIFT MAINLY FROM COLD FRONT...SO WILL INCLUDE 
ISOLATED TSRA (OR SLIGHT CHANCE).

OTHERWISE...SLOWED DOWN THE CLOUDINESS AND KEPT POPS AROUND A MOS 
BLEND FOR NOW. I DID INCREASE POPS OVER NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES OF EAST 
TN INTO EXTREME WRN PARTS OF SWRN VA...TO BETTER LINE UP WITH HIGHER 
JKL POPS. KEPT POPS EARLY THIS EVENING OVER VALLEY AND ERN MOST 
AREAS...BUT DROPPED POPS THIS EVENING FOR WRN MOST COUNTIES.  

DOWNSLOPING WESTERLY WINDS INTO VALLEY...AND DRY AIR...FAVORS THE 
WARMER GFS MOS HIGHS FOR TODAY. MOS MINS TONIGHT CLOSE AND GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SIGNIFICANT TROUGH WITH
COLD FRONT FRIDAY WILL MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY SATURDAY. HIGHS ABOUT 10 DEGREES COOLER AND N TO NW WINDS
WILL CONTINUE TO BRING COOL DRY AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AS
UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE MID 40S TO MID
50S. TROUGH SHIFTS EAST SUNDAY WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES. NIGHTS
WILL STAY COOL THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. MONDAY THROUGH
WEDNESDAY RIDGE BUILDS OVERTHE EASTERN STATES WITH ABOVE NORMAL
TEMPERATURES. LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY MODELS TRY TO BRING A
WEAK FRONT INTO EAST TN. THINK RIDGE MAY BE TO STRONG AND BEST
CHANCE WILL STAY WEST AND NORTH SO WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE AUG 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC AND CAROLINAS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. THIS AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES FAIRLY UNIFORM IN THE MID
80S TO NEAR 90 AND ONLY CLOUDS ARE SCATTERED CUMULUS ON THE PLATEAU
AND A FEW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. DRY AIR
MASS WILL ALLOW FOR LARGE DIURNAL SWING WITH NIGHTTIME LOWS AS LOW
AS MID 50S TRI-CITIES AND HIGHER VALLEYS IN THE MOUNTAINS TO LOWER
TO MID 60S MOST OTHER LOCATIONS. GUIDANCE ALMOST IDENTICAL FOR
WEDNESDAY WITH FULL SUN AND DRY AIR MASS SO NO DEVIATIONS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING TO BRING DRY AND UNSEASONABLY 
WARM CONDITIONS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. A FAIRLY STRONG COLD FRONT 
IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY...BRINGING A 
RETURN TO MORE SEASONAL TEMPS FOR THE WEEKEND. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF ONLY SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN SETTLE ACROSS 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH 
BUILDING FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS PATTERN 
WILL RESULT IN A RETURN TO DRY AND UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...TRENDED CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

CONTROL WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...A COLD FRONT PUSHING IN ON 
FRIDAY...WEAK NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT FOR THE WEEKEND...AND HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN ONCE AGAIN BY MONDAY.  AS SUCH...WILL KEEP THE 
THE FORECAST GENERALLY DRY WITH THE ONLY CHANCE OF CONVECTION ON 
FRIDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH...AND LINGERING SHOWERS FRIDAY 
NIGHT.  CURRENT FORECAST WAS ON TRACK AND ONLY MADE MINOR TWEAKS.  
GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

895 
FXUS64 KMRX 310133
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
933 PM EDT MON AUG 30 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. NO RADAR ACTIVITY 
ACROSS THE CWA. HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING A DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES 
NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...TROPICAL MOISTURE ON BACK SIDE 
OF BUILDING RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID ATLANTIC AND 
CAROLINAS HAS BEEN STREAMING NORTH INTO WESTERN AND SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. VARIABLE MID AND HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS SPREAD ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
A FEW SPRINKLES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. THIS HAS KEPT TEMPERATURES DOWN WITH CURRENT TEMPERATURES 
IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S THERE. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NE ARE IN THE 
UPPER 80S. TONIGHT ATMOSPHERE SLOWLY DRIES OUT IN THE WEST WITH 
SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR WEST AND CLEAR EAST BY MORNING. LOWS 
TONIGHT ALL AREAS WITH LESS CLOUD COVER. STILL WENT ON HIGH SIDE 
WEST AS LAST NIGHT CLOUDS KEPT LOWS SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE. 
TUESDAY WARMER TEMPERATURES NEAR 90 TO THE LOWER 90S WITH NEARLY 
FULL SUN. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT CONTINUING TO 
BRING DRY AND UNSEASONABLY WARM MAXES THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE WEEK. A 
FAIRLY STRONG COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION 
ON FRIDAY...BRINGING A RETURN TO MORE SEASONAL TEMPS FOR THE 
WEEKEND. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS SEEM TO AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE 
FAIRLY LIMITED WITH THIS COLD FRONT...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY 
SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS... 
TRENDED CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

248 
FXUS64 KMRX 300736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 AM EDT MON AUG 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE OUR WEATHER FOR THE SHORT TERM. EXPECT DRY
CONDITIONS WITH AN OVERALL DECREASE IN CLOUDS. MAV TEMPS LOOK
REASONABLE OVERALL..SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST IS 
STEADY STATE. ONLY MADE A FEW MINOR ADJUSTMENTS AS MASSIVE RIDGE 
REMAINS IN POSITION WITH AXIS EXTENDING FROM THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC 
STATES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THROUGH THURSDAY. HOWEVER...THE 
RIDGE WILL BE WEAKENING BY THURSDAY AS AN UPPER TROF SWINGS EAST 
FROM THE NORTH CENTRAL STATES THROUGH MUCH OF THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
BY FRIDAY NIGHT. A WEAK AND MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE TROF'S PASSAGE FRIDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT. TWEAKED 
THE POPS UP TO LOW CHANCE ON FRIDAY FOR THE FROPA. MODELS ALLOW FOR 
A DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BEHIND THE DEPARTED SYSTEM FOR THE WEEKEND. 
HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE A GOOD 8 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL UNDER 
THE INFLUENCE OF THE RIDGE TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS NEARLY 
MAXIMUM INSOLATION OCCURS WITHIN A DRY ATMOSPHERIC COLUMN. ONCE 
AGAIN ADJUSTMENTS HAD TO BE MADE TO MEX MOS MIN TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE 
AS IT APPEARS THE MODELS MAY BE LOWERING DEWPOINT TEMPS JUST A BIT 
TOO MUCH...MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
ALSO...MODELS DON'T SEEM TO BE ACCOUNTING FOR THE TREMENDOUS AMOUNT 
OF HEAT ENERGY THE SURFACE HAS ENDURED DURING THIS VERY WARM LATE 
SUMMER SEASON. BELIEVE THERE WILL BE A FAIR AMOUNT OF RE-RADIATED 
ENERGY DURING THIS HEAT WAVE WHICH SHOULD SLOW THE DROP IN 
TEMPERATURES EVEN IN THE DRIER ENVIRONMENT. ALSO HAD TO ADJUST MAX 
TEMPS UP A BIT OVER THE WEEKEND AS MOS SEEMS TO BE ERRONEOUSLY 
PULLING THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS DOWN DUE TO CLIMATOLOGY.   


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  91  65  93  64  93 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       91  64  93  64  93 /   0   0   0   0   0

433 
FXUS64 KMRX 300130
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT SUN AUG 29 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR ECHOES OVER 
AREA NOT INDICATING ANY PRECIPITATION REACHING THE GROUND. HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE AREA SHOULD PROVIDE A DRY FORECAST FOR 
THE REST OF TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...A BAND OF SHOWERS...ASSOCIATED WITH LOW PRESSURE OVER
THE LOWER MS REGION...HAS STAYED TO OUR SOUTHWEST. OVER THE NEXT
24 HOURS...THE TREND WILL BE FOR HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID
ATLANTIC AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TO RETROGRADE AND STRENGTHEN
SLIGHTLY...WHICH WILL PUSH THE RAIN BAND FARTHER AWAY AND INCREASE
SUBSIDENCE. THE BUILDING RIDGE WILL ALSO RESULT IN WARMER MIDLEVEL
TEMPS TOMORROW...WHICH WILL SUPPRESS CONVECTION. SO THE FIRST TWO
PERIODS OF THE FORECAST LOOK DRY. MOS GUIDANCE HAS CONSISTENTLY
BEEN TOO COOL WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS...SO WENT ABOVE GUIDANCE TONIGHT.
LESS CLOUD COVER TOMORROW SHOULD RESULT IN WARMER HIGH
TEMPS...ESPECIALLY SOUTH...WITH MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS IN
THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
NOT MUCH CHANGE IN FORECAST WITH MID ATLANTIC UPPER RIDGE IN PLACE 
AND STRENGTHENING MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. THE 
NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN COMES FRIDAY. ECMWF AND GFS BRING WEAK COOL 
FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY WITH VERY LIMITED 
MOISTURE. GFS SLOWER SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE MOST AREAS FRIDAY NIGHT. 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH NW FLOW BEHIND FRONT. STILL 
FOLLOWING WARMER GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR HIGHS AND LOWS AS MODELS HAVE 
BEEN TOO COLD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  92  68  93  66 /  10  10  10  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  91  66  93  65 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  90  66  93  65 /  10   0   0   0   0

FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY WITH VERY LIMITED 
MOISTURE. GFS SLOWER SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE MOST AREAS FRIDAY NIGHT. 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH NW FLOW BEHIND FRONT. STILL 
FOLLOWING WARMER GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR HIGHS AND LOWS AS MODELS HAVE 
BEEN TOO COLD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  91  66  93  65 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  90  66  93  65 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              63  90  59  92  57 /   0   0   0   0   0

348 
FXUS64 KMRX 291723 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
123 PM EDT SUN AUG 29 2010

.AVIATION...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK NORTH ALONG THE MS VALLEY...WHILE
HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS FIRMLY ENTRENCHED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC
REGION. DEEP MOISTURE AND PRECIP/LOW CEILINGS ASSOCIATED WITH THE
LOW WILL REMAIN TO THE WEST OF THE TAF SITES. THE ONLY IMPACT WILL
BE SOUTHEAST WINDS AT OR ABOVE 10 KT AT CHA...WTIH BROKEN MIDLEVEL
CLOUDS. TYS AND TRI ARE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A SOUTHEASTERLY
DOWNSLOPE FLOW...WHICH WILL PREVENT ANY PRECIP OR LOW CEILINGS.
HOWEVER AS WE HAVE SEEN THE PAST SEVERAL MORNINGS...VISIBILITIES
MAY BE REDUCED TO MVFR OR 6SM DUE TO LIGHT FOG OR HAZE AT TYS AND
TRI. WITH LITTLE PATTERN CHANGE...TONIGHT SHOULD BE NO DIFFERENT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

318 
FXUS64 KMRX 291357 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 AM EDT SUN AUG 29 2010

.DISCUSSION...
EAST TN WILL BE IN A TRANSITION ZONE FROM A VERY MOIST AIR MASS AND
LOW PRESSURE TO THE SOUTHWEST TO A DRY AIR MASS AND HIGH PRESSURE TO
THE NORTHEAST. 12Z RAOBS SHOW WELL OVER 2 INCH PW AT BMX...TO 1
INCH AT RNK. A DEEP SOUTHEAST FLOW FROM THE SURFACE TO 500 MB
SHOULD MEAN THAT THE PRECIP OVER AL SHOULD STAY JUST OUTSIDE OUR
BORDERS...BUT SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT COULD OCCUR THIS
AFTERNOON...SO WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING. SATELLITE
TRENDS AND FORECAST MOISTURE PROFILES SHOW THAT SIGNIFICANT MID TO
UPPER LEVEL CLOUDS WILL AFFECT THE SOUTHERN HALF OF OUR AREA. FOR
THIS REASON TEMPERATURES WILL NEED TO BE LOWERED A FEW
DEGREES...INTO THE MID/UPPER 80S. THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS
WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A DOWNSLOPE FLOW...AND CLOUD COVER
WILL HAVE LESS IMPACT THERE...SO WILL KEEP THE CURRENT FORECAST
HIGHS AROUND 90 GOING FOR TYS AND TRI.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

731 
FXUS64 KMRX 290752
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
352 AM EDT SUN AUG 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
CENTERED TO OUR EAST AND NORTHEAST.  WEAK LOW NEAR GULF COAST WILL 
DRIFT NORTH NEAR MISSISSIPPI RIVER.  SOUTHEAST FLOW WILL BRING SOME 
INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND CLOUDS...ESPECIALLY TO SOUTHERN AREAS...BUT 
APPEARS BULK OF PRECIP WILL STAY TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST.  WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTH TODAY AND FAR SOUTHWEST ZONES EARLY 
TONIGHT.  WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS FOR HIGHS 
TODAY...WITH A NUDGE UP MOST LOCATIONS FOR MINS TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE WITH THE IDEA 
OF THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES UPPER RIDGE HOLDING ITS POSITION AND 
STRENGTH THROUGH MID WEEK. STAYED WITH THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
CONVECTION ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ON MONDAY AS THE RIVER OF 
TROPICAL MOISTURE BETWEEN THE EXPANDING HIGH AND LOWER PRESSURE OVER 
THE CENTER OF THE NATION WILL CONTINUE TO FLOW NORTHWEST ACROSS THE 
HIGHER PLATEAU TERRAIN. SOME LIFT WILL STILL BE PRESENT WITH 
WEAKENING AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE DEEP SOUTH...ALONG WITH SOME 
INSTABILITY AND OROGRAPHICS. BEYOND THIS RATHER LIMITED CHANCE FOR 
RAIN. THE NEXT CHANCE THAT THE FORECAST AREA MAY SEE A COOLING 
SHOWER WOULD BE FRIDAY. SOME DIFFERENCES IN MODEL TIMING OF 
WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL TROF MIGRATING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TOWARD 
THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH THE ECMWF FASTER 
THAN THE GFS HOWEVER...BOTH MODELS APPEARED TO SLOW DOWN THE ARRIVAL 
OF THIS FEATURE FROM EARLIER MODEL DEPICTION SO JUST PLACED THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP ON FRIDAY. A LITTLE TOO DISTANT TO HAVE A GREAT 
DEAL OF CERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM BUT IT DOES APPEAR TO BE RATHER 
ANEMIC WITH UPPER TROF BUILDING EAST INTO MASSIVE UPPER RIDGE. COOL 
FRONT LOOKS LIKE IT MAY HAVE VERY LIMITED MOISTURE TO WORK WITH AS 
IT MOVES INTO A REGION WHICH WILL BE AFFECTED BY AN EXTENDED PERIOD 
OF DRIER EASTERLY DOWNSLOPING FLOW. ALSO THE PRESSURE PATTERN AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT REVEALS ONLY WEAK CONVERGENCE WITH ITS PASSAGE. STAYED 
WITH A DRY FORECAST ON SATURDAY AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW PUSHES 
BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. MONDAY NIGHT MET/MAV TEMPS A 
FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES TO COOL AND HAD TO ADJUST HIGHER. ALSO MEX 
MOS MINS LOOK SEVERAL DEGREES TO COOL ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE 
EXTENDED.



&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       90  67  90  67  92 /  10  10   0   0   0

467 
FXUS64 KMRX 290146
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
946 PM EDT SAT AUG 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...ISOLATED SHOWERS ARE EXITING THE AREA. REST OF THE 
TONIGHT SHOULD BE DRY. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO 
OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.   

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...  

.SHORT TERM...ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED THIS AFTERNOON IN THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SE TN...WITH A
SOUTHEAST WIND ALOFT MOVING THE SHOWERS INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY
COUNTIES. A FEW MAY PERSIST INTO THE EVENING HOURS...SO WILL CARRY
A SLIGHT CHANCE POP UNTIL 03Z.

THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE IN THE SHORT TERM WILL BE LOW PRESSURE 
ALONG THE GULF COAST THAT WILL BE MOVING NORTHWARD UP THE MS RIVER 
THROUGH SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY TO OUR 
NORTHEAST...PRODUCING A SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW OFF THE ATLANTIC. THIS 
WILL TRANSPORT ADDITIONAL MOISTURE INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR 
AREA. MOST OF THE PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THE GULF COAST LOW WILL 
REMAIN TO OUR SOUTHWEST OVER AL. EXPECT THAT CONVECTION IN OUR AREA 
WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL IN NATURE OVER OUR SOUTHERN HALF. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE STABLE MID LEVELS AND A DOWNSLOPE FLOW THAT SHOULD 
KEEP THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY DRY. HIGHEST TEMPS TOMORROW 
MAY BE NORTH AND CENTRAL DUE TO THE DOWNSLOPE AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS 
SEEING GREATER CLOUD COVER. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
WEAK LOW THAT IS IN THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO NOW WILL HAVE DRIFTED 
WESTWARD INTO MEXICO BY SUNDAY EVENING AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND 
ALOFT REMAINS ACROSS THE MID ATLANTIC STATES AND STRENGTHENS FARTHER 
SOUTH INTO THE CAROLINAS. SOME GULF MOISTURE WILL STILL BE FUNNELED 
NORTH INTO THE LOWER MS AND TN VALLEYS SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY ON 
THE WEST SIDE OF THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY MAINLY SOUTHERN PLATEAU 
AND PART OF THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE MID 
ATLANTIC MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS THE MOISTURE FROM THE LOW GRADUALLY 
SHIFTS WEST. DRIER AIR WILL ALLOW FOR NEARLY MAXIMUM HEATING WITH 
HIGHS RISING TO THE LOWER 90S. NIGHTS WILL STILL BE NEAR NORMAL IN 
THE 60S. A COLD FRONT WITH UPPER TROUGH ADVANCING ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
STATES WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WILL SHIFT RIDGE INTO THE ATLANTIC BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL PUSH OR KEEP EARL OFF THE COAST. THE FRONT 
LOOKS FAIRLY WEAK ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY SO 
CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE CONVECTION. SUNNY AND DRY FORECAST BEHIND 
FRONT SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD LOWER 3 TO 5 DEGREES WITH THE 
CLOUDS AND THEN NW FLOW BEHIND THE FRONT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.         

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  89  69  90  65 /  20  20  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  91  67  90  64 /  10  10  10  10   0

FXUS64 KMRX 280732

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EDT SAT AUG 28 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NOT MUCH CHANGE TO THE PATTERN 
FOR THE SHORT TERM...WITH UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION AND SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO OUR NORTHEAST.  WITH SOUTHEAST LOW LEVEL 
FLOW THERE MAY BE ISOLATED CONVECTION AGAIN OVER THE FAR SOUTHEAST 
AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS...BUT DOWNSLOPE FLOW INTO THE VALLEY SHOULD 
INHIBIT MUCH CONVECTION MAKING IT WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS.  WILL GO 
WITH A MAINLY PERSISTENCE FORECAST.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO NO SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS PLANNED.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A NICE AND WARM PERIOD IN STORE 
AS AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES AND THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. HAD TO MAINTAIN SOME SMALL AND 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY AS A WEAK LOW SHIFTS NORTH FROM THE 
NORTHERN GULF COAST INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE SOUTHERLY 
FLOW BETWEEN THE BUILDING RIDGE AND LOWER PRESSURE AREA WILL ALLOW 
FOR THE ADVECTION OF TROPICAL MOISTURE ACROSS MUCH OF THE DEEP 
SOUTH. THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE 
ON THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF THIS MOIST PLUME EARLY IN THE WEEK 
BEFORE BEING SHUNTED FARTHER AND FARTHER WEST AS THE THE RIDGE 
STRENGTHENS. SUBSIDENCE AND DRYING WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER SCENE 
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY ALLOWING FOR NEARLY UNABATED INSOLATION 
AND A MINI HEAT WAVE. BY THURSDAY NIGHT AN UPPER TROF WILL HAVE 
MIGRATED EAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND MIDWEST. AN ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT MAY MAKE IT INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT WITH 
PROGRESSION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE DAY 
FRIDAY SO HELD ONTO THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR FRONTAL CONVECTION AT 
THIS TIME. MEX MOS GUIDANCE LOOKED A LITTLE TOO COOL THROUGH MOST OF 
THE PERIOD SO TWEAKED TEMPS UPWARD A DEGREE OR TWO.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             93  71  85  69  88 /  10  10  20  10  10

OAK RIDGE, TN                       92  67  87  67  88 /  10  10   0   0   0

380 
FXUS64 KMRX 280135
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EDT FRI AUG 27 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR INDICATING A 
FEW LIGHT SHOWERS LINGERING IN THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS...BUT THEY 
SHOULD CONTINUE TO DIMINISH THIS EVENING. WILL KEEP A DRY FORECAST 
FOR TONIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
VERY LITTLE CHANGE TO THE PATTERN IS EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT 24
HOURS...SO PERSISTENCE WILL BE FOLLOWED. SHOWERS OVER EXTREME SW NC
SHOULD DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET...ALONG WITH THE CU ACROSS THE REST OF
THE AREA...LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT. AS AS SAW LAST
NIGHT...THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH OF A PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE
AREA TO PREVENT MUCH FOG FORMATION. THE MID LEVEL RIDGE WILL BE A
BIT MORE OVERHEAD TOMORROW...WHICH MAY LEAD TO HIGH TEMPS A FEW
DEGREES WARMER. THE 850 MB RIDGE OVER THE CAROLINAS WILL SUPPLY A
SOUTHEAST UPSLOPE FLOW...WHICH WILL AGAIN PRODUCE ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS IN THE SMOKIES AND SW NC. DOWNSLOPE FLOW ON THE
LEEWARD SIDE SHOULD PREVENT MUCH SHOWER ACTIVITY IN THE VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
SHOWERS SHOULD END BY EVENING SATURDAY WITH SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY 
CLEAR. LOWS SLIGHTLY WARMER SUNDAY. SOME SLIGHT CHANGES TO FORECAST 
AFTER THAT AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE MID ATLANTIC AND 
APPALACHIANS AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING KEEPS OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ALONG THE GULF COAST FROM SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY ALTHOUGH MOISTURE 
IN THE FOR OF CLOUDS MAY MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN AND SOUTHWEST 
SECTIONS AT TIMES. UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS. HIGHS WILL BE ABOVE 
NORMAL IN THE 80S TO NEAR 90 AT CHA WITH LOWS UPPER 50S TO UPPER 
60S. THURSDAY HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST AS COLD FRONT 
BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE OHIO AND WEST TN VALLEY. WEAK COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS 
GREAT LAKES STATES. WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THURSDAY NIGHT 
NW AND ALL AREAS FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT FRI AUG 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
NORTH WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND INTO THE AREA AS IT SHIFTS EAST.  
MEANWHILE...UPPER TROUGH WILL GIVE WAY TO A BUILDING RIDGE DURING

DOES APPEAR THAT THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE/INSTABILITY OVER THE 
EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES FOR SOME ISOLATED AFTERNOON CONVECTION...SO 
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE.  OTHERWISE...EXPECT MOSTLY 
CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO 
JUST A FEW TWEAKS.   


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DID NOT MAKE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST AS MODELS 
BASICALLY INDICATE THAT THE EASTERN STATES UPPER TROF MOVES EAST 
WITH HEIGHTS BUILDING ALOFT ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. SURFACE HIGH DROPS SOUTHWEST FROM PENNSYLVANIA AND NEW 
YORK ON SATURDAY TO A POSITION RIGHT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THROUGH MID WEEK. KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS SOUTH 
TO THE NORTHERN GEORGIA BORDER INCLUDING SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. 
MODELS SHOW A SOUTHEAST (UPSLOPE) FLOW DEVELOPING WITH INDICATION OF 
A WEAK SHORT WAVE FEATURE BUILDING NORTHWEST ACROSS THIS PART OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH AN AREA OF DEEPER MOISTURE AT THIS TIME. 
OTHERWISE MAINTAINED A DRY FORECAST THROUGHOUT THE REMAINDER OF THE 
LONG TERM WITH THE RIDGE ONLY BREAKING DOWN TOWARD THE END OF THE 
PERIOD AS AN UPPER TROF MAKES PROGRESS THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION. TRENDED TEMP 
FORECAST CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO UNDER NEW MEX MOS NUMBERS.

PRESSURE GRADIENT. EXPECT THAT THIS MIXING SHOULD PREVENT FOG AT

MOVING ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...SEEN IN THE 12Z RAOBS OVER

SOUNDINGS DO SHOW SOME INSTABILITY AS YESTERDAY'S MIDLEVEL CAP IS
WEAKER TODAY...ESPECIALLY TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. THE
RUC...NAM...AND CANADIAN ALL PRODUCE SOME LIGHT QPF IN SW VA AND SW
NC TODAY. SO THE CURRENT FORECAST OF ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS IN OUR EASTERN COUNTIES THIS AFTERNOON APPEARS
JUSTIFIED. TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK FOR HIGHS IN THE 80S TO AROUND
90 IN THE VALLEY...WITH 70S IN THE MOUNTAINS. NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

FXUS64 KMRX 260755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT THU AUG 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT...A WEAK FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA WITH VERY LITTLE MOISTURE SUPPORT ASSOCIATED WITH IT. WILL 
CONTINUE WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AND 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. NO SEVERE WEATHER IS ANTICIPATED TODAY. DRY 
WEATHER RETURNS TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE CWA. 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURE ARE EXPECTED AGAIN TODAY AND 
TONIGHT.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES ARE SIMILAR...SO STAYED 
RELATIVELY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...AND REVEAL A TRANQUIL 
PATTERN WITH A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. MODELS INDICATE THAT AN 
EASTERLY SURFACE WIND FLOW ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WILL GENERATE SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS OVER WESTERN NC...SO 
WILL MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER SOUTHWEST NC. OTHERWISE...A 
LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION SHOULD 
SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK...AND ALSO ALLOW TEMPS TO GRADUALLY RISE EACH DAY. LATEST GFS 
MODEL RUN INDICATES THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME TROPICAL MOISTURE 
SURGING NORTHWARD ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK (WHICH 
IS SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY'S ECMWF SOLUTION)...BUT IT APPEARS THIS 
MOISTURE SHOULD STAY EITHER SOUTH OR WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT KEPT TEMPS EITHER THE SAME OR GRADUALLY RISING 
INTO NEXT WEEK WITH A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH EXPECTED OVER THE 
APPALACHIANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 251831

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EDT WED AUG 25 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY TODAY WILL TRACK 
TOWARD THE AREA TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. THE FRONT IS DISTINGUISHED 
MAINLY BY A DROP IN DEWPOINTS AND BY THE BACK EDGE OF SOME CLOUDS IN 
SATELLITE. RADARS SHOW NO PRECIP CURRENTLY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
FRONT AS MOISTURE IS SHALLOW...MAINLY BELOW 850 MB...AND THE 
MIDLEVEL FLOW IS NORTHWEST. SO AS THE FRONT APPROACHES TONIGHT AND 
TOMORROW...NOT MUCH PRECIP IS EXPECTED. THE MODELS DO PRODUCE SOME 
LIGHT QPF IN SW VA AND IN SW NC TOMORROW AFTERNOON...AND THE 
MIDLEVEL INVERSION NOTED IN RAOBS THIS MORNING IS WEAKER 
TOMORROW...ESPECIALLY NORTH AND EAST. WILL INCLUDE A MENTION OF 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND TSTMS IN THESE AREAS...IN LINE WITH SURROUNDING 
OFFICES. TEMPS SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO TODAY...WITH LOWS IN THE 60S AND 
HIGHS IN THE 80S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
REVEAL A TRANQUIL PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES EAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND BECOMES STATIONARY 
OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH IS PROGGED 
TO DEVELOP OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND AND 
INTO NEXT WEEK...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT AND ALLOW DAYTIME TEMPS TO GRADUALLY RISE EACH DAY. 
FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 241912

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE AUG 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE 
OVER THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES WILL GRADUALLY LIFT OUT TO THE 
NORTHEAST TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. STAYED WITH JUST A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE TONIGHT WITH THE EXITING SYSTEM. DECIDED TO USE THE AREAS 
OF FOG WORDING AGAIN TONIGHT ALTHOUGH THE FOG COULD TURN OUT TO BE 
PATCHY WITH WITH AN EXPANDING STRATO CU DECK SLOWING THE RATE OF 
COOLING. NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY CURRENTLY ADVANCING THROUGH THE PLAINS STATES. MODELS HAVE 
ADVERTISED A WEAK FROPA WITH LIMITED CONVERGENCE AND MOISTURE FOR 
SEVERAL DAYS AND WAS USING THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE EVENT. THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP THAT WAS IN THE ZONES FOR THE LAST SEVERAL DAYS 
WAS RECENTLY REMOVED FROM THE FORECAST. BECAUSE THIS WILL BE SUCH A 
LOW PROBABILITY EVENT IN TERMS OF RAINFALL AND BECAUSE OF THE DESIRE 
TO KEEP FROM FLIPPING AND FLOPPING (POPS IN/POPS OUT)...DECIDED I 
WOULD STAY WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE. 
THIS  INCLUDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM FOR THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ON THURSDAY AS DEEPER MOISTURE AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
TRAILS THE SURFACE FRONT. VERY SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT MIN/MAX TEMPS FOR 
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW WHILE STAYING WITH THE BLEND FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROF OVER THE 
APPALACHIANS SHIFTS NE EARLY IN THE PERIOD. LARGE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES EAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. DRY WEATHER WITH COOL 
MORNINGS AND WARM DAYS. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT MON AUG 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH AND CAROLINAS...WITH A SLIGHTLY DRIER 
AIR MASS (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...BRINGING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND 
LIGHT WINDS. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOME CHANGES COMING AS UPPER 
LOW OVER NORTHEAST US OPENS UP AND DRIFTS AWAY FROM REGION...PUSHED 
BY UPPER TROF OVER HUDSON BAY. THIS WILL ALLOW A WEAK COLD FRONT TO 
PASS THROUGH THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...TEMPS WILL ONLY COOL 
TO MORE NEAR NORMAL VALUES FOR LATE SUMMER AND THE ATMOSPHERE WILL 
STILL BE QUITE DRY FOR PREDICTING ANY REAL RAINFALL. HAVE LEFT POPS 
MUCH AS THEY WERE AND GONE WITH PREVIOUS THINKING THAT THEY MAY END 
UP BEING REMOVED ALTOGETHER IN SUBSEQUENT FORECASTS. EVEN THE PW'S 
RETURN TO MORE NORMAL LEVELS...SO BELIEVE THAT IF A THUNDERSTORM 
DOES OCCUR IT WILL ONLY PRODUCED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...AND NOT 
LOCALLY VERY VERY HEAVY RAINFALL. BY THURSDAY...THE LOW MOVES OUT 
AND THE WESTERN US RIDGE MOVES QUICKLY EAST TO ASSERT ITSELF QUITE 
STRONGLY OVER THE EAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. IT ALMOST TAKES ON QUASI 
OMEGA BLOCK CHARACTERISTICS AND SO THIS WILL BEAR WATCHING LATER. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE QUITE DRY AS WELL...HINTING AT SOME MIDDLE TO 
HIGH CLOUDS WITH FROPA BUT THAT'S ABOUT IT. KEPT TEMPS AS IS...SEE 
NO REASON TO CHANGE THEM.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EDT SUN AUG 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS
ARE THE RULE THIS AFTERNOON...AS MOISTURE LINGERS IN THE SURFACE TO
850 MB LAYER. KEPT NRN AND CENTRAL AREAS PARTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT...
WHILE SRN VALLEY SHOULD CLEAR OUT THIS EVENING. THE BOUNDARY LAYER
WILL BE QUITE MOIST...SO ADDED SOME AREAS OF FOG FOR MOST AREAS.
MOS MINS QUITE CLOSE AND HARD TO DIFFER WITH...AS DEW POINT TEMPS
HAVE BEEN FALLING SLOWLY. 

SURFACE HIGH AND UPPER RIDGE TO DOMINATE...ALTHO NERN STATES UPPER
LOW DOES SETTLE SOUTH TO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY MONDAY NIGHT.
PAINTED IN A FEW MORE CLOUDS FOR OUR FAR NE AREAS FROM THIS FEATURE 
BUT PREFER NOT TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS JUST YET FOR TUESDAY
AFTERNOON. 

OTHERWISE...DRIER AIR BRINGS SEASONAL MINS WITH HIGHS RUNNING A FEW
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL...WITH GFS MOS SLIGHTLY PREFERRED.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FINALLY THE EXTENDED 
WEATHER PATTERN FEATURES QUITE A BIT OF CHANGE IN TEMPERATURE AND 
DEWPOINT TEMPERATURE WITH A NORTHERLY UPPER LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING 
THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD AS AN UPPER LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN AND MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES WITH ANOTHERN LONG WAVE TROF 
DROPPING BACK INTO THIS AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. THIS FEATURE WILL 
BE PRECEDED BY A COLD FRONT THAT MOVES THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
ADJUSTED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM TO THIS 
PERIOD WITH FROPA BUT THIS MAY NEED TO BE REMOVED IF THE PASSAGE  
APPEARS LIKE IT WILL OCCUR IN A MOISTURE STARVED ENVIRONMENT. WENT 
AHEAD AND KEPT AND EXTENDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA AND THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA ON FRIDAY. 
EXPANDED THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REGION 
FOR SATURDAY AS MOISTURE DEEPENS WITH INCREASING SOUTHEASTERLY 
UPSLOPE FLOW AROUND THE BASE OF THE PERSISTANT NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
SURFACE RIDGE. USED A NICE DRY SUNDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE MAKES 
PROGRESS INTO THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY. ADJUSTED MAX AND 
MINS A LITTLE BELOW MOS GUIDANCE AS REFRESHING SLIGHTLY BELOW TO 
NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE IN STORE THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST.

917 PM EDT SAT AUG 21 2010

WAS THE MAIN CONCERN ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SATURATED NORTHERN
PLATEAU. ACTIVITY HAS BEGUN TO WEAKEN BUT MORE STORMS ACROSS MIDDLE
TN AND SE KY SHOULD CONTINUE A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. LOWERED TEMPERATURES A FEW
DEGREES DUE TO RAIN COOLED AIR MASS. PATCHY FOG MAY DEVELOP IN
LOCALIZED LOCATIONS WHERE HEAVY RAIN FELL BUT DID NOT ADD TO ZONES.
UPDATE OF FORECAST ALREADY SENT.

406 
FXUS64 KMRX 211919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT SAT AUG 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CONVECTION CONTINUES TO 
DEVELOP WELL AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT AND SHORTWAVE TROUGH THIS 
AFTERNOON. SURFACE BOUNDARY FOCUSING MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY APPEARS 
TO AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY OR PERHAPS A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AXIS. MADE 
LAST MINUTE ADJUSTMENTS TO INCREASE POPS FOR REST OF THE PRE-00Z 
FORECAST GRIDS...AS THIS LINE OF CONVECTION SWEEPS EAST FROM THE 
PLATEAU COUNTIES TO THE ERN MTNS. UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FOR THIS 
CONVECTION SEEMS TO BE THE RIGHT REAR QUADRANT OF A MID TO UPPER 
LEVEL JET AXIS TO OUR NORTH. 

AFTER THIS ACTIVITY...LOWERED POPS FOR THE EARLY EVENING HOURS AND 
THEN INCREASED POPS IN LINE WITH SHORT RANGE MODELS AND LATEST POPS. 
AIRMASS IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT IS QUITE UNSTABLE OVER THE WRN 
2/3RDS OF TN INTO NRN PARTS OF MS AND AL...SO CAN'T ARGUE WITH SHORT 
RANGE MODELS DEVELOPING MORE SHOWERS AND TSRA OVERNIGHT. GUSTY WINDS 
AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS APPEAR TO BE THE MAIN THREAT. 

OTHERWISE...MAIN CHANGES FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WERE TO LOWER 
POPS MUCH QUICKER ON SUNDAY...AND ACTUALLY DROP NEARLY ALL POPS BY 
SUNDAY EVENING. NORTHERLY FLOW BEHIND THIS SYSTEM BRINGS CLEARING 
AND DRIER AIR FOR MONDAY. HOWEVER...NAM MOS HIGHS LOOKED TOO COOL 
FOR MONDAY...AND I TRENDED CLOSER TO A BLEND WITH THE WARMER GFS 
MOS. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...LATER MODEL RUNS HAVE 
COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT ON SHIFTING MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES UPPER 
LOW JUST A BIT FARTHER EAST ALLOWING FOR A NICE DRY TUESDAY. DECIDED 
TO HANG ONTO THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR POSSIBLE CONVECTION WITH A 
FROPA ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...THIS EVENT STILL LOOKS VERY 
QUESTIONABLE IN TERMS OF HAVING SUFFICIENT MOISTURE FOR RAIN. WILL 
WAIT UNTIL THE NEXT COUPLE OF MODEL RUNS. A NORTHERLY FLOW AND 
HIGHER SURFACE PRESSURE LEADS TO DRY AND TEMPERATE WEATHER FOR MUCH 
OF THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST. ALTHOUGH I DID ADD A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER AND THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU FOR SATURDAY AS MODELS 
SHOW A MOISTENING SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
MIDDLE ALANTIC SURFACE RIDGE. ONCE AGAIN...UNDERCUT THE WARMER MEX 
MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS ACROSS THE BOARD AS MILDER AIR FILTERS INTO THE 
REGION.

EAST ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE IMPACTING TRI. TIMED THE CONVECTIVE
LINE INTO THE TAF SITES LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FROM
AROUND 22-01Z WITH POSSIBILITY OF SOME TRAILING THUNDER LATE INTO
THE NIGHT ESPECIALLY AT TRI AND TYS. BETTER WEATHER RETURNS ON
SUNDAY WITH SCT-BKN CU IN THE MORNING WITH CLEARING TOWARD MID DAY.

.DISCUSSION...QUITE AN AIRMASS CHANGE FROM YESTERDAY MORNING WITH A 
WARM FRONT MOST LIKELY LOCATED BETWEEN TYS (DEWPT 74) AND TRI (DEWPT 
65). THE WEAK CIRCULATION (TROPICAL) TO OUR SOUTH YESTERDAY SEEMS TO 
HAVE PUSHED THE WARM FRONT INTO OUR REGION...WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
(PW) BACK UP TO JUST OVER 2 INCHES AT OHX PER 12Z SOUNDING. 12Z RNK 
SOUNDING STILL QUITE DRY IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS AND PW NOT 
QUITE 1 INCH. MODIFIED 12Z OHX SOUNDING FOR HIGHS NEAR 90 WOULD 
YIELD INSTABILITY OF 1300 J/KG AND LIFTED INDEX OF -3 DEGS C.

RADARS ALREADY FAIRLY ACTIVE AS SCATTERED SHOWERS AND TSRA OVER NRN 
GA MOVE NORTH INTO SW NC...WITH WIDESPREAD CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE 
MS VALLEY COLD FRONT MOVING ESE INTO CENTRAL KY AND NW PARTS OF 
MIDDLE TN. THIS ACTIVITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT LOOKS TO WEAKEN...BUT 
COULD LEAVE AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY NEAR OUR NW AREAS TO POTENTIALLY 
HELP FOCUS CONVECTION LATER TODAY OR EARLY TONIGHT. 

PREDICTING CONVECTIVE COVERAGE IS CHALLENGING...SO PLAN TO LEAVE 
POPS AT HIGH CHANCE FOR SW TO LESSER CHANCE IN THE NE...WITH 
SCATTERED WORDING FOR COVERAGE. 

MOS MISSED MIN TEMPS THIS MORNING BY SEVERAL DEGREES (TOO COOL) AND 
THE TROPICAL LIKE MOISTURE DOES NOT FAVOR A LOT OF 90 DEGREE PLUS 
MAX TEMPS TODAY. UNDERCUTTING MAX TEMPS TODAY LOOKS GOOD.

WILL FRESHEN FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS BY AROUND 11 AM EDT.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S OVER SOUTHEAST TN. THIS WARM FRONT 
IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE SLOWLY MOVING NORTHEAST TODAY...WITH A VERY 
MOIST TROPICAL AIR MASS SPREADING ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. 
IN FACT...MODELS INDICATE THAT PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL RISE 
TO BETWEEN 2 AND 2.25 INCHES BY THIS EVENING...WHICH SHOULD RESULT 
IN SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WITH SOME OF THE SCATTERED CONVECTION 
EXPECTED TODAY AND TONIGHT. A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS BY THIS 
EVENING...WITH CONVECTION BECOMING LIKELY AROUND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU BY LATE TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS 
THE NAM GUIDANCE (WITH COOLER MAXES AND WARMER MINS)...SINCE IT HAS 
BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...FORECAST MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT IN PUSHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLOWLY SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY TSRA POPS AREA 
WIDE ON SUNDAY WITH BOUNDARY PUSHING THROUGH AND PWAT VALUES AT OR 
ABOVE TWO INCHES ON 12Z SUNDAY ALONG WITH SLIGHT TO MODERATE 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED ALONG BOUNDARY. FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
SOUTHEAST WITH TIME...WITH GFS/ECMWF/NAM MODELS PUSHING FRONT 
SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO GEORGIA/NORTH ALABAMA BY 06Z 
MONDAY. 

CURRENT TRENDING BY FORECAST MODELS ARE FOR LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO
PUSH SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z MONDAY...SO HAVE DROPPED
MENTION OF SHRA/TSRA SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY ACROSS THE AREA.
ECMWF MODEL IS STILL INDICATING THAT THERE SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE/LIFT/INSTABILITY ALONG NEXT COLD FRONT TO KEEP IN A
SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR WEDNESDAY...HOWEVER...INDICATIONS ARE THAT
THIS SHOULD BE A SMALL LINE OF SHRA/TSRA ALONG BOUNDARY AS IT MOVES
THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 

ECMWF/GFS MODELS DEVELOP A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ACROSS NORTH 
GEORGIA BY 12Z FRIDAY...WITH MODELS DEPICTING MEASURABLE PRECIP 
ACROSS MY SOUTHEAST COUNTIES AND FAR EASTERN COUNTIES AND INTO 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. HAVE ADDED IN A SLIGHT CHANCE POP TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS FEATURE. 

TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO ONE TO TWO CATEGORIES BELOW GFS GUIDANCE
AND WILL KEEP TEMP FORECAST GENERALLY ALONG SAME TRACK WITH THIS
THINKING IN MIND.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...EFFECTS OF DRIER AIR

ACROSS TN/NC MTNS AND ALSO TO OUR SOUTH ALONG THE WEAK FRONTAL

LIKELY AIDING WHAT CONVECTION IS ONGOING TO OUR SOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON. THESE TSRA APPEAR TO BE MOVING SLOWLY NORTH TOWARD SE TN
AND SW NC.

KEPT THE LOW POPS OVER SRN AND WRN AREAS OVERNIGHT...AND LOWERED
MIN TEMP FORECAST JUST A BIT FROM PREVIOUS GRID...ALTHOUGH 61
DEGREES LOOKED TOO LOW FOR TRI (MOS WAS 6 DEGREES TOO COOL THERE
LAST NIGHT). PATCHY AREAS OF FOG MAY DEVELOP AGAIN TONIGHT...BUT
MAINLY WHERE LEAST CLOUD COVER IS EXPECTED (SW VA AND NE TN).

OTHERWISE...SHORT RANGE MODELS SIMILAR AND THE TREND CLEARLY WAS TO
DECREASE RAIN CHANCES ON SATURDAY AND EVEN A SLOWER ONSET OF
PRECIPITATION WITH THE NEXT SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT. 
SLOWED DOWN THE LIKELY POPS UNTIL FAR W-NW AREAS LATE SATURDAY
NIGHT...THEN LOW END OF LIKELY POPS FOR SUNDAY.

TROF WILL CONTINUE TO AMPLIFY OVER THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY DRIVING COLD FRONT SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS. HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON MONDAY FOR 
PART OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH 
CAROLINA AS MODELS SLOW DOWN UPPER TROF SIGNIFICANTLY AND FORM A 
CLOSED LOW OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS EARLY IN THE PERIOD. WILL 
HAVE TO LOOK AT THIS CLOSER OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS TO SEE IF THIS 
SYSTEM MAY HAVE MORE OF AN IMPACT ON THE FORECAST AREA IN TERMS OF 
CONTINUED CHANCE FOR RAIN IN THIS AREA AS WEAK SHORT WAVE FEATURES 
ROTATE SOUTHEAST AROUND THE SYSTEM'S PRESSURE CENTER. FOR NOW KEPT 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT DRY BUT DID MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON WEDNESDAY AS A MOISTURE STARVED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. DRIER NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW BUILDS IN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK WITH SURFACE 
RIDGING SO KEPT PRECIP OUT OF THE FINAL TWO DAYS OF THE EXTENDED. 
CONCERNING TEMPS...MEX MOS LOOKED A BIT TOO WARM AND ADJUSTED THE 
NUMBERS DOWN A FEW DEGREES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

ADVISORY ISSUED EARLIER...BUT MAY BE ABLE TO CANCEL IT EARLY FOR 
SOUTHEAST TN AND CENTRAL EAST TN IF FOG DOES NOT DEVELOP IN THE NEXT

THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND CENTRAL EAST 
TN...WHERE A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS SHOULD DEVELOP CLOSE TO 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
THESE AREAS FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS INTO TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS 
GUIDANCE APPEARS TO BE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND LOOKS REASONABLE. HOWEVER...WILL TREND WARMER THAN GUIDANCE WITH 
MINS TONIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SINCE IT SEEMS 
UNLIKELY THAT DEWPOINTS WILL BE ABLE TO DROP INTO THE LOWER 60S.

PROGGED BY THE MODELS TO PUSH THROUGH THE REGION. LATEST GFS MODEL 
RUN TRIES TO HOLD BACK SHRA/TSRA WITH NEXT FRONTAL BOUNDARY AS IT IS 
SHOWN TO DEVELOP SHRA/TSRA INTO EAST TENNESSEE BY 12Z SUNDAY. 

HAVE INCREASED PRECIP CHANCES SLIGHTLY TO AROUND 50 PERCENT FOR A 
PORTION OF SUNDAY MORNING FOR THE AREA DUE TO A LITTLE BETTER MODEL 
CONSISTENCY. UPPER TROF IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS BY LATE SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY TIME FRAME. ECMWF MODEL IS 
A LITTLE SLOWER WITH RESPECTS TO FRONTAL MOVEMENT SOUTHEAST INTO THE 
AREA AND MODEL HOLDS ON TO PRECIP A LITTLE LONGER THAN GFS MODEL. 

WILL CONTINUE FOR NOW WITH GFS SOLUTION OF KEEPING MONDAY DRY FOR 
THE TIME BEING...AS FRONT IS PROGGED TO PUSH FARTHER SOUTH OF THE 
AREA DURING DAY...WITH DRIER CONDITIONS AS PER GFS EXPECTED. MODELS

SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY TOWARD THE

ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AROUND SATURDAY/SATURDAY NIGHT 
TIMEFRAME SO MAINTAINED A 50 PERCENT POP FOR THE FORECAST AREA AT 
THIS TIME. MAIN UPPER TROF WILL BE PROGRESSING EAST ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES AND MIDWEST SUNDAY INTO MONDAY DRIVING A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
THROUGH THE REGION. KEPT PROBABILITY AT 40 PERCENT ON SUNDAY FOR 
CONVECTIVE PRECIP WHILE DROPPING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE SUNDAY NIGHT 
AS BOUNDARY SLIPS FURTHER SOUTH AND EAST. BOUNDARY STARTS TO SLOW 
DOWN AND MAY BECOME STATIONARY OVER NORTHERN GEORGIA ON MONDAY SO 
STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA ON MONDAY WHILE 
OPTING FOR A NICE DRY FORECAST REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA. WAS 
ABLE TO KEEP TUESDAY DRY WITH HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDING IN BEHIND 
THIS EARLY WEEK SYSTEM. UNCERTAINTY INCREASES LATE IN THE LONG TERM 
FORECAST BUT MODELS WOULD LIKE TO BRING YET ANOTHER UPPER TROF 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT AT MID WEEK. 
USED THE SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION WITH THIS FRONT 
WHILE DRYING IT OUT AGAIN ON THURSDAY WITH EXPECTATION OF FRONTAL 
PASSAGE FOLLOWED BY LOWER DEWPOINT AND HIGHER PRESSURE.

TO OUR WEST IN FENTRESS AND PUTNAM COUNTIES FOR EXAMPLE...WHERE A 
COCORAHS COOKEVILLE SITE REPORTED 7.75 INCHES OF RAIN IN PAST 24 
HOURS. MORGAN COUNTY COCORAHS HAD 3.79 INCHES IN HARRIMAN AND 2.51 
INCHES AT PETROS...WITH DOPPLER RADAR ESTIMATES IN EXCESS OF 3 
INCHES NOTED FROM NORTHERN SCOTT CO. TN NORTH INTO SE KY.  

ELSEWHERE...AMOUNTS DROPPED BELOW 2 INCHES...ALTHO I DID MEASURE 
2.25 INCHES AT MY GAGE IN JEFFERSON COUNTY. MOST AREAS AROUND AN 
INCH OR LESS...WITH EXTREMELY LIGHT RAINS OVER SE TN AND SW NC 
GENERALLY BELOW 1/10 INCH. 

WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR REST OF TODAY...SINCE UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH AXIS IS TO OUR WEST...AND THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPEARS 
TO BE LOCATED ACROSS OUR SRN MOST AREAS THIS MORNING. MODIFIED 12Z 
OHX SOUNDING (WITH AN INCH LESS OF PRECIPITABLE WATER FROM 12Z WED)
SHOWS SLIGHT INSTABILITY (CAPE OF AROUND 800 J/KG AND LIFTED INDEX 
NEAR -2 DEGS C).

INCHES BETWEEN NOW AND AROUND NOON. NAM AND GFS MODELS BRING LARGE
QPF AMOUNTS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TODAY. RUC MODEL TAKES
VORTICITY MAX THAT IS PRODUCING THE HEAVY RAIN NE OF BNA SLOWLY
EAST BUT WEAKENS IT GRADUALLY THROUGH THE DAY TODAY. WITH WHAT IS
OCCURRING NOW FAVOR MORE THE RUC. AM TEMPTED TO DROP WATCH BUT AS
ACTIVITY IS INCREASING NOW WILL REISSUE WATCH WITH FORECAST UPDATE
TO EXPIRE AT 11 AM. THINK URBAN AND SMALL STREAM ADVISORIES
POSSIBLE AND ISOLATED FLOODING THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES ARE MILD
IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S WITH DEW POINTS UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.
HIGHS TODAY SHOULD STAY COOL WITH MOSTLY 80S...POSSIBLY 90 AT CHA.
TONIGHT FRONT SETTLES SOUTH WITH DRIER AIRMASS FROM OHIO VALLEY
FILTERING INTO THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN SECTIONS. LOWS NOTICEABLY

60S TO THE LOWER 70S SOUTH. LOWERING POPS FROM CATEGORICAL EARLY TO
CHANCE LATER TODAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE MAINLY SOUTHERN SECTIONS
TONIGHT.

FRIDAY. PRECIPITATION CHANCE ALONG S PART MRX NEAR DP BOUNDARY TO 
THE SOUTH. HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST SATURDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES IN

FAVORING SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS. UPPER TROF MOVES SE INTO THE 
APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. COLD FRONT MOVES SE INTO MRX CWA WITH 
ONGOING PCPN CHC. BEGIN TO FAVOR ECMWF WHICH PUSHES FRONT FARTHER

.DISCUSSION...
WHILE MUCH OF THE PRECIP HAS TAPERED OFF FOR THE MOMENT...EXPECT
THAT THE AREA OF RAIN OVER MIDDLE TN ASSOCIATED WITH THE 850 MB LOW
WILL TRACK ACROSS OUR AREA OVERNIGHT. THIS CIRCULATION IS EXPECTED
TO MOVE ACROSS OUR NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES AND NE TN/SW VA
BETWEEN MIDNIGHT AND NOON TOMORROW. ENHANCED LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE
ALONG THE TRACK OF THE LOW WILL RESULT IN HEAVY SHOWERS...AND WITH THE
HIGH AMOUNT OF RAIN ALREADY RECEIVED IN THIS AREA...THE FLOOD
THREAT WILL REMAIN HIGH.

WILL SEND AN EARLY UPDATE TO THE CURRENT FORECAST TO RAISE POPS TO
CATEGORICAL EVERYWHERE OVERNIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING.

&&

.AVIATION...
RAIN IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA LATER
TONIGHT...BRINGING PREDOMINANT MVFR CONDITIONS TO THE TERMINALS.
OCCASSIONAL HEAVIER SHOWERS WILL BRING IFR CONDITIONS OR
LOWER...WITH THE BEST CHANCES OF THIS AT TRI AS THE AXIS OF
HEAVIEST RAIN WILL LIKELY BE OVER NE TN/SW VA. RAIN SHOULD BE
DECREASING THROUGH THE MORNING...WITH VFR CONDITIONS RETURNING BY
TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

CONTINUE LIKELY POPS FOR SATURDAY. MOISTURE LINGERING INTO SUNDAY SO 
WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE FOLLOWS

AT LEAST 70 DEGREE DEWPOINTS.

NAM/GFS MODELS BOTH INDICATE REALLY HIGH PWAT VALUES FROM FORECAST
SOUNDINGS THROUGH TONIGHT...AS TROPICAL MOISTURE SPREADS NORTH AND
NORTHEAST INTO THE AREA. TRI CITIES AREA AND NORTHERN TENNESSEE
COUNTIES AND INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN RIGHT REAR EXIT REGION OF
DECENT MID LEVEL JET...COMBINED WITH SURFACE NEARLY STATIONARY
BOUNDARY ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF COUNTY WARNING AREA AS PER
LATEST 06Z SURFACE ANALYSIS. 

WILL BE GOING WITH FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR NORTHERN TENNESSEE BORDER
COUNTIES TO KENTUCKY AND VIRGINIA AND FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
COUNTIES IN ANTICIPATION OF HEAVY RAINFALL BY LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING
THAT COULD CAUSE FLASH FLOODING PROBLEMS IF CURRENT TRENDING OF
EXPECTED PRECIP FORMATION AND TRAINING OCCURS OVER TRI CITIES/SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AREAS. PWAT VALUES ARE PROGGED BY MODELS TO INCREASE TO
BETWEEN 2.3 TO 2.8 INCHES ACROSS THE CWA AND MAY NEED TO WATCH
SOUTHERN AND PLATEAU COUNTIES LATER TONIGHT FOR SAME FLASH FLOOD
POTENTIAL. WILL WAIT ANOTHER MODEL RUN BEFORE MAKING THAT DECISION
FOR REST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE BUMPED UP PRECIP FORECAST FOR
THIS AFTERNOON/TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR TIMING AND COVERAGE OF
PRECIP. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ONGOING PRECIPITATION
MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS THURSDAY MORNING. UPPER TROF CONTINUES 
TO DIG SE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUPPRESSING DEEP 
MOISTURE TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA BY THU EVENING. PCPN SHOULD HAVE 
ENDED ACROSS THE NORTH WITH LOW CHANCE CONTINUING THU NGT IN THE 
SOUTH. DRIER AIR FILTERS IN FROM THE NW ON FRI. PCPN TRENDING 
DOWNWARD AND FAVORING SOUTHERN LOCATIONS. A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES 
FROM THE W FRI NGT. DEEP MOISTURE RETURNS TO THE AREA. PCPN WILL 
LIKELY BECOME WIDESPREAD ACROSS THE AREA ON SAT. SHORTWAVE PROGGED 
TO MOVE EAST OF THE AREA SAT NGT WITH PCPN TAPERING OFF OR ENDING BY 
SUN AFTN. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES INTO THE AREA INTO NEXT WEEK 
BRINGING A COOLER AND DRIER AIRMASS. UNDERCUT GFS MAX TEMPS AND 
PREFERRED COOLER GFS MINS LATER IN THE PERIOD.

272 
FXUS64 KMRX 171840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT TUE AUG 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...DIFFUSE SURFACE BOUNDARY 
WHICH HAS PROVIDED A FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR ORGANIZED PRECIP MAINLY 
OVER SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE TODAY IS PROJECTED TO DRIFT SLOWLY 
NORTHWARD TAKING BULK OF PRECIP WITH IT. THUS ANTICIPATE BEST 
COVERAGE IN THE NORTHERN TIER OVERNIGHT AND HAVE KEPT LIKELY POPS 
GOING FOR THAT AREA. UPPER SHORT WAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY PROVIDING VERY MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALONG WITH 
MODERATE INSTABILITY. CONTINUED LIKELY POPS AREA-WIDE FOR TOMORROW. 
TEMPS WILL AGAIN BE DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP COVERAGE. 
UNDERCUT MAV GUIDANCE FOR TOMORROW SLIGHTLY IN ANTICIPATION OF 
RELATIVELY GOOD PRECIP COVERAGE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT ABOUT THE GENERAL PATTERN FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...HOWEVER THERE REMAINS A GREAT DEAL OF 
VARIANCE IN THE DETAILS. THE GENERAL TREND IS FOR THE TROPICAL GULF 
COAST LOW TO DRIFT TOWARD THE NORTH AND MERGE INTO A PASSING 
MID-LATITUDE SHORTWAVE TROUGH. THE SPEED AND INTENSITY OF THE 
TROPICAL LOW WILL BE THE KEY TO THE AMOUNT OF PRECIP ACROSS EAST TN. 
UNFORTUNATELY THE MODELS DIFFER WIDELY...WITH THE CANADIAN 
BEING FASTEST AND STRONGEST AND THE NAM BEING WEAKEST. THE GFS SEEMS 
TO BE A REASONABLE COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO AND WILL GENERALLY BE 
FOLLOWED...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW.

DEEP GULF MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO FEED INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AS THE TROPICAL LOW DRIFTS NORTH. UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE 
RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET WILL ENHANCE LIFT. THE GFS 
AND CANADIAN MODELS SHOW AN AREA OF STRONG 850 MB MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE AT THE NOSE OF A 20-25 KT LLJ OVER THE AREA LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. IF THIS FEATURE DOES 
DEVELOP...SOME SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL TOTALS WILL BE POSSIBLE. WILL 
HAVE LIKELY POPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING. THE UPPER 
TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON...SO 
POPS WILL DROP BACK TO A CHANCE. 

WHILE MODEL RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN POOR...THE TREND OF THE 
MORE RECENT RUNS HAS BEEN TOWARD A BUILDING RIDGE OVER THE AREA ON 
FRIDAY...WITH DEEP MOISTURE BEING SUPPRESSED TO OUR SOUTH. WILL 
LOWER POPS FRIDAY BUT WILL STILL KEEP A LOW CHANCE POP SOUTH/SLIGHT 
CHANCE NORTH DUE TO LOW CONFIDENCE. THE RIDGE GIVES WAY QUICKLY TO A 
TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE NORTHWEST...WHICH SHOULD BRING 
INCREASING CHANCES OF SHOWERS ON SATURDAY. THE GFS SHOWS A CLOSED 
LOW DROPPING SOUTH ALONG THE EAST COAST FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. 
CONFIDENCE IN THIS SOLUTION IS LOW...SO WILL NOT MAKE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANCES TO THE LAST THREE DAYS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             73  93  74  89  74 /  50  60  70  70  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  88  73  89  71 /  70  60  70  60  20

OF THE MOUNTAINS BUT GOOD COVERAGE EXPECTED ACROSS MRX CWA. CLOUD 
AND PCPN COVERAGE WILL HOLD TEMPS DOWN INTO THE 80S MOST AREAS. 
OVERNIGHT LOWS CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL.

LINGERING BOUNDARY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA COMBINED WITH GOOD FETCH 
OF GULF OF MEXICO AND TROPICAL TYPE OF MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
LEAD TO HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY SHRA/TSRA THROUGH THURSDAY.

EXTENDED PERIOD OF PRECIP AND THIS SCENARIO IS LOOKING GOOD AT THIS
TIME. MAY NEED TO RAISE POPS EVEN HIGHER THAN LIKELY CATEGORY AND
SLIGHTLY RAISED POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT DUE TO EXPECTED TIMING OF
MAIN AREA OF SHRA/TSRA INTO EAST TENNESSEE. 

MAY NEED TO MONITOR HEAVY RAINFALL POTENTIAL FOR WEDNESDAY AND
INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT DUE TO EXPECTED SLOW MOVEMENT OF FRONTAL
BOUNDARY AND TROPICAL LOW OVER THE GULF COAST AND UPPER TROUGH.
WILL KEEP DAYTIME TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY CLOSE TO NORMAL DUE TO CLOUD
COVER AND POTENTIAL FOR PRECIP. 

THE GFS/ECMWF MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY SIMILAR AGREEMENT IN KEEPING
TROPICAL LOW NEAR THE GULF COAST AND PUSHING MOISTURE UP INTO THE
REGION INTO THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED BY THE
MODELS TO MOVE THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BY
SUNDAY...AND IS EXPECTED TO NEARLY STALL OUT ACROSS THE AREA BY 00Z
MONDAY. 

HAVE INTRODUCED AT LEAST 30 PERCENT POPS AND MORE PESSIMISTIC CLOUD
COVER WITH SYSTEM SLOWLY MOVING THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY. THERE
WILL ALSO BE DECENT LEFT OVER GULF MOISTURE MOVING NORTHWARD TOWARD
THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE NOT IN AGREEMENT WITH
RECENT RUNS OF DEVELOPING SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
REGION UNTIL MONDAY. 

&&

489 
FXUS64 KMRX 161840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT MON AUG 16 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...DIFFUSE BOUNDARY CURRENTLY 
MOVING THROUGH THE EAST TENNESSEE AREA IS FOCUSING SCATTERED 
CONVECTION ALONG IT. MODELS/SREF IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
BOUNDARY WILL STALL OUT NEAR THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS 
BEFORE RETURNING NORTH BY LATE TOMORROW. THIS WILL AGAIN SERVE AS A 
FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR CONVECTION TOMORROW AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY IN 
OUR SOUTHEASTERN ZONES. PRECIPITATBLE WATER VALUES ACCOMPANYING THIS 
BOUNDARY APPROACH 2.5 INCHES PER NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS. HAVE BUMPED 
UP POPS TO LIKELY IN THE SOUTHEASTERN ZONES WHILE MAINTAINING CHANCE 
POPS ELSEWHERE. TEMPS HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER AND DEGREE OF 
PRECIP COVERAGE...BUT GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV 
GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A LINGERING BOUNDARY ALONG WITH A GOOD FLOW OF TROPICAL MOISTURE 
WILL MEAN A WET PERIOD TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. LIKELY POPS 
WILL BE FORECAST TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH THE SLOW NORTHWARD DRIFT OF THE TROPICAL LOW OVER 
THE GULF COAST AND THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF A MID-LATITUDE UPPER 
TROUGH. THERE WILL BE A POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAIN THESE PERIODS GIVEN 
THE DEEP FEED OF GULF MOISTURE AND THE PRESENCE OF A SURFACE 
BOUNDARY. DAYTIME TEMPS SHOULD ALSO BE CLOSER TO NORMAL WITH BROKEN 
TO OVERCAST CLOUD COVER.

THE MODELS HAVE HAD A DIFFICULT TIME GETTING A HANDLE ON THE 
MOVEMENT OF THE TROPICAL LOW NEAR THE GULF COAST. RUN-TO-RUN 
CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN POOR...AND THE ENSEMBLE SPREAD FOR THE WEEKEND 
IS QUITE LARGE. THUS CONFIDENCE IN THE WEEKEND FORECAST IS LOW. THE 
GFS AND THE CANADIAN DO HAVE SOME SIMILARITIES TO EACH 
OTHER...SHOWING THE NORTHWARD-DRIFTING TROPICAL LOW BEING PICKED UP 
BY THE MID-LATITUDE SHORTWAVE AND MOVING AWAY FROM THE AREA ON 
FRIDAY...BUT THE 12Z CANADIAN IS MUCH FASTER. THE ECMWF IS 
COMPLETELY DIFFERENT...SHOWING A WESTWARD DRIFT OF THE LOW AND A 
LARGE RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE SOUTHEAST. GIVEN THESE 
UNCERTAINTIES...WILL NOT MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...KEEPING POPS IN THE LOW CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE FOR 
NOW. SUNDAY AND MONDAY LOOK TO BE DRY WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST AND A RIDGE BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  92  73  87  72 /  30  50  60  70  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  92  72  87  72 /  30  50  60  70  60

GULF AND ITS POSSIBLE INTERACT WITH ANOTHER APPROACHING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY PUSHING IN FROM THE NORTHWEST.  WITH CONFIDENCE SO 
LOW...WILL JUST CONTINUE WITH CURRENT FORECAST OF ISOLATED TO

425 
FXUS64 KMRX 151853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT SUN AUG 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SLOW MOVING WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MAY MANAGE TO MAKE IT INTO OUR AREA MONDAY...BUT NO 
SIGNIFICANT COOLING OR DRYING ON TAP. FORCING FOR CONVECTION ALSO 
WEAK WITH THE FRONT. AIRMASS WILL REMAIN RATHER STAGNANT FOR THE 
SHORT TERM...AND WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS TONIGHT AND MONDAY ALL 
ZONES.  WILL GENERALLY KEEP NEAR MAV TEMPS...BUT WILL GENERALLY 
TWEAK MAV MIN TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY...AND SOME MAX TEMPS DOWN 
SLIGHTLY.   

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS DETERIORATE FROM 
DECENT AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE LONG TERM TO A CONTINUATION OF UTTER 
DISAGREEMENT BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM...ALONG WITH A CONTINUATION OF 
POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY. SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BECOMES 
SITUATED BETWEEN WESTERN PERIPHERY OF UPPER RIDGE OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COAST AND AN APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE IN RESULTING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. 
THUS HAVE CONTINUED WITH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. AFTER THIS...PROFOUND DIFFERENCES START TO APPEAR. THE 
BIGGEST SOURCE OF MODEL/ENSEMBLE UNCERTAINTY CONTINUES TO BE THE 
TRACK AND TIMING OF RESIDUAL MOISTURE FROM NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO 
TROPICAL FEATURE. THE GFS AND SEVERAL GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
EVENTUALLY BRING MOISTURE INTO THE AREA...BUT THE TIMING DIFFERS BY 
SEVERAL PERIODS. ECMWF MODEL SHOWS TROPICAL MOISTURE GETTING CAUGHT 
UP INTO ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE BOUNDARY THAT APPROACHES THE 
AREA. A SLIGHT MAJORITY OF MODELS/ENSEMBLE MEMBERS BRING BULK OF 
MOISTURE THROUGH ON SATURDAY. THUS HAVE BUMPED UP POPS SLIGHTLY FOR 
THAT TIME FRAME. OTHERWISE...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO 
PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST DUE TO HIGH DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD.  MODELS 
DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY DURING THE LATER HALF OF THE EXTENDED.  MAIN 
PROBLEM IS THE HANDLING OF THE REMNANTS OF A TROPICAL SYSTEM.  FOR 
NOW MADE FEW CHANGES...LEAVING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED POPS EACH DAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EDT SAT AUG 14 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM 
NEAR DETROIT SOUTHWEST TO NEAR ST LOUIS...WITH A WARM AND VERY MOIST 
AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEALED A LINE OF PRE- 
FRONTAL CONVECTION ALONG THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. THIS CONVECTIVE LINE 
SHOULD QUICKLY DISSIPATE WITH THE LOSS OF SOLAR HEATING AND THE 
WEAKENING OF THE UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. WITH A SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS LINGERING THROUGH THE NIGHTTIME HOURS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE 
THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION ISOLATED OVERNIGHT CONVECTION 
WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS ON THE PLATEAU. TEMPS AND WINDS APPEAR TO 
BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...RATHER STRIKING 
DIFFERENCES IN MODEL SOLUTIONS CONTINUE TO PLAGUE CONFIDENCE THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. EUROPEAN MODEL CONTINUES TO DEPICT SERIES OF 
SHORT WAVE TROUGHS PROGRESSING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION WITH SURFACE BOUNDARY LURKING IN THE GENERAL AREA WHILE THE 
GFS SHOWS UPPER RIDGE BUILDING BACK INTO THE REGION BY MID WEEK. 
MODELS ALSO SEEM TO BE HAVING DIFFICULTY HANDLING TROPICAL SYSTEM 
THAT MEANDERS ALONG THE GULF OF MEXICO COAST BY EARLY WORK WEEK. 
POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY ALSO DOES NOT HELP. AT ANY RATE...HAVE 
OPTED TO MAKE ONLY MINOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST UNTIL 
(HOPEFULLY) SOME SOLUTION AGREEMENT/CONSISTENCY APPEARS. DEGREE OF 
COOLING...IF ANY...WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON ULTIMATE UPPER FLOW 
CONFIGURATION.

PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE IS QUITE LOW ON DETAILS...ESPECIALLY WHERE 
BOUNDARY WILL STALL ACROSS THE REGION.  HOWEVER...THIS WILL KEEP THE 
MRX CWA IN AN UNSETTLED PATTERN THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

OF A NEARLY STATIONARY BOUNDARY IN OUR REGION...AND WHAT WILL
HAPPEN TO REMNANT MOISTURE FROM A GULF OF MEXICO TROPICAL FEATURE
THAT DEVELOPS PER MODEL CONSENSUS. THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR
CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT
DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE. TEMPS PROJECTED TO ACTUALLY
FALL TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM.

SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST THROUGH THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT THU AUG 12 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WITH THE CONVECTION ROLLING
THROUGH THE FEW COUNTIES IN THE CURRENT HEAT ADVISORY...LOOKS LIKE
CRITERIA WILL NOT BE MET THIS AFTERNOON...SO WILL CANCEL THE
ADVISORY EARLY.  NOT MUCH CHANGE TO THE PATTERN FOR THE SHORT
TERM...SO ONCE AGAIN WILL GO WITH A MAINLY PERSISTENCE FORECAST.
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS INTO TONIGHT...THEN SLIGHT
CHANCE TO CHANCE FOR FRIDAY. WE HAVE GENERALLY BEEN FALLING JUST
SHORT OF HEAT ADVISORY CONDITIONS EVEN IN THE SOUTH...AND LOOKS
LIKE WE MAY BE A LITTLE BELOW CRITERIA AGAIN TOMORROW. INSTEAD OF
EXTENDING ADVISORY...FOR NOW WILL ISSUE AN SPS FOR THE ENTIRE AREA
TALKING ABOUT THE HEAT. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK TOO LOW FOR MIN
TEMPS TONIGHT...AND A BIT HIGH FOR MAX TEMPS TOMORROW...SO WILL
MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED 
PATTERN IN THE OFFING THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD PER MODEL 
AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS AS PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGING OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS BECOMES LESS PROMINENT AND IS EVENTUALLY REPLACED 
BY A TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. ABUNDANT MOISTURE ALONG WITH A 
NEARLY STATIONARY BOUNDARY LURKING NEARBY ALSO EXPECTED TO KEEP 
THINGS UNSETTLED. THUS HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS THROUGH VIRTUALLY 
THE ENTIRE LONG TERM. DISAGREEMENT ON EXACT PLACEMENT OF BOUNDARY 
PRECLUDES HIGH CONFIDENCE HOWEVER. TEMPS ALSO EXPECTED TO COOL 
SLIGHTLY DURING THIS TRANSITION...ALBEIT STILL AT LEAST SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE CLIMO. GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS.
