FXUS64 KMRX 120703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EDT THU AUG 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
VERY LITTLE CHANGE IN THE OVERALL PATTERN SHOULD RESULT IN TODAY
BEING SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY. MODELS INDICATE A SHORTWAVE TROUGH
MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...WITH THE GREATEST
INSTABILITY AND WEAKEST CAPPING IN THAT AREA AS WELL. GREATER CIN
WILL HAVE TO BE OVERCOME IN THE SOUTHERN HALF. WILL HAVE HIGH
CHANCE POPS NORTH AND A SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTH...ABOVE MOS
GUIDANCE. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST FEW NIGHTS...CONVECTION
SHOULD PERSIST WELL PAST SUNSET DUE TO LINGERING OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES...AND WILL CARRY CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO
TONIGHT.

THE GFS MOS TEMPS HAVE BEEN RUNNING A BIT WARM THE PAST FEW
DAYS...AND WILL GO BELOW THEM BY A FEW DEGREES...BUT THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY SHOULD STILL REACH THE UPPER 90S. DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN
DROPPING WITH DAYTIME MIXING THE PAST FEW DAYS...BUT THIS MAY NOT
HAPPEN QUITE AS MUCH TODAY DUE TO THE NOCTURNAL PRECIP THAT HAS
PERSISTED. THE HEAT INDEX SHOULD EXCEED 105 FOR A FEW HOURS...AND
THE HEAT ADVISORY AREA WILL BE MAINTAINED. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
BOUNDARY LINGERING ACROSS THE AREA BRINGING SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE REGION ON FRIDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST
CHANCES FOR THE UPSLOPE AREAS. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA BY THE
WEEKEND AS A TROPICAL SYSTEM PROVIDES A INCREASE IN MOISTURE. WILL
KEEP HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. THE FRONT
LINGERS INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK...SO WILL CONTINUE CHANCE
POPS FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. UPPER NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR
TEMPERATURES.

AREA...BUT WILL KEEP HEAT ADVISORY GOING AS IS.  WILL GENERALLY GO 
CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...BUT WILL RAISE SOME MIN TEMPS TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE STILL 
PROMINENT IN THE FORECAST THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH ONLY SLIGHT 
RAIN CHANCES OVERALL WITH A LITTLE BETTER COVERAGE FRIDAY IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. CONTINUED HOT TREND WITH DAYTIME HIGHS AND OVERNIGHT LOWS 
SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. MOISTURE MOVING NORTH FROM THE GULF 
FROM TROPICAL SYSTEM WILL LIKELY NOT INCREASE SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM CHANCES UNTIL LATE FRIDAY AND MORE LIKELY OVER THE 
WEEKEND. HEAT INDEX VALUES LIKELY TO BE IN THE 100 TO 105 RANGE 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY SECTIONS. A 
COLD FRONT WILL DROP SE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY LATE IN THE WEEKEND 
AND THIS FEATURE WILL COMBINE WITH THE MOISTURE FROM THE TROPICAL 
SYSTEM OVER THE MS VALLEY AND SOUTHEAST FOR GREATER CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AT LEAST INTO TUESDAY AND POSSIBLY 
WEDNESDAY. HIGHS WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH HEAT INDEX VALUES 
TOPPING OUT NEAR 100.

163 
FXUS64 KMRX 110720
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT WED AUG 11 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE FORECAST TODAY SHOULD BE 
SIMILAR TO TUESDAY'S WEATHER WITH ANTICYCLONIC FLOW PERSISTING IN 
RELATIVELY MOIST AIRMASS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY AND OROGRAPHIC LIFTING TO ALLOW FOR SLIGHT 
AND LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION TODAY. A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
MAY ASSIST CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION SHOULD PERSIST INTO THE 
EVENING ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. NO RELIEF IN THE HEAT WAVE 
TODAY WITH MIDDLE AND UPPER 90 DEGREE TEMPERATURES FOR THE GREAT 
VALLEY. HIGH HUMIDITY CONTINUES WITH ANOTHER VERY WARM NIGHT TONIGHT 
ACROSS MUCH OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE SO THE HEAT ADVISORY WILL REMAIN 
IN EFFECT FOR THIS AREA.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE DOMINANT UPPER RIDGE 
BECOMES ELONGATED EAST TO WEST ACROSS MS/AL/GA ON 
THURSDAY...ALLOWING A WEAK TROUGH TO MOVE INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
NORTHWEST. THIS SHOULD BRING SLIGHTLY BETTER PRECIP CHANCES...MAINLY 
TO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST FEW 
NIGHTS...ISOLATED CONVECTION SHOULD PERSIST INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. 
ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP HIGH TEMPS BELOW THE TRIPLE 
DIGITS OF THE GFS MOS AT CHA...BUT UPPER 90S AND LITTLE DROP IN 
AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS WILL MEAN HEAT INDEX VALUES AROUND 105 ON 
THURSDAY. WILL KEEP THE HEAT ADVISORY IN PLACE. 

A SHORTWAVE RIDGE BUILDS BACK OVER THE AREA FOR FRIDAY...WHICH MAY 
CONFINE SHOWER ACTIVITY TO MAINLY THE HIGHER TERRAIN. HIGHS WILL 
ONCE AGAIN REACH THE UPPER 90S IN SOUTHERN LOCATIONS. GREATER 
MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF TD5 COMBINED WITH THE WEAKENING AND 
RETROGRADING OF THE RIDGE WILL MEAN GREATER PRECIP CHANCES AND 
SLIGHTLY LOWER TEMPS FOR THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. A MIDLEVEL 
DEFORMATION ZONE THAT SETS UP OVER THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
SHOULD PROVIDE A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BOTH DAYS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             98  76  98  76  97 /  20  20  30  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  96  74  96  74  95 /  20  20  30  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       96  74  96  74  95 /  20  20  30  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              95  71  94  68  94 /  20  20  40  30  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY FROM 2 PM EDT /1 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM 
     EDT /7 PM CDT/ THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BRADLEY...
     HAMILTON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE.

VA...NONE.

551 
FXUS64 KMRX 110115
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT TUE AUG 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO DROP POPS OVERNIGHT. ISOLATED 
CONVECTION SHOULD STAY BELOW 20%. WARM TEMPS CONTINUE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN 
TO MIGRATE SLIGHTLY WESTWARD DURING THE SHORT TERM.  HOWEVER ...IT 
WILL REMAIN THE MAIN INFLUENCE OVER AREA WEATHER.  EVENING 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ISOLATED AND SHOULD FAVOR HIGHER TERRAIN.  
CONVECTION SHOULD END AROUND SUNSET...THOUGH COULD SEE ISOLATED 
DEVELOPMENT TOWARDS MORNING AS A WEAK IMPULSE SLIDES THROUGH.  
CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP AGAIN OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  
COVERAGE SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY INCREASED AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE ENHANCES 
DEVELOPMENT.  WILL SEE TEMPERATURES ONCE AGAIN CLIMB INTO THE MID TO 
UPPER 90S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.  HEAT INDICES WILL BE AROUND 105 
DEGREES IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS AT OR ABOVE 75 
DEGREES.  THEREFORE...A HEAT ADVISORY WILL BE IN EFFECT BEGINNING 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE CONVERGING 
ON PUSHING UPPER RIDGE SOUTHWEST INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. THIS 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO SHIFT SOUTHEAST TOWARD 
AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z FRIDAY. UNTIL THE BOUNDARY MAKES 
IT INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY...EXPECT ANOTHER HOT DAY AND CONTINUING 
HEAT ADVISORY FOR THE SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE COUNTIES AROUND 
CHATTANOOGA FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL 00Z FRIDAY.  AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH AMPLIFIES BY THE END OF THE WORK WEEK...NORTHWEST FLOW WILL 
AGAIN SET UP ACROSS THE AREA...RESULTING IN SLIGHTLY INCREASED POPS 
FOR THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE UPPED POPS INTO THE 40 PERCENT RANGE FOR 
FRIDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND THE BOUNDARY 
INTERACTION.

THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE SLOWLY DROPPING SOUTH ACROSS THE
AREA AND FURTHER WEAKENING ON SATURDAY...AND WILL STILL CONTINUE
WITH CHANCE POPS FOR THE AREA. SECONDARY AND STRONGER FRONT WILL
SYNOPTICALLY PUSH SOUTHEAST WITH TIME BY SUNDAY INTO THE FORECAST
AREA AND HAVE UPPED POPS SLIGHTLY INTO THE 40 PERCENT CATEGORY AT
THIS TIME TO ACCOUNT ALSO FOR BUILDING OF LONG WAVE TROUGH BACK
INTO THE EAST-SOUTHEAST PART OF THE U.S. 

EXPECT UPPER TROUGH TO PUSH EASTWARD THROUGH THE AREA BY SUNDAY
AFTERNOON...AND THROUGH AREA BY MONDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH BASIC
FORECAST THINKING OF REDUCING POPS FOR MONDAY TO SLIGHT CATEGORY
IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR
TYS-SOUTHWARD TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPECTED SURFACE FRONTAL POSITION BY
AFTERNOON/EVENING ON MONDAY. 

WILL STAY A LITTLE COOLER THAN GFS GUIDANCE TOWARD LATER PERIODS 
WITH MORE EXPECTED CLOUDS/CHANCE POPS FOR SHRA/TSRA. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  75  98  76  97  75 /  10  20  20  30  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    73  95  74  95  73 /  10  20  20  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN            73  96  74  95  73 /  10  20  20  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   71  94  70  93  69 /  10  20  20  40  40

509 
FXUS64 KMRX 100718
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT TUE AUG 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE
LOWER OHIO VALLEY/MID MS VALLEY THROUGH MUCH OF THIS PERIOD. THUS
EXPECT THAT A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WILL BE THE WAY TO GO. EXPECT
ISOLATED AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TODAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH THE TERRAIN AREAS BEING FAVORED. THE
RIDGE DOES BREAK DOWN A LITTLE ON THURSDAY...ALLOWING A WEAK
SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO PASS BY ON THURSDAY. THIS SHOULD BRING SOME
BETTER PRECIP CHANCES...ESPECIALLY IN NORTHERN SECTIONS.

TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL REACH THE UPPER 90S ACROSS MUCH OF THE
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TODAY AND WEDNESDAY. WITH AFTERNOON
DEWPOINTS AROUND 70...HEAT INDEX VALUES IN THIS AREA WILL TOP OUT
BETWEEN 100 AND 105 TODAY...JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. MODELS
INDICATE SLIGHTLY HIGHER DEWPOINTS TOMORROW...WHICH MAY GIVE HEAT
INDICIES JUST ABOVE 105. GREATER CLOUD COVER ON THURSDAY SHOULD
HOLD TEMPS BACK A LITTLE ON THURSDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 90S.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGING CONTINUES TO
FADE INTO THE WEEKEND AS WESTERN ATLANTIC UPPER TROF AMPLIFIES.
RESULTING NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW WILL BRING A WEAK SHORT WAVE
FEATURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY
WILL BE SLOWLY DROPPING SOUTH ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIAN
MOUNTAINS AS THE UPPER TROF STRENGTHENS. THEREFORE APPLIED MEDIUM
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WITH PROTECTIVE RIDGE OUT OF
THE PICTURE AND GRADUAL APPROACH OF A LONG WAVE TROF BUILDING BACK
INTO THE EASTERN PART OF THE COUNTRY...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE
SUFFICIENTLY UNSTABLE FOR WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION SO USED 30
PERCENT POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. THE UPPER TROF CONTINUES EAST
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND MODELS LIKE THE IDEA OF ANOTHER COOL
FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACCOMPANYING THIS FEATURE INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY SO STAYED WITH 30 PERCENT POPS FOR THIS POSSIBILITY DROPPING
BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE DURING THE DAY MONDAY ACROSS THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS FRONT MAY BE ABLE TO MOVE THROUGH MUCH
OF THE REGION BY AFTERNOON OR EVENING. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT MON AUG 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL STAY 
IN CONTROL THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  WILL BE IN A NORMAL SUMMERTIME 
CONVECTIVE PATTERN WITH ISOLATED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE 
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN AND POSSIBLY OVER FAR SOUTHERN LOCATIONS.  IT 
WILL BE ANOTHER HOT AND HUMID DAY ON TUESDAY.  TUESDAY AFTERNOON 
HIGHS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 90S AND HEAT INDICES BETWEEN 100 AND 105 
DEGREES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...AND LOWS WILL STAY BELOW 75 
DEGREES.  THESE NUMBERS SHOULD KEEP US JUST BELOW HEAT ADVISORY 
CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...INITIAL PERSISTENT 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST CONTINUES TO SHOW SIGNS OF 
WEAKENING BY THURSDAY. WEAK INITIAL FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED BY 
GFS/ECMWF MODELS TO MAKE IT TO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY 00Z FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH AT LEAST 30 PERCENT POPS TO 
CONTEND WITH EXPECTED SCATTERED AFTERNON SHRA/TSRA DEVELOPMENT 
ESPECIALLY FROM TYS-NORTHWARD. 

MODELS ARE CONSISTENT IN DEPICTING THAT BOUNDARY SHOULD CONTINUE TO
WEAKEN/DISSIPATE ACROSS THE AREA BY SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH AT
LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THROUGH SUNDAY. NEXT FRONT IS DEPICTED BY
MODELS TO SLOWLY PUSH THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AND
TIMING OF THIS BOUNDARY MOVING THROUGH THE AREA WILL LIKELY DEPEND
UPON WHETHER WE WILL LATER BE INCREASING PRECIP CHANCES FOR MONDAY
AFTERNOON. AT THIS TIME...WILL CONTINUE WITH GOING PRECIP CHANCES...
DUE TO UNCERTAINTY OF TIMING. 

WILL CONTINUE WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH UPCOMING WEEKEND
AND WITH INCREASED CLOUDS/MOISTURE BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...TEMPS MAY 
SLOWLY WORK THEIR WAY BACK DOWN TOWARD CLIMO.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT MON AUG 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE VERTICALLY STACKED OVER THE TN VALLEY REGION 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. GREATER 1000-850 THICKNESS VALUES TODAY WILL 
LEAD TO HIGH TEMPS A COUPLE DEGREES HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY...HOWEVER 
SOME SCATTERED CLOUDS MAY PREVENT FULL SUN HIGHS FROM BEING REACHED. 
MODELS INDICATE SOME SHOWERS DEVELOPING IN SE NC AND ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY AND PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON...AND SOUNDINGS SHOW LESS 
CAPPING IN THAT AREA COMPARED TO NORTHERN SECTIONS. WILL INCLUDE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
COUNTIES FOR THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HEAT INDEX VALUES THIS 
AFTERNOON SHOULD STAY BELOW 105 DEGREES IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...AND 
OVERNIGHT LOWS SHOULD DROP BELOW 75 DEGREES TONIGHT...SO HEAT 
ADVISORY CRITERIA WILL NOT LIKELY BE MET.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS REGION 
PROVING A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. MAY SEE A 
FEW THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. 
MOISTURE ON THE INCREASE ON THURSDAY AS A WEAK BOUNDARY TRACKS INTO 
THE AREA AND LINGERS INTO THE WEEKEND. WILL KEEP 20-30 POPS GOING 
FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS WELL 
AS AN INCREASE IN HEAT INDEX VALUES. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

FRIDAY. EXPECT A RETURN TO A NORMAL SUMMERTIME CONVECTIVE PATTERN

AND COOLER AIR OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS AGREE THAT THIS FRONT 
WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHWARD TONIGHT INTO THE DEEP 
SOUTH...WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE APPALACHIANS. WITH A 
FAIRLY STABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO BE OVER THE REGION THIS WEEKEND... 
EXPECT ANY CONVECTION TO BE ISOLATED AND CONFINED TO THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. OTHERWISE...AN 
UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL BEGIN TO BUILD BACK OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF 
THE NATION BY SUNDAY..WITH TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS GRADUALLY RISING 
AGAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MAXES THROUGH THE PERIOD...AND WILL 
PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM MINS SINCE DEWPOINTS ARE NOT 
EXPECTED TO DROP MUCH (ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA).

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...WILL SEE NORMAL SUMMERTIME HIGH ELEVATION CONVECTION 
POTENTIAL.  WILL MOVE INTO A SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR 
THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED AS A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES TRACK 
THROUGH...PROVIDING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY.  TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL FOR HOT AND HUMID 
CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.
&&

FRONT WILL HAVE WORKED ITS WAY TO THE GA/AL BORDER...BRINGING THE 
DRIER AIR MASS INTO THE ENTIRE AREA. LOW TEMPS IN THE LOWER TO MID 
60S ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF WILL BE A REFRESHING CHANGE.

ON SATURDAY AND LINGERS INTO TUESDAY. WITH DIURNAL INSTABILITY 
EXPECTED...MAY SEE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ACROSS MAINLY THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.  A 
DISTURBANCE PUSHES INTO REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...SO WILL 
CONTINUE THE LOWS POPS FOR THE ENTIRE AREA. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT THU AUG 5 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS KENTUCKY...WITH A VERY MOIST 
AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SHORT-RANGE MODELS AGREE 
THAT A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF 
OF THE NATION TONIGHT...PUSHING THIS WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL INCREASING MID 
LEVEL WINDS AND COOLING MID LEVEL TEMPS...WITH MSAS ANALYSIS 
REVEALING A STRONGLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. IN 
ADDITION...AN INVERTED-V PROFILE IN THE LOWER LEVELS WILL LIKELY 
ENCOURAGE DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS WITH SOME STORMS...WITH HIGH 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES (AROUND 2 INCHES) RESULTING IN LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY STALL OUT AROUND 
THE MOUNTAINS BY LATE TONIGHT...AND SHOULD HELP TO TRIGGER 
ADDITIONAL SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY. 
ANOTHER SECONDARY COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH SHOULD BRING SLIGHTLY DRIER 
AND COOLER AIR FOR THE WEEKEND. IT APPEARS THAT ANY CONVECTION ON 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOULD BE CONFINED MOSTLY TO THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES THROUGH THE PERIOD...AND WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS A 
COMPROMISE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE ONCE 
AGAIN BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL ALLOW 
CONTINUED NORMAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN OF ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.  BEST CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION REMAINS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  ALSO...CONTINUED HOT AND 
HUMID CONDITIONS THROUGH THE PERIOD...STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE.

PUSHING THIS WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL INCREASING MID LEVEL WINDS AND COOLING MID 
LEVEL TEMPS BY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY 
STRONGLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. IN

HEAVY RAINFALL. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT ORGANIZED CONVECTION WILL 
LIKELY INTENSIFY AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
BY THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WITH THIS IN MIND...WITH MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE ZONE 
FORECASTS.

UPDATE THIS MORNING TO MAKE A FEW TWEAKS TO TEMPS AND PRECIP 
WORDING. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE HEAT ADVISORY FOR THE KNOXVILLE 
AND CHATTANOOGA AREAS FOR TODAY...ALTHOUGH AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND 
CONVECTIVE COVERAGE MAY KEEP HEAT INDICES A LITTLE LOWER THAN

FXUS64 KMRX 050645

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT THU AUG 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(T0DAY AND TONIGHT)...A CLUSTER OF STORMS WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU INTO SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THIS MORNING. SPC SHOWS CAPES UP
TO 2500 J/KG. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS AND
TORRENTIAL RAINS.

UPPER RIDGE THAT HAS BEEN PRODUCING EXCESSIVE HEAT OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL WEAKEN SOME TODAY. EVEN SO...TEMPERATURES IN
THE MID AND UPPER 90S AND VERY HIGH DEWPOINTS (MID-UPPER 70S) WILL
PRODUCE HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA AGAIN FOR CHA AND TYS AREAS.

A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND
ENTER INTO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS TONIGHT. VERY UNSTABLE AIRMASS
ANTICIPATED WITH CAPES BETWEEN 2500-3500 J/KG. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE
THERMODYNAMIC DRIVEN DOWNBURSTS AND TORRENTIAL RAINS. WILL INCLUDE
WITHIN THE HWO.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS (NAM/GFS/ECMWF) STILL 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON MAIN FEATURES/PATTERN FOR THESE PERIODS. THE 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOOKS TO PICK UP ENOUGH SOUTHWARD PUSH TO MAKE 
IT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT. THUS...MINOR TWEAK WAS 
TO REMOVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS A BIT EARLIER IN THE GRIDS ACROSS NRN 
MOST AREAS ON FRIDAY NIGHT AS DRIER AIR ADVECTS IN BEHIND FROPA.

KEPT LOW POPS OVER SRN AREAS ON SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...THEN UPPER 
RIDGE BUILDS EAST AND LOOKS TO KEEP ANY RAIN CHANCES TO A MINIMUM 
FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 05/00Z GFSX MOS HIGHS CAME IN HOTTER 
THAN PREVIOUS MAX TEMPS GENERALLY FOR THESE LATER DAYS...SO I NUDGED 
HIGHS UP BY A FEW DEGREES.  DURING THE ONGOING HEAT WAVE...I HAVE 
NOTICED THAT MOS HAS BEEN A FEW DEGREES TOO COOL ON MINS...SO I 
RAISED THE MIN TEMP GRIDS UP A COUPLE OF DEGREES EACH NIGHT...ONCE 
THE UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS ITS GRIP AGAIN.

SCATTERED TO BROKEN STORMS. WILL INCLUDE VCTS FOR THIS AFTERNOON FOR 
ALL SITES BY 18Z. 

BESIDES THE CONVECTION...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE 
MVFR FOG AT TRI AND POSSIBLY TYS EARLY THIS MORNING...OTHERWISE VFR 
CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL OUTSIDE OF THUNDERSTORMS. THE STORMS WILL 
HAVE THE CAPABILITY OF PRODUCING STRONG DOWNBURSTS WINDS UP TO 
50KTS.

AWAYS FROM STORMS...WINDS WILL REMAIN LIGHT GIVE SURFACE RIDGING 
OVER THE AREA.

&&

009 
FXUS64 KMRX 041929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT WED AUG 4 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND 
MID WEST...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE PIEDMONT AREA OF 
THE CAROLINAS. CURRENT AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT SCATTERED CONVECTION 
WAS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WITH ADDITIONAL 
ACTIVITY FURTHER UPSTREAM OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THE 
COLD FRONT. WILL PLAN TO KEEP CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF...TO ACCOUNT FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF THIS OHIO RIVER VALLEY CONVECTION AFFECTING THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER THIS EVENING. THIS WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY APPROACH THE REGION ON THURSDAY...WITH VERY HOT TEMPS AND 
HIGH DEWPOINTS COMBINING AGAIN TO PRODUCE DANGEROUS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HEAT INDICES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL GREAT TN VALLEY 
AREAS. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL INCREASING MID LEVEL WINDS AND COOLING 
MID LEVEL TEMPS ON THURSDAY...AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION AND PUSHES THE COLD 
FRONT INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT...THINK 
THAT ORGANIZED CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON 
THURSDAY ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS CAUSING SOME STORMS TO BECOME SEVERE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS. ANOTHER SECONDARY COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...TRIGGERING ADDITIONAL SCATTERED 
CONVECTION. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS NOT TOO DISSIMILAR 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH DEPICTION OF GRADUAL 
DEPARTURE OF EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF. FRONTAL ZONE STILL NEARBY 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY SO KEPT THE LOW AND SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION IN THIS 
AREA. UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD IN BEHIND THIS FEATURE BRINGING THE HEAT 
WAVE BACK WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A COOLING SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. ENSEMBLE 
MEANS SHOW THE RIDGE RETROGRADING BACK INTO THE PLAINS STATES BY 
WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER LEVEL WINDS BECOMING MORE NORTHWESTERLY ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WITH THIS TYPE OF FLOW 
CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS WITH ASSOCIATED OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES MAY BE ABLE TO 
BRING A POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA SO 
INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP ON WEDNESDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO IF NOT A 
DEGREE OR TWO BELOW MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

UPDATE THIS MORNING TO MAKE A FEW MINOR WORDING TWEAKS.

FXUS64 KMRX 040703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EDT WED AUG 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG UPPER RIDGE REMAINS
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUPPRESSING
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED STORMS
POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT OVERALL DRY. STAGNANT
UPPER RIDGE WILL PRODUCE HAZY CONDITIONS AGAIN TODAY...BUT OVERALL
PLENTY OF SUNSHINE. TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB INTO THE MID 90S TO
NEAR 100 DEGREES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA
THIS AFTERNOON. HOT TEMPERATURES COMBINED WITH DEWPOINTS REMAINING
IN THE LOWER AND MID 70S WILL PRODUCE HIGH HEAT INDICES. WILL
CONTINUE WITH A HEAT ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY
AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN QUESTION IS WHAT PERIOD 
THE BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL OCCUR ON EARLY IN THE EXTENDED. MODELS 
SHOW SOME DECENT MOISTURE INCREASE ON THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
NRN PLATEAU AND SWRN VA...WHERE MOISTURE POOLS AHEAD OF THE WEAK 
COLD FRONT. SUMMERTIME FRONTS NEVER SEEM TO CLEARLY PUSH THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA...SO PREFER TO TAKE A WAIT AND SEE APPROACH FOR WHERE 
FRONT WILL BE LOCATED ON FRIDAY. NEIGHBORS TO THE NORTH AND EAST 
HAVE INCREASED THEIR POPS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH 
SEEMS MOST REASONABLE TO ME FOR MY NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.
THUS...RAISED POPS FOR NRN PLATEAU AND SWRN VA TO LOWER END OF 
LIKELY BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON...AND A LESSER INCREASE IN POPS OVER 
REST OF THE AREA INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. 

BACKED OFF A DEGREE OR TWO FOR MAX TEMPS THURSDAY...GIVEN NEW MOS 
HIGHS AND THE INCREASE IN MOISTURE. HOWEVER...HEAT INDICES STILL 
LOOK HIGH ENOUGH TO WARRANT AN EXTENSION OF THE HEAT ADVISORY FOR 
THE SRN AND CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES ON THURSDAY.

OTHERWISE...ECMWF AND GFS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON UPPER RIDGE BUILDING 
FOR LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL BRING BACK THE HEAT 
AND KEEP RAIN CHANCES TO A MINIMUM. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED 
ON TRACK WITH VERY LITTLE CHANGES.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RADAR INDICATING ISOLATED

FOR WEDNESDAY AS IS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...IT'S THE DOG DAYS. 
BIG RIDGE KEEPING THE COLUMN CAPPED, ALLOWING ONLY VERY SLIGHT 
CHANCES FOR LOCALIZED CONVECTIVE SHOWERS, AND THOSE ARE LIGHT AND 
SHORT LIVED. NEAR RECORD TEMPS AND VERY HIGH RH CREATING DANGEROUS 
APPARENT TEMPS OVER THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES AND CENTRAL VALLEY. UPPER 
TROF WILL MOVE ACROSS NORTHEAST NOAM FRIDAY AND INTO THE WEEKEND, 
AND WITH ASSOCIATED "COLD" FRONT WILL DROP TEMPS BACK TO MERELY HOT 
SEASONAL NORMS, INSTEAD OF BLISTERING. WILL ALSO RAISE POPS TO HIGH 
CHANCE LATE THU AND FRI. THE UPPER RIDGE RE-ASSERTS ITSELF EARLY 
NEXT WEEK AND HOT TEMPS WILL BE BACK, BUT ATMS STILL PRETTY 
SUPPRESSED WITH TERRAIN ENHANCED CONVECTION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

954 AM EDT TUE AUG 3 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. RADAR INDICATING 
ISOLATED SHOWERS TRACKING THROUGH THE CWA...SO WILL THE FORECASTED 
POPS AS IS FOR TODAY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LIGHT WINDS AND SOME AREAS OF
LOW CLOUDINESS (DUE TO WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW) ARE CREATING
SOME VERY MILD/MUGGY TEMPS THIS MORNING...MOSTLY 70 TO 80 DEGREES!

NO SHRA OR TSRA ON RADAR THIS MORNING...AND I THINK THAT ANY
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE VERY ISOLATED...AS UPPER RIDGE
DOMINATES. PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

MAX TEMPS MONDAY WERE NOT AS HOT AS I HAD ANTICIPATED...DUE TO
LINGERING CLOUDINESS. HOWEVER...SUBSIDENCE ALOFT AND BETTER MIXING
TODAY SHOULD LEAD TO PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TO REACH 80S TO MID 90S BY
THIS AFTERNOON. RECORD HIGHS ARE NOT IN JEOPARDY AT CHA - 100...
AND TYS - 98...BUT MAY COME CLOSE AT TRI - 95. 

THE HEAT IS DEFINITELY ON AGAIN...AND THE HEAT ADVISORY LOOKS ON
TRACK FOR SRN VALLEY TODAY. WE EVEN CONSIDERED EXPANDING IT NORTH
TO THE CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES...BUT CRITERIA LOOKS TO BE MET THERE
ON WEDNESDAY...AFTER FALLING JUST SHORT FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

OTHERWISE...KEPT THE LOW EVENING POPS FOR TSRA WITH ANOTHER MILD TO
MUGGY NIGHT AHEAD. WENT WITH OR A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE A MOS BLEND
FOR MINS TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...STRONG UPPER RIDGE WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. NEAR RECORD TO RECORD HIGHS ARE EXPECTED WEDNESDAY...EXCEPT
FOR CHA.  THE CURRENT RECORD HIGHS ARE THE FOLLOWING FOR 
WEDNESDAY:

CHA 105 (1947)     TYS 99 (1930)    TRI 94 (2002)

MAY NEED TO EXTEND HEAT ADVISORY INTO THE TYS AREA FOR WEDNESDAY.
AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST 
UNITED STATES THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY. WILL CALL FOR HIGH CHANCE POPS 
FOR LATE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THE LATTER 
HALF OF THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH ANOTHER ROUND OF HOT 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WITH MAINLY DIURNAL TERRAIN INDUCED 
CONVECTION AT BEST.

CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY...AND WILL
CONTINUE HEAT ADVISORY INTO WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR SAME AREA IN
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...NO REAL REASON TO CHANGE 
THE PREVIOUS FORECAST OR THINKING MUCH. ADJUSTED A FEW POPS UP  TO 
ACCOUNT FOR TERRAIN ON WEDNESDAY. RIDGE WILL DOMINATE UNTIL THE 
NORTHEASTERN NOAM TROF FLATTENS IT LATER IN THE PERIOD, WITH THE 
OPPORTUNITY FOR A WEAK COLD FRONT TO SLIDE THROUGH. THIS COLD FRONT 
WILL DROP TEMPS BACK TO SEASONAL (READ: "MERELY HOT" RATHER THAN 
"BLISTERING") NORMALS. THIS ALSO LESSEN THE CHANCE FOR HEAT 
ADVISORIES LATER IN THE WEEK. KEPT TEMPS CLOSE TO MOS, AGAIN.

319 
FXUS64 KMRX 020745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT MON AUG 2 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW THE
UPPER RIDGE ALREADY BUILDING EASTWARD...WITH FORECAST SOUNDINGS
SHOWING A STRONGER CAPPING INVERSION FOR TODAY. SINCE SO LITTLE
CONVECTION POPPED ON SUNDAY...IT WOULD APPEAR THAT VERY LITTLE WILL
DEVELOP LATER TODAY. HOWEVER...I DID KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
FAR ERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...NEAR RNK/GSP/FFC GRIDS. 

THE HOTTER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED HARD TO DISAGREE WITH...AND
THE MILDER MINS BEST FOR TONIGHT.

DID A LITTLE RESEARCH ON THE NUMBER OF 90 DEGREE OR HIGHER MAX
TEMPS SO FAR THIS YEAR FOR OUR 4 MAIN VERIFICATION POINTS AND 
FOUND THE FOLLOWING NUMBERS FOR MAY 1ST THROUGH AUG 1ST THIS YEAR:

CHA - 47 DAYS (30 YEAR AVERAGE = 42.3)
TYS - 47 DAYS (30 YEAR AVERAGE = 31.2)
TRI - 34 DAYS (30 YEAR AVERAGE = 13.3)
OQT - 36 DAYS (30 TEAR AVERAGE = 27.7)

THE 30 YEAR AVERAGES ARE FOR THE ENTIRE YEAR...SO DEFINITELY
RUNNING WELL ABOVE THE AVERAGE NUMBERS THUS FAR...WITH A HOT WEEK
AHEAD!


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...BASICALLY KEPT WITH THE 
DIURNALLY OROGRAPHIC POP SCHEME FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS THE 
FORECAST AREA AWAITS THE ARRIVAL OF YET ANOTHER LONGWAVE WHICH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY. FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY MAINTAINED THE 30 PERCENT POPS FOR 
SCATTERED CONVECTION AS A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDS SOUTH THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE GFS AMPLIFIES THE 
UPPER TROF SUFFICIENTLY TO PUSH THE BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA LATER SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY SO KEPT POPS LOWER SATURDAY AND 
MAINTAINED LESS THAN 15 PERCENT POP FOR SUNDAY WITH THE POSSIBILITY 
OF LESS HUMID/MORE STABLE AIRMASS IN PLACE BY THIS TIME. STAYED 
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SPOTTY TO SCATTERED CONVECTION 
CONTINUES TO DEVELOP EARLY THIS MORNING...WITH REMNANTS OF THE WEAK 
FRONT AND AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH IN OUR VICINITY. THE NW FLOW 
ALOFT IS MOVING THIS CONVECTION SE AT AROUND 20 MPH...WITH SOME 
BRIEF HEAVY RAINS...WHILE LITTLE LIGHTNING HAS BEEN INDICATED.

SHORT RANGE MODELS MOVE THE INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AXIS SLIGHTLY
EAST THIS AFTERNOON...TO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NORTH INTO ERN KY.
MODELS ALSO SUGGEST WEAK MOISTURE CONVERGENCE IN OUR HIGHER TERRAIN
AREAS (MTNS) IN THE EAST. OPTED TO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY FOR TODAY
IN THESE AREAS...PLUS EARLY TODAY WHERE ONGOING CONVECTION WAS
NOTED. ADDED SOME LOW POPS FOR THIS EVENING IN ERN MOST AREAS TO
BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS TO OUR EAST AND SE. AREAS OF FOG
LATE TONIGHT AFTER CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDINESS DISSIPATES. 

MAX TEMPS TRICKY AGAIN FOR TODAY...WITH A MOS BLEND A GOOD CHOICE. 
FOR MINS TONIGHT...WENT CLOSER TO THE MUGGIER NAM-WRF MOS.


LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
LESSEN AS THE RIDGE OVER CENTRAL NOAM BUILDS BACK EASTWARD. SERIES 
OF SMALL SHORT WAVES WILL CROSS THE AREA AND WITH VERY HIGH RH (PW'S 
AROUND 2.1)...THERE IS A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS EACH DAY. HEAT STAYS 
AROUND...SORRY FOLKS. IT'S THE DOG DAYS. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT SAT JUL 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EARLY MORNING CONVECTION
STARTING TO DEVELOP UPSTREAM IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...
WHICH SHORT RANGE MODELS WERE ALL SUGGESTING FOR TODAY. DEW POINT
TEMPS ON THE RISE...ESPECIALLY OVER CENTRAL AND SRN AREAS...SO
SLIGHTLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE TODAY WITH TEMPS REACHING 80S TO
LOWER 90S. MID TO HIGH CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE ALREADY...SO TEMPS
WILL BE OFF TO A MILD START THIS MORNING...BUT THE EARLY START TO
CONVECTION FAVORS MORE OF A BLEND OF MOS WHERE MAXES DIFFER. 

MAIN CHANGES TO GRIDS WERE TO INCREASE POPS FOR EARLY TODAY...
AND THEN TO BUMP POPS UP BY 15 TO 25 PERCENT FOR THE AFTERNOON
ACROSS THE BOARD. THIS MESHES BETTER WITH NEIGHBORS AND ALSO MORE
IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS POPS. 

EXPECT CONVECTION TO BE DIMINISHING FROM THE NW AFTER THIS EVENING
...WITH JUST A FEW MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO GRIDS FOR TONIGHT. MOS MINS
AND POPS WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. MAY SEE SOME AREAS OF FOG LATE
TONIGHT...DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS DECREASE. 
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAK SURFACE LOW MOVES TOWARD 
AREA SUNDAY, AND HAVE ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO WHOLE AREA. HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY...EXCEPT FOR 
MOUNTAINS WITH NORTHWEST FLOW INFLUENCE, BUT STILL ONLY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY...BUT BEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS SO WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRYISH FOR 
NOW WITH BARELY A SLIGHT CHANCE EVERYWHERE.  A BOUNDARY PUSHES INTO 
THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY. WITH STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND STRENGTH...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
EXPECTED FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR

RECENT TIME IN STORE WITH ALL AREAS BELOW 70 AND SPOTS IN THE N AND 
MNTS BELOW 60. MINS WILL COOL TO NEAR NORMAL. BROAD UPPER TROF 
CONTINUES OVER NE U.S. WITH PERIODIC JET SEGMENTS RIDING THROUGH.
GENERAL WNW FLOW ALOFT. MCS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP TONIGHT AND 
MOVE SE INTO TN VALLEY SAT. EASTERN PROGRESSION OF COMPLEX REMAINS 
IN QUESTION AND SYSTEM WILL LIKELY BE IN DECAY MODE BY SAT AFTN AS 
IT MOVES INTO MRX CWA. MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN AND PERSIST 
MUCH OF THE DAY. KEPT FCST MAX TEMPS RELATIVELY HIGH BUT COULD BE 
OVERDONE DEPENDING ON CLOUDS AND PCPN. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS 
NORTHWARD WEST OF AREA AND BUILDS EAST SOME ON SUNDAY. LAYER REMAINS 
FAIRLY DRY WILL ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPS RISE A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES SAT NGT AND SUNDAY.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA 
ON TUESDAY...BUT BEST MOISTURE REMAINS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS SO WILL 
KEEP TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW  A BOUNDARY PUSHES INTO THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON 
TIMING AND STRENGTH...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  95  71  96  74 /  10  40  30  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  91  70  94  71 /  10  30  40  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  92  69  95  70 /  10  30  30  20  10

961 
FXUS64 KMRX 301501
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT FRI JUL 30 2010

.DISCUSSION...MORNING FOG BURNING OFF. CAP AROUND 5000FT HOLDING 
ONTO LOW CLOUDS. MID LEVEL VERY DRY. CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT NOT 
EXPECTED. TEMP ON TRACK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LAST BIT OF CONVECTION PASSING SE 
INTO SWRN NC EARLY THIS MORNING...WITH 06Z SURFACE PLOTS SHOWING 
COLD FRONT LIKELY FROM NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES EASTWARD TO NEAR TRI. 
DEW POINT TEMPS IN THE MUGGY 70S AT MOST LOCATIONS...WITH MOIST 
BOUNDARY LAYER AND SOME LATE NIGHT PCPN...WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO AREAS 
OF FOG FOR ALL BUT SE TN EARLY THIS MORNING.

THE COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO BE DROPPING INTO EXTREME NRN GA THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH IS POSSIBLE...BUT I KEPT SOME LOW POPS IN FOR THE 
AFTN HOURS NEAR GSP (MY SMOKIES AND SRN MTNS). MOS MAXES SIMILAR AND 
I TRENDED CLOSER TO THE WARMER HIGHS WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE 
NOTED.

KEPT FORECAST DRY FOR TONIGHT...BUT EXPECT SOME CLOUDS TO RETURN AT 
VARYING HEIGHTS. WEAK NORTHERLY FLOW AND THESE CLOUDS SHOULD INHIBIT
FOG FROM DEVELOPING. GFS MINS QUITE LOWER THAN NAM...WITH A BLEND 
CHOSEN FOR NOW ON MINS TONIGHT.


LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
INDICATE THAT SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL PUSH ACROSS ON 
SATURDAY...WITH POSSIBLY OF AN MCS TRAVERSING THE AREA.  WILL BEEF 
POPS UP INTO THE CHANCE RANGE.  SUNDAY WE REMAIN IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...AND WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP WE HAVE GOING FOR 
NOW...THEN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA MONDAY AND CONTINUES 
TUESDAY.  WILL GO DRY BOTH DAYS...DESPITE SOME UNCERTAINTY AS TO 
WHETHER THERE MAY BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION.  RIDGE FORECAST TO BREAK DOWN A BIT TOWARD THE END OF 
THE PERIOD...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BOTH WED AND THU.  WE 
SHOULD STAY ON THE HOT SIDE...AND GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

OF HEATING AND MID LEVEL DRYING OVERNIGHT. CONVECTIVE TRIGGERS LACKING
AND WITH DECREASE IN PW'S HAVE UNDERCUT MOS POP GUIDANCE. SHORT WAVE 
BRINGS IN MID CLOUDS ON SATURDAY BUT MAIN FOCUS FOR CONVECTION 
SHOULD BE EAST AND WSW OF AREA. MIN TEMPS SHOULD BE A COUPLE DEGREES 
COOLER BY FRI NGT. MAX TEMPS WILL BE A BIT WARMER WITH EXTENDED 
MINUTES OF SUNSHINE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS FOR NOW. HIGH 
PRESSURE FOLLOWS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE 
TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR TUESDAY 
AS WELL. A BOUNDARY PUSHES INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS 
INTO THURSDAY. WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR BOTH PERIOD. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX

497 
FXUS64 KMRX 291458
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT THU JUL 29 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATE PLANNED. MODELS IN AGREEMENT ON LOW END 
PRECIPITATION CHANCE TODAY. AIRMASS HAS NOT CHANGED AND UPPER FLOW A 
BIT STRONGER TODAY FALLING MORE UNDER INFLUENCE OF TROF. CLOUD COVER 
HOLDING OFF DESTABILIZATION. PATTERN LENDS ITSELF TO FAIRLY GOOD 
COVERAGE THIS AFTERNOON BUT MODELS NOT AS ENTHUSIASTIC AS MYSELF SO 
WILL REIGN IN GUT FEELING AND LET CHANCE POPS STAND. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER RIDGE HAS SHIFTED WEST 
OF THE AREA...PUTTING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT.  ADDITIONALLY...A WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE 
APPROACHING THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  WITH CONTINUED LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE AND A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE...WILL SEE 
CONVECTION MOVE ACROSS THE AREA ONCE AGAIN TODAY AND THIS EVENING.  
A BIT DRIER IS WILL MOVE IN OVERNIGHT.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...IT 
WILL BE ANOTHER HOT AND HUMID DAY WITH HIGHS REACHING INTO THE 90S 
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW WILL PERSIST OVER THE REGION FOR MUCH OF THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD. APPEARS MUCH OF THE PERIOD WILL BE ON THE DRY 
SIDE...BUT THERE WILL LIKELY BE SOME DIFFICULT TO TIME IMPULSES IN 
THE FLOW THAT WILL LEAD TO CONVECTION AT TIMES.  FRONT SHOULD BE 
SOUTH OF THE AREA FRIDAY...AND WITH DRIER AIR FILTERING IN...WILL 
KEEP FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT PRECIP FREE.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
SAT AND SUN...AND AGAIN TUE AND WED...BUT AS STATED EARLIER TIMING 
OF ANY ENHANCED PRECIP CHANCES UNCERTAIN GIVEN LACK OF MODEL 
AGREEMENT ON THESE DETAILS. WILL REMAIN RATHER HOT FOR THE PERIOD. 
GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...WITH THE MAIN ADJUSTMENTS 
BEING TO RAISE SOME MIN TEMPS SLIGHTLY.     


&&

PUSHES GENTLY INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY 
APPROACHES THE AREA FROM THE NORTH. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS PACKING
REMAINS NORTH OF THE AREA. A FEW FORECAST CHALLENGES. CONDITIONS MAY 
REMAIN SOMEWHAT CLOUDY TONIGHT DUE TO UPSTREAM AND ONGOING 
CONVECTION AND MID LEVEL INVERSION THAT HAS BEEN DEVELOPING 
OVERNIGHT LATELY. THIS SHOULD NOT AFFECT WARM OVERNIGHT TEMPS MUCH. 
PCPN COVERAGE MAY BE UNDERDONE FOR THURSDAY WITH WARM UNSTABLE 
AIRMASS IN PLACE AND FAVORABLE NW STEERING. HARD TO GO LIKELY 
FOR CONVECTIVE  PCPN WITH NO SPECIFIC TRIGGER. MAX TEMPS THU ALSO A 
CONCERN WITH PCPN AND CLOUD COVER LIMITING SUNSHINE WHILE THICKNESS 
VALUES REMAIN RELATIVELY HIGH.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...NORTHWEST UPPER 
FLOW WILL PERSIST OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. THIS PERSISTENT 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL SLOWLY TRANSITION FROM CYCLONIC TO ANTICYCLONIC 
AS UPPER THROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST PULLS AWAY AND UPPER RIDGING 
BUILDS BACK INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS. ANTICIPATING GENERALLY DRY 
CONDITIONS THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM ALTHOUGH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
IS NOTORIOUS FOR MCS ACTIVITY. HOWEVER...PLACEMENT AND TIMING OF ANY 
INDIVIDUAL EVENT IS INHERENTLY TREACHEROUS. THUS HAVE MADE ONLY 
MINOR TWEAKS TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST AS THEY APPEAR REASONABLE 
GIVEN EXPECTED SCENARIO.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             74  93  74  97  73 /  20  50  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  91  72  93  68 /  30  50  10  10  10

OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AND CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS.  IT WILL BE HOT AND HUMID THROUGH THE SHORT TERM WITH HIGHS

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY/EARLY THURSDAY NIGHT.  
DYNAMICS NOT EXPECTED TO BE IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS FEATURE...BUT 
SHOULD BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO WARRANT HIGH CHANCE POPS THU. SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS EARLY THU NIGHT...THEN WILL GO DRY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
AS DRIER AIR FILTERS IN. UNCERTAINTY FAIRLY HIGH FURTHER OUT...WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SUNDAY AS ANOTHER WEAK FRONT MAY BE 
OVER THE AREA...THEN DRY MONDAY AND BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE TUE AS 
MOISTURE INCREASES OVER THE AREA. RATHER HOT CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR 
MUCH OF THE LONG TERM...AND DO NOT SEE ANY REASON TO MAKE 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

AND WESTERN NC. A FEW STORMS WERE DEVELOPING OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND GENERALLY INCREASING. TEMPERATURES TODAY ARE SEVERAL 
DEGREES COOLER THAN MONDAY DUE TO MORE CLOUD COVER. EXPECTING A FEW 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AS TEMPERATURES REACH 
ABOUT 90 DEGREES. HEAVY RAINFALL MAY CAUSE LOCALIZED FLOODING 
ESPECIALLY WHERE HEAVY RAIN FELL MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. 

SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOW THE BOUNDARY OR OLD FRONT MOVING SLOWLY 
NORTH OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. ALSO THEY SHOW SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING 
ACROSS KY AND THEN SE THROUGH SW VA AND NE TN INTO NC. UPPER RIDGE 
TO THE SOUTH WILL BUILD SLIGHTLY. FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS VALLEYS AND LIKELY RAIN CHANCES 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SW VA DROPPING OFF OVERNIGHT TO SLIGHT CHANCE 
VALLEYS AND CHANCE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WEDNESDAY HAVE HIGHEST POPS 
AGAIN NE AND MOUNTAINS. EXPECTING LOWS TONIGHT SIMILAR TO THIS 
MORNINGS IN THE LOWER 70S AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY CLOSE TO THE HIGHER 
MAV GUIDANCE.      


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...NORTHERN STREAM 
TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE NORTHEASTERN CONUS BY THURSDAY PUSHING A 
BOUNDARY INTO THE VICINITY OF OUR FORECAST AREA. DYNAMICS NOT VERY 
STRONG WITH THIS FEATURE BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
ACCOMPANIES BOUNDARY THAT AT LEAST SCATTERED CONVECTION APPEARS 
PLAUSIBLE. THUS HAVE CONTINUED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY. 
MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT BOUNDARY WILL EVENTUALLY BE PUSHED
SOUTH OF THE REGION WITH SOMEWHAT DRIER AIR BEHIND BOUNDARY. HAVE
CONTINUED DRY PERIODS ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. HAVE ALSO
CONTINUED WITH MAINLY DIURNAL POPS THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE
WEEKEND AS AREA REMAINS IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. FOR TEMPS...
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

.SHORT TERM...CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU WITH SOME REACHING SEVERE INTENSITY. SOME
CONVECTION MAY SPREAD INTO VALLEY AS OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES ARE
PRODUCED BY ONGOING CONVECTION. EXPECTED THIS ACTIVITY TO CONTINUE
THROUGH THE EARLY PORTIONS OF THE FIRST PERIOD BEFORE DIMINISHING
IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY OVERNIGHT. ANTICIPATE MAINLY DIURNAL
ACTIVITY TO RETURN TOMORROW AS WEAK BOUNDARY REMAINS IN THE GENERAL
VICINITY. FOR TEMPS...STAYED CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST
PART.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE 
RETROGRADES WEST BY EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PLACING SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. WEAK BOUNDARY APPROACHES 
FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY. HOWEVER...NO MAJOR IMPACTS EXPECTED FROM 
THIS FEATURE. DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/ 
FORECAST AS MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION IS EXPECTED THROUGH MID WEEK 
IN NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME. KEPT POPS SOMEWHAT LOWER BY LATE WORK WEEK 
AS SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR WORKS INTO THE REGION BEHIND BOUNDARY. WEAK 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH EMBEDDED IN NORTHWEST FLOW MAY INCREASE PRECIP 
CHANCES BY LATE NEXT WEEKEND...BUT EXACT TIMING UNCERTAIN AT THIS 
POINT. FOR TEMPS... GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE. TEMPS EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG-TERM 
PERIOD.


&&

OVER TWO INCHES. A FEW STORMS COULD BE STRONG WITH HIGH WINDS AND
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS. WILL RAISE POPS ABOUT 10 PERCENT IN THE SOUTH
AND ADJUST HIGHS DOWN A COUPLE DEGREES ALL AREAS. UPDATE OUT SOON.

633 
FXUS64 KMRX 260725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT MON JUL 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK AND SOMEWHAT DIFFUSE COOL 
FRONT TO OUR NORTH WILL STALL OVER THE REGION DURING THE SHORT 
TERM.  APPEARS THAT IT WILL NOT GET FAR ENOUGH SOUTH TO BRING ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN AIRMASS FOR OUR AREA. SHOULD BE ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE AROUND FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION...SO WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES TODAY INTO TONIGHT.  IT WILL STILL BE ON 
THE HOT SIDE...BUT MAX TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE A BIT LOWER THAN 
YESTERDAY.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.      

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
GRADUALLY SLIP BACK NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY WHILE UPPER LEVEL RIDGING RETROGRADES SLOWLY WEST. LITTLE 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN AIRMASS EXPECTED TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL REMAIN SUFFICIENT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT 
OF SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROF WILL AMPLIFY AS IT SHIFTS EAST 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR YET ANOTHER FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO MOVE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY KEEPING A CHANCE FOR COOLING SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS GOING THROUGH THIS PERIOD. IF THE NORTHEASTERN STATES 
UPPER TROF UNDERGOES ENOUGH AMPLIFICATION...THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY 
BE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THE WEEKEND. WITH SLIGHTLY DRIER 
AIR IN PLACE BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH AN INCREASE IN ATMOSPHERIC 
STABILITY...THE CHANCE FOR CONVECTION MAY BE DIMINISHED TO SOME 
DEGREE. TRENDED THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD THIS WAY WITH THE USE 
OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION.   

&&

737 
FXUS64 KMRX 260139
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
939 PM EDT SUN JUL 25 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. WITH SCATTERED 
ACTIVITY STILL POSSIBLE TONIGHT...WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS.  
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK. NO 
CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A MOIST AIR MASS IS IN PLACE OVER THE TN VALLEY...AND WITH A FRONT
APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...RAIN CHANCES WILL
BE INCREASING. EXPECT MAINLY SCATTERED COVERAGE THROUGH THE REST OF
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH THE BEST CHANCES NORTH CLOSER TO A
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH. STORMS SHOULD WANE AFTER SUNSET...BUT WEAK LOW
LEVEL CONVERGENCE IN THE MOIST AIR MASS WILL KEEP A CHANCE THROUGH
THE NIGHT. 

THE SURFACE FRONT WILL STALL JUST TO OUR NORTH ACROSS EASTERN KY
AND SOUTHERN WV...WITH A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH IN OUR VICINITY. THERE
WILL BE SOME WEAK UPPER DIVERGENCE TOMORROW...BUT WITH PRECIPITABLE
WATER VALUES WELL OVER 2 INCHES AND THE TROUGH ACROSS THE
AREA...NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA. HEAVY RAIN AND TRAINING STORMS WILL BE A THREAT DUE TO
VERY LIGHT STEERING WINDS. CLOUD COVER SHOULD HELP KEEP TEMPS IN
THE 85 TO 90 RANGE IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
MODELS KEEP BERMUDA RIDGE FLATTENED AND TO THE SOUTHEAST OF THE
FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT WITH WEAK BOUNDARY NEAR OR ALONG THE
SOUTHERN BORDER. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA INTO PART OF THE EVENING BEFORE DECREASING. TUESDAY
MORE SCATTERED CONVECTION SHOULD BREAK OUT WITH CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS
AS BOUNDARY LINGERS. ACTIVITY WILL DECREASE AGAIN TUESDAY EVENING.
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES REMAIN NEAR 2.00 INCHES MONDAY NIGHT INTO
TUESDAY NIGHT SO THERE IS A RISK OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN. WEDNESDAY
RIDGE TRIES TO RESTRENGTHEN AS BOUNDARY WEAKENS AND MOVES NORTH SO
LESS COVERAGE AND SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES. THURSDAY A NEW
BOUNDARY BEGINS TO SINK SOUTH INTO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA AS UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS ACROSS THE NE STATES. THIS
FRONT LOOKS TO MOVE TO THE SOUTHERN BOUNDARY BY FRIDAY AND REMAIN
THERE OR JUST SOUTH OF THE TN/GA BORDER THROUGH THE WEEKEND. CLOUDS
AND RAIN WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPERATURES COOLER IN THE UPPER 80S TO MID
90S THROUGH THE EXTENDED. WILL FOLLOW THE HIGHER GUIDANCE NUMBERS
SINCE THE TREND FOR ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES HAS BEEN A PRESENCE
FOR THE LAST COUPLE WEEKS AND HOPE THAT CLOUDS AND RAIN WILL LOWER
TEMPERATURES EVEN MORE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

GH/DGS/TD

FXUS64 KMRX 251348 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
948 AM EDT SUN JUL 25 2010

.DISCUSSION...
MOISTURE HAS BEEN INCREASING ACROSS THE REGION...WHICH WILL GIVE A
BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON THAN WE
HAVE SEEN IN THE PAST FEW DAYS. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES HAVE
RISEN TO NEAR 2 INCHES AND THE CAP IS WEAKER. THE FAVORED AREAS
APPEAR TO BE IN OUR SOUTHERN SECTIONS...ALONG AN AXIS OF HIGHER
THETA-E VALUES FROM WESTERN NC TO NRN GA...AND IN NORTHERN SECTIONS
IN ASSOCIATED WITH A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH ACROSS KY AND WV. MODELS
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN PRODUCING PRECIP IN THESE AREAS. WILL
UPDATE TO RAISE POPS TO A HIGH CHANCE ACROS SW NC AND SW VA.
TEMPERATURES LOOK TO BE ON TRACK...AND MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY SHOULD
SEE MAXIMUM HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 100 AND 105 THIS AFTERNOON.
THE SPS MENTIONING THE HEAT WILL BE CONTINUED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT SUN JUL 25 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ISOLATED WEAK CONVECTION HAS 
ALREADY FIRED UP ACROSS THE AREA LAST HOUR OR SO. WITH UPPER RIDGE 
FLATTENING OUT DURING THE SHORT TERM...AND WEAK COOL FRONT SAGGING 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH...SHOULD SEE SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER 
THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS BOTH TODAY 
AND TONIGHT.  WITH INCREASED CLOUD COVER EXPECTED TEMPS MAY BE 
SLIGHTLY LOWER THAN YESTERDAY MOST LOCATIONS...BUT STILL HOT. EXPECT 
HEAT INDEX VALUES TO BE NEAR...BUT GENERALLY BELOW...HEAT ADVISORY 
CRITERIA FOR SOUTHERN AREAS AND CENTRAL VALLEY...SO WILL CONTINUE 
SPS FOR THOSE AREAS.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE MODELS GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT AN UPPER TROF WILL CONTINUE TO PRESS EAST ACROSS THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. KNOCKING THE RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES 
BACK A FEW MILLIBARS AND ALLOWING A COOL FRONT TO MAKE PROGRESS INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RATHER DECENT MOISTURE...LIFT AND 
INSTABILITY WILL BE IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE FRONT FOR LIKELY POPS 
NORTH AND GOOD CHANCE PROBABILITIES SOUTH ON MONDAY. INCREASED THE 
CHANCE OF RAIN TO A LIKELY CATEGORY FOR ALMOST THE ENTIRE REGION ON 
TUESDAY WITH DEEP MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY IN PLACE ALONG WITH THE 
STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY IN THE AREA. GRADUALLY LOWERED THE CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS THE FRONT 
SHIFTS BACK NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. BY FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROF WILL BE AMPLIFYING ACROSS THE 
NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION AND AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
DROP SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INCREASING THE CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION AT THE END OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD. TRENDED 
MAX/MIN TEMPS CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH PROVIDES FOR 
MODERATING TEMPERATURES RESULTING FROM THE MORE ACTIVE WEATHER 
PATTERN WHICH FEATURES INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND BETTER CHANCES FOR 
CONVECTIVE RAINFALL.

443 
FXUS64 KMRX 250158
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 PM EDT SAT JUL 24 2010

.DISCUSSION...PRECIPITATION ON THE DECLINE SO WILL UPDATE FORECAST 
TO REMOVE EVENING GROUP. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE ANCHORED OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST WILL BEGIN TO GIVE
WAY OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN SLIGHTLY COOLER
TEMPERATURES AND BETTER CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS
THE AREA FOR SUNDAY. DESPITE THE COOLER TEMPS WITH HIGHS IN THE MID
90S...DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S
TOMORROW...SO THE HEAT INDEX SHOULD STILL EXCEED 100 IN THE
SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY. WILL KEEP THE SPS GOING TO MENTION
THIS. 

A FRONT NEAR THE GREAT LAKES TODAY WILL PUSH TOWARD THE 
SOUTH...WEAKENING THE GRIP OF THE ATLANTIC RIDGE OVER THE AREA.
MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL INCREASE WITH A BETTER SOUTHERLY FLOW
PROVIDING GULF MOISTURE. THE MOS GUIDANCE SHOWS A PRETTY BIG SPREAD
IN POPS BETWEEN THE NAM AND THE GFS...WITH THE GFS BEING THE DRIER
OF THE TWO. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE LESS CIN TO BE OVERCOME
TOMORROW AND HIGHER PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES. WILL MENTION CHANCE
POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...BUT NOT QUITE AS HIGH AS THE NAM.
BEST CHANCES APPEAR TO BE IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW
VA...FARTHER FROM THE SUPPRESSING INFLUENCE OF THE RIDGE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER TROF OVER THE 
NORTH CENTRAL STATES WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHEASTERN STATES DURING 
THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. THE FLOW NOW MORE FROM THE NORTHWEST
WILL ALLOW THE COOL FRONT TO SLIDE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
HIGHEST FROM SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE FRONT SETTLES OVER
THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. BY MIDWEEK THE FRONT
WEAKENS AND LIFTS BACK NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY. SATURDAY ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROF MOVES INTO THE NE STATES
AND ANOTHER COLD FRONT MAY MAKE IT INTO SW VA. TEMPERATURES WILL
REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL BUT NOT AS HOT AS THEY HAVE BEEN THE LAST TWO
DAYS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

839 
FXUS64 KMRX 250020
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
820 PM EDT SAT JUL 24 2010

.DISCUSSION...SENT AN UPDATE TO REMOVE HEAT ADVISORY. STILL SEEING 
ISOLATED ACTIVITY IN THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS SO WILL CURRENTS POPS 
GOING FOR NOW...BUT IT LOOKS LIKES IT IS DISSIPATING QUICKLY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE ANCHORED OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST WILL BEGIN TO GIVE
WAY OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN SLIGHTLY COOLER
TEMPERATURES AND BETTER CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS
THE AREA FOR SUNDAY. DESPITE THE COOLER TEMPS WITH HIGHS IN THE MID
90S...DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S
TOMORROW...SO THE HEAT INDEX SHOULD STILL EXCEED 100 IN THE
SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY. WILL KEEP THE SPS GOING TO MENTION
THIS. 

A FRONT NEAR THE GREAT LAKES TODAY WILL PUSH TOWARD THE 
SOUTH...WEAKENING THE GRIP OF THE ATLANTIC RIDGE OVER THE AREA.
MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL INCREASE WITH A BETTER SOUTHERLY FLOW
PROVIDING GULF MOISTURE. THE MOS GUIDANCE SHOWS A PRETTY BIG SPREAD
IN POPS BETWEEN THE NAM AND THE GFS...WITH THE GFS BEING THE DRIER
OF THE TWO. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE LESS CIN TO BE OVERCOME
TOMORROW AND HIGHER PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES. WILL MENTION CHANCE
POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...BUT NOT QUITE AS HIGH AS THE NAM.
BEST CHANCES APPEAR TO BE IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW
VA...FARTHER FROM THE SUPPRESSING INFLUENCE OF THE RIDGE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER TROF OVER THE 
NORTH CENTRAL STATES WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHEASTERN STATES DURING 
THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. THE FLOW NOW MORE FROM THE NORTHWEST
WILL ALLOW THE COOL FRONT TO SLIDE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
HIGHEST FROM SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE FRONT SETTLES OVER
THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. BY MIDWEEK THE FRONT
WEAKENS AND LIFTS BACK NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY. SATURDAY ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROF MOVES INTO THE NE STATES
AND ANOTHER COLD FRONT MAY MAKE IT INTO SW VA. TEMPERATURES WILL
REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL BUT NOT AS HOT AS THEY HAVE BEEN THE LAST TWO
DAYS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

GH/DGS/TD


149 
FXUS64 KMRX 241401 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 AM EDT SAT JUL 24 2010

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE SOUTH CAROLINA COAST WILL CONTINUE
ITS GRIP OVER THE REGION TODAY...PROVIDING HOT AND HUMID
CONDITIONS. 1000-850 MB THICKNESS VALUES FROM FFC AT 12Z THIS
MORNING ARE NEARLY IDENTICAL TO YESTERDAY MORNING...SO WE SHOULD
SEE HIGH TEMPS AT LEAST AS HIGH AS YESTERDAY AFTERNOON...PERHAPS A
BIT HIGHER WITH ANY DAY OF SURFACE DRYING. CURRENT OBSERVED
TEMPERATUERS AND DEWPOINTS ARE ON TRACK TO SEE HEAT INDEX VALUES
AROUND 105 IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...WITH 100 TO 105 AROUND
KNOXVILLE. THE HEAT ADVISORY AND SPS WILL NOT BE CHANGED. 

THE GFS AND SREF CONTINUE TO SHOW SOME PRECIP THIS AFTERNOON IN SW
NC...SO WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING THERE. FORECAST
SOUNDINGS ELSEWHERE INDICATE SOME CIN THAT WILL NEED TO BE OVERCOME
FOR ANY SHOWERS TO DEVELOP...WHICH SEEMS UNLIKELY. NO UPDATE WILL
BE NEEDED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...WEST POLK.

345 
FXUS64 KMRX 240754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT SAT JUL 24 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER HIGH STILL TRYING TO 
MAINTAIN ITS HOLD ON THE AREA THIS MORNING AND THROUGH THESE THREE 
PERIODS...ALTHOUGH BY SUNDAY IT HAS SLID A BIT TO THE EAST. BIG
DISAGREEMENT IN THE MOS GUIDANCE...SOMEWHAT TODAY...BUT MORE-SO
TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. NAM IS QUITE AGGRESSIVE AND SEEMS TO BE THE
ODD-ONE-OUT THIS TIME AS OTHER MODELS KEEP THINGS PRETTY QUIET
OVERALL. PMDHMD SINGLED OUT THE NAM AS THE MODEL TO POSSIBLY LEAN
AWAY FROM. THEREFORE WILL OPT FOR THE DRIER SIDE OF THE FORECAST
THROUGH SUNDAY...HOWEVER NOT COMPLETELY DRY...A COLD FRONT OR AT
LEAST A PREFRONTAL TROUGH...SHOULD BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO WARRANT
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY.

STILL TOASTY TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY...WILL KEEP HEAT ADVISORY GOING 
TODAY...AS HEAT INDEX OF 105 LOOKS ON TRACK AGAIN FOR KCHA...GOT TO 
106 YESTERDAY.  SUNDAY WILL BE CLOSE...BUT THINK INCREASING CLOUDS 
WILL KEEP HEAT INDEX JUST UNDER CRITERIA DURING THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEATHER PATTERN THE 
REGION HAS SEEN SEVERAL TIMES THIS SUMMER WILL COME TO THE RESCUE 
ONCE AGAIN AS AN UPPER ATMOSPHERIC TROF CURRENTLY OVER THE NORTH 
CENTRAL STATES MAKES PROGRESS INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S.  THE 
RESULTING WEST NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL HELP TO DRIVE A COOL FRONT 
SOUTH THROUGH THE CENTRAL INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE ESPECIALLY DURING THE 
FIRST THREE DAYS OF THE WORK WEEK WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPPING 
SOUTH INTO THE REGION. LATER IN THE DAY WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY THE 
FRONT WILL WEAKEN TAKING FOCUS FOR STORM DEVELOPMENT AWAY FROM 
CONVERGENCE ALONG THE BOUNDARY WITH A SLIGHT SHIFT TOWARD OROGRAPHIC 
INITIATION. BY FRIDAY ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROF WILL ARRIVE IN THE 
NORTHEASTERN PART OF THE COUNTRY AND YET ANOTHER COOL FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL DROP SLOWLY SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE 
FORECAST AREA. STAYED WITH A SMALL CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AS OUTFLOW FROM POSSIBLE ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY SPARK STORM FORMATION 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. TRENDED 
TEMPS CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN            100  76  96  74  94 /  10  10  20  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  97  75  94  74  91 /  10  10  20  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       98  76  94  74  90 /  10  10  20  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              96  70  92  72  89 /  10  10  20  40  50 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...WEST POLK.

019 
FXUS64 KMRX 231909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT FRI JUL 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...
A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE POPPED UP IN NE TN AND SW VA...BUT ARE
HAVING A HARD TIME SURVIVING IN THE CAPPED ENVIRONMENT. ANY SHOWERS
SHOULD DISSIPATE BY SUNSET...AND WILL NOT CARRY ANY POPS THIS
EVENING. 

THE STRONG HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST CONUS WILL
REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...RESULTING IN PRIMARILY A
PERSISTENCE FORECAST. ONE SLIGHT DIFFERENCE TOMORROW IS A
LOW LEVEL SOUTHEASTERLY FETCH ACROSS SC...WHICH MAY LEAD TO MORE
UPSLOPE SHOWERS IN NC MOUNTAINS. CIN AND SUBSIDENCE SHOULD BE
SUFFICIENT TO PREVENT MUCH SHOWER DEVELOPMENT ELSEWHERE. WILL
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE SMOKIES AND SW NC...OTHERWISE
TOMORROW LOOKS DRY AND HOT AGAIN. LOWS TONIGHT ARE EXPECTED TO BE
AROUND 75 DEGREES OR HIGHER IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...WITH HEAT
INDEX VALUES TOMORROW BETWEEN 105 AND 108. THUS A HEAT ADVISORY
WILL BE ISSUED FOR THIS AREA TOMORROW AFTERNOON. WILL CONTINUE THE
SPS MENTIONING HEAT INDEX VALUES OF 100 TO 105 ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...THE CENTRAL VALLEY INCLUDING
KNOXVILLE...AND SW NC FOR TOMORROW. HIGH TEMPS WILL APPROACH RECORD
HIGHS AT TRI AND AT CHA.

RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR JULY 24...
TRI...97
TYS...101
CHA...101

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HOT UPPER RIDGE
CONTINUES CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHEAST COAST SATURDAY NIGHT. A WEAK
COLD FRONT IS SLOWLY DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. TS BONNIE
IS EXPECTED TO MOVE NE ACROSS THE GULF TOWARDS THE MS RIVER.
ANOTHER VERY WARM NIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT WITH ONLY ISOLATED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS HIGHER ELEVATIONS PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. SUNDAY
THE COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER AND MOISTURE GETS
PUSHED INTO TH MS VALLEY AND THEN TN VALLEY FROM BONNIE.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER BUT ONLY EXPECTING 20 TO
30 PERCENT COVERAGE OF THUNDERSTORMS. HEAT INDEX VALUES STILL
EXPECTED TO BE 100 TO 105 ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. SUNDAY NIGHT
AND MONDAY COLD FRONT DROPS DOWN EVEN CLOSER WITH LEFTOVERS OF
BONNIE COMBINING FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THIS
PATTERN SHOULD CONTINUE ALL WEEK AS UPPER LEVEL HIGH LIES OVER SE STATES
AND MOISTURE FROM FRONT AND BONNIE LINGER OVER THE TN VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: HAMILTON.

     HEAT ADVISORY FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM EDT SATURDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST 
     MONROE...RHEA...WEST POLK.

VA...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS WILL RESULT IN HEAT INDEX VALUES NEAR OR
ABOVE 100 DEGREES FOR MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY TODAY. OBSERVED
TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS ARE RUNNING CLOSE TO FORECAST...SO MAX
HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 100 AND 105 REMAIN LIKELY...WITH THE HEAT
ISLAND OF CHATTANOOGA GOING OVER 105. WILL KEEP THE HEAT ADVISORY
GOING AS IS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME CIN WILL NEED TO BE
OVERCOME TO PRODUCE CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH APPEARS
UNLIKELY FOR MOST SPOTS GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE UPPER RIDGE OVER
THE DEEP SOUTH. HOWEVER...WILL KEEP JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING
IN NE TN AND SW VA WHICH FARTHER FROM THE RIDGE.

840 
FXUS64 KMRX 230850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
450 AM EDT FRI JUL 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RATHER DIRTY UPPER HIGH PRESSURE 
SO FAR IN THIS EVENT...THAT LOOKS LIKE A BAD HEAT WAVE ON THE 500 MB 
MAPS...BUT LOOKING AT RADAR AND SATELLITE THE LAST COUPLE OF 
DAYS...LOOKS LESS THAN TEXT BOOK FOR A HEAT WAVE.  UPPER RIDGE AXIS 
HAS SEEMED TO PLAY AS A SHEAR AXIS AT LEAST AS MUCH AS A SUPPRESSING 
AGENT.  STILL LOOKS LIKE SHEARING COULD BE OCCURRING THROUGH TODAY 
IN OUR NERN AREAS...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN NE OF MORRISTOWN...AND 
TAPER OFF TO LESSER VALUES TO THE SW.  THINK THAT THE RIDGE WILL 
HAVE A SUPPRESSIVE EFFECT...BUT NOT ALL AT ONCE...SO ONCE 
AGAIN...WILL KEEP SOME POPS IN THE NORTHEAST.

ALSO INTERESTING THAT THE CONVECTION STARTED EARLY YESTERDAY...PRIOR 
TO 15Z...AND SREF PROGS SUGGEST AN EARLY BUILD UP TODAY AS WELL. 
WILL START POPS CHANCES AT 15Z.  

AM GOING CLOSE TO MAV MAX TEMPS TODAY...BUT 1-2 DEGREES COOLER IN 
THE NORTHEAST DUE TO A LITTLE MORE CONVECTIVE BUILD-UP.

KIND OF BORDERLINE FOR ANY HEAT ADVISORY WITH APPARENT TEMPERATURES 
THIS AFTERNOON SCRAPING CRITERIA NEAR KCHA...AND OVERNIGHT LOWS 
STAYING WARM ENOUGH ONLY IN THE CHA HEAT ISLAND.  HAVE DECIDED TO 
ISSUE HEAT ADVISORY FOR HAMILTON COUNTY ONLY.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STRONG BERMUDA RIDGE WILL
STAY IN PLAY AND EVEN SHOWS SOME INDICATIONS OF RETROGRESSION LATER
IN THE PERIOD. SURFACE HIGH WAVERS A BIT, AND ALLOWS A WEAK COLD
FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE NORTH BUT THIS WILL LARGELY WASH OUT
EARLY IN THE WEEK AND NOT AFFECT MUCH. TEMPS MAY COOL DOWN CLOSER
TO NORMAL. THE ATMOSPHERE DOES DRY OUT A BIT AND SO POPS LOWER
THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE LATER ON. MOST OF
THE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR WILL BE DUE TO INSOLATION ON
TERRAIN. PROBABLY BE FAILY SLOW MOVING DUE TO WEAK STEERING WINDS
AND WILL THEREFORE CONTAIN BRIEF HEAVY RAIN. STILL HOT AND MUGGY
FOR THE MOST PART WITH GENERALLY LIGHT WINDS. LITTLE RELIEF IN
SIGHT.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN            101  75  98  76  96 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  97  73  96  75  93 /  10  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       98  72  96  76  93 /  10  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              95  69  95  70  91 /  20  10  10  10  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

WILL START POPS CHANCES AT 15Z.  

AM GOING CLOSE TO MAV MAX TEMPS TODAY...BUT 1-2 DEGREES COOLER IN 
THE NORTHEAST DUE TO A LITTLE MORE CONVECTIVE BUILD-UP.

KIND OF BORDERLINE FOR ANY HEAT ADVISORY WITH APPARENT TEMPERATURES 
THIS AFTERNOON SCRAPING CRITERIA NEAR KCHA...AND OVERNIGHT LOWS 
STAYING WARM ENOUGH ONLY IN THE CHA HEAT ISLAND.  HAVE DECIDED TO 
ISSUE HEAT ADVISORY FOR HAMILTON COUNTY ONLY.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STRONG BERMUDA RIDGE WILL
STAY IN PLAY AND EVEN SHOWS SOME INDICATIONS OF RETROGRESSION LATER
IN THE PERIOD. SURFACE HIGH WAVERS A BIT, AND ALLOWS A WEAK COLD
FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE NORTH BUT THIS WILL LARGELY WASH OUT
EARLY IN THE WEEK AND NOT AFFECT MUCH. TEMPS MAY COOL DOWN CLOSER
TO NORMAL. THE ATMOSPHERE DOES DRY OUT A BIT AND SO POPS LOWER
THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE LATER ON. MOST OF
THE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR WILL BE DUE TO INSOLATION ON
TERRAIN. PROBABLY BE FAILY SLOW MOVING DUE TO WEAK STEERING WINDS
AND WILL THEREFORE CONTAIN BRIEF HEAVY RAIN. STILL HOT AND MUGGY
FOR THE MOST PART WITH GENERALLY LIGHT WINDS. LITTLE RELIEF IN
SIGHT.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN            101  75  98  76  96 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  97  73  96  75  93 /  10  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       98  72  96  76  93 /  10  10  10  10  20

749 
FXUS64 KMRX 221931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EDT THU JUL 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS 
FORECASTS. SORT OF RUN OUT OF NEW THINGS TO TALK ABOUT. BERMUDA
HIGH DOMINATES THE SCENE AS USUAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. HOT,
HUMID, SOME MINOR INSTABILITY BUT LITTLE SFC LIFT OTHER THAN HEAT
AND EVEN SOME DIFFLUENCE GETS IN THE WAY OF THAT. ALOFT, THE TEMPS
ARE JUST TOO WARM TO ALLOW FOR MUCH IN THE WAY OF LAPSE RATES. SO
WE ARE LEFT WITH SHORT TOPPED, QUASI-ORGANIZED CONVECTION WITH
MAINLY SOME GUSTY WINDS AND LOTS OF BRIEF HEAVY SHOWERS. OVERNIGHT,
SKIES WILL CLEAR UP A BIT AND THERE WILL BE AREAS OF FOG,
ESPECIALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND ADJACENT VALLEY UP INTO
SW VA. POPS DROP A BIT FOR TOMORROW, UNLESS THESE INVISIBLE WEAK
FINE LINES KEEP POPPING A FEW SHRA/TSRA. BIGGER STORY IS HEAT
STATEMENT STILL UP. WILL LOOK AT IT ON EITHER THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT OR
TOMORROW'S DAY SHIFT FOR UPGRADE TO HEAT ADVISORY. BIGGEST PROBLEM
WITH IT IS HAVING MIN TEMPS STAY UP HIGH ENOUGH OVER NIGHT TO MEET
CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE STAYS
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES SATURDAY WITH HOT TEMPERATURES
IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S. CONVECTION LOOKS TO BE LIMITED TO THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FROM SUNDAY THROUGH MID WEEK A COLD FRONT WILL
DROP INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TO JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND
THEN LIFT BACK NORTH. THE RIDGE WILL FLATTEN OUT AND SHORTWAVE
ENERGY WILL MOVE SOUTH INTO THE TN VALLEY FOR A CHANCE OF AFTERNOON
AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. LOW TEMPERATURES FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY NIGHTS WILL BE IN THE MID 70S IN THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL
VALLEYS. FROM SUNDAY ON HIGHS AND LOWS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER
BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL.

FXUS64 KMRX 220800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU JUL 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...NO ECHOES SHOWING UP ON THE RADAR FOR NOW...BUT 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO TRACK ACROSS THE CWA TODAY. DEEPEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH AND CENTRAL. WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY EXPECTED...COULD SEE 
A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS 
AGAIN. THE ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH DURING EVENING HOURS AS THE 
DISTURBANCE EXITS THE AREA...SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES EARLY 
FOR TONIGHT. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED AGAIN TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. HEAT INDICES IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY SHOULD BREAK 100 
DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON WHILE THE CENTRAL VALLEY COULD NEAR A HEAT 
INDEX OF 100 DEGREES. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LONG-RANGE MODELS APPEAR TO 
BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE STRENGTHENING OF AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH 
OVER THE SOUTHEAST ON FRIDAY...WHICH WILL RESULT IN CONFINING 
ISOLATED CONVECTION TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND HOTTER TEMPS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA INTO SATURDAY. IN FACT...IT APPEARS THAT HEAT 
INDICES WILL BE OVER 100 DEGREES FOR SEVERAL HOURS ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS OF THE GREAT TN VALLEY ON FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON AND AGAIN ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THIS POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS 
HEAT. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS SEEM TO AGREE THAT A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH THE REGION BY SUNDAY NIGHT...AND STALL OUT AROUND THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. WHILE THIS FRONT WON'T BRING MUCH 
COOLER AIR...IT SHOULD INCREASE CLOUDS AND THE CONVECTIVE COVERAGE 
ENOUGH TO PROVIDE SOME RELIEF TO THE HEAT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

PRETTY MUCH A REPEAT OF YESTERDAY AND LAST EVENING. LOOKING FOR SOME 
STORMS TO PRODUCE STRONG GUSTY WINDS BORDERING ON SEVERE CRITERIA 
AND ESPECIALLY LOCALLY FLOODING RAINS. THURSDAY ANOTHER REPEAT. 
UNTIL THE BIG BERMUDA HIGH MOVES ON OUT IT WILL STAY THIS WAY, 
TYPICAL MID SUMMER WEATHER.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL DOMINATE WEATHER OVER THE REGION INTO THE WEEKEND.  THE RESULT 
WILL BE CONTINUE HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS WITH SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS OCCASIONALLY DEVELOPING AND MOVING ACROSS THE AREA.  
THE BEST CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO BE DURING 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  A WEAKENING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA AROUND THE SUNDAY/MONDAY 
TIME FRAME.  THE BOUNDARY WILL STALL IN OR AROUND THE AREA AND ACT 
AS A FOCUS FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION AND MAY CONTINUE TO EFFECT THE 
MRX CWA THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

WINDS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD.

266 
FXUS64 KMRX 201850 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT TUE JUL 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG BERMUDA HIGH BRINGING 
HOT AND HUMID AIR FROM GMEX INTO SOUTHEASTERN US. SURFACE 
STREAMLINES SHOWING FAIRLY STRONG CLOUD STREETS MOVING INTO AREA 
FROM SOUTHWEST. INSTABILITY APPEARS IMPRESSIVE, AND NO CAP IS 
APPARENT IN LOCAL SOUNDINGS, WHILE CONVECTIVE TEMPS HAVE GENERALLY 
BEEN MET. CONVECTION IS JUST NOW BEGINNING TO BECOME STRONG. BELIEVE 
THAT THE DELAY HAS BEEN DUE TO LACK OF STRONG SURFACE LIFT, DESPITE 
HIGH THETA E VALUES. 

HAVE INCREASED POPS A BIT OVER BLEND GUIDANCE WITH UPSTREAM 
LEFTOVERS FROM MCS MOVING THIS WAY. ALSO, WITH INCREASED LIKELIHOOD 
OF CLOUDS TONIGHT FROM CENTRAL SECTIONS TO THE NORTHEAST HAVE KEPT 
MIN TEMPS UP AND DECREASED THEM TO THE SOUTHWEST. KEPT MORNING FOG 
IN, AS WELL. 

CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING AND BEGIN TO WEAKEN AFTER 
SUNSET. EXPECT WEDNESDAY TO BE LARGELY A REPEAT OF TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE
DIFFERING IN RESPECTS TO AMOUNT OF MOISTURE INFLUX INTO THE REGION
WITH NORTHWEST FLOW INITIALLY BEING ACTIVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH THURSDAY. HAVE UPPED PRECIP CHANCES SLIGHTLY ON THURSDAY
AND ADDED POPS IN ON FRIDAY FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA TO
ACCOUNT FOR AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHRA/TSRA. MODELS HAVE BEEN
CONSISTENT IN PUSHING UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE ACROSS MAINLY NORTHERN
SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...ALSO LEADING TO SLIGHTLY
INCREASED POPS AT LEAST FROM TYS NORTHWARD INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

CMWF MODEL IS THEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT IN BRINGING UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING BACK INTO THE AREA BY FRIDAY AND INTO SATURDAY WITH MINIMAL
POPS EXPECTED FORECAST AREA WIDE AND HOT CONDITIONS PREVAILING
INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND.

MODELS ALL THEN BEGIN TO PUSH FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARD AND INTO THE
FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...LINGERING INTO MONDAY AND TUESDAY. WITH
SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES POPS FOR
NOW. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE PERIOD...STAYED
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             74  94  73  96  73 /  20  20  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  73  92  72  93  73 /  20  20  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       73  92  72  93  72 /  20  20  10  20  10

939 
FXUS64 KMRX 200730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT TUE JUL 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE MID WEST AND MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM 
(MCS) OVER CENTRAL ILLINOIS...WHICH WAS MOVING EAST-SOUTHEAST 
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS MCS WILL MOVE 
MOSTLY TO THE EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TODAY...DUE TO ZONAL 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW. HOWEVER...THINK THAT OUTFLOW FROM THIS MCS SHOULD 
AT LEAST TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AGAIN. 
THUS...WILL MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION EVERYWHERE WITH THE HIGHEST 
POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS PATTERN OF 
MCS DEVELOPMENT OVER THE MID MS AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS POSSIBLY 
MOVING TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA WILL LIKELY CONTINUE TONIGHT. IT IS 
POSSIBLE THAT ANOTHER MCS OVER THE MID WEST COULD MOVE TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BUT FOR NOW WILL ONLY INCLUDE SMALL POPS 
THROUGH THE NIGHT SINCE ANY ADDITIONAL MCS ACTIVITY MIGHT WAIT UNTIL 
WEDNESDAY TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO 
TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST...BUT WITH MAXES A FEW DEGREES 
HIGHER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH 
THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH 
WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS PROGGED. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH AGAIN WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE LINGERS. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BUT MAY STILL SEE SOME ISOLATED 
DIURNAL ACTIVITY BOTH DAYS AS THE INSTABILITY INCREASES....BUT MOST 
OF THE STORMS SHOULD BE IN THE UPSLOPE REGIONS. A BOUNDARY TRACKS 
INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND LINGERS INTO MONDAY. WITH SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES POPS FOR NOW. 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE PERIOD...STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

U.S. BUT TRY TO INCREASE POPS TO SOME DEGREE WITH ADDITIONAL MCS

HAVE A LITTLE HIGHER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE CLOSER TO THE NORTHWARD ADVANCING MCS WAVE 
TRAIN. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MOS MAX/MIN TEMP GUIDANCE. 
HOWEVER...ADJUSTED MAXES A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW MOS BLEND FOR 
TUESDAY.

BE POSITIONED OVER THE SOUTHERN U.S. DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
EXTENDED.  THE RESULT WILL BE LIMITED CONVECTION...MAINLY DURING THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS WITH BEST CHANCE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  A WEAKENING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SLIDE INTO THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY.  
THERE SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BUT LIFT WILL BE QUITE 
WEAK AND WILL KEEP POPS LOW ON SUNDAY.  A SHORT WAVE TRACKS THROUGH
