TO TRIGGER ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...WILL MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION EVERYWHERE TODAY...WITH A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AGAIN AREAWIDE. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE SINCE 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT SHOULD HAVE A LARGE INFLUENCE ON THE HIGHS 
THIS AFTERNOON. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS ARE SIMILAR IN 
KEEPING A SLIGHT WEAKNESS IN NORTHWEST FLOW TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS FORECAST AREA WIDE 
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPECTED NORTHWEST FLOW AND 
SCATTERED AFTERNOON/EVENING DEVELOPMENT. ECMWF/GFS ARE FAIRLY 
SIMILAR IN DEVELOPING UPPER RIDGE MORE PREDOMINANTLY ACROSS THE AREA 
BY THURSDAY AND WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
DIURNAL CONVECTION IN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN COUNTIES. WILL CONTINUE 
CLOSELY WITH CURRENT TEMP FORECAST.

UPPER RIDGE ACROSS SOUTHEAST U.S. DOES SHOW SOME SIGNS OF WEAKENING
BY LATTER PART OF UPCOMING WEEKEND...AS UPPER TROUGH AND WEAKENING
SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ARE PROGGED BY MODELS TO ATTEMPT TO MOVE
SOUTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA OUT OF KENTUCKY. STILL A LONG WAYS OUT
TO KEY ON ANY TIMING WITH THIS BOUNDARY.

FXUS64 KMRX 181941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 PM EDT SUN JUL 18 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SCATTERED TSRA CONTINUE
OVER SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH ISOLATED
TSRA OVER NRN HALF. THIS ACTIVITY SEEMS TO BE PURELY DIURNAL...WITH
ALL INSTABILITY AND LITTLE TO NO SHEAR...OR UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT
NOTED. MOVEMENT IS NE AT 15 TO 20 MPH...AND EARLY GRIDS WERE DRAWN
FOR THESE TSRA TO CONTINUE PROPAGATING NE INTO THE EVENING HOURS.

UPSTREAM OF OUR REGION...THE MCS IS DROPPING SOUTHWARD FROM THE MID 
MS VALLEY REGION...MOVING INTO WRN TN WHERE SPC MESO PAGE SHOWS 
HIGHEST INSTABILITY AND A THETA-E RIDGE. SATELLITE PICS SHOW TOPS 
WARMING...BUT ACTIVITY COULD DEVELOP OVER CENTRAL KY AND MIDDLE TN 
ALONG ANY OUTFLOW BOUNDARY TONIGHT. THUS...SHORT RANGE MODELS 
DEPICTION OF OVERNIGHT TSRA REACHING NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA SEEMS 
REASONABLE. 

HARDER CALL FOR MONDAY...DEPENDING ON HOW FAR MCS PUSHES OVERNIGHT.
HOWEVER...THINK THAT 50 TO 60 PERCENT POPS ARE IN ORDER FOR MONDAY
...DECREASING TO LESS THAN 30 PERCENT BY MONDAY NIGHT. MODELS DIFFER 
ON PATTERN FOR TUESDAY...WITH GFS SHOWING ANOTHER VORT MAX/MCS TO 
GENERATE MORNING TSRA...WHILE NAM LOOKS DRIER WITH MORE OF A ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT. LEANING MORE WITH NAM...SO OPTED FOR A MOS BLEND ON POPS 
WHICH KEEPS CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.

GFS MOS WAS CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR TEMPS EACH PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FOR THE PAST FEW DAYS 
MODELS HAVE BEEN JUST A BIT SLOWER TO ALLOW THE ADVERTISED 
RE-EMERGENCE OF THE UPPER RIDGE. THEREFORE...DID A SLIGHT UPWARD 
ADJUSTMENT OF POPS FOR WEDNESDAY TO WIDESPREAD SLIGHT CHANCE WITH 
LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY ON THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND ACROSS MUCH OF 
EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE RIDGE FINALLY BUILDS ON THURSDAY 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY LIMITING CONVECTION TO A LARGE DEGREE. BY SUNDAY 
THE UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN ENOUGH TO ALLOW A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
TO SHIFT SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE REGION. ADDED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SLIGHTLY 
BETTER INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE. 
TRENDED MAX TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD CLOSE TO IF NOT A COUPLE 
DEGREES UNDER NEW MEX MOS MAXIMUM TEMP GUIDANCE.

DIVERGENCE ALOFT DOES LINGER ACROSS SW VA AND NE CORNER OF TN...
WITH TWO MAIN AREAS OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE...TO OUR N OVER SE KY
AND TO OUR S ACROSS NRN AL AND NRN GA. POSSIBLY SOME WEAK SPIN

...BUT THINK MOST CONVECTION WILL DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET. SHORT
RANGE MODELS SPREAD THE AL/GA CONVECTION NE INTO SE TN AND SW NC
...WHILE RUC MODEL SPREADS A GOOD DEAL OF CONVECTION FROM SE KY
INTO SW VA AND NE TN THIS EVENING. THIS SEEMS REASONABLE...SO
HIGHER CHANCE POPS WERE USED FOR THOSE AREAS...WHILE SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS WERE USED ELSEWHERE. WORDED AS ISOLATED OR SCATTERED FOR
COVERAGE. LINGERING CLOUD COVER SUPPORTS THE MILDER GFS MINS OR
EVEN A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GFS.

FOR LATER PERIODS...EXPECT MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR SUNDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS STILL ON TRACK. MODELS HINT AT
A MESOSCALE COMPLEX DEVELOPING LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND AFFECTING OUR
AREA INTO MONDAY. THIS ALSO SEEMS REASONABLE...BUT FELT IT WAS A
BIT EARLY TO WARRANT LIKELY POPS...SO STAYED WITH HIGH CHANCE FOR
NOW. OTHERWISE...CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS TEMPS AND POPS FOR
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MEAN UPPER TROF HOLDS 
OVER THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION THROUGH APPROXIMATELY 
MID WEEK KEEPING UNSETTLED WEATHER IN PLACE WITH POSSIBILITY OF 
SCATTERED CONVECTION. BY THURSDAY UPPER RIDGING WILL HAVE 
STRENGTHENED SUFFICIENTLY TO LIMIT CONVECTION TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
WITH MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA RAIN FREE. MAINTAINED THIS LOOK TO 
THE FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY BUT BY SATURDAY ANOTHER UPPER TROF DROPS 
THROUGH THE NORTH CENTRAL STATES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. PUSHING 
A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. INTRODUCED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP AREA WIDE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO ACCOUNT FOR A 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER CHANCE FOR A COOLING SHOWER AT THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF 
THE FORECAST.

AT SOME POINT DURING THE TAF PERIOD. HOWEVER...WITH THE LACK OF A

TIMING OF CONVECTION AT EACH TAF SITE WILL BE DIFFICULT. THUS...WILL 
COVER THE CONVECTIVE SCENARIO WITH A MENTION OF VCTS FOR SEVERAL 
HOURS IN THE AFTERNOON AT ALL THREE TAF SITES. OTHERWISE...VFR 
CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED (OUTSIDE OF TSTORMS) 
THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 170705
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT SAT JUL 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS NOT EXPECTED TO MAKE MUCH FURTHER PROGRESS SOUTHWARD 
TODAY...WITH THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN TRIGGERS FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. THUS... 
DO NOT FEEL CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO MAINTAIN THE CURRENT FORECAST OF 
CATEGORICAL POPS...ESPECIALLY SINCE CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY THIS MORNING 
HAS BEEN SPARSE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL LOWER POPS BACK 
INTO THE LIKELY CATEGORY AREAWIDE. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL THAT THE 
UPPER TROUGH HAS ERODED THE MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION THAT HAS 
BEEN OBSERVED DURING THE PAST FEW DAYS...BUT OVERALL INSTABILITY 
APPEARS TO BE LESS TODAY THAN YESTERDAY WITH WEAKER LAPSE RATES. 
EXPECT CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TO GRADUALLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET WITH 
THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS AND MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD BACK 
INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS BY MID WEEK AND PERSIST THROUGH THE 
BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM. THIS WILL RESULT IN A RETURN TO ABOVE 
CLIMO TEMPS AND A GENERAL SUPPRESSION OF DIURNAL CONVECTION. IN THE 
MEANTIME...A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGHS WILL KEEP THINGS 
POTENTIALLY UNSETTLED THROUGH THE EARLY PORTION OF THE UPCOMING
WORK WEEK. CONTINUED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR THESE
PERIODS. FOR TEMPS...DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX
GUIDANCE. OVERALL...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING
GRIDS/FORECAST.

FOR THE ENTIRE NIGHT...WITH A THIN RIBBON OF LOW LIKELY POPS ACROSS

ELSEWHERE...RANGING FROM 50 PERCENT NORTH TO 35 PERCENT SOUTH.

FALL BELOW LIKELY BY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. THIS IS DUE TO WEAK 
FRONT MOVING NORTH OR DISSIPATING...AND WEAK RIDGING ALOFT. ALTHOUGH 
I LIKED THE DRIER LOOK OF THE NAM MODEL FOR SUNDAY...BOTH GFS AND 
ECMWF SUPPORT AT LEAST HIGH CHANCE POPS SUNDAY. THUS...MADE LITTLE 
IF ANY CHANGES TO POPS FOR SUNDAY FOR NOW. ADDED PATCHY LATE NIGHT 
FOG FOR BOTH NIGHTS. OTHERWISE...CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS FOR 
MAX AND MIN TEMPS.

ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MIDWEST WHILE DRAGGING A COOL 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. STAYED WITH THE SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS 
FOR CONVECTION WITH SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY PRESSING A LITTLE CLOSER TO 
THE FORECAST AREA. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE EXPANDS AGAIN ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY KEEPING THUNDER 
SUPPRESSED. CONVECTION SHOULD MAINLY BE LIMITED TO HIGHER TERRAIN 
FEATURES DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. GENERALLY STAYED JUST 
UNDER MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS.

.DISCUSSION...RELATIVELY CLOUD AND FOG FREE START TO THE DAY THIS

WEAKENED SLIGHTLY FROM YESTERDAY...WITH LITTLE NEGATIVE CAPE TO 
OVERCOME.  MODIFIED SOUNDINGS SHOW MODERATE INSTABILY FOR REACHING 
80S TO MID 90S...WITH AROUND 1200 J/KG (RNK) TO 2500 J/KG (OHX).
FREEZING LEVEL REMAINS EXTREMELY HIGH (GREATER THAN 16000 FT) AS 
DOES WET BULB ZERO HEIGHT (GREATER THAN 13000 FT).  MAY SEE A SLIGHT 
INVERTED-V LOOK TO SOUNDINGS THIS AFTERNOON...WITH SOME MIXING IN 
THE LOWER LEVELS...SO MAIN THREAT WOULD APPEAR TO BE GUSTY DOWNBURST 
WINDS.  ISOLATED TO SCATTERED AFTERNOON CONVECTION EXPECTED...WITH
BEST COVERAGE IN HIGHER TERRAIN.

NOT MUCH UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT NOTED...UNTIL UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
DEEPENS LATER TONIGHT AND SATURDAY.  STORM MOTION LOOKS ON THE SLOW 
SIDE (SE AT 10 MPH OR SO)...WITH HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES
SO SOME BRIEF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS COULD OCCUR.

FORECAST GRIDS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK...SO AT THIS POINT PLAN TO JUST 
MONITOR HOURLY CONDITIONS...AND REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING FROM THE 
ZFP.

337 AM EDT THU JUL 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE CONTINUES ACROSS THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES AND TENNESSEE
VALLEY EARLY THIS MORNING. SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR WITH EARLY
MORNING TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 60S TO THE MID 70S. AIR MASS DRIER
THAN WEDNESDAYS WITH ONLY A FEW LOCATIONS WITH FOG. LITTLE CHANCE
OF SHOWERS OR THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST AREA
AS PATTERN HAS NOT CHANGED FROM WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL RISE A
FEW MORE DEGREES TODAY. ALSO UPPER TROUGH ALONG EAST COAST IS
TRAPPING SOME MOISTURE ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS WHERE A
FEW SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP WITH DAYTIME HEATING. SKIES AGAIN MOSTLY
CLEAR TONIGHT WITH LOWS NEAR NORMAL IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO PATTERN 
AND EXTENDED FORECAST. BERMUDA HIGH RIDGE AXIS BUILDS SLOWLY WEST 
INTO SE U.S. AND N GLFMEX THROUGH PERIOD. WEAK UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG 
TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BY FRIDAY EVENING...WITH LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE PROGGED BY MODELS TO INCREASE AS PWAT VALUES EXPECTED TO BE 
AROUND TWO INCHES BY SATURDAY. CONVECTION SHOULD BECOME WIDESPREAD 
ACROSS THE AREA BY EARLY SATURDAY. THE TROF WEAKENS AND DRIFTS INTO 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ALOFT NEXT 
WEEK. SHRA/TSRA WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING PULSE 
STORMS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY WAIN BY MID WEEK AS LAYER BECOMES 
INCREASINGLY DRY.

WENT SLIGHTLY ABOVE GUIDANCE ON TEMPS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIODS 
KEEPING WITH THIS SEASONS TREND.

ALOFT TODAY.

THURSDAY. TROF DEVELOPS OVER TN RVR VLY POISED BETWEEN LARGE FOUR 
CORNERS AND ATLANTIC HIGH PRESSURE CELLS. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS AND ENHANCED...MAINLY DIURNAL PCPN CHANCES.

956 
FXUS64 KMRX 131836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EDT TUE JUL 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ABRUPT END TO CONVECTION 
ANTICIPATED EARLY IN THE FIRST PERIOD AS UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGS 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHAIN REGION. MUCH DRIER AIR AT ALL 
LEVELS FOLLOWS TROUGH AXIS AS FLOW BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR TOMORROW RESULING IN
GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE
FROM MAV GUIDANCE AS THEY APPEAR REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...WHILE A MIDLEVEL 
RIDGE WILL EXTEND FROM THE SOUTHERN MS VALLEY ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. 
SUBSIDENCE BENEATH THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL STRENGTHEN A MIDLEVEL 
INVERSION AND SUPPRESS CONVECTION ON THURSDAY. HIGHS WILL REACH THE 
LOWER TO MID 90S IN MOST SPOTS.

THE UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN MS VALLEY REGION 
RETROGRADES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND SOUTHERN ROCKIES. BETWEEN 
THIS RIDGE AND THE BERMUDA HIGH...A TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE OHIO AND 
TN VALLEYS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. MODELS ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THIS GENERAL PATTERN AND HAVE SHOWN GOOD RUN-TO-RUN 
CONTINUITY. THOUGH THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT WILL STALL WELL TO 
OUR NORTH...A MOIST AND UNSTALBE AIR MASS UNDER WEAK DIFFLUENCE 
ALOFT WILL ENHANCE THE CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH 
DAY. WILL INCREASE POPS A BIT BOTH DAYS...BUT WILL KEEP IN THE 
CHANCE RANGE FOR NOW. CLOUD COVER SHOULD HOLD HIGH TEMPS BACK TO THE 
80S ON SATURDAY.

THE MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE ON THEIR SOLUTIONS FOR THE BEGINNING OF 
NEXT WEEK...WITH CONSIDERABLE SPREAD AMONG THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. 
THUS CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON THE DETAILS OF THE FORECAST. GENERALLY 
SPEAKING...THE PATTERN BECOMES SLIGHTLY MORE PROGRESSIVE ON SUNDAY 
AS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS RIDGE SHIFTS SLOWLY TOWARD THE EAST AND THE 
UPPER TROUGH MOVES OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST. THIS PATTERN APPEARS 
FAVORABLE FOR MCS DEVELOPMENT OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...AND WITH A 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...THE REMANTS OF THESE COULD AFFECT OUR AREA 
EACH DAY. WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS EACH DAY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
EACH NIGHT...WITH TEMPS ABOVE NORMAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  92  69  94  73 /  30  10   0  10  10

WILL COOL TO NEAR NORMAL.

FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING BUT A FEW SHOWERS LINGER ACROSS 
EASTERN SECTIONS. RIDGING ALOFT OVER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SPREADS EAST 
WITH CLEARING SKIES AND WARMING TEMPERATURES. HIGHS SHOULD REBOUND 
TO THE MID 80S NORTH TO LOWER TO MID 90S SOUTH. MOSTLY CLEAR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THURSDAY UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG WITH TEMPERATURES 
A FEW DEGREES WARMER. THURSDAY NIGHT MODELS HINT THAT EASTERLY FLOW 
MAY BRING SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO REGION. 
FRIDAY RIDGE RETROGRADES TO THE WEST AND TROUGH MOVES TOWARD TN 
VALLEY. MOISTURE INCREASE WILL BRING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. NEW TROUGH DEVELOPS ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY WITH MORE ROUNDS OF CONVECTION AND 
COOLER TEMPERATURES. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LOOKS 
TO BE SATURDAY. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS TO BUILD AGAIN MONDAY BUT 
STILL KEPT CHANCE OF CONVECTION AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY STILL MOVING 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE REGION.

084 
FXUS64 KMRX 121835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT MON JUL 12 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODELS AND SREF GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT THE NEXT IN A SERIES OF SHORT WAVE TROUGHS WILL APPROACH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON TUESDAY...THIS ONE EVEN MORE 
AMPLIFIED THAN ITS PREDECESSORS. THIS FEATURE WILL POTENTIALLY 
PRODUCE ANOTHER ROUND OF ORGANIZED CONVECTION...MAINLY DURING THE 
SECOND PERIOD. HAVE BUMPED UP POPS LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD AND INTO 
THE SECOND PERIOD IN ANTICIPATION OF THIS EVENT. EXTRAORDINARILY 
HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES DEPICTED BY FORECAST SOUNDINGS (UP TO 
AND EXCEEDING 2.3 INCHES) SUGGEST THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAIN...BUT EXACT LOCATION UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME. CONFIDENCE ALSO 
LOW ON MAX TEMPS FOR TUESDAY AS THEY WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON THE 
DEGREE OF CLEARING...IF ANY. DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV GUIDANCE 
DUE TO UNCERTAINTY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
PRECIP SHOULD BEGIN TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS PASSES THROUGH THE AREA AND A 
DEVELOPING NORTHWEST FLOW ADVECTS DRIER AIR ALOFT. WILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY POPS BEFORE 06Z...FOLLOWED BY CHANCE TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS AFTER. MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE 
TROUGH AXIS WILL BE EAST OF OUR AREA AROUND 12Z WED...WITH A RIDGE 
BUILDING THROUGH THE DAY.

A LARGE RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL EXTEND 
NORTHEAST...KEEPING THE TN VALLEY DRY WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT. HIGHS WILL CREEP BACK UP TOWARD THE MID 90S FOR MUCH OF THE 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN/RETROGRADES ON 
FRIDAY AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH/COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE GRT 
LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. THE RESULTING LARGE-SCALE PATTERN IS A WEAK 
TROUGH AND A STALLED FRONT OVER THE TN/OHIO VALLEYS THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...SANDWICHED BETWEEN THE BERMUDA HIGH TO THE EAST AND THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS RIDGE TO THE WEST. THIS BLOCKING PATTERN SHOULD 
PROVIDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND AND INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.


&&

242 PM EDT SUN JUL 11 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SOME CONVECTION TRYING TO

LATER TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...WITH MOST AREAS SEEING AT LEAST SOME

MONDAY. SOME OF THESE THUNDERSTORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE 
MONDAY...ESPECIALLY IF ENOUGH SUN FOR SIGNIFICANT HEATING.  WILL 
BUMP SOME MAV TEMPS UP A BIT FOR HIGHS MONDAY...USING MORE OF A 
MAV/MET BLEND.      


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LONG TERM WILL BEGIN WITH 
THE APPROACH OF AN UNSEASONABLY AMPLIFIED SHORT WAVE TROUGH WHICH 
WILL KEEP THINGS UNSETTLED THROUGH MID WEEK PER MODEL AND SREF 
CONSENSUS. HAVE BUMPED UP POPS SLIGHTLY FOR TUESDAY ESPECIALLY ALONG 
THE PLATEAU. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM WILL SEE THE RE-ESTABLISHMENT OF 
UPPER RIDGING OVER MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN CONUS. MODELS DISAGREE ON 
THE CONFIGURATION OF THE UPPER RIDGE WITH ECMWF PLACING THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION ON THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE...IN A MORE 
FAVORABLE LOCATION FOR MCS ACTIVITY. THE GFS HAS THE RIDGE MORE OR 
LESS SPRAWLED UNIFORMLY ACROSS THE REGION. THE GFS SOLUTION HAS THE 
SUPPORT OF THE THE GEFS ENSEMBLES...AND THUS TENDED TO FOLLOW ITS 
SOLUTION...SUGGESTING MAINLY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION WITH
ACTIVITY DISSIPATING OVERNIGHT. WITH THIS IN MIND...REMOVED POPS IN
A FEW OF THE OVERNIGHT PERIODS. ALSO TENDED TO GO ON THE WARM SIDE
OF MEX GUIDANCE ESPECIALLY FOR MID TO LATE LONG TERM.

DUE TO THE DRY AIR MASS AND RELATIVELY DRY GROUND.

WAVE IS LOW AND IS LIKELY CONVECTIVELY INDUCED.

AS A UPPER TROUGH  MOVES ACROSS THE NORTHERN-CENTRAL PLAINS 
WEDNESDAY...UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS OVER THE SOUTH...BUT NOT ENOUGH 
TO LIMIT DIURNAL CONVECTION. AS NORTHERN UNITED STATES UPPER TROUGH 
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES BY FRIDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
SOUTH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. CONFIDENCE 
ON TIMING AND LOCATION OF FRONT LOW...BUT WILL MAINTAIN DIURNAL 
CONVECTION THROUGH FRIDAY.

THROUGH MUCH OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK WITH THE ANTICIPATION THAT 
PRECIP WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL IN NATURE. UPPER RIDGE BECOMES 
RE-ESTABLISHED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE IN THE 
LONG TERM RESULTING IN A REDUCTION OF PRECIP CHANCES. FOR TEMPS... 
WHICH ARE PROJECTED TO GENERALLY REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM...DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART.

AND MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE PERIOD. UPPER RIDGE SUPPRESSES SOUTH

SHEAR...LAPSE RATES AND LIFT VERY MINIMAL. AIRMASS SHOULD 
DESTABILIZE NICELY BY THIS AFTN. THE LACK OF TRIGGERS REMAINS THE 
FLY IN THE OINTMENT PERTAINING TO TIMING AND EXTENT OF CONVECTION 
TODAY AND TONIGHT. OLD BOUNDARIES AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT ALONG THE 
PLATEAU SHOULD SEE THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTIVE INITIATION. BEYOND 
THAT. WEAK STEERING FLOW MAY KEEP DECENT CHANCE GOING ALONG LOW 
LEVEL BOUNDARY THROUGH TONIGHT FOR MOST AREAS...ESPECIALLY NE. MOS 
TEMP GUIDANCE DOWN CONSIDERABLY DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND QUICK FALL IN 
LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES THIS AFTN. WILL LEAN ABOVE MOS NUMBERS IN 
THIS DRY AIRMASS. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FOR SATURDAY...WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA IN THE MORNING. WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THE EASTERN COUNTIES...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
AFTERNOON STORMS. MOST LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN DRY.

FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL WITH 
WEAK SURFACE RIDGING. WILL CONTINUE DRY FORECAST WITH MORE SEASONAL 
TEMPERATURES.

FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY RETURNS. 
GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...BUT 
TIMING OF SYSTEM DIFFERENT. WILL CALL FOR A RETURN OF MAINLY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WITH MAIN FORCING BEING TERRAIN. 

FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...UPPER RIDGING STRENGTHENS SO DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WILL LESSEN...BUT WILL MAINTAIN SLIGHT POPS FOR THE 
VALLEY AND CHANCE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

739 
FXUS64 KMRX 081855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT THU JUL 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL BREAK DOWN 
OVER THE AREA...ALLOWING A COLD FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE NORTH AND 
NORTHWEST.  HIGH CLOUDS WILL START TO INCREASE TONIGHT...THEN 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY. 
WILL GO LIKELY POPS FOR NORTHWEST ZONES...CHANCE SOUTHEAST.  TEMPS 
SHOULD BE LOWER FRIDAY GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUDS/PRECIP.  WILL GENERALLY 
NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.  


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES IN THE OFFING AS EASTERN CONUS UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND 
WEAK TROUGH TRANSLATES THROUGH THE AREA. TROUGH WILL PUSH WEAK COLD 
FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY FRIDAY NIGHT. 
SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED TO ACCOMPANY FRONT BUT PREVAILING DRY 
CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY PRECLUDE WIDESPREAD COVERAGE OF SIGNIFICANT QPF. 
DRY PERIOD FOLLOWS THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE WEEKEND BEFORE UPPER 
FLOW TRANSITIONS INTO A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW BY EARLY IN THE WORK 
WEEK. THIS WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ADVECTION INTO THE AREA PER MODEL 
CONSENSUS. HAVE CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS THROUGH MUCH 
OF THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. FOR TEMPS... GENERALLY DID 
NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

018 
FXUS64 KMRX 080731
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT THU JUL 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EXCESSIVE HEAT WILL BE THE STORY 
OF THE DAY ONCE AGAIN WITH RIDGING HOLDING ON ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE CENTRAL U.S. UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED 
COOL FRONT WILL SLOWLY APPROACH THE MID SOUTH LATER TODAY AND 
TONIGHT BUT NOT SOON ENOUGH TO BRING ANY REASONABLE CHANCE FOR RAIN. 
LATE TONIGHT THERE MAY BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM ON THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. HOWEVER...A MUCH 
BETTER CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE IN PLACE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS THE 
UPPER TROF PROGRESSES THROUGH THE EASTERN U.S. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO 
MOS GUIDANCE WHICH FEATURES HIGH TEMPERATURES AROUND 10 DEGREES 
ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WELCOME CHANGE TO THE HOT 
AND DRY PATTERN WILL FINALLY ARRIVE ON FRIDAY. AN UPPER TROUGH AND 
SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTHWEST...WHICH SHOULD 
BRING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO MOST OF THE AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THE MOISTURE FEED AHEAD OF THE FRONT IS 
NOT IMPRESSIVE WITH THE RIDGE SUPPRESSED TO OUR SOUTH...THERE IS 
DECENT LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER JET STREAK AND THE AMPLIFYING 
MIDLEVEL TROUGH. MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT...SO 
CONFIDENCE IS HIGH ENOUGH TO RAISE POPS TO LIKELY EVERYWHERE FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THE PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT OCCURS SATURDAY MORNING WITH A 
DRY NORTHWEST FLOW FOLLOWING...THOUGH ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
PASSES BY DURING THE DAY. WILL HAVE JUST A SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POP 
ON SATURDAY.

A WEAK RIDGE AND A NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PROVIDE A DRY DAY ON 
SUNDAY. ON MONDAY THE BERMUDA HIGH BECOMES MORE DOMINANT WHILE A 
TROUGH TRACKS ACROSS THE MIDWEST...PROVIDING A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW OF 
MOISTURE FOR OUR AREA. MAINLY DIURNAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED FOR MONDAY...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR MORE ORGANIZED PRECIP 
TUESDAY WITH THE APPROACH OF THE UPPER TROUGH. HOWEVER THE MODELS 
DIVERGE IN THEIR SOLUTIONS DURING THIS TIME FRAME...SO CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION CHANCE POPS AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             99  73  91  72  88 /   0  10  50  60  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  98  70  87  71  86 /   0  10  60  60  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       98  71  84  69  86 /  10  10  60  60  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              96  65  87  67  84 /   0  10  60  60  20

553 
FXUS64 KMRX 071841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EDT WED JUL 7 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM.  WITH LIMITED MOISTURE...SHOULD 
REMAIN DRY WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR TO CLEAR SKY.  ANOTHER HOT AFTERNOON 
IN STORE FOR THURSDAY...BUT WITH RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES EXPECTED 
TO REMAIN ON THE LOW SIDE...HEAT INDEX VALUES SHOULD STAY BELOW HEAT 
ADVISORY CRITERIA.  JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...WHICH LOOK 
REASONABLE OVERALL.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE START OF 
THIS PERIOD THE UPPER RIDGE IS STILL OVER THE AREA...ALTHOUGH THE 
LOW OFF THE CAROLINA COAST HAS STARTED TO EAT AWAY AT THE EASTERN 
PARTS OF THE RIDGE AND A TROUGH IS WORKING ITS WAY THROUGH THE 
PLAINS THAT LIMITS THE WESTWARD EXTENT OF THE RIDGE.  BY SATURDAY 
MORNING THE PLAINS TROUGH HAS MOVED EAST AND HAS PRETTY WELL PUSHED 
THE RIDGE SOUTHWARD...OUT OF THE AREA.  A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE AREA AS WELL WITH THIS TROUGH.  IT WILL BE APPROACHING 
ON FRIDAY...EXPECTED TO SLIDE THROUGH ON SATURDAY...AND BE JUST 
SOUTH OF THE AREA BY SUNDAY.  GOING WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR 
SUNDAY...ALTHOUGH MODELS DON'T REALLY DRY OUT THE AIR MASS THAT 
MUCH.  BY MONDAY THE RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SURFACE 
RIDGE IS ALREADY STARTING...SO WILL GET POPS STARTED ON MONDAY IN 
THE WESTERN AREAS AND IN THE HIGH TERRAIN.  


&&

192 
FXUS64 KMRX 070701
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT WED JUL 7 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MASSIVE RIDGE WILL REMAIN ACROSS 
THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE. SUBSIDENCE 
AND NEARLY FULL SUNSHINE SHOULD PUSH HIGH TEMPERATURES ACROSS MUCH 
OF THE REGION INTO THE MID AND UPPER 90S TODAY. ANOTHER MILD NIGHT 
IS IN STORE WITH LOWS NEAR 70 EXCEPT ACROSS PARTS OF NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WELL AS HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS 
INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH 
CAROLINA. IN THESE AREAS MINS WILL BE A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES 
COOLER.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ONE MORE HOT AND DRY DAY IS 
EXPECTED THURSDAY BEFORE A CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN BRINGS SOME 
RELIEF ON FRIDAY. THE MIDLEVEL RIDGE WILL BE DRIFTING SOUTHWARD 
ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH HIGH TEMPS REACHING THE MID TO 
UPPER 90S IN MOST SPOTS THURSDAY. RECORD HIGH TEMPS AT THE BIG THREE 
SITES ARE ALL OVER 100...SO IT SEEMS UNLIKELY THAT THEY WILL BE 
BROKEN. THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN ON FRIDAY AS A CLOSED LOW OFF THE 
ATLANTIC COAST BEGINS TO MERGE WITH A TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE 
NORTHWEST. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF PRECIP 
ASSOCIATED WITH A COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL RAISE 
POPS TO A HIGH CHANCE THESE PERIODS. 

MODELS INDICATE THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL HAVE ENOUGH PUSH TO BRING A 
COOLER AIR MASS INTO THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. LOW LEVEL RIDGING 
WILL CROSS THE AREA ON SUNDAY...THEN SHIFT TO OUR EAST BY MONDAY. A 
MOST SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW SHOULD SUPPLY ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR 
DIURNAL SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             97  70  98  72  93 /   0   0  10  10  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  96  70  97  71  91 /   0   0  10  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       97  70  96  71  89 /   0   0  10  10  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              95  65  96  65  90 /   0   0  10  10  40

822 
FXUS64 KMRX 070132
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT TUE JUL 6 2010

.FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RIDGING SURFACE ALOFT WILL 
CONTINUE PRODUCING DRY AND HOT CONDITIONS. MAIN CONCERN IS DROUGHT 
CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. DUE TO THE DRY GROUND...HAVE 
LOWERED AFTERNOON MOS DEWPOINTS ABOUT 3-5 DEGREES FOR WEDNESDAY. 
WENT CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPERATURES.

LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...NO CHANGE TO THE 
PATTERN FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO DOMINATE THE REGION...SO SLIGHTLY HOTTER FOR THURSDAY. ADJUSTED 
AFTERNOON DEW POINT TEMPS DOWN FOR THURSDAY AS GOOD MIXING IS 
EXPECTED...AND LOWERED DEW POINTS AGAIN SLIGHTLY ON FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON. 

PATTERN STARTS TO CHANGE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE CENTRAL ATLANTIC WILL BE DRIFTING 
WESTWARD TO JUST OFF COASTAL CAROLINAS...WHILE AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
OF LOW PRESSURE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION FRIDAY. 
THIS TROUGH WILL CAUSE ANY REMNANTS OF THE UPPER LOW TO LIFT QUICKLY 
NE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH OUR REGION BY SATURDAY MORNING...BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ADVECTION REALLY SEEMS TO BE LACKING IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...AS 
GULF MOISTURE LOOKS CUT OFF UNTIL THE MIDDLE TO NEXT WEEK. THUS...
I HESITATED TO INCREASE POPS JUST YET...ALTHO SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS 
WERE MADE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT TO STAY IN 
TOLERANCE WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES. 

NET RESULT OF THESE CHANGES WILL CERTAINLY BE TO WEAKEN THE STRONG 
UPPER RIDGE...A LITTLE MORE CLOUDINESS...AND SOME ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED TSRA. 06/00Z GFSX MOS MAXES FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK REFLECTED COOLER TEMPS...WITH 12Z MOS TRENDING UP MAXES A 
FEW DEGREES. 

AFTER THE WEAK FRONTAL PASSAGE...I PREFERRED THE DRIER LOOK OF THE 
ECMWF MODEL...SO KEPT POPS AT MINIMAL VALUES (BELOW GFSX MOS) FOR 
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. TEMPS SHOULD CREEP BACK UP INTO THE 80S TO 
AT LEAST LOWER 90S BY TUESDAY...IF ECMWF IS INDEED CORRECT IN 
BUILDING BACK THE UPPER RIDGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  97  71  98  73 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  96  70  97  72 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  96  70  97  70 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  95  64  96  66 /   0   0   0  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

WERE MADE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT TO STAY IN 
TOLERANCE WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES. 

NET RESULT OF THESE CHANGES WILL CERTAINLY BE TO WEAKEN THE STRONG 
UPPER RIDGE...A LITTLE MORE CLOUDINESS...AND SOME ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED TSRA. 06/00Z GFSX MOS MAXES FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK REFLECTED COOLER TEMPS...WITH 12Z MOS TRENDING UP MAXES A 
FEW DEGREES. 

AFTER THE WEAK FRONTAL PASSAGE...I PREFERRED THE DRIER LOOK OF THE 
ECMWF MODEL...SO KEPT POPS AT MINIMAL VALUES (BELOW GFSX MOS) FOR 
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. TEMPS SHOULD CREEP BACK UP INTO THE 80S TO 
AT LEAST LOWER 90S BY TUESDAY...IF ECMWF IS INDEED CORRECT IN 
BUILDING BACK THE UPPER RIDGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  97  71  98  73 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  96  70  97  72 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  96  70  97  70 /   0   0   0  10  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT TUE JUL 6 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A STRONG RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER ACROSS THE 
REGION THROUGH THURSDAY. THE VERTICALLY STACKED RIDGE WILL BE 
CENTERED OVER VIRGINIA TODAY...AND MAKE A SLOW WESTWARD DRIFT 
THROUGH THURSDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN A CONTINUED WARMING 
TREND...WITH UPPER 90S LIKELY IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY 
BY THURSDAY. THE RIDGE DOES BEGIN TO GET PINCHED OFF BETWEEN A 
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS AND A RETROGRADING LOW OFF THE 
CAROLINA COAST...BUT SUBSIDENCE AND A LACK OF MOISTURE WILL MEAN OUR 
HOT DRY SPELL WILL PERSIST THROUGH THURSDAY. 

EXPECT THAT A RECORD HIGH WILL BE SET TODAY AT TRI...AS THE RECORD 
IS ONLY 93...SET IN 1993. TEMPS WILL APPROACH RECORD HIGHS FOR THE 
NEXT THREE DAYS AT TYS AND CHA BUT APPEAR TO BE SAFE BY A COUPLE 
DEGREES.

RECORD HIGHS FOR TODAY...WEDNESDAY...AND THURSDAY...
TRI...93...97...100
TYS...96...98...101
CHA...98...101...104

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
BASICALLY STAYED WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH ALLOWS FOR THE
EVENTUAL WEAKENING OF THE MASSIVE EASTERN STATES RIDGE BY THE
WEEKEND. PROGS INDICATE AN UPPER TROF WILL MOVE INTO THE
NORTHEASTERN U.S. AND THE NORTHERLY COMPONENT BEHIND THIS FEATURE
WILL PULL COOLER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. STAYED
WITH LOW CHANCE POPS MAINLY ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS THE FRONT
WORKS ITS WAY SLOWLY SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT MON JUL 5 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT TUESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO

NIGHT AND ANOTHER DAY OF HOT...SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS.  
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO TREND SLIGHTLY WARMER WITH HIGHS ON

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG 
FOR AT LEAST INTO EARLY FRIDAY...THEN A TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACHING OUR 
REGION BY SATURDAY. HATE TO ADVERTISE MUCH RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM AND 
NOT BE ABLE TO DELIVER...SO KEPT POPS AT A MINIMUM FOR NOW (20-30 
PERCENT). THE DRY BOUNDARY LAYER AND BUILDING RAINFALL DEFICITS FOR 
THE YEAR WILL NEED TO BE OVERCOME BY SOME DECENT MOISTURE ADVECTION 
OR RAIN CHANCES DON'T LOOK THAT PROMISING. 

AFTER THIS WEAK SYSTEM...THE GFS CONTINUES A THREAT OF CONVECTION 
FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WHICH I WOULD QUESTION AT THIS POINT. I 
PREFER THE DRIER LOOK OF THE ECMWF...BUT OFFICES TO MY WEST AND 
SOUTH ARE TRENDING TOWARD THE WETTER GFS SOLUTION. THUS...CONTINUED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SUNDAY AND ALSO FOR WRN AND SRN FRINGES ON MONDAY.

I DID LOWER MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY IN LINE 
WITH LATEST GFSX MOS.

FXUS64 KMRX 031849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT SAT JUL 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...A WEAK SHORT-WAVE WAS ACROSS
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH SURFACE CONVERGENCE NOTED BY LAPS OVER
MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND PLATEAU COUNTIES. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM WERE DEVELOPING NEAR BNA. LAPS SHOWS BEST
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY ACROSS THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. WILL INCLUDE
A SMALL POP OVER THE PLATEAU FOR EARLY THIS EVENING.

FOR TONIGHT...WEAK DISTURBANCE MOVES WEST AND NORTH. AFTER LOSS OF
DAYTIME HEATING ISOLATED SHOWER OR TWO WILL DISSIPATE WITH MOSTLY
CLEAR SKY.

FOR WEDNESDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING WILL DOMINATE SUPPRESSING
CLOUD DEVELOPMENT. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WILL REMAIN IN A QUIET 
WEATHER PATTERN WITH STRONG HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR MUCH OF THE 
EXTENDED.  AS A RESULT...WILL CONTINUE WITH HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS 
THROUGH AT LEAST MID WEEK.  THERE CONTINUES TO BE SOME DISAGREEMENT 
IN THE MODELS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP 
FORECAST TRENDED CLOSER TO THE ECMWF WITH THE HIGH MAINTAINING 
CONTROL...FOR A PERSISTENT HOT AND DRY FORECAST.  MODELS BRING A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE AREA AROUND THE SATURDAY TIME FRAME.  THE 
FRONT SHOULD BE WEAKENING AS IT APPROACHES AND HAVE INTRODUCED LOW 
POPS FOR NOW.

088 
FXUS64 KMRX 030735
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT SAT JUL 3 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A STRONG AND DEEP HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE TN 
VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT. AN UPSLOPE FLOW IN THE LOW LEVELS IS 
GENERATING SOME CLOUDS ALONG AND EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS DUE TO THE 
POSITION OF THE SURFACE HIGH OVER VIRGINIA...WITH A FEW CLOUDS 
SPILLING OVER INTO THE VALLEY. HOWEVER THESE CLOUDS SHOULD BE OF 
LITTLE CONSEQUENCE TO THE SENSIBLE WEATHER EXCEPT IN SW NC WHERE 
TEMPS MAY BE HELD BACK A BIT BY THE CLOUDS. HIGHS IN MOST SPOTS 
SHOULD REACH THE MID TO UPPER 80S...EXCEPT FOR SOME 70S TO LOWER 80S 
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND IN SW NC. AS THE SURFACE HIGH DRIFTS TO THE 
SOUTH OVER THE CAROLINAS TONIGHT...THE UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD DECREASE 
AND REDUCE CLOUD COVER IN SW NC. FORECAST LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE IN 
THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AN INVERTED TROUGH 
APPROACHES THE REGION BY FRIDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON 
TIMING...WILL GO WITH PERSISTENCE AND KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW.  
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR THE PERIOD.  
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

871 
FXUS64 KMRX 021900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI JUL 2 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
EASTERN GREAT LAKES REGION...WITH A WEAK TROUGH LOCATED GENERALLY 
ALONG THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NAM MODEL INDICATES THAT THIS 
SURFACE TROUGH MAY HELP TO TRIGGER A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS THIS 
EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWEST NC AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SO WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THESE AREAS. OTHERWISE... 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...AS MODEL SOUNDINGS 
REVEAL A MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION AND VERY DRY AIR WHICH SHOULD 
INHIBIT ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT WILL GENERALLY 
FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH TEMPS RISING A FEW DEGREES HIGHER 
EACH DAY AND NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE ANCHORED 
OVER THE REGION WILL KEEP US DRY AND HOT FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. 
MODELS DIVERGE AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME WITH A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY APPROACHING THE AREA. FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
PERSISTENCE AND THE DRY ECMWF MODEL...WILL NOT MENTION PRECIP AT 
THIS TIME. GUIDANCE NUMBERS REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHWEST NC...EXTREME SOUTHEAST TN AND THE SMOKY

FXUS64 KMRX 020710
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT FRI JUL 2 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HUGE CENTRAL NORTH AMERICAN RIDGE 
TO WEST IS KEEPING ALEX MOISTURE WEST AND SOUTH OF US. UPPER TROF 
OVER EASTERN NOAM IS DIGGING SOUTH INTO DEEP SOUTHEASTERN US. 
SURFACE STREAMLINES COMING FROM NORTHEASTERN SURFACE HIGH, GIVING US 
A DRY NORTHEAS FLOW. SOME ORTHOGRAPHIC SHOWERS EARLIER OVER THE 
EXTREME SOUTHERN NC MOUNTAINS HAVE MOVED ON AND DISSIPATED. THIS 
SITUATION WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD...OVERNIGHT. 
EXPECT SOME SOLAR POWERED CU LATE THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON. MAY 
PERSIST UNTIL AROUND SUNSET. WILL NOT RULE A STRAY, VERY LIGHT 
SHOWER, OR EVEN VIRGA OVER THE CENTRAL (HIGHEST) MOUNTAINS ALONG THE 
NC LINE SO HAVE ADDED A 6-12% POP THERE BUT IS NOT MENTIONED IN 
ZONES. SOME THIN GAUZY CIRRUS OR ALTOSTRATUS/ALTOCU MAY FORM OR WAFT 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND SO HAVE DROPPED MAX TEMPS A DEGREE, 
AND RAISED THE A DEGREE TONIGHT. MORE DEWPOINTS WILL BEGIN A SLOW 
RISE TONIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH DRIFT EAST AND STREAMLINES MOVE OUT 
SLIGHTLY OVER ATLANTIC, BRINGING MORE MOIST AIR INTO REGION.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE
REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. A FRONT
APPROACHES THE REGION BY THURSDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON
TIMING...WILL GO WITH PERSISTENCE AND KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW.
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR SATURDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH AT LEAST 
TUESDAY. THEREFORE...PERSISTENCE WAY TO GO WITH HOT...DRY AND 
TRANQUIL WEATHER. MODELS DIVERGE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED 
AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW. FOR NOW...WILL LEAN TOWARD CONTINUING HIGH

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY NOW SOUTH OF
THE FORECAST AREA AS PER 05Z SURFACE ANALYSIS. BOUNDARY ANALYZED
TO BE EXTENDING WEST TO EAST FROM SOUTH OF MSL TO JUST NORTH OF
CULLMAN ALABAMA...THEN TO AROUND RMG AND THEN ACROSS NORTH GEORGIA.
LATEST IR SATELLITE IMAGE AT 06Z CONTINUES TO SHOW NORTH END OF
MID-HIGH CLOUD BAND STILL ACROSS NORTH ALABAMA...AND SLOWLY
TRENDING SLIGHTLY SOUTHWARD. WILL CONTINUE WITH MOSTLY SUNNY
FORECAST ACROSS THE AREA TODAY...AND HAVE EVEN TRENDED DOWNWARD THE
CLOUD CONDITIONS IN GRIDS FOR TODAY. 

TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY GOOD AS PER GOING FORECAST AND WILL CONTINUE
WITH BASIC FORECAST TRENDS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...VERY STRONG UPPER RIDGE
STILL LOOKS TO DOMINATE OUR REGION INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. SURFACE
RIDGE LOCATION WILL NOT ALLOW ANY RETURN OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
UNTIL WEDNESDAY OR LATER. 

GFS AND ITS ENSEMBLE BREAK UPPER RIDGE DOWN BY LATE NEXT WEEK...
AS A TROUGH MOVES ACROSS GREAT LAKES REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO
THURSDAY. HOWEVER...ECMWF SHOWS UPPER RIDGE HOLDING STRONG...
SO KEPT OUR DRY FORECAST INTACT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. PROLONGED
PERIOD OF LITTLE WIDESPREAD RAIN HAS RESULTED IN A DRY BOUNDARY
LAYER...WHICH WILL AID IN MAX TEMPS RUNNING A FEW DEGREES ABOVE
CLIMO FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. MINS WILL START OUT COOLER THAN
SEASONAL NORMALS THAN RISE TO CLIMO BY MID NEXT WEEK.

LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST AT THIS POINT...EXCEPT TO
ADJUST DEW POINT TEMPS IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS AND ADJACENT NWS
OFFICES GRIDS.

AIR TO INHIBIT ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME 
LIGHT SHOWERS OVER NORTHERN GA NEAR THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...SO WILL

NC THIS EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS 
THE WARMER NAM MINS FOR TONIGHT AND COOLER GFS MAXES ON THURSDAY DUE 
TO THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS FROM ALEX. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH OVER 
THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL LIFT EAST WITH UPPER RIDGING 
DOMINATING THROUGH THE EXTENDED. BY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...GFS 
DEPICTS UPPER RIDGE WEAKENING...BUT OVERALL...VERY DRY AND STABLE 
AIRMASS (PWS 1 INCH) WILL BE THE RULE. DUE TO THE DRY AIR...FAIRLY 
WIDE DIURNAL RANGE IN TEMPERATURES ANTICIPATED. HAVE UPPED MAX 
TEMPERATURES A DEGREE OR TWO MOST DAYS BECAUSE OF THE DRY CONDITIONS.

251 PM EDT TUE JUN 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT IS MOVING SOUTH
ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST COUNTIES THIS AFTERNOON. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
HAVE DEVELOPED ACROSS CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES. DRIER AIR WITH
DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 50S TO MIDDLE 60S ARE MOVING INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. WILL MAINTAIN LOW POPS FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN AREAS
FOR EARLY THIS EVENING...OTHERWISE DRY.

WINDS WILL BECOME CALM TONIGHT WITH ONLY HIGHS CS OVERHEAD...SO THERE
MAY BE PATCHY-AREAS OF FOG...ESPECIALLY NEAR AREA LAKES.

FOR WEDNESDAY...FRONT BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY ACROSS NORTHERN 
ALABAMA-NORTHERN GEORGIA. WILL MAINTAIN LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE FAR 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES...OTHERWISE DRY AND WARM.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT THE START OF
THIS PERIOD THE NORTHEASTERN TROUGH IS STILL IN THE PICTURE...BUT
THE UPPER HIGH IS BUILDING INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW AND BY FRIDAY
THE RIDGE IS DEFINITELY IN CONTROL. THE RIDGE LOOKS TO HOLD ON
THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THEN START TO WEAKEN EARLY NEXT WEEK.

THINK THE FORECAST LOOKS DRY FOR THE MOST PART THROUGH THESE 6 
DAYS. ON THE FRONT END...WED EVE...THINK THAT RAIN THREAT WILL BE
MAINLY SOUTH OF AREA...AND ON THE BACK END OF THE FORECAST...EARLY
NEXT WEEK...MOISTURE RETURN IS EXPECTED TO BE FAIRLY LIMITED AS
FLOW COMES MORE OFF OF THE ATLANTIC THAN THE GULF. WILL HAVE SOME
LIGHT POPS/SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN EAST AND SW ON MONDAY AND
TUESDAY...OTHERWISE WILL KEEP IT DRY.

HAVE GONE VERY CLOSE TO MOS TEMPS THROUGHOUT.

FXUS64 KMRX 290806
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
406 AM EDT TUE JUN 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EVENING CONVECTION HAS
DISSIPATED OR MOVED EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. SURFACE
ANALYSIS WOULD SUGGEST THE WEAK COLD FRONT (OR PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH)
MAY STRETCH FROM OUR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES INTO WESTERN MOST
COUNTIES OF SWRN VA. HOWEVER...BETTER AIRMASS DIFFERENCE BASED ON
DEW POINT TEMPS IS NOTED OVER THE WESTERN THIRD OF KY NE INTO SW
OHIO...WHERE THE ACTUAL COLD FRONT MAY STILL BE LOCATED. 850 MB
ANALYSIS FROM 29/00Z PLOTS SUPPORTS THIS POSITION. 

CONSIDERING FRONTAL POSITION...AND DAYTIME HEATING...HAD TO KEEP
POPS ABOVE MOS VALUES...CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS. WON'T RULE OUT AN
ISOLATED STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORM THIS AFTERNOON. GFS MOS
MAX TEMPS LOOKED GOOD AND WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

FOR TONIGHT...GFS MODEL/MOS DRIES AIRMASS OUT MORE THAN NAM-WRF
...AND I TRENDED TOWARD A BLEND WHICH KEEPS MIN TEMPS MOSTLY IN THE
60S TO LOWER 70S. MAY ALSO SEE SOME PATCHY AREAS OF FOG...PER NAM
MOS. PREVIOUS POP/WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED GOOD WITH LOW EVENING POPS
ACROSS SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS DIFFER INITIALLY
WITH SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WITH GFS MODEL
KEEPING MORE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND HIGHER POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA COMPARED TO THE NAM MODEL. WILL GO SOMEWHAT WITH A SPLIT OF
BOTH MODELS FOR SOUTHERN COUNTIES...AS BELIEVE THAT CHANCE POPS
ALONG TENNESSEE BORDER COUNTIES TO GEORGIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA WILL NEED TO HAVE AT LEAST 30 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY. WILL
ALSO INTRODUCE SMALL AREA OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS JUST TO NORTH OF 30
POP AREA. 

AFTER WEDNESDAY...UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA IN
AMPLIFIED PATTERN BY THURSDAY...WITH MODELS CONTINUING IN KEEPING
RIDGE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST
PERIOD. WILL SLOWLY RAISE TEMPS UPWARD AS RIDGE MOVES OVER THE AREA
BY THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND. MODELS HINT TO A SLIGHT WEAKNESS
IN THE RIDGE PATTERN BY MONDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT
CHANCE AFTERNOON PRECIP CHANCES FOR AREA.

MUCH LESS WITH BEST CHANCES NEAR CHA.  WILL HAVE ONLY CB WORDING FOR

194 
FXUS64 KMRX 281840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT MON JUN 28 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A VERY WARM...MOIST AND 
UNSTABLE AIRMASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH MODEL CAPE NEAR 3000 
J/KG. THERMODYNAMICS IS FAVORABLE TO PRODUCE DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS
DUE TO DRY MID-LEVELS PRODUCING MDPI WELL OVER 1 AND DELTA K VALUES 
30+. I AM ALSO CONCERNED WITH LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING THIS 
AFTERNOON-EVENING AS PWS ARE 1.8...DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER AND MID 
70S...AND POTENTIAL OF TRAINING OF CELLS ALONG THE INCOMING OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY OVER KENTUCKY-SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA-NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.

WILL WATCH FOR DEVELOPMENT OF STORMS FOR POTENTIAL FLASH FLOOD 
WATCH. AT THIS TIME...DO NOT PLAN TO ISSUE...BUT WILL MONITOR.

FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
KEEPING CHANCES OF CONVECTION...WITH HIGHS POPS OVER THE SOUTH AND 
EAST WHERE INSTABILITY THE BEST.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE 
IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE OVERALL PATTERN DURING THE LONG 
TERM...WITH A EASTERN US TROUGH SETTING UP AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
EXTENDING INTO THE REGION FROM THE NORTH AND THEN NORTHEAST.  MAY 
STILL BE SOME CONVECTION ALL BUT FAR NORTH AND NORTHWEST ZONES TUE 
NIGHT WITH EXITING COLD FRONT...AND FRONT MAY STILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH 
TO FAR SOUTH ZONES FOR SOME CONVECTION ON WED.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS.  OTHERWISE...SHOULD BE COOLER 
AND MAINLY DRY FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD.  SOME DISAGREEMENT AMONG 
MODELS AND RUN TO RUN ABOUT HOW FAST MOISTURE RETURNS...AS 
DIFFERENCES EXIST IN HANDLING REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM ALEX.  06Z 
GFS BROUGHT MOISTURE BACK IN MUCH MORE QUICKLY THAN THE ECMWF...BUT 
12Z GFS HAS BACKED OFF OF THIS IDEA.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP THINGS DRY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THEN INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY.  
HOWEVER...UNCERTAINTY IS FAIRLY HIGH FOR LATTER PERIODS.  GFS MOS 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

259 
FXUS64 KMRX 280837
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
437 AM EDT MON JUN 28 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION 
CONTINUES OVER THE SRN OHIO VALLEY REGION THIS MORNING...WITH
SOME SIGNS OF WEAKENING AS IT DROPS SE. CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
CONVECTION MAY OVERSPREAD SW VA AND NE TN WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
SUFFICIENT FOR THE REST OF THE EARLY TO MID MORNING HOURS. PREVIOUS 
FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY WERE ON TRACK WITH SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS
...MAINLY TO INCREASE POPS ACROSS SW VA AND ALSO TO LOWER POPS 
ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC EARLY TODAY. 

A PERSISTENT MAX TEMP FORECAST HAS BEEN GOOD LATELY...BUT AN EARLY 
START TO CONVECTION TODAY MAKES COOLER MAX TEMPS A BETTER CHOICE 
ACROSS NRN AREAS. FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGS SLOWLY SOUTH...SO BETTER 
RAIN CHANCES MAY SHIFT SOUTHWARD BY THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...HARD TO 
TIME THE SLOW PUSH OF THE FRONT SOUTHWARD AND INTERACTION WITH 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES...SO KEPT THE PREVIOUS TREND OF LOWERING TO 
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. A BLEND OF 
SIMILAR MOS MINS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT AND WAS CONSISTENT.

FORECAST AREA NOT OUTLOOKED FOR SLIGHT CHANCE OF SEVERE DUE TO WEAK 
FLOW ALOFT...BUT THE MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS MAY SUPPORT A FEW 
PULSE TYPE SEVERE STORMS. DOWNBURST GUSTY WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINS THE MAIN THREATS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO PASS
THROUGH FORECAST AREA TUESDAY WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF THE FRONT. BEST CHANCES SOUTH. TEMPERATURES
ONLY SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN TODAY. DRIER AIR MASS WITH SURFACE HIGH
MOVING SOUTH INTO OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY AND THEN TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY. COLD FRONT WILL GET HUNG UP ALONG TN AND GA BORDER AS
MOISTURE MOVES NORTHEAST AHEAD OF TROPICAL STORM ALEX AS IT MOVES
INTO THE MEXICAN AND SOUTH TEXAS COAST. NAM MODEL KEEPS MOISTURE
SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA BUT GFS BRINGS MOISTURE TO CHA AND SW NC
AREA. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS EXTREME SOUTH. DROPPED HIGHS
A FEW DEGREES AS NEW MODELS TRENDING HIGHS SLIGHTLY LOWER WEDNESDAY. 
AS UPPER TROUGH SETTLES OVER EAST COAST AND SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS SOUTH
FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. 
HIGHS WILL STAY MOSTLY IN THE 80S WITH LOWS IN THE UPPER 50S AND
60S. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY TROUGH SHIFTS OFF THE EAST COAST AND UPPER
RIDGE MOVES EAST FROM THE CENTRAL STATES. THIS WILL BRING A SLOW
WARMING TREND INTO THE TN VALLEY. MOISTURE FROM ALEX MAY BEGIN TO
MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE SUNDAY OR MONDAY OF NEXT WEEK.

MARGINALLY SEVERE (PULSE TYPE) STORM THIS AFTERNOON.

AGREEMENT WITH ADJACENT NWS SITES GRIDS...WHICH SHOWS NO BREAK IN 
CONVECTION OVERNIGHT. THIS LEADS INTO HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS 
EARLY MONDAY AS COLD FRONT DRAWS NEAR.

PRE-DAWN TEMPS RUNNING VERY MILD...SO I OPTED FOR CLOSER TO 
PERSISTENCE ON MAX TEMPS...WHICH IS ACTUALLY NEAR GFS MOS. MINS 
TONIGHT NEAR MOS BLEND ALSO LOOK HARD TO BEAT. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT TO MOVE INTO 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY AS LARGE UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES AND MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN THE UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS. SOME STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND 
DANGEROUS LIGHTNING. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL SOME AREAS TOO. FRONT 
WILL SLOWLY MOVE OUT OF TENNESSEE TUESDAY WITH BEST CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION SOUTHERN SECTIONS. HIGH PRESSURE WITH DRIER AND COOLER 
AIR MASS WILL SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY AS UPPER TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE EASTERN STATES WITH NO 
RAIN AND MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS LOWERING TO THE MID 
TO UPPER 50S NORTH AND LOWER TO MID 60S SOUTH. &&

STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE (PULSE TYPE) STORM THIS AFTERNOON. 

CONVECTION TONIGHT LOOKS MOSTLY DIURNAL...BUT KEPT CONTINUITY AND 
AGREEMENT WITH ADJACENT NWS SITES GRIDS...WHICH SHOWS NO BREAK IN 
CONVECTION OVERNIGHT. THIS LEADS INTO HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS 
EARLY MONDAY AS COLD FRONT DRAWS NEAR.

PRE-DAWN TEMPS RUNNING VERY MILD...SO I OPTED FOR CLOSER TO 
PERSISTENCE ON MAX TEMPS...WHICH IS ACTUALLY NEAR GFS MOS. MINS 
TONIGHT NEAR MOS BLEND ALSO LOOK HARD TO BEAT. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT TO MOVE
INTO FORECAST AREA MONDAY AS LARGE UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE
GREAT LAKES AND MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN THE 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS. SOME STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS
AND DANGEROUS LIGHTNING. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL SOME AREAS TOO.
FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE OUT OF TENNESSEE TUESDAY WITH BEST CHANCE OF
CONVECTION SOUTHERN SECTIONS. HIGH PRESSURE WITH DRIER AND COOLER
AIR MASS WILL SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY THROUGH
SATURDAY AS UPPER TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE EASTERN STATES WITH NO
RAIN AND MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS LOWERING TO THE
MID TO UPPER 50S NORTH AND LOWER TO MID 60S SOUTH. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             94  73  93  71  91 /  40  20  40  40  40

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...FOR MONDAY...A VERY 
MOIST...HOT...AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. GFS SHOWS A PRE-FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOCATED OVER THE FAR NORTHERN 
AREAS BY EARLY EVENING. THIS BOUNDARY ALONG WITH OROGRAPHIC LIFT 
WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED-BROKEN AREAS OF CONVECTION. ISOLATED SEVERE 
STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH MAIN THREAT DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS 
AND HEAVY RAIN (LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING).

FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL PULL SOUTH 
ACROSS THE AREA AS AN UPPER TROUGH BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER THE 
EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. WILL MAINTAIN HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY 
POPS WITH BEST COVERAGE OVER THE EASTERN-SOUTHERN COUNTIES. 
AGAIN...ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED (SATURDAY)... 
SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS AND NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT WILL DOMINATE THE FORECAST. TROPICAL SYSTEM IN THE GULF 
WILL REMAIN WELL SOUTH OF THE REGION DUE TO STRONG HIGH PRESSURE. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS DRYING OUT CONSIDERABLY WITH PWS 0.5 
INCH OR LESS. WILL KEEP THE PERIOD DRY WITH A SLOW WARMING OF 
TEMPERATURES. WILL TREND ON THE WARMER SIDE OF MEX MOS DUE TO PLENTY 
OF SUNSHINE AND RELATIVELY DRY SOIL ALLOWING FOR GOOD DAYTIME 
INSOLATION.

FXUS64 KMRX 261512
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SAT JUN 26 2010

.DISCUSSION...WARM AND RELATIVELY DRY FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE 
PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCE NOTED IN 
DEW POINT TEMPS FROM SOUTH (LOW 70S) TO NORTH (LOW 60S) THIS 
MORNING...WITH 26/00Z RNK SOUNDING SHOWING A SIGNIFICANT DRYING 
TREND. 26/00Z OHX SOUNDING STILL QUITE MOIST WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
AROUND 1.75 INCHES. CONVECTION YESTERDAY WAS QUITE LIMITED TO MOSTLY 
SRN PLATEAU AND EXTREME SE TN INTO SW NC. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS 
LOOKED ON TRACK FOR TODAY...KEEPING CONVECTION ISOLATED AND CONFINED 
TO SIMILAR AREAS FROM FRIDAY (MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN). IT SHOULD BE 
DIFFICULT FOR ANY STORM TO MAINTAIN ANY INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON. 
OPTED TO KEEP MAX TEMPS CLOSER TO PERSISTENCE.

FOR TONIGHT...KEPT SOME EVENING POPS FOR SAME AREAS AS AFTERNOON 
POP/WEATHER GRIDS. OTHERWISE...CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY AFTER ANY 
CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS DISSIPATE. MINS TEMPS FALL A LITTLE CLOSER 
TO CLIMO OVER NRN AREAS...BUT STILL A BIT MILDER THAN CLIMO ACROSS 
SE TN AND SW NC AREAS. A BLEND OF MOS MINS LOOKED BETTER OVERALL.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MOIST AND WARM UNSTABLE 
AIRMASS WILL LIE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH AND A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH. UPPER TROUGH 
DEVELOPING OVER THE GREAT LAKES SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WILL FORCE A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH 
AND EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY AND TUESDAY. EXPECTING AN 
INCREASE IN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. 
ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE AHEAD AND ALONG THE 
COLD FRONT WITH A POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING WINDS MONDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING PER SPC DAY 3 OUTLOOK. TUESDAY CONVECTION WILL DECREASE FROM 
NORTH TO SOUTH. EUROPEAN MODEL SEVERAL HOURS QUICKER WITH FRONT AND 
END OF PRECIPITATION. HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY EVENING 
IN THE EAST AND SOUTH. HIGHS SUNDAY SHOULD BE THE SAME OR A DEGREE 
OR TWO COOLER THAN SATURDAY. MONDAY AND TUESDAY HIGHS WILL BE 
SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER WITH CLOUDS AND SHOWERS. WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE NW 
AS UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES OVER THE EASTERN STATES. HIGHS AND LOWS 
WILL BE MUCH COOLER. HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S. 

&&

NORMAL READINGS.

WARM...MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH ONLY FORCING BEING OROGRAPHIC AND ANY LEFT OVER OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES. WILL CALL FOR CHANCE POPS CENTRAL AND SOUTH WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE NORTH.

FOR MONDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DEVELOP OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
LATE IN THE DAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. WILL CALL FOR SCATTERED TO BROKEN 
CONVECTION. 

ENOUGH INSTABILITY WILL WARRANT A CHANCE OF STRONG-SEVERE STORMS 
BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WINDS AND 
LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL.

FOR TUESDAY...FRONT PULLS EAST OF THE AREA...JUST EAST OF THE SPINE 
OF THE APPALACHIANS. WILL MAINTAIN A CHANCE OF CONVECTION OVER THE 
EASTERN-SOUTHERN COUNTIES WITH SLIGHT POP ELSEWHERE.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...A UNSEASONABLE STRONG UPPER 
TROUGH WILL ESTABLISH ITSELF OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
WITH STRONG SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
SHOW A DRY AIRMASS WITH PWS 0.5 INCH OR LESS. DRY CONDITIONS WITH 
LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES AND COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
THE RULE.

945 
FXUS64 KMRX 251455
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EDT FRI JUN 25 2010

.DISCUSSION...FRONTAL BOUNDARY DRAPED ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA THIS 
MORNING. SIGNIFICANT PRECIPTABLE WATER GRADIENT STRADDLES THE 
BOUNDARY WITH VALUES NEAR 2.00 SOUTH OF THE FRONT ... LOWERING TO 
NEAR 1.00 OVER SW VA TODAY. WEAK STEERING FROM THE WEST TODAY. GOOD 
DESTABILIZATION EXPECTED THIS AFTN. RAISED POPS ACROSS S PART OF MRX 
CWA BELIEVING CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP AND MARCH SLOWLY EAST INTO AND 
ACROSS S CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SMOKYS SHOULD ALSO SEE DECENT 
DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTN. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGHER DEW 
POINT TEMPS THIS MORNING WERE NOTED ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC...ALTHO 
EXACT LOCATION OF COLD FRONT IS UNCERTAIN. CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS 
HAVE THINNED CONSIDERABLY OVERNIGHT...AND STILL EXPECT SOME PATCHY 
AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS AND DENSE FOG TO DEVELOP BY DAYBREAK. MOST 
CONVECTION YESTERDAY WAS CENTRAL VALLEY AND SMOKIES NORTHWARD...SO 
INCLUDED SOME EARLY MORNING FOG FOR THOSE AREAS.

PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY LOOKED GOOD FOR TODAY...WITH NO 
POPS EXTREME NRN PARTS OF SW VA TO CHANCE ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC.
I DID LOWER POPS SOME FOR EARLY TODAY...THEN AREAL QUALIFIER FOR THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. AN ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORM POSSIBLE THIS 
AFTERNOON. SPOTTY WEAKENING CONVECTION THIS EVENING THEN CLEARING WITH 
AREAS OF FOG POSSIBLE.

STAYED CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE FOR HIGHS OR MINUS A DEGREE OR TWO ACROSS
NRN AREAS. LOWERED MIN TEMP GRID CLOSER TO A BLEND OF MOS.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK BOUNDARY MOVES JUST 
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY WITH DRIER AIR MASS AND WEAK 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. KEPT SMALL RAIN 
CHANCES MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU. BOUNDARY DISSIPATES BY 
SUNDAY WITH MOISTURE LIFTING BACK TO THE NORTH. AT THE SAME TIME A 
TROPICAL SYSTEM MAY DEVELOP IN THE GULF OF MEXICO. AS MOISTURE 
SPREADS NORTH RAIN CHANCES INCREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. SUNDAY 
NIGHT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE AS COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH. THIS FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. HIGHEST POPS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. TUESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY EXPECT TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES COOLER AS MUCH 
DRIER AIR MASS SETTLES INTO THE SOUTHEAST.

CHANCES MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU. BOUNDARY DISSIPATES BY
SUNDAY WITH MOISTURE LIFTING BACK TO THE NORTH. AT THE SAME TIME A

SPREADS NORTH RAIN CHANCES INCREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. SUNDAY
NIGHT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE AS COLD FRONT

MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. HIGHEST POPS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. TUESDAY
THROUGH THURSDAY EXPECT TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES COOLER AS MUCH
DRIER AIR MASS SETTLES INTO THE SOUTHEAST.

AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR...BUT ARE NOT EXPECTED REACH 
RECORD HIGHS.  THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IS AGAIN EXPECTED TO BE 
SUPPRESSED OVER MUCH OF THE AREA WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE 
...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND ALSO 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS.  THE ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL END DURING THE 
EVENING FOR A QUIET AND SEASONABLY WARM NIGHT.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A WEAK FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH 
TOWARD THE AREA ON THURSDAY...WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO A BETTER COVERAGE 
OF CONVECTION.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES.  APPEARS FRONT 
WILL HAVE A HARD TIME MAKING IT VERY FAR SOUTH...AND EXPECT IT TO 
STALL OVER THE REGION BEFORE DISSIPATING.  MODELS INDICATE UPPER 
RIDGE WILL REASSERT ITSELF BY THE WEEKEND...SO EXPECT HOT AFTERNOONS 
TO CONTINUE...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  MODELS INDICATE A 
MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA EARLY IN THE WEEK.  
GFS SHOWS A STRONGER FRONT AND IS FASTER THAN THE ECMWF.  THINK THE 
GFS IS TOO AGGRESSIVE...SO FOR NOW WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE...AND 
WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  WILL GENERALLY NOT 
STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS...WITH JUST SOME TWEAKS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

746 
FXUS64 KMRX 231450
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT WED JUN 23 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ANOTHER HOT AND HUMID DAY.  
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR...BUT ARE NOT EXPECTED REACH 
RECORD HIGHS.  THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IS AGAIN EXPECTED TO BE 
SUPPRESSED OVER MUCH OF THE AREA WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE 
...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND ALSO 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS.  THE ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL END DURING THE 
EVENING FOR A QUIET AND SEASONABLY WARM NIGHT.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A WEAK FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH 
TOWARD THE AREA ON THURSDAY...WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO A BETTER COVERAGE 
OF CONVECTION.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES.  APPEARS FRONT 
WILL HAVE A HARD TIME MAKING IT VERY FAR SOUTH...AND EXPECT IT TO 
STALL OVER THE REGION BEFORE DISSIPATING.  MODELS INDICATE UPPER 
RIDGE WILL REASSERT ITSELF BY THE WEEKEND...SO EXPECT HOT AFTERNOONS 
TO CONTINUE...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  MODELS INDICATE A 
MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA EARLY IN THE WEEK.  
GFS SHOWS A STRONGER FRONT AND IS FASTER THAN THE ECMWF.  THINK THE 
GFS IS TOO AGGRESSIVE...SO FOR NOW WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE...AND 
WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  WILL GENERALLY NOT 
STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS...WITH JUST SOME TWEAKS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       97  73  93  70  93 /  10  10  30  30  30

728 
FXUS64 KMRX 221833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT TUE JUN 22 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...PRETTY MUCH A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS UPPER RIDGING REMAINS ANCHORED 
OVER THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE CONUS. CONVECTION SHOULD ONCE AGAIN 
BE SUPPRESSED TOMORROW BY SUBSIDENCE INVERSION INDUCED BY UPPER 
RIDGING AND KEPT ISOLATED CONVECTION CONFINED TO HIGHER TERRAIN 
ALONG WITH NORTHEASTERN ZONES WHICH WILL BE RELATIVELY CLOSER TO MCS 
TRACK OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. FOR TEMPS...WHICH WILL REMAIN WELL ABOVE 
CLIMO...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV GUIDANCE. APPEARS 
HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL APPROACH...BUT NOT QUITE MEET...HEAT ADVISORY 
CRITERIA. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AS A RESULT...EXPECT 
A FAIRLY STAGNANT PATTERN WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS LINGERING 
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY 
SETTLE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY...AND THEN BECOME QUASI- 
STATIONARY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. WHILE THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL NOT 
PROVIDE MUCH TEMP RELIEF...IT WILL INCREASE THE CLOUD COVER AND 
AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION DURING THE PERIOD...WHICH SHOULD RESULT 
IN A SLIGHT DECREASE OF A FEW DEGREES IN AFTERNOON MAXES. GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT ANOTHER STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH 
THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH PUSHING IT ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. AS A 
RESULT...IT APPEARS THAT THIS NEXT COLD FRONT MAY ACTUALLY BRING 
COOLER TEMPS CLOSER TO NORMAL. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING EACH DAY THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD OVER THE REGION... 
THINK THAT AT LEAST ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH DAY... 
ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF MORE-ORGANIZED MCS ACTIVITY FROM THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON A FEW DAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL FOLLOW A 
PERSISTENCE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT WITH A SLIGHT 
DECREASING TREND WITH MAXES DUE TO THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT BY THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   72  97  73  96  73 /  10  10  10  20  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  97  72  96  72 /  10  10  10  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             70  97  72  96  72 /  10  10  10  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    65  95  68  93  68 /  10  20  10  30  30

FOR SW VA THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING...AND WILL INCLUDE OUR 
EASTERN MOUNTAIN AREAS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE AS WELL AS INSTABILITY 
MAY BE A LITTLE BETTER IN THESE AREAS.  THIS AGREES FAIRLY WELL WITH 
THE SREF POPS.   MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST A FEW 
TWEAKS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A WEAKENING FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO SLOWLY DROP SOUTH AND SETTLE OVER THE AREA LATE THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY...GIVING US OUR BEST CHANCE AT THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY DURING 
THE EXTENDED.  OTHERWISE...WILL CONTINUE TO SEE A PERSISTENT 
SUMMERTIME WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE PERIOD.  THIS 
MEANS...HOT...HUMID CONDITIONS WITH ISOLATED AFTERNOON/EVENING 
CONVECTION POSSIBLE MOST DAYS.  ADDITIONALLY...THERE IS A 
POSSIBILITY A REMNANT OF AN MCS MAY MOVE THROUGH DURING THE 
PERIOD...INCREASING COVERAGE OF THE CONVECTION.

753 
FXUS64 KMRX 220015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
815 PM EDT MON JUN 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING MOST THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
EXITING THE CWA. WILL KEEP THE REMAINDER OF TONIGHT DRY AND HANDLE 
THE REST OF THE PRECIPITATION WITH NOWCASTS. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK. REMOVED AFTERNOON WORDING 
ALREADY...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
PROMINENT WEATHER MAKER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH HOT 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 90S FROM AROUND KNOXVILLE SOUTH TO THE GA 
BORDER AND MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. MCS ACTIVITY ACROSS SOUTHERN OH AND 
NORTHEAST KY MOVING SE TOWARDS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WILL LIKELY 
REACH SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND POSSIBLY NORTHERN TN LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING. ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP COULD BECOME 
SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND DANGEROUS LIGHTNING. CAPE VALUES OF 
AROUND 2000 J/KG WITH LIFTED INDEX VALUES OF AROUND -5 SHOW 
ATMOSPHERE IS MODERATELY UNSTABLE. SHORT RANGE MODELS BRING 
CONVECTION INTO THE NE SECTIONS BY LATE AFTERNOON SO HAVE SLIGHT TO 
CHANCE POPS THAT AREA THROUGH 00Z. CLOUD COVER SHOULD BE MINIMAL 
EXCEPT NE SECTIONS THROUGH MID EVENING AS STORMS DISSIPATE.  LOWS 
TONIGHT STILL FAIRLY COMFORTABLE IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70. TUESDAY 
ANOTHER VERY WARM DAY WITH HIGHS INTO THE MID TO UPPER 90S CENTRAL 
AND SOUTH. MODELS INDICATE NO POPS BUT WILL KEEP ISOLATED CONVECTION 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THIS MAY HAVE TO BE INCREASED IN LATER 
SHIFTS ACROSS THE NE IF BOUNDARIES ARE LEFT FROM MCS NOW IN KY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AS A RESULT...A 
STAGNANT PATTERN WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS WILL LINGER INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY SETTLE INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WHICH SHOULD 
INCREASE THE AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION DURING THIS PERIOD. A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW SHOULD THEN PUSH THIS FRONT BACK NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT DURING THE WEEKEND...WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS PERSISTING. 
WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH DAY OVER THE 
REGION...THINK THAT AT LEAST ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE 
EACH DAY...ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF MORE-ORGANIZED MCS ACTIVITY 
FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON A FEW DAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL FOLLOW 
A PERSISTENCE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE THE AIR 
MAS IS NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE MUCH WITH ONLY SCATTERED CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY POSSIBLY ALTERING THIS PATTERN.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  97  72  95  72 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  95  71  94  71 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  96  71  94  71 /  10  10  10  10  10

STAGNANT PATTERN WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS WILL LINGER INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY SETTLE INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WHICH SHOULD 
INCREASE THE AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION DURING THIS PERIOD. A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW SHOULD THEN PUSH THIS FRONT BACK NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT DURING THE WEEKEND...WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS PERSISTING. 
WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH DAY OVER THE 
REGION...THINK THAT AT LEAST ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE 
EACH DAY...ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF MORE-ORGANIZED MCS ACTIVITY 
FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON A FEW DAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL FOLLOW 
A PERSISTENCE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE THE AIR 
MAS IS NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE MUCH WITH ONLY SCATTERED CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY POSSIBLY ALTERING THIS PATTERN.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  97  72  95  72 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  95  71  94  71 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  96  71  94  71 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  93  68  92  68 /  10  10  20  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

788 
FXUS64 KMRX 210756
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON JUN 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN ON THE DRY 
SIDE WITH UPPER RIDGE CONTINUING OVER THE AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM.  
WHILE LOW LEVELS AGAIN MAY NOT BE QUITE AS DRY AS GFS 
DEPICTION...STILL APPEARS INSTABILITY WILL BE QUITE LIMITED AND 
SOUNDINGS LOOK DRY ENOUGH TO GO PRECIP FREE FOR THE PERIOD.  WILL BE 
HOT ONCE AGAIN. A FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...MAINLY DOWN A DEGREE OR 
TWO FOR HIGHS TODAY.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE HOLDS ITS 
GROUND THROUGH WEDNESDAY KEEPING THE CHANCE FOR CONVECTION SLIM AND 
THE MERCURY IN THE LOW TO MID 90S. BY THURSDAY...NORTHWESTERN STATES 
UPPER TROF WILL HAVE MIGRATED EAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES ON ITS WAY 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. THE RIDGE WILL BE SUPPRESSED A LITTLE 
FARTHER SOUTH AND THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL ALLOW A COOL FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO DROP SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THEREFORE 
MAINTAINED A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AS THE BOUNDARY PROVIDES A FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTION WHILE PRESSING VERY SLOWLY SOUTH. THIS FRONT WEAKENS AND 
LOSES ITS IDENTITY OVER THE WEEKEND AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
RE-ESTABLISHES ITSELF ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE WILL BE LEFT BEHIND IN THE VICINITY OF THE DISSIPATING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY SO MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE WEEKEND. GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAX TEMP 
GUIDANCE BY A DEGREE OR TWO THROUGH THE PERIOD.

862 
FXUS64 KMRX 210141
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
941 PM EDT SUN JUN 20 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING DRY 
WEATHER TONIGHT ALONG WITH PATCHY FOG IN THE VALLEYS. TEMPERATURES 
AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CAPPING INVERSION HAS WEAKENED
OVER ALL BUT SE TN AND OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES THIS AFTERNOON...BUT
LITTLE IF ANY AREAS OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ARE NOTED. THUS...WILL
LET THE LATE AFTERNOON POPS CONTINUE WHILE NOT CARRYING ANY EVENING
POPS. CUMULUS CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON WERE VERY SUPPRESSED. DON'T
SEE MORE THAN AN ISOLATED TSRA OR TWO POSSIBLE...WHICH COULD BE
HANDLED IN A SHORT TERM FORECAST. AREAS OF FOG WERE NOTED THIS
MORNING...MOSTLY IN THE VALLEYS...SO ADDED THIS AGAIN FOR LATE
TONIGHT. DEW POINT TEMPS A LITTLE LOWER THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MOS
MINS SIMILAR AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

FOR MONDAY...EXPECT THE CAPPING INVERSION TO BE QUITE STRONG AGAIN
AND I REMOVED POPS FROM WRN AREAS...WHERE THE CAP SHOULD BE THE
STRONGEST. OTHERWISE...CONTINUED THE VERY LOW SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN IN THE EASTERN AREAS...WHICH MESHED BETTER WITH
ADJACENT OFFICES. CLOSELY FOLLOWED PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID...AS
TEMPS HAVE LAGGED A BIT BEHIND GRID VALUES FOR TODAY. HIGHS MONDAY
SHOULD BE A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM 
YESTERDAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING REMAINS STRONG ACROSS THE REGION 
THROUGH TUESDAY AND PROBABLY WEDNESDAY. THE BEST CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION STILL LOOKS LIKE THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THURSDAY THE UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE SHIFTS SOUTH AND WEST SLIGHTLY AS SHORT WAVE TROF DROPS 
SOUTH FROM THE EASTERN STATES. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA LATE THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AND THEN DISSIPATE IN THE 
VICINITY OVER THE WEEKEND. WILL CONTINUE HIGHER POPS THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY BUT KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HOT 
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S VALLEY 
AREAS AND THEN SLIGHTLY COOLER THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH A LITTLE 
MORE CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

933 AM EDT SUN JUN 20 2010

.DISCUSSION...AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS AND PATCHY FOG PERSIST ACROSS MANY 
VALLEY LOCATIONS THIS MORNING...BUT EXPECT MUCH IMPROVEMENT OVER THE 
NEXT HOUR OR SO. 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW THE EFFECTS OF 
RIDGING ALOFT...AS WARMER AIR HAS CREATED A FAIRLY STRONG CAPPING 
INVERSION. STILL SOME NEGATIVE CAPE (BUOYANCY) TO OVERCOME IF 80S TO 
LOW/MID 90S ARE REACHED IN THE AFTERNOON...BUT THE CAP COULD BE 
BROKEN IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS IN THE HEAT OF THE DAY. 

THUS...SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LOOK GOOD FOR HIGH TERRAIN AREAS...WHILE 
ELSEWHERE A DRY FORECAST WILL BE MAINTAINED...AS ANY ONGOING 
CONVECTION IS WELL UPSTREAM AND WEAKENING.   

WILL UPDATE THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING...AND 
MONITOR HOURLY CONDITIONS AGAINST GRIDS FOR POSSIBLE UPDATE TO 
FORECAST GRIDS/PRODUCTS.

337 
FXUS64 KMRX 200130
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT SAT JUN 19 2010

.DISCUSSION...ACTIVITY DECREASING THIS EVENING WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING. THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE DONE SHORTLY FOR THE REST OF 
TONIGHT. WILL KEEP THE DRY FORECAST FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 
 
.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.DISCUSSION...MCS ACTIVITY FROM LAST NIGHT THAT WEAKENED OVER KY
AND MIDDLE TN EARLY THIS MORNING RE-FIRED ACROSS EAST TN LATE THIS
MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON. THIS ACTIVITY WAS ENHANCED BY A WEAK
SHORTWAVE THAT HAS MOVED INTO THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL MOVE OUT
OF THE REGION THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED DRAMATICALLY
FROM LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON INTO THE 70S TO LOWER 80S
EXCEPT AROUND 90 NE TN AND SW VA AND ALSO IN SW NC. STRONGEST
ACTIVITY AT MID AFTERNOON WAS IN THE SE TN AND SW NC MOUNTAINS BUT
THIS WILL MOVE OUT OF THE REGION BY LATE AFTERNOON. WILL KEEP A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS EVENING ACROSS THE
NE AND ELEVATED AREAS BUT EXPECTING ACTIVITY TO PROBABLY END
BEFORE SUNSET.

SHORT TERM MODELS DID NOT HANDLE TODAYS CONVECTION WELL AND AM
CONCERNED ABOUT UPSTREAM ACTIVITY IN MO MAY LEAVE BOUNDARIES IN
PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER IT DIES OVERNIGHT. MODELS SHOW
RIDGE STRENGTHENING NEXT 24 HOURS BUT WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY AS AIR MASS BECOMES UNSTABLE FROM
HEATING WITH HIGHS BACK IN THE LOW TO MID 90S. AFTER SUNDAY LATE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION LIKELY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH HOT
TEMPERATURES CONTINUING. THERE IS SOME INDICATION THE RIDGE MAY
WEAKEN AGAIN BY THURSDAY AND ALLOW A FRONT TO MOVE BACK INTO THE
AREA FROM THE NORTH BUT THEN STRENGTHEN AGAIN WILL KEEP PERSISTENCE
AND ONLY HAVE 20 PERCENT CHANCE TO THE END OF THE FORECAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

CONVECTOIN HAS DEVELOPED OVER MIDDLE TN EARLIER THAN EXPECTED DUE
TO AN APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH. THE MODELS ARE DOING A VERY
POOR JOB OF PICKING UP ON THIS CONVECTION. AN EARLY UPDATE WILL
NEED TO BE ISSUED TO RAISE POPS IN ALL LOCATIONS...BUT ESPECIALLY
IN THE PLATEAU. WILL BRING POPS UP TO LIKELY THERE. TEMPS WILL ALSO
BE ADJUSTED DOWNWARD ACCORDINGLY.

CONVECTIVE PARAMETERS FROM THE 12Z OHX SUGGEST A POTENTIAL FOR
SEVERE WEATHER TODAY. THE OHX SOUNDING MODIFIED TO 92/70 YIELDS AN
LI OF -6 AND CAPE VALUES AROUND 3000 J/KG. MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS
IN OUR AREA THIS AFTERNOON INDICATE SIMILAR NUMBERS. A WBZ HEIGHT
OF NEARLY 14KFT SHOULD MEAN A MINIMAL HAIL THREAT...BUT A SURFACE
TO MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCE OF 35 C SUGGESTS DAMAGING DOWNBURTS
WILL BE THE MAIN CONCERN.

&&


.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

DGS


