295 
FXUS64 KMRX 190721
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT SAT JUN 19 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK BOUNDARY THAT HAS BEEN OVER 
THE AREA HAS MOSTLY WASHED OUT.  MODELS SHOW SHORT WAVE MOVING 
ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. APPEARS THERE WILL BE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS THIS AFTERNOON.  EXPECT MOST OF THE CONVECTION TO BE 
GONE BY TONIGHT...SO OTHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE EARLY IN SOME OF THE 
TERRAIN AREAS SOUTHERN HALF...WILL GO DRY.  WILL MAKE SOME MINOR 
TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...MAINLY TO BUMP HIGHS DOWN SLIGHTLY FOR 
TODAY.     

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL SHIFT 
EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER WELL NORTH OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION EARLY IN THE FORECAST PERIOD. AT THE SAME TIME HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL STRENGTHEN ALOFT OVER MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
IN THIS REGIME THE CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL REMAIN SLIGHT AND WILL BE 
MAINLY LIMITED TO THE HIGHER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND APPALACHIAN 
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. BY THURSDAY THE RIDGE IS 
EXPECTED TO RETROGRADE WHILE AN UPPER LEVEL TROF SHIFTS INTO THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. THIS MAY ALLOW A COOL FRONT TO MAKE ITS WAY SOUTH 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. UNCERTAINTY ABOUT JUST HOW FAR SOUTH THIS 
FRONT MAY PROGRESS WILL REQUIRE USE OF A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR NOW. 
IF THIS SCENARIO LOOKS MORE REALISTIC IN FUTURE MODEL RUNS POPS WILL 
BE TWEAKED UPWARD. KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE AREA WIDE POPS GOING INTO 
FRIDAY WITH SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY HANGING AROUND THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. WENT CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW SUGGESTED 
MEX MOS MAXES WHILE TRENDING VERY CLOSE TO MINS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

392 
FXUS64 KMRX 190130
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT FRI JUN 18 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR STILL SHOWING 
ISOLATED SHOWERS IN NORTH CAROLINA AHEAD THE FRONT. NOT WIDESPREAD 
ENOUGH TO ADD POPS FOR TONIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE THE DRY FORECAST 
FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES 
NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...THE WEAK FRONT ACROSS THE
AREA TODAY APPEARS TO BE PUSHING BACK TO THE NORTH...NOTED BY A
DEW POINT GRADIENT BETWEEN MORRISTOWN AND KNOXVILLE. A FEW ISOLATED
STORMS HAVE DEVELOPED SOUTH OF THE FRONT IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY
AND SW NC. THE SHOWERS SHOULD DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET...AND CAN BE
COVERED WITH NOWCASTS...SO WILL NOT CARRY ANY POPS IN THE FIRST
PERIOD.

TOMORROW THE FRONT SHOULD WASH OUT AND CONTINUE ITS RETREAT WHILE A 
SURFACE RIDGE DEVELOPS ALONG AND EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. ALOFT...A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL SUPPRESS THE UPPER RIDGE. FORECAST SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE A WEAKER CAP TOMORROW...AND THE UPPER TROUGH MOVING THROUGH 
IN THE AFTERNOON SHOULD BE ENOUGH FOR SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. PINPOINTING ANY FAVORED LOCATION IS DIFFICULT SO WILL 
JUST HAVE A BLANKET SLIGHT CHANCE POP EVERYWHERE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SATURDAY NIGHT
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT MODELS BUILD UPPER RIDGE OVER FORECAST
AREA WITH DAYTIME HEATING BEING THE MAIN TRIGGER FOR AFTERNOON
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. SO JUST HAVE ISOLATED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS IN THE FORECAST AND
VERY WARM TEMPERATURES. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY LONG RANGE MODELS TRY
TO PUT SLIGHTLY MORE ACTIVITY ACROSS THE REGION AS NW FLOW COMES
AROUND THE RIDGE AND IT SHIFTS SLIGHTLY BACK TO THE WEST BUT
DECIDED TO JUST ADD POPS TO THE VALLEYS FOR NOW AND KEEP POPS AT
SLIGHT CHANCE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  92  69  95  70 /  10  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  92  69  95  69 /  10  20  10  10  10

CAPPED AS THE 12Z RNK AND ILN SOUNDINGS SHOW A STRONG INVERSION

REMNANTS OF A DECAYING MCS ARE LOCATED IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY
WILL EXIT THE AREA SHORTLY...BUT WEAK INSTABILITY SOUTH OF THE
FRONT ALONG WITH ANY BOUNDARIES FROM THE MORNING SHOWERS SHOULD BE
ENOUGH TO PRODUCE A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON.

THE CURRENT FORECAST OF ISOLATED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS IN THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY LOOKS GOOD. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE THE MENTION OF
MORNING PRECIP FROM THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY.
TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK AND IN LINE WITH THE LATEST GUIDANCE.

MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COULD NOT FIND ANY SOLID 
EVIDENCE THROUGH THE PERIOD TO UTILIZE BETTER THAN A SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP FOR CONVECTION AS THE MODELS INDICATE SHORT WAVE PASSAGE ACROSS 
THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH AN 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE STRENGTHENING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THROUGH TIME. 
UNCERTAINTY EXISTS LATE IN THE PERIOD ON THURSDAY WITH RIDGE 
POSSIBLY RETROGRADING WHILE ANOTHER SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. BASICALLY TRIED TO TRIM THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE LONG TERM LIMITING THUNDER 
CHANCES TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES. STAYED SOMEWHAT CLOSE TO MEX 
MOS GUIDANCE ALTHOUGH NOT QUITE AS WARM ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY.

144 
FXUS64 KMRX 180027
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
830 PM EDT THU JUN 17 2010

.DISCUSSION...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM THREAT HAS ENDED FOR SE TN. ISOLATED
CONVECTION STILL POSSIBLE SOUTHERN AREAS UNTIL AROUND MIDNIGHT.
LOWERED SOUTHERN TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING PERIOD
WILL BE NEEDED IN THE FORECAST DUE TO THE CONVECTION THAT WILL BE
AFFECTING THE SOUTHWESTERN COUNTIES OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS.
PROJECTING THE TIMING THE CONVECTIVE LINE TAKES IT OUT OF OUR AREA
AROUND 21Z...SO EXPECT THAT THE SVR TSTM WATCH WILL BE ENDED BEFORE
00Z.

A SECOND MCS OVER SOUTHERN IL MAY AFFECT THE AREA LATE TONIGHT. THE 
NAM INDICATES THAT A MCV ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONVECTION WILL CROSS 
THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. THE STORMS WILL LIKELY 
RIDE ALONG THE FRONT...WHICH WILL BE LOCATED BETWEEN TYS AND CHA 
TONIGHT. BUT THE STORMS SHOULD LOSE THEIR INTENSITY WITH THE LACK OF 
HEATING. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP AFTER 06 IN SOUTHERN 
COUNTIES TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. 

A BUILDING MIDLEVEL RIDGE SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
TOMORROW...AND THE SURFACE FRONT ACROSS THE AREA SHOULD CONTINUE ITS 
SOUTHWARD PUSH...THUS BRINGING A DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR MASS TO 
THE ENTIRE AREA. TEMPS WILL STILL BE VERY WARM...IN THE UPPER 80S TO 
LOWER 90S OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRIER AIRMASS WILL 
CONTINUE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY WITH LOWS IN THE COOLER 60S 
POSSIBLY UPPER 50S IN A FEW PLACES NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
THE MOUNTAINS. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AIRMASS GRADUALLY BECOMES MORE 
UNSTABLE WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY DISSIPATES. 
SATURDAY CONVECTION SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
THEN AREA WIDE SUNDAY. HIGHS SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY UPPER RIDGE REMAINS
FAIRLY STRONG ACROSS THE REGION WITH AT LEAST WIDELY SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HOT TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE. DRIER
AIRMASS BEHIND A WEAK FRONT TUESDAY SHOULD KEEP NORTHERN SECTIONS
DRY OTHERWISE NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE PATTERN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  93  69  95  70 /  20  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  91  68  93  69 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  91  68  93  69 /  10  10  10  10  10

518 
FXUS64 KMRX 171709 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
109 PM EDT THU JUN 17 2010

.AVIATION...
MAIN CONCERN FOR THE TAFS THIS AFTERNOON IS THE TIMING OF A LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS THAT IS APPROACHING CHA. EXTRAPOLATION OF THIS LINE
PUTS IT NEAR CHA JUST AFTER 19Z...BUT THERE ARE SOME CELLS
DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE MAIN LINE THAT COULD AFFECT THE AIRPORT A
LITTLE EARLIER. WILL INCLUDE A TEMPO FOR TSRA...IFR VIS...AND WIND
GUSTS UP TO 30 KTS WITH THE CONVECTIVE LINE. STORMS SHOULD BE CLEAR
OF THE AIRPORT BY 21Z. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AT
TYS AND TRI. A FRONT THAT HAS PUSHED INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH
HAS PROVIDED A DRIER AIR MASS AND NORTH-NORTHEAST WINDS...WHICH
SHOULD PREVENT MUCH FOG FORMATION TONIGHT DESPITE CLEARING SKIES. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

DGS

931 AM EDT THU JUN 17 2010

DEPICTED BY GOES SOUNDER PW AND MESOANALYSIS OF LI. TO THE NORTH OF
THE FRONT...DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S...AND THE 12Z RNK
AND ILN SOUNDINGS SHOW A STRONG INVERSION BETWEEN 800-700 MB. THE
RUC AND LOCAL WRF MODELS INDICATE A SLIGHT SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT OF
THE FRONT TODAY. CONVECTION CURRENTLY IN SOUTH CENTRAL KY/NORTHERN
MIDDLE TN IS PROJECTED TO TRACK JUST SOUTH OF THE FRONT...AND REACH
OUR SOUTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES AROUND 18Z. WITH THE FRONT POSITIONED
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTION OF OUR AREA...THERE SHOULD BE
SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY IN OUR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN COUNTIES TO KEEP
THESE STORMS GOING AS THEY MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY. SO THE UPDATE
WILL RAISE POPS TO A CHANCE IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
PLATEAU...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP ADDED TO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU
AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY. OBSERVED TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING A BIT
ABOVE FORECAST...BUT INCREASING CLOUD COVER THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD
RESULT IN HIGH TEMPS CLOSE TO THE CURRENT FORECAST.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EDT THU JUN 17 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING ISOLATED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE CWA ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE ACTIVITY 
SHOULD WEAKEN THIS MORNING. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
SOUTHERN AREAS FOR TODAY WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE LINGERS. THE 
HIGHEST INSTABILITY SHOULD ALSO BE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AREAS FOR 
TODAY. SO THE BEST CHANCE FOR STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL BE IN 
THAT AREA OF THE CWA THIS AFTERNOON.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS TONIGHT.   
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED AGAIN TODAY AND TONIGHT. STAYED 
NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL BUILD OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY 
ON FRIDAY...AND THEN SLOWLY RETROGRADE TOWARDS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
DURING THE WEEKEND. AT THE SURFACE...SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR IS PROGGED 
TO SETTLE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF A 
WEAK COLD FRONT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A MID-LEVEL CAPPING 
INVERSION DEVELOPING OVER THE REGION ON FRIDAY...WHICH SHOULD 
SUPPRESS CONVECTION OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...WILL 
KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP OVER THE MOUNTAINS...WHERE THE GFS MODEL 
INDICATES SOME CONVECTION MAY BE ABLE TO BREAK THROUGH THIS CAP. 
ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SUNDAY...BUT SHOULD BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. WITH NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW AND THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
STALLED-OUT NEAR THE FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT SOME POSSIBLE MCS 
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY MAY MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SUNDAY OR MONDAY. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN HINTS AT THIS 
SCENARIO...BUT SINCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXACT LOCATIONS OF MCS 
SYSTEMS CAN BE HIGHLY VARIABLE...WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY A MENTION 
OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD... 
WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

831 
FXUS64 KMRX 170125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT WED JUN 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTION WINDING DOWN WITH LOSS OF HEATING. 
ISOLATED SHOWERS POSSIBLE BUT COVERAGE LESS THAN 20% EXPECTED.
ADDED PATCHY FOG OVERNIGHT. TEMPS LOOK GOOD. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
CONVECTION IS BEGINNING TO DEVELOP ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...AND WILL BE TRACKING INTO THE VALLEY THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON. CONVERGE SHOULD INCREASE QUICKLY AS OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES 
HELP BREAK THE CAP AND INITIATE NEW CONVECTION. FORECAST CAPE VALUES 
ACROSS THE AREA WILL BE AROUND 2500 J/KG...ENOUGH FOR SOME PULSE 
STORMS TO PRODUCE STRONG WIND GUSTS AND SOME HAIL. SEVERE THREAT 
SHOULD BE MORE ISOLATED THAN YESTERDAY THOUGH. THE LACK OF LARGE 
SCALE LIFT SHOULD RESULT IN ANY STORMS DISSIPATING WITH SUNSET...SO 
WILL REMOVE ALL POPS FROM THE FORECAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

A FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY WILL PUSH SOUTHWARD OVERNIGHT. 
THIS WILL BRING A DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR MASS TO THE AREA. 
DEWPOINTS TOMORROW AFTERNOON ARE FORECAST TO BE 10 DEGREES LOWER 
THAN TODAY. IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS...A RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING 
OVER THE REGION...AND THE FLOW ALOFT WILL BE NORTHWESTERLY. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS AT TRI SHOW A STRONG MIDLEVEL INVERSION DEVELOPING UNDER 
THIS RIDGE. SO CHANCES OF PRECIP LOOK MUCH LOWER 
TOMORROW...ESPECIALLY NORTH. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES WHERE DEWPOINTS WILL BE HIGH SOUTH OF THE FRONT. 
HIGHS WILL BE IN THE MID 80S TO LOWER 90S AGAIN...BUT SHOULD FEEL 
MORE PLEASANT WITH LOWER HUMIDITY.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN UPPER RIDGE 
WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AIRMASS WILL BE 
DRIER WITH PWS BETWEEN 1.25 AND 1.5 FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY. ALSO...A 
WEAK MID-LEVEL CAP WILL BE IN PLACE LIMITING AFTERNOON CAPES TO 1000 
J/KG. AT THE SURFACE AND 850MB...A WEAK UPPER LOW WILL DEVELOP OVER 
GA-AL WITH WEAK EASTERLY FLOW KEEPING BEST CHANCE OF ANY CONVECTION 
THROUGH MONDAY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS EASTWARD.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS...BUT MOISTURE 
INCREASES. OVERALL...THROUGH THE EXTENDED ONLY LOW CHANCE VALLEY TO 
CHANCE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE FORECAST.

WILL FOLLOW MEX MOS CLOSELY...BUT WILL GO A DEGREE TO TWO WARMER FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK AS UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  92  67  95  70 /  20  20  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  89  64  93  67 /  30  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  89  63  93  66 /  30  10  10  10  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1021 AM EDT WED JUN 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...
A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE TN VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE OVER THE
PAST SEVERAL DAYS...DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP IN THIS
UNSTABLE AIR MASS...BUT WILL REMAIN UNORGANIZED WITH LITTLE UPPER
LEVEL FORCING. STORMS WILL LIKELY DEVELOP ALONG THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU WHERE THE LOCAL MESOSCALE MODEL SHOWS A CONVERGENCE ZONE
AND A THETA-E RIDGE. PULSE STORMS WILL TRACK SLOWLY EAST WITH
MIDLEVEL WINDS FROM THE WEST AROUND 15-20 KTS...AIDED BY CONVECTIVE
INITIATION FROM OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES. MODIFIED 12Z OHX SOUNDING
PRODUCES MUCAPE VALUES AROUND 2800 J/KG...AND AN LI OF -7. SO HAIL
AND DAMAGING WINDS WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST
STORMS. BACK-BUILDING STORMS ALONG OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL MEAN A
LOCALIZED FLOOD THREAT. THE CURRENT FORECAST OF LIKELY POPS WITH
HIGH TEMPS IN THE MID 80S TO LOWER 90S LOOKS GOOD. WILL JUST UPDATE
THE ZFP TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT WED JUN 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING SHORTWAVE 
TRIGGERING SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN MIDDLE TN. THE DISTURBANCE IS 
PROGGED TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION TODAY. WITH INCREASING MOISTURE 
AND INSTABILITY EXPECTED WITH IT...WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS. COULD SEE A FEW SEVERE STORMS AGAIN BY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. DRIER WEATHER RETURNS TONIGHT. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURE EXPECTED AGAIN TODAY AND TONIGHT BUT SHOULD BE WELL 
BELOW RECORD TEMPERATURES. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A WEAKENING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY...BRINGING DRIER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA ALONG WITH AN 
END TO CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. THIS SCENARIO SEEMS HARD TO BELIEVE 
GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR...AND THE FACT THAT THERE DOES NOT APPEAR TO 
BE MUCH UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT FOR THIS SCENARIO WITH ONLY WEAK 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A MID-LEVEL CAPPING 
INVERSION OVER THE REGION...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BUILDING OVER 
THE DEEP SOUTH. WHILE THESE FACTORS SHOULD INHIBIT CONVECTION OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...THINK IT IS PRUDENT TO 
KEEP AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGHOUT 
THE EXTENDED FORECAST. WILL PLAN TO LOWER DEWPOINTS SOME BY THURSDAY 
AND INTO THE WEEKEND...BUT WILL REMAIN A LITTLE HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE 
SINCE IT IS NOT ENTIRELY CONVINCING THAT DRIER AIR WILL WORK ITS WAY 
THIS FAR SOUTH. ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT THINK THAT THIS ONE WILL ALSO 
STALL OUT AND DISSIPATE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS (BUT ULTIMATELY A 
LITTLE HIGHER) THROUGH THE PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

305 PM EDT TUE JUN 15 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE HAS 
ERUPTED INTO POCKETS OF STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION WHICH APPEARS TO 
BE INITIATING ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES AND DRIFTING VERY SLOWLY 
EAST. EXPECT THE ACTION TO CONTINUE POSSIBLY THROUGH THE MIDDLE PART 
OF THE EVENING BEFORE LOSING STRENGTH AS THE SURFACE SLOWLY COOLS. 
FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS MODELS HAVE BEEN TARGETING THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY AS 
NORTH CENTRAL STATES UPPER TROF DRIVES EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES 
AND OHIO VALLEY. MIDWEST FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRESS 
SOUTH AND EAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE NORTHERN REACHES 
OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY. EXPECT FAIRLY DECENT CONVERAGE OF 
STORMS ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS WELL AS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WELL IN ADVANCE OF THIS COOL FRONT. 
THEREFORE EDGED POPS TO LIKELY CATEGORY IN THIS AREA WHILE USING 
GOOD CHANCE ACROSS THE REMAINING COUNTIES. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE BLEND FOR TEMPS IN THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY...WEAK 
FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA MAINTAINING A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...MODELS SHOW A WEAK SURFACE AND 850MB LOW 
DEVELOPING OVER GA WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH INTO THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. CONVERGENCE ALONG INVERTED TROUGH ALONG WITH UPSLOPE 
EAST FLOW INTO THE CAROLINA MOUNTAINS WILL KEEP BEST CHANCES- 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ALONG THE TENNESSEE-NORTH CAROLINA STATE- 
LINE. THE FLOW AROUND THE WEAK LOW WILL PRODUCE A DEEP...BUT 
WEAK...EASTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH DOWNSLOPE IN THE 
VALLEY. ALSO...MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW DRY AIRMASS AND WEAK MID-LEVEL 
CAP OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.  BESIDES THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA...WILL CALL FOR MOSTLY DRY 
CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR TUESDAY...DEEPER MOISTURE RETURNS IN ADVANCE OF ANOTHER WEAK 
BOUNDARY. CONFIDENCE OF THIS FRONT LOW...SO WILL ONLY CALL FOR LOW 
CHANCE POPS.

&&

ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH THE GFS MODEL 
REVEALING A LITTLE MORE 850 MB MOISTURE THAN THE NAM MODEL WHICH 
WOULD RESULT IN A STRONGLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION AREAWIDE WITH GOOD CHANCE POPS...AND 
THINK THAT SOME STORMS WILL AGAIN BECOME SEVERE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST SINCE THE AIR MASS HAS NOT CHANGED MUCH SINCE YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SERIES OF SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
OVER THE RIDGE COMBINED WITH MODERATE DIURNAL INSTABILITY WILL BRING 
THE CHANCE FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH 
DAY. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL BE IN AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
224 PM EDT MON JUN 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LARGE UPPER RIDGE STAYS IN PLACE. 
SERIES OF SHORT WAVES COME OVER THE TOP AD NAUSEUM. SEEMS LIKE THIS 
HAS BEEN GOING ON FOR MONTHS. EXTREMELY HIGH SFC RH AND MODERATE 
INSTABILITY GIVE FUEL TO THE MIX. TRIGGER SEEMS TO WARMTH HITTING 
CONVECIVE TEMPS. GIVEN THAT NEAREST SFC FRONT FOR FOCUS IS WELL TO 
THE NORTH NEAR THE GREAT LAKES, EXPECT THAT AFTER SUNSET CONVECTION 
SHOULD DROP OFF GRADUALLY. NAM12 SOUNDINGS DON'T SHOW MUCH IN THE 
WAY OF MINIMAL DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS AND AM EXPECTING SOME RESIDUAL 
CLOUDINESS OVERNIGHT. WILL NOT ADD FOG TO WEATHER OVERNIGHT, AS IT 
WILL BE PATCHY AT BEST, OCCURRING MAINLY AREAS WHICH RECEIVE HEAVY 
RAINFALL TODAY AND TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THE NORTHEAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS 
WAVE WILL PROVIDE ENOUGH EMPHASIS TO MOVE A WEAK BOUNDARY INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY-WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH 
DRIER AIR. WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY SLIGHT POPS FOR MAINLY THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN. SURFACE RIDING WILL PULL EAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY WITH RETURN OF DEEPER MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY. FORCING 
WILL STILL BE LIMITED TO THE TERRAIN FEATURES...SO SLIGHT POPS FOR 
THE VALLEY AND CHANCE FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

UPPER RIDING FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES VERY 
WARM THROUGH THE PERIOD AND WILL FOLLOW MEX MOS CLOSELY...BUT MAY GO 
A LITTLE HIGHER AT THE END OF THE EXTENDED.

182 
FXUS64 KMRX 140710
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT MON JUN 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE MID WEST...WITH A VERY 
MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
A CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER SOUTHEAST KY...WHICH WAS MOVING SOUTHEAST 
TOWARDS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. THUS...WILL MENTION SCATTERED 
CONVECTION THROUGHOUT THE DAY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS WILL AGAIN DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON...WITH THE HIGHEST 
INSTABILITY LOCATED OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...WILL MENTION CHANCE POPS EVERYWHERE...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO 
TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST SINCE THE AIR MASS HAS NOT 
CHANGED MUCH SINCE YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...BASIC PATTERN FOR THIS 
PERIOD IS RELATIVELY CONSISTENT WITH RIDGING IN THE SOUTHERN U.S. 
AND A MORE PROGRESSIVE PATTERN TO THE NORTH. UPPER RIDGE OVER OUR 
AREA IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN SLIGHTLY THEN TRY TO BUILD BACK IN FROM 
THE WEST IN LATER PERIODS.  

ON WEDNESDAY MODELS AGREE ON A WEAK FRONTAL PASSAGE...OR MAYBE MORE 
CORRECT TO SAY TROUGH PASSAGE. MODELS HAVE SEEMED OVERLY AGRESSIVE 
LATELY ON FRONTAL PASSAGES AND DRYING OUT THE AIR MASS. THINK IT IS 
WISE TO WILL KEEP DEW POINT READINGS HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE. FOR 
EXAMPLE THE GFS AT 18Z ON THURSDAY HAS THE DEW POINT AT KTYS OF 55 
DEG...WITH THE GFS MOS DEW POINT AT 60 BY 00Z. ALSO...LOOKING 
UPSTREAM THERE SHOULD BE LITTLE SOURCE OF DRY AIR. SO ANY DRYING 
WILL NEED TO BE DONE THROUGH SUBSIDENCE AND DEEP MIXING--WILL 
PROBABLY GET A FEW DEGREES OF DRYING BUT NOT 10-15 DEG DRIER. WITH 
THIS IN MIND...HAVE BUMPED UP THE POPS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TO NOW 
MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS AT MOST LOCATIONS. LOW 
END POPS CONTINUE INTO THE WEEKEND.

FOR TEMPS...WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...EXCEPT 1-2 DEGREES 
COOLER ON MAX TEMP FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY DUE TO HIGHER MOISTURE 
LEVELS...LIKEWISE WENT WARMER ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY MIN TEMPS DUE 
TO HIGHER DEW POINTS.
&&

252 
FXUS64 KMRX 131906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT SUN JUN 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CONVECTION CONTINUES TO 
MAINLY AFFECT SW VA AND NE TN THIS AFTERNOON...AIDED BY WEAK UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH/VORTICITY CENTER APPARENTLY PASSING SE THROUGH THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. COVERAGE HAS DIMINISHED SLIGHTLY OVER THE PAST 
HOUR OR SO...WITH SCATTERED WORDING AND HIGHER CHANCE POPS GOOD FOR 
THOSE AREAS THIS EVENING. ELSEWHERE...LOOKS LIKE MAINLY ISOLATED 
DIURNAL CONVECTION...MUCH IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. 
THE INTENSITY OF ANY STORMS HAS REMAINED VERY WEAK SO FAR. PATCHY 
FOG WAS MENTIONED AGAIN FOR LATE TONIGHT.

SHORT RANGE MODELS SUGGEST SLIGHTLY MORE TSRA OVER SW VA AREAS AGAIN 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY EVENING...ALTHO UPSTREAM CONVECTION SEEMS FURTHER 
NW TO ME THAN PAST FEW DAYS. THUS...NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO MORE 
THAN HIGH CHANCE POPS TOMORROW FOR SW VA. NO REAL AIRMASS DIFFERENCE 
AGAIN ON TUESDAY...SO BEST FORECAST IS TO CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS 
FOR NOW. 

FOR TEMPS...A FEW MORE LOCATIONS HITTING THE LOWER 90S TODAY...AND 
MIN TEMPS HAVE BEEN TRENDING MILDER AND MUGGY EACH NIGHT. LOWER 70S 
OR SO EACH NIGHT ACROSS SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA LOOKS HARD TO 
BEAT. INCREASED MAX TEMPS JUST SLIGHTLY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...BUT
STAYED A LITTLE BELOW THE HOTTER NUMBERS FOR NOW...SINCE AIRMASS IS 
SO MOIST. TRI HAS BEST CHANCE TO TIE OR SET A RECORD MAX MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...AS RECORDS ARE 92 DEGREES EACH DAY. HOT AND MUGGY ENOUGH 
TO SEE HEAT INDEX MENTIONED FOR CHA ZONE GROUP...ALTHO NOT YET HIGH 
ENOUGH TO JUSTIFY A HEAT ADVISORY (105 DEGREES OR HIGHER FOR 2 DAYS
WITH A MIN TEMP OF 75 DEGREES OR HIGHER). 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...STAYED CLOSER TO ECMWF 
DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST WHICH DEPICTS ANOTHER SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH TROF ROUNDING THE TOP OF THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. RIDGE. THE 
TROF CROSSES THE GREAT LAKES ON WEDNESDAY AND SUBSEQUENTLY SWINGS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. THIS WILL 
MEAN ANOTHER SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY. AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION MAY BE A 
LITTLE GREATER IN THIS REGIME ON WEDNESDAY WITH SOME HELP FROM TAIL 
END OF NORTHEASTERN STATES VORT AXIS. KEPT THE POPS AT 40 PERCENT 
FOR THE EVENT. DEPARTURE OF THIS UPPER LEVEL FEATURE FOR FRIDAY AND 
A NICE STRENGTHENING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE REGION WILL HELP 
LOWER THE CHANCE FOR SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY SO KEPT THE 10-20 PERCENT POP GOING FOR THIS 
PERIOD. PERHAPS ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL SHOVE ANOTHER SYNOPTIC COOL 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARD THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 
SUNDAY SO USED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP AT THIS RATHER REMOTE PERIOD OF 
THE FORECAST.

WHICH HAS BEEN ANCHORED OVER THE GULF COAST STATES...SHIFTS SLIGHTLY 
EASTWARD THROUGH THE EARLY PORTION OF THE WORK WEEK BEFORE 
RETROGRADING BACK TO THE WEST BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM. THE WESTWARD 
RETROGRADE WILL ALLOW SLIGHTLY DRIER NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THUS 
HAVE KEPT POPS SOMEWHAT LOWER FOR LATE IN THE PERIOD AFTER 
MAINTAINING NEARLY PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH MID WEEK. 
WELL-ABOVE-CLIMO TEMPS WILL ALSO PERSIST AS HEIGHT ANOMALIES REMAIN 
POSITIVE OVER MUCH OF THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH THE FORESEEABLE 
FUTURE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SAT JUN 12 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORTWAVE TROUGH CONTINUES 
TO MOVE EAST INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS AND ERN OHIO VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH BEST COVERAGE OF TSRA OVER SE KY AND SW VA. BREAKS 
OF SUNSHINE OCCURRING...ESPECIALLY OVER CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY OF E 
TN WHERE TEMPS HAVE REACHED THE MID 80S TO LOWER 90S. SHOWER COOLED 
AREAS OF SW VA AND NE TN HOLDING IN THE 70S. AIRMASS DESTABILIZING 
WITH NEW RANDOM DEVELOPMENT ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THINK 
THAT COVERAGE WILL BE ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED FROM LATE 
AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING...WHICH FITS WELL WITH CURRENT FORECAST 
GRIDS. HAVE SEEN A STORM OR TWO BRIEFLY PULSE UP...BUT NOTHING 
STRONG TO SEVERE JUST YET.

CARRIED SOME POPS OVERNIGHT AS SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOW MORE 
CONVECTION MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER RIDGE LATE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY.
KEPT POPS JUST BELOW LIKELY FOR SUNDAY ACROSS SW VA AND NRN PLATEAU
...AND WILL DEFER TO MIDNIGHT SHIFT TO SEE IF HIGHER POPS WILL BE 
JUSTIFIED. OTHERWISE...FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...SHOULD SEE 
MORE MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION WITH A STORM OR TWO POSSIBLY BUILDING 
TO STRONG OR MINIMALLY SEVERE LEVELS. ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY TO STICK 
CLOSE TO PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS FOR NOW FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. 

FOR TEMPS...MIN TEMPS STARTING TO SHOW THE EFFECTS OF PERSISTENT 
UPPER RIDGE AND A MUGGY AIRMASS...SO 60S TO LOWER 70S PER MOS LOOKS 
GOOD. ALSO...STARTING TO BELIEVE LOWER 90S FOR MAX TEMPS...ACROSS 
THE SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MOS OFFERS UP MID 90S FOR CHA 
BOTH DAYS...WHICH WON'T BE A RECORD MAX TEMP EITHER DAY. I KEPT SW 
VA AND NE TN CLOSER TO A GFS BLEND WITH THE COOLER NAM HIGHS. 

THE RECORD HIGHS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS ARE AS FOLLOWS:

SUNDAY (13TH)...CHA 99/1953...TYS 96/1958...TRI 94/1944...AND OQT 
95/1958.

MONDAY (14TH)...CHA 97/1914...TYS 96/1943...TRI 92/1943...AND OQT
95/1964.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...ECMWF EDGED A LITTLE 
CLOSER TO THE GFS IN THE MID WEEK TIMEFRAME AND BOTH MODELS ALLOW 
SOME PERIODIC SHORTWAVE ENERGY TO BUILD OVER THE TOP OF SOUTHEASTERN 
U.S. UPPER RIDGE WITH PERHAPS A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
ON WEDNESDAY. THEREFORE KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING DURING THIS PERIOD 
WHILE CONTINUING THEME OF LATER WEEK SUPPRESSION OF THUNDERSTORM 
FORMATION WITH LIMITATION TO HIGHER TERRAIN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS 
UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES. MODELS TRY TO 
BRING AN UPPER TROF THROUGH THE MIDWEST ON SATURDAY AND WITH 
POSSIBILITY OF INCREASING MOISTURE AND LESS STABILITY AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM WENT AHEAD AND PLACED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON DAY SEVEN. PULLED BACK JUST A BIT ON MEX 
MOS TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 AM EDT SAT JUN 12 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHING FROM WEST VA SOUTHWARD 
INTO THE PIEDMONT REGION OF NC...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL DRIFT NORTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY TODAY...AND INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY TONIGHT. 
THIS SHORT WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
TSTORMS ALONG ITS PATH...SO WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA WITH DECREASING POPS FURTHER SOUTH. MODELS INDICATE THAT A VERY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS COULD DEVELOP BY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS MIDDLE TN 
AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SO THINK THAT SOME STRONG TO SEVERE 
CONVECTION WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST OVERALL... 
EXCEPT WITH MAXES ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
WHERE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP TEMPS A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NO MAJOR CHANGES IN 
PERSISTENT SUMMER-LIKE PATTERN EXPECTED THROUGH THE LONG TERM AS 
UPPER RIDGE REMAINS CENTERED OVER THE GULF COAST STATES. STILL SOME 
DIFFERENCES NOTED IN LATEST RUNS OF ECMWF AND GFS OPERATIONAL MODELS 
AS GFS DEPICTS WEAK BOUNDARY PUSHING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED BY MARKEDLY DRIER AIR. 
AS WITH PREVIOUS RUNS...THIS SCENARIO IS NOT DEPICTED BY THE ECMWF. 
SINCE THE ECMWF SCENARIO SEEMS MORE PLAUSIBLE GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR 
AND PERSISTENCE OF THE PATTERN...HAVE TENDED TO FAVOR ITS SOLUTION. 
THIS RESULTS IN ONLY MINOR CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST... 
WITH MAINLY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION AND WELL-ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS 
PERSISTING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT FRI JUN 11 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN AREA OF ONGOING
CONVECTION IS FROM CUMBERLAND PLATEAU JUST INTO WESTERN MOST PARTS
OF THE CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY. THIS IS WHERE CAPPING INVERSION

OPTED FOR A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD TO THE ZFP PRODUCT TO CARRY

CHANCE POPS FOR MOST AREAS. KEPT SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN
OVERNIGHT TO MAINLY MESH WITH HIGHER POPS FROM JKL TO OUR NORTH.
NOT CERTAIN THAT THIS CONVECTION WILL LINGER ALL NIGHT...BUT
PARTIAL CLEARING AFTER CONVECTION SHOULD LEAD TO DEVELOPMENT OF
PATCHY DENSE FOG (AND LOW CLOUDS) BEFORE DAYBREAK. MOS BLEND FOR
MINS LOOKED SLIGHTLY BETTER THAN THE MILDEST CHOICES.

MOST UNSTABLE AIRMASS ON SATURDAY WILL BE WESTERN AND NORTHERN AREAS
WITH SHORT RANGE MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON A SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX TO 
MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS. SURFACE TROUGH OR OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES FROM THIS MESOSCALE CONVECTION SHOULD HELP TO TRIGGER A 
LITTLE MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION ACROSS NRN PLATEAU AND SWRN VA 
AREAS...SO I INCREASED POPS FOR THOSE AREAS INTO LOWER END OF 
LIKELY. 

THINK THAT CONVECTION WILL BE MOST ACTIVE INTO SATURDAY EVENING...
BUT KEPT LOW POPS OVERNIGHT TO BE CONSISTENT WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND 
ADJACENT NWS OFFICES. MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS ON SUNDAY WITH 
SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED AGAIN BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. AIRMASS 
STILL SEEMS TOO MOIST TO WARRANT GOING MUCH INTO THE 90S FOR HIGHS...
SO STAYED ABOUT 1 TO 3 DEGREES BELOW MOS FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY HIGHS. MOS MIN TEMPS LOOKED VERY REASONABLE AND CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DIFFERENCES REMAIN 
BETWEEN GFS AND ECMWF. PREFERRED TO STAY CLOSER TO ECMWF VERSION 
LATE IN THE PERIOD. MODELS BRING UPPER TROF ACROSS EASTERN CANADA 
AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. MONDAY INTO TUESDAY DRIVING A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY SOUTH THROUGH THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
SUPPOSE THIS COULD PROVIDE A LITTLE MORE OF A FOCUS FOR A SLIGHTLY 
HIGHER POP FOR CONVECTION ALONG WITH SOME UPPER SUPPORT FROM TROF 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD. TRIED TO TREND BACK A BIT ON POP WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH FRIDAY AS RIDGING BEGINS TO STRENGTHEN WITH LITTLE FOCUS FOR 
PRECIPITATION. EMPHASIZED THE SMALL POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. 
FOR TEMPERATURES ADJUSTED BACK A DEGREE OR TWO OFF THE RATHER WARM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

MODERATE INSTABILITY AGAIN TODAY WITH MAX TEMPS IN THE 70S TO NEAR 
90 DEGREES...SO EXPECT RANDOM CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT SIMILAR TO 
THURSDAY. AN ISOLATED STRONG STORM OR TWO COULD PRODUCE GUSTY 
WINDS...MAINLY OVER WESTERN AND SRN AREAS...PER OHX SOUNDING 
PARAMETERS. LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN AS WELL...BUT EAST STORM MOVEMENT AT 
10 TO 15 MPH AND NO TRAINING OF CONVECTION SHOULD LIMIT THIS THREAT. 

MESOSCALE CONVECTION THIS MORNING OVER NRN AR AND SRN MO STILL SEEMS 
TO BE THE FEATURE THAT SHORT RANGE MODELS MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER 
RIDGE AXIS ON SATURDAY. THIS MAY WARRANT LIKELY POPS FOR SATURDAY 
ACROSS SW VA/NRN PLATEAU/NE TN...MORE ON THIS LATER.

OTHERWISE...AREAS OF LOW CLOUDINESS AND FOG ARE LIFTING/DISSIPATING 
THIS MORNING. WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING...BUT
FORECAST LOOKS GENERALLY ON TRACK.

FXUS64 KMRX 110636
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 AM EDT FRI JUN 11 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT LOCATED ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA AND NORTHEAST TN...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS RESIDING OVER MOST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS WARM 
FRONT WILL SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHWARD TODAY...WITH A HOT AND HUMID DAY 
DEVELOPING OVER THE ENTIRE REGION. MODELS INDICATE THAT INSTABILITY 
WILL BE HIGHEST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IN THE PROXIMITY OF 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...THINK IT IS BEST TO KEEP POPS THE 
SAME ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
BUILDING NORTHWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WILL PLAN TO KEEP 
POPS BELOW 50 PERCENT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
TREND TOWARDS MAXES AND MINS BEING A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN 
YESTERDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...TYPICAL SUMMER REGIME IN 
THE OFFING ALONG WITH OBLIGATORY DISORGANIZED...MAINLY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE SOUTHEASTERN 
CONUS THROUGH THE LONG TERM. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS BECOME DISSIMILAR 
BY WEDNESDAY AS GFS DEPICTS SURFACE FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WHILE THE ECMWF HAS THIS FRONT COMING 
THROUGH MUCH LATER...AFTER THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD IN FACT. 
THE GFS SOLUTION DOES NOT HAVE ANY STRONG SUPPORT FROM THE GEFS 
ENSEMBLES...THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST. HOWEVER... CONFIDENCE IS LOW AT THIS POINT AS MODELS 
ARE PROFOUNDLY OUT-OF-PHASE FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE LONG TERM. 
FOR TEMPS...ALSO DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS 
DUE TO AFOREMENTIONED UNCERTAINTIES.

880 
FXUS64 KMRX 101911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT THU JUN 10 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...BASED ON SURFACE ANALYSIS 
AND USING SPC MESOSCALE PAGE TODAY...WOULD PLACE WEAK COLD FRONT 
STILL TO OUR NORTH. CLOUD COVER HAS PERSISTED AND LIMITED WARMING 
ACROSS NRN 1/3 TO 1/2 OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHILE SOME SUNSHINE HAS 
WARMED CHA AND RHP INTO THE LOWER TO MID 80S. AIRMASS STARTING TO 
DESTABILIZE (MIXED LAYER CAPES FROM SPC PAGE 1000 TO 2000 J/KG).
WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING WITH GENERALLY NO FAVORED 
AREA AT THIS TIME...SO NUDGED LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING POPS DOWN 
TO HIGH CHANCE (WITH AREAL QUALIFIER). LET POPS FALL TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE LATE WITH PATCHY AREAS OF FOG. THINK THAT GFS MOS IS CLEARING 
SKIES OUT A BIT TOO MUCH...WITH NAM MOS FAVORED FOR SKY COVER. 

OTHERWISE...AIRMASS REMAINS VERY MOIST (ABOVE NORMAL) INTO THE 
WEEKEND...SO AT LEAST DIURNAL CONVECTION EXPECTED. SHORT RANGE 
MODELS HINT AT A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES TO RIDE UP AND OVER THE 
UPPER RIDGE. THIS SCENARIO IS BETTER DEPICTED TO OCCUR ON SATURDAY
...SO I INCREASED POPS UP TO LOW END OF LIKELY IN A FEW AREAS BY 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. OVERALL NO MAJOR CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS 
WEATHER WISE. 

MOIST AIRMASS WOULD SEEM TO FAVOR MILDER MOS MINS AT NIGHT...AND 
ALSO FAVOR GOING BELOW LOWER TO MID 90S FOR MAX TEMPS EACH DAY. THUS
I TRENDED TOWARD A MOS BLEND FOR MINS...A MOS BLEND FOR FRI MAXES
AND COOLER GFS MAXES ON SATURDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORT WAVE TROF RIDES 
OVER THE TOP OF SOUTHEASTERN U.S. RIDGE DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD 
SUPPRESSING THE PRESSURE PATTERN A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTHWARD. THIS 
ACTION SHOULD CAUSE A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO DROP SOUTH THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. MAINTAINED PREVIOUS PACKAGE 
SMALL THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION SATURDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY AS THE WEAK BOUNDARY SLIPS FARTHER SOUTH. TUESDAY 
INTO THURSDAY TRIED TO STAY WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY WITH 
UPPER HEIGHTS BUILDING ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES WHILE DIFFUSE 
BOUNDARY DROPS SOUTH OF TENNESSEE. STAYED CLOSE TO IF NOT JUST UNDER 
SUGGESTED GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

945 AM EDT THU JUN 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...MOST CONSISTENT FEATURE FROM YESTERAY IS THE AMOUNT OF

MAX TEMPS ARE REACHED THIS AFTERNOON...SO RAIN CHANCES FROM PREVIOUS

THIS AFTERNOON...AS PARAMETERS LOOK LESS IMPRESSIVE THAN EVEN 
YESTERDAY.

SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW BROKEN TO OVERCAST 
CLOUD COVER IN PLACE THIS MORNING. THIS MAY SLOW WARMING AND LIMIT 
INSTABILITY AT LEAST EARLY. WILL CONSIDER ADJUSTING MAX TEMPS DOWN A 
FEW DEGREES.

ALSO...WILL NUDGE SKY COVER UP A BIT IN FORECAST GRIDS TO TREND AWAY 
FROM MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES...AND CLEAN UP A FEW WEATHER/POP GRID 
DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

211 
FXUS64 KMRX 100805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT THU JUN 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS PASSES OVERHEAD 
TODAY AND SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT IS STILL WEAK AND DISORGANIZED OVER 
MOST OF THE AREA, WITH HIGH PRESSURE TO SOUTH AND WEAKLY 
ANTI-CYCLONIC FLOW CURVES OVER TOP. WINDS WILL BE A LITTLE STRONGER 
IN THE NORTHEAST SO THAT SFC CONVERGENCE WILL BE SOMEWHAT LIMITE, 
ESPECIALLY WITH NEXT UPSTREAM FRONT FAR TO THE WEST OVER THE GREAT 
PLAINS. HOWEVER, LOW RH IS VERY HIGH WITH DEWPOINTS NEAR 70 AND LOW 
70S FAR SOUTH. ALSO PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES BETWEEN 1.60 AND 1.8 
OR AROUND 160-180% OF NORMAL. "FORTUNATELY", THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD 
COVER SHOULD LIMIT SUNSHINE A BIT AND KEEP TEMPS FROM RISING TOO 
HIGH TOO FAST. THE NAM FCST SOUNDING FOR ALL THREE ASOS STATIONS 
INDICATES A NEARLY ISOTHERMAL COLUMN FOR LIMITED INSTABILITY. WOULD 
NOT RULE OUT HAVING TO ISSUE SOME SPS'S OR EVEN SOME SVR'S FOR LATER 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING, MAINLY FOR GUSTY WINDS. SPEED OF 
MOVEMENT OF STORMS WILL BE ON THE ORDER OF 10-15 KNOTS SO LOCALIZED 
HEAVY RAINS ARE A DISTINCT POSSIBILITY. HAVE TAPERED POPS OFF FROM 
LIKELY SOUTH/CHANCE NORTH GRADUALLY STARTING AT 00Z UNTIL ABOUT 04Z, 
WHEN RESIDUAL DAY TIME WARMTH SHOULD LESSEN THE LIFT. DID KEEP 
CLOUDS IN OVERNIGHT AS I SEE NO REDUCTION IN RH. HOT AND HUMID, WARM 
OVERNIGHT. WELCOME TO SUMMER.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A DISSIPATING BOUNDARY
WILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY WITH PLENTY OF VERY WARM...MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR ACROSS
THE REGION. WILL MAINTAIN HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY
WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...UPPER RIDGE WILL STRENGTHEN OVER THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...BUT AMOUNT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY TO KEEP
AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION GOING...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...ANOTHER FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA
WITH UPPER RIDGE FLATTENING...SO CONTINUED CHANCE OF STORMS...AGAIN
WITH THE MAIN COVERAGE OVER THE HIGH ELEVATIONS.

A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ALMOST EACH
DAY DUE TO THE MODERATE INSTABILITY. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING
WINDS AND TORRENTIAL RAINS PRODUCING LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING.

MENTION CB AT THOSE SITES IN THE AFTERNOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 091922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT WED JUN 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...INITIAL BAND OF CONVECTION 
HAS MOVED EAST THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA...WITH ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED RE-DEVELOPMENT NOTED OVER WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA (AND ALSO OVER CENTRAL KY AND MIDDLE TN). ACTUAL COLD FRONT IS 
STILL WELL UPSTREAM...PROBABLY NOT AS FAR EAST AS FRONTAL PROG CHART 
FOR 18Z. OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES...SOME UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...AND DAYTIME 
INSTABILITY SHOULD KEEP SCATTERED CONVECTION GOING WELL INTO THE 
EVENING HOURS. WEAK COLD FRONT PROGGED TO SAG SOUTH OVERNIGHT...SO 
NOT ABLE TO REMOVE POPS.

OTHERWISE...AIRMASS REMAINS MOIST AND UNSTABLE THROUGH THESE SHORT 
TERM PERIODS. ADJUSTED POP/WX GRIDS IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS POPS...
WITH AN ATTEMPT TO DETERMINE WHERE BOUNDARY MAY BE LOCATED EACH 
PERIOD. BIGGEST CHANGE TO FORECAST GRIDS WAS FOR THURSDAY...AS PRIOR 
POPS WERE QUITE MINIMAL. APPEARS TO BE TOO MUCH MOISTURE AROUND EACH 
DAY TO REACH THE LOWER 90S...SO STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS MAX TEMP 
GRIDS. MIN TEMPS ALSO ADJUSTED UP SLIGHTLY...GIVEN THE FACT THAT WE 
DON'T GET A REAL AIRMASS CHANGE. 

RAINFALL SO FAR TODAY HAS NOT BEEN THAT HEAVY...SO WON'T MENTION 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS FOR TONIGHT. WILL NEED TO MONITOR STORMS REST OF 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ESPECIALLY IF MAX TEMPS PUSH INTO THE 
MID OR UPPER 80S OVER THE NEXT 2 TO 3 HOURS. GUSTY WINDS PROBABLY
MAIN THREAT...IN LINE WITH LOCAL STORM REPORTS FROM NEIGHBORING
OFFICES. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
SATURDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE LINGERS. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SUNDAY WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  A 
FRONT TRACKS ACROSS THE CWA ON MONDAY. WITH A DECENT MOISTURE 
INDICATED...WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE ACROSS THE CWA.  HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AS MUCH OR MORE OF A THREAT THAN LARGE HAIL TODAY...WHILE DAMAGING 
WINDS COULD OCCUR WITH THE STRONGER STORMS.

TWEAK SOME HOURLY GRIDS TO BETTER REFLECT OBSERVATIONS...AND MAY 
NUDGE POPS UP ABOUT 10 PERCENT MORE. MAX TEMP FORECAST MAY NEED A

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EDT WED JUN 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES ALONG THE 
EAST COAST AND SOUTHEAST STATES WITH LOW PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES. A COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM 
NORTHERN ILLINOIS SOUTHWEST TOWARD THE TEXAS PANHANDLE. OVERNIGHT 
SKIES BECAME MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS AS 
MOISTURE HAS INCREASED FROM THE SOUTHWEST. THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES 
OVER THE CENTRAL STATES AND SPREADING ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY AND LOWER OHIO VALLEY WERE NOW MOVING INTO THE LOWER 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AS WELL. SHOWERS WERE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THE AIRMASS WAS MOSTLY 
STABLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BUT SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE ACROSS MIDDLE 
TN AND CENTRAL KY. EXPECTING THE EARLY MORNING CONVECTION OVER 
WESTERN KY AND TN TO PUT OUT OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES ACROSS NORTHWESTERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON AND 
BE A FOCUS FOR ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT AS THE AIRMASS BECOMES MORE 
UNSTABLE. STRONGEST SHEAR TO THE NW OF FORECAST AREA PER SPC 
OUTLOOK. LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING ACTIVITY SHOULD REACH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS POSSIBLY IN THE FORM OF ANOTHER MCS LIKE HAS 
BEEN SEEN THE LAST COUPLE DAYS TO THE NW. HEAVY RAINFALL ALSO A 
THREAT WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES OF ALMOST 2.0 INCHES THIS 
AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING. PUT HEAVY RAINFALL MENTION IN NORTHERN 
ZONES AND SMOKY MOUNTAIN GROUP WHICH WILL CONTINUE INTO THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS. CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER MAY HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN 
A COUPLE DEGREES WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUDS SPREADING INTO FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING. THIS MAY TEMPER SEVERE THREAT AS WELL. GRADUALLY 
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY AFTERNOON. 
THEN TONIGHT THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY BARELY SINKS INTO THE CWA EARLY 
THURSDAY MORNING SO CONTINUE HIGH POPS FIRST HALF OF TONIGHT EASTERN 
SECTIONS BEFORE DROPPING TO CHANCE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LARGE, YET DIRTY, UPPER 
RIDGE, EXTENDS FROM THE GMEX NORTHWARD INTO SOUTHERN AND SOUTHEAST 
US. A SERIES OF RELATIVELY WEAK SHORT WAVES MOVE ACROSS THE TOP OF 
THE RIDGE. IN ADDITION, OLD OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM CENTRAL US 
MCC/MCS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION. TEMPS SHOULD BE HOT ENOUGH TO 
TRIGGER CONVECTION EACH DAY, AND SFC-H5 RH STAYS IN PLACE OVER AREA 
THROUGH THE PERIOD UNTIL THE END. HAVE THEREFORE RAISED POPS A TAD 
IN THE NEAR TERM AND LEFT THE REST LARGELY ALONE. ADJUSTED TEMPS A 
BIT TO ACCOUNT FOR COORDINATION WITH SURROUNDING AREAS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE JUN 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...AFTER A GENERALLY

SEVERE WEATHER FOR TOMORROW BY SPC. BOUNDARY HAS HAD HISTORY OF

OUT. BOUNDARY SINKS JUST SOUTH OF OUR CWA BY EARLY THURSDAY TAKING 
BULK OF PRECIP WITH IT. HAVE OPTED FOR LIKELY POPS FOR THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY BEFORE TAPERING TO CHANCE WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT START OF THIS
PERIOD...WE FIND A LARGE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE GULF MEX THAT EXTENDS
NORTHWARD INTO OUR AREA WITH A WEAK UPPER SHORT WAVE TROUGH TRYING
TO PENETRATE THE WESTERN AND NWRN PORTIONS OF THE RIDGE. MODELS
AGREE THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL NOT BE A MAJOR PLAYER IN OUR AREA...DUE
TO EITHER WEAKENING OR HAVING THE HEART OF THE SYSTEM PASSING
MAINLY TO OUR NORTH FRIDAY-SATURDAY. AN OLD SURFACE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY WILL BE CLOSE TO THE AREA AS WELL ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY
THAT COULD SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR CONVECTION. RIGHT NOW IT LOOKS LIKE
THIS BOUNDARY WILL BE MAINLY TO OUR SOUTH ON THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY...SO I HAVE THE POP GRADIENTS ORIENTED WITH HIGHER CHANCES
SOUTH. AS THE UPPER TROF PASSES TO OUR NORTH ON SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY...THE POPS ARE HIGHER TO THE NORTH. THE BEST COVERAGE OF
POPS IS ON MONDAY WITH THE ESTIMATED FRONTAL PASSAGE CENTERED ON
THAT TIME PERIOD...PER FAVORED ECMWF. THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO BE
FAIRLY AGGRESSIVE FOR SO LATE IN THE SEASON. AFTER THE FROPA THE
FORECAST IS DRY FOR TUESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.

FOR TEMPS HAVE GONE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE WITH A SLIGHTLY WARMER MINS 
JUST PRIOR TO THE FROPA AND SLIGHTLY COOLER MINS JUST AFTER.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT TUE JUN 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...RIDGE OVER AREA WILL KEEP US DRY THROUGH TODAY, BUT
SHORT WAVE MOVING OVER TOP OF IT WILL AFFECT MAINLY THE FAR
NORTHEAST SECTIONS LATE TONIGHT AND VERY EARLY WEDNESDAY WITH
MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND A STRAY THUNDERSTORM. A WEAK 
SWIRL OF CLOUDS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS TONIGHT
WITH A TENDENCY TO CREATE SOME WEAK UPSLOPE FROM THE SOUTHEAST AND
A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDER. LOWERED MAX TEMPS
TODAY IN LIGHT OF EXPECTED MIDDLE AND HIGH CLOUDS GAUZING THE SUN A BIT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS 
WILL BE BACK IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF A COLD 
FRONT. SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGION 
WEDNESDAY WITH BEST COVERAGE OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS. COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY. THEN RIDGING BEGINS BUILDING ALOFT WHICH WILL KEEP MOIST 
AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS LEFT OVER FROM THE FRONT. STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY AND POSSIBLY THURSDAY WITH THE MAIN CONCERN
BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS AND HEAVY RAINS CAUSING LOCALIZED 
FLASH FLOODING. FOR FRIDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED UPPER AND 
SURFACE RIDGING CONTINUES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A VERY WARM AND 
MOIST UNSTABLE AIRMASS REMAINS WITH AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION 
LIKELY. THE BEST COVERAGE IS EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
ADJACENT FOOTHILLS.

DEVELOP OVER THE AREA BOTH DAYS WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING
DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS AND TORRRENTIAL RAINS CAUSING LOCALIZED
FLASH FLOODING. WBZ IS QUITE HIGH WHICH WILL LIMIT LARGE HAIL CHANCES.

FOR THE WEEKEND THROUGH MONDAY...UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS INTO
THE FORECAST AREA...BUT VERY WARM...MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS
REMAINS DO DIURNAL CONVECTION LIKELY. GREATEST COVERAGE ACROSS THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS.

FOLLOWED MEX MOS CLOSELY THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE OUT OF THE

FROM AROUND SOUTH MIDDLE TN NORTHEAST TO THE PANHANDLE OF MD. SPEED 
OF SOUTHEASTWARD MOVEMENT OF LINE HAS IT MOVED OUT OF FORECAST AREA 
BY BETWEEN, SAY, 7 AND 9 PM EDT. ANY THUNDERSTORMS COULD PRODUCE 
MINOR OUTFLOWS WHICH COULD STILL WARRANT SPS STATUS OR EVEN AN 
ISOLATED SVR WITH GUSTS. WHILE HEAVY RAIN IS STILL LIKELY WITH 
THUNDER AND HIGH PW'S SPEED OF CELLS AND ORIENTATION/DIRECTION OF 
MOVEMENT OF LINE SHOULD PROHIBIT MUCH FLOODING, EXCEPT IN VERY 
ISOLATED INSTANCES. LOW CLOUDS ALL BUT DISAPPEAR WITH FROPA AND THIS 
LEAVES ONLY MIDDLE AND HIGH CLOUDS. HAVE KEPT SOME CLOUDINESS IN ALL 
NIGHT WHICH WILL HELP TO INHIBIT DENSE FOG FORMATION, ALONG WITH 
DIMINISHING WINDS AND LARGE-ISH DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS. LOWERED MINS 
OVERNIGHT A COUPLE DEGREES, AND ADJUSTED MONDAY MAXES MORE IN LINE 
WITH NAM.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AFTER BRIEF DRY PERIOD 
TO START LONG TERM...ANOTHER BOUNDARY WILL BE PUSHED SOUTH BY 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THIS FEATURE WILL BE IN OUR GENERAL 
VICINITY BY MID WEEK AND PROVIDE FOCUS FOR AT LEAST SCATTERED 
CONVECTION. THUS HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS WITH HIGHEST CHANCE 
GRADED TOWARD THE NORTHERN ZONES ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS DEPICT 
BOUNDARY TO DISSIPATE AS AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS. ANTICIPATE CONVECTION TO BECOME MORE DIURNAL IN 
NATURE AS THIS PROCESS UNFOLDS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE CLOSELY. TEMPS PROJECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM ESPECIALLY AS UPPER RIDGING BUILDS OVER THE 
REGION.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN JUN 6 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST 
THROUGH KENTUCKY THIS MORNING AND INTO THE MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON. 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IN ADVANCE OF FRONT WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS 
THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PW'S WILL 
INCREASE TO ABOVE 1.80. SURFACE DP'S WILL RISE TO ABOVE 70 ACROSS 
WESTERN AND SOUTHERN AREAS THIS MORNING. CLOUD COVER THIS MORNING 
WILL DETERMINE EXTENT OF DESTABILIZATION PRIOR TO ONSET OF 
CONVECTION. INSTABILITY WILL LIKELY BECOME MODERATE. LIFT WILL BE 
WEAK AS 50 KT MID LEVEL JET PUSHES CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA. MAIN 
THREAT WILL BE HEAVY RAIN AND STRONG GUSTY WINDS. A NORTHERN TROF 
WILL MOVE EAST OFF THE AREA EARLY TONIGHT. MODERATE NW JET ON 
BACKSIDE OF TROF SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT TO PUSH CONVECTION THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GOOD LAYER DRYING AND CAA WILL 
BRING RAPID LOWERING OF DP'S AND COOL TEMPS TO NEAR NORMAL 
OVERNIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WILL BE IN A DRY 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME ON MONDAY.  FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE ZONAL 
WITH MODELS TRENDING TOWARD KEEP THE MAIN STORM TRACK TO OUR NORTH 
ON TUESDAY.  HAVE ALSO TRENDED FORECAST FOR THIS AND HAVE LOWERED 
POPS...KEEPING A SLIGHT CHANCE WORDING OVER NORTHERN AREAS.  BY 
WEDNESDAY AND CONTINUING INTO THURSDAY...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY DROPS 
THROUGH THE AREA.  WEAK DISTURBANCES AS WELL AS A POSSIBLE MCS WILL 
MOVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY...PROVIDING SCATTERED CONVECTION TO THE 
AREA.  MODELS BEGIN TO DIFFER SUBSTANTIALLY FOR THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW.  OVERALL...LOOK TO SEE A COUPLE 
OF WEAK IMPULSES MOVE THROUGH AND WILL MAKE LITTLE CHANGE TO THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...KEEPING LOW POP FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  AS FOR 
TEMPS...GUIDANCE LOOKED GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

WATCH FOR WILL BE EXACTLY HOW FAR SOUTH FRONT MAKES IT BEFORE
EITHER STALLING RIGHT OVER US, OR DISSIPATING. THIS TIME OF YEAR
THIS IT IS DIFFICULT FOR FRONTS TO STAY INTACT THIS FAR SOUTH.
THAT SAID, THE PROBLEM FOR THUNDERSTORMS APPEARS TO BE THE
POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING RAINS IN URBAN AREAS AND SMALL STREAMS. SOME
ISOLATED BORDERLINE SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAY OCCUR WITH DAMAGING
STRAIGHT LINE WINDS THE BIGGEST ISSUE.

HAVE ALSO ADJUSTED POPS DOWN AS IT APPEARS COVERAGE WILL NOT BE AS
WIDESPREAD AS PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT, THOUGH DID KEEP SOME LIKELIES IN
THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. ALSO, ADJUSTED BOTH MAX/MIN TEMPS DOWN A
HAIR.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
STILL GENERALLY AGREE THAT DRIER CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE 
EARLY PART OF THE WORK WEEK AS REGION COMES UNDER INFLUENCE OF 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. UPPER FLOW WILL GRADUALLY TRANSITION TO A
NEARLY ZONAL FLOW BY MIDWEEK. MODELS DEPICT ANOTHER DIFFUSE
BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE NORTH WITH OCCASIONAL MCS
ACTIVITY TRANSLATING ALONG THE BOUNDARY. HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS
FOR MID WEEK WITH HIGHEST CHANCE ALONG NORTHERN TIER ZONES...
DECREASING TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY LATE WORK WEEK AND INTO NEXT WEEKEND
AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS. FOR TEMPS...
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  86  62  86  61 /  20  50  30   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  83  60  83  60 /  20  50  30  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  83  60  83  59 /  20  50  30  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  83  57  81  54 /  20  50  30  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT SAT JUN 5 2010

.DISCUSSION...WILL UP DATE ZONES TO REFLECT TIMING ISSUES ONLY. ALL 
ASPECTS OF THE ZONES LOOK GOOD. THE ONLY REAL "CONCERN" IS THE 
POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND WITH SUCH WEAK 
STEERING WINDS THEY WILL MOVE SLOWLY. VAST MAJORITY OF PLACES WILL 
SEE NO RAIN, BUT THOSE WHO DO GET THE STRAY THUNDERSTORM WILL GET 
SOAKED. SOME ISOLATED BRIEF MINOR FLOODING MAY OCCUR IN CONJUNCTION. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE BETWEEN 175 AND 190% OF NORMAL FOR THE 
DATE, WHICH IS SAYING SOMETHING FOR LATE SPRING/EARLY SUMMER.

OF OUR REGION ON THE PERIPHERY OF UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST INCREASES CHANCES OF MSC ACTIVITY...BUT DETAILS OF TIMING 
AND PLACEMENT OF THESE FEATURES REMAIN MURKY. HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE 
POPS OVER SEVERAL PERIODS THROUGH MUCH OF THE LATTER PORTIONS OF THE 
LONG TERM TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS UNCERTAINTY.

FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE EARLY IN THE LONG 
TERM BUT FAVORED HPC GUIDANCE FOR THE EXTENDED PORTION. APPEARS 
TEMPS WILL MODERATE TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS 
BROAD UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN CONUS.

AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 

EXPECT FOCUS OF AFTERNOON SHRA/TSRA TO REMAIN ACROSS MY SOUTHERN
COUNTIES AND BELIEVE CURRENT FORECAST HAS A DECENT HANDLE ON PRECIP
FORECAST. AM A LITTLE CONCERNED ABOUT AMOUNT OF MOISTURE INFLUX
INTO SOUTHERN COUNTIES AND HEAVY RAINFALL WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED
DURING THE AFTERNOON/INTO EARLY EVENING HOURS. 12Z OHX SOUNDING
INDICATED CAPE VALUES ABOVE 3600 J/KG AND AN LI VALUE NEARLY AT -8
ALONG WITH PWAT VALUE OF 1.66 INCHES. ANY STRONG STORMS WILL LIKELY
PRODUCE MORE OF STRONGER WINDS AND HEAVY RAINFALL...AS FREEZING LEVEL
INDICATED AT AROUND 14KFT.

WILL ONLY BE MAKING MINOR CHANGES TO GOING FORECAST. TEMPS LOOK
GENERALLY GOOD AREA WIDE.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...18Z SURFACE...IR/VISIBLE AND

EXPECT THE BOUNDARY TO BE THE BASIC FOCUSING MECHANISM AND FOR IT
TO SLOWLY SHIFT SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA WITH TIME. WILL
KEEP IN SLIGHT/CHANCE POPS FOR EVENING AND THEN WILL KEEP IN CHANCE
POPS FOR FRIDAY WITH SLIGHTLY BETTER EXPECTED CHANCES FOR SHRA/TSRA
THAN TODAY. NAM MAY HAVE A BETTER TIMING OF PRECIP CHANCES FOR
FRIDAY THAN GFS...SO AM LEANING TOWARD NAM MODEL SOLUTION. 

TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD...SO WILL BE MAKING ONLY SLIGHT CHANGES
OVERALL TO FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...PATTERN TO REMAIN 
GENERALLY UNSETTLED THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD PER MODEL AND 
ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. DIFFUSE SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL LURK IN THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AND A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES WILL 
MAINTAIN SCATTERED...MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION OVER THE WEEKEND. 
HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY POPS FOR SUNDAY AS MOST GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
PROJECT PRECIP FOR OUR REGION IN ADDITION TO THE OPERATIONAL MODELS 
AND SREF. HAVE ALSO CONTINUED BRIEF DRY PERIOD FROM MONDAY THROUGH 
EARLY TUESDAY AS UPPER FLOW TRANSITIONS TO NORTHWESTERLY FLOW. 
MODELS GENERALLY AGREE BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM BUT DIFFER SOMEWHAT 
ON THE DETAILS...LEADING TO LOWER CONFIDENCE FOR THAT TIME FRAME. 
THUS HAVE GENERALLY NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST. FOR TEMPS...DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX
GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART.

FXUS64 KMRX 030725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT THU JUN 3 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LIKED THE WRF DEPICTION OF 
EXPECTED WEATHER BETTER THAN THE GFS TODAY AS IT SEEMS TO BE PICKING 
UP ON THE EARLY MORNING LOWER OHIO VALLEY CONVECTION WHILE THE GFS 
IS A LITTLE BEHIND THE TIMES. BUMPED UP POPS A BIT ACROSS THE MAJOR 
TERRAIN AREAS TODAY BUT MORE SPECIFICALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND PART OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. IN THESE AREAS SHORT WAVE DRIVING CONVECTION ACROSS THE 
MIDWEST MAY BE ABLE TO CLOSE IN ON THE REGION WITH OUTFLOW BOUNDARY 
ENHANCED PRECIP LATER IN THE DAY. APPLIED AREAS OF FOG AGAIN TONIGHT 
IN THE WELL MOISTENED LOW LEVEL ATMOSPHERE PROGGED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. TWEAKED POPS FOR THIS EVENING BASED ON THIS IDEA AS 
WELL. STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE NAM TEMP GUIDANCE TODAY WHILE 
ADJUSTING A TAD TOWARD THE MAV NUMBERS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FOR FRIDAY...A STATIONARY 
FRONT WILL BE ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY WITH PLENTY OF 
WARM...MOIST...AND UNSTABLE AIR OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MAIN LIFT 
WILL BE FROM LOCAL TERRAIN.  FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...AN 
UPPER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES PULLING 
FRONT BACK TOWARD THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL 
HAVE THE HIGHER POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA-NORTHEAST TENNESSEE
AND ALONG THE MOUNTAINS.

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT WILL PULL ACROSS THE 
LOWER OHIO VALLEY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR SUNDAY.  WILL CALL 
FOR HIGH CHANCE-LIKELY POPS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON-EVENING. A BETTER 
CHANCE FOR SEVERE STORMS FOR SUNDAY AS WELL GIVEN CAPES BETWEEN 
2500-3500 J/KG. ALSO...WEAK DIVERGENCE ALONG NOTED ALOFT AND 
STEERING WINDS WILL ALSO BE STRONGER WITH 850MB JET OF 30-35KTS. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME MID-LEVEL DRIER AIR WHICH WILL ALSO HELP 
ENHANCE DOWNDRAFT STRENGTH. WILL HIGHLIGHT WITHIN THE HWO.

FOR MONDAY...FRONT PULLS SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND BECOMES 
STATIONARY OVER THE GULF COAST STATES. DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR 
DEPICTED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...SO WILL CALL FOR A DRY 
DAY.

FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN-CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY-GULF COAST STATES 
WILL SET THE STAGE FOR MCS DEVELOPMENT. AT THIS TIME...AIRMASS IS 
TOO STABLE FOR CONVECTION MONDAY NIGHT...BUT ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER 
THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY MAY BE ENOUGH TO PULL THE REMAINS OF A 
MCS INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY...MAINLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...FRONT TO OUR SOUTH WILL PULL 
CLOSER NORTH WITH INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT.  WILL INCREASE CHANCES 
OF CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY FOR EAST TENNESSEE. HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 021936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT WED JUN 2 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...LATEST 88-D IMAGES FROM KHTX-
KMRX RADARS INDICATE THAT WIDELY SCATTERED SHRA/TSRA HAS BEEN
FORMING FROM NEAR CHA-EXTENDING NORTHEAST ALONG I-75 TO NEAR MCMINN
COUNTY AND THEN FURTHER EAST AND SOUTHEAST INTO WESTERN NORTH
CAROLINA. PRECIP FORMING IN MORE UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH HIGHER
CAPE VALUES RANGING FROM 1500-2000 J/KG. WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...EXCEPT FOR THE SMOKYS
AREA AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...WHERE WILL CONTINUE WITH 30 PERCENT
CHANCE POPS.

MAY HAVE SOME SCATTERED LOW FOG AT SOME LOCATIONS OVERNIGHT...SO
WILL ADD IN A MENTION OF PATCHY FOG IN ZONES TONIGHT.

HAVE DECIDED TO LOWER POPS SOMEWHAT FOR THURSDAY...AS MODELS ARE
PROGGING THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO ONLY MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TO NEAR
THE OHIO RIVER DURING THE DAY. WILL DROP POPS INTO THE 30-40 PERCENT
CHANCE CATEGORY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TO ACCOUNT FOR THE SLOWING
DOWN OF THE BOUNDARY TO THE NORTHWEST. HAVE UPPED TEMPS AROUND A
CATEGORY WITH A LITTLE MORE EXPECTED SUNSHINE.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
FRONTAL SYSTEM THAT HAS BEEN POISED TO THE NORTH LOOKS LIKE IT WILL 
STAY NORTH THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS IT WAFFLES ABOUT THE OHIO RIVER.  
FINALLY ON SUNDAY IT LOOKS LIKE IT SHOULD GET A GOOD PUSH AND MAKE 
IT THROUGH THE AREA.  BY SUNDAY...DEW POINTS SHOULD BE RIDING HIGH 
WITH THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S COMMON AHEAD OF THE FRONT...AND WITH 
MLCAPE VALUES POSSIBLY GETTING TO NEAR 2000 J/KG.  WE'RE STILL 
SEVERAL DAYS AWAY...BUT THERE IS SOME LIKELIHOOD OF A SEVERE 
THREAT IF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE OCCURS DURING THE AFTERNOON OR EVENING 
HOURS.

AFTER THE FRONT PASSES...HAVE GONE WITH A DRY FORECAST THOUGHT 
TUESDAY MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE FILLS IN...HOWEVER...WITH IT THIS 
LATE INTO THE SPRING...THE FRONT AND MOISTURE DON'T GET VERY FAR 
AWAY.  NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL ALREADY BE OCCURRING BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON AND INTO NEXT WEDNESDAY AS THE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
RETURN.

BEFORE THE FRONT APPROACHES...FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...THE AIR MASS 
WILL BE UNSTABLE.  IT LOOKS LIKE ON FRIDAY THERE MAY BE A LITTLE 
MORE ORGANIZED LIFT...SO I HAVE A LITTLE HIGHER POPS ON FRIDAY THAN 
ON SATURDAY.

.SHORT TERM...PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS PRODUCING PATCHY

EVENING. CONVECTION WILL DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)... A TYPICAL SUMMERTIME
PATTERN WILL CHARACTERIZE THE REST OF THE WEEK...WITH A WEAK FLOW
ALOFT AND A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS IN THE LOW LEVELS. THUS SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE GENERALLY SCATTERED AROUND THE AREA
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS THROUGH SATURDAY.
HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS ON THURSDAY AS
WEAK UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE AREA. THE ENTRANCE REGION OF A
300 MB JET STREAK OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS MAY PROVIDE LIKELY
POPS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING.

A MORE SIGNIFICANT TROUGH AND FRONTAL PASSAGE IS EXPECTED ON SUNDAY 
AS THE POLAR JET DIVES SOUTHWARD OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS. GFS...ECMWF..AND THE GEM ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE FROPA OCCURRING SUNDAY EVENING. WILL RAISE POPS TO A HIGH CHANCE 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. A DEEP TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE EAST 
COAST...ALLOWING A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS TO BUILD OVER THE AREA. 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY LOOK DRY WITH A DEEP NORTHWEST FLOW AND HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE AREA.

FXUS64 KMRX 011834

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 PM EDT TUE JUN 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK BOUNDARY SLIDING ACROSS 
THE REGION THIS EVENING WILL COMBINE WITH DEEP...ABUNDANT MOISTURE 
AND A WEAKLY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE AND CONTINUE TO GENERATE SCATTERED 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  
IMPROVING CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT AS THE BOUNDARY PULLS 
AWAY FROM THE AREA.  SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN ON WEDNESDAY 
...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT CONVECTION AND HAVE KEPT POPS FAIRLY LOW.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RESIDUAL MOISTURE 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S EACH DAY WILL CREATE PLENTY OF INSTABILITY TO 
SUPPORT AT LEAST DIURNAL CONVECTION. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TO OUR NORTH 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL WARRANT LIKELY POPS THURSDAY...WITH 
SCATTERED COVERAGE LINGERING INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. HARD TO FINE ANY 
DRY PERIODS UNTIL NEXT MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WITH AT LEAST ISOLATED 
TO SCATTERED DAYTIME CONVECTION FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT ON SUNDAY COULD LEAD TO 60 PERCENT OR BETTER COVERAGE...BUT 
FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE WITH GOOD CHANCE POPS.

OTHERWISE...MAX AND MIN TEMPS TWEAKED A BIT IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS 
AND TO STAY IN TOLERANCE WITH ADJACENT OFFICES GRIDS. NUDGED SOME 
MIN TEMPS UP UNTIL THE STRONGER COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. ANOTHER CHANGE WAS TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR EARLY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO BETTER MESH WITH GSP AND FFC GRIDS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  67  89  68  88  67 /  20  20  20  60  40

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT TUE JUN 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE AREA OVERNIGHT WILL BE PULLING 
OUT THROUGH THE MORNING. HOWEVER THERE IS A MIDLEVEL TROUGH LOCATED 
NEAR THE MS VALLEY THAT WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA LATER TODAY. WHILE 
FORCING WITH THE TROUGH IS WEAK...IT SHOULD PROVIDE ENOUGH LIFT IN 
THIS MOIST AIR MASS TO DEVELOP SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS TODAY. 
THE PASSAGE OF THE TROUGH WILL PUSH THE MOISTURE AXIS TO OUR SOUTH 
AND EAST FOR WEDNESDAY...AND SOME DRIER AIR IS ABLE TO MOVE INTO THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS. THUS PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE LOWERED TO A LOW 
CHANCE SOUTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH. TEMPS WILL BE WARMER AS 
WELL...REACHING TO NEAR 90 IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. ANOTHER WEAK 
TROUGH WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL 
KEEP POPS IN THE HIGH CHANCE RANGE THIS PERIOD...IN LINE WITH MOS 
GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)... RELATIVELY ACTIVE PERIOD WITH
A SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION AND HANGING AROUND FOR POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE FOCUS FOR FRIDAY
WITH SUGGESTION OF SHORTWAVE TROF TRANSITING THE LOWER TENNESSEE
VALLEY SO USED A 40 PERCENT POP HERE WHILE ADJUSTING BACK TO A 30
PERCENT POP WITH UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING ARRIVAL OF NEXT SIGNIFICANT
UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. TRIED TO
INDICATE BEST CHANCE FOR THIS SYSTEM'S ARRIVAL TO BE SUNDAY WITH
CANADIAN/ECMWF/GFS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD CONCERNING TIMING. FOR
MONDAY WENT WITH ECMWF IDEA OF DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND
DEPARTING UPPER TROF. SO JUST APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP AT THIS
TIME PERIOD. FOR TEMPS TRIED TO STAY AWAY FROM SOME OF THE EXTREMES
SUGGESTED IN GUIDANCE CONCERNING MAX TEMPS DURING POSSIBLY ACTIVE
CONVECTIVE WEEKEND PERIOD.

FLOW TURN TO A MORE WESTERLY DIRECTION BEHIND THE LOW.

REGION ON TUESDAY. WITH DEEP MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH IT...WILL 
CONTINUE THE HIGH CHANCE POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY. MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY...WILL CONTINUE WITH THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT FOLLOWS ON THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. ANOTHER FRONT 
TRACKS INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE 
INDICATED...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH DAYS. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

INCHES BY 20Z MONDAY...AS MOISTURE TRANSPORT FROM THE UPPER LOW
SHIFTS NORTHEAST THROUGH THE AREA. MAY SEE SOME BREAKS IN PRECIP

AND GOOD LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...WILL KEEP A HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR THIS

IN A LINE OF COLD FRONTS SLIDES IN AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME 
FRAME...CONTINUING OUR UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN.  SHOULD BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS FOR SATURDAY...WITH ANOTHER FRONT MAKING ITS WAY INTO THE

DIDN/T STRAY FAR.

FOG AND LOW CLOUDS AT TYS AND CHA ARE EXPECTED TO LIFT
SHORTLY...WITH VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REST OF THE MORNING.
PLENTIFUL MOISTURE TODAY SHOULD PROVIDE FOR NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AROUND TYS AND CHA THIS AFTERNOON...AND SCATTERED
STORMS NEAR TRI. WILL MENTION SHRA AND VCTS WITH VFR CONDTITIONS
FOR NOW...BUT IF THE STORMS MOVE OVER THE TAF SITES...IFR
CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY. AS AN UPPER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES
TOWARD THE AREA TONIGHT...THERE MAY BE ANOTHER PREIOD OF PRECIP
LATE TONIGHT...BRINGING MVFR VIS/CIGS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN MAY 30 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE UPPER LOW OVER MS/AL YESTERDAY WILL DRIFT TOWARD THE NORTHEAST. 
THIS SHOULD POSITION THE DEEP SOUTH-SOUTHEASTERLY MOISTURE FEED 
DIRECTLY OVER THE TN VALLEY OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. MODEL 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE AROUND 1.75 OVER THIS PERIOD. WHILE 
UPPER FORCING IS WEAK...IT WILL NOT TAKE MUCH LIFT TO GET SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS STARTED...AND MODELS INDICATE SOME 850 MB 
CONVERGENCE OVER THE AREA TODAY. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS SOUTH TO 
CHANCE POPS NORTH. WARMEST TEMPS TODAY WILL BE IN THE NORTH. THE 
POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW OVER NORTHERN AL TONIGHT ALONG WITH THE 
DEEP MOISTURE SHOULD PROVIDE ENOUGH LIFT TO KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
GOING AFTER SUNSET. DUE TO THE LACK OF INSTABILITY...SEVERE STORMS 
ARE NOT EXPECTED TODAY...BUT HEAVY RAIN AND LOCALIZED FLOODING MAY 
BE THE MAIN CONCERN.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKS ACROSS THE REGION BRINGING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON  
MONDAY. WITH THE INCREASING MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL BUMP UP POPS 
TO LIKELY FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON. A FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH 
PERIODS. MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH THE LOW CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE EASTERN AREAS. ANOTHER FRONT FOLLOWS ON THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS ON SATURDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A 
MORE MOIST AIR MASS (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS HIGHER MOISTURE CONTENT WILL COMBINE 
WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER MID LEVEL TEMPS TO PRODUCE A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL AN INVERTED-V PROFILE DEVELOPING AGAIN THIS 
AFTERNOON...SO THINK THERE WILL BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY FOR STRONG 
DOWNBURST WINDS WITH SOME STORMS. SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL THAT THE 
OVERALL WIND FLOW WILL BE VERY LIGHT TODAY...SO EXPECT SOME STORMS 
TO PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL DUE TO THEIR SLOW MOVEMENT. 
CURRENT FORECAST MENTIONING LIKELY POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON LOOKS 
GOOD...AS AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY SINKS 
SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 280800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT FRI MAY 28 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME MORE CYCLONIC TODAY AS A 
WEAK UPPER LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE AREA FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. A 
SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW OFF THE ATLANTIC AT 850 MB SHOULD ALSO HELP 
SUPPLY ADDITIONAL MOISTURE THIS AFTERNOON. THOUGH THESE CHANGES TO 
THE PATTERN ARE WEAK AND SUBTLE...THEY SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO INCREASE 
THE CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO LIKELY ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
AREA. A LACK OF SHEAR SHOULD KEEP STORMS MAINLY OF THE PULSE OR 
MULTICELL VARIETY. HOWEVER A FEW SEVERE STORMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT 
GIVEN THE GOOD CAPE. MOST OF THE STORMS SHOULD DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET 
AS THERE IS LITTLE UPPER SUPPORT TO KEEP THE STORMS GOING 
OVERNIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP JUST A SLIGHT OR LOW CHANCE POP GOING AS 
THERE WILL STILL BE PLENTY OF MOISTURE ALONG WITH LINGERING 
BOUNDARIES. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
LINGERING ACROSS THE REGION BRINGING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE FIRST FEW DAYS OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL BE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS.  A FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND LINGERS 
INTO WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS.  
A SHORTWAVE FOLLOWS ON THURSDAY...MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO KEPT ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 271837
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT THU MAY 27 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A DIFFUSE AND POORLY-DEFINED FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE LINGERING OVER 
THE WESTERN ATLANTIC OFF THE CAROLINA COAST. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
IS PROGGED TO GRADUALLY SINK INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AND 
COULD POSSIBLY TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION THROUGH THE NIGHT- 
TIME HOURS. A STAGNANT SUMMERLIKE PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH 
DAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL 
BECOME MORE DIFLUENT ON FRIDAY...RESULTING IN A BETTER COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION. IN ADDITION...A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
OVER THE DEEP SOUTH BY SATURDAY...HELPING TO TRIGGER ADDITIONAL 
SCATTERED CONVECTION THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO 
FOLLOW PERSISTENCE WITH MINS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH GRADUALLY 
LOWERING MAXES EACH DAY DUE TO THE INCREASING COVERAGE OF CLOUDS AND 
CONVECTION.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN IN 
STORE FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL BRING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION ON SUNDAY...WITH A BETTER CHANCE MONDAY. 
A WEAKENING COLD FRONT SLIDES IN FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THERE 
WILL BE A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW DURING THE 
REST OF THE EXTENDED...FOR NOW...CONTINUED WITH LOW POPS WEDNESDAY 
AND KEPT THURSDAY DRY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EDT THU MAY 27 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE LINGERING 
OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC OFF THE CAROLINA COAST...WHICH WAS 
CONTINUING TO PRODUCE A MOIST NORTHEASTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. MODELS REVEAL A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING AGAIN 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH DRIER AIR (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) IN THE LOWER 
LEVELS PRODUCING A MORE PRONOUNCED INVERTED-V PROFILE FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. THIS INVERTED-V PROFILE WILL RESULT IN THE POSSIBILITY OF 
STRONG DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS WITH ANY STORM THAT DEVELOPS THIS 
AFTERNOON. CURRENT TEMP FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL 
PLAN TO RAISE MAXES A LITTLE FOR THIS AFTERNOON...DUE TO THE DRIER 
AIR IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING MAINLY FOR 
SOME MINOR WORDING TWEAKS...AND WILL UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME STRONG DAMAGING WINDS 
WITH A FEW STORMS THIS AFTERNOON.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...06Z SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES

MISSOURI. 

FOR TODAY...WILL CONTINUE WITH PERSISTENCE INVOLVING THE FORECAST...
AS EXPECT ISOLATED/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR AREA MUCH LIKE WEDNESDAY.
NAM/GFS MODELS CONTINUE TO PUSH WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE
OHIO RIVER BY 00Z TONIGHT AND INTO SOUTHERN KENTUCKY BY 12Z FRIDAY.
MAY HAVE TO WATCH NORTHERN PLATEAU AND KENTUCKY BORDER COUNTIES BY
END OF SHORT TERM FORECAST PERIOD FOR POTENTIAL FOR CHANCE POPS...
BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY OF TIMING...WILL KEEP POPS IN SLIGHT CHANCE
POP CATEGORY. TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY GOOD FOR FORECAST AREA AS PER
GOING FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE
SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FROM THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY ACROSS THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY FRIDAY...THEN TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FOR SATURDAY.

ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO THE
NORTHERN GREAT LAKES SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY LIFTING THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SHORT-WAVE BACK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY
AND MONDAY NIGHT. OVERALL...A CONTINUED CHANCE OF CONVECTION
THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH BEST CHANCES FRIDAY AND
AGAIN MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT PULLS THROUGH THE REGION. INSTABILITY WILL
BE SUFFICIENT TO PRODUCE STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS FRIDAY
AFTERNOON-EVENING AS WELL AS MONDAY AFTERNOON-EVENING.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.
