756 
FXUS64 KMRX 261849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT WED MAY 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC OFF 
THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES REGION. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
EVENTUALLY DISSIPATE IN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...WITH THE 
ATLANTIC LOW CONTINUING TO PRODUCE A MOIST NORTHEASTERLY FLOW ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT...EXPECT A 
SUMMERLIKE PATTERN TO CONTINUE WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING EACH DAY. THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN ISOLATED 
CONVECTION THIS EVENING AND REDEVELOPING BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. 
MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME MORE 
DIFLUENT ON FRIDAY...RESULTING IN A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT...SINCE THE AIR MASS IS NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE MUCH. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS NOT TOO DISSIMILAR 
IN DEPICTION OF EVENTS IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. 
SOLUTIONS STILL HOLD ONTO A WEAK UPPER LOW DROPPING SLOWLY SOUTH 
THROUGH DIXIE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. CREATED MORE OF A NORTH TO SOUTH 
GRADIENT IN POP FOR CONVECTION ON SATURDAY WITH BETTER CHANCE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AS BACK DOOR FRONT 
SHIFTS FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. HIGHER 
PRESSURE GRADUALLY REPLACES THE PRESSURE WEAKNESS BY SUNDAY INTO 
MONDAY SO EDGED POPS BACK JUST A BIT. BY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
MODELS INDICATE ZONAL FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
COUNTRY WHICH WILL ALLOW ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO PRESS SOUTH 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. THUS...THE CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE A LITTLE 
HIGHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY BY WEDNESDAY AS 
SCATTERED CONVECTION WOULD BE MORE LIKELY TO FORM AHEAD OF THE COOL 
FRONT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

978 
FXUS64 KMRX 260727
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 AM EDT WED MAY 26 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE FORESEEN THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM...THUS PERSISTENCE FORECAST APPEARS BEST APPROACH. 
WEAK NORTHEAST FLOW AROUND UPPER LOW OFF THE SOUTHEAST CONUS COAST 
WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP ATMOSPHERE FAIRLY MOIST THROUGH THE VERTICAL 
COLUMN...BUT INSTABILITY NOT IMPRESSIVE. ANTICIPATE COVERAGE SIMILAR 
TO YESTERDAY WITH ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS BEING MAINLY DIURNAL 
IN NATURE. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR BLEND OF MET AND MAV GUIDANCE 
AS IT REPRESENTED BETTER PERSISTENCE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY...AIRMASS
STABILIZES WITH PWS NEAR 1 INCH AND CAPES GENERALLY BELOW 500 J/KG.
WILL ONLY KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. FOR
FRIDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING SOUTHEAST INTO THE
FORECAST AREA ALONG WITH A SURFACE TROUGH. AIRMASS ALSO
DESTABILIZES...SO WILL RAISE POPS FOR 50-60 PERCENT FOR THE
AFTERNOON-EARLY EVENING. THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE SOUTHEAST
UNITED STATES KEEPING PLENTY OF MOISTURE-INSTABILITY OVER THE AREA
TO CONTINUE 20-40 POPS FOR SATURDAY WITH BEST CHANCES OVER
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA...AND PLATEAU DUE TO
UPSLOPE FLOW.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...UPPER RIDGING WILL DOMINATE PRODUCING
WARMER CONDITIONS...BUT MOISTURE-INSTABILITY REMAINS TO KEEP
CHANCES OF CONVECTION GOING FOR MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR TUESDAY...GFS SUGGEST A FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA...BUT
CONFIDENCE LOW. WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

GENERALLY FLOW MEX MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST...EXCEPT FOR SUNDAY AND
MONDAY. WENT A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN MEX MOS HIGHS DUE TO THE
EXPECTED UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS.

&&

050 
FXUS64 KMRX 251903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT TUE MAY 25 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...A TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA TONIGHT. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES 
POPS FOR TONIGHT. THE ACTIVITY SHOULD END DURING THE EVENING HOURS. 
NO SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED. MORE DIURNAL ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FOR 
WEDNESDAY BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED AGAIN SO CARRIED ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED AGAIN TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES LOOK REASONABLE...SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
SHOW UPPER RIDGE AXIS TO OUR WEST EARLY IN THE PERIOD...WITH SOME 
MOISTURE LINGERING OVER OUR AREA BUT NOT MUCH TO TRIGGER ANY 
PRECIP.  CONSEQUENTLY WILL CARRY ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THU 
AFTERNOON/EVENING.  DECENT AGREEMENT THAT WEAK BACKDOOR COLD FRONT 
WILL SAG INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS.  
UNCERTAINTY RISES FURTHER OUT...AS MODEL AGREEMENT/CONTINUITY ON HOW 
MUCH DRYING WILL OCCUR IS LACKING.  FOR NOW WILL GENERALLY KEEP 
CONTINUITY...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SAT AND DRY SUN...THEN BACK TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE MON AND TUE. GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...BUT WILL MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS...MOST NOTABLY TO 
TRIM SOME HIGH TEMPS A BIT.

645 
FXUS64 KMRX 251407
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EDT TUE MAY 25 2010

.DISCUSSION...TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. CURRENT POPS 
STILL LOOKS REASONABLE.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK.  WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE 
CAROLINA COAST AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES WILL 
PRODUCE DEEP EASTERLY WINDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE 
UPSLOPE FLOW IS PRODUCING SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER WESTERN NORTH 
CAROLINA. HOWEVER...DOWNSLOPING INTO THE VALLEY IS DISSIPATING THE 
SHOWERS BEFORE SPREADING WEST INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS SHOW 
THE AIRMASS BECOMING MARGINALLY UNSTABLE DURING THE AFTERNOON WITH 
CAPES APPROACHING 1000 J/KG. MAIN FORCING WILL BE TERRAIN WITH 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE PRODUCING THE 
BEST CHANCES THERE THIS AFTERNOON-EVENING.

DOWNSLOPING WINDS INTO THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
WILL LIKELY KEEP TRI AND MRX DRY TODAY. TRENDED TOWARD GFS MOS.

CONVECTION WILL DISSIPATE THIS EVENING AFTER LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER LOW OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COAST WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT SOUTHEAST AND AWAY FORM THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE WORK WEEK. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE LINGERS TO 
WARRANT SLIGHT CHANCE OF MAINLY DIURNAL POPS FOR BOTH WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY. A WEAK FRONT SAGS THROUGH THE REGION IN THE LATE FRIDAY 
THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY TIME FRAME. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES IN GOOD 
ENOUGH AGREEMENT WITH THIS FEATURE TO JUSTIFY BUMPING POPS UP INTO 
THE LOW CHANCE CATEGORY. CONTINUED DRY FORECAST FOR LATE WEEKEND AS 
FRONT PUSHES SOUTH OF THE AREA. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY
BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM. THUS DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES FOR
THAT TIME FRAME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             84  61  86  63  91 /  30  10  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  60  86  61  89 /  20  10  20  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  60  86  61  90 /  20  10  20  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              84  56  86  56  88 /  20  10  20  10  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT MON MAY 24 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A TROUGH ENTERING THE REGION

IN THE EASTERN AREAS WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE RESIDES.  WILL KEEP

REASONABLE...SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR.



.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS INDICATE SOME 
MOISTURE LINGERING OVER THE AREA EARLY PART OF THE PERIOD...BUT 
INSTABILITY LOOKS LIMITED.  WILL ONLY CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION THROUGH THU.  WEAK BACKDOOR COLD 
FRONT MAY SLIP SOUTH THROUGH AREA FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MODELS 
NOT IN GREAT AGREEMENT FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD SO 
UNCERTAINTY FOR IS FAIRLY HIGH.  FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN GO DRY FOR THE WEEKEND.  
MAY BE ENOUGH MOISTURE RETURN BY MONDAY FOR SOME CONVECTION 
AGAIN...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ONCE AGAIN. WILL GENERALLY 
GO CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPS EARLY ON...BUT WILL GO CLOSER TO HPC 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR THE LATTER PERIODS GIVEN BIG SWINGS OF MEX MOS 
AND AFOREMENTIONED UNCERTAINTY.

888 
FXUS64 KMRX 241356
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
956 AM EDT MON MAY 24 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING.  PRECIPITATION FROM 
UPPER LOW SHOULD REMAIN ALONG THE EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA TODAY. 
CURRENT POPS LOOK REASONABLE. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE OVER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY NE INTO GREAT LAKES THIS MORNING...WITH UPPER LOW OVER ERN 
NC. SOME LOW CLOUDS JUST TO OUR EAST ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LOW
...WHILE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA. BOUNDARY LAYER 
DRIER THIS MORNING...SO PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT NOT YET UNDERWAY.

PRESENCE OF UPPER LOW TO OUR EAST TODAY WILL CREATE SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
CHANCE POPS ACROSS ERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THERE IS ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY WITH HIGHS HITTING 70S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES...SO 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE...BUT NO STRONG STORMS EXPECTED. 

FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY RIGHT ON TRACK WITH VERY LITTLE TWEAKS. 
WENT CLOSER TO WARMER HIGHS IN WESTERN AREAS...AND CLOSER TO COOLER 
MOS HIGHS IN THE EASTERN AREAS. NO REASON TO STRAY FAR FROM SIMILAR 
MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LOW ALONG SOUTHEAST
COAST EARLY TUESDAY WILL CONTINUE TO BRING MOISTURE INTO THE REGION
FROM THE EAST WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING HOURS. MORE CLOUD COVER TUESDAY
WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN SEVERAL DEGREES. WEDNESDAY THE UPPER
LOW SHIFTS TO THE EAST SO ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. THURSDAY PATTERN STAYS ABOUT THE SAME BUT HIGH
PRESSURE OVER THE NE AND COLD FRONT TO THE NORTH SHIFTS SOUTH
INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS SLIGHTLY FRIDAY. UPPER FLOW SHIFTS
TO THE NW AS COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTH THROUGH THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY AND
FRIDAY NIGHT. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY SHOULD BE DRY AS TROUGH
DEVELOPS ALONG EAST COAST AND EASTERN TN VALLEY AND DRIER AIR MOVES
INTO REGION FROM THE NORTH.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  64  83  61  87 /  10  10  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  86  63  83  62  86 /  20  10  30  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       86  62  83  62  86 /  10  10  30  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              81  58  82  57  84 /  20  20  30  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT SUN MAY 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGES SW DOWN THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE PERIOD. UPPER LOW SLIDES 
S THROUGH THE CAROLINAS TONIGHT BECOMING ABSORBED BY LARGE SCALE LOW 
OFF THE SE U.S. COAST. DEEP LAYER EASTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS AS AREA 
POISED NW OF BROAD UPPER ATLC LOW. MOISTURE FROM THE ATLC WILL 
INCREASE ACROSS THE CAROLINAS THROUGH THE PERIOD. AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
AND EXTENT OF CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENMT REMAINS IN QUESTION W OF THE E 
TN LINE. AFTN CONVECTION OVER THE MOUNTAINS LOOKS REASONABLE. 
THICKNESS VALUES REMAIN HIGH SO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS CONTINUE. CLOUD 
COVER TUESDAY MAKES TUE MAX SOMEWHAT CHALLENGING AT THIS TIME. 
LEANED AT OR ABOVE GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS WHEN THE HIGHEST INSTABILITY IS 
EXPECTED.  ANOTHER TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY.  
WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS WITH 
THE BEST CHANCE THE AFTERNOON HOURS WHEN THE HIGHEST INSTABILITY IS 
EXPECTED AGAIN. A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON 
FRIDAY...WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE WILL KEEP ONLY LOW 
POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

623 
FXUS64 KMRX 231600
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1200 PM EDT SUN MAY 23 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. WARM WITH 
ISOLATED CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY POSSIBLE ACROSS NE EDGE THIS AFTN. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMNANTS OF LOW CLOUDS LINGER 
ACROSS A FEW SPOTS THIS MORNING...WITH VERY LIGHT WINDS AND RATHER 
HIGH DEW POINT TEMPS. SEEING SOME FOG DEVELOP IN NE TN AND SW VA 
WHERE SOME LIGHT RAINS OCCURRED YESTERDAY...AND VSBYS MAY DROP BELOW 
1 MILE BEFORE DAYBREAK AT LOCATIONS SUCH AS TRI.

OTHERWISE...STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WITH A WARM AND 
MOSTLY DRY FORECAST FOR TODAY. TEMPS HITTING 80S TO LOWER 90S WILL 
CREATE AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS...BUT OPTED TO ONLY INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR EXTREME NE PARTS OF FORECAST AREA. UPPER LOW SETTLING OVER 
THE CAROLINAS BY 12Z MONDAY...WILL MAINLY AFFECT FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY. THUS...DRY FORECAST TONIGHT WITH SOME PATCHY FOG AGAIN.

MAX TEMPS SHOULD STAY A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS...AND I 
TRENDED CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY COOLER NAM MOS FOR MAX TEMP. MOS MINS 
QUITE CLOSE FOR TONIGHT AND FOLLOWED. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER CAROLINAS 
SPREADS MOISTURE WESTWARD INTO NE AND MOUNTAINS AS UPPER RIDGE 
WEAKENS OVER THE SOUTHEAST. HIGHS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER 
MONDAY WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS EAST...AND DRY WEST. MODELS 
DEVELOP SURFACE LOW OFF THE CAROLINA COAST AND KEEPS THIS FEATURE 
SPINNING OFF THE COAST TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LATE FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY HIGH PRESSURE MOVES SOUTH ALONG EAST COAST AND HIGHER 
PRESSURE FILTERS INTO THE TN VALLEY FROM THE NE. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S.

&&

008 
FXUS64 KMRX 221447
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT SAT MAY 22 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL ISSUE TEXT UPDATE TO LOWER POPS
FOR THIS AFTERNOON. ISOLATED CONVECTION REMAINS POSSIBLE ACROSS 
SMOKYS AND NE AREAS. TEMPS LOOK GOOD. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND WEAK 
SURFACE TROUGH CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THIS MORNING...CREATING A WEAK 
LINE OF CONVECTION FROM SOUTH OF BNA NE TO THE NRN PLATEAU INTO 
EXTREME EASTERN KY. SOME SPOTTY SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED IN ADVANCE OF 
THIS LINE...BUT ATMOSPHERE HAS BEEN STABILIZING TO THE POINT OF 
LITTLE IF ANY LIGHTNING AT THIS TIME. BETTER FORCING/LIFT IS FROM E 
KY AND SW VA NORTHWARD...SO CARRIED LIKELY POPS FOR THIS MORNING 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE CORNER OF TN...AND INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY IN 
OTHER AREAS TO BETTER MESH WITH ADJACENT OFFICES GRIDS. 

OTHERWISE...STILL PREFERRED TO KEEP A DRY FORECAST FROM 23/00Z TO 
23/12Z...AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS EAST FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.
SOME CLEARING OR DECREASING CLOUDS COULD SET THE STAGE FOR AT LEAST 
PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT. FOLLOWED SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY
...BUT A BLEND FOR TONIGHT WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING CONTINUES 
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. MAV GUIDANCE BRINGS HIGHS INTO THE LOWER TO 
MID 90S. WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY AND WILL BE CONSERVATIVE WITH HIGHS 
SIMILAR TO NAM MODEL. WEAK UPPER LOW TO THE NE MOVES SOUTH WITH 
UPPER RIDGE RETROGRADING TO THE WEST MONDAY SO SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE MONDAY. THEN DEVELOPMENT OF A LOW PRESSURE 
AREA IN THE WESTERN ATLANTIC TUESDAY WILL APPROACH THE CAROLINA 
COAST. THIS FEATURE WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
AND LEAD TO CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY RIDGE REBUILDS ACROSS FORECAST AREA AND 
CONTINUES THROUGH FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  61  88  62  87 /  20  10  10  10  20

FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST PRECIP WORDING.

008 
FXUS64 KMRX 211840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
226 PM EDT FRI MAY 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...MRX RADAR REMAINS RELATIVELY 
QUIET AT THE MOMENT. INGREDIENTS REMAIN IN PLACE FOR CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING. LATE HEATING WILL LEAD 
TO DECREASED STABILITY. LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE W OF THE AREA WILL AID 
IN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THAT WILL MIGRATE TO THE EAST THIS 
EVENING. UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE HAS SET UP ALOFT SE OF THE UPPER 
TROF AXIS. THESE FEATURES LEAD TO CONTINUED RELATIVELY HIGH POPS FOR 
THE TONIGHT PERIOD. UPPER TROF AXIS WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY. CLEARING AND DRYING TREND THROUGH THE DAY. TEMPERATURES 
ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE UPPER TROUGH THAT WILL CROSS THE AREA IN THE SHORT TERM WILL 
TRANSITION INTO A CLOSED UPPER LOW OF THE CAROLINA COAST ON 
SUNDAY...CREATING AN OMEGA BLOCK PATTERN WITH A STRONG RIDGE OVER 
THE GREAT LAKES AND MS VALLEY. THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL BE IN 
THE TRANSITION ZONE...ADDING TO FORECAST UNCERTAINTY. WITH THE 
BLOCKING PATTERN...A PERSISTENCE FORECAST IS LIKELY THE BEST WAY TO 
GO. SO WILL HAVE SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS AND SLIGHT CHANCE 
DIURNAL POPS IN FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SHORTWAVE TROUGHS 
MOVING AROUND THE LOW MAY ENHANCE PRECIP CHANCES...BUT TIMING OF 
THESE IS UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME. THE GFS INDICATES THAT THE COASTAL 
LOW WILL BECOME PROGRESSIVE AND THE RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO DOMINATE BY 
THURSDAY...THUS LOWERING PRECIP CHANCES TOWARD THE LATTER HALF OF 
THE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  86  62  90  64 /  40  20  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  83  61  87  62 /  60  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       62  83  60  87  62 /  60  20  10  10  10

470 
FXUS64 KMRX 211436
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1031 AM EDT FRI MAY 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...FIRST ROUND OF PCPN MAKING ITS WAY INTO NE AREAS LATE 
THIS MORNING. TEMPS SHOULD JUMP WITH BRIEF BREAKS IN CLOUD COVER. 
EXPECT A REPRISE EARLY THIS AFTN BEFORE REDEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED 
TSTMS CONTINUING INTO THIS EVENING. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FIRST BAND OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE WEAKENED...BUT NEW DEVELOPMENT ALREADY UNDERWAY 
OVER AL AND SRN MIDDLE TN. MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND PREVIOUS 
GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...SO JUST MINOR ADJUSTMENTS 
TO FIT CURRENT RADAR AND SATELLITE TRENDS. 

A FEW STRONG THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE...BUT BETTER INSTABILITY JUST
TO OUR WEST BETWEEN WARM FRONT AND APPROACHING COLD FRONT. MOS
HIGHS/LOWS CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.


LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DID NOT MAKE BIG CHANGES TO 
LAST PACKAGE ALTHOUGH DID ADJUST POPS IN NEAR TERM DOWN A HAIR. 
CURRENT UPPER TROF EXITS AREA SATURDAY, WITH RIDGE BUILDING INTO 
AREA, ALONG WITH DRIER AIR. COASTAL LOW APPEARS TO DEVELOP AND 
RETROGRESS INTO COAST, AND GRADUALLY SLIPPING UNDER UPPER HIGH. GFS 
LOOKS TO TRY AND BUILD A REX TYPE BLOCK OVERHEAD WITH LOW BRINGING 
SOME LIMITED MOISTURE INTO REGION BY MID WEEK. THIS WILL KEEP A 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POP IN AREA EACH DAY, MOSTLY IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS. MAINTAINED MENTION OF THUNDER 
DURING DAYLIGHT HOURS WITH SHOWERS AFTER DARK. ALL IN ALL, 
RELATIVELY WARM AND DRY...SORT OF A SUMMER LIKE PATTERN.


&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM FRONT OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN 
AND NORTHEAST AL...WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS REVEAL A LINE OF CONVECTION SLOWLY MOVING 
TOWARDS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WHICH SHOULD CONTINUE MOVING EAST 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING AND SLOWLY WEAKEN OVERNIGHT. 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY IS PROGGED TO 
AMPLIFY LATER TONIGHT...AND GENERATE ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION 
OVER MIDDLE TN. THUS...CATEGORICAL POPS LOOK GOOD FOR THE WESTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH CHANCE POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN WHERE CONVECTION SHOULD BARELY REACH BEFORE SUNRISE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO MAINLY FRESHEN UP PRECIP WORDING.

FXUS64 KMRX 201928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT THU MAY 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAKENING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE FROM THE MID MS RVR VLY THROUGH THE OH RVR VLY 
THROUGH SATURDAY. MODERATE LAYER SHEAR AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE 
ALONG AND EAST OF THE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL MOVE EAST 
INTO THE MRX CWA TONIGHT AND CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY. PARAMETERS FOR 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE NOT IMPRESSIVE. A FEW STORMS 
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SE TN EARLY FRI AND ALONG THE N 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU FRI AFTN. DEEP MOISTURE MOVES EAST OF AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT AS DRIER AIR BUILDS INTO THE AREA BEHIND UPPER TROF AXIS. PCPN 
COVERAGE WILL BE SCATTERED ON SAT. DECENT DESTABILIZATION WITH NW 
UPPER FLOW PATTERN COULD KICK OFF A FEW STRONG INSTABILITY 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE AFTERNOON MAINLY ACROSS SW VA/NE TN. TEMPS 
SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORTWAVE EXITS THE 
REGION ON SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
NOW.  LINGERING MOISTURE MAY TRIGGER DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS ON THE CWA.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE FOLLOWS 
ON MONDAY WITH LIMITED...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
MONDAY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE FOLLOWS ON TUESDAY...AGAIN WITH WITH 
LIMITED...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHERN 
SECTIONS AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR TUESDAY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE FOLLOWS 
ON WEDNESDAY WITH LIMITED AGAIN...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

540 
FXUS64 KMRX 201438
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1037 AM EDT THU MAY 20 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER RIDGE WILL 
BRIEFLY SLIDE THROUGH THE REGION TODAY.  THE RIDGE WILL GIVE WAY TO 
AN UPPER TROUGH THAT WILL SHIFT EAST INTO THE AREA OVERNIGHT.  THIS 
WILL BRING IN A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.  
THE RESULT WILL BE AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE 
SHORT TERM.  AN INITIAL SHORT WAVE WILL REACH INTO THE AREA 
TONIGHT...SPREADING A BAND OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE MRX 
CWA.  THEN...A WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON FRIDAY... 
BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT.  AS FOR 
TEMPERATURES...IT WILL BE WARM TODAY WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S AND 
80S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY...AND COOLER ON FRIDAY WITH CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP OVER THE AREA...HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE IN THE 70S.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BY THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD...AROUND 12Z SATURDAY...THE DEEP LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE HAS 
MOVED OFF TO THE EAST ALONG WITH THE UPPER TROF AXIS...LEAVING A 
MORE CLASSIC SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON IN A 
MID/UPPER LEVEL NWLY FLOW.  THERE MIGHT BE A FEW SEVERE STORMS...BUT 
OVERALL ORGANIZATION OF STORMS SHOULD BE LIMITED DUE TO ONLY 
MODERATE DEEP-LAYER SHEAR. IN GRIDS...HAVE KEPT SURFACE DEW POINTS A 
LITTLE LOWER THAN SOME OF THE MODELS--GENERALLY LOWER TO MID 60S FOR 
SATURDAY.  MLCAPE VALUES WILL LIKELY RANGE BETWEEN 1000 TO 1500 J/KG 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS...WHEREAS THE 
NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA WILL LIKELY BE LESS THAN 1000 J/KG.

IN LATER PERIODS...UPPER LEVEL TROF/UPPER LOW SETTLES INTO ATLANTIC 
OFF THE SE US COAST...AND IS EXPECTED TO STAY PUT FOR THE MOST PART 
THROUGH THE END OF THIS FORECAST PERIOD.  WITH THIS ORIENTATION...A 
NLY MID/UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL PERSIST FOR DAYS...WITH A FEW WEAK 
SHORT WAVES EXPECTED TO RACE THROUGH THE AREA.  HAVE ORIENTED POPS 
HIGHER NE AND LOWER SW DUE TO PROXIMITY TO UPPER LOW AND EXPECTED 
COOLER TEMPS ALOFT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  84  64  79  65  87 /  10  60  80  40  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    80  61  77  63  82 /  10  40  80  50  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN            80  61  77  63  81 /  10  50  80  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   78  57  75  58  79 /  10  30  70  60  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT WED MAY 19 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...AND EXTENDING SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE APPALACHIANS WAS CREATING A LARGE 
AREA OF CLOUDINESS OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WHICH EXTENDED 
OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
DIMINISH OVERNIGHT AS THIS UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST TOWARDS THE 
ATLANTIC OCEAN. SOME HIGH CLOUDS FROM CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS AND LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY OVERNIGHT...BUT SHOULD DECREASE AS THEY MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND TO MENTION 
DECREASING CLOUDINESS.

APPROACHES MVFR IN THE FIRST COUPLE HOURS. LATER THIS EVENING
DROPPED THE CEILING INTO MVFR AS THE LOWER LEVELS BECOME SATURATED

FOR SOME VFR FOG FORMATION TOWARD DAYBREAK. CONDITIONS SHOULD
REMAIN VFR AT TYS AND CHA AS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AWAITS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT WED MAY 19 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE OVER E 
KY/SW VA WILL MOVE SE THROUGH NORTHERN AREAS THIS EVENING. LAPSE 
RATES SUFFICIENT TO PRODUCE ISOLATED SHOWERS LATE THIS AFTN MAINLY 
ACROSS SW VA. CLOUDS WILL BREAK UP OVERNIGHT AS TROF PASSES INTO NC. 
COOL TEMPS THU MORNING BUT GOOD WARM UP THU WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES 
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NW. USED MODEL BLEND FOR TEMPS 
BELOW MAV MOS GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...TROUGH/SURFACE COLD 
FRONT WHICH APPROACHES IN THE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY TIME FRAME IS 
MAIN FOCUS OF LONG TERM. STILL SOME MINOR TIMING DIFFERENCES 
REGARDING ONSET AND DEPARTURE OF THIS EVENT. NAM MUCH MORE 
PROGRESSIVE WITH SYSTEM THAN EITHER THE GFS OR SREF...BOTH OF WHICH 
SUGGEST SYSTEM WILL LINGER IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WELL 
INTO SATURDAY. SINCE THE GFS HAS SUPPORT FROM THE SREF...TENDED TO 
FAVOR ITS SOLUTION AND THE MAV GUIDANCE. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM 
GENERALLY UNREMARKABLE WITH NO MAJOR FEATURES AFFECTING THE REGION. 
KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN EARLY WORK WEEK BEFORE DRYING OUT BY MID 
WEEK. TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

130 PM EDT WED MAY 19 2010

.AVIATION...850 MB TROF MOVING SE THROUGH THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON.
CU AND STRATO CU EMBEDDED IN TROF WILL SLIDE THROUGH THE AREA INTO

&&

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO TODAYS FORECAST. TEMPS OFF TO A SLOW 
START. H85 TROF WILL SWING INTO NE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. KNOCKED TEMPS
DOWN 2-3 DEGREES. ISOLATED SHOWERS REMAIN POSSIBLE NE AREAS AND SMOKYS.
SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY EXITING THE 
AREA TODAY WITH RIDGING OVERNIGHT.  MAY SEE A STRAY SHOWER OVER FAR 
NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS THIS AFTERNOON AS THE TROUGH PULLS 
AWAY.  OTHERWISE...GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS WITH CLOUDS CONTINUING 
OVER THE REGION FOR MUCH OF THE SHORT TERM.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK 
REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA GIVING WAY TO ADVANCING TROUGH LIFTING 
NORTHEAST OUT OF THE PLAINS EARLY IN THE PERIOD.  LATEST MODEL RUNS 
TRENDING SLOWER WITH RETURN OF PRECIP.  NAM SLOWEST...KEEPING THINGS 
DRY FOR MOST OF OUR AREA THROUGH FRIDAY.  GFS IS QUICKER...BUT 
SLOWER THAN EARLIER RUNS.  WILL SLOW THINGS DOWN...USING MORE OF AN 
SREF/GFS BLEND FOR TIMING.  THIS YIELDS A DRY THURSDAY...THEN BRINGS 
POPS IN FROM WEST TO EAST THU NIGHT/FRIDAY.  FURTHER OUT...MODELS 
SHOWING UPPER RIDGE BUILDING TO OUR WEST...WITH UPPER TROUGH 
DROPPING SOUTH ALONG EASTERN EDGE AND AFFECTING OUR AREA.  THIS WILL 
KEEP POSSIBILITY OF SOME CONVECTION OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND INTO AT LEAST MONDAY.  BY TUESDAY...GFS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING IN ENOUGH FROM THE NORTH TO SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTION...BUT 
UNCERTAINTY RATHER HIGH THAT FAR OUT...SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE 
IN TUESDAY FOR NOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO 
WILL STAY CLOSE.

LINGER ACROSS THE BULK OF THE FORECAST AREA. EXPECT THESE LOW CLOUDS

196 
FXUS64 KMRX 181857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EDT TUE MAY 18 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
EASTERN GREAT LAKES WITH TROUGH EXTENDING ACROSS EASTERN STATES 
INCLUDING TN VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. A BROAD SURFACE LOW WAS LOCATED 
FROM OHIO SOUTH ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WHICH 
SEPARATED SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS AND MORE MOIST 
AIR TO THE EAST. SHOWERS WERE STILL OCCURRING IN NE TN AND SW VA BUT 
COVERAGE WAS BEGINNING TO DIMINISH. MODELS SHOW WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
PUSHING DOWN INTO THE TN VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT AS COLD FRONT 
CONTINUES TO MOVE SOUTH AND EAST AWAY FROM THE REGION. WILL CONTINUE 
CHANCE SHOWERS THIS EVENING ENDING BY MIDNIGHT NE OTHERWISE DRY WITH 
CLEARING SKIES SOUTH. LOWS COOLER WITH DRIER COOLER AIR MASS. 
FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MAV NUMBERS TONIGHT. PATCHY FOG EXPECTED NE 
SECTIONS WHERE RAIN FELL TODAY. WEDNESDAY UPPER TROUGH ELONGATES 
BACK OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WITH HIGHS ONCE AGAIN IN THE MID 60S TO UPPER 70S. SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY ROTATING AROUND UPPER TROUGH MAY BRING A FEW SHOWERS TO THE 
NE SO SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS THERE. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE 
SMALLER-SCALE DETAILS. THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE APPALACHIANS 
WILL FINALLY EXIT THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT ANOTHER 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL QUICKLY MOVE TOWARDS THE MS RIVER VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL TRIGGER SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... 
WITH CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY GRADUALLY INCREASING IN AREAL COVERAGE BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS A WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA. A 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY MORNING...AND QUICKLY MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION BY FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL PLAN TO MENTION LIKELY POPS 
FOR FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...AS THIS SYSTEM PULLS A WEAKENING COLD 
FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT A 
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BECOME CENTERED OFF THE NORTHEAST 
COAST BY THE WEEKEND...PRODUCING A MOIST EASTERLY FLOW FROM THE 
ATLANTIC OCEAN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. AS A 
RESULT...EXPECT A MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS TO LINGER INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED EACH DAY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE 
GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.DISCUSSION...A STACKED LOW PRESSURE AREA IS LOCATED OVER OHIO
WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH THROUGH EAST TENNESSEE.
SCATTERED SHOWERS WERE MOVING NE ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA AS
SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATES AROUND THE LOW. BASIC FORECAST LOOKS GOOD
WITH CONTINUED SHOWERS ROTATING AROUND THE LOW ACROSS MAINLY THE NE
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE
PLATEAU AND BREAKING UP AS IT MOVES INTO THE VALLEY. WILL LOWER
HIGHS ON THE PLATEAU A COUPLE DEGREES. AIR MASS SHOULD BECOME MORE
STABLE THIS AFTERNOON AS FRONT SHIFTS EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. NOT
SURE IF ANY THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP BUT COLDER TEMPERATURES
ALOFT AND HEATING MAY DEVELOP A FEW IN NE SECTIONS. WILL KEEP
THUNDER IN FOR THE AFTERNOON. UPDATE OUT SOON.

INSTABILITY LOOKS LIMITED...BUT WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER 
WITH THE SHOWERS IN THE AFTERNOON.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS 
NORTHEAST...BUT THINK FAR  SOUTHWEST ZONES LIKELY TO STAY DRY.  A 
FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER NORTH EARLY TONIGHT...OTHERWISE DRY TONIGHT. 
TEMPS WILL BE A BIT COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT...AND WILL NOT STRAY FAR 
FROM MAV TEMPS WHICH LOOK REASONABLE.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WILL BE IN AN UNSETTLED 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  AN UPPER LOW...WELL TO 
OUR NORTH...MAY BRING IN A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER FAR NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS ON WEDNESDAY.  THERE IS SOME QUESTION ON TIMING...BUT THE 
NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD REACH INTO THE AREA LATE THURSDAY...WITH THE MAIN 
FRONT AND ASSOCIATED BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP PUSHING IN ON FRIDAY.  
THIS WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE OUT...AND MAY STILL BE AFFECTING THE MRX 
CWA...MAINLY NORTH AND EAST...INTO SATURDAY.  A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
TRACKING THROUGH WILL CONTINUE OCCASIONAL LOW POPS FOR THE REST OF 
THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   78  54  78  56  80 /  10  10   0  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     74  52  75  54  78 /  20  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             74  52  75  54  78 /  20  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    72  51  70  51  75 /  40  20  20  10  20

300 
FXUS64 KMRX 180123
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT MON MAY 17 2010

.DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS WEAKENING IN THE CWA. SEVERE WEATHER 
SHOULD BE OVER WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. SO LET THE WATCH 
EXPIRE ON TIME. STILL SCATTERED ACTIVITY UPSTREAM WITH THE WEAK FRONT 
STILL TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA...SO WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS INTO 
THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONE FORECAST TO LOWER POPS AND REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING. NO OTHER OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LOW PRESSURE STILL LOCATED
OVER EASTERN KY AND SOUTHERN OH WITH WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDING
SOUTHWEST INTO MIDDLE TN. SCATTERED CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONT
HAS DEVELOPED AND MOVING INTO EAST TN WITH STORMS BECOMING
STRONGER. WITH HEATING CAPE VALUES TO 1000 J/KG PRODUCING POSSIBLE
DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL. EXPECT SCATTERED
CONVECTION SOUTH AND MORE NUMEROUS NORTH CLOSER TO SURFACE LOW.
ACTIVITY SHOULD DECREASE IN INTENSITY BY EARLY EVENING. NE SECTIONS
MAY HAVE ACTIVITY LAST LONGER AS SHORTWAVE ACTIVITY PRODUCES MORE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE NIGHT ACROSS KY AND MOVE INTO
VA. TUESDAY UPPER LOW SHIFTS TO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES WITH BEST
CHANCE OF SHOWERS SW VA AND NE TN WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A
SHOWER SOUTH. LOWS SHOULD BE A LITTLE LOWER TONIGHT IN THE 50S TO
NEAR 60 WITH SOME PATCHY FOG. TUESDAY HIGHS COOLER WITH CLOUDS
NORTH AND SOME SUN CENTRAL AND MORE SUN SOUTH HIGHS WILL REACH
UPPER 70S.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A 
HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS 
PROGGED TO LINGER OVER THE APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY...AND WILL LIKELY PRODUCE A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN 
PROGGED TO MOVE QUICKLY INTO THE MS RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY... 
PRODUCING ANOTHER SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE NORTHEAST INTO 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION ON FRIDAY...BUT A WARM AND MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL BE LEFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...LEADING TO 
AN INCREASED CHANCE FOR CONVECTION. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE THEN 
DEVELOPS OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND...WHICH CREATES A 
NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS UPPER- 
LEVEL PATTERN WILL CREATE A MODERATELY TO POSSIBLY VERY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...LEADING TO 
CONTINUED CHANCES FOR CONVECTION THROUGH MONDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED...WHICH ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  77  53  78  56 /  20  10  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  75  52  74  53 /  60  20  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  74  52  74  53 /  60  20  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  73  51  69  49 /  60  40  30  20  10

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1016 AM EDT MON MAY 17 2010

.DISCUSSION...LOW PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO RIVER WITH DIFFUSE FRONT
EXTENDING SOUTHWEST THROUGH KY AND MIDDLE AND WEST TN WILL MOVE
LITTLE TODAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL ADVANCE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
TONIGHT. AN UPPER LOW OVER THE MID MS VALLEY WILL SHIFT INTO THE
OHIO VALLEY BY TONIGHT AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND IT
WILL SET OFF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE CURRENT
SCATTERED ACTIVITY ON THE NORTHERN PLATEAU WILL INCREASE IN
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY GRADUALLY LATE THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON.
UPDATED FORECAST TO INCREASE POPS THIS AFTERNOON TO LIKELY. CLOUDS
SHOULD BREAK FOR A FEW HOURS. THE HEATING WILL LEAD TO THUNDERSTORMS
DEVELOPING BY EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE
WITH LARGE HAIL ESPECIALLY NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NE TN AND SW VA
CLOSER TO UPPER LOW MOVEMENT. DAMAGING WINDS ALSO A CONCERN AND
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN PRODUCING LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY
IN THE SAME AREAS AS MENTIONED ABOVE WHERE FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE IS
LOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT MON MAY 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL 
LINGER OVER THE AREA TODAY INTO TONIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH WILL 
GRADUALLY SHIFT INTO THE AREA...AND A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
DURING THE PERIOD.  EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN TODAY 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...AND SOME OF THESE STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL THE PRIMARY THREATS.  
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY SOME THUNDERSTORMS WILL LINGER INTO TONIGHT AS 
FRONT TRAVERSES THE FORECAST AREA.  STILL COULD BE SOME LOCALIZED 
FLOODING...BUT THREAT DOES NOT LOOK WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A 
FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME.  NO ARGUMENTS WITH MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL SHIFT SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY KEEPING THE CHANCE FOR SCATTERED TO WIDELY SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM ALIVE ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
TUESDAY. DROP POPS BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY WEDNESDAY AS THE LOW 
MOVES FARTHER EAST TAKING THE BETTER LIFT/MOISTURE INTO THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. AND MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES. DROPPED POPS ON 
THURSDAY AS MODELS INDICATE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS EAST AHEAD OF 
YET ANOTHER SLOW MOVING UPPER LEVEL LOW. MOISTURE INCREASES THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS A SURFACE WAVE RIDES NORTHEAST INTO THE UPPER 
MIDWEST AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY BUILDS INTO THE MID SOUTH. APPLIED 
SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF INCREASED LIFT WITH SURFACE TROF ADVANCING NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS. ALSO STAYED WITH A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION ON SUNDAY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN 
SHORTWAVE TIMING AT THIS EXTENDED PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.

220 
FXUS64 KMRX 170137
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
937 PM EDT SUN MAY 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...THE BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION IS EXITING THE CWA...BUT 
MORE ACTIVITY IS DEVELOPING UPSTREAM AHEAD OF THE SHORTWAVE...SO 
WILL LEAVE LIKELY POPS IN FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND 
THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING INTO 
AREA OVER TOP OF STALLED WEAK FRONT AND AMPLE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL KEEP POPS HIGH THROUGH WEE HOURS WITH GRADUAL LOWERING THROUGH 
MONDAY. INSTABILITY FAIR, AND SO BORDERLINE SEVERE (HAIL, 
STRAIGHT LINE WINDS) TSTMS WILL OCCUR INTO EARLY EVENING. EXPECT THIS 
TO MODERATE AFTER SUNSET AND FOR SEMI-UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE TO TAKE 
ITS PLACE WITH SUSTAINED LIFT. HENCE, PERIODS OF BRIEFLY HEAVY RAIN 
WILL OCCUR WITH THUNDERSTORMS. DO NOT EXPECT TO ISSUE TO FLASH FLOOD 
WATCH, BUT WILL HANDLE WITH SHORT TERM FORECASTS, AND FLOOD 
ADVISORIES/WARNINGS, IF NECESSARY. OVERNIGHT CLOUDS STICK AROUND 
HOLDING TEMPS UP AND SOME AREAS OF FOG WILL FORM. WILL KEEP AN EYE 
OUT ON THIS AND RECOMMEND TO EVENING/MIDNIGHT SHIFTS ABOUT FOG 
ADVISORY, AS NEEDED.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK FRONT SLOWLY
MOVES EAST INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS AND MID ATLANTIC MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DIGS SOUTHWARD INTO THE TN
VALLEY DURING THIS TIME WITH PRECIPITATION DIMINISHING FROM
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DURING THE EVENING. INSTABILITY WILL
DECREASE AS WELL. TUESDAY SHOULD BE MOSTLY DRY SOUTHWEST HALF
TUESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE SLOWLY SHIFTS EAST. TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BE
COOLER WITH SOME CLEARING AND LOWER DEW POINTS BEHIND COLD FRONT.
STILL SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS NE. WEDNESDAY LOOKS TO BE THE DRIEST
DAY WITH SOME SUN BUT MODELS WANT TO BRING MOISTURE EAST FROM THE
PLAINS AS A NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPS OVER TEXAS. THIS SYSTEM
WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY NIGHT
INTO THE WEEKEND SO HAVE ADDED AND INCREASED POPS FOR THE AREA.
ECMWF MODEL DEVELOPS AN UPPER LOW TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA FOR THE
WEEKEND SO KEPT POPS IN THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  80  60  77  54 /  70  60  30  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  78  59  74  53 /  70  60  50  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  78  59  74  52 /  70  60  50  20  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
120 PM EDT SUN MAY 16 2010

.AVIATION...AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS MOVING NORTHEAST OVER CENTRAL EAST 
TENNESSEE. HAVE ISSUED ON SEVERE TSTM WARNING FOR HAIL...WINDS. 
EXPECT SOME HEAVY RAINS, AS WELL. ONCE THIS AREA PASSES THERE IS A 
GAP BUT ANY SUNSHINE WILL DRIVE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF MORE STORMS. 
ANY STORMS NEAR AIRFIELDS WILL CAUSE STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND POSSIBLE 
HAIL...HEAVY RAINS APPEAR TO BE THE BIGGEST THREAT AT THIS TIME. 

EXPECT MVFR CIGS VSBYS WITH STORMS AND DEVELOPMENT OF OVERNIGHT FOG 
AS CLOUDS LIFT SOME AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE COOLS OFF.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT SUN MAY 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...THE "FRONT" IS HARD TO FIND. DOES NOT APPEAR IN 
DEWPOINTS, TEMP, OR PRESSURE FIELDS VERY WELL AT ALL, ALTHOUGH THERE 
IS A VERY TIGHT GRADIENT OF THETA E NORTH OF US IN KY. WIND FIELD 
DOES SHOW A WEAK AREA OF CONVERGENCE IN WEST TENNESSEE WHICH 
BROADENS OUT TO THE EAST. SO THERE DOES APPEAR TO BE A WEAK FOCUSING 
MECHANISM OVER THE AREA WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE. THERE ALSO MAY BE 
SOME VERY WEAK DIFFLUENCE ALOFT AS SOME CLOUD/WV ELEMENTS APPEAR TO 
MOVE AWAY FROM EACH OTHER OVER THE AREA. THIS WOULD IMPLY THAT WEAK, 
BROAD UPLIFT IS LIKELY AND SO CATEGORICAL FORECAST FOR RAIN APPEARS 
ON TRACK, WITH MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL A 
GOOD BET. 

TEMPS A BIT IN THE LOW SIDE OF THE FORECAST, BUT WILL LEAVE WELL 
ENOUGH ALONE. 

NO CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST OTHER THAN TO CLEAN UP MORNING 
WORDING.

679 
FXUS64 KMRX 160813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT SUN MAY 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WHAT REMAINS OF A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL CONTINUE TO LINGER OVER THE REGION...AND DEEP MOISTURE 
WILL BE PRESENT AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY SWINGS ACROSS THE AREA 
TODAY/EARLY TONIGHT.  THIS WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS.  WHILE SEVERE THREAT DOES NOT LOOK HIGH...STILL MAY 
BE SOME ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS TODAY WITH DAMAGING WIND AND LARGE 
HAIL THE MAIN THREATS.  IN ADDITION...VERY HEAVY RAIN MAY CAUSE SOME 
WATER PROBLEMS. AT THIS TIME ANY FLOODING PROBLEMS EXPECTED TO BE 
FAIRLY ISOLATED SO WILL NOT ISSUE ANY FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME...BUT 
WILL LET DAY SHIFT EVALUATE AND ISSUE LATER IF THREAT INCREASES.  
WILL TWEAK SOME MAV TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY TODAY...BUT OVERALL WILL STAY 
CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROF WILL 
STRENGTHEN DEEPENING SUFFICIENTLY TO ALLOW DEVELOPMENT OF A CLOSED 
LOW ACROSS THE MIDWEST MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING 
FOR CONVECTION ON MONDAY AS HEALTHY SURFACE WAVE TRANSITS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GRADUALLY DROP POPS BACK MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST WITH DEPARTURE OF SURFACE 
FEATURE. UPPER LEVEL LOW IN NO HURRY TO LEAVE AND WILL MAKE ONLY 
SLOW PROGRESS EAST THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY INTO THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. DEEPER MOISTURE PRESENT 
FOR LIFTING ON TUESDAY SO USED GRADATION OF HIGH CHANCE POPS 
NORTHERN AND EASTERN AREAS THROUGH SLIGHT CHANCE POP FARTHER 
SOUTHWEST. SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS WILL SUFFICE FOR NOW ON 
WEDNESDAY AS A SHOWER IS CERTAINLY STILL POSSIBLE ACROSS PART OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH UPPER LOW IN PLACE AND POSSIBILITY OF SHORT 
WAVELENGTH ENERGY ROUNDING BASE OF TROF ON ITS WAY ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. REMOVED POPS FROM ALMOST THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY AS OFFENDING UPPER LOW'S INFLUENCE 
BECOMES MORE INEFFECTIVE AS HEIGHTS FINALLY START BUILDING ACROSS 
THE EASTERN U.S. WENT AHEAD AND ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS MODELS ARE BECOMING MORE INSISTENT ON 
BRINGING ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM INTO THE MIDWEST WITH ASSOCIATED 
TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE ADVECTION EARLY IN THE WEEKEND.  

&&

193 
FXUS64 KMRX 160139
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EDT SAT MAY 15 2010

.DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE WEAKENING THIS EVENING. WILL UPDATE 
ZONE FORECAST TO LOWER POPS FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST 
OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM SW NC TO MIDDLE TN ARE FORMING IN A 
ZONE OF DEEP MOISTURE CONVERGENCE AND AN AXIS OF INSTABILITY. 
MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE NOT AS STEEP TODAY AS YESTERDAY...RESULTING 
IN LESS CAPE...BUT LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS REMAIN A 
POSSIBILITY THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON. THERE WILL BE SOME 
WEAK UPPER DIVERGENCE AS WELL...BUT THIS DEPARTS AFTER SUNSET...SO 
WITH LITTLE UPPER SUPPORT MOST ACTIVITY SHOULD DISSIPATE BY 
MIDNIGHT. 

ON SUNDAY A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL TRACK FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS. A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW OFF THE GULF WILL 
PROVIDE ABUNDANT MOISTURE AS PW RISE TO 1.8 INCHES. THE MAIN CONCERN 
TOMORROW IS THE AMOUNT OF RAIN THAT MAY FALL IN THE PLATEAU COUNTIES 
THAT SAW SOME FLOODING YESTERDAY AND MAY SEE MORE AGAIN TODAY. A 
FLOOD WATCH HAS BEEN CONSIDERED...BUT AS MOST PRECIP WILL COME 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON...WILL LET THE MID SHIFT EVALUATE NEWER MODEL 
QPF. RAISED POPS UP TO CATEGORICAL IN WESTERN SECTIONS TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. THE THREAT FOR SEVERE LOOKS MINIMAL TOMORROW AS MORNING 
CLOUDS WILL INHIBIT HEATING AND DESTABILIZATION.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SUNDAY NIGHT SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY CONTINUES TO SWING NORTHEAST OUT OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY INTO THE TN VALLEY GENERATING CONSIDERABLE SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WITH UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST 
U.S. VERY HIGH RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY AS A DEEPENING UPPER TROF MOVES FROM THE PLAINS STATES INTO 
THE MIDWEST. A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROF
WILL SHIFT FROM THE MS RIVER TO OHIO. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL
COLLIDE WITH MOIST/UNSTABLE AIR ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THERE WILL BE A CONTINUED THREAT FOR
HEAVY RAINFALL SUNDAY NIGHT AND POSSIBLY INTO EARLY MONDAY.
FLOODING WILL BE THE MAIN SEVERE WEATHER THREAT FOR THAT TIME.

FROM MONDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY THE SYSTEM WILL CLOSE OFF INTO AN 
UPPER LOW AND MAKE SLOW PROGRESS EASTWARD. THIS LARGE CIRCULATION 
HAS SEVERAL SHORT WAVES WITH IT THAT WILL ROTATE SOUTH AND EAST 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS KEEPING SHOWERS IN THE 
FORECAST NE TN AND SW VA THROUGH THAT PERIOD. THE NW FLOW AROUND THE 
UPPER LOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL FOR A FEW DAYS BUT 
WARMING WILL TAKE PLACE BY THE END OF THE WEEK INTO SATURDAY. 
ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
THURSDAY WILL MOVE SLOWLY NORTHEAST TOWARDS THE EASTERN TENNESSEE 
VALLEY FRIDAY. WILL INTRODUCE POPS BACK IN THE SOUTH SATURDAY AS 
THINK THE UPPER LOW WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT TO THE NORTHEAST AND THE 
NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE SLOWER. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  82  65  81  60 /  40  80  70  70  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  80  65  79  59 /  40  80  80  70  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  77  65  79  58 /  40  80  80  70  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              57  78  60  78  58 /  40  70  90  80  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 151507 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1107 AM EDT SAT MAY 15 2010

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS A FRONT THAT HAS BECOME
STATIONARY JUST NORTH OF THE AREA...ACROSS SOUTHERN KY INTO SW
VA...WITH A TROUGH LOCATED TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS NRN AL/GA. THE 12Z
OHX SOUNDING MODIFIED TO 83/64 INDICATES THAT WE WILL NOT HAVE AS
MUCH INSTABILITY TO WORK WITH TODAY AS WE DID YESTERDAY...YIELDING
SBCAPES AROUND 1800 J/KG AND LI AROUND -7. THERE WILL BE SOME UPPER
DIVERGENCE TO HELP THINGS ALONG AS WE ARE IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF
A JET STREK OVER VA. WITH A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW OFF THE GULF IN THE
LOWER AND MID LEVELS RIDING INTO THE FRONT...AND VERY MOIST GROUND
IN THE PLATEAU COUNTIES...HEAVY RAIN AND FLOODING MAY BE THE
GREATEST THREAT TODAY IN ADDITION TO LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND
GUSTS.

WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO RAISE POPS TO LIKELY IN THE PLATEAU AND
IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY.

718 
FXUS64 KMRX 150751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SAT MAY 15 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL REMAIN 
OVER THE REGION TODAY. LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE CONSIDERABLE 
MOISTURE AND SIGNIFICANT INSTABILITY AGAIN TODAY...SO EXPECT ANOTHER 
ROUND OF CONVECTION.  WHILE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE LOOKS A LITTLE LESS 
THAN YESTERDAY...SOME STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE ONCE AGAIN WITH 
DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL THE MAIN THREATS.  WILL CARRY CHANCE 
POPS ALL BUT FAR NORTH TODAY INTO EARLY TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO MAIN ADJUSTMENT WILL BE A SLIGHT 
TWEAK UP FOR SOME LOCATIONS FOR HIGHS TODAY.     

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ON SUNDAY SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL 
SWING NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE MID SOUTH 
GENERATING THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
UNSTABLE AIR PROGGED ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THE CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION WILL INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS A DEEPENING 
UPPER TROF MAKES PROGRESS FROM THE PLAINS STATES INTO THE MIDWEST. A 
RELATIVELY STRONG SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
TROF WILL SHIFT EAST NORTHEAST FROM THE OZARKS THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL CLASH WITH MOIST/UNSTABLE AIR 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY 
REQUIRING THE USE OF LIKELY POPS FOR THUNDERSTORMS. MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY THE NOW CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS EAST 
ACROSS THE CORN BELT AND THEN APPEARS TO RETROGRADE A BIT. THIS 
LARGE CIRCULATION HAS SEVERAL SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES THAT WILL 
ROTATE SOUTH AND EAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SO KEPT SOME SMALL AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS GOING THROUGH 
THIS PERIOD. WITH THE UPPER LOW DOMINATING MUCH OF THE NORTHEASTERN 
QUARTER OF THE NATION FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD...TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
BELOW NORMAL INITIALLY FOLLOWED BY A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WHEN THE 
CIRCULATION FINALLY DEPARTS TO THE EAST. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

325 
FXUS64 KMRX 150125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT FRI MAY 14 2010

.DISCUSSION...FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. BUT NO 
MORE SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
MESOSCALE ANALYSIS OF SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
A GOOD POTENTIAL FOR LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS...WITH THE 
GREATEST POTENTIAL CENTERED OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES. THE 
MID LEVEL INVERSION IS LIKELY A BIT STRONGER OVER EAST TN THAN MIDDLE 
TN...SO CONVECTION WILL NEED AN ADDITIONAL PUSH TO GET MORE STORMS 
GOING...AND THIS PUSH WILL PROBABLY COME IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS FROM 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES PUT DOWN BY CONVECTION TO OUR WEST. HAIL LOOKS TO 
BE THE PRIMARY THREAT WITH SBCAPE AROUND 3000 J/KG...WBZ HEIGHTS 
AROUND 10.5 KFT...AND THE SHP AROUND 2. DYNAMIC LIFT WILL BE 
PROVIDED BY UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF A JET STREAK 
TO THE NORTHEAST...AND 700 MB FRONTOGENESIS. 

MODELS INDICATE THIS LIFT EXITING BY MIDNIGHT...AND WITH THE LOSS OF 
INSTABILITY AFTER SUNSET...STORMS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY MIDNIGHT. A 
MID LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA TONIGHT...WHILE AT THE 
SURFACE THE FRONT TO OUR NORTH WILL APPROACH AND STALL JUST TO OUR 
NORTH. A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND CONVERGENCE ZONE SETS UP ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY...AND THIS SHOULD HELP FOCUS 
CONVECTION IN OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES TOMORROW AFTERNOON. WHILE 
INSTABILITY AND SHEAR WILL NOT BE HIGH AS TODAY...THERE WILL BE 
POTENTIAL FOR SOME SEVERE STORMS IN THE PLATEAU AND IN THE SOUTHERN 
HALF. THE MAIN THREAT MAY BE DAMAGING WINDS AS FORECAST SOUNDINGS 
SHOW AN INVERTED-V PROFILE AT CHA. LARGE HAIL POTENTIAL LOOKS LOWER 
DUE TO HIGHER WBZ HEIGHTS AND LOWER CAPE. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS 
TOMORROW IN THE SOUTH...TAPERING TO A SLIGHT CHANCE IN SW VA.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT
STAYS JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. ON
GOING AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO DIE OUT WITH
HEATING OF THE DAY. SUNDAY LOW PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPS OVER THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MOVES NORTHWEST TO MID MS VALLEY. CONVECTION
WILL DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND LIKELY
CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AS COLD FRONT MOVES SLOWLY EAST. NAM
SHOWS MUCH HIGHER RAIN CHANCE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY BUT THINK
THE GFS WITH A DIURNAL TREND IS BETTER. DRIER NW FLOW WILL TAKE
OVER WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. MODELS SHOW UPPER LOW HANGING BACK
OVER THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES WITH A POSSIBLE CHANCE OF SHOWERS NW
BUT WILL KEEP LAST TWO DAYS DRY FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

210 
FXUS64 KMRX 141423 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1023 AM EDT FRI MAY 14 2010

.DISCUSSION...
A FRONT IS LOCATED ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING...AND WILL
PUSH SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY. THE AIRMASS AHEAD OF THIS FRONT HAS
PLENTY OF POTENTIAL TO SUPPORT SEVERE STROMS. OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES
FROM MORNING CONVECTION TO OUR NORTHWEST WILL LIKELY HELP INITIATE
THUNDERSTORMS EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING MODIFIED
TO 85/66 YIELDS SBCAPE VALUES AROUND 3000 J/KG AND LI OF -10C.
ALTHOUGH LOW LEVEL WINDS ARE WEAK (REDUCING ANY TORNADO
POTENTIAL)...THE 0-6 KM BULK SHEAR OF 45 KTS WILL SUPPORT
SUPERCELLS. THE HIGH CAPE ALONG WITH WET-BULB ZERO HEIGHTS UNDER 11
KFT SUGGEST A LARGE HAIL THREAT. A SURFACE-TO- MIDLEVEL THETA-E
DIFFERENCE OF 25C AND MIDLEVEL DRY AIR IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS WILL
GIVE A THREAT OF DAMAGING WINDS. RUC AND NAM INDICATE A PERIOD OF
UPPER DIVERGENCE THIS AFTERNOON IN NORTHERN AREAS THAT WILL
ENHANCE LIFT.

THE MORNING UPDATE WILL RAISE POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN
SECTIONS TO LIKELY. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY
UPWARD TO MATCH THE LATEST TRENDS...AS THERE HAS BEEN VERY LITTLE
CLOUD COVER SO FAR.

912 
FXUS64 KMRX 140751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT FRI MAY 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT WILL DRIFT 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE REGION DURING THE SHORT TERM. QUITE A BIT OF 
MOISTURE OVER THE AREA...AND APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME SIGNIFICANT 
INSTABILITY TODAY...SO SHOULD SEE SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW WIND PROFILES ARE WEAK 
WITH LITTLE SHEAR...AND FREEZING LEVELS ARE FAIRLY HIGH.  
HOWEVER...STILL APPEARS TO BE SOME SEVERE THREAT...MAINLY FOR 
DAMAGING WIND DOWNBURSTS AND HAIL...GIVEN EXPECTED INSTABILITY.  
WILL CARRY A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS...BUT LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD END BEFORE 
MIDNIGHT. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STAYED CLOSER TO ECMWF 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WHICH FEATURES A FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT WILL 
MEANDER AROUND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA ON 
SATURDAY. ATMOSPHERE PROGGED FOR SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION SOUTH THROUGH THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHILE 
MORE WIDELY SEPARATED DEVELOPMENT OCCURS ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DUE TO EXPECTED GREATER DISTANCE FROM THE 
SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY. ON SUNDAY LONGWAVE TROF SHIFTS STEADILY EAST 
ACROSS THE PLAINS TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WHILE SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH ENERGY DRIVES NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE 
LOWER OHIO VALLEY PULLING FRONTAL BOUNDARY NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA DURING THE DAY. KEPT POPS AT MEDIUM CHANCE FOR POSSIBLE 
SCATTERED CONVECTION THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT WHILE MAINTAINING LIKELY 
PROBABILITY OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY AS LONGWAVE TROF DEEPENS AS 
IT MOVES INTO THE MIDWEST STATES. THIS WOULD APPEAR TO BE THE BEST 
PERIOD FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASES 
ALONG WITH CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF SYNOPTIC COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY. 
GRADUALLY DROP POPS BACK MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY BUT STILL 
MAINTAIN MEDIUM CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS 
UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO DEEPEN AND SLOW DOWN OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST. 
NOT SURE JUST HOW LONG THIS FEATURE WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA SO 
DID NOT ADD POPS ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE EXTENDED LEAVING WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT DRY AT THIS TIME. SLIGHTLY TWEAKED 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST TOWARD NEW MOS GUIDANCE.

272 
FXUS64 KMRX 131912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT THU MAY 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS THAT HAS SUPPRESSED CONVECTION OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IS MOVING TO THE EAST...ALLOWING FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OVER MIDDLE TN AND KY THIS 
AFTERNOON. A FEW OF THESE SHOWERS MAY MOVE INTO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
OUR AREA...SO WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE NORTHWESTERN 
COUNTIES THIS EVENING. 

ON FRIDAY A FRONT TO OUR NORTH WILL PUSH FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY...AND A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH WILL HELP PROVIDE SOME FOCUS 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE AFTERNOON. THE MIDLEVEL 
INVERSION THAT WE HAD IN PLACE TODAY WEAKENS TOMORROW...ALLOWING 
PLENTY OF INSTABILITY TO BE TAPPED. NAM AND GFS SHOW MLCAPE VALUES 
OF 1500-2000 J/KG...AND ALTHOUGH LOW LEVEL WINDS ARE LIGHT...0-6 KM 
SHEAR VALUES NEAR 40 KTS AND BULK RICHARDSON NUMBERS AROUND 20 
SUGGEST A POTENTIAL FOR SUPERCELLS. THE MAIN THREAT LOOKS TO BE HAIL 
GIVEN THE HIGH CAPE VALUES...AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS AS SURFACE TO 
MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCES ARE AROUND 25 DEGREES AND STEEP LOW 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES. LIMITING FACTORS WILL BE THE LACK OF LARGE-SCALE 
FORCING AS THE UPPER JET AND THE SURFACE FRONT WILL BE POSITIONED 
WELL TO THE NORTH. THIS AND THE LIMITED AMOUNT OF MOISTURE SHOULD 
MEAN THAT THE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL...SO WILL REMOVE 
ALL POPS FROM THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT JUST SOUTH OF
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY MORNING BUT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY STILL
HIGH WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SOUTHERN SECTIONS
AND A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH. STILL LOOKS FAVORABLE FOR A FEW SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS. BEST CHANCE THOUGH SOUTH OF THE TN BORDER. ACTIVITY
SHOULD BE MAINLY DIURNAL. INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY AS NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES
EAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY MORNING INTO THE SOUTHERN
GREAT LAKES BY TUESDAY MORNING. THE FRONT TO THE SOUTH SHOULD MOVE
BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT AND THEN THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE
THROUGH MONDAY NITH AND EARLY TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN
FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. HAVE HIGHEST POPS MONDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE TUESDAY NIGHT. WARM AND HUMID SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES MONDAY AND TUESDAY WITH MORE
CLOUDS AND RAIN. MUCH COOLER NIGHTS BEHIND SECOND FRONT TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HIGHS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY NEAR NORMAL
WITH LOWER HUMIDITIES. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL 
SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE PROGRESSION OF A COLD FRONT FOR THIS 
WEEKEND...BUT THE GFS MODEL SEEMS TO NOW BE TRENDING CLOSER TO THE 
MORE CONSISTENT ECMWF SOLUTION. OVERALL...AN ACTIVE PATTERN IS 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...AS A COLD 
FRONT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WHICH WILL 
LIKELY RESULT IN A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE TSTORMS BY THE AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING HOURS. ECMWF MODEL INDICATES THAT THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR THE 
WEEKEND...WHICH SEEMS REALISTIC GIVEN THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW 
BECOMES ZONAL AND WILL NOT PROVIDE MUCH OF A PUSH FOR THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO MOVE FURTHER SOUTH. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP EACH DAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH AN UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS REMAINING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS 
THEN PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT... 
CREATING A SURFACE LOW THAT TRACKS ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY. THUS...WILL PLAN TO INCREASE POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT...WITH A FEW WRAP-AROUND SHOWERS POSSIBLE ON TUESDAY ON THE 
BACK SIDE OF THIS LOW. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER 
THAN THE GFS NUMBERS WITH MAXES THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO 
THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND GOOD CHANCES FOR CONVECTION EACH DAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

212 
FXUS64 KMRX 121837
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT WED MAY 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A RIDGE AXIS EXTENDING FROM 
HIGH PRESSURE THAT IS CENTERED OVER FLORIDA TODAY WILL BE BUILDING 
INTO OUR AREA TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. A BAND OF LIGHT RAIN TRAILING 
THE MCS OVER WV MAY CROSS OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES THIS EVENING. ONCE 
THIS PASSES WE SHOULD SEE CLEARING SKIES AS SUBSIDENCE ALOFT 
INCREASES WITH THE BUILDING RIDGE AXIS. IF CLOUDS CAN CLEAR QUICKLY 
ENOUGH...THERE COULD BE SOME PATCHY FOG IN AREAS THAT SAW SHOWERS 
TODAY. 

FORECAST SOUNDINGS FOR TOMORROW SHOW A STRONG MIDLEVEL 
INVERSION...STRONGER IN THE SOUTH THAN THE NORTH...AS A RESULT OF 
THE RIDGING ALOFT. THIS SHOULD KEEP A CAP ON MOST CONVECTION 
TOMORROW AS THERE IS VERY LITTLE FORCING TO OVERCOME THE STRONG CAP. 
BUT THE NAM DOES INDICATE SOME LOW LEVEL CONFLUENCE IN NORTHERN 
AREAS WHERE THE CAP IS WEAKER...AND THERE COULD BE SOME LINGERING 
BOUNDARIES IN THAT AREA FROM TODAY'S ACTTIVITY TO THE NORTH...SO 
WILL INCLUDE A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP NORTH AND IN THE 
MOUNTAINS/PLATEAU TOMORROW AFTERNOON. NAM MLCAPE RISES TO OVER 2000 
J/KG TOMORROW...BUT THE LACK OF DYNAMIC FORCING AND SHEAR WILL 
PREVENT ANY ORGANIZED SEVERE. HIGHS WILL BE QUITE WARM UNDER THE 
RIDGE...REACHING BETWEEN 85 AND 90 IN MOST LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE 
MOUNTAINS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN POOR 
AGREEMENT ON POSITION/TRACK OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT...BUT 
OVERALL...BELIEVE WEATHER PATTERN WILL BE UNSETTLED THROUGH MUCH OF 
THE EXTENDED.  MAIN QUESTION THROUGH THE EXTENDED IS...WILL THE 
APPROACHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY STALL AROUND THE MRX CWA OR WILL IT 
PUSH THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH THIS WEEKEND.  CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP AND MOVE ALONG THE FRONT EACH DAY.  HAVE GONE WITH A 
COMPROMISE OF THE MODELS AND HAVE POPS RANGING FROM 20 TO 40 FROM 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
IN ON MONDAY WITH ASSOCIATED CONVECTION LINGERING INTO TUESDAY.  
WILL KEEP THINGS DRY ON WEDNESDAY BEHIND THE FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    63  89  65  85  61 /  10  10  10  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN            64  89  65  85  61 /  10  20  10  40  30

142 
FXUS64 KMRX 120750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT WED MAY 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT...A SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO TRACK 
ALONG THE WARM FRONT BRINGING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM TO THE CWA 
TODAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE CWA TODAY WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT IS PROGGED. 
SHORTWAVE LINGERS INTO TONIGHT...SO WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THE 
THE EVENING HOURS FOR OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES AND DRY ELSEWHERE. 
TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL TODAY. GUIDANCE NUMBERS SIMILAR SO DIDN'T 
STRAY TOO FAR.     

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL 
SOME DISCREPANCIES IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST WITH THE PROGRESSION OF 
A COLD FRONT THAT IS EXPECTED TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY THE END 
OF THE WEEK. WILL PLAN TO TREND CLOSER TO THE ECMWF MODEL SOLUTION 
THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD...SINCE IT HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT 
THAN THE GFS MODEL AND GENERALLY VERIFIES BETTER. OVERALL...AN 
ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA BY FRIDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO BE LOCATED OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY MORNING...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST 
ORIENTED WARM FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA. WHILE THIS WARM 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES ON 
THURSDAY...A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION ISOLATED AFTERNOON 
CONVECTION IN MOST AREAS ON THURSDAY...WITH SOME POSSIBLY BECOMING 
SEVERE. THE COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
THEN SETTLE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...RESULTING IN A BETTER 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. THE LOCAL AIR MASS IS AGAIN PROGGED TO 
BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS...SO THINK THAT AN 
OUTBREAK OF SEVERE WEATHER MAY BE POSSIBLE. ECMWF MODEL INDICATES 
THAT THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND...WHICH SEEMS REALISTIC GIVEN THAT THE 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AND WILL NOT PROVIDE MUCH OF A PUSH 
FOR THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO MOVE FURTHER SOUTH. AS A RESULT...A WET 
AND ACTIVE PATTERN SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH SOME 
SEVERE STORMS ALSO POSSIBLE EACH DAY. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE PLAINS BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...WHICH WILL 
LIKELY CREATE A SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY AND 
CONTINUE THE WET PATTERN INTO TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A 
LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE 
TO THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND GOOD CHANCES FOR CONVECTION. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  66  90  68  86 /  20  10  10  10  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  64  89  68  85 /  20  10  20  10  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  65  89  68  85 /  20  10  20  10  50

FXUS64 KMRX 120106

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EDT TUE MAY 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...SATELLITE AND AREA OBSERVATIONS CONTINUE TO SHOW A 
GOOD DEAL OF CLOUDINESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. BOUNDARY SOUTHERLY 
WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO PULL MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
KEEPING SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY. ONLY OROGRAPHIC LIFT IS EVIDENT FOR 
CONVECTION OVERNIGHT. WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT POP AS FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SHOW MARGINAL INSTABILITY OVERNIGHT.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND PLAN NO CHANGES.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL GRADUALLY 
BUILD OVER THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
MAY TRIGGER SOME SHOWERS TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY NORTH.  GFS AND NAM 
SOUNDINGS DIFFER SOME FOR WEDNESDAY...WITH THE GFS MUCH MORE 
CAPPED.  HOWEVER...LOOKS LIKE THERE MAY BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR 
SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY...AGAIN WITH BEST 
CHANCES NORTH.   GFS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.
 
.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE NE GLFMEX RIDGES INTO THE E TN RVR VLY ANS S 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THURSDAY. TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL WITH 
SLIGHT CHC MAINLY AFTN TSTMS NE TN/SW VA. RIDGE SLIDES EAST BY FRI
AND WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGS SE INTO THE AREA. MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE ALONG FRONT AND LIFT PROVIDED BY SPEED MAX THAT WILL 
MOVE NE THRU TN VLY WILL RESULT IN A GOOD CHC FOR CONVECTION FRI 
AFTN. FRONT MOVES TO SOUTH MRX BOUNDARY SAT AND SUN. AFT BRIEF UPPER 
SHORT WAVE RIDGING SW FLOW ALOFT RETURNS ON SUN. SCATTERED 
CONVECTION PSBL ALONG AND N OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY. WARM TEMPS AND 
SCATTERED CONVECTION CONTINUES INTO NEXT WEEK AS SFC LOW MOVES EAST 
INTO THE AREA ON TUE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME REMNANT SHOWERS FROM THE EARLIER CONVECTION 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WHICH WAS MOVING EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY AND WEAKENING THIS MORNING. MODELS REVEAL SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON... 
SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF THUNDER FOR TODAY. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL THEN MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...SO WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE POPS FOR ADDITIONAL 
CONVECTION THROUGH TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THEIR MAXES FOR TODAY... 
MAINLY DUE TO DIFFERENCES IN THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER EXPECTED. 
SINCE THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON UPSTREAM 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY...WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SETS 
OF GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A WARM FRONT TRACKS THROUGH 
THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH NEARER THE FRONT. DRY WEATHER RETURNS BRIEFLY ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT BEFORE A COLD FRONTS ENTERS THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND LINGERS 
INTO SATURDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. ANOTHER 
DISTURBANCE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY BRINGING 
MORE RAIN CHANCES FOR BOTH DAYS. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ISENTROPIC ASCENT WILL

TO BE OVERCOME TO GET DECENT WIDESPREAD COVERAGE. DIFFICULT 
DETERMINING IF EVERYONE GETS A HUNDREDTH OF AN INCH IN THIS LIGHT 
RAIN EVENT. DECIDED TO PLAY THE POPS A LITTLE LOWER WITH MAIN LIFT 
SHIFTING STEADILY EAST FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS ALONG WITH THE LOSS 
OF INSOLATION. WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN KEEPS RIGHT ON GOING ON 
TUESDAY AND THE ATMOSPHERE PROGGED TO BECOME LESS STABLE THAN WHAT 
WE ARE EXPERIENCING TODAY. SO USED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR MY 
PRECIP TYPE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. STAYED WITH THE TREND OF 
HIGHER POPS NORTH CLOSER TO THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT IN THE WARM 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN. SURFACE WAVE WILL DRAG A COOL FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND A LITTLE BIT OF MODEL DISAGREEMENT 
HOW FAR SOUTH THE FRONT WILL PROGRESS...SO HIGHER POP NORTH AND WEST 
NOT A BAD IDEA. MODELS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
TRANSITING THROUGH THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY EARLY WEDNESDAY WITH 
MOVEMENT TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY AFTERNOON SO USED A 
GRADATION OF HIGHER CHANCE POPS NORTH THROUGH LOWER CHANCE SOUTH FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH BOUNDARY IN PLACE AND SHORT WAVE 
MOVING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND 
CONCERNING TEMPS DURING THE SHORT TERM. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGING EXTENDS 
NORTHWARD FROM THE EAST GLFMEX INTO THE S APPALACHIANS THURSDAY. 
WARM TEMPS WITH CHANCE OF AFTN CONVECTION OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. NORTH END OF RIDGE FLATTENS AS FRONT MOVES SE INTO THE 
AREA FRI. CHANCE OF SHOWERS IMPROVES INTO FRI NGT. RIDGE BUILDS IN 
ON SAT. LEFT CHANCE POPS GOING S AREAS ALLOWING FOR FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
TO LINGER EARLY SAT. NOT MUCH OF A COOL DOWN WITH THIS WESTERN 
ORIGIN RIDGE. CONFIDENCE LOWERS FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE EXTENDS. 
SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST AND INVERTED SURFACE TROF TRIES TO WORK ITS 
WAY INTO THE AREA. IMPULSES IN THE UPPER SWRLY FLOW WILL ALSO MOVE 
INTO THE AREA. PCPN CHANCES WILL BE DEPENDENT OF MOISTURE RETURN 
FROM THE WESTERN GULF. TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL WITH CHANCE OF 
RAIN SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT MON MAY 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION... 
RESULTING IN AN UNSEASONABLY COOL AND DRY AIR MASS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS A WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH ACROSS 
THE DEEP SOUTH. THIS ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL RESULT IN AN INCREASE IN 
CLOUDS AREAWIDE...WITH SOME SHOWERS SPREADING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. 
THIS WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATER 
TONIGHT...WITH A BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS EXPECTED...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE MOVING QUICKLY 
EAST ACROSS THE LOWER GREAT LAKES-LOWER OHIO VALLEY WILL HELP PULL A 
WARM FRONT ACROSS THE NORTHERN FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. BEST CHANCES 
OF CONVECTION WILL BE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA-NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
TUESDAY.  AS SHORT-WAVE MOVES TO THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE NORTHERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE BECOMING STATIONARY. BEST 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL BE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.  

FOR THURSDAY...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS THE PLAIN 
STATES TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. FRONT WILL LIFT BACK NORTH WITH 
RIDGING ALOFT PRODUCING A DRIER AND VERY WARM DAY.

FOR FRIDAY...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA PRODUCING 
SCATTERED TO BROKEN CONVECTION.

FOR SATURDAY...SURFACE RIDGE WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE OHIO AND 
NORTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEYS LIMITING ANY CHANCE OF STORMS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...RIDGING WILL MOVE EAST ALLOWING MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY TO RETURN ALONG WITH A CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

CAN NOT RULE OUT CHANCES OF SEVERE STORMS THROUGH THE EXTENDED. 
CONFIDENCE ON HOW MUCH INSTABILITY RETURNS AHEAD OF EACH BOUNDARY IS 
LOW.

FOR NE TN AND SW VA AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AS TEMPERATURES FALL
TO NEAR THE DEW POINTS OF MID TO UPPER 30S WITH A FEW SPOTS
POSSIBLY DROPPING TO NEAR FREEZING. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE IN THE
WEST AND LOWS THERE WILL STAY IN THE 40S. ADJUSTED LOWS A DEGREE OR
TWO DOWNWARD MOUNTAINS AND NE AS WELL. UPDATED FORECAST ALREADY SENT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT SUN MAY 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE
CONTINUE TO DOMINATE OUR AREA'S WEATHER...WITH SOME PATCHY AREAS OF

BUT A DRY FORECAST OVERNIGHT.

NOT SEE MUCH OF A FOCUS FOR CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION. OPTED TO KEEP
POPS OUT OF NE TN AND SW VA THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON AND ALSO TO
STAY A BIT BELOW THE HIGHER NAM-WRF MOS POPS.

GENERALLY WENT WITH A BLEND OF MOS FOR MIN AND MAX TEMPS. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH BOUNDARY LAYER 
SOUTHERLY FLOW PULLING A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT. PLENTY OF POTENTIAL INSTABILITY 
TUESDAY...BUT ONLY FORCING SEEMS TO BE OROGRAPHIC. WILL CALL FOR 
CHANCE AND LOW CHANCE POPS.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...STATIONARY FRONT WILL BE OVER 
THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY. THERE MAY BE A MCS THAT DEVELOPS ACROSS 
SOUTHERN IL/IN THEN RIDE EAST-SOUTHEAST INTO THE NORTHERN THIRD OF 
THE FORECAST AREA.

RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT BUILDS BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...SO VERY WARM AND MUGGY 
AIR. WILL LIKELY SEE WIDELY SCATTERED OROGRAPHIC CONVECTION DURING 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

FOR FRIDAY...ANOTHER FRONT DIPS INTO THE FORECAST AREA PRODUCING 
SCATTERED-BROKEN CONVECTION. THIS FRONT REMAINS QUASI-STATIONARY 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH SUNDAY.

SEVERE CHANCES POSSIBLE THROUGH THE EXTENDED AS FRONT MOVES BACK AND 
FORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
