FXUS64 KMRX 131848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT TUE APR 13 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE CENTERED 
TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA CONTINUES RELATIVELY UNCHANGED FROM 
YESTERDAY. TEMPERATURES RUNNING ABOUT THE SAME AS MONDAY BUT DEW 
POINTS HAVE RISEN A FEW DEGREES. SOME RELATIVE HUMIDITIES ARE IN THE 
LOW TO MID 20S IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SOME VALLEY LOCATIONS A 
FEW PERCENT HIGHER THAN MONDAY WHERE MIN RH VALUES WERE AS LOW AS
15 PERCENT. SOME CU HAS FORMED ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. BASICALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WILL FOLLOW CLOSER TO COOLER MAV NUMBERS FOR
LOWS AND WARMER MET GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS NEXT 24 HOURS. THERE MAY BE
SOME ADDITIONAL CLOUDS FORMING WEDNESDAY NE SECTIONS AS MOISTURE
FLOWS DOWN EAST SIDE OF RIDGE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH A MOSTLY DRY
PATTERN CONTINUING OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. A
WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER REINFORCING SHOT OF DRY AND
SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR. LATEST GFS AND ECMWF MODEL RUNS ARE NOW BOTH
REVEALING A LITTLE MORE MOISTURE WITH THIS COLD FRONT...BUT WILL
CONTINUE TO MENTION ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS BEGINNING FRIDAY AFTERNOON
THROUGH SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...TRENDED CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE
NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE
ENSEMBLE MEANS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT TUE APR 13 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL BE TO OUR 
WEST AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO EXTEND INTO THE AREA 
DURING THE PERIOD.  ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN RATHER DRY...SO DO NOT 
EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN A FEW HIGH CLOUDS.  MAV DEW POINTS HAVE BEEN 
RUNNING TOO HIGH IN THE AFTERNOONS AS DRY AIR MIXES TO THE 
SURFACE...AND EXPECT THAT TO BE TRUE AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON.  WILL GO 
LOWER THAN MAV DEWPOINTS WITH RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES QUITE LOW 
AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...DIPPING TO NEAR 25 PERCENT IN MOST AREAS. 
WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...PERSISTENCE WAY TO GO 
THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN 
CONTROL FOR CONTINUED DRY AND SEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS.  MODELS 
BRING A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA AROUND FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY.  MOISTURE AND ENERGY LIMITED AND WILL KEEP POPS LOW AS IT 
MOVES THROUGH.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR 
A RETURN TO A DRY...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN...THOUGH TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE SLIGHTLY COOLER.

759 
FXUS64 KMRX 130126
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
926 PM EDT MON APR 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE AREA BRINGING ANOTHER DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE 
AND ALOFT CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON WITH SUNNY SKIES AND TEMPERATURES 
IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S. WINDS ARE LIGHT GENERALLY FROM THE NORTH TO 
NORTHEAST. DRY AIR ALOFT HAS MIXED DOWN TO THE SURFACE WITH RELATIVE 
HUMIDITY VALUES VERY LOW GENERALLY BELOW 30 PERCENT BUT PLACES IN 
THE MOUNTAINS HAVE RH VALUES BELOW 20 PERCENT ONCE AGAIN. NOT MUCH 
CHANGE THROUGH TUESDAY WITH LOWS A DEGREE OR TOO HIGHER TONIGHT AND 
HIGHS A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER TUESDAY. MODELS ARE TRYING TO RAISE DEW
POINTS ABOUT 10 DEGREES BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY NE SECTIONS
AS RIDGE AMPLIFIES AND BRINGS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THAT AREA. AM
SKEPTICAL ABOUT THAT MUCH OF A RISE WHICH WOULD BRING MINIMUM RH
VALUES UP SEVERAL PERCENT. WILL BE MORE CONSERVATIVE AND KEEP RH
VALUES ABOUT THE SAME TO SLIGHTLY HIGHER.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH A RELATIVELY DRY 
PATTERN CONTINUING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A 
WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER REINFORCING SHOT OF DRY AND 
SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL 
BE LIMITED WITH THIS COLD FRONT...SO WILL MENTION ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...TRENDED CLOSE TO 
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

416 
FXUS64 KMRX 120704
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT MON APR 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL BE TO OUR 
WEST AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH 
AND NORTHEAST DURING THE PERIOD.  ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN RATHER 
DRY...SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN A FEW HIGH CLOUDS.  RELATIVE 
HUMIDITY VALUES WILL BE QUITE LOW AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...DIPPING TO 
NEAR OR BELOW 25 PERCENT IN MOST AREAS...ALTHOUGH WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV 
TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...DRY WEATHER REGIME TO CONTINUE 
FOR MUCH OF THE WEEK AS MODELS DEPICT RISING ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE 
WITH SUBSIDENCE ALLOWING FOR MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS AND MOSTLY CLEAR 
NIGHTS. BY FRIDAY THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WEAKENS AS A TROF DROPS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TOWARD THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. A 
SURFACE COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL ACCOMPANY THIS PATTERN CHANGE 
PRESSING SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. MODELS DON'T DEPICT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SIGNIFICANT LOW 
LEVEL INFLOW OF MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS BOUNDARY. THEREFORE USED JUST 
A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A POSSIBLE SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM EARLY IN 
THE WEEKEND WITH THIS FROPA. WITH HEIGHTS BUILDING OVER THE CENTER 
OF THE NATION SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AND UPPER TROF SHIFTING SLOWLY 
EAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN STATES TRENDED TEMPERATURES BACK A FEW 
DEGREES BUT NOT QUITE AS COOL AS NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.     

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 120121
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
921 PM EDT SUN APR 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION BRINGING ANOTHER DRY NIGHT TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK.  NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...HIGH
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL PUSH A BACK DOOR COLD
FRONT INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...BUT IT WILL REMAIN WELL NORTH
OF OUR AREA. ALOFT...A ZONAL FLOW WILL BECOME INCREASINGLY
AMPLIFIED AS A MID/UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE PLAINS STRENGTHENS
AND MOVES EAST. THIS SHOULD PROVIDE GREATER SUBSIDENCE AND SLIGHTLY
WARMER TEMPERATURES TOMORROW. HIGHS SHOULD REACH TO NEAR 80 IN
CHATTANOOGA TO MID 70S IN THE TRI-CITIES AREA. BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTURE IS ALSO A BIT GREATER TOMORROW...WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR A
LITTLE AFTERNOON CU DEVELOPMENT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE TO
PREVIOUS FORECAST. HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE CENTERED OVER LOWER MS
VALLEY AND TN VALLEY CONTINUES MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH
SHORT RANGE MODELS STRENGTHENING THE FEATURE AS IT BECOMES MORE
AMPLIFIED. GFS TRYING TO BRING SOME ENERGY OVER TOP RIDGE INTO SW VA
TUESDAY NIGHT AND THEN INTO NC WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT
WILL NOT ADD ANY SIGNIFICANT CLOUDS OR POPS FOR THAT TIME YET.
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY TRIES TO DEVELOP SHOWERS UNDER RIDGE AS
WELL. ECMWF AND GFS BEGIN TO WEAKEN RIDGE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY
AS IT SINKS SOUTHWARD. COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE IN FROM NE FRIDAY
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY WITH INCREASED MOISTURE AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY
BRINGING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS TO MAINLY NE
HALF OF FORECAST AREA. COOL NIGHTS AND ABOVE NORMAL HIGHS TO
CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

180 
FXUS64 KMRX 110656
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT SUN APR 11 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  A 
WEAK BACKDOOR COLD FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH TOWARD THE AREA 
TONIGHT...BUT SHOULD JUST BRING A FEW HIGH CLOUDS.  EXPECT A CLEAR 
TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKY THROUGH THE PERIOD.  RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES 
WILL BE QUITE LOW AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...DIPPING BELOW 25 PERCENT 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA...ALTHOUGH WINDS WILL BE LIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
AMPLIFIES WHILE SHIFTING FROM THE CENTER OF THE NATION EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD INTO THE EASTERN U.S. FROM TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. BEFORE 
THE RIDGE ESTABLISHES ITSELF IN THE EAST A BACKDOOR COOL FRONT WILL 
LIMP SOUTH ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS REGION. THE FRONT WILL NOT HAVE MUCH INFLUENCE ON 
WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OTHER THAN A SLIGHT INCREASE IN 
CLOUD COVER MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. LATE IN THE WEEK AROUND FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY THE 
RIDGE WILL BE IN THE PROCESS OF BREAKING DOWN AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROF 
DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
DRIVING A WEAK COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE FORECAST AREA. ATTM 
KEPT POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT FOR NOW AS THE FRONT DOESN'T LOOK LIKE IT 
WILL HAVE SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL INFLOW OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO TO 
PRODUCE RAIN. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS INDICATED WARMING TREND 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM.

629 
FXUS64 KMRX 110110
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EDT SAT APR 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING ANOTHER DRY AND COOL NIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST ON TRACK.  NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL SLOWLY
DRIFT TOWARD THE EAST COAST OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. CLEAR SKIES AND
LIGHT WINDS WILL CONTINUE. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD NOT BE QUITE AS LOW
AS LAST NIGHT...SO THE RISK OF FROST/FREEZE IS LESS. WILL MENTION
PATCHY FROST IN THE MOUNTAINS AND IN SW VA/NE TN...BUT DO NOT THINK
IT WILL BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH FOR AN ADVISORY. HIGHS SUNDAY SHOULD
BE IN THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
LITTLE CHANGE IN FORECAST FROM PREVIOUS ONE. GFS AND ECMWF WORK IN
TANDEM TROUGH ABOUT THURSDAY, WHEN THE EC KEEP A WELL DEVELOPED
CLOSED LOW OVER TH THE UPPER MIDWEST/SOUTHERN CANADA AND THE GFS
BUILDS A STRONG RIDGE INTO THE SAME AREA. BOTH MODELS HAVE A CLOSE
LOW OFF NEW ENGLAND AND THE MARITIMES. BY SATURDAY THIS EUROPEAN
CLOSE LOW DROPS INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES WHILE THE GFS RIDGE
BUILDS EVEN MORE STRONGLY OVER THE INTERIOR EAST AND SOUTHEAST
CONUS. REALLY, BOTH SITUATIONS ALLOW THE POSSIBILITY OFF A BACK
DOOR FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BUT THE AIR WILL BE QUITE
DRY WITH THE GFS TURNING THE SURFACE WINDS TO NORTH-ISH AND THEN
BEGINNING TO GO NORTHEAST. BOTTOM LINE ALL WEEK: MOSTLY
SUNNY/MOSTLY CLEAR WITH VERY LOW POPS AND WARM TO ABOVE AVERAGE
DAYS AND COOL NIGHT. PERFECT SLEEPING WEATHER. ONLY FLY IN OINTMENT
IS THE DRYNESS. SOME STREAMFLOWS ARE AT OR NEAR RECORD LOWS FOR THE
DATE. APRIL IS, AFTER ALL THE MONTH THEN MANY RECORD FLOODS HAVE 
OCCURRED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  76  46  78  49 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  74  46  75  47 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       42  74  45  75  47 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              35  72  40  72  41 /   0   0   0  10  10

431 
FXUS64 KMRX 100725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SAT APR 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM...WITH A MAINLY CLEAR SKY EXPECTED AND 
TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONABLE NORMS.  WILL ALLOW FREEZE/FROST 
PRODUCTS TO CONTINUE FOR EARLY THIS MORNING.  MAY BE SOME FROST 
AGAIN TONIGHT MAINLY NORTHEAST ZONES AS WELL AS MOUNTAINS AND 
SOUTHWEST NC...BUT CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH THAT IT WILL BE EXTENSIVE SO 
FOR NOW WILL JUST MENTION PATCHY FROST AND LET DAY SHIFT DECIDE IF 
FROST ADVISORY WILL BE WARRANTED.  RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES WILL BE 
QUITE LOW THIS AFTERNOON...DIPPING BELOW 25 PERCENT ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE AREA...ALTHOUGH WINDS WILL BE LIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL 
TRANSITION FROM ZONAL TO A MORE AMPLIFIED PATTERN AS LONG WAVE TROF 
DEEPENS OVER THE WESTERN U.S. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A BACK DOOR 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHEN APPALACHIANS 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. LITTLE FANFARE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FROPA AS 
MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING AS LOW LEVEL FLOW SHOULD REMAIN EASTERLY. 
COOL CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THIS FRONT AND WILL 
OCCUPY MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S. THROUGH MID WEEK WHILE UPPER HEIGHTS 
BUILD ALOFT. THE OMEGA BLOCKING PATTERN INDICATED BY THE LONG RANGE 
MODELS MAY BE ABLE TO KEEP FAIR WEATHER IN PLACE THROUGH FRIDAY. 
STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE ALTHOUGH CUT MIN TEMPS A 
COUPLE DEGREES DUE TO BELIEF THAT DRIER ATMOSPHERE AT ALL LEVELS 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR MORE EFFICIENT RADIATION THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

     NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

     FROST ADVISORY FROM 4 AM EDT /3 AM CDT/ TO 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ 
     THIS MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...JEFFERSON...
     KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NW 
     BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST 
     MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SCOTT TN...SEQUATCHIE...UNION...
     WEST POLK.

VA...FREEZE WARNING FROM 4 AM TO 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

205 
FXUS64 KMRX 100112
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
912 PM EDT FRI APR 9 2010

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING A DRY AND COLD NIGHT TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK.  WILL LEAVE 
CURRENT WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES AS IS.  WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO 
REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT AND 
TOMORROW. THE SCATTERED CU OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS WILL DISSIPATE AT 
SUNSET...LEAVING CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS TONIGHT. THIS WILL ALLOW 
TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 30S ACROSS THE AREA...WITH THE 
MOUNTAINS...SW VA...AND NE TN LIKELY FALLING BELOW FREEZING BASED ON 
MOS GUIDANCE AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN TEMPERATURES. DID GO A COUPLE 
DEGREES BELOW GFS MOS FOR LOWS TONIGHT. A FREEZE WARNING WILL BE 
ISSUED FOR THIS AREA PLUS SW NC...WITH A FROST ADVISORY ACROSS THE 
PLATEAU COUNTIES AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY. AFTER A CHILLY 
START...SATURDAY WILL BRING PLENTY OF SUN AND HIGH TEMPERATURES IN 
THE UPPER 60S TO MID 70S. ALTHOUGH WINDS WILL BE LIGHT...RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES WILL BE QUITE LOW...AROUND 25 PERCENT TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON...SO HAZARDOUS FIRE CONDITIONS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE A 
CONCERN.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND WEAK SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL...CENTERED JUST TO OUR EAST. ON SUNDAY A
WEAK RETURN FLOW BEGINS TO TAKE SHAPE...BUT WITH NO MOISTURE. BY
SUNDAY NIGHT SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING SOUTHWARD INTO THE
GREAT LAKES INDUCES A WEAK AND DRY FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING...THAT CUTS OFF THE RETURN FLOW AND SETS
UP A NORTHERLY FETCH THAT LASTS INTO MIDWEEK. HOWEVER...IN THE
UPPER LEVELS HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING THAT SHOULD HEAT THINGS UP
FROM SUBSIDENCE ALOFT.

TOUGHER FORECAST FOR TEMPS LATER IN THE WEEK...AS BACKDOOR COOL 
SURGES WORK THEIR WAY SOUTHWARD ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...DIFFICULT TO KNOW HOW MUCH OF THIS AIR WILL BE ABLE 
TO BLEED INTO OUR CWA...FROM THE NORTHEAST DIRECTLY OR SOUTHEAST 
COMING AROUND THE BASE OF THE APPS. TENDING TOWARD THE WARMER SIDE 
OF MAX TEMP GUIDANCE FOR THESE PERIODS...AS I FEEL THAT UPPER RIDGE 
WILL DOMINATE OVER BACKDOOR COOL AIR INFLUENCE.

BY NEXT FRIDAY...UPPER RIDGE IS WEAKENING SOMEWHAT AND LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE LOOKS LIKE IT MAY FINALLY BE RETURNING AS SOUTHWEST WINDS 
BRING MOISTURE FROM THE WESTERN GULF.  NOT GOING TO INTRODUCE ANY 
POPS YET...BECAUSE STABLE AIR FROM BACKDOOR SYSTEMS STILL LOOKS VERY 
CLOSE BY...TO OUR SOUTH...SO MOISTURE COULD BE BLOCKED.  THIS WILL 
BE SOMETHING TO WATCH FOR LATER PERIODS.  ALSO, NO OBVIOUS FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTION CAN BE SEEN IN THE AREA EITHER.

NOT OFTEN WE SEE AN ENTIRE SEVEN DAY PERIOD WITH NO MENTION OF 
PRECIPITATION...WHICH STARTS TO MAKE FOR FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS.  
RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES GET PRETTY DRY ON SOME OF THE DAYS...BUT 
WINDS BEHAVE THEMSELVES FOR THE MOST PART THROUGH THIS PERIOD.  RH 
VALUES WILL LIKELY GO BELOW 35% AT MANY LOCATIONS ON A DAILY BASIS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  36  71  41  73  44 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  71  41  74  42 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              31  69  34  74  39 /   0   0   0   0   0

     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     EAST POLK...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...NORTHWEST 
     CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...
     SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

     FROST ADVISORY FROM 4 AM EDT /3 AM CDT/ TO 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ 
     SATURDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...JEFFERSON...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
951 AM EDT FRI APR 9 2010

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS WILL LINGER ACROSS THE NORTHERN COUNTIES
TODAY AS THE MIDLEVEL THERMAL TROUGH CREATES STEEP LAPSE RATES IN
THAT AREA. OTHERWISE SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY. WILL UPDATE TO
MAKE SOME SLIGHT CHANGES TO THE SKY GRIDS AND CLOUD WORDING IN THE
FORECAST...AND DECREASE WINDS SLIGHTLY AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT
SLACKENS THROUGH THE DAY. CURRENT FORECAST TEMPERATURES LOOK TO BE
ON TRACK.

LOOKING AT THE 06Z MODEL DATA FOR TONIGHT...NEAR- TO SUB-FREEZING
TEMPERATURES APPEAR LIKELY ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN...WITH MID 30S IN
THE CENTRAL VALLEY. WILL AWAIT THE 12Z DATA BEFORE MAKING A FINAL
DECISION...BUT AT THE MOMENT THE FROST ADVISORY WILL LIKELY NEED
BE EXPANDED SOUTH WITH A FREEZE WARNING ADDED NORTH WITH THE
AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE.

865 
FXUS64 KMRX 090725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT FRI APR 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DEPARTING UPPER TROUGH WILL GIVE 
WAY TO RIDGING ALOFT...WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN.  
CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY CLEAR OUT BY LATER TODAY...LEAVING A MAINLY 
CLEAR SKY OVERNIGHT.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME FROST 
ESPECIALLY NORTH AND SOUTHWEST NC/SE TN MOUNTAINS.  LOOKS LIKE 
ENOUGH OF A RISK TO ISSUE FROST ADVISORY THESE AREAS AT THIS 
TIME...AND DAY SHIFT CAN TAKE A LOOK TO SEE IF IT WILL NEED TO BE 
EXPANDED.   ELSEWHERE WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FROST MENTION...EXCEPT 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL TN MOUNTAINS WHERE FREEZE PROGRAM HAS NOT 
STARTED YET.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STAYED WITH A DRY FORECAST 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMING ZONAL FOR A BRIEF 
TIME OVER THE WEEKEND. GRADUALLY THE PATTERN BEGINS TO AMPLIFY WHICH 
CAUSES UPPER LEVEL WINDS TO BECOME NORTHWESTERLY LATER SUNDAY NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY. THE MODELS INDICATE A WEAK AND MOISTURE STARVED FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY DROPS SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WITH 
VERY LITTLE IMPACT. TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
BUILDS ACROSS THE CENTRAL INTO THE EASTERN U.S. KEEPING THE FORECAST 
DRY WHILE MAINTAINING PLEASANT TEMPERATURES IN THE 70S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

780 
FXUS64 KMRX 090134
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT THU APR 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...TAIL END OF JET SEGMENT EAST OF UPPER TROF ABOUT TO 
EXIT THE MRX CWA. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE POPS...LOWER CLOUD COVER AND 
RAISE MINS A DEGREE OR TWO. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
EXTRAPOLATION OF THE BACK EDGE OF THE PRECIP BRINGS IT TO OUR 
EASTERN BORDER BY 00Z. SO WILL INCLUDE A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD IN 
THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE RAIN UNTIL THAT 
TIME. THE SURFACE FRONT IS LOCATED JUST BEHIND THE BACK EDGE OF THE 
RAIN...AND IS NOW ENTERING THE PLATEAU. THE FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH 
THE AREA BEFORE MIDNIGHT. GOOD COLD ADVECTION WITH A NORTHWEST FLOW 
WILL FOLLOW. SATELLITE INDICATES SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERING 
BEHIND THE FRONT...THEN CLEARING COMING LATER TONIGHT. THIS EARLY 
CLOUD COVER ALONG WITH SOME LIGHT WINDS WILL KEEP TEMPS WELL ABOVE 
FREEZING TONIGHT. THE NAM AND GFS SHOW A MOIST LAYER AROUND 850 MB 
TOMORROW IN NORTHERN AREAS...SO WE SHOULD NOT BE COMPLETELY CLEAR. 
HIGHS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY TOMORROW MAY REACH THE UPPER 60S...BUT 
IN THE NORTH ONLY 50S ARE EXPECTED.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
AFTER THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT STAY A
BIT TIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND THOUGH TEMPS WILL BE MUCH COOLER
IN THE AFTERMATH OF THE FRONT, HAVE KEPT THEM UP MOSTLY ABOVE
FREEZING. STILL, SOME ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEAST AND HIGHER
TERRAIN SOME PLACES WILL DROP DOWN TO WELL BELOW FREEZING. WILL NOT
ISSUE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT OR FREEZE WATCH AS THESE AREAS ARE
STILL QUITE PRONE TO SUCH TEMPS AT THIS SEASON. WILL SEE A RIDGE
BUILD INTO NEXT WEEK FOR A WARMING AND DRYING TREND. WILL ALSO
WATCH THE DRYNESS FACTOR. SOME FIRE WEATHERS, AND LOW STREAMFLOWS,
WITH LITTLE TO NO RAIN EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. NO
DROUGHT, BUT OVERALL DRYNESS IS BEGINNING TO CREEP BACK IN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  67  39  72  41 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  62  37  69  41 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  63  36  72  38 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  59  31  70  33 /  10   0   0   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

224 PM EDT THU APR 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
EXTRAPOLATION OF THE BACK EDGE OF THE PRECIP BRINGS IT TO OUR 
EASTERN BORDER BY 00Z. SO WILL INCLUDE A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD IN 
THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE RAIN UNTIL THAT 
TIME. THE SURFACE FRONT IS LOCATED JUST BEHIND THE BACK EDGE OF THE 
RAIN...AND IS NOW ENTERING THE PLATEAU. THE FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH 
THE AREA BEFORE MIDNIGHT. GOOD COLD ADVECTION WITH A NORTHWEST FLOW 
WILL FOLLOW. SATELLITE INDICATES SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERING 
BEHIND THE FRONT...THEN CLEARING COMING LATER TONIGHT. THIS EARLY 
CLOUD COVER ALONG WITH SOME LIGHT WINDS WILL KEEP TEMPS WELL ABOVE 
FREEZING TONIGHT. THE NAM AND GFS SHOW A MOIST LAYER AROUND 850 MB 
TOMORROW IN NORTHERN AREAS...SO WE SHOULD NOT BE COMPLETELY CLEAR. 
HIGHS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY TOMORROW MAY REACH THE UPPER 60S...BUT 
IN THE NORTH ONLY 50S ARE EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
AFTER THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT STAY A
BIT TIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND THOUGH TEMPS WILL BE MUCH COOLER
IN THE AFTERMATH OF THE FRONT, HAVE KEPT THEM UP MOSTLY ABOVE
FREEZING. STILL, SOME ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEAST AND HIGHER
TERRAIN SOME PLACES WILL DROP DOWN TO WELL BELOW FREEZING. WILL NOT
ISSUE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT OR FREEZE WATCH AS THESE AREAS ARE
STILL QUITE PRONE TO SUCH TEMPS AT THIS SEASON. WILL SEE A RIDGE
BUILD INTO NEXT WEEK FOR A WARMING AND DRYING TREND. WILL ALSO
WATCH THE DRYNESS FACTOR. SOME FIRE WEATHERS, AND LOW STREAMFLOWS,
WITH LITTLE TO NO RAIN EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. NO
DROUGHT, BUT OVERALL DRYNESS IS BEGINNING TO CREEP BACK IN.

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 AM EDT THU APR 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...
LEADING LINE OF SHOWERS IS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA ABOUT 3 HOURS
FASTER THAN SHOWN BY THE NAM...AND THE BACK EDGE OF THE TRAILING
STRATIFORM PRECIP IS ON OUR DOORSTEP. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT IS
LOCATED JUST EAST OF NASHVILLE AT THE MOMENT...AND WILL MOVE ACROSS
OUR AREA THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...REACHING OUR EASTERN
BORDER BETWEEN 6 PM AND 8 PM. SOME LIGHT SHOWERS MAY ACCOMPANY THE
FRONT...BUT MOST OF THE RAIN WILL END BETWEEN 4 PM AND 6 PM. WILL
SPEED UP THE DECREASE OF POPS THROUGH THE DAY. 

THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY HAS DIMINISHED WITH THE CONVECTIVE LINE...AND
WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO JUST MENTION SHOWERS THE REST OF THE
DAY. 

COLD ADVECTION AND CLOUDS BEHIND THE FRONT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES
FROM RISING MUCH TODAY...AND MANY PLACES HAVE PROBABLY ALREADY SEEN
THEIR HIGH TEMPS. SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURES WILL BE MADE
WITH THE UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
421 AM EDT THU APR 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT TO THE WEST OF THE 
CWA TRIGGERING SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN MIDDLE TN AND NORTHERN

TODAY. INSTABILITY IS FAIRLY WEAK...BUT A FEW OF THE THUNDERSTORMS 
MAY STILL BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE.  ANOTHER BREEZY DAY IS ALSO 
EXPECTED. THE CLOUDS ENTERING THE REGION WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FAIRLY STEADY WITH TEMPERATURES MUCH COLDER THAN YESTERDAY. THE 
FRONT TRACKS OUT OF THE AREA TONIGHT...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES 
IN THE EVENING HOURS.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL  
MOVE EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY ALLOWING A RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE...SURFACE AND ALOFT...TO BUILD INTO THE REGION. THIS 
PERSISTENT RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP CONDITIONS DRY WITH A 
WARMING TREND. MORE SUMMER-LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN EARLY NEXT 
WEEK AS A STRONGER UPPER RIDGE DEVELOPS OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.

FOLLOWED THE GFS TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BUT WENT A 
DEGREE OR TWO WARMER FOR HIGHS EARLY NEXT WEEK AS STRONG UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS.

ELEVATED FIRE DANGER WILL LIKELY RETURN LATE THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY 
NEXT WEEK AS DEWPOINTS REMAIN LOW AND DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WARM-UP
PRODUCING LOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES.

877 
FXUS64 KMRX 080142
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT WED APR 7 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BEGUN TO 
DEVELOP IN WEST TN...WELL AHEAD OF THE SURFACE FRONT...WHICH IS 
LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL MO AND AR. THIS APPEARS TO BE FASTER THAN THE 
MODELS DEPICT. AS A RESULT...WILL HAVE POPS HIGHER THAN MOS GUIDANCE 
TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN THE WEST. WILL BRING POPS INTO OUR WESTERN 
COUNTIES AROUND MIDNIGHT...WITH LIKELY POPS A FEW HOURS LATER. WILL 
CONTINUE THE CATEGORICAL POPS FOR THURSDAY MORNING AND EARLY 
AFTERNOON. INSTABILITY LOOKS QUITE WEAK WITH MUCAPE UNDER 500 J/KG 
AND LI UNDER -2. THIS SHOULD BE ENOUGH FOR A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
WITH GUSTY WINDS...BUT SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS MINIMAL. PRECIP 
APPEARS TO END QUICKLY ONCE THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH...WHICH LOOKS TO 
BE IN THE AFTERNOON. WITH COLD ADVECTION AND OVERCAST CLOUDS BEHIND 
THE FRONT...EXPECT THAT THE HIGH TEMPS FOR THE DAY WILL BE REACHED 
IN THE MORNING...AND TEMPS WILL FALL OR HOLD NEARLY STEADY THROUGH 
THE DAY. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS MAY 
LINGER OVER THE AREA THURSDAY EVENING AS A COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO 
PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA.  BEHIND THE FRONT...MUCH COOLER AND DRIER 
AIR WILL SLIDE IN.  AFTERNOON HIGHS WILL DROP BELOW NORMAL LEVELS ON 
FRIDAY...WITH A WARMING TREND EXPECTED FOR THE WEEKEND.  A DRY AIR 
MASS AND A SURFACE HIGH WILL BE IN PLACE FOR MUCH OF THE 
EXTENDED...AND WILL PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS FRIDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY.  

&&

DOMINATE THE FORECAST PRODUCING AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER

STORMS AS THEY MOVE INTO THE AREA. PW VALUES UP A BIT FROM PREVIOUS 
RUNS BUT CONTINUE TO FALL OFF AS SYSTEM MOVES INTO AND THEN EAST OF 
THE AREA. ONE HALF TO THREE QUARTERS OF AN INCH REMAINS A GOOD BET 
AS PCPN MOVES THROUGH BY THU EVE. UPPER TROF AXIS MOVES THROUGH FRI 
MORNING. SURFACE RIDGE REMAINS W OF AREA WITH NW FLOW AND GOOD CAA 
INTO SAT MORNING. H85 TEMPS FALL TO BELOW FREEZING ACROSS NE AREAS. 
SHELTERED VALLEYS COULD DECOUPLE ACROSS NE TN/SW VA WITH FREEZING 
TEMPS POSSIBLE SAT MORN. RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN FOR THE REMAINDER OF 
THE PERIOD. ANOTHER DRY SPELL AND WARMING TREND ON TRACK FOR NEXT 
WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EDT TUE APR 6 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN FOR TODAY IS THE
ELEVATED FIRE DANGER. LOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL DROP
TO 20-25 PERCENT WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS BETWEEN 10 AND 20 MPH. WILL
INFORM DAYSHIFT OF POTENTIAL NEED OF FIRE DANGER STATEMENT.
CONDITIONS WILL BE CLOSE TO FIRE WARNING CRITERIA. SUSTAIN WIND
SPEED CRITERIA WILL NOT BE MEET.

SYNOPTIC...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE...SURFACE AND ALOFT...WILL
DOMINATE THE SHORT-TERM PRODUCING SUMMER-LIKE TEMPERATURES. RECORD
HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY BE SEEN TODAY AT MOST LOCATIONS. VERY
DRY AIRMASS WITH PWS AROUND .5 INCH...SO DRY AND WARM WILL BE THE
THEME FOR TODAY'S WEATHER.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH 
THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  WILL KEEP THE LIKELY POPS 
GOING FOR OUR WESTERN COUNTIES FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE CWA ON THURSDAY AS THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH. WITH SOME 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED ALONG WITH STRONG LOW LEVEL JET...A FEW STRONG 
TO SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY.  THE FRONT MAY LINGER 
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  TEMPERATURES BECOME 
CLOSER TO NORMAL TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK.  STAYED NEAR MEX AND 
HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AND BELOW THE LIKELY NAM POPS FOR MONDAY. PREVIOUS GRIDS WITH CHANCE

NWS OFFICES TO OUR NORTH. MUCH MILDER FOR MINS TONIGHT WITH CLOUDS 
DEVELOPING AND LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS AS WELL...AND I TRENDED TOWARD 
THE GFS MOS MINS. 

BETTER MIXING THAN EXPECTED HAS LOWERED DEW POINT TEMPS CONSIDERABLY 
ACROSS THE AREA...BUT THOSE DEW POINTS SHOULD RECOVER OVERNIGHT...
AND REACH INTO THE MID 40S TO MID 50S ON MONDAY. SURFACE WINDS WILL 
PICK UP A BIT BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AS SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST 
TO THE SRN ATLANTIC AND SW LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS. MIN RH VALUES 
SHOULD STAY ABOVE CRITICAL VALUES ON MONDAY...BUT WARMER TEMPS ON 
TUESDAY SHOULD DROP MIN RH DOWN TO OR JUST BELOW CRITICAL VALUES ON 
TUESDAY. I WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT TONIGHT AND DAYSHIFT MONDAY 
COORDINATE WITH FIRE AGENCIES ON THE NEED FOR A POSSIBLE FIRE DANGER 
STATEMENT...FOR MONDAY AND/OR TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY EVENING.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NICE AMPLIFIED UPPER 
RIDGE KEEPS THE WEATHER RATHER NICE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS 
FORECAST AREA AWAITS ADVANCE OF PLAINS STATES UPPER LEVEL TROF. WENT 
CLOSER TO ECMWF FROPA FOR THURSDAY WITH A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY TAPERING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS SOME TRAILING ENERGY DROPS IN BEHIND 
THE MAIN UPPER TROF. KEPT REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH 
SUNDAY AS DRIER/COOLER NORTHWEST FLOW BUILDS IN TO WRAP UP THE 
WEEKEND.

258 
FXUS64 KMRX 031946
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 PM EDT SAT APR 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...PER LATE COORDINATION WITH
SW NC FIRE DISTRICTS...ADDED CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES TO THE RED FLAG
WARNING WHICH RUNS THRU 7 PM EDT. WIND SPEEDS MARGINAL THERE BUT RH
HAS DROPPED VERY LOW DUE TO STRONG MIXING AND DEMISE OF SHOWERS. 

FIRE DANGER THREAT LINGERS INTO AT LEAST MONDAY...AS HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS OVER THE REGION...AND UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES LINGER.
LIGHTER WIND SPEEDS WITH VERY LOW AFTERNOON TO EARLY EVENING
HUMIDITIES...SO CONDITIONS SHOULD BE JUST ABOVE RED FLAG CRITERIA.

EXPECT FRONTAL PASSAGE BY 6 PM OR SO...WITH SKIES SLOWLY CLEARING. 
FAVORED MILDER MINS TONIGHT GIVEN CURRENT DEW POINTS AND LIGHT
WINDS. SUNNY AND CONTINUED WARM SUNDAY...DRY SUNDAY NIGHT...THEN 
ADDED A VERY LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA FOR
MONDAY AFTERNOON. NOT SURE WHAT MODELS ARE SHOWING OTHER THAN A
POSSIBLE WEAK DISTURBANCE TO OUR NORTH IN THE ZONAL FLOW...COUPLED 
WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION AND INCREASING INSTABILITY TO OUR NORTH.

OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY
AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK SHORTWAVE DROPS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WITH LITTLE IMPACT ON THE 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT. PATTERN AMPLIFIES AGAIN TUESDAY WITH 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. KEEPING THE REGION VERY 
WARM AND DRY THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROF MAKES ITS 
MOVE INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 12Z THURSDAY WITH SYSTEM COLD 
FRONT SHIFTING EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY SO CRANKED 
POPS FROM 30 PERCENT WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO 40 PERCENT ON THURSDAY WITH 
CONVECTION THE MORE LIKELY CHOICE FOR CHARACTER OF PRECIP. 
PREFERRED ECMWF DEPICTION WITH MORE PROGRESSIVE SYSTEM MOVEMENT 
FRIDAY INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND SO STAYED WITH A DRY 
FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.

MIDDLE TN AND NORTHWEST AL. THIS COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE MOVING 
EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY...WITH SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS 
INCREASING AFTER SUNRISE ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. CONVECTION 
ALONG THE FRONT SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO EAST TN...DUE TO A 
MORE STABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE AND THE UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS MOVING 
NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. WILL PLAN TO MENTION THUNDER 
AT KCHA LATER THIS MORNING...BUT WILL MENTION SHOWERS AT KTYS DUE TO 
THE EXPECTED WEAKENING TREND. OVERALL...EXPECT VFR CONDITIONS WITH A 
DRY BOUNDARY LAYER CREATING HIGH CLOUD BASES WITH THE CONVECTION. 
THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD QUICKLY PASS THROUGH ALL THREE TAF SITES BY 
SUNSET...WITH LIGHT WINDS AND ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS EXPECTED

063 
FXUS64 KMRX 030640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT SAT APR 3 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE OZARKS REGION...WITH A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION 
OCCURRING AHEAD OF IT OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY... 
WITH ITS ASSOCIATED CONVECTION WEAKENING AS IT MOVES INTO A DRIER 
AND MORE STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. IN ADDITION...THE 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY 
MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY THIS EVENING. 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL BECOME GUSTY THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE 
FRONT...WHICH WILL INCREASE THE FIRE DANGER THREAT WITH THE BOUNDARY 
LAYER REMAINING VERY DRY. WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION SOME 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND TSTORMS FOR TODAY...WITH ISOLATED ACTIVITY 
EXPECTED FURTHER EAST ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT TODAY...AND GENERALLY ONLY AROUND A 
TENTH OF AN INCH OR LESS IN MOST AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE WITH COOLER TEMPS EXPECTED TODAY DUE TO INCREASED CLOUD 
COVER.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MINOR SHORT WAVE TROUGH  
PASSES JUST NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY. SYSTEM CLOSE 
ENOUGH THAT STRAY SHOWER CLIPPING NORTHERN TIER PROBABLY CAN'T BE 
RULED OUT...BUT KEPT MONDAY DRY FOR NOW. MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES LATER IN THE WORK WEEK. MAJOR TIMING DISCREPANCIES HAVE 
EMERGED BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND GFS WITH THE GFS BEING NEARLY 36 HOURS 
FASTER WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION. 
ENSEMBLES ARE NOT MUCH HELP AS THE GEFS ENSEMBLES FAVOR THE GFS 
TIMING WHILE THE CANADIAN ENSEMBLES FAVOR THE EUROPEAN MODEL TIMING. 
DUE TO THE MAJOR TIMING UNCERTAINTIES...DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST WHICH TEND TO FAVOR ECMWF 
TIMING. TEMPS WILL FALL BACK TO NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO AFTER 
PASSAGE OF FRONT...BUT NO REALLY COLD AIR IN SIGHT AS HEIGHT 
ANOMALIES REMAIN NO WORSE THAN NEUTRAL PER GEFS ENSEMBLES.


&&

646 
FXUS64 KMRX 021926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT FRI APR 2 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN CONCERN FOR THESE
PERIODS CONTINUES TO BE FIRE WEATHER DANGER ACROSS ESPECIALLY SW VA
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. LOW LEVEL JET BRIEFLY INCREASES LATE SATURDAY
MORNING AND AFTERNOON...TO GET SUSTAINED SPEEDS AROUND 20 MPH OR SO
WITH SOME HIGHER GUSTS...UNTIL THE FRONTAL PASSAGE VERY EARLY
SATURDAY EVENING.

HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE SLIGHTLY AHEAD OF THE FRONT...
AND ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS MAY ALSO DEVELOP. THE
INCREASED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...PLUS SOME CLOUDINESS...WILL WORK TO
PRODUCE LOWEST AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES IN THE 30 TO 35 PERCENT RANGE. 

THUS...CONDITIONS MAY BRIEFLY REACH NEAR RED FLAG WARNING CRITERIA
SATURDAY AFTERNOON...ACROSS MOST OF SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA. WILL ALSO
RE-ISSUE SPS FOR FIRE DANGER IN CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES...ALTHO
WIND SPEEDS WON'T BE AS HIGH THERE...AND ALSO LOWEST RH WILL BE
QUITE HIGHER THAN TODAY (35 TO 45 PERCENT).

OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION RATHER
QUICKLY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...SO DRY WEATHER EXCEPT FOR ONE
PERIOD. FAVORED WARMER MINS IN THE WRN SECTIONS TONIGHT AND WARMER
MAXES FOR NE TN AND SW VA ON SATURDAY. CHOSE A MOS BLEND FOR MINS
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH VERY WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION...AND GFS MOS
LOOKED GREAT FOR MAXES SUNDAY.

THANKS TO RNK FOR THE COORDINATION ON THE RED FLAG WATCH. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE PERIOD STARTS OUT 
WITH A ZONAL FLOW BUT TRANSITIONS INTO A NICE AMPLIFYING RIDGE 
PATTERN ALL THE WAY OUT THROUGH MID WEEK. THIS RATHER EXTENDED 
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WILL BE DRY AWAITING THE ARRIVAL OF THE NEXT 
UPPER TROF WHICH PRESSES INTO THE EASTERN U.S. LATER ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH A COLD FRONT BUILDING TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. KEPT POPS IN A LOW CHANCE RANGE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THIS PERIOD DUE TO TIMING UNCERTAINTIES WITH 
THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN. BUT FROPA WILL OCCUR SOMETIME THURSDAY 
FOLLOWED BY SOME TRAILING SHORTWAVE ENERGY FOR LATER THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY WHICH ACCOUNTS FOR THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP AT THIS TIME. 
TWEAKED MAX TEMPS JUST A LITTLE WARMER EARLY IN THE FORECAST WHILE 
ADJUSTING MINS DOWN A BIT DUE TO DRIER CONDITIONS EARLY ON. 


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 AM EDT FRI APR 2 2010

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE HAVE SHIFTED SLIGHTLY EAST 
FROM YESTERDAY...BUT ANOTHER DAY OF SUNSHINE AND UNSEASONABLY WARM 
TEMPERATURES WILL OCCUR THIS AFTERNOON. 12Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW 
TEMPS ALOFT HAVE WARMED AND MOST AREAS WILL REACH 70S TO MID 80S
...ALTHO HIGHEST ELEVATIONS MIGHT JUST GET TO MID OR UPPER 60S
(WHICH ARE SEASONAL NORMS FOR THE LOWER ELEVATIONS).

THE DRY AIRMASS ALLOWED MIN TEMPS TO FALL A FEW DEGREES BELOW EVEN 
THE COOLER MOS MINS FROM YESTERDAY'S 12Z MOS GUIDANCE. 

WEATHER LOOKS TO CHANGE BRIEFLY ON SATURDAY...WITH A VERY BRIEF 
BREEZY PERIOD SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SOME WEAKENING SHOWERS MOVING
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. RAIN THREAT SHOULD END SATURDAY 
EVENING AND THE BREEZY WINDS WILL VERY QUICKLY DECREASE...AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE REGION AGAIN.

FXUS64 KMRX 020635

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EDT FRI APR 2 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD... 
WITH AN ELONGATED AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
PLAINS. THIS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL COMBINE WITH A STRONG 
UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST TO BRING ANOTHER WARM AND 
TRANQUIL DAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. CONVECTION OVER THE PLAINS 
WILL LIKELY CREATE SOME HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATER 
THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT...BUT PROBABLY NOT ENOUGH TO MENTION 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. TEMPS WILL ONCE AGAIN RISE INTO THE 80S AND 
POSSIBLY REACH CLOSE TO THE RECORDS FOR THIS DATE (CHA 88...TYS 
88...OQT 84...TRI 83). WILL ALSO PLAN TO REISSUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT MENTIONING HIGH FIRE DANGER TODAY DUE TO LOW AFTERNOON 
RELATIVE HUMIDITIES AND THE UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WELL ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM AS UPPER RIDGE 
HOLDS STRONG OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. A COUPLE OF WEAK SYSTEMS WILL
HAVE LIMITED SUCCESS IN OVERCOMING UPPER RIDGE BOTH ON SATURDAY AND
AGAIN MONDAY. APPEARS SATURDAY'S SYSTEM WILL WEAKEN AS IT TRAVERSES
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SO NOT EXPECTING ANYTHING
SIGNIFICANT AT THIS TIME. MONDAY'S SYSTEM ALSO APPEARS RELATIVELY
INSIGNIFICANT. DRY PERIOD ENSUES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE
ANOTHER POTENTIALLY MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY LATE IN
THE LONG TERM PERIOD. QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO
TIMING WITH THIS SYSTEM. THUS HAVE SPREAD CHANCE POPS OVER SEVERAL
PERIODS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED MAV/MEX FAIRLY CLOSELY.
APPEARS TEMPS WILL RETURN TO NEAR OR EVEN BELOW CLIMO WITH LATE
WEEK SYSTEM AS HEIGHTS FALL SIGNIFICANTLY.

PREVAIL AT ALL THREE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD.

133 
FXUS64 KMRX 011901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT THU APR 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG ACROSS 
SE STATES INTO FRIDAY EVENING. SURFACE RIDGE AXIS ACROSS THE SRN AND 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON WILL SLIP EAST TO ALONG THE 
ATLANTIC COAST STATES BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL ALLOW A WEAK 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE PLATEAU LATE FRIDAY.
ELSEWHERE...CALM WINDS AT NIGHT AND VARAIBLE 5 TO 10 MPH DAYTIME 
FRIDAY. 

AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES WILL REMAIN LOW...BUT JUST ABOVE RED FLAG 
WARNING CRITERIA...WHILE WIND SPEEDS REMAIN WELL BELOW CRITERIA.
THUS...AN SPS TO HIGHLIGHT INCREASED FIRE DANGER FOR SW VA AND SW NC 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND WILL SUFFICE. 

DRY AIR ALLOWED A LARGE DIURNAL RANGE TODAY...WITH THURSDAY MINS 
DIPPING A TAD BELOW MOS IN GENERAL AND MAXES THUS FAR RUNNING BELOW 
ANY RECORD VALUES. GIVEN LAST NIGHT MINS...I TRENDED WITH OR JUST 
BELOW THE COOLER MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT. MOS HIGHS FOR FRIDAY ARE 
QUITE CLOSE AND LOOK VERY REASONABLE...AND SHOULD STAY BELOW RECORDS 
EXCEPT FOR TRI (82). RECORD HIGH FOR BOTH CHA AND TYS IS 88 DEGREES.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON-EVENING.
UPPER SUPPORT WILL MOVE WELL WEST AND NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA
AND MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED DUE TO RIDGING INTO THE GULF. WILL
KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE WITH HIGHEST IN THE WEST.

UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME ZONAL FOR SUNDAY WITH DRY AND CONTINUED WARM
WEATHER. FOR MONDAY...WINDS BECOME MORE SOUTHERLY ALLOWING GULF
MOISTURE TO RETURN. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AS INSTABILITY RETURNS.

FOR TUESDAY...RIDGING RETURNS WITH VERY WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS.
FOR WEDNESDAY...ANOTHER FRONT MOVES TOWARD THE AREA. LOW CONFIDENCE
OF TIMING OF NEXT SYSTEM. WILL ONLY GO FOR CHANCE POPS FOR NOW.
BETTER MOISTURE RETURN FROM THE GULF WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG CONVECTION.

FOR THURSDAY...FRONT MOVES EAST WITH COOLER WEATHER.

&&

071 
FXUS64 KMRX 010750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT THU APR 1 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE LIES
DIRECTLY OVERHEAD EARLY THIS MORNING WITH UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE
ENTIRE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. WIDE RANGE OF TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING
WITH MID AND UPPER 30S EXTREME NE TN VALLEYS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA TO 40S MOST OTHER LOCATIONS. HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON THE
PLATEAU AND MID SLOPE AREAS IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60. CURRENT CLEAR
SKIES AND WARMING TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TODAY AS THICKNESS
VALUES RISE EVEN MORE TODAY. HIGHS SHOULD REACH NEAR 80 TO THE
LOWER 80S AND NEAR TO THIS MORNING TO SLIGHTLY WARMER WITH LOWS
40S TO LOWER 50S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
STRONG HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SE ATLANTIC COAST WILL REMAIN NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...GIVING OUR AREA WARM TEMPERATURES 
AND CLEAR SKIES. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BE IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S IN 
MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS...AND TRI IS EXPECTED TO BREAK OR 
TIE A RECORD HIGH OF 82 (RECORD HIGHS FRIDAY AT TYS AND CHA ARE BOTH 
88...AND THEY SHOULD REMAIN BELOW THAT).

AN UPPER TROUGH TRACKS FROM TEXAS TO THE GREAT LAKES SATURDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY. THE GFS CONTINUES TO BE FASTER THAN THE ECMWF WITH 
THIS SYSTEM. GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE RIDGE ALONG THE EAST 
COAST...PREFER THE SLOWER SOLUTION WITH MEAGER POPS SATURDAY NIGHT. 
THE SYSTEM STRETCHES OUT AS IT LIFTS NORTHEAST...WITH THE BEST LIFT 
PASSING TO OUR NORTH. ANY SHOWERS/TSTMS THAT APPROACH FROM THE WEST 
WILL LIKELY BE DECREASING AS THEY MOVE EAST.

WE SHOULD SEE A SLIGHT COOL-DOWN FOR SUNDAY AS THE UPPER RIDGE GETS 
TEMPORARILY SUPPRESSED FARTHER SOUTH...BUT THE RIDGE BUILDS BACK 
NORTHWARD FOR MONDAY. GFS SEEMS TOO COOL EARLY NEXT WEEK AND WENT 
ABOVE GUIDANCE ON TEMPS. ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES IN BY MID WEEK. 
MODELS DIFFER ON SOLUTIONS BUT KEPT ISOLD TSTM CHANCE GOING.

&&

764 
FXUS64 KMRX 311841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EDT WED MAR 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A DRY AIRMASS OVER THE REGION 
AS A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE (SURFACE AND ALOFT) DOMINATES. VERY 
LIGHT TO CALM WINDS OVERNIGHT...PLUS CURRENT DEW POINT TEMPS...WHICH 
SHOULD FAVOR THE COOLER MOS MIN TEMPS. A GOOD DIURNAL RANGE THURSDAY 
FROM MINS TO MAXES...BUT PREFERRED TO GO CLOSER TO A MOS BLEND OVER 
THE VERY WARM GFS MOS HIGHS. THOSE GFS MOS HIGHS FOR THURSDAY ARE 
ACTUALLY JUST A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR APRIL 1ST. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
STRONG HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SE ATLANTIC COAST WILL REMAIN NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...GIVING OUR AREA WARM TEMPERATURES 
AND CLEAR SKIES. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BE IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S IN 
MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS...AND TRI IS EXPECTED TO BREAK OR 
TIE A RECORD HIGH OF 82 (RECORD HIGHS FRIDAY AT TYS AND CHA ARE BOTH 
88...AND THEY SHOULD REMAIN BELOW THAT).

AN UPPER TROUGH TRACKS FROM TEXAS TO THE GREAT LAKES SATURDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY. THE GFS CONTINUES TO BE FASTER THAN THE ECMWF WITH 
THIS SYSTEM. GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE RIDGE ALONG THE EAST 
COAST...PREFER THE SLOWER SOLUTION WITH HIGHEST POPS SATURDAY NIGHT. 
STILL...BOTH SYSTEMS STRETCH THE SYSTEM OUT AS IT LIFTS 
NORTHEAST...WITH THE BEST LIFT PASSING TO OUR NORTH. ANY 
SHOWERS/TSTMS THAT APPROACH FROM THE WEST WILL LIKELY BE DECREASING 
AS THEY MOVE EAST. SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE LOW CHANCE RANGE 
SATURDAY NIGHT...AND REMOVE ALL POPS FROM SUNDAY. 

WE SHOULD SEE A SLIGHT COOL-DOWN FOR SUNDAY AS THE UPPER RIDGE GETS 
TEMPORARILY SUPPRESSED FARTHER SOUTH...BUT THE RIDGE BUILDS BACK 
NORTHWARD FOR MONDAY. THE MODELS DEPICT A CLOSED LOW OVER THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS PUSHING A COLD FRONT THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY. THERE ARE 
SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES...BUT WILL INTRODUCE WEDNESDAY WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP.

FXUS64 KMRX 310743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EDT WED MAR 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES ARE CLEAR ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH CALM WINDS. TEMPERATURES RANGE FROM
THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S NE VALLEYS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA
VALLEYS TO LOWER TO MID 40S ELSEWHERE. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH ONLY A FEW THIN HIGH
LEVEL CLOUDS AND WARMING TEMPERATURES. DRY AIR ALOFT WILL CAUSE
RAPID WARMING INTO THE 70S. SOME PLACES MAY BE NEAR 80 IN THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY. TONIGHT WITH FULL RADIATIONAL COOLING TEMPERATURES
WILL AGAIN DROP INTO THE MID 30S TO MID 40S. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS THROUGH FRIDAY. SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE AXIS WILL 
GIVE CLEAR SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S/LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS 
THURSDAY. THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS TOWARD THE COAST...PROVIDING A LIGHT 
SW FLOW THAT SHOULD BRING EVEN WARMER TEMPS FOR FRIDAY...WITH HIGHS 
IN THE LOWER/MID 80S IN THE VALLEY. RECORD HIGHS FOR FRIDAY ARE 
TRI-82...TYS-88...CHA-88 SO PROBABLY ONLY TRI WILL GET CLOSE TO A 
RECORD HIGH.

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL LIFT FROM THE DESERT SW TO THE GREAT LAKES FOR 
THE WEEKEND. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT ARE IN SLIGHTLY BETTER AGREEMENT THAN 
YESTERDAY. OVERALL THE MODELS SEEM TO BE CONVERGING TOWARD A 
SATURDAY NIGHT TIMING FOR FROPA. WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON...AND RAISE POPS SATURDAY NIGHT TO A CHANCE. WILL 
KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SUNDAY DUE TO THE TIMING UNCERTAINTIES. 
A WEAK RIDGE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY AND MILD WEATHER EARLY NEXT WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 310108

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EDT TUE MAR 30 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OFF 
THE NORTHEAST COAST...WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE TN AND 
OHIO RIVER VALLEYS. THIS HIGH WILL BRING CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL 
CLOSE TO THE CURRENT DEWPOINTS. AS A RESULT...IT WOULD APPEAR THAT 
SOME PATCHY FOG MAY BE POSSIBLE TOWARDS SUNRISE...MAINLY NEAR THE 
WATERWAYS. HOWEVER...WILL NOT PLAN TO MENTION PATCHY FOG IN THE 
ZONES...SINCE THE RELATIVELY COOL WATER TEMPS THIS TIME OF YEAR MAY 
PREVENT ANY MEANINGFUL FOG DEVELOPMENT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS EVENING.

131 
FXUS64 KMRX 301815
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
215 PM EDT TUE MAR 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MAJOR SHIFT TO NEAR SUMMER 
PATTERN COMMENCES DURING THE SHORT TERM AS SPRAWLING UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS OVER MUCH OF THE EASTERN CONUS. UPPER FLOW TRANSITIONS FROM 
CYCLONIC TO ANTICYCLONIC BY LATE IN THE SHORT TERM. RELATIVELY 
STRONG SOLAR RADIATION COUPLED WITH INCREASING WARM ADVECTION SHOULD 
PROVIDE IMPRESSIVE MODERATION TREND IN TEMPS BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 
ABOUT THE ONLY FORECAST CONCERN IS POTENTIAL FREEZING CONDITIONS 
OVERNIGHT AS CLEARING SKY CONDITIONS AND OTHERWISE GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO RESULT IN BELOW CLIMO TEMPS 
OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...AT THIS TIME APPEARS FREEZING CONDITIONS WILL 
BE CONFINED TO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AND HIGHER TERRAIN. THUS DO 
NOT PLAN TO ISSUE ANY ADVISORIES AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
FAVORED COOLER MAV GUIDANCE VALUES IN THE FIRST PERIOD WHILE 
FAVORING A BLEND OF RELATIVELY CLOSE MET/MAV GUIDANCE IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS THROUGH FRIDAY. SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE AXIS WILL 
GIVE CLEAR SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S/LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS 
THURSDAY. THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS TOWARD THE COAST...PROVIDING A LIGHT 
SW FLOW THAT SHOULD BRING EVEN WARMER TEMPS FOR FRIDAY...WITH HIGHS 
IN THE LOWER/MID 80S IN THE VALLEY. RECORD HIGHS FOR FRIDAY ARE 
TRI-82...TYS-88...CHA-88 SO PROBABLY ONLY TRI WILL GET CLOSE TO A 
RECORD HIGH.

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL LIFT FROM THE DESERT SW TO THE GREAT LAKES FOR 
THE WEEKEND. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT ARE IN SLIGHTLY BETTER AGREEMENT THAN 
YESTERDAY. THE GFS REMAINS THE FASTEST MODEL...AND IS STILL FASTER 
THAN THE ECMWF AND THE ENSEMBLE MEAN...BUT NOT BY AS MUCH AS THE 
ECMWF IS A BIT FASTER. OVERALL THE MODELS SEEM TO BE CONVERGING 
TOWARD A SATURDAY NIGHT TIMING FOR FROPA. WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP IN SATURDAY AFTERNOON...AND RAISE POPS SATURDAY NIGHT TO A 
CHANCE. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SUNDAY DUE TO THE TIMING 
UNCERTAINTIES. A WEAK RIDGE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY AND MILD WEATHER FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 


&&

AFTERNOON. GIVEN THIS SCENARIO...FORECAST MAX TEMPS SHOULD BE
ATTAINABLE. NO OTHER FORECAST ISSUES OF CONCERN IN GENERALLY
TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN AND THUS NO CHANGES WARRANTED AT THIS

.DISCUSSION...

SOME UPSLOPE-INDUCED SHOWERS AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
OVERNIGHT...SO WILL LEAVE A MENTION OF SHOWERS IN THESE AREAS. 

OTHERWISE...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE ZONES LATER THIS EVENING TO 
REMOVE EVENING PRECIP WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS AND SKY 
CONDITIONS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

143 
FXUS64 KMRX 291840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT MON MAR 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AXIS OF UPPER TROUGH CURRENTLY 
DRIFTING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. FEATURE EXPECTED 
TO CONTINUE TO SLOWLY DRIFT EAST AND AWAY FROM THE AREA THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM. UPPER RIDGING WILL COMMENCE BUILDING INTO THE REGION BY 
TUESDAY. CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR ALL BUT THE 
SOUTHERN TIER OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
EXPECTING DRY CONDITIONS EVERYWHERE BY THE SECOND PERIOD AS RIDGE 
BUILDS IN. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED COOLER MET GUIDANCE SINCE 
REGION WILL REMAIN IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE FLOW ALOFT WILL BECOME INCREASINGLY AMPLIFIED THROUGH THE END OF 
THE WEEK...RESULTING IN A BUILDING RIDGE OVER THE EAST COAST. THIS 
WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER...CLEAR SKIES AND WARM TEMPERATURES THROUGH 
SATURDAY. WITH FULL SUN EXPECTED...HIGHS SHOULD REACH THE 80S IN 
MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. 

THE GENERAL MODEL CONSENSUS IS THAT A CLOSED LOW WILL CROSS THE 
DESERT SW...THEN LIFT NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MS AND LOWER OH 
VALLEYS...PUSHING A COLD FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT/SUNDAY. THERE IS CONSIDERABLE SPREAD AMONG THE GFS ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND THE ECMWF IS QUITE A BIT SLOWER THAN 
THE OPERATIONAL GFS. HPC PROGS ARE ALSO CLOSER TO THE ECMWF. THUS 
PREFER THE SLOWER SOLUTION GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE RIDGE THAT WILL 
HAVE TO BE OVERCOME...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ISOLATED TO 
SUNDAY. ANOTHER LARGE RIDGE LOOKS TO BUILD OVER THE REGION EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...SO WE MAY BE IN FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF DRY AND WARM 
CONDITIONS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER

DIMINISH THIS EVENING AND EXPECT WINDS TO GENERALLY BE BELOW WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA...SO WILL LET WARNINGS/ADVISORIES EXPIRE ON 
SCHEDULE.    


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION STILL ON TRACK FOR MAJOR PATTERN SHIFT WITH UPPER AIR FLOW 
AND ACCOMPANYING HEIGHTS BECOMING MORE REMINISCENT OF SUMMER 
PATTERN. EFFECTS OF SYSTEM CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE REGION 
EXPECTED TO END BY EARLY TUESDAY AFTER WHICH UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO 
BUILD IN. RIDGE CONTINUES TO AMPLIFY OVER THE REGION INTO NEXT 
WEEKEND IN RESPONSE TO AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN 
CONUS. AS A RESULT...DRY WEATHER WITH WELL ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS 
EXPECTED THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. A SYSTEM DOES APPROACH BY 
LATE NEXT WEEKEND BUT TIMING AND INTENSITY STILL IN QUESTION AT THIS 
POINT. DID INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NEXT SUNDAY HOWEVER. FOR 
TEMPS...AGAIN DID NOT DEVIATE TOO SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE BUT DID BUMP UP MAX VALUES SLIGHTLY TO ACCOUNT FOR 
ANTICIPATED NEAR-SUMMERTIME HEIGHTS ACCOMPANYING UPPER RIDGE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HOLDING ITS

MORNING. INSTABILITY LACKING BUT MODERATE SHEAR VALUES PRESENT. SOME 
CONVECTIVE WIND DAMAGE IS POSSIBLE. CONVECTION WILL MARCH SOLIDLY 
ACROSS CWA TODAY. FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH LATE THIS AFTN/EARLY EVE. 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. SCATTERED POST FRONTAL 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE TONIGHT. TEMPS MODERATED BY CLOUDS REMAINING ABV 
NORMAL TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER LOW WILL TRACK 
THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY...CONTINUING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE AREA INTO MONDAY NIGHT.  BEHIND THE SYSTEM...A STRONG UPPER 
RIDGE WILL BUILD IN AND WE WILL MOVE INTO A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN 
FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  THE STRONG HIGH WILL BRING PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE...DRY CONDITIONS AND WARM TEMPS...AFTERNOON HIGHS SHOULD 
REACH WELL ABOVE NORMAL BY WEEKS END.  MODELS BRING THE NEXT SYSTEM 
INTO THE REGION DURING THE WEEKEND.  CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON 
TIMING AND FOR NOW WILL KEEP THINGS DRY ON SATURDAY.

883 
FXUS64 KMRX 280139
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT SAT MAR 27 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER 
THE OZARKS REGION...WITH AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WEDGED EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS OVER THE CAROLINAS AND MID ATLANTIC STATES. LOCAL OBS 
REVEAL A TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BETWEEN THESE TWO SYSTEMS...WITH WIND TOWERS IN THE 
FOOTHILLS ALREADY REPORTING WINDS WELL INTO THE ADVISORY RANGE. THE 
COMBINATION OF A SOUTHEASTERLY WIND FLOW AND A STABLE AIR MASS OVER 
THE MOUNTAINS WILL PRODUCE A GOOD SCENARIO FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES 
TONIGHT INTO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...HAVE UPDATED THE WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR ADJACENT FOOTHILLS TO BEGIN 
IMMEDIATELY. THERE IS SOME CONCERN THAT WINDS MAY STRENGTHEN FURTHER 
OVERNIGHT INTO THE HIGH WIND WARNING CRITERIA...BUT CONFIDENCE IS 
NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO ISSUE...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH AN ADVISORY FOR 
NOW. 

FURTHER WEST...A SOLID LINE OF STRONG CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED OVER 
ARKANSAS AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT WHICH EXTENDS SOUTHWEST OF THE OZARKS 
LOW. THIS PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION WILL LIKELY RACE AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT OVERNIGHT...AND BE LOCATED AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
TOWARDS SUNRISE. THIS CONVECTION SHOULD WEAKEN LATER TONIGHT AS IT 
MOVES INTO A MORE STABLE ENVIRONMENT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THUS... 
CURRENT FORECAST WHICH MENTIONS SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT LOOKS TO BE 
ON TRACK...BUT WILL TWEAK THE WORDING TO MENTION 'TOWARDS SUNRISE'. 
REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT CHANGE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     50  66  44  55  40 /  40  90  50  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             50  64  44  54  39 /  50  90  50  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    42  62  45  55  37 /  20  90  60  20  10 
&&

     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 271840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SAT MAR 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH FROM THE WEST TONIGHT...AND WILL PULL A COLD FRONT INTO OUR 
AREA ON SUNDAY.  SHOWERS WILL ARRIVE LATER TONIGHT AT LEAST IN THE 
SOUTHWEST...WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS THERE AND MINIMAL POPS NORTHEAST 
FOR TONIGHT.  CAT POPS ALL ZONES ON SUNDAY.  INSTABILITY DOES NOT 
LOOK IMPRESSIVE...BUT STILL ENOUGH TO CARRY CHANCE OF THUNDER FOR 
SUNDAY.  LOW LEVEL SOUTH SOUTHEAST JET FORECAST TO STRENGTHEN 
OVERNIGHT.  LOOKS LIKE MOUNTAIN WAVES POSSIBLE LATER TONIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY WITH STRONG WINDS IN THE NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS...BUT AT THIS 
TIME CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO ISSUE A HIGH WIND WARNING.  WILL 
KEEP WIND ADVISORY FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND EXTEND THE AREA WEST TO 
INCLUDE SOME OF THE FOOTHILLS.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE 
MOST PART SO WILL STAY CLOSE.   


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...DRAMATICALLY IMPROVING 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED AFTER TOMORROW'S SYSTEM PULLS OUT AS IMPRESSIVE 
HEIGHT RISES ARE PROJECTED BY MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. STILL 
EXPECT PRECIP TO LINGER INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS UPPER LOW SLOWLY DRIFTS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY. UPPER RIDGING WILL THEN BUILD INTO THE 
REGION BY MID WEEK WITH RIDGE AMPLIFYING IN RESPONSE TO HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN CONUS. THE ECMWF MODEL PROJECTS 
500 MB HEIGHTS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION OF >5860 METERS 
WHICH ARE MORE TYPICAL OF SUMMER. THUS ANTICIPATE TEMPS TO AVERAGE 
WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE WORK WEEK AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEKEND. ONCE 
AGAIN HAVE BUMPED UP GUIDANCE MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY FOR LATE IN THE 
LONG TERM BASED ON THE PROJECTED HEIGHT RISES. OTHERWISE...GENERALLY 
STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MAV/MEX GUIDANCE VALUES. ANOTHER SYSTEM
APPROACHES OUR REGION BY NEXT WEEKEND...BUT TIMING ISSUES ABOUND
AND THUS KEPT NEXT SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW DUE TO UNCERTAINTY.


&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD START THIS MORNING WITH HIGH

CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE IN THE PERIOD. TEMPS WILL REMAIN WARM SAT 
NGT.

APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  
WINDS WILL INCREASE AS THE SYSTEM MOVES IN AND EXPECT MOUNTAIN 
LOCATIONS TO SEE WINDS REACH INTO ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR MUCH OF THE 
DAY SUNDAY.  ADDITIONALLY... ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL SLIDE IN.  THERE 
REMAINS SOME DISCREPANCY WITH TIMING AND DETAILS OF SYSTEM BUT WILL 
KEEP WITH A COMPROMISE AND BRING WIDESPREAD RAIN INTO THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY.  WITH GOOD WIND SHEAR AND WEAK INSTABILITY...WILL HAVE 
CHANCE THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL.  WINDS SHOULD DECREASE SUNDAY NIGHT 
WITH SHOWERS BECOMING MORE SCATTERED IN NATURE.  BY MONDAY...A FEW 
SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA AS THE UPPER LOW SWINGS THROUGH.  
WILL MOVE INTO A DRY WEATHER PATTERN TUESDAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED AS A STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AND DOMINATES 
THE WEATHER

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE/SURFACE HIGH WILL

AFTERNOON...AND SHOULD SEE MAINLY CLEAR SKY TONIGHT AND SATURDAY.  
MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LATE WEEKEND/EARLY WORK 
WEEK SYSTEM REMAINS MAIN FORECAST ISSUE FOR THE LONG TERM. STILL 
PROFOUND DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS WITH BOTH 
MAINTAINING THEIR PREVIOUS DEPICTIONS OF THE EVOLUTION OF THIS 
SYSTEM. AS SUCH...MAJOR DIFFERENCES ARE EVIDENT WITH THE PROJECTED 
DEPARTURE OF PRECIP. HAVE AGAIN FAVORED TIMING OF GEFS ENSEMBLES 
WHICH CONTINUE TO REPRESENT A REASONABLE COMPROMISE OF THE TWO 
OPERATIONAL MODELS. THE GEFS ENSEMBLES HAVE SUPPORT FROM THE 
CANADIAN ENSEMBLES ALSO. BALANCE OF THE WORK WEEK APPEARS DRY AT THIS 
TIME. AMPLIFYING UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM WITH DRAMATIC HEIGHT RISES 
RESULTING. THE ECMWF IS ESPECIALLY PRONOUNCED WITH THIS TREND AND 
HAS SOME SUPPORT FROM THE GEFS ENSEMBLES. AS A RESULT...WENT 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE MEX GUIDANCE FOR MAX TEMPS ON FRIDAY. OTHERWISE... 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

MB SPEEDS OF 40 TO 45 KNOTS AT THIS TIME.

ADVISORY. HOWEVER...I DID RE-POPULATE AND NUDGE SPEEDS UP A BIT FOR
ALL AREAS AHEAD OF THE FRONT.

CLOSED CIRCULATION OF UPPER LOW WHILE GFS WEAKENS IT INTO AN OPEN 
THROUGH AS IT TRANSLATES THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION. AS
SUCH...GFS ENDS POPS BY EARLY MONDAY WHILE ECMWF KEEPS POPS
LINGERING IN THE REGION INTO TUESDAY. TENDED TO FAVOR THE GEFS
ENSEMBLES WHICH REPRESENT A REASONABLE BLEND OF THE TWO OPERATIONAL
MODELS. OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FRIDAY
AND SATURDAY AND AGAIN BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM RESULTING IN DRY
WEATHER WITH NEAR TO ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID
NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

989 
FXUS64 KMRX 250804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU MAR 25 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THOUGHT THE GFS WAS A LITTLE TOO 
ENERGETIC IN BRINGING PRECIP INTO THE FORECAST AREA SO EARLY THIS 
MORNING BUT A CHECK OF THE RADAR SCOPE INDICATES IT HAD POSSIBLY A 
LITTLE BETTER HANDLE ON TODAY'S ACTION. SORT OF A ONE TWO PUNCH AS 
INITIAL SHORT WAVE FEATURE PRESSES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. STAYED 
WITH A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION WESTERN SECTIONS WITH THIS INITIAL 
WAVE. MAIN LIFT WITH PLAINS STATES UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT STRENGTHENS LATER TODAY INTO TONIGHT SO KEPT POPS RATHER HIGH 
FOR THE BIG FROPA. SPREAD CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT BUT 
MODELS DON'T DEPICT A GREAT DEAL OF INSTABILITY. UPPER TROF SHIFTS 
ONLY SLOWLY EAST TONIGHT SO ONLY GRADUALLY DECREASE POP WITH BETTER 
CHANCE NORTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS AS DRIER AIR FILTERS IN ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. STAYED RELATIVELY 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR THE MAX AND MIN.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL PUSH 
TO OUR EAST FRIDAY MORNING...AND ANY CHANCE OF PRECIP SHOULD END 
BEFORE NOON ON FRIDAY. A HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE WILL 
PROVIDE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. 

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE SATURDAY NIGHT ONCE THE RIDGE AXIS 
MOVES EAST AND MOISTURE ADVECTION PICKS UP AHEAD OF A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS. THE GFS DEPICTS THIS SYSTEM TRANSITIONING 
FROM A CLOSED LOW TO AN OPEN WAVE AS IT APPROACHES...BUT THE ECMWF 
KEEPS THE CLOSED LOW IN TACT AS IT PASSES BY. THUS THE GFS SOLUTION 
HAS TRENDED FASTER. THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE FASTER SOLUTION. WILL TREND THE FORECAST IN THIS DIRECTION 
AS WELL...AND BRING CHANCE POPS IN LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE 
LIKELY POPS ON SUNDAY WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. WHILE THE 
INSTABILITY LOOKS MARGINAL...THERE IS GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE AT THE 
NOSE OF A JET STREAK...AS WELL AS A 50 KT LLJ. IF THE FASTER GFS IS 
CORRECT...PRECIP WILL COME TO AN END EARLY SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT THE 
ECMWF HAS THE CLOSED LOW OVER OUR AREA INTO MONDAY. WILL TREND POPS 
DOWNWARD ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...BUT KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE IN TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THE ECMWF SOLUTION. NO CHANCES TO TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
AS THE MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE REGION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TUESDAY DRY...AND THE PATTERN DOES NOT SEEM TO SUPPORT MAX TEMPS AS

902 
FXUS64 KMRX 230744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT TUE MAR 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
CLOSED UPPER LOW HAS MOVED WELL EAST OF THE AREA...AND ONLY A FEW 
LIGHT SHOWERS ARE SEEN ON RADAR ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. 
TEMPERATURES IN THAT AREA ARE IN THE MID 30S...SO A FEW SNOW SHOWERS 
ARE POSSIBLE THIS MORNING. BUT ANY CHANCE OF PRECIP SHOULD END BY 
NOON AS THE DEPARTING LOW MOVES FARTHER EAST AND MOISTURE DEPTH 
DECREASES. WE WILL HAVE A GOOD PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE 
AREA...AND NORTHWEST WINDS COULD APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA IN THE 
MOUTNAINS. AT THIS TIME IT LOOKS LIKE SUSTAINED WINDS WILL STAY 
PREDOMINANTLY IN THE 15 TO 25 MPH RANGE...SO WILL NOT GO WITH AN 
ADVISORY AT THE MOMENT. MORING CLOUDS SHOULD GIVE WAY TO MOSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES BY THE AFTERNOON AS CLOUDS GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM WEST 
TO EAST. 

A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY...PRODIVING 
CLEAR SKIES AND MILD TEMPERATURES. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S IN MOST SPOTS. THE FLOW BECOMES MORE SOUTHERLY ON THURSDAY 
AS THE RIDGE MOVES EAST...BRINGING GREATER MOISTURE ADVECTION. THE 
MODELS SHOW A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING EAST ACROSS THE MID MS 
VALLEY REGION ON THURSDAY...AND THIS SHOULD BRING A CHANCE POP TO 
OUR WESTERN COUNTIES BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON...FOLLOWED BY LIKELY POPS 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE LOW TRACKS INTO KY. THIS TIMING IS FASTER THAN 
PREVIOUS FORECASTS...BUT THE MODELS SEEM TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS FAIRLY SIMILAR IN DEPICTION OF DEAMPLIFYING UPPER TROF
BUILDING EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON FRIDAY. SURFACE SYSTEM SHIFTS
SOUTHEAST AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND USED HIGHER
CHANCE CATEGORY POPS FOR POSSIBLE CONVECTION DECREASING TO SLIGHT
CHANCE FRIDAY NIGHT AS TRAILING UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS THE
MOUNTAINS INTO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES. RIDGING STILL IN ORDER
FOR SATURDAY WHICH WILL MAINTAIN THE BRIEF PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER.
NEXT UPPER TROF PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON
SUNDAY AND PREFERRED THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER ECMWF AND CANADIAN
SOLUTION WHICH HOLDS OFF MAIN EVENT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY OR SUNDAY
NIGHT. THEREFORE GRADUALLY ADJUSTED POPS FROM SLIGHT SUNDAY MORNING
THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE SUNDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE COLD FRONT MAKES ITS
MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. ALSO MAINTAINED MEDIUM CHANCE POP FOR
MONDAY IN LINE WITH SLOWER ECMWF SYSTEM MOVEMENT. STAYED RELATIVELY
CLOSE TO PREVIOUS TEMP FORECAST.


&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...CLOSED LOW WILL SLIDE NORTHEAST

DECREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH.  A WARMING TREND BEGINS ON TUESDAY 
WITH AFTERNOON HIGHS EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE 50S AND LOW 60S 
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.

MOVE FAR ENOUGH EAST BY TUESDAY NIGHT TO LET PRECIPITATION (PCPN) 
END...AND CLOUDS TO DECREASE. UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE WILL SETTLE 
ACROSS THE REGION INTO THURSDAY...BEFORE ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
DEVELOPS OVER N TX AND OK...THEN TRACKS EAST ACROSS THE MID MS AND 
TN VALLEYS. EXPECT LIQUID PCPN WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND LATER SHIFTS 
MAY NEED LIKELY POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY. HOWEVER...MODELS 
WERE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON PCPN NOT REACHING BULK OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA UNTIL AFTER 26/00Z...SO KEPT ALL BUT EXTREME WRN FRINGES DRY 
THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

FOR LATER PERIODS...I LIKED THE FASTER MOVEMENT OF SYSTEMS FROM 
ECMWF. THUS...UPPER RIDGE SHOULD BUILD IN FOR SATURDAY...BEFORE 
ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM FORMS OVER THE MID MS VALLEY REGION LATE 
SUNDAY...AND AFFECTS THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS INTO LATE 
MONDAY. AGAIN...EXPECT MOSTLY LIQUID PCPN WITH TEMPS COOLING BACK 
BELOW CLIMO SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. MAX AND MIN TEMPS WERE TWEAKED 
IN LINE WITH LATEST GFSX MOS GUIDANCE...AND TO BE IN LINE WITH 
ADJACENT OFFICES GRIDS.

126 
FXUS64 KMRX 220826
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
426 AM EDT MON MAR 22 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE 
FORCING ASSOCIATED WITH THE SURFACE FRONT HAS PASSED THROUGH...AND 
THE MAIN LIFTING MECHANISM TODAY WILL BE STEEPENING LAPSE RATES AS 
THE MIDLEVEL COLD POOL MOVES ACROSS. MODELS INDICATE THIS LIFT TO BE 
QUITE WEAK. MOISTURE IS NOT VERY DEEP EITHER...CONFINED BELOW 700 
MB. SO WHILE SHOWERS SHOULD BE NUMEROUS...ESPECIALLY THIS 
AFTERNOON...THE PRECIP AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT...MAINLY A 
TENTH OF AN INCH OR LESS AREA-WIDE. WITH 850 MB TEMPS DROPPING TO 
-6C TODAY AND MOISTURE EXTENDING UP TO -12C...SOME SNOW SHOWERS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE IN THE MOUNTAINS. WITH LIGHT QPF...DO NOT EXPECT MUCH 
ACCUMULATION...POSSIBLY UP TO 1 INCH IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
CLOUDY SKIES TODAY COMBINED WITH COLD ADVECTION WILL KEEP 
TEMPERATURES NEARLY STEADY TODAY IN THE 40S...WITH 30S IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. THE CLOSED LOW WILL BE EXITING THE AREA TONIGHT. THE 
RESULTING STABILIZATION AND DECREASING MOISTURE DEPTH WILL LOWER THE 
POPS TO A CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AS THE  UPPER LOW EXITS THE 
REGION ON TUESDAY...SOME LINGERING MOISTURE MAY BRING MORE 
PRECIPITATION EARLY ON TUESDAY AND MAINLY IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE CWA.  A BRIEF PERIOD OF LIGHT SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE ON TUESDAY 
MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  BUT LITTLE OR NO SNOW 
ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.  A WEAK FRONT TRACKS INTO THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS ON THURSDAY...BUT 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A STRONGER FRONT TRACKS INTO REGION ON 
FRIDAY...SO WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY.  HIGH 
PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT 
APPROACHES THE CWA LATE ON SUNDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS SUNDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 211908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT SUN MAR 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROUGH WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT
AND MONDAY...THEN OFF THE MID-ATLANTIC COAST BY LATE TUESDAY. 

ONE OF THE MAIN CONCERNS WITH THIS SYSTEM IS THE TIGHT PRESSURE
GRADIENT AROUND THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE PRODUCING A 50-60KT JET AT
850MB. THE SOUTHEAST COMPONENT OF THE WIND FIELD ACROSS THE
MOUNTAINS AND MOUNTAIN VALLEYS WILL PRODUCE STRONG AND GUSTS WIND
NEAR 55KTS. HAVE ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
AND ADJACENT FOOTHILS FOR THIS EVENING (SOUTH) AND OVERNIGHT
(NORTH).

COLD FRONT...CURRENTLY OVER ALABAMA...WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA THIS EVENING-EARLY MORNING. A BAND OF SHOWERS WILL ACCOMPANY
THE FRONT WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDER FOR THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF
THE FORECAST AREA.

PLENTY OF COLD AIR STRATO-CU WILL TRAIL BEHIND FRONT AND WILL
PERSIST OF THE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. ALSO...ENOUGH LOW
LEVEL INSTABIILTY TO PRODUCE SCT-BKN SHOWERS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY
NIGHT. ALSO...UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE MOUNTAINS MONDAY AND EARLY
TUESDAY MORNING WILL KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS GOING. MODELS DO SHOW A
WEAK-MODERATE DEFORMATION ZONE MOVING THROUGH ON MONDAY AS WELL...THUS
HAVE TRENDED TOWARD THE MORE AGGRESSIVE NAM PCPN SOLUTION.

TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL SUPPORT A MIXTURE OR CHANGE TO SNOW FOR
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS WELL AS THE PLATEAU COUNTIES FOR MONDAY
AND MONDAY NIGHT. SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE FOR THE
HIGHER TERRAIN.

FOR TUESDAY...LOW CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY ERODE FROM THE SOUTHWEST
ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO WARM.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD IN EARLY IN THE EXTENDED FOR A RETURN TO DRY AND WARM 
CONDITIONS ON WEDNESDAY.  A WEAK DISTURBANCE SLIDES THROUGH TO OUR 
NORTH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...BUT MOISTURE AND LIFT 
RATHER LIMITED AND WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.  THE NEXT SYSTEM 
SHOULD PUSH INTO THE REGION AROUND THE FRIDAY TIMEFRAME.  
CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING...SO HAVE CONTINUED WITH LOW POPS THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT...AND CHANCE ON FRIDAY.   KEPT SATURDAY DRY 
WITH ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA FOR SUNDAY.

THE TIME OF FRONTAL PASSAGE. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO W-SW BEHIND THE
FRONT OVERNIGHT. ALTHOUGH PRECIP WILL END WITH THE FROPA...EXPECT

657 
FXUS64 KMRX 210819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
419 AM EDT SUN MAR 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY WILL SPREAD PRECIP 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWERS SHOULD BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
BY LATE MORNING IN ASSOCIATION WITH MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS AND 
INCREASING UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE JET EXIT REGION. DOWNSLOPE WINDS 
WILL DELAY THE ONSET OF PRECIP IN NORTHERN AND CENTRAL LOCATIONS 
UNTIL LATE AFTERNOON. THUS THE BRISTOL AREA WILL LIKELY REMAIN DRY 
FOR MOST OF THE DAY...AND MAY ONLY SEE LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON...ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH BEFORE SUNSET. THE 
DOWNSLOPE FLOW WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO MILD TEMPERATURES...AND WILL 
GO ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE IN THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL TN VALLEY TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS. WARMEST TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY BE IN THE 
NORTHERN VALLEY TODAY.

HEAVIER SHOWERS WILL ARRIVE IN SOUTHERN SECTIONS IN THE LATE 
AFTERNOON/EVENING AND SPREAD NORTHWARD THROUGH MIDNIGHT AS MOISTURE 
ADVECTION STRENGTHENS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE LLJ. THE 30-40 KT LLJ 
MAY ALSO BRING WINDS TO NEAR ADVISORY LEVEL IN THE MOUNTAINS LATE 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT IT APPEARS MARGINAL ENOUGH AND LATE ENOUGH 
TO LET THE DAY SHIFT MONITOR AND EVALUATE LATER. INSTABILITY AND LOW 
LEVEL FORCING NEAR THE SURFACE FRONT MAY BE JUST ENOUGH IN SOUTHERN 
AND CENTRAL SECTIONS TO PRODUCE ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. THE PASSAGE 
OF THE COLD FRONT LOOKS TO BE BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z TONIGHT. 850 MB 
TEMPS DROP RAPIDLY BEHIND THE FRONT...AND THIS MAY LEAD TO SOME OF 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS CHANGING TO SNOW LATE TONIGHT. DO NOT EXPECT 
MUCH IF ANY ACCUMULATION BEFORE 12Z.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION 
EARLY MONDAY FOLLOWED BY AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ALOFT WHICH TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. WILL CONTINUE THE 
40-60 POPS GOING FOR MONDAY THEN 50-60 POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH 
THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  SHOULD HAVE COOLER WEATHER ON 
MONDAY.  AS THE  UPPER LOW EXITS THE REGION ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY...A BRIEF PERIOD OF LIGHT SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE ON MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  RIDGING 
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT 
APPROACHES THE CWA ON THURSDAY...BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THURSDAY. A STRONGER FRONT TRACKS 
INTO REGION ON FRIDAY...SO WILL KEEP THE LOW CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
FRIDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY.  
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 201906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT SAT MAR 20 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...STRONG UPPER TROUGH ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES TO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS THROUGH MONDAY. STRONG DYNAMICS WITH THE SYSTEM WILL
PULL MOISTURE BACK ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH 850MB JET OF
50-60KTS BY LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. SHOWERS ARE LIKELY...BUT
LIMITED INSTABILITY WILL KEEP THUNDER CHANCES MINIMAL. BEST
INSTABILITY WILL BE ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES AND FAR SOUTHEAST
UNITED STATES. 

STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL PRODUCE DOWNSLOPING WINDS INTO THE
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY WHICH WILL LIMIT RAINFALL UNTIL SURFACE
FRONT MOVES ACROSS LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. ONE OF THE BIGGEST
CONCERNS WILL BE POTENTIAL OF STRONG DAMAGING WINDS DUE TO THE
850MB JET OF 50-60KTS. WINDS ARE APPROACHING HIGH WIND WATCH
CRITERIA FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT
FOOTHILLS.

FOR MONDAY...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
ALLOWING THE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE TO SUPPORT CHANCE OF SNOW
SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...INCLUDING THE PLATEAU COUNTIES.
ENOUGH LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY LIFT TO PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AREA-WIDE.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS EXCEPT FOR MONDAY. DUE TO THE
CLOUDS...PRECIPITATION...AND COLD AIR ADVECTION...HAVE GONE A CAT
OR TWO BELOW MOS HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AS AN UPPER LOW PULLS 
AWAY FROM THE REGION EARLY IN THE EXTENDED...LIGHT SCATTERED SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER OVER THE MRX CWA.  SHOWERS WILL SLOWLY END FROM SOUTH TO 
NORTH LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  BEHIND THE SYSTEM...HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FOR A RETURN TO DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS ON 
WEDNESDAY.  A WEAK DISTURBANCE WILL SLIDE THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...FLATTENING THE RIDGE...BUT ENERGY AND MOISTURE SHOULD BE 
TOO LIMITED FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN A FEW BANDS OF CLOUDS.  THE 
RIDGE REBOUNDS THURSDAY.  THE NEXT SYSTEM IS PROGGED INTO THE AREA 
LATE IN THE PERIOD.  CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND GO DRY FOR SATURDAY.


&&
