FXUS64 KMRX 200825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EDT SAT MAR 20 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL MOVE OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST TODAY WHILE A 
STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TAKES SHAPE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
THIS WILL PUT THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION IN A SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW...PROVIDING EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES TODAY. THOUGH THERE MAY BE 
SOME THIN HIGH CLOUDS...THEY SHOULD HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ON 
TEMPERATURES...WITH THE SOUTHERN VALLEY NEARING THE MID 70S. MOST 
OTHER LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S.

CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING THIS EVENING AS MIDLEVEL MOISTURE AND LIFT 
INCREASE AHEAD OF A CLOSED LOW TO OUR WEST. THE LIFT REMAINS WEAK 
BEFORE 12Z SUNDAY AND MOST PRECIP SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER THAT 
TIME. WILL CUT THE POPS BACK TONIGHT TO ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE WEST 
AFTER 09Z. THERE ARE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS 
THAT GIVE SOME UNCERTAINTY REGARDING THE ONSET OF PRECIP...WITH THE 
GFS BEING FASTER...BUT DRY LOW LEVEL AIR WILL NEED TO BE OVERCOME 
BEFORE PRECIP CAN REACH THE GROUND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY BRINGING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE WITH IT.  WILL KEEP LIKELY 
TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SUNDAY.  SOME INSTABILITY IS ALSO EXPECTED SO 
WILL MENTION THUNDER FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  AN UPPER LOW ENTERS 
THE REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE LIKELY POPS 
GOING FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY WITH HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  SHOULD HAVE COOLER WEATHER ON MONDAY.  THE 
UPPER LOW EXITS THE REGION ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WITH BRIEF 
LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  RIDGING RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES THE CWA ON THURSDAY...BUT 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR 
THURSDAY. A STRONGER FRONT TRACKS INTO REGION ON FRIDAY...SO WILL 
KEEP THE LOW CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

MIXING.  FOR TEMPS...WENT VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TONIGHT.

LESS CLOUDS AND SLIGHT DOWNSLOPE IN NE SECTIONS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT

SHOWERS INTO THE AREA LATE SATURDAY NIGHT.  HOWEVER...THE MAIN LINE 
OF SHOWERS IS EXPECTED TO ACROSS THE MRX CWA ON SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY 
NIGHT.  MODELS NOW SHOWING A SLIGHTLY DESTABILIZED AIR MASS WITH THE 
SHOWERS...SO COULD SEE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS.  HAVE INCREASE POPS 
SLIGHTLY AND ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON.  HAVE ALSO INCREASE POPS SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH LIKELY POPS 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA.  BEHIND THE FRONT...THE UPPER LOW WILL 
SLIDE THROUGH AND USHER IN COOLER AIR AND SOME LINGERING SCATTERED 
SHOWERS FOR MONDAY.  HAVE ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF POPS OVER THE 
NORTHEAST AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS ON TUESDAY AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY 
FROM THE REGION.  HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING....BUT NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD ARRIVE 
AROUND THE FRIDAY TIMEFRAME.  HAVE DRIED THINGS UP FOR THURSDAY AND 
ADDED 20 TO 30 POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

THE OFFING FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY AS RIDGING DOMINATES. MAIN
SYSTEM WILL BE THE CLOSED UPPER LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION SATURDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF
NOW CLOSE OFF THIS SYSTEM...WHICH MAY KEEP MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION
(PCPN) WEST OF OUR FORECAST AREA THROUGH 12Z SUNDAY. 

SLOWER TIMING STILL WOULD FAVOR LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS BY
SUNDAY AFTERNOON...BUT WAS HESITANT TO GO ANY HIGHER THAN THE
UPPER END OF LIKELY FOR NOW. BEST THREAT OF THUNDERSTORMS LOOKS TO
BE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND GULF COAST REGION...SO I
DID NOT ADD THUNDERSTORMS YET TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON OR EVENING.

A RAIN AND/OR SNOW SHOWER MIX IS POSSIBLE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
EARLY MONDAY (SW VA AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF E TN/SW NC)...BUT ECMWF
LOOKS A BIT TOO WARM...AND MUCH DEPENDS ON THE ACTUAL TRACK AND
TIMING. OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGE MAKES A QUICK RETURN FOR TUESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY. VERY MINOR TEMPERATURE TWEAKS IN LINE WITH LATEST
GFSX MOS.

.SHORT TERM...UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES WILL 
PRODUCING WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AND DEFORMATION ZONE OVER THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.
THE WEAK LIFT IS PRODUCING LIGHT SHOWERS GENERALLY SOUTH OF MRX.

THIS LIFT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MID-MORNING THURSDAY...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS GENERALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40.

FOR THURSDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST ALLOWING SKY TO CLEAR FROM 
NORTH TO SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.  THE RETURN OF SOME 
SUNSHINE WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM-UP INTO THE 60S IN THE 
VALLEY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE FORECAST.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...MAIN FOCUS OF THE 
LONG TERM IS SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST IN THE SATURDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY TIME FRAME. SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES PERSIST 
BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS...BUT BOTH SUGGEST WIDESPREAD 
PRECIP FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AS SURFACE COLD FRONT 
PASSES THROUGH. AS SUCH...HAVE INCREASED POPS INTO THE LIKELY 
CATEGORY FOR SUNDAY. THERE ARE ALSO SOME DIFFERENCES IN HOW LONG 
PRECIP WILL LINGER BEHIND SYSTEM...BUT HAVE NOT MADE CHANGES TO 
PRECEDING FORECAST IN THIS REGARD DUE TO UNCERTAINTY. REMAINDER OF 
FORECAST APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME. ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES LATE IN 
THE LONG TERM BUT APPEARS ANY ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL 
LATE WEEK. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

761 
FXUS64 KMRX 170819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
419 AM EDT WED MAR 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MISSING MODEL DATA SLIGHTLY 
COMPLICATING FORECAST. UPPER LOW FINALLY MADE ITS EXIT EAST WITH ITS 
GIANT SFC STREAMLINE GRADIENT ALSO WEAKENING. BUT THE LONG TROF 
BEING DRAGGED BEHIND THE ATLANTIC LOW IS AFFECTING AREA TODAY AND 
TONIGHT WITH WEAK MID-UPPER DYNAMICS. SFC TROF AFFECTS AREA THROUGH 
TONIGHT BY PROVIDING AMPLE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO REGION. HENCE, 
SLOW CLEARING STILL. SORRY. AS UPPER LOW IN DIXIE MOVES NORTHEAST IT 
MAY CLIP MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT LOWLAND FOR SOME SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
LOW CHANCE POPS WITH VERY LOW QPF. BY TONIGHT POPS DROP EVEN MORE. 
ON TEMPS WENT CLOSE TO A BLEND OF MODELS. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...GULF COAST LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS SHOWN TO BE FAR ENOUGH SE OF THE SRN APPALACHIANS BY 
THURSDAY MORNING...TO KEEP THIS PERIOD DRY AND IGNORE LOW POPS FROM 
NAM MODEL. CLOUDS SHOULD DECREASE FROM THE NORTH AND ALLOW A GOOD 
DEAL OF SUNSHINE...SO SEE POTENTIAL TO WARM TO A BLEND OF THE 
SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS. LITTLE TO NO CHANGES REQUIRED TO GRIDS.

SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BUILD ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH FRIDAY...
SO WE WILL FINALLY GET REDEMPTION AND REACH AROUND SEASONAL NORMS 
FOR HIGHS AND LOWS.

MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON LONG WAVE TROUGH DEVELOPING ACROSS
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION BY 06Z SUNDAY. HOWEVER...ECMWF HAS
SLOWED THIS SYSTEM DOWN A BIT AND IS PREFERRED. THUS...OPTED TO
KEEP POPS AT LOW CHANCE WEST TO SLIGHT CHANCE EAST ON SATURDAY
NIGHT. ECMWF CLOSES OFF THE SRN END OF THE TROUGH...SO CHOSE TO
KEEP POPS AT CHANCE FOR NOW ON SUNDAY. NO CHANGES NEEDED FOR MONDAY
OR TUESDAY...WITH POPS INTO MONDAY THEN DRY MONDAY NIGHT INTO NEW
DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY) AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION.

PATCHY AREAS OF DRIZZLE...SO ONLY CARRIED 10 TO 20 PERCENT POPS. 

UNDERCUT GFS MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY (GIVEN PAST FEW DAYS) AND WENT
CLOSER TO THE MILDER GFS MOS MINS AS CLOUDS PERSIST.
 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS 
PACKAGE AS MODELS SEEM TO BE DEPICTING UPPER LOW OFF EASTERN 
SEABOARD WELL. BEHIND THE LOW IS A QUICK LIVED RIDGE WHICH FLATTENS 
AS THE SOUTHWEST LOW KICKS OVER. THIS LOW PASSES SOUTH OF US WITH 
LITTLE EFFECT. THEN ANOTHER LOW PASSES JUST TO THE NORTH AS PART OF 
THE OVERALL LONG WAVE TROUGH, WHICH INCREASES THE RH AND PROVIDES 
SOME LIFT OVER THE WEEKEND. MONDAY-TUESDAY SEES ANOTHER SHARP TROUGH 
PASSES QUICKLY THROUGH BUT WITH LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. TEMPS 
ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY MAINLY LATER IN THE PERIOD.

631 
FXUS64 KMRX 151841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EDT MON MAR 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A PERSISTENT TROUGH OF LOW 
PRESSURE OFF THE MID-ATLANTIC COAST WILL BRING ANOTHER WEAK WAVE OF 
ENERGY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. AN AREA OF LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION IS EVIDENT OVER WEST VIRGINIA MOVING SOUTH TOWARD 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE MAINLY IN THE FORM OF 
RAIN...BUT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS (ABOVE 3000 FEET) OF HIGH KNOB AND 
SMOKY MOUNTAINS WILL SEE SNOW. MARGINAL TEMPERATURES WILL LIMIT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS TO 1 INCH OR LESS AT THE HIGHEST LOCATIONS.

A WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
TUESDAY WITH DRY CONDITIONS A WARMING TREND. ENOUGH LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY TO PARTLY CLOUDY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL PATTERN FOR THE LONG TERM. EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD WE HAVE TWO UPPER TROUGHS TO DEAL WITH...ONE EJECTING OUT OF 
THE SOUTHWEST AND ONE DROPPING DOWN FROM THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES.  
THE CORE OF BOTH SHOULD PASS TO OUR SOUTH. MODELS TRY TO BRING A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH OF PRECIP TO THE AREA EARLY IN THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD...BUT SINCE NOT MUCH FORCING IS EVIDENT WILL LEAN TOWARD 
DRIER SREF SOLUTION AND ONLY CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS 
WED...AND SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTHEAST ZONES WED NIGHT.  RIDGING SHOULD 
BEGIN BUILDING IN ON THURSDAY...PROVIDING DRY WEATHER INTO AT LEAST 
THE FIRST PART OF SATURDAY.  MODELS IN SOME DISAGREEMENT FOR TIMING 
OF NEXT FRONT...SO FOR NOW WILL COMPROMISE AND CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS SAT AFTERNOON...THEN CHANCE SAT NIGHT AND SUN.  WILL GO DRY 
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM ON MONDAY FOR NOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             41  58  45  59  43 /   0  10  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  41  56  43  57  43 /  10  10  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  56  42  57  42 /  10  10  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              38  53  38  54  40 /  20  10  10  20  10

463 
FXUS64 KMRX 150827
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
427 AM EDT MON MAR 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CALLS MADE AROUND TO SW VA AND
NE TN COUNTIES IN THE EXPIRING WSW FOUND LITTLE IF ANY SNOW
CURRENTLY OR EARLIER. THE LONE EXCEPTIONS WERE A VERY LIGHT
ACCUMULATION (UNKNOWN AMOUNT) ON ROAN MTN AND HOLSTON MTN IN CARTER
COUNTY OF NE TN. RADAR RETURNS HAVE BEEN EXTREMELY WEAK OR NON-
EXISTANT IN THESE AREAS...SO SEEMED WISE TO LET THE ADVISORY EXPIRE
FOR THOSE AREAS.

EVENING SHIFT ON SUNDAY GOT A REPORT OF A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION
IN THE SMOKIES...ABOVE 3500 FEET...AND RADAR ECHOES HAVE PERSISTED
IN THE SMOKIES OVERNIGHT. THUS...I CHOSE TO EXTEND THE WSW FOR THE
SMOKIES THROUGH NOON TODAY. THE NAM MODEL SEEMED TO HAVE THESE WEAK
UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS WELL DEFINED...AND ALSO INDICATED YET ANOTHER
WEAK DISTURBANCE TO ROTATE AROUND THE BACKSIDE OF THE STAGNANT
UPPER LOW. BEST CHANCE OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION IS MAINLY SW VA/NE TN
AND THE SMOKIES TODAY AS THIS DISTURBANCE SWINGS ACROSS.

MAY BE SOME LINGERING RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS OVER SW VA AND EXTREME
NE TN TONIGHT...UNTIL THE UPPER LOW WOBBLES A BIT FURTHER EAST.
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED VERY GOOD AND WERE ONLY SLIGHTLY
MODIFIED. 

OTHERWISE...FAVORED UNDERCUTTING THE MILDER MOS MAX TEMPS TODAY AND
WENT CLOSER TO THE NOT AS COOL GFS MINS FOR TONIGHT (DUE TO THOSE
LINGERING CLOUDS AND ONLY VERY WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION).


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...SO LITTLE CHANGES WITH 
THESE OCCLUDED LOWS. SLOWLY MOVING EAST, BUT THE WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE AND ENERGY SPOKES KEEP COMING AND WILL DO SO UNTIL THE NEXT 
SHORT RIDGE BUILDS IN MID WEEK-ISH. BUT...THE SOUTHWEST LOW WILL 
KICK IN AFTER THAT TOWARD THE WEEKEND. BOTTOM LINE, CONTINUOUS POPS 
THROUGH MID WEEK, SHORT BREAK, THEN POPS AGAIN. TEMPS ABOUT NORMAL 
TO JUST UNDER. WE MIGHT GET SOME LIGHT SNOW IN SMOKIES TUESDAY 
NIGHT/EARLY WEDNESDAY BUT THIS WILL BE LIGHT, LOCAL, AND SHORT LIVED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  41  57  41  59 /  10  10  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  39  56  38  55 /  30  10  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  38  56  38  57 /  30  10  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              47  37  54  35  54 /  40  20  10  20  20

287 
FXUS64 KMRX 141927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EDT SUN MAR 14 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...BACK END LOBE OF STACKED 
LOW WILL SWING SE THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. 
FREEZING DROPS TO NEAR 2800 FT OVERNIGHT. SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH COOL RAIN ACROSS THE VALLEYS. LOW 
LEVEL FLOW SHIFTS TOWARD TO NORTH MONDAY AND THE LAPSE RATE WILL NOT 
BE AS STEEP SO PCPN CHC WILL TAPER OFF THROUGH MON AFTN. BELOW NORMAL
TEMPS AGAIN ON MONDAY.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE SHORT OF IT IS 
THAT THE UPPER LOW NOW OVER EASTERN NOAM WILL EASE ON EASTWARD BUT 
THIS LEAVES ROOM FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN LOW KICKER OVER FOUR CORNERS 
TO PROGRESS EAST TO THE GULF COAST BY ABOUT MIDWEEK WHICH IN TURNS 
CREATES A WEAKNESS IN THE FLOW. THIS WEAKNESS WILL ALL A SERIES OF 
SHORT WAVES TO CROSS THE REGION TOWARD THE WEEKEND. ATMOSPHERE NEVER 
MOISTENS UP OR BECOMES UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR SERIOUS CONVECTION, BUT 
NEVER DRIES OUT ENOUGH FOR WARM SUNNY WEATHER, EITHER. LOOKS LIKE A 
SERIES BACK TO BACK TO BACK LITTLE SYSTEMS WHICH WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
IN ALL WEEK, AND TEMPS A BIT ON THE COOL SIDE FOR THE SEASON. THERE 
IS A CHANCE FOR SOME ACCUMULATING SNOWS IN THE MOUNTAINS EARLY ON. 
WINDS WILL BE A BIT BRISK OR STEADY AT LEAST ALL WEEK, WHICH IS 
TYPICAL FOR SPRING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

015 
FXUS64 KMRX 141458
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SUN MAR 14 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. PCPN WILL BE
ON INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPS WONT MOVE MUCH. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER AIR PLOTS AND SATELLITE 
PICS SHOW THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS 
MORNING...WITH AN ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE TO PASS ACROSS THE REGION 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

DEEPENING MOISTURE AND WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION/LOWERING FREEZING 
LEVEL SUPPORTS A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION ABOVE 3000 TO 3500 FEET 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...MAINLY ACROSS THESE ELEVATIONS OVER SW VA...
THE NRN MTNS AND SMOKY MTNS OF EAST TN. HOWEVER...UNFAVORABLE LOW 
LVL THICKNESSES...PLUS MILD BOUNDARY LAYER AND SURFACE TEMPS DON'T 
SUPPORT THE VERY HIGH SNOW AMOUNTS FROM LOCAL WRF MODEL. SHOULD SEE 
TOO MUCH MELTING TO ACCUMULATE MORE THAN ADVISORY SNOW AMOUNTS 
(1 TO 4 INCHES FROM THIS EVENT). COORDINATION WITH GSP AND RNK FOUND 
GOOD AGREEMENT ON THIS FORECAST/ADVISORY. 

INCREASED POPS ACROSS THE BOARD TODAY...AND CARRIED LIKELY POPS IN 
THE ADVISORY AREA FOR TONIGHT. CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION WILL KEEP 
TEMPS IN CHECK...PROBABLY CLOSER TO A MOS BLEND...WITH MIXING 
HEIGHTS ALSO LOWERED A BIT. MOS MINS QUITE CLOSE AND REASONABLE FOR 
TONIGHT. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE 
AREA OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST WILL CONTINUE TO BRING SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY FROM THE NORTH AND NORTHWEST MAINLY INTO THE NE HALF OF THE 
REGION WITH SCATTERED RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING. THE SHOWERS 
WILL TAPER OFF MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING IN THE EXTREME NE 
SECTION. HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD RECEIVE ANOTHER INCH OR SO IN 
FAVORED NW FLOW AREAS AND WENT WITH COLDER NAM TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE 
FOR HIGHS MONDAY AND LOWS MONDAY NIGHT. AS UPPER LOW SLIDES EAST 
TUESDAY THERE WILL BRING A BRIEF BREAK FROM THE PRECIPITATION UNTIL 
ANOTHER WEAK UPPER LEVEL LOW OR TROUGH SETTLES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMER TUESDAY 
WITH SOME SUN WITH THE TREND TO CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY. FRIDAY 
INTO EARLY SATURDAY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR A FAIR WEATHER DAY 
BEFORE ANOTHER MORE SPRING LIKE SYSTEM DEVELOPS IN THE PLAINS LATE 
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WITH SHOWERS SPREADING INTO TENNESSEE SATURDAY. 
AREAS TO THE WEST MAY GET THUNDERSTORMS WHICH COULD MOVE IN BY 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  41  54  39  57 /  60  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  39  50  37  56 /  60  30  30  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  39  50  38  56 /  60  30  30  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  37  48  35  54 /  60  30  40  20  10

LATER TODAY...SO THIS WILL MEAN MORE MVFR OR LOWER CONDITIONS AT ALL 
3 TAF SITES WELL INTO THE LAST 6 HOURS OF THIS TAF PERIOD.

LOWERING FREEZING LEVEL TODAY WITH WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION...BUT I

TYPE AT THE SURFACE. 

OUTLOOK FOR BEYOND 15/06Z...MAY SEE SOME IMPROVEMENT FOR CHA/TYS/TRI

WILL BE COOLER THAN OF LATE. HIGHER PRESSURE TRIES TO BUILD IN

WARM SEVERAL DEGREES. TUESDAY NIGHT A COUPLE OF UPPER LOWS OVER THE 
CENTRAL STATES COMBINE AND MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 131505
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST SAT MAR 13 2010

.DISCUSSION..ANOTHER QUICK UPDATE TO LOWER TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON. 
FREEZING LEVELS DROP THIS AFTN. INTRODUCED SOME FROZEN PCPN ACROSS 
THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS CONTINUES TO 
TRACK NORTH OVER EXTREME NE TN AND SWRN VA THIS MORNING...AS THE 
UPPER LOW SPINS OVER THE MID-MS VALLEY REGION. BEST COVERAGE OF RAIN 
WILL BE EARLY THIS MORNING...THEN I DON'T EXPECT MORE THAN SCATTERED 
LIGHT SHOWERS LATER TODAY AND THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...LOWERED POPS TO 
40 TO 50 PERCENT CHANCE GENERALLY IN LINE WITH MOS POPS. CURRENT 
TEMPS MILD AND RUNNING A BIT AHEAD OF PREVIOUS HOURLY GRIDS. HOWEVER 
...INCREASING CLOUDS AND ANY SHOWERS WILL KEEP MAX TEMPS DOWN CLOSE 
TO SIMILAR MOS VALUES.

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS DIFFER ON HOW MUCH SHOWERS RE-DEVELOP AS THE 
UPPER LOW TRACKS EAST...BUT ANY PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIGHT. KEPT 
POPS MORE IN LINE WITH NAM MODEL...AND AROUND 50 PERCENT OR LESS FOR 
NOW. COLD AIR ADVECTION IS VERY WEAK AND 850 MB TEMPS GENERALLY STAY 
ZERO DEGREES C OR WARMER...SO NOT MUCH CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS 
THROUGH 12Z SUNDAY. CLOUDS SHOULD FAVOR MILDER MOS MINS.


LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER MID ATLANTIC 
SUNDAY BRINGS CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO FORECAST AREA. COLD 
TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL DROP FREEZING LEVELS TO NEAR 4000 FEET SO 
SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS HOWEVER 
AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT AND GROUND TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY 
BE TO WARM FOR ACCUMULATIONS. MODELS HAVE LIKELY POPS SOUTH AND 
CHANCE NORTH. WILL KEEP POPS IN CHANCE RANGE. NAM MODEL GENERALLY 
THE WETTER ONE BUT MOISTURE GRADUALLY DECREASES AS UPPER LOW SHIFTS 
OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE COOL WITH HIGHS MID 40S TO LOWER 50S SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH 
LOWS IN THE 30S. HIGHER PRESSURE TRIES TO BUILD IN TUESDAY WITH SOME 
RIDGING AND NO PRECIPITATION. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM SEVERAL 
DEGREES. TUESDAY NIGHT A COUPLE OF UPPER LOWS OVER THE CENTRAL 
STATES COMBINE AND MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE 
SHOWERS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

860 
FXUS64 KMRX 122038
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EST FRI MAR 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VORT LOBE TRAVELING THROUGH MEAN 
UPPER TROF HAS MOVED INTO MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON. THIS FEATURE HAS 
PROVIDED GOOD LIFT ALLOWING SOME STORMS TO REACH THE LOW END OF 
SEVERE LIMITS. HAIL POTENTIAL WILL DIE OFF SHORTLY. FLOODING THREAT 
AND WIDESPREAD PCPN WILL CONTINUE TO GATE SWING INTO NE PARTS OF THE 
CWA THIS EVENING. N-S AREA OF SURFACE LOW PRESSURE REMAINS WEST OF 
THE MNTS THIS AFTN. PATTERN STILL FAVORS MNT WAVE POTENTIAL ALONG 
FOOTHILLS SO LET WIND WARNING STAND. FRONT WILL PUSH EAST OF MOST 
OF THE AREA TONIGHT WILL LATE NIGHT COOL DOWN. WINDS DROP OFF AND 
MORNING FOG POSSIBLE. UPPER LOW DROPS SE TO OVER AREA SATURDAY. WRAP 
AROUND MOISTURE WILL MOVE IN WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS 
POSSIBLE....MAINLY IN THE AFTN. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW NOW OVER CENTER OF 
U.S. PROGGED TO MOVE OVER AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT AND THEN OUT TO SEA 
BY LATE SUNDAY. BUT...THE UPPER GRADIENT BEHIND THIS LOW IS TIGHT 
AND SO IS THE SFC GRADIENT. HAVE KEPT WINDS UP JUST A BIT IN 
RESPONSE. THIS GRADIENT DOES NOT REALLY RELAX UNTIL LATE MONDAY. 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN BY MIDWEEK ALLOWING FOR DRYING AND RELAXING OF 
PRESSURE GRADIENT. WITH SFC LOW STILL OVER ATLANTIC SEABOARD LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY, AND DUE TO OCCLUDED NATURE OF UPPER 
LOW, GFS HAS "SPOKES" OR SFC TROFS ROTATING AROUND BACK SIDE OF SFC 
LOW AND THIS KEEPS A DECENT SOURCE OF LIFT IN THE REGION THROUGH 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. POPS GRADUALLY DIMINISH THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND 
THEN ALL BUT DISAPPEAR TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. THE NEXT REAL SYSTEM 
DOES NOT APPEAR UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD, NEXT SATURDAY. HAVE ADDED 
SOME LOW POPS OUT THERE. TEMPS WILL BE WARM ENOUGH TO KEEP RAIN 
SHOWERSIN THE FORECAST, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHEST RIDGES 
WHERE SOME MIX MIGHT OCCUR BRIEFLY SUNDAY INTO MONDAY DURING THE 
COLDEST TIMES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EST FRI MAR 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG STORMS ALREADY DEVELOPING 
OVER EXTRM NE MS AND NW AL MAY BE INDICATIVE OF THINGS TO COME THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 150 KNOT PLUS UPPER LEVEL JET LOOKS TO 
PROVIDE MODERATE TO STRONG DIVERGENCE ALOFT TODAY...WITH SOME 
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING OCCURRING THIS AFTERNOON...AND LOCAL WRF MODEL 
SHOWS MUCH STRONGER LOW LEVEL JET DEVELOPING THAN NAM AND GFS 
SUGGEST. SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY IS A BIT LACKING...ALTHO HIGHER 
DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE ADVECTED NE INTO CHA THAN GUIDANCE WOULD OFFER.
AN AXIS OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY DOES ALSO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH INCREASING LOW LEVEL STORM 
RELATIVE HELICITY. THUS...PARAMETERS MAY COME TOGETHER TO PRODUCE A 
FEW SEVERE STORMS OVER OUR FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY PLATEAU...SE TN
AND CENTRAL VALLEY/SMOKIES. 

ANOTHER THREAT WILL BE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINS TO PRODUCE FLOODING 
OVER SE TN AND THE MTN COUNTIES ALONG THE TN-NC STATE LINE...SO WE 
HAVE POSTED A FLOOD WATCH FOR THOSE AREAS.

PATTERN ALSO SUGGESTS POTENTIAL FOR A MTN WAVE EVENT...WITH LOCAL 
WRF MODEL 850 MB WINDS FAVORING A HIGH WIND WARNING AND WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THE FORECAST AREA LATER TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING...
AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS AND TRACKS NE ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY.

OTHERWISE...ADJUSTED DEW POINT TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY TODAY FROM MOS DATA.
TRENDED TOWARD WARMER MOS HIGHS WHERE SOME DOWNSLOPING MAY 
OCCUR...BUT SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD ARRIVE SOON ENOUGH TO INHIBIT 
MAX TEMPS OVER SE TN AND SW NC AREAS. CHOSE A MOS BLEND FOR MINS 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY THEN EAST OF THE
AREA FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL MAINTAIN HIGH CHANCE-LIKELY POPS
FOR SATURDAY...THEN TAPER DOWN SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM
MOVES EAST. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW
SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...GENERALLY AT OR ABOVE 3500 FEET.

FOR TUESDAY... A WEAK RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION BEFORE THE NEXT
SHORT-WAVE ROTATES ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND GULF COAST
STATES WEDNESDAY. LOW CONFIDENCE ON PRECIPITATION CHANCES
TUESDAY...SO WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE. DRY WEATHER RETURNS
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST THU MAR 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ALONG IT OVER CENTRAL 
LOUISIANA. THIS LOW PRESSURE AREA IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEAST 
TONIGHT TOWARDS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...AND STRENGTHEN WITH INCREASING 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY. HOWEVER...MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS ACTIVITY 
WILL NOT AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL AFTER SUNRISE TOMORROW. 
LOCAL RADARS REVEAL THAT EARLIER SHOWER ACTIVITY HAS EXITED THE 
FORECAST AREA.

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE ZONES TO REMOVE 
POPS FOR TONIGHT...BUT KEPT A MENTION OF DRIZZLE. WITH A MOIST AIR 
MASS IN PLACE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...FELT THAT AREAS OF FOG 
WILL FORM OVERNIGHT...SO INCLUDED A MENTION OF FOG IN THE UPDATE. 
ALSO...TEMPS SHOULD NOT FALL MUCH BELOW THE CURRENT DEWPOINTS...SO 
RAISED MINS FOR TONIGHT AS WELL.

301 
FXUS64 KMRX 112013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST THU MAR 11 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WEAK IMPULSE AND ASSOCIATED 
SHOWERS MOVING OFF TO THE NORTHEAST EARLY THIS EVENING. COLD FRONT 
REMAINS WEST OF AREA WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED BENEATH CAP 
AROUND 6000 FT. ADDITIONAL LOW LEVEL CAP WILL DEVELOP OVERNIGHT. 
PATCHY FOG MAY DEVELOP AS WINDS DECOUPLE AFTER MIDNIGHT. JET SEGMENT 
STRENGTHENS OVERNIGHT AS IT ROTATES UNDER BROAD UPPER TROF WOBBLING 
OVER MO RVR VLY. THIS JET MOVES NE INTO MID TN EARLY FRI. WINDS 
INCREASE THROUGH THE LAYER. CONVECTION DEVELOPS ALONG FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO THE SW TONIGHT AND SHOULD GET BOAST FROM JET LATER 
TONIGHT. INSTABILITY PEAKS OVER MRX CWA ARND 12/18Z AND IS 
SUFFICIENT TO SUPPORT ONGOING TSTM ACTIVITY. CURRENTLY STORMS LOOK 
TO STAY BELOW SVR LIMITS. WEST SLOPES OF TN MNTS MAY SEE HIGH WIND 
GUSTS AND REDUCED PCPN WITH DOWNSLOPE AFFECTS MUCH OF FRI. FLOOD 
GUIDANCE PRETTY HIGH BUT LOCALIZED FLOODING MAY OCCUR. WENT ON THE 
WARM SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS TONIGHT AND THE COOL SIDE OF MOS 
FOR FRI.   

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NAM...GFS AND ECMWF 
ARE INITIALLY IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO PUSHING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY ON THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY EVENING. WILL 
CONTINUE WITH CURRENT POPS AS PER GUIDANCE AND TIMING SAKE...AS 
BELIEVE THERE SHOULD BE DECENT AMOUNT OF RESIDUAL MOISTURE AVAILABLE 
ESPECIALLY FROM THE TRI CITIES THROUGH SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AREA. 

ALL THREE MODELS ARE SIMILAR AT THIS POINT IN INDICATING THAT
UPPER LOW SHOULD SLOWLY PROGRESS OFF THE EAST COAST OF THE U.S. BY
00Z MONDAY. THE EFFECTS OF THIS SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO BE
PROVIDING AT LEAST MOSTLY CLOUDY/CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE AREA
AND WILL CONTINUE WITH CURRENT POPS FOR AREA OVER WEEKEND. MAY BE COLD
ENOUGH ALOFT FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AT
TIMES SAT NIGHT THROUGH MON NIGHT...BUT LOOKS LIKE BULK OF PRECIP
WILL BE LIQUID. WILL CONTINUE TO HANG ON TO SLIGHT CHANCE/LOW
CHANCE POPS INTO MONDAY BEFORE WEAK UPPER RIDGING IS PROGGED TO
BUILD BACK INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BY 12Z TUESDAY.

NEXT WEAK SYSTEM PROGGED BY GFS IS A WEAK UPPER TROUGH/LOW PRESSURE
AREA THAT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY
INTO THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY. WILL ONLY INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
AT THIS TIME...AS ECMWF IS NOT INDICATING AS MUCH OF A PRESENCE. 

GFS MOS TEMPS STILL LOOK GENERALLY REASONABLE...SO WILL ONLY TWEAK
TEMP FORECAST SLIGHTLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 111457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST THU MAR 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO REMOVE TSTM WORDING. MINOR SHORT WAVE MOVING 
NE UP S APPALACHIANS WILL ADD LIFT FOR CONTINUED LIGHT PCPN AS IT 
MOVES THROUGH MRX CWA THIS AFTN. PCPN AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT. SON

&& 

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODEL CONSISTENCY RATHER POOR AND 
CONFIDENCE LOW...BUT CURRENT MODEL RUNS INDICATE A SOUTHERN SHORT 
WAVE WILL TRACK MAINLY TO OUR EAST AND A FRONT APPROACHING FROM OUR 
WEST SHOULD LIFT NORTH OF THE AREA.  THIS SCENARIO WILL LIMIT THE 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH BEST LIFT EXPECTED NORTH OF OUR AREA.  
CONTINUED WITH LIKELY POPS THIS AFTERNOON BUT BELIEVE PRECIP AMOUNT 
WILL BE MINIMAL.  ADDITIONALLY...INSTABILITY WEAKENS AS THE SYSTEM 
APPROACHES THE AREA...AGAIN...LIMITING CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.  AS 
A RESULT...HAVE LEFT ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
FORECAST.  WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS OVERNIGHT AND KEPT POPS AT 20 TO 
30.  STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM WITH UPPER LOW TRAVERSING THE 
REGION AND EVENTUALLY MOVING OFF THE COAST...KEEPING OUR WEATHER 
UNSETTLED THROUGH AT LEAST THE WEEKEND.  HOWEVER...DETAILS CONTINUE 
TO BE MUCH MORE UNCERTAIN AS TIMING INDIVIDUAL PIECES OF ENERGY 
ROTATING THROUGH HAS A LOW PROBABILITY OF SUCCESS BEYOND THE FIRST 
COUPLE OF PERIODS.  STILL LOOKS LIKE COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING 
THROUGH FRIDAY/EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL CARRY FAIRLY HIGH POPS.  
STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO WARRANT MENTION 
OF THUNDER AS WELL.  WILL CARRY CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.  MAY BE COLD ENOUGH ALOFT FOR SOME 
SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AT TIMES SAT NIGHT THROUGH MON 
NIGHT...BUT LOOKS LIKE BULK OF PRECIP WILL BE LIQUID.  WILL CONTINUE 
DRY FORECAST FOR TUE AND WED FOR NOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS HERE AND THERE.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 110129
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
830 PM EST WED MAR 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
OVER THE DEEP SOUTH...WITH A MILD AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
LOCAL RADARS REVEAL THAT MOST OF THE CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WAS LOCATED SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS NOT EXPECTED TO MAKE MUCH PROGRESS TO THE 
NORTH OVERNIGHT...SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY TO AFFECT 
THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL PLAN TO LOWER POPS EVERYWHERE FOR 
TONIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST 
NC. WILL LEAVE SOME POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FOR THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS...DUE TO THE APPROACH OF AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
TOWARDS SUNRISE. TEMPS APPEAR TO STILL BE ON TRACK...AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
638 PM EST WED MAR 10 2010

.AVIATION...A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVE FEATURES TO BUILD ACROSS THE TAF
SITES THROUGH 24 HOURS. THE FIRST SEEMS TO BE HANDLED WELL BY THE
MODELS WITH GREATEST IMPACT EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
MOUNTAIN RANGE. IT APPEARS THAT FLIGHT WEATHER MAY BE BETTER THAN
ONE WOULD EXPECT (FOR TYS AND TRI) AS THE LOW LEVEL FLOW IS
DESCENDING OFF THE SMOKY MOUNTAIN TERRAIN LEADING TO ADIABATIC
WARMING AND ASSOCIATED DRYING AND THEREFORE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF A
LOW LEVEL BKN CEILING AT THESE SITES. AT CHA IT WILL BE A SLIGHTLY
DIFFERENT STORY AS SC HAS INVADED THIS AREA WITH DECENT MOISTURE
ADVECTION ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. KEPT CEILINGS A LITTLE LOWER HERE
AND EVEN ADDED AN MVFR VSBY RESTRICTION FOR THURSDAY AS SECOND
SHORTWAVE MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. TRIED TO KEEP TYS AND TRI IN VFR
CATEGORY AS THE DOWNSLOPE FLOW MAY CONTINUE TO KEEP FLIGHT WEATHER
A LITTLE BETTER THAN AT CHA THROUGH THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 102041

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST WED MAR 10 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WEAKENS OVER THE AREA THROUGH PERIOD. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES NORTHWARD WEST OF THE MS RVR VLY. WARM FRONT MOVES NORTHWARD 
THROUGH TN RVR VALLEY ON THU. LIGHT WINDS WITH WARM ADVECTIVE 
PATTERN. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS WITH PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER. FORECAST 
PROBLEM IS TIMING OF PCPN AND CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. MRX CWA 
POSITIONS BETWEEN BEST LIFTING MECHANISMS AND INSTABILITY WEAKENS AS 
IT MOVES EAST INTO THE AREA THU. JET SEGMENT INTENSIFIES AND TURNS 
SHARPLY CYCLONIC INTO UPPER LOW KEEPING BEST LIFT NW OF AREA. 
STRAYING WEAKENING SEGMENT MOVES NE THROUGH AREA WITH WARM FRONT. 
KEPT POP NUMBERS HIGH BUT HEAVY RAINFALL NOT EXPECTED AT THIS TIME. 
TSTM ACTIVITY SHOULD BE WEAKENING AS IN MOVES INTO MRX CWA.   

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...EXTENDED PERIOD OF 
UNSETTLED WEATHER STILL IN THE OFFING PER MODEL/ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS 
AS UPPER LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS VERY SLOWLY DRIFTS 
EASTWARD BEFORE EXITING THE EAST COAST BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. ALTHOUGH 
MODELS/ENSEMBLES REMAIN IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS 
FEATURE...DETAILS REMAIN MURKY. THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES FROM PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. CONTINUED WITH DRY FORECAST 
FROM TUESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. TEMPS SHOULD 
REMAIN WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF CLIMO PER MEX GUIDANCE.

031 
FXUS64 KMRX 101529
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EST WED MAR 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...ADJUSTED POPS DOWNWARD FOR N HALF OF MRX CWA FOR THE 
REST OF TODAY. SMALL SHORT WAVE HAS EXITED NE PART OF CWA THIS 
MORNING. SHORT WAVE RIDGE BUILDING IN ALOFT VERY DIRTY FROM 
CONVECTIVE EXHAUST FROM THE SSW. 700-500 MB LAYER REMAINS RELATIVELY 
DRY FOR TODAY WITH DEEP MOISTURE MAINLY AFFECTING SE AREAS THIS 
AFTN. PCPN AMOUNTS N OF I40 SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT. REMOVED THUNDER 
WORDING SINCE CHC ONLY ISOLATED ACROSS EXTREME S. SON

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DURING THE SHORT TERM...AN 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE TO ESTABLISH ITSELF OVER THE 
REGION.  A SHORT WAVE TRACKING THROUGH NORTH GA AND THE CAROLINAS 
TODAY WILL BRUSH THROUGH THE MRX CWA ...BRINGING WITH IT OVERCAST 
SKIES AND SCATTERED SHOWERS.  WE REMAIN RELATIVELY STABLE...BUT A 
STRAY RUMBLE OF THUNDER IS POSSIBLE SOUTH.  THIS AFTERNOON/S SYSTEM 
WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA THIS EVENING BEFORE EXITING...THEN WE MAY 
SEE A BRIEF BREAK BEFORE ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS MOVES IN TOWARD 
MORNING IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING FRONT.  AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES 
...WILL BE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT THAT UPPER LOW OVER THE PLAINS WILL SHIFT SLOWLY EAST AND 
NORTHEAST...LEADING TO AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF UNSETTLED WEATHER.  
DETAILS LESS CLEAR...AS TIMING OF INDIVIDUAL PIECES OF SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY ROTATING AROUND MAIN LOW IS MUCH LESS CERTAIN.  FAIRLY HIGH 
CONFIDENCE THAT ONE SIGNIFICANT WAVE WILL AFFECT THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY...SO WILL GO WITH CAT POPS.  INSTABILITY LOOKS 
LIMITED...BUT STILL WORTH A MENTION OF THUNDER FOR THURSDAY.  ON 
FRIDAY...INSTABILITY LOOKS MORE IMPRESSIVE...SO WILL CARRY 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST ONCE AGAIN. COLDER AIR WILL BE 
FILTERING IN DURING THE WEEKEND AND INTO MONDAY...AND THERE MAY BE 
SOME SNOW SHOWERS AT TIMES OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT 
EXPECT ONLY RAIN SHOWERS FOR THE BULK OF THE AREA.  WILL GO DRY FOR 
TUESDAY...AS UPPER TROUGH SHOULD BE MOVING OFF TO THE EAST.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EST TUE MAR 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY INCREASING 
FROM THE WEST AS MOISTURE IS STREAMING NORTH AHEAD OF COLD FRONT 
THATS NOW MOVING INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY. AN AREA OF SHOWERS IS 
SLOWLY ADVANCING TOWARD THE PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON. A FEW SPRINKLES 
HAVE ALREADY OCCURRED NEAR CHA. TEMPERATURES HAVE ONCE AGAIN WARMED 
INTO THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S BY MID AFTERNOON AND WILL FALL MORE 
SLOWLY TONIGHT AS CLOUD COVER MOVES IN. RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE 
TONIGHT AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES UP FROM THE SOUTHWEST. FIRST 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION SINCE LAST WEEK WEDNESDAY ACROSS SOUTHERN 
AREAS AS MOISTURE FEED FROM GULF INCREASES AND LIFT INCREASES. WEAK 
FRONT DISSIPATES BUT ANOTHER FRONT REDEVELOPS ABOUT THE SAME AREA 
WEDNESDAY. LOWS TONIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER AND HIGHS TOMORROW 
MAINLY LOW TO MID 60S DUE TO CLOUDS AND RAIN.     

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS 
ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT IN CARVING OUT A CLOSED UPPER TROUGH 
OVER THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION BY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. THE 
CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY FILL AS IT MOVES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL 
ROTATE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH OCCASIONAL SHOWERS 
ANTICIPATED. STRONGEST WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON. A 
BOUNDARY JET (850MB WINDS 40-50KTS) WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY THURSDAY. DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEAST WINDS OF 
30-35 KTS ARE DEPICTED BEFORE THE TROUGH PASSAGE THURSDAY WHICH MAY 
PRODUCE 40-50KT MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS. A WIND 
ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS.

DRY SLOT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
DIMINISHING THE CHANCES OF RAIN.

THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO SWING TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. MODELS ARE DEPICTING 
CAPES APPROACHING 1000 J/KG WITH LIFTED INDICES OF -4 TO -6 
POSSIBLE. WBZ WILL BE QUITE LOW IN THE 7500-8500FT VICINITY...SO 
LARGE HAIL MAY BE A CONCERN FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON-EARLY EVENING.

FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS PRODUCING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE VALLEY AND 
LIKELY HIGHER TERRAIN. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE COLD 
ENOUGH TO PRODUCE A MIXTURE OR CHANGE OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 

UPPER TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO MOVE OUT MONDAY...BUT ANOTHER TROUGH MAY 
SWING IN BEHIND IT. CONFIDENCE OF THIS NEXT WAVE IS LOW.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS THROUGH THE EXTENDED...BUT TRENDED A 
DEGREE OR TWO LOWER ON THE MAX TEMPERATURES DUE TO THE CLOUDS AND 
PRECIPITATION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  62  51  68  49 /  60  70  90  80  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  64  50  68  50 /  50  60  80  80  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  64  49  66  49 /  40  60  80  80  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              40  64  45  64  48 /  40  50  50  60  50

1030 AM EST TUE MAR 9 2010

.DISCUSSION...STACKED LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER KS WITH SHOWER
ACTIVITY WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM MOVING SLOWLY
EAST ACROSS THE WESTERN TN VALLEY WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS EAST TODAY
INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON.
RAISED TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY WESTERN SECTIONS AND ADJUSTED POPS
DOWNWARD SLIGHTLY. EXPECTING SHOWERS TO CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AS THEY
MOVE EAST AND NEW MET GUIDANCE SHOWING WARMER TEMPERATURES WEST.
THICKER CLOUDS JUST MOVING INTO SOUTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES BUT
TEMPERATURES EAST OF NASHVILLE STILL WARMING NICELY THIS MORNING. WILL
SEND OUT UPDATE SOON TO RELECT CHANGES.

216 
FXUS64 KMRX 090940 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 AM EST TUE MAR 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AXIS OF UPPER RIDGE WILL SHIFT 
EAST DURING THE PERIOD. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER THE AREA...AND 
SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL BRING POSSIBILITY OF SOME SHOWERS 
THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. FORCING LOOKS WEAK AND EXPECT PRECIP 
AMOUNTS TO BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE.  WILL CARRY HIGH CHANCE POPS 
SOUTHWEST BUT KEEP FAR NORTHEAST NO HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE 
TODAY...THEN CHANCE NORTHEAST AND LOW LIKELY SOUTHWEST ZONES 
TONIGHT.  WILL GENERALLY TWEAK MAV TEMPS UP A BIT TODAY...BUT WILL 
GO WITH MOS LOWS TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN 
IS SHAPING UP FOR THE EXTENDED.  ON WEDNESDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH 
PUSHES INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. WITH A SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE 
REGION IN THE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.  THE WAVE SHOULD BE EXITING 
THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND WE SHOULD BE BETWEEN THINGS THURSDAY NIGHT 
BUT COULD STILL SEE SOME SCATTERED ACTIVITY SO HAVE LEFT 20-30 
POPS.  AN UPPER LOW SLIDES INTO THE REGION FOR THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED.  A SERIES OF WAVES ROTATING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WILL 
OCCASIONALLY PRODUCE SHOWERS OVER THE AREA.  TIMING OF THESE WAVE IS 
QUITE DIFFICULT AND CONFIDENCE LESSENS EACH DAY.  SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY DOES REACH INTO THE AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AND HAVE 
LEFT THE POTENTIAL FOR THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN            66  45  61  47  67 /  40  50  60  60  60

762 
FXUS64 KMRX 090233
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
933 PM EST MON MAR 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  HIGH PRESSURE  
BRINGING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SKIES BECAME MOSTLY SUNNY IN 
THE WAKE OF THE WEAK DISTURBANCE THAT BRUSHED THROUGH THE NE HALF OF 
THE AREA THIS MORNING WITH JUST A FEW SPRINKLES OR SHOWERS AND 
POSSIBLY A BIT OF SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES SOARED 
TO THE MID 50S TO NEAR 60 IN SW VA AND NE TN TO THE MID 60S TO LOWER 
70S CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS...A FEW DEGREES MORE THAN 
EXPECTED. DRIER AIR MIXED DOWN WITH LOW HUMIDITIES AT LOCATIONS 
ACROSS THE REGION ESPECIALLY SOUTH. NEXT SYSTEM TAKING SHAPE OVER 
THE CENTRAL ROCKIES THIS AFTERNOON THAT DEEPENS TONIGHT AND MOVES 
INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TUESDAY. GFS MUCH FASTER WITH MOISTURE 
INCREASE THEN NAM WHICH BRINGS SHOWERS INTO WESTERN SECTIONS TUESDAY 
MORNING WHILE NAM HOLDS OFF UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL BRING POPS IN 
VERY GRADUALLY TUESDAY NOT REACHING NE TN UNTIL AFTER 00Z. AM A 
LITTLE AFRAID HIGHS MIGHT BE CLOSER TO NAM GUIDANCE BUT INCREASED 
CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP TEMPS A LITTLE COOLER. LOWS A FEW DEGREES 
WARMER MOST PLACES AS RIDGING ALOFT MOVES OVERHEAD. LOWER VALLEYS 
WHERE ATMOSPHERE DECOUPLES STILL SHOULD DROP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 
30S.       

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEATHER STORY FOR THE
EXTENDED IS A DEVELOPING DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEYS BY LATE WEEK- WEEKEND. A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES
WILL MOVE OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THROUGH THE WEEK. FIRST WAVE
WILL AFFECT THE AREA LATE TUESDAY AND NIGHT WITH GOOD DIVERGENCE
ALOFT AND SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT. AIRMASS WILL BE INITIALLY DRY.
ANOTHER WAVE FOR WEDNESDAY...BUT MOST OF THE ENERGY WILL REMAIN
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.
ALSO...DOWNSLOPING WINDS INTO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS
WILL KEEP CHANCES DOWN. FAIRLY STRONG SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY PRODUCING LIKELY POPS...BUT AGAIN
DOWNSLOPING WINDS MAY LIMIT QPF FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN
SECTIONS.

A DRY SLOT ALSO MOVES ACROSS THURSDAY WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. THURSDAY NIGHT WILL BE MAINLY DRY.

FOR FRIDAY...SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. A COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON WITH AN UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED COLD AIR ALOFT SETTING THE STAGE FOR CONVECTION. 
DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH INSOLATION OCCURS BEFORE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND 
TIMING OF FRONT...AIRMASS MAY BE UNSTABLE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE SEVERE 
STORMS WITH THE MAIN THREAT BEING LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.

FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...UPPER TROUGH REMAINS ACROSS THE OHIO-
TENNESSEE VALLEYS AND SLOWLY FILLING. WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE...AFTERNOON
INSTABILITY DUE TO COLD AIR ALOFT...AND UPSLOPE FLOW WILL CONTINUE
CHANCES OF SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. VERTICAL
TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE COLD ENOUGH ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN
FOR A MIXTURE-CHANGE OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  65  47  61  49 /   0  40  70  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  65  45  61  48 /   0  30  60  60  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  65  45  60  48 /   0  40  60  60  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              34  63  40  64  45 /   0  10  50  40  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1022 AM EST MON MAR 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...LIGHT SHOWERS HAVE ENDED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THIS MORNING. SKIES ARE PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY SUNNY IN MOST
PLACES. TEMPERATURES ARE GENERALLY RUNNING A FEW DEGREES ABOVE WHAT
IS IN THE GRIDDED FORECAST SO HAVE UPDATED THAT. DEW POINTS ARE A
FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN EXPECTED. MODELS WANT TO RAISE DEW POINTS
CONSIDERABLY DUE TO LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. BUT THINK MOISTURE WILL
MIX OUT AND ONLY RISE SLIGHTLY. CURRENT MINIMUM RH VALUES MAYBE
SLIGHTLY LOWER. RAISED HIGHS A FEW DEGREES IN SW VA AND NE TN
MOUNTAINS. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY TO REMOVE MENTION OF PRECIPITATION
NORTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST MON MAR 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING SHORT WAVE WILL EXIT 
NORTHERN AREAS THIS MORNING.  MAY BE A FEW SPRINKLES OR LIGHT 
SHOWERS EARLY OVER FAR NORTH...AND GIVEN LACK OF OBS UPSTREAM WITH 
MEASURABLE PRECIP WILL JUST MENTION SPRINKLES.  OTHERWISE...CLOUDS 
SHOULD DECREASE DURING THE DAY...AND SHOULD BE DRY THROUGH TONIGHT.  
MAV TEMPS CONTINUE TO BE PRETTY GOOD OF LATE...AND LOOK REASONABLE 
ONCE AGAIN...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL TRANSITION 
FROM THE WEEKEND FAIR WEATHER PATTERN TO A MORE UNSETTLED AND 
PERHAPS MORE SPRINGLIKE PATTERN AS THE WESTERN STATES UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH SHIFTS STEADILY EAST INTO THE CENTER OF THE NATION WHILE 
CLOSING OFF ON TUESDAY. KIND OF LIKED THE NAM DEPICTION WITH 
EXPECTED WEATHER ON TUESDAY WITH A POP THAT DOESN'T GET TOO FAR OUT 
OF HAND AND DISPLAYS A GRADIENT OF HIGHER TO LOWER PROBABILITY FROM 
SOUTHWEST THROUGH NORTHEAST. FORECAST STILL UNCERTAIN TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD WEDNESDAY AS SURFACE WARM FRONT ADVANCES 
NORTH OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AND SUPPORTING UPPER LOW 
SHIFTS WELL NORTH INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS. MODELS INDICATE 
POSSIBILITY OF THE PASSAGE OF SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY DURING 
THIS PERIOD WITH CONTINUATION OF MOISTURE ADVECTION OFF THE GULF SO 
STAYED IN MEDIUM CHANCE CATEGORY AS THE REGION AWAITS INFLUENCE OF 
STRONGER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THIS 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL ALSO DEEPEN THROUGH TIME AND WILL CLOSE OFF 
WHILE MAKING LIMITED PROGRESS THROUGH THE MIDWEST THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY. THIS FEATURE SUPPORT A SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM WHICH WILL 
DRIVE EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY THURSDAY 
GENERATING A DECENT AREA OF CONVECTION. THUS CONTINUED TO ADVERTISE 
LIKELY POPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY FOR THIS SYSTEM. 
VERTICALLY STACKED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL PRODUCE YET ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT ON FRIDAY AND AS UPPER CENTER DRAWS CLOSER TO THE MID SOUTH 
INSTABILITY WILL INCREASE DURING THE DAY FRIDAY FOR THE POSSIBILITY 
OF MORE CONVECTION. UPPER LOW TRUDGES SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS OVER THE WEEKEND SO HAD TO MAINTAIN 
A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS THROUGH THIS PERIOD AS NORTHWEST FLOW BRINGS 
COLDER AIR BACK INTO THE REGION. ADJUSTED MAX/MIN TEMPERATURES 
CLOSER TO MILDER NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE WITH 
SUCH A LENGTHY PERIOD OF SOUTHERLY FLOW THROUGH DAY FIVE.     

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  43  65  47  64 /   0   0  40  30  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  41  64  44  64 /   0   0  30  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  41  64  44  63 /   0   0  40  30  40

632 
FXUS64 KMRX 080228
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
928 PM EST SUN MAR 7 2010

.DISCUSSION...OBSERVATIONS UPSTREAM INDICTING LIGHT RAIN 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORTWAVE.  CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD WITH THE 
BULK OF THE RAIN IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA.  TEMPERATURES 
AND THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST ALSO APPEARS ON TRACK.  WILL 
UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING/MIDNIGHT WORDING.  NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HIGH CLOUDS HAVE THINNED ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...ALLOWING TEMPS TO REACH WITHIN A 
FEW DEGREES OF SEASONAL NORMS ALREADY. UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE WAS 
LOCATED ACROSS NRN ILLINOIS AND NOT AS TIGHTLY WOUND UP AS EARLIER 
TODAY. AIRMASS IS QUITE DRY PRESENTLY...BUT MODELS ARE PERSISTENT IN 
DEVELOPING SOME LIGHT QPF ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NRN PARTS OF E TN 
OVERNIGHT. WILL MAINTAIN CONSISTENCY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND KEEP A 
LOW POP OR SPRINKLES ACROSS THOSE AREAS. INCREASING CLOUDS WILL 
FAVOR MILDER MINS TONIGHT.

SOME LINGERING SPRINKLES OR PATCHY LIGHT SHOWERS MONDAY MORNING...
THEN A DECREASE IN CLOUDINESS. CHOSE THE GFS MOS IN GENERAL FOR 
MONDAY HIGHS...ALTHO GUIDANCE WAS QUITE CLOSE AND REASONABLE. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHORT RANGE MODEL 
ENSEMBLES SHOW A PATTERN CHANGE AS UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT SHIFTS EAST. LOW PRESSURE OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND UPPER LOW MOVES SLOWLY NORTHEAST MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY TOWARD THE MID MS VALLEY. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AS A WEAK WARM FRONT PASSES THROUGH. TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY THE SYSTEM WILL WOBBLE AROUND WITH CONSIDERABLE CLOUD 
COVER BUT NOT MUCH PRECIPITATION AS MAIN SYSTEM STAYS FAR TO THE 
WEST. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AS WARM AIR 
ADVECTION AND COLD FRONT PASS THROUGH EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
THUNDERSTORMS LOOK POSSIBLE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. UPPER LOW WOBBLES 
EAST THROUGH OHIO VALLEY AS SURFACE LOW MOVES BY NORTH OF TN. COULD 
BE FIRST THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TOO. LARGE 
UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM WILL STAY NEAR FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND 
WITH THREAT FOR SHOWERS CONTINUING. TEMPERATURES MILD THROUGH 
FRIDAY THEN COOLING A FEW DEGREES ON THE WEEKEND.

828 
FXUS64 KMRX 070900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SUN MAR 7 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAKENING SHORT WAVE WILL DIVE 
SOUTHEAST...BRUSHING NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT.  WE WILL 
SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS DURING THE SHORT TERM...WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES FAR NORTH LATE TONIGHT.  
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MUCH OF OUR SW VA ZONES TONIGHT.  
LOOKS LIKE TEMPS WILL BE CLOSE TO FREEZING IN SW VA AND A FEW 
POCKETS OF VERY LIGHT FREEZING RAIN CANNOT BE COMPLETELY RULED 
OUT...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP TEMPS JUST ABOVE FREEZING AND ONLY 
MENTION RAIN SHOWERS.   MAV TEMPS HAVE BEEN PERFORMING FAIRLY 
WELL...AND LOOK REASONABLE ONCE AGAIN...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE FAIR WEATHER PATTERN 
GRADUALLY BREAKS DOWN LEADING TO AN UNSETTLED MID TO LATE WEEK 
PERIOD. MONDAY SHOULD BE DRY FOR MOST OF THE AREA...BUT THERE WILL 
BE A FEW MORE CLOUDS AROUND AS A WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SHIFTS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP FOR A SHOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MONDAY MORNING. THE NEXT 
SYSTEM THAT WILL IMPACT THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE AN UPPER LEVEL LOW 
(CURRENTLY BUILDING EAST TOWARD SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA) THAT JOURNEYS 
NORTHEAST INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON TUESDAY. THIS PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE ADVECTION 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. DURING THE DAY AND A FEW SHOWERS MAY 
DEVELOP ALONG A WARM FRONT MAKING ITS WAY NORTH. GENERALLY KEPT POPS 
IN LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE FOR THIS POSSIBILITY ON TUESDAY. TRIED 
TO KEEP PROBABILITY OF PRECIP FOR A SHOWER IN A LOW TO MEDIUM RANGE 
FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS STILL BELIEVE THE FORECAST AREA 
MAY NOT SEE ANY SIGNIFICANT LIFTING MECHANISM UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY AS TRAILING SHORT WAVE/UPPER LOW DRIVES EAST ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE MIDWEST WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM LIFTING NORTHEAST THROUGH THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
INTO THE MID SOUTH DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. MODELS INDICATE SOME 
INSTABILITY PRESENT AHEAD OF SYSTEM COLD FRONT AND KEPT POSSIBILITY 
OF CONVECTION GOING WITH LIKELY POPS. KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS 
ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS MODELS SLOW THE PROGRESSION OF LONG WAVE 
UPPER LOW ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY 
CONCERNING THE  DETAILS OF TIMING EPISODES OF PRECIP DURING THE LONG 
TERM FORECAST SO JUST TRIED TO KEEP TREND OF INCREASING CHANCE FOR 
RAIN INTO THE LATTER PORTION OF THE WORK WEEK WITH SOME TAPERING BY 
WEEKS END. THE GOOD NEWS IS WITH UPPER TROUGHING HANGING AROUND WEST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA TEMPERATURES WILL GENERALLY BE MILDER THAN 
WE'VE SEEN IN RECENT WEEKS.   

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 060848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST SAT MAR 6 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN 
CONTROL...WITH CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKY...LIGHT WINDS...AND 
CONTINUATION OF THE GRADUAL WARMING TREND.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGING HOLDS ON FOR ANOTHER 
GREAT DAY ON SUNDAY WITH SKIES FILLED WITH SUNSHINE AND HIGH 
TEMPERATURES ACTUALLY RIGHT AROUND CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMS FOR EARLY 
MARCH. A WEAKENING SHORT WAVE TROF WILL TRAVERSE THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE SUNDAY NIGHT/EARLY MONDAY AND STAYED WITH 
JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. MONDAY 
SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE A FAIRLY DECENT DAY ALTHOUGH NOT QUITE AS 
SUNNY WITH A FEW CLOUDS PRESSING IN WITH THE WEAK SHORT WAVE TROF. 
BY TUESDAY...CENTRAL PLAINS UPPER TROF/CLOSED LOW WILL MIGRATE 
STEADILY NORTHEAST TOWARD THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES WHILE SURFACE LOW 
TAKES SIMILAR ROUTE. INCREASING WAA/ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY LEAD TO THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT AS WARM FRONT SHIFTS NORTH TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY. 
FORECAST UNCERTAINTY EMERGES MID TO LATE WEEK AS THE FIRST UPPER 
TROF SWINGS FURTHER NORTH INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT 
LAKES WHILE THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS TRAILING UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM 
WHICH DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN ROCKIES. TRIED TO MAINTAIN 
JUST A SMALL POP FOR DAYTIME PERIOD WEDNESDAY AS THERE COULD END UP 
BEING A BREAK IN THE ACTION AS THE REGION WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS. 
GRADUALLY RAISE POPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AS DEEPENING 
UPPER LEVEL TROF OR CLOSED LOW BUILD INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. APPLIED CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS 
OF THE FORECAST THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT AS INSTABILITY INCREASES 
WITH APPROACH OF UPPER LOW. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE WITH GFS 
ACCELERATING THE LOW FASTER TOWARD THE ATLANTIC COAST ON FRIDAY 
WHILE ECMWF SEVERAL HUNDRED MILES FARTHER WEST. THERFORE...HELD ONTO 
CHANCE POPS DURING THE DAY SEVEN PERIOD AS WE AWAIT BETTER MODEL 
RESOLUTION.   

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 052001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST FRI MAR 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
AS THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OFF THE COAST MOVES FARTHER EAST...THE 
AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER THE MS VALLEY WILL TRACK EAST TONIGHT AND 
TOMORROW. THIS WILL KEEP SKIES CLEAR THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. WE 
SHOULD SEE GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS TONIGHT AS WINDS DROP 
OFF TO NEAR CALM AFTER SUNSET. WENT WITH THE COOLER GFS MOS TEMPS 
FOR LOWS TONIGHT. THE SURFACE RIDGE WILL SETTLE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY 
TOMORROW. TEMPERATURE ADVECTION WILL BE NEAR NEUTRAL BUT WITH FULL 
SUN WE SHOULD REACH THE UPPER 50S SOUTH TO UPPER 40S NORTH.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THERE SHOULD STILL
BE GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING SATURDAY NIGHT AND VIRTUALLY NO CLOUDS.
EVEN WITH WARMING AN EVEN DRIER AIRMASS SATURDAY NIGHT WILL ALLOW
LOWS TO DROP INTO THE MID AND UPPER 20S WITH LOWS BELOW 20 IN THE
HIGHER NORTHEAST VALUES LIKE AT TRI. SUNDAY WARMING CONTINUES WITH
SOME MOISTURE RETURN BUT STILL A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY. HIGHS NEAR
NORMAL MID 50S TO LOWER 60S. AN UPPER LOW NOW OVER THE NORTHERN
ROCKIES WILL WEAKEN SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS IT PASSES OVER RIDGE
OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES. A FEW SHOWERS MAY SPREAD INTO SW
VIRGINIA BUT THE MAIN AFFECT WILL BE INCREASING CLOUDS. PATTERN
CHANGES MORE MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS RIDGING ALOFT SLOWLY SHIFTS EAST
INTO THE ATLANTIC. MILD TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE WITH NIGHT TIME
TEMPERATURES ABOVE FREEZING FOR THE MOST PART SUNDAY NIGHT.
DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT
WILL INCREASE MOISTURE AND LIFT INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY.
EXPECT SHOWERY CONDITIONS TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY BUT BEST CHANCES
HOLD OFF AS SYSTEM SLOWLY MOVES ACROSS REGION THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.
ADDED THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

FXUS64 KMRX 050830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST FRI MAR 5 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD 
INTO THE AREA DURING THE PERIOD.  WILL BE A FEW CLOUDS AROUND AT 
TIMES...ESPECIALLY NORTH...BUT STILL SHOULD BE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE 
TODAY WITH A CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKY TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND 
ALOFT WILL KEEP THE FAIR WEATHER REGIME GOING OVER THE WEEKEND. THE 
MODELS INDICATE A WEAK SHORT WAVE TROF DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE 
OHIO VALLEY ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY. STAYED THE COURSE FOR NOW AND KEPT POPS OUT OF THE FORECAST 
FOR THIS RATHER INSIGNIFICANT FEATURE AWAITING STRONGER MID TO LATE 
WEEK SYSTEM WHICH THE MODELS HAVE SLOWED DOWN A BIT. BECAUSE OF 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER TREND...ADJUSTED POPS BACK A LITTLE IN TIMING AND 
MAGNITUDE BUT STILL HAVE SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POP GOING FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AS INITIAL SHORT WAVE BUILDS 
NORTHEAST INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. WAA/ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY 
LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW SHOWERS DURING THIS PERIOD BEFORE 
TAPERING BACK DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY AS THIS FIRST SYSTEM ROTATES 
NORTH TOWARD THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES. NEXT SHORT WAVE DRIVES EAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND IS DEPICTED TO SLOW DOWN AND CLOSE 
OFF INTO AN UPPER LOW SOMEWHERE OVER THE MID SOUTH. STAYED WITH 
CHANCE POPS DURING THIS PERIOD WITH THE HIGHEST PROBABILITY USED ON 
THURSDAY DUE TO THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE STACKED PRESSURE SYSTEM. 
CONCERNING TEMPERATURES STAYED A FEW DEGREES UNDER SUGGESTED MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EST THU MAR 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...MINOR ADJUSTMENT TO FORECAST. LOWERED CLOUD COVER 
...DP...AND RH OVERNIGHT. SON

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH OFF THE NORTHEAST 
UNITED STATES WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH EAST ALLOWING A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE SURFACE AND ALOFT TO BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. LOW 
CLOUDS OVER MOST OF THE REGION WILL DISSIPATE SOON AFTER SUNSET...SO 
WILL CALL FOR SKY TO BECOME CLEAR SOUTH TO PARTLY CLOUDY NORTHEAST 
BY LATE THIS EVENING/MIDNIGHT. 

FOR FRIDAY...MOSTLY CLEAR SKY. THICKNESS/850MB TEMPERATURES SHOW 
WARMER TEMPERATURES AND WILL FOLLOW GFS MOS NUMBERS CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORT RANGE MODELS 
FINALLY SHOVE LAST BIT OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE EAST FRIDAY EVENING SO 
EXPECTING CLEAR SKIES. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
STILL CENTERED TO THE WEST AND NORTH OF FORECAST AREA. SATURDAY HIGH 
PRESSURE SETTLES OVERHEAD WITH RISING HEIGHTS BUILDING INTO THE 
REGION. WENT CONSERVATIVE WITH WARMING TREND AND KEPT HIGH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE 50S EXCEPT UPPER 40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS MOUNTAINS 
AND SW VIRGINIA. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT WITH DRY AIR 
ALOFT AND HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD. MORE WARMING SUNDAY WITH HIGHS 50S 
NORTH TO LOWER 60S AROUND CHA. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE 
BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST TO THE EAST COAST WITH MOISTURE BEGINNING TO 
INCREASE AHEAD OF SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS 
SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY TUESDAY WITH WARM FRONT APPROACHING 
THE TN VALLEY. WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MONDAY NIGHT NE 
TO CHANCE SW AHEAD OF WARM FRONT. BETTER CHANCE SHOWERS TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT. GFS TRIES TO BETTER MOISTURE EAST BY WEDNESDAY. BUT 
ECMWF KEEPS LOWER PRESSURE AREA IN MS VALLEY THROUGH END OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD SO CONTINUE RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THURSDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD THROUGH THE END OF THE 7 DAY PERIOD.

616 
FXUS64 KMRX 040911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EST THU MAR 4 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA BRINGING LIGHT SNOW AND FLURRIES TO THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE CWA THIS MORNING.  ADDITIONAL SNOW ACROSS THE ADVISORY AREAS 
SHOULD BE LIMITED AS A DRIER AIRMASS PUSHES INTO THE REGION 
TODAY...SO WILL LEAVE THE CURRENT WSW AS IS. THE HIGHEST CHANCE POPS 
FOR TODAY WILL BE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT CHANCES WILL DECREASE 
BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. CLOUDS SHOULD BE DECREASING TODAY WHICH WILL 
HELP TEMPERATURES TO BE A BIT WARMER THAN YESTERDAY...BUT WE STILL BE 
BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  STAYED NEAR THE MET/MAV BLEND 
TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TONIGHT BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. STAYED NEAR THE MET/MAV 
BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT AS WELL.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS REMAIN IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND 
THEN DIVERGE WITH THEIR HANDLING OF THE NEXT SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE EXITING THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE NATION ON FRIDAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE 
PLAINS. A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH THE UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
MIGRATING OVER THE REGION BY SATURDAY AS WELL. THIS SCENARIO WILL 
FINALLY BRING A NICE WARMING TREND BACK TO NORMAL LEVELS FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR. LATEST MODEL RUNS CONTINUE TO INDICATE THAT A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY...BUT WILL 
LIKELY NOT AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA...SO HAVE REMOVED THE MENTION OF 
SHOWERS FOR MONDAY. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS HAVE NOT BEEN IN AGREEMENT 
WITH ANY SOLUTION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT THEY STILL BOTH AGREE 
THAT A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE TN RIVER VALLEY AROUND 
THE TUESDAY TIMEFRAME. THE GFS MODEL SHOWS THIS SYSTEM QUICKLY 
MOVING OUT OF THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...WHILE THE ECMWF MODEL KEEPS 
THINGS UNSETTLED WITH ANOTHER STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING 
ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY. 
SINCE THE ECMWF MODEL HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT LATELY IN THE 
EXTENDED THAN THE GFS MODEL...WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 

&&

716 
FXUS64 KMRX 040205
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST WED MAR 3 2010

.DISCUSSION...SHORT WAVE EMBEDDED IN MEAN TROF ON TRACK TO MOVE SE 
THROUGH MRX CWA LATER TONIGHT. THIS SHOULD HELP MAINTAIN SNOW SHOWER 
ACTIVITY MAINLY AFFECTING NW FACING UPSLOPE AREAS. CLOUDS AND WIND 
WILL KEEP TEMPS FROM FALLING TOO FAR OVERNIGHT. NO UPDATE PLANNED. 
SON

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROUGH OFF THE 
MID-ATLANTIC COASTS WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE NORTH-NORTHWEST FLOW 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS SHOW ANOTHER WEAK SHORT-WAVE ROTATING 
AROUND THE UPPER LOW OVERNIGHT. NORTHWEST-SOUTHEAST CROSS SECTIONS 
SHOW BOUNDARY LAYER NORTHWEST FLOW STRENGTHENING SOME OVERNIGHT WITH 
DEEPER MOISTURE. UPSLOPE LIFT INCREASES...SO WILL CALL FOR THE 
CONTINUATION OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE WEST-NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES 
WITH ADDITIONAL 1 TO 3 INCHES...FAVORED AREAS UP TO 4 INCHES 
OVERNIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES 
ARE ANTICIPATED ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND 
SOUTHERN PLATEAU. WILL EXTEND WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR FAR 
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND INCLUDE WISE COUNTY FOR HIGH KNOB 
AREA UNTIL 15Z THURSDAY.

FOR THURSDAY...WAVE MOVES EAST OF AREA ALLOWING SNOW TO END AND 
CLOUDS TO SLOWLY BREAK...BUT STILL OVERALL MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SKY...EXCEPT FOR THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES.

TRENDED ON THE COLD SIDE OF GUIDANCE HIGHS FOR THURSDAY GIVEN CLOUD 
COVER.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL BE 
PULLING WAY FROM THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
BUILDING IN FOR FRIDAY AND THE WEEKEND.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR PLENTY 
OF SUNSHINE WITH AFTERNOON HIGHS WARMING TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS.  
MODELS REMAIN IN POOR AGREEMENT FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  HOWEVER...DO EXPECTED A SYSTEM MOVE PUSH IN 
AROUND THE TUESDAY TIME FRAME.  WILL LEAVE MONDAY AS A TRANSITION 
DAY WITH INCREASING CLOUDS AND LOW POPS LATE IN THE DAY.  HAVE KEPT 
CHANCE POPS AROUND TUESDAY.  FOR NOW...HAVE WEDNESDAY DRY 
ANTICIPATING THE TUESDAY SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE AREA...THOUGH SOME 
MODELS INDICATE CONTINUED UNSETTLED WEATHER INTO WEDNESDAY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  30  48  28  54  28 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    30  41  26  48  26 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN            30  43  26  48  26 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   26  38  24  43  23 /  30  10   0   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1226 PM EST WED MAR 3 2010

.AVIATION...WRAP AROUND STRATU-CU WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD ACROSS THE 
TAF SITES THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH CEILING GENERALLY BETWEEN 
25-35KFT. ANOTHER WEAK SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT PRODUCING SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVER 
TRI AND POSSIBLY TYS. VISIBILITIES WILL OCCASIONALLY LOWER TO 3 TO 5 
MILES ASSOCIATED WITH SNOW SHOWERS. OVERALL...HIGH MVFR AND VFR 
CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO BREAK ACROSS CHA 
AND POSSIBLY TYS THURSDAY MORNING.

WINDS WILL REMAIN NORTHWESTERY BETWEEN 5 AND 10KTS.

.DISCUSSION...PLENTY OF WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE INTO THE APPALACHAINS WILL

STRENGTHENING SOME THIS EVENING INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING AS
ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE ROTATES AROUND UPPER TROUGH. MAY EXTEND THE WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING AND INCLUDE THE HIGH KNOB AREA
DURING THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

DUE TO ABUNDANT LOW CLOUDS...HAVE LOWERED HIGHS FOR THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY.

HAVE A GREAT DAY...

737 
FXUS64 KMRX 030905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST WED MAR 3 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DOWNGRADED THE WINTER STORM 
WARNING TO AN ADVISORY WITH THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AND DEEP 
MOISTURE TRACKS NORTHEAST OF THE CWA TODAY.  STILL HAVE UPSLOPE 
CONDITIONS TODAY BUT MOISTURE IS TOO LIMITED TO CONTINUE THE 
WARNING.  HIGHEST CHANCES TODAY AND TONIGHT STILL ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS AS THE LOW EXITS THE AREA.  TEMPERATURES STILL BELOW 
NORMAL TODAY AND TONIGHT.  STAYED NEAR THE MET/MAV BLEND NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS SEEM TO BE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND 
THEN DIVERGE WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM EXPECTED FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. A 
BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL STILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION ON THURSDAY...WITH A FEW SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN DURING THE MORNING HOURS. THIS 
UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY EXIT THE REGION ON FRIDAY...WITH 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER- 
LEVEL RIDGE WILL THEN FINALLY DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
SATURDAY...WHICH SHOULD BRING A NICE WARMING TREND BACK TO NORMAL 
LEVELS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. EARLIER MODEL RUNS HAD INDICATED THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A COLD FRONT STALLING OUT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
ON TUESDAY...AND THEN BECOMING THE FOCUS FOR SOME SHOWER DEVELOPMENT 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...LATEST RUNS 
OF BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS SEEM TO HAVE BACKED OFF ON THAT 
IDEA...BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FOR 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY NIGHT SINCE THE MODELS HAVE NOT BEEN 
CONSISTENT WITH ANY SOLUTION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE MAIN IDEA THAT 
BOTH OF THE MODELS SEEM TO HAVE AGREED ON WITH THEIR PREVIOUS RUNS 
INVOLVES THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
PLAINS ON MONDAY...AND THEN SLOWLY MOVING IT EASTWARD INTO THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY. THUS...WHILE IT APPEARS THAT NEXT WEEK 
WILL BE WARM...IT WILL LIKELY ALSO BE UNSETTLED. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             45  29  50  28  53 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  41  29  47  27  50 /  20  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       42  28  47  27  50 /  20  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  25  42  24  45 /  50  20  20   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST TUE MAR 2 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. MAIN DEFORMATION ZONE HAS
ALREADY MOVED ALONG AND EAST OF THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH
THE HEAVIEST SNOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVER THE FAR EASTERN
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER STORM WARNING THERE
THROUGH 10Z. RADAR SHOWS SOME ENHANCEMENT ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE VALLEY ASSOCIATED WITH TROUGH AXIS. WILL
CONTINUE WITH THE ADVISORY FOR AREAS IN THE VALLEY ALONG AND NORTH
OF KNOXVILLE. HAVE CANCELLED THE ADVISORY FOR THE PLATEAU AND
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. SOME REPORTS OF RAIN ACROSS THE AREA...BUT
FEEL WILL LIKELY CHANGE BACK TO LIGHT SNOW-FLURRIES BEFORE ENDING.

FOR WEDNESDAY...SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED OVER FAR EASTERN
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...OTHERWISE CLOUDY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS
AND FLURRIES CONTINUE ACROSS NE AREAS EARLY IN THE PERIOD. AMOUNTS 
WILL BE LIGHT AND SOME DAY TIME RAIN/DRIZZLE POSSIBLE ACROSS 
NORTHERN VALLEYS. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE WEEKEND. PROLONGED 
PERIODS OF SUNSHINE ARE PROJECTED AND SUNDAYS MAX TEMPS LOOK TO 
CLIMB ABOVE NORMAL. COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NW ON MONDAY 
BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF PCPN. FRONT BECOMES STATIONARY ACROSS 
NORTHERN AREAS BY TUE WITH CONTINUED CHC FOR RAIN. STAYED NEAR 
HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.DISCUSSION...A DEFORMATION ZONE IS MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA

INCHES FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA. HAVE SENT OUT AN UPGRADE TO THE WSW.

MORNING SINCE THE MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME UPSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPING
WITH AN ADDITIONAL 1 TO 3 INCHES POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT.

BESIDES THE SNOW....HAVE LOWERED HIGHS TODAY AND INCREASED POPS.

544 
FXUS64 KMRX 021236
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
735 AM EST TUE MAR 2 2010

.MESOSCALE UPDATE...
CALLS FROM WISE COUNTY INDICATED THAT 1 TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW HAS 
ALREADY ACCUMULATED...SO HAVE INCLUDED THEM IN THE WINTER WX 
ADVISORY FOR TODAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE COAST OF THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE...WITH AN 
INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTHEAST OF IT ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RADAR IMAGERY REVEALS AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT PRECIP OVER ALABAMA AND GEORGIA...WHICH WAS 
SLOWLY MOVING NORTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE UPPER-LEVELS WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
SNOW...WITH THE BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS ULTIMATELY DETERMINING PRECIP 
TYPE. OVERALL...THINK THAT SNOW WILL BE THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2000 FEET...WITH A RAIN/SNOW MIX 
IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BELOW 2000 FEET. IN ADDITION...IT APPEARS 
THAT TEMPS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS WILL EITHER REMAIN OR RISE ABOVE 
FREEZING TODAY...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT MOST SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS TO 
GRASSY SURFACES AND LIKELY KEEP THE LIQUID TO SNOW RATIOS LOW 
(AROUND 1 TO 5). MODELS HAVE REMAINED CONSISTENT WITH THEIR EARLIER 
RUNS...BUT THE GFS MODEL CONTINUES TO BRING MORE MOISTURE NORTHWARD 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO THE NAM MODEL. OVERALL...IT 
STILL APPEARS THAT LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST NC AND THE MOUNTAINS...BUT MAINLY 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2000 FEET. THUS...WILL CONTINUE 
THE ADVISORIES AS PREVIOUSLY ADVERTISED. FOR THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT UP TO AN INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE ON GRASSY SURFACES THIS MORNING...AND WILL PLAN TO ISSUE 
A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THIS POTENTIAL. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL UNDERCUT THEIR MAXES TODAY DUE TO THE ANTICIPATED 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING EFFECTS FROM THE PRECIP. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKING EAST OF THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH SOME 
LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA...SO WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH. THE BEST CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE IN THE UPSLOPE 
AREAS. ONLY FLURRIES EXPECTED EXPECTED BY THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER WEATHER INTO THE WEEKEND. 
ANOTHER DISTURBANCE APPROACHES THE AREA ON MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD RETURN CLOSER TO SEASONAL LEVEL BY THE WEEKEND. STAYED NEAR 
HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   38  30  45  28  49 / 100  20  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     38  29  42  26  44 /  80  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             38  30  44  26  46 /  70  20  10  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    36  26  38  25  40 /  70  40  20  20  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     BRADLEY...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HAMILTON...
     JOHNSON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...
     RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI...
     WEST POLK.

FXUS64 KMRX 020128
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
825 PM EST MON MAR 1 2010

.DISCUSSION...SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVING INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY WITH STRENGTHENING MOISTURE ADVECTION AHEAD OF FEATURE ACROSS 
MISSISSIPPI/ALABAMA. MIXED PRECIPITATION IN THE FORM OF SNOW AND 
RAIN SHOULD INITIATE LATER TONIGHT. PRECIP WILL BE FALLING INTO DRY 
LOWER LEVELS ACROSS THE REGION CHILLING THE NEAR SURFACE AIR WHICH 
WILL ALLOW FOR THE WINTRY MIX. ALSO...SLIGHTLY STRONGER DYNAMIC LIFT 
AS WAVE APPROACHES LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING MAY ALLOW FOR 
ADDITIONAL COOLING OF THE COLUMN. STILL APPEARS BEST CHANCE FOR 
ACCUMULATION WILL BE IN HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS WITH SOME MINOR 
ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
WILL KEEP ADVISORY IN PLACE FOR THE EXPECTED LIGHT ACCUMULATION.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
655 PM EST MON MAR 1 2010

.AVIATION...SOUTHEAST TEXAS STORM SYSTEM IS MAKING PROGRESS INTO
THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THIS EVENING. LOW AC DECK ADVANCING EAST
ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND WILL BUILD ACROSS THE TAF SITES THROUGH
THIS EVENING. LOW LEVEL CLOUDS WITH MVFR CEILINGS AND LIGHT
RAIN/SNOW WILL BEGIN TO MOVE IN AFTER 08Z WITH BETTER LIFT AND
DEEPER MOISTURE. VSBY MAY DROP TO IFR IN -SNRA AROUND 14Z ALL TAF
SITES. LIMITED IMPROVEMENT POSSIBLE BY 20-22Z AS UPPER TROF SHIFTS
EAST TOWARD THE ATLANTIC COAST STATES.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

693 
FXUS64 KMRX 012102
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 PM EST MON MAR 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM CURRENTLY OVER EASTERN TEXAS WILL BUILD ACROSS THE DEEP
SOUTH LATER TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS ASSOCIATED
WITH THIS SYSTEM'S TREK NOT ENTIRELY ON THE SAME PAGE WITH THE GFS
A LITTLE STRONGER AND FASTER THAN THE WRF AND ECMWF. MODEL
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW
ACCUMULATION ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. HOWEVER...THE
PROFILE WILL SUPPORT A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA. UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS AND DEPTH OF MOISTURE WILL BE BETTER
SUITED TO SOME SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AS WELL AS THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE
TENNESSEE AND NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. THEREFORE...A WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY WAS ISSUED FOR THESE AREAS. THE GREATEST SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATION...AS IS USUALLY THE CASE...WILL BE IN THE SMOKY
MOUNTAINS WHERE SNOWFALL MAY REACH 4 INCHES. LESSER AMOUNTS WILL
OCCUR ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WHERE RAIN SHOULD BE MIXED WITH
THE SNOW AT TIMES MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AS LOW LEVEL
TEMPERATURES RISE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE FREEZING. INCLUDED SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE IN THE ADVISORY BECAUSE OF THE BETTER LIFT AND MOISTURE
EXPECTED IN THIS AREA AS WELL AS EVENT ONSET WHICH WILL BE VERY
CLOSE TO THE MORNING RUSH HOUR. SLICK SPOTS MAY DEVELOP ON BRIDGES
AND OVERPASSES DURING THIS CRITICAL PART OF THE DAY. UNDERCUT MAX
TEMP GUIDANCE BY A FEW DEGREES ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES
TO MOVE NE OFFSHORE THE MID ATLANTIC COAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD. SCT
SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS WED THEN TAPER TO
FLURRIES ACROSS NE AREA BY THU. LARGE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF
CONTINUES THE COLD PATTERN ACROSS THE REGION. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN AND BECOMES CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON
SATURDAY. UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD IN FROM THE SW SO WARM UP STILL IN
STORE FOR THE WEEKEND BUT LOWERED TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES. ECMWF
BRINGS COLD FRONT SE THROUGH OH RIVER VALLEY MONDAY. DOWNPLAYED
PCPN CHC FOR THIS SYSTEM FOR THIS PACKAGE.
