738 
FXUS64 KMRX 010803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST MON MAR 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LINGERING OFF THE NEW ENGLAND 
COAST...WITH ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER TEXAS. THE 
NORTHEAST LOW IS PROGGED TO FINALLY MOVE EAST OUT OVER THE ATLANTIC 
OCEAN TODAY...WITH THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF LOW 
CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH HIGH CLOUDS IN 
ADVANCE OF THE TEXAS LOW SPREADING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A STRONG MID LEVEL INVERSION 
WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...SO WILL BE PESSIMISTIC 
WITH SKY CONDITIONS DUE TO THE LIMITED VERTICAL MIXING EXPECTED. 
WITH CLOUDS IN ADVANCE OF THE TEXAS LOW MOVING OVER THE REGION... 
THINK THAT IT WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY THROUGH AT LEAST TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THIS SOUTHERN-STREAM LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND THEN INTO THE 
WESTERN ATLANTIC ON TUESDAY. SHORT-RANGE MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT MOST ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE WILL REMAIN SOUTH AND 
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT THE NORTHERN FRINGE OF ITS PRECIP IS 
EXPECTED TO AFFECT MOSTLY SOUTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST NC AND THE 
MOUNTAINS. IN ADDITION...TEMPS ARE PROGGED TO RISE INTO THE 40S ON 
TUESDAY ACROSS MOST OF THE LOWER ELEVATIONS...SO THINK THERE WILL BE 
A CHANGEOVER TO RAIN BY THE AFTERNOON IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BELOW 
2500 FEET. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST NC AND THE 
MOUNTAINS...BUT MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. 
WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THIS 
POTENTIAL LIGHT SNOWFALL EVENT ON TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES. WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE 
COOLER NAM NUMBERS WHICH HAVE VERIFIED BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOUTHEAST LOW MOVES UP THE 
COAST WITH US IN WEAK WRAP-AROUND RH ON WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. TEMPS IN THE COLUMN REMAIN BELOW FREEZING EXCEPT PERHAPS AT 
THE SFC ITSELF, AND SO WHAT LITTLE POPS THERE ARE WILL BE SNOW, EVEN 
AT RELATIVELY WARM TEMPS. TEMPS REMAIN A BIT COOL THROUGH THE END OF 
THE WEEK WITH A CONTINUED CLEARING AND DRYING TREND. BY THE WEEKEND 
WITH A RIDGE BUILDING IN, A RETURN TO MORE NORMAL (EVEN ABOVE 
NORMAL) TEMPS LOOKS LIKELY, ALTHOUGH CLOUDS WILL ALSO ADVANCE IN 
FROM NEXT SYSTEM OVER THE HORIZON. STILL, SHOULD THIS ACTUALLY 
HAPPEN, IT WILL SEEM LIKE A HEAT WAVE. SPRING MAY HAPPEN EVENTUALLY, 
AFTER ALL. CROSS YOUR FINGERS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EST SUN FEB 28 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...INFRARED AND VISIBLE SATELLITE 
PICS SHOW LOW CLOUDS HOLDING...EXCEPT FOR SOME DOWNSLOPE AREAS OF SW 
NC AND A SLIGHT EROSION ON THE WESTERN FRINGES ACROSS MIDDLE TN. 
CLOUDS MAY CONTINUE TO DECREASE OVER EXTREME SE TN AND SW NC THIS 
EVENING...BUT STAY MOSTLY CLOUDY ELSEWHERE OVERNIGHT. THE CLOUD 
COVER LAST NIGHT WREAKED HAVOC WITH MIN TEMP FORECAST...WITH MAV MOS 
AS MUCH AS 10 DEGREES TOO COLD AT CHA. MADE A SLIGHT ADJUSTMENT FOR 
THESE CLOUDS TONIGHT. 

NOT A LOT OF PRECIPITATION INDICATED ON AREA RADARS...BUT SMOKY MTN 
NATL PARK DID REPORT FLURRIES EARLIER WITH NOT MUCH ON RADAR...THUS 
OPTED TO CARRY A MENTION OF FLURRIES INTO THE EVENING FOR THE SMOKY 
MTNS AND NRN MTNS INTO WSHINGTON AND RUSSELL COUNTIES OF VA.

LOW CLOUDS SHOULD LIFT AND GRADUALLY DISSIPATE MONDAY...BUT JUST IN 
TIME FOR SOME MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS TO ARRIVE AHEAD OF THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SYSTEM. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD INHIBIT REACHING THE 
WARMER MOS HIGHS (WHICH ARE STILL WELL BELOW CLIMO NORMS) ON MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NEXT SYSTEM POISED TO 
BRUSH AREA ON TUESDAY AS THE HEART OF IT PASSES TO OUR SOUTH AND 
THEN TO OUR EAST.  STILL FORECASTING SOME PRECIP FOR PARTS OF THE 
AREA WITH IT LOOKING LIKE MOST OF THE PRECIP WILL BE SNOW. ONLY 
GOING WITH ABOUT AN INCH ALONG THE SOUTHERN TIER WITH AN INCH OR
TWO IN THE SE CORNER OF THE AREA...THEN TAPERING TO LESS THAN AN
INCH QUICKLY FARTHER NORTH. AFTER THAT...STILL KEEPING SOME LIGHT
SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES FOR NORTHERN SECTIONS THROUGH WEDNESDAY
NIGHT DUE TO UPSLOPE AND SLIGHT INSTABILITY. TAKING OUT POPS ON
THURSDAY NOW...AS SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE TOO FAR TO THE
NORTH.

AS THIS TROUGH FINALLY EXITS...IT LOOKS TO BE MUCH WARMER STARTING 
ON FRIDAY AND INTO THE WEEKEND.  A WEAK SYSTEM MAY BE APPROACHING BY 
THEN SUNDAY...BUT NOT INSERTING ANY POPS...JUST PUMPING UP THE SKY 
COVER IN THOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EST SUN FEB 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION ACROSS MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN 
THIS MORNING...WITH NOT IDEAL CONDITIONS FOR SNOW CRYSTAL GROWTH. 
THUS...PRECIPITATION HAS BEEN FALLING AS A MISTY DRIZZLE OR FREEZING 
DRIZZLE WITH LITTLE TO NO NEW SNOW ACCUMULATION. ENOUGH ICY TYPE TO 
CAUSE SOME PATCHY ICE ON BACK ROADS AND BRIDGES IN WASHINGTON CO VA 
AND JOHNSON CO TN...WHILE WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES REPORTED SOME 
VERY LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE OR SNOW EARLIER THIS MORNING. WILL WATCH 
SURFACE TEMPS IN THOSE AREAS...WITH LATEST TEMPS IN THE UPPER 20S TO 
AROUND 30 DEGREES. SHOULD BE ABLE TO LET OUR WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY 
EXPIRE AT NOON...WITH JUST A FEW DEGREES OF WARMING.

OTHERWISE...LOW CLOUD DECK HAS SPREAD SOUTHWARD AND OVER TAKEN THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THIS LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE MAY GET TRAPPED BELOW AN INVERSION AROUND 850 TO 750 MBS.
THUS...MAY NEED TO LOWER MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES...MORE IN LINE WITH 
THE COOLER NAM MOS.

WILL FRESHEN FORECAST GRIDS AND UPDATE ALL PRODUCTS BY 1130 AM EST 
OR SO.

189 
FXUS64 KMRX 280745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST SUN FEB 28 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LINGERING OVER THE NORTHEAST...WITH A LEE 
TROUGH EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO REMAIN QUASI- 
STATIONARY OFF THE NORTHEAST COAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH ANOTHER 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE ROTATING AROUND ITS PARENT UPPER LOW THIS 
MORNING. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT RADAR IMAGERY AND SURFACE OBS OVER 
EASTERN KY AND SOUTHWEST VA INDICATE THAT THE PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH 
THIS SHORT WAVE IS VERY LIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT MOST OF 
THE MOISTURE TODAY OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE SHALLOW AND MOSTLY 
LOCATED BELOW 850 MB AND BENEATH A STRONG MID LEVEL INVERSION. WITH 
THE PRECIP INITIATION REGION REMAINING LOCATED BETWEEN -5 AND -10 
CELSIUS...THINK THAT SUPERCOOLED WATER INSTEAD OF SNOW WILL BE 
POSSIBLE THIS MORNING. A PHONE CALL TO WISE COUNTY DISPATCH CONFIRMS 
THAT SOME BLACK ICE HAS BEEN REPORTED THIS MORNING...WITH SOME 
FREEZING DRIZZLE ALREADY OBSERVED IN A FEW AREAS IN EASTERN KY. 
THUS...WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VA 
AND THE MOUNTAINS THIS MORNING...AND WILL ALSO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME LIGHT FREEZING RAIN AND SOME LIGHT ICE ACCUMS. 
WITH PRECIP EXPECTED TO REMAIN MORE STRATIFORM THAN CONVECTIVE 
TODAY...DO NOT EXPECT MUCH UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT TO THE PRECIP ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS A RESULT...FEEL THAT ONLY AN INCH OR TWO 
OF SNOW ACCUMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT 
THIS MAY BE OPTIMISTIC IF FREEZING DRIZZLE LINGERS INSTEAD. THE MID 
LEVEL INVERSION OVER THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD KEEP CLOUDS FROM 
DIMINISHING TOO MUCH TODAY OR TONIGHT...SO WILL PLAN TO BE 
PESSIMISTIC WITH SKY CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL 
PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND THE COOLER NAM NUMBERS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN FOCUS FOR THE LONG 
TERM IS SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES IN THE LATE MONDAY NIGHT/EARLY
TUESDAY MORNING TIME FRAME AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY. MODELS ARE
NOW IN SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM...WITH TRACK OF
MAIN SURFACE LOW REMAINING WELL SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR FORECAST
AREA. HOWEVER...APPEARS NORTHERN/WESTERN FRINGE OF THIS SYSTEM
WILL BRUSH OUR FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY WITH RELATIVELY TIGHT POPS
GRADIENT FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST. EXPECT PRECIP TO GENERALLY BE
VERY LIGHT. UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT WILL CAUSE SCATTERED PRECIP TO
LINGER INTO THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. WITH
TEMPS REMAINING WELL BELOW CLIMO...APPEARS PRECIP TYPE WILL BE
PREDOMINATELY SNOW WITH THIS EVENT. BALANCE OF LONG TERM STILL
APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME... WITH TEMPS SLOWLY MODERATING TO NEAR
CLIMO AS EASTERN CONUS LONGWAVE TROUGH FINALLY DEAMPLIFIES.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 272032
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EST SAT FEB 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...LOW CLOUDS CONTINUE TO SINK 
SLOWLY SOUTH INTO THE REGION...WITH JUST SE TN AND SW NC STILL UNDER 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. HOWEVER...NOT MUCH MORE THAN A STRAY FLURRY NOTED
THIS AFTERNOON. INFRARED SATELLITE PICS DO SHOW AN ENHANCED AREA 
ROTATING SOUTH FROM EASTERN PARTS OF THE OHIO VALLEY...ON THE 
BACKSIDE OF THE LARGE UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER NY. MODELS BRING 
ANOTHER SLUG OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE (SHALLOW OVER ALL BUT SW VA AND 
EXTREME NE TN) OVERNIGHT AND DEVELOP SOME WEAK UPSLOPE FLOW. NOT 
TOTALLY SOLD ON MORE THAN A VERY LIGHT ACCUMULATION OF SNOW OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA INTO NE CORNER OF TN...AS SNOW GROWTH LOOKS 
QUESTIONABLE OUTSIDE OF THOSE AREAS...EVEN OVER SMOKIES.

HOWEVER...CAN'T RULE OUT AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW LATE TONIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY MORNING...AND AN ADVISORY FOR OUR FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS WILL 
ALSO MESH WELL WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. LOWERED POPS FOR EARLY THIS 
EVENING...THEN LIKELY FOR ADVISORY AREAS INTO SUNDAY MORNING. EXPECT 
DIMINISHING SNOW SHOWERS TO JUST FLURRIES IN THE AFTERNOON.

OTHERWISE...OPTED TO GO CLOSE TO MOS BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT GIVEN 
CLOUD COVER...AND STAYED CLOSER TO THE COOLER MAXES SW VA AND NE TN 
FOR SUNDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...BIG CHANGE STARTING 
FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGHINESS OVER THE EAST SUBSIDES...AND ALLOWS 
SOMEWHAT WARMER AIR TO WORK INTO THE AREA.  UNTIL THEN THERE ARE 
SEVERAL WAVES IN THIS COOL AND MODERATELY MOIST AIR MASS TO DEAL 
WITH FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.  

WEAK RIDGE TRIES TO BUILDING AS CURRENT TROUGH EXITS TO 
NORTHEAST...BUT NEXT TROUGH RACES INTO PLACE FOR THE MIDDLE PORTION 
OF THE WEEK.  SYSTEM ALONG GULF COAST ON MONDAY IS EXPECTED TO 
SPREAD LIGHT PRECIP IN THE AREA AS IT CUTS ITS WAY OVER TO THE 
ATLANTIC SEABOARD TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  WITH MOST OF THE MOISTURE 
HAVING TO COME OVER THE MOUNTAINS...THINK THAT PRECIP WILL BE VERY 
LIGHT OVERALL...WITH BEST AMOUNTS ALONG THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS.  PRECIP TYPE MAY BE AN ISSUE OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF 
THE AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS WARM AIR TRIES TO PENETRATE 
NORTHWARD.  FINALLY ON THURSDAY THIS SYSTEM WILL BE EXITING TO THE 
NORTHEAST.  THEN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY LOOK DRY AND FINALLY WARMER.

STAY PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS...ALTHOUGH WENT AT LEAST A 
CATEGORY COOLER FOR HIGHS ON TUESDAY...AND FOR THE NORTHEAST 1/2 OF 
THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY DUE TO THICKER CLOUD COVER.

.DISCUSSION...LIGHT SNOW BAND DROPPING SOUTH FROM SE KY AND SW VA

OF MOISTURE AND COLD ENOUGH FOR DECENT SNOW GROWTH...BUT OHX 
SOUNDING WAS EXTREMELY DRY. SOUNDINGS ALSO SHOW VERY LITTLE LOW 
LEVEL INSTABILITY TO HELP INITIATE MUCH SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY.

THUS...CURRENT FORECAST GRIDS ARE MOST LIKELY ON TRACK...ALTHO I 
WILL CONSIDER NUDGING POPS UP NEAR JKL...RLX AND RNK...IF LATEST 
RADAR TRENDS ALSO SUPPORT THIS DECISION. ANOTHER CHANCE OF SNOW 
OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY...AND I WILL RE-EVALUATE THIS AFTER VIEWING 
12Z MODEL DATA.

166 
FXUS64 KMRX 270745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST SAT FEB 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHEAST...WITH A LEE TROUGH 
EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO REMAIN QUASI-STATIONARY OVER 
THE NORTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH A FEW UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES 
ROTATING AROUND THE PARENT UPPER LOW. THE FIRST SHORT WAVE WAS 
APPROACHING SOUTHWEST VA EARLY THIS MORNING...BRINGING AN INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS AND SOME LIGHT SNOW. GFS AND NAM MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT THIS INITIAL SHORT WAVE WILL WEAKEN AFTER SUNRISE... 
WITH THE NEXT UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE PROGGED TO ROTATE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. MODELS SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT MOISTURE 
WILL BE TRAPPED BENEATH A STRONG MID LEVEL INVERSION ABOVE 850 MB... 
SO THINK THAT THIS SNOW WILL BE MORE STRATIFORM THAN CONVECTIVE IN 
NATURE. AS A RESULT...DO NOT EXPECT MUCH UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT TO THE 
SNOWFALL ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND WITH ONLY UP TO AN INCH 
OF SNOWFALL ACCUMS EXPECTED IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WILL NOT PLAN 
TO ISSUE ANY WINTER WX ADVISORIES FOR TODAY OR TONIGHT. CLOUDS 
SHOULD CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY INCREASE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHEAST 
RETROGRADES A LITTLE TO THE SOUTHWEST. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL 
PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE NAM NUMBERS WITH COOLER MAXES AND WARMER 
MINS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO THE 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK UPPER RIDGING BRIEFLY 
BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON MONDAY AFTER 
NORTHWEST CYCLONIC FLOW FINALLY ABATES BY LATE SUNDAY AS PERSISTENT 
UPPER LOW MIGRATES AWAY FROM THE NORTHEASTERN STATES. ANOTHER SYSTEM 
APPROACHES IN THE LATE MONDAY/EARLY TUESDAY TIME FRAME. STILL QUITE 
A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM AS A CONSENSUS OF THE MODELS 
AND ENSEMBLES KEEPS THE MAIN TRACK SOUTH OF OUR AREA. THE EXCEPTION 
IS THE GFS WHICH CONTINUES TO ADVERTISE PROLONGED EVENT AS UPPER 
CLOSED LOW LINGERS OVER THE REGION. HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY POPS FOR 
TUESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE NOT VERY HIGH AT THIS POINT. CONTINUED WITH 
DRY FORECAST THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM 
ALTHOUGH RATHER PROFOUND MODEL DISAGREEMENTS CONTINUE. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS 
FORECAST WITH THE EXCEPTION OF FAVORING COOLER OF GUIDANCE VALUES 
FOR THE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT PERIODS.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST FRI FEB 26 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SKIES HAVE REMAINED NEARLY 
CLOUD FREE THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHO TEMPS HAVE STRUGGLED TO WARM TO 
ANYWHERE NEAR THE WARMER MOS HIGHS FOR TODAY. LOW CLOUDS HAVE EASED 
BACK INTO PARTS OF SW VA AND EXTREME NE CORNER OF TN THIS AFTERNOON
...AND EXPECT CLOUDS TO INCREASE OVERNIGHT AS A VORTICITY LOBE 
ROTATES SE AROUND THE UPPER LOW OVER THE NEW ENGLAND STATES. LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE RETURNS TO ALL BUT SE TN AND SW NC LATE TONIGHT 
THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE ACROSS 
WISE...RUSSELL...AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES OF SW VA INTO NRN MTNS OF 
EAST TN. AMOUNTS MAY TOTAL UP TO ADVISORY RANGE BY LATE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON OR EVENING...BUT WILL DEFER ISSUANCE OF AN ADVISORY TO 
MIDNIGHT SHIFT...AS ACCUMULATING SNOW COULD EXTEND INTO SUNDAY.

OTHERWISE...WENT NEAR OR JUST BELOW A MOS BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT
AND TRENDED MUCH CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM MOS FOR SATURDAY HIGHS.

SHORT TERM CONCERN WAS OUR WIND ADVISORY...WHICH I HAVE OPTED TO 
CANCEL WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE AS GUSTS HAVE REMAINED BELOW 30 
KNOTS. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY...ANOTHER LOBE OF ENERGY SWINGS AROUND UPPER TROUGH ACROSS 
THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES INCREASING UPSLOPE MOISTURE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA...MAINLY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.
ANOTHER WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED FOR THESE AREAS.

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST 
FINALLY LIFTS EASTWARD ALLOWING A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD 
INTO THE AREA.

ANOTHER STRONG UPPER TROUGH WILL LIFT OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO THE TUESDAY. AT THE SAME TIME...ANOTHER NORTHERN 
STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. SOME DIFFERENCES IN HOW 
MUCH CYCLO-GENESIS OCCURS WITH SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE...BUT GFS SHOWS
STRONG SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING. PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE BACK INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY WITH MAINLY SNOW (POSSIBLY BEGINNING AS RAIN 
SOUTH AND CENTRAL). AMOUNTS IS STILL UNCERTAIN GIVEN UNCERTAINTY OF 
STRENGTH OF CYCLOGENESIS. 

DUE TO COLD 850MB TEMPERATURES...INCOMING PRECIPITATION AND CLOUDS 
HAVE TRENDED BELOW MEX MOS NUMBERS FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNEDSDAY.

FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES OUT WITH SNOW ENDING.

VERY LITTLE IF ANY SNOW SHOWERS ON AREA RADARS...AND 12Z SOUNDINGS 
ARE MUCH DRIER IN THE LOW LEVELS...SO WILL ALSO LOWER POPS ACROSS SW 
VA AND NE TN. WIND ADVISORY FOR NRN AND SMOKY MTNS LOOKS GOOD.

WILL MAKE THESE CHANGES AND UPDATE ZFPMRX AND WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 260730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 AM EST FRI FEB 26 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHEAST...WITH A LEE TROUGH 
EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO REMAIN QUASI-STATIONARY OVER 
THE NORTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW LINGERING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
THAT MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW AND LIMITED TODAY...WITH A STRONG MID 
LEVEL INVERSION ABOVE 850 MB. THUS...EXPECT LESS SNOW SHOWER 
ACTIVITY THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS...AND WILL PLAN TO LET THE WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS EXPIRE ON TIME AT 4 AM THIS MORNING. 
A TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION TODAY...AND 
EXPECT GUSTY WINDS TO DEVELOP BY THIS AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THAT 
SUSTAINED WIND SPEEDS MAY NOT BE STRONG ENOUGH FOR A WIND ADVISORY 
(GREATER THAN THE 25 MPH) OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. WHILE IT SHOULD 
BE A BREEZY DAY ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...WILL PLAN TO 
CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY FOR MOST OF NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. 
HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY UNTIL SUNSET ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED. WILL ALSO PLAN TO USE A LARGE LAPSE RATE TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THE COOLER TEMPS DUE TO SNOW COVER ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
WILL ROTATE AROUND PARENT UPPER LOW ON SATURDAY NIGHT AS UPPER LOW 
MEANDERS IN THE NEW ENGLAND AREA. THIS WILL RESULT IN DEEPER 
LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE AND THUS ENHANCE POPS IN FAVORED UPSLOPE 
LOCATIONS. UPPER RIDGING VERY BRIEFLY BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON 
MONDAY BEFORE ANOTHER TROUGH APPROACHES ON TUESDAY. STILL QUITE A 
BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM AS GFS PAINTS WIDESPREAD PRECIP 
ACROSS THE AREA WHILE GEFS ENSEMBLES KEEP MOST OF PRECIP SOUTH AND 
EAST. SLIGHTLY RAISED POPS FOR TUESDAY TO CHANCE EVERYWHERE WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY. KEPT REMAINDER OF 
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED COOLER OF 
GUIDANCE VALUES EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD BEFORE FOLLOWING MEX 
GUIDANCE CLOSELY FOR THE EXTENDED PORTION.

612 
FXUS64 KMRX 251931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EST THU FEB 25 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...PERSISTENT PATTERN OF
SNOW SHOWERS DROPPING SE FROM SE KY ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN THIS
AFTERNOON. LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW...COLD AIR ADVECTION AND SOME
WEAK INSTABILITY SHOULD LAST INTO THE EVENING HOURS...SO SOME
ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED IN THE WARNING AREAS OF
SW VA AND NRN MTNS OF EAST TN. DROPPED SMOKIES BACK TO A WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY (SIMILAR TO LEE AND SCOTT COUNTIES OF VA) AND
EXTENDED WARNING AND ADVISORY THROUGH 4 AM EST FRIDAY. WILL LET
LATER SHIFTS DECIDE TO CANCEL OR EXTEND INTO FRIDAY IF NEEDED.
SNOW AMOUNTS HAVE VARIED GREATLY FROM BARELY FLURRIES TO AN INCH OR
TWO OF NEW SNOW WHERE THE SNOW SHOWERS HAVE PASSED OVER.

PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS OVERNIGHT AND LOW LEVEL JET REACHES 40
TO 45 KNOTS...SO I ALSO ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TO 4PM
FRIDAY...FOR SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES.

OTHERWISE...EXPECT LESS SNOW SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY THEN A LIKELY
BREAK IN ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION...BEFORE ANOTHER SHORT WAVE
PASSES ACROSS THE REGION LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. 

SNOW ACCUMULATING TODAY AND TONIGHT PLUS SOME LINGERING CLOUDINESS
OVER SW VA AND NE TN...SUPPORTED UNDERCUTTING MAX TEMPS EVEN BELOW
THE COOLER NAM MOS. MOS MINS MORE REASONABLE AND I GENERALLY
FOLLOWED THE COLDER MINS. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS NOT 
SIGNIFICANTLY DISSIMILAR DURING THE PERIOD. STAYED CLOSER TO THE 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER AND DEEPER ECMWF SOLUTION WHICH KEEPS THE BLOCKING 
PATTERN IN PLACE WITH UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE STUCK OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. THE LOW DRIFTS ONLY SLOWLY EAST KEEPING A 
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW REGIME GOING ALL THE WAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS 
REGIME HIGHLIGHTS SNOW IN THE MAJOR OROGRAPHIC PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE TERRAIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. THERE COULD 
BE A BREAK IN THE ACTION ON MONDAY BEFORE THE JET STREAM GETS ACTIVE 
AGAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TIER OF THE NATION. SHORT WAVE DRIVES EAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. LATER MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT. JUST A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME CONCERNING THE TRACK 
AND STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE AND THE POSSIBILITY OF PHASING WITH 
NORTHERN STREAM ENERGY SO MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS AT 
THIS TIME. SYSTEM DEPARTS TO THE ATLANTIC COAST FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
HEIGHTS BUILD INTO THURSDAY SO KEPT THE LAST COUPLE DAYS OF THE 
EXTENDED DRY. THOUGHT IT BEST TO UNDERCUT TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT 
THIS FORECAST DUE TO THE LENGTHY PERIOD OF NORTHERLY FLOW ACROSS 
SNOW COVERED GROUND.

.AVIATION...NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW MACHINE AT WORK TODAY WITH SHORT
WAVE ENHANCEMENT. SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE WHICH
ARE LIMITING VSBY TO MVFR AND EVEN IFR AT TIMES IN LIGHT TO
MODERATE SNOW AT TRI AND TYS. NICE FLOW OF MOISTURE OFF THE GREAT
LAKES AND CEILINGS ARE DROPPING INTO MVFR RANGE IN AREAS OF BETTER
LIFT AT TYS AND TRI. THE UPPER LEVEL LOW WHICH IS DRIVING THE FLOW
PATTERN WILL GRADUALLY SLIP EAST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH THE
PERIOD WHICH WILL RESULT IN DECREASING MOISTURE AND BETTER FLIGHT
CONDITIONS. HOWEVER THE BEST FLYING WEATHER MAY NOT DEVELOP UNTIL
AFTER 14Z ON FRIDAY AS VFR CONDITIONS DOMINATE AT CHA AND TYS.
MAINTAINED MVFR CEILING AT TRI THROUGH THE TAF BUT THIS MAY LIFT
TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL LOW NOW CENTERED

INTO KY AND EAST TN. EXPECT THIS TO CONTINUE THROUGH MID AFTERNOON
SO ISSUED WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR A COUPLE INCHES OF SNOW FOR
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NORTH TN COUNTIES TO BLEND WITH ADVISORY IN
VA. ADDED RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IN VA AND NE TN MOUNTAIN
COUNTIES FOR EXPECTED HIGH ELEVATION SNOW TODAY AND TONIGHT TO
CURRENT WSW. ELSEWHERE EXPECT SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WITH DRY
POWDERY SNOW FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST VALLEY. SNOW SHOWERS
OVER THE SE TN VALLEY EXPECTING TO OCCUR A COUPLE MORE HOURS BEFORE
ENDING. TEMPERATURES EARLY THIS MORNING ARE IN THE UPPER TEENS
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 20S LOWER ELEVATIONS. HIGHS TODAY WILL STAY
MUCH BELOW NORMAL AND WENT NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW MET GUIDANCE.
SOME SUN SE TN WILL WARM TEMPERATURES HOPEFULLY TO THE LOWER 40S.
TONIGHT SNOW SHOULD END ACROSS ALL BUT THE MOUNTAINS AND NE TN AND
SW VA AS UPPER LOW AND MOISTURE SHIFTS NE. LOWS WILL CONTINUE TO BE
VERY COLD IN THE TEENS AND 20S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LARGE AND STACKED LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM REMAINS CENTERED NEAR SE NY THROUGH SAT NGT. 
CYCLONIC CURVATURE AND NW FLOW WILL PERSIST BRINGING SNOW SHOWERS 
ACROSS SW VA...NE TN AND SMOKYS FOR MUCH OF THE WEEKEND. PW VALUES 
RANGE FROM .25-30 WITH GOOD MOISTURE IN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION. 
INCREASED POPS NORTHERN AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. TEMPS A BIT BELOW 
GUIDANCE WITH GOOD SNOW PACK OVER SOURCE REGION. OVERALL LIGHT SNOW 
EXPECTED BUT FAVORABLE LOCATIONS COULD SEE FAIRLY HIGH ACCUMULATION 
OF GOOD FLUFF. WIND ADVSRY MAY BE NEEDED FRI FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AS WINDS REMAIN BREEZY. LOW PRESSURE BEGINS TO WEAKEN AND 
MOVE EAST SUNDAY. FLOW NO LONGER FAVORING SNOW BUT NEUTRAL OR CAA 
PERSISTS THROUGH MONDAY. UPPER TROF DEEPENS INTO W GLFMEX LATE 
MONDAY. SIGNIFICANT SFC LOW DEVELOPS OVR GLFMEX AND MOVES NE THROUGH 
FL ON TUE. GOOD SPREAD IN MODEL SOLUTIONS FOR THIS SYSTEM. HAVE 
BACKED OFF SOME ON PCPN CHC NEXT WEEK SINCE NW EXTENT OF PCPN SHIELD 
IN QUESTION.

WIND OF 20-25 KTS THAT WILL ENHANCE SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE MOUNTAINS.
IN THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS
CLEARING SKIES UPSTREAM OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN...SO ANY FLURRIES
THERE SHOULD END SHORTLY. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING COLDER
THAN FORECAST...AND WITH THE CLEARING IN THE SOUTH...TEMPS WILL
CONTINUE TO DROP THERE. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND
ADJUST TEMPS DOWNWARD SLIGHTLY. NO CHANGES TO THE ADVISORY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST WED FEB 24 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
FOR THE SHORT TERM...WITH UPPER TROUGH DIGGING IN...ALONG WITH A 
SURGE OF COLDER AIR. LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER PERIOD OF SNOW SHOWERS 
SETTING UP FOR THE AREA AS NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER THE 
AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD...WITH ACCUMULATING SNOWS EXPECTED FOR THE 
NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS.  AT THIS TIME...IT APPEARS THAT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN ALL BUT PERHAPS THE VERY HIGHEST ELEVATIONS ARE 
LIKELY TO STAY BELOW WARNING CRITERIA THROUGH THURSDAY...SO WILL 
REPLACE WINTER STORM WATCH WITH AN ADVISORY FOR NOW.  WILL STAY 
CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS FOR TONIGHT...BUT WILL UNDERCUT MAV NUMBERS FOR 
HIGHS THURSDAY.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT. THE 
DEEPEST MOISTURE LINGERS IN THE EVENING HOURS...SO WILL CONTINUE 
LIKELY POPS THE NORTHERN ZONES.  COULD SEE MORE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON THURSDAY EVENING.  UPPER LOW LINGERING 
TO THE NORTHERN BRINGING LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS ON 
BOTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN AREAS ON EARLY SUNDAY.  WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON 
TIMING...WILL CONTINUE THE DRY FORECAST GOING FOR SUNDAY. DRY 
WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE INTO MONDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE TRACKS 
INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY...WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
TUESDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 240924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EST WED FEB 24 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE CONTINUES
TRAPPED NEAR THE SURFACE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S. SOME PATCHY DRIZZLE
OCCURRED EARLIER BUT RADAR RETURNS SHOWING LIGHT RETURNS ACROSS SW
NC AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. MODELS SHOW SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM
MAINLY MOVING BY TO THE SOUTH TODAY WITH PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS FIRST AND THEN ALL AREAS BY LATE MORNING AND
AFTERNOON. COLD FRONT WITH ARCTIC AIR MASS NOW NEAR THE MS RIVER AND
LOWER OHIO RIVER. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES
IS DIVING SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND WILL DIG INTO THE TN
VALLEY LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. AS THE COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH
LATER TODAY WINDS WILL INCREASE OUT OF THE NW AND SNOW SHOWERS WILL
INCREASE OVER THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS. FOR HIGHS FOLLOWED THE
COLDER MAV GUIDANCE WITH SOME PLACES EVEN LOWER. HAVE REISSUED WSW
FOR TONIGHT BECAUSE CONFIDENCE STILL NOT HIGH ENOUGH THAT AMOUNTS
TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WILL REACH WARNING CRITERIA ALTHOUGH
THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS IN THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS AND SW VA SHOULD
SEE SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL AMOUNTS STARTING TONIGHT. LOWER
ELEVATIONS SHOULD SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS BY THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING ALTHOUGH NO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS WITH COLD CORE DOWN INTO SW VA. 700MB TEMPS AROUND -22C 
EARLY THU. VERY STEEP LAPSE RATE PEAK. MODELS AGREE ON SFC COMPUTED 
CAPE AROUND 30 J/KG BUT GFS POPS A BRIEF 80 IN THERE. 850MB NW FLOW 
INCREASING TO ABOVE 40 KTS. THESE FEATURES COUPLED WITH FAVORABLE 
UPSLOPE DIRECTION SHOULD PRODUCE PERIODS OF MODERATE SNOW SHOWERS 
ACROSS NE TN/SW VA AND THE SMOKYS. PWS REMAIN FAIRLY LOW AROUND .22 
BUT SNOW/LIQUID RATIOS SHOULD BE AOA 20. UPPER LOW SHIFTS NE INTO 
THE WEEKEND. SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES SLOWLY TAPER OFF THROUGH SAT. 
BREEZY NW WINDS WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY WEEKEND. GRADIENT OF SNOW
...WINDS...CLOUDS AND TEMPS WILL BE TIGHT WITH AREAS IN SOUTHERN 
CWA EXPERIENCING MAINLY COOLER THAN NORMAL CONDITIONS. WEAK RIDGING 
MOVES IN SUNDAY. BROAD UPPER TROF SLIDES THROUGH TX AND INTO THE 
GLFMEX NEXT WEEK. THIS DEVELOPS IMPRESSIVE SFC LOW THAT MOVES THRU 
FL AND OFFSHORE THE CAROLINAS BY END OF PERIOD. NEXT UPPER LOW WILL 
MOVE SE INTO THE TN VLY. THIS SHOULD DRAW CLOUDS AND PCPN NORTHWARD 
INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY TUE. BELOW NORMAL TEMPS THROUGH PERIOD.

667 
FXUS64 KMRX 240359
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
835 PM EST TUE FEB 23 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE MID 
ATLANTIC COAST...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY TOWARDS 
SUNRISE...BUT WILL NOT MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL AFTER 
SUNRISE. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING THAT A 
STRONG MID LEVEL INVERSION WILL LINGER OVER THE REGION TONIGHT. 
THUS...EXPECT LIMITED VERTICAL MIXING OF THE SATURATED LOW-LEVEL AIR 
MASS. WHILE SOME DRIZZLE (AND EVEN FREEZING DRIZZLE) WILL BE 
POSSIBLE TONIGHT...IT SHOULD REMAIN PATCHY IN NATURE AND NOT AFFECT 
TOO MANY AREAS. IN ADDITION...TEMPS SHOULD BE SLOW TO FALL TONIGHT 
WITH THE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER IN PLACE.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO TWEAK 
TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   34  45  25  43  25 /  10  40  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     33  42  24  36  22 /  10  50  30  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             33  42  22  37  22 /  10  40  30  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    31  40  23  31  22 /  10  50  60  60  30 
&&

241 
FXUS64 KMRX 231935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST TUE FEB 23 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...GFS/NAM/SREF REMAIN IN 
REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE 
REMAINS TRAPPED UNDER INVERSION AT LEAST THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS. THUS...DO NOT EXPECT MUCH CHANGE FROM THE PERSISTENT LOW 
OVERCAST AND OCCASIONAL DRIZZLE THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. LIGHT 
FREEZING DRIZZLE POSSIBLE IN SOME LOCATIONS AS TEMPS FALL TO NEAR OR 
BELOW FREEZING. SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM APPROACHES THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY BUT IS PROJECTED TO REMAIN MAINLY SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR 
AREA. DID CONTINUE CHANCE POPS ALONG THE EASTERN FRINGE AND 
NORTHEASTERN ZONES OF OUR FORECAST AREA HOWEVER WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS ELSEWHERE. FOR TEMPS...FAVORED BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES IN
THE FIRST PERIOD...AND FAVORED COOLER MET GUIDANCE VALUES IN THE
SECOND PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THEN CROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON THURSDAY. 
VERY COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL CREATE STEEP LAPSE RATES FOR SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE NORTHERN HALF OF OUR AREA...AND A 25-35 KT 850 MB 
WIND FROM THE NORTHWEST WILL PROVIDE ENHANCED LIFT IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT MOISTURE WILL EXTEND AS 
HIGH AS THE -20C LEVEL...SUFFICIENTLY DEEP FOR DENDRITE GROWTH. A 
LIMITING FACTOR WILL BE WEAK LARGE-SCALE DYNAMIC FORCING...WHICH 
MEANS THAT MOST SNOW ACCUMULATION WILL BE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN DUE 
TO UPSLOPE FLOW ENHANCEMENT. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS FOR SW VA AND THE 
TN MOUNTAINS...AND WILL ISSUE A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR THE SAME AREA 
FROM 00Z THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...USING A 
SNOW-LIQUID RATIO OF 15:1...3-6 INCHES LOOKS POSSIBLE IN HIGHER 
TERRAIN...WITH 1-2 IN LOWER ELEVATIONS OF NE TN AND SW VA. 

THE CLOSED LOW MOVES OVER NEW ENGLAND BY FRIDAY...WARMING TEMPS 
ALOFT SHOULD END ANY SNOW SHOWERS BY THEN. THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WILL REMAIN IN A PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. THE LATEST 
GFS BRINGS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AROUND THE CLOSED LOW THROUGH OUR AREA 
ON SATURDAY...BUT WILL WAIT FOR BETTER RUN-TO-RUN CONTINUITY BEFORE 
ADDING ANY PRECIP. THE GFS AND ECMWF DO AGREE ON A SOUTHERN STREAM 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH ON MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. WILL HAVE SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POPS DURING THIS TIME FRAME 
ACROSS THE AREA.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             34  46  25  43  25 /  10  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  30  42  24  36  22 /  10  20  30  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       31  43  22  37  22 /  10  20  30  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
650 AM EST TUE FEB 23 2010

.AVIATION...SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH EARLY WITH PATCHES OF DRIZZLE 
OR LIGHT RAIN. CIGS WILL BE IN THE MVFR CATEGORY. CLOUDS WILL LIFT 
SOME FOR THIS AFTERNOON TO HIGH END MVFR. WEST WINDS SHIFT TO THE NW 
TONIGHT AND CLOUDS DROP BACK TO LOWER MVFR. 

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WEAKLY
BUILDS IN THROUGH THE PERIOD. STRONG CAP NEAR 4500 FEET WILL KEEP
LOW CLOUDS TRAPPED TODAY AND MUCH OF TONIGHT. WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES
THROUGH TODAY WITH MINIMAL EFFECT ON OVERALL WEATHER. PATCHES OF
DRIZZLE ARE POSSIBLE. MODERATED TEMPERATURE RISE. SOUTHERN STREAM
JET INCREASES TONIGHT BUT MOVES NE TO EAST OF THE MRX CWA.
DEVELOPING UPPER LOW NW OF THE AREA...WITH AXIS TO THE WEST...COLD
AIR ADVECTION NOT THAT IMPRESSIVE. SOME PATCHES OF DRIZZLE WITH
FREEZING DRIZZLE POSSIBLE LATE. 850-700 MB LAYER REMAINS FAIRLY DRY
SO LIGHT SNOW DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A THREAT AT HIS TIME.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SOME ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT GRIDS AS A NRN AND SRN STREAM
SHORTWAVE TROUGH AFFECT THE REGION. MAIN SWATH OF PRECIPITATION IS
PROGD TO MOVE NE ACROSS GA AND THE CAROLINAS...FOLLOWED BY COLD AIR
ADVECTION AND DEVELOPMENT OF NW LOW LEVEL FLOW. INCREASED POPS FOR
THESE PERIODS...ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AS A STRONG VORT MAX
CLIPS THE SRN APPALACHIANS. SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE
IN THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS...MUCH IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS SNOW
AMOUNT GRIDS. 

OTHERWISE...UPPER FLOW FLATTENS AFTER THIS SYSTEM AND MODELS
SUGGEST A DRY PERIOD...WITH MOST PRECIPITATION STAYING TO OUR NORTH
AND ALSO OVER THE GULF COAST STATES. A STRONGER SRN STREAM SYSTEM
FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY IS ALSO INDICATED TO STAY TO OUR
SOUTH BY ECMWF. THUS...LITTLE CHANGES NEEDED FROM THURSDAY THROUGH
MONDAY FOR NOW.

&&

855 PM EST MON FEB 22 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR SLOWLY FILTERING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
CLOUDINESS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH AREA RADARS REVEALING 
ONLY VERY LIGHT ECHOES. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A SATURATED 
AIR MASS WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE NIGHT... 
WITH NOT MUCH UPPER-LEVEL LIFT EXPECTED WITHIN THE SOUTHWESTERLY 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW. THUS...THINK THAT DRIZZLE WILL BE THE RESULTING 
PRECIP TYPE OVERNIGHT. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE 
FORECAST TO MENTION AREAS OF DRIZZLE AND FOG FOR THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS. TEMP AND WIND FORECAST STILL APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR 
TONIGHT...AND WILL NOT CHANGE IN THE UPDATE.

721 
FXUS64 KMRX 221940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST MON FEB 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE IN REASONABLY 
GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. EASTERN CONUS LONG WAVE 
TROUGH BECOMES RE-ESTABLISHED. A FEW MINOR SHORT WAVES TRAVERSE 
THROUGH THE FLOW OF THE LONG WAVE TROUGH. HOWEVER... NORTHWEST 
CYCLONIC FLOW REMAIN RATHER WEAK. THUS NOT ANTICIPATING ANY 
SIGNIFICANT UPSLOPE EVENT IN THE SHORT TERM. DID KEEP POPS CONFINED 
MAINLY TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR 
COOLER MET GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL PASS TO OUR SOUTH ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. THE NAM AND GFS HAVE SOME 
DIFFERENCES WITH THIS FEATURE...BUT IT LOOKS LIKE THE BEST LIFT AND 
MOISTURE WILL STAY TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. WILL GO DRY FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT. A MUCH MORE SIGNIFICANT NORTHERN STREAM CLOSED LOW APPROACHES 
FROM THE NORTHWEST ON WEDNESDAY. LARGE SCALE Q-G FORCING AHEAD OF 
THE LOW WILL PROVIDE SOME WEAK LIFT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...MAINLY 
ACROSS OUR NORTHERN SECTIONS. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS NORTH WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON.

THE CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL BE TRACKING ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THURSDAY...BRINGING A SURGE OF COLD AIR ALOFT 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE RESULTING STEEP LAPSE RATES AND NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW AT 850 MB WILL HELP TO GENERATE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS 
AND NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE FOR NOW AS MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE FAIRLY LIMITED. TEMPERATURES 
WILL ONCE AGAIN DROP WELL BELOW NORMAL...WITH HIGHS THURSDAY IN THE 
30S NORTH AND CENTRAL WITH 40S IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. 

AS THE LOW MOVES OVER NEW ENGLAND ON FRIDAY AND BECOMES NEARLY 
STATIONARY...WE SHOULD BEGIN TO SEE DRIER CONDITIONS AND A SLIGHT 
WARMING TREND. HOWEVER THE EASTERN CONUS WILL REMAIN UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF A LONGWAVE TROUGH AND THE UPPER JET WILL STAY TO OUR 
SOUTH...SO TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. CONFIDENCE IS LOW REGARDING THE POSITION OF THE CLOSED LOW 
AND ANY SHORTWAVES MOVING AROUND IT...SO WILL KEEP THE LAST FEW DAYS 
OF THE FORECAST PERIOD DRY.


&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BEST UPPER SUPPORT AND FORCING
CURRENTLY OVER MRX CWA. SPEED MAX WILL MOVE OFF EARLY TODAY.

DOWN WITH PCPN...THEN MILD WARM UP IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT. COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH LATE THIS AFTERNOON. SOME SHOWER ACTIVITY 
REMAINS POSSIBLE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. POST FRONTAL COOLING COMES 
IN VERY LATE IN PERIOD. MOISTURE BECOMES SHALLOW BY THEN SO WINTRY 
PCPN DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A THREAT TONIGHT. WILL LIKELY ISSUE A 
EARLY MORNING UPDATE TO LOWER POPS AND POSSIBLY CANCEL MNT WIND 
ADVSRY AS LOW LEVEL JET SHIFT NE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL ONCE 
AGAIN SETTLE OVER THE REGION FOR THE EXTENDED.  A SERIES OF SHORT 
WAVES AND WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARIES WILL PUSH THROUGH EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD.  THESE ARE WEAK...BUT AIDED BY ENHANCED LIFT FROM NORTHWEST 
FLOW...WILL GENERATE OCCASIONAL LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES OVER NORMALLY 
FAVORED NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN TUESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY.  THE UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY...PUTTING US BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS FOR THE WEEKEND AND WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FRIDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY.  TEMPERATURES WILL STAY BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  37  49  32  45 /  30  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  37  46  29  45 /  60  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  35  46  31  42 /  50  20  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  35  46  28  41 /  90  20  10  20  20 

&&

NC...NONE.

     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...

FXUS64 KMRX 220118
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
820 PM EST SUN FEB 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
OZARKS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE 
LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A PRE-FRONTAL LINE 
OF CONVECTION AHEAD OF THIS FRONT ACROSS LA AND MS...WITH THE 
NORTHERN EDGE OF THE LIGHTNING STRIKES OCCURRING AROUND THE SOUTHERN 
TN BORDER. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL SOME WEAK ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN LATER TONIGHT...SO WILL PLAN TO ADD A CHANCE OF 
THUNDER FOR SOUTHEAST TN. THESE SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL A STABLE 
BOUNDARY LAYER STRENGTHENING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
SOUTHERLY WINDS ALSO INCREASING AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING FRONT. AS A 
RESULT...THINK THAT SOME MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL BE POSSIBLE AROUND THE 
FOOTHILLS OF THE MOUNTAINS LATER TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY AROUND SUNRISE 
AS A DECENT 850 MB JET (AROUND 50 KT) APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS SCENARIO. OTHERWISE...PRECIP TIMING AND TEMP 
FORECAST STILL APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT...SO WILL ONLY MAKE 
A FEW MINOR TWEAKS BASED ON THE CURRENT TRENDS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST SUN FEB 21 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT TRACKS FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS NORTHEAST 
TO NEAR LAKE ERIE BY END OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD...BRINGING A COLD 
FRONT INTO OUR AREA.  BULK OF PRECIP SHOULD COME THROUGH LATE 
TONIGHT/EARLY MONDAY...THEN MAY BE A FEW SHOWERS AROUND AS FRONT 
MOVES IN LATER IN THE DAY.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL THE PRECIP 
TO FALL AS RAIN THROUGH MONDAY.  COULD BE A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER 
IN THE SOUTH LATE TONIGHT...BUT FOR NOW WILL LEAVE OUT AS ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY LOOKS VERY LIMITED AT BEST.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO JUST A FEW TWEAKS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...EASTERN CONUS LONG WAVE 
TROUGH WILL BECOME RE-ESTABLISHED THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM. 
THIS WILL RESULT IN A RETURN TO NORTHWEST CYCLONIC FLOW FOR THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. A SERIES OF NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE 
TROUGHS WILL TRANSLATE THROUGH NORTHWEST FLOW KEEPING LOW POPS GOING 
MAINLY FOR THE FAVORED UPSLOPE LOCATIONS. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD 
BE LIMITED WITH MARGINAL TEMPS EXCEPT POTENTIALLY ON THE MOUNTAIN 
PEAKS. KEPT LATTER PORTION OF LONG TERN DRY AS UPSLOPE FLOW 
COMPONENT RELAXES. TEMPS PROJECTED TO BE GENERALLY BELOW CLIMO 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM WITH A SLOW RECOVERY BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. 
GENERALLY TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER OF GUIDANCE VALUES.

FXUS64 KMRX 211131
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
630 AM EST SUN FEB 21 2010

.AVIATION...LIGHT WINDS AND CIRRUS FOR MUCH OF TODAY. CLOUDS LOWER 
AFT 22/00Z. MID DECK CIGS CONTINUE TO LOWER THRU 22/03Z. LIGHT RAIN 
BEGINS AROUND 22/06Z. BY END OF PERIOD...CIGS/VSBY APPROACH MVFR AS 
RAIN INCREASES IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY 
POSSIBLE NEAR CHA LATE BUT CHC TOO LOW TO MENTION AT THIS TIME. 

&& 

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE NE 
FROM TX TODAY TO W TN TONIGHT. DEVELOPING SFC LOW WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE MS RVR VLY TO THE WESTERN OH RVR VALLEY. ATTENDANT COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN LATE IN THE PERIOD. HIGH CLOUDS STREAM 
ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. TEMPS WILL WARM A FEW DEGREES OVER SATURDAY 
READINGS. MOISTURE TRANSPORT AND WAA MODERATELY STRONG IN THE 
850-600MB LAYER TONIGHT. THIS COINCIDES WITH GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE 
EAST OF SHORT WAVE. PRECIPITATION WILL ADVANCE ACROSS ENTIRE CWA BY 
LATE TONIGHT. MIN TEMPS WILL LIKELY OCCUR AROUND MIDNIGHT...THEN 
BECOME STEADY OR RISE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING 
THROUGH THE AREA EARLY MONDAY FOR WIDESPREAD RAIN EARLY.  COVERAGE 
WILL DECREASE TO SCATTERED SHOWERS MONDAY AFTERNOON...BEHIND THE 
FRONT.  SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO MONDAY NIGHT WITH RAIN SLOWLY 
MIXING WITH THEN CHANGING OVER TO LIGHT SNOW.  AN UPPER TROUGH 
SLIDING IN BEHIND THE FRONT WILL PULL IN ANOTHER ROUND OF SEASONALLY 
COLD TEMPERATURES.  ADDITIONALLY...NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
GENERATE OCCASIONAL LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES OVER NORMALLY FAVORED 
NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY.  THERE REMAINS SOME DISCREPANCY IN MODELS BUT BELIEVE A 
WEAK UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL TRY TO BUILD IN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY FOR 
A BRIEF RETURN TO DRY WEATHER AND MODERATING TEMPERATURES.  



&&

NIGHT. APPEARS THIS FEATURE WILL PLACE THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION INTO ANOTHER PROLONGED CYCLONIC NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW REGIME 
AS UPPER LOW DRIFTS ONLY VERY SLOWLY EASTWARD JUST NORTH OF OUR 
AREA. THUS INCLUDED SOME ELEVATION-DEPENDENT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THROUGH THURSDAY. KEPT REMAINDER OF FORECAST DRY FOR NOW ALTHOUGH 
UPSLOPE FLOW REGIME PROJECTED TO PERSIST INTO NEXT WEEKEND. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER OF GUIDANCE VALUES AS WELL 
BELOW CLIMO TEMPS RETURN.

TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATION MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  
MODELS AND RUN CONSISTENCY POOR FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  
CONFIDENCE LOW...BUT MAY SEE A SHORT WAVE FROM THE SOUTH TRACK INTO 
THE CAROLINAS ON WEDNESDAY.  THIS COULD EFFECT THE MRX CWA...BUT FOR 
NOW WILL ONLY INTRODUCE LOW POPS OVER OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  
ANOTHER FRONT COMES IN FROM OUR NORTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY.  
THIS FEATURE SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR NORTH AND SHOWS LITTLE MOISTURE OR 
LIFT OVER OUR AREA.  WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR NOW THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.  OTHERWISE...UPPER TROUGH MOVING IN BEHIND THE FRONT WILL 
AGAIN BRING TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH IN CONTROL THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM FOR CONTINUED WARMING TREND AND DRY CONDITIONS.  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD CLIMB TO ABOVE SEASONAL NORMS BY SUNDAY WITH 
HIGHS EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE MID 50S NORTHERN VALLEY TO MID 60S 
IN THE SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE MAIN WEATHER SYSTEM 
OF THE EXTENDED WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY...BRINGING WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION INTO THE AREA.  WITH WARM 
TEMPS IN PLACE...PRECIP TO REMAIN RAIN THROUGH MONDAY.  BEHIND THE 
SYSTEM...COOLER AIR WILL SLIDE IN AND A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL 
LINGER OVER THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...POSSIBLY MIXING WITH OR CHANGING 
TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATION MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  
MODELS AND RUN CONSISTENCY POOR FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  
CONFIDENCE LOW...BUT MAY SEE A SHORT WAVE FROM THE SOUTH TRACK INTO 
THE CAROLINAS ON WEDNESDAY.  THIS COULD EFFECT THE MRX CWA...BUT FOR 
NOW WILL ONLY INTRODUCE LOW POPS OVER OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  
ANOTHER FRONT COMES IN FROM OUR NORTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY.  
THIS FEATURE SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR NORTH AND SHOWS LITTLE MOISTURE OR 
LIFT OVER OUR AREA.  WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR NOW THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.  OTHERWISE...UPPER TROUGH MOVING IN BEHIND THE FRONT WILL 
AGAIN BRING TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST FRI FEB 19 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SIGNIFICANT WARM-UP 
CONTINUES THROUGH THE EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM WITH TEMPS 
PROJECTED TO BE WELL ABOVE CLIMO ON SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY AS 
APPROACHING TROUGH INDUCES UPPER RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. THIS WILL BE RELATIVELY SHORT LIVED HOWEVER AS 
UPPER TROUGH AND ACCOMPANYING SURFACE COLD FRONT PROGRESS EASTWARD 
AND THROUGH THE REGION BY MONDAY. HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY POPS SUNDAY 
NIGHT...AND INTO MONDAY FOR THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AS SYSTEM
TRAVERSES THE AREA. KEPT BALANCE OF FORECAST AFTER TUESDAY DRY IN
SPITE OF GFS PROJECTION OF A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WHICH
APPROACHES ON WEDNESDAY. THIS IS NOT DEPICTED IN THE ECMWF MODEL
AND TENDED TO FAVOR ITS SOLUTION FOR CONSISTENCY SAKE. HOWEVER...
SOME OF THE GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SUPPORT THE GFS...AND SUBSEQUENT
RUNS MAY REQUIRE THE INTRODUCTION OF POPS FOR MID WEEK. FOR TEMPS...
TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER OF GUIDANCE VALUES EARLY IN THE LONG TERM
AND TENDED TO UNDERCUT MEX GUIDANCE AFTER PASSAGE OF THE EARLY WORK
WEEK SYSTEM AS THEY APPEAR GENERALLY TOO WARM GIVEN THE EXPECTED
SCENARIO.

LONG TERM IS UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE FRONT WHICH APPROACHES THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE LATE SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY TIME 
FRAME. DOES NOT APPEAR THIS SYSTEM WILL BE VERY SIGNIFICANT AT THIS 
TIME. NEVERTHELESS...DID BUMP UP POPS TO LIKELY FOR MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. ALSO APPEARS THIS WILL BE PRIMARILY 
A RAIN EVENT WITH BRIEF WARMING TEMP TREND.

SHORTWAVE SKIRTS TO OUR NORTH ON SATURDAY...BUT HAS VERY LITTLE 
MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. DID CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS 
IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES FOR LATE SATURDAY BASED ON SREF TRENDS. 
ALSO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS FOR TUESDAY ON 
THE BACKSIDE OF DEPARTING EARLY WORK WEEK SYSTEM. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE. OTHER 
THAN POSSIBLY MONDAY IN BRIEF WARMING TREND REGIME...TEMPS ARE 
PROJECTED TO REMAIN BELOW CLIMO AS HEIGHT ANOMALIES REMAIN NEGATIVE 
WITH EASTERN CONUS LONG WAVE TROUGH PERSISTING FOR THE FORESEEABLE 
FUTURE.

717 
FXUS64 KMRX 180855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST THU FEB 18 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ATMOSPHERE IS IN THE PROCESS OF 
TRANSITIONING FROM THE NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME INTO A DRIER MORE ZONAL 
CONFIGURATION IN THE SHORT TERM. HOWEVER...JUST ENOUGH MOISTURE AND 
WEAKENING INSTABILITY ALONG WITH OROGRAPHIC LIFT TO GENERATE SOME 
LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...EXTREME 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. 
EXTENDED THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH MID DAY FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER INCH OF TWO OF ACCUMULATION IN THIS HIGHER 
TERRAIN REGION. A CHECK OF THE SATELLITE IMAGE WITH RAPIDLY CLEARING 
SKIES OUT TO THE WEST MAKES IT APPEAR THAT SKIES MAY GO PARTLY 
CLOUDY FOR A FEW HOURS ACROSS MUCH OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS WELL 
AS CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE TODAY. MODELS HINT AT ANOTHER WEAK WAVE 
POSSIBLY GENERATING MORE STRATO CU THIS AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING 
SO KEPT MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA MOSTLY CLOUDY HOWEVER THIS WILL 
HAVE TO BE MONITORED AS THE SKY CONDITION MAY END UP BEING MORE 
OPTIMISTIC. THE LIGHT SNOW MACHINE SHOULD BE ABOUT OUT OF GAS 
TONIGHT BUT MAY BE ABLE TO PRODUCE A FLURRY OR TWO IN THE HIGHEST 
TERRAIN SO KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SNOW SHOWERS HERE. FOR TEMPS 
STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAXES WHILE GENERALLY 
UNDERCUTTING MINS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL 
BE CROSSING THE AREA ON FRIDAY...AND SHOULD PROVIDE ABUNDANT 
SUNSHINE AND RELATIVELY MILD TEMPERATURES COMPARED TO WHAT WE HAVE 
HAD LATELY. AS THE RIDGE AXIS MOVES TO OUR EAST...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
WILL APPROACH AND BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR LATE FRIDAY 
NIGHT/SATURDAY. LIFT IS QUITE WEAK AND MAINLY TO OUR NORTH. TIMING 
OF THE TROUGH IN THE LATE NIGHT/EARLY MORNING WILL MEAN THE PRECIP 
MAY BE SNOW...BUT IT SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT WITH LITTLE IF ANY 
ACCUMULATION. 

THE LATEST ECMWF IS DRIER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS FOR SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT...MORE IN LINE WITH THE GFS IN SHOWING A DRY ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT. SO WILL REMOVE THE POPS FROM THAT TIME PERIOD. MEANWHILE 
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BEGINS TO TAKE SHAPE OVER THE PLAINS. THIS 
SYSTEM WILL TRACK EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH MONDAY. 
POSITIVE THETA-E ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR SUNDAY...WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS BY SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE 
850 MB LOW MOVES ACROSS KY. A 45 KT 850 MB JET FROM THE SOUTHWEST 
WILL PROVIDE AMPLE WARM ADVECTION FOR AN ALL-RAIN EVENT. THE 
TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON MONDAY...BRINGING A RETURN OF 
COLDER TEMPS FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS 
MAY ALSO BE POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY BEHIND THE FRONT...BUT 
MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  27  54  30  54 /   0  10   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  24  50  30  50 /  10  10   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       42  24  50  30  50 /  10  10   0  10  10

GRIDS...AND UPDATE WEB PRODUCTS AND GRAPHICS IN THE NEXT HOUR OR SO.

270 
FXUS64 KMRX 172017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EST WED FEB 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...YET ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE 
WILL AFFECT AT LEAST NORTHERN AREAS TONIGHT...AND WITH NORTHWEST 
FLOW OF COLD AIR CONTINUING WILL EXTEND WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR 
SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH TONIGHT FOR THE AREAS WHERE IT IS ALREADY IN 
EFFECT.  SHOULD SEE SNOW SHOWERS ENDING ON THURSDAY...AND CLOUDS 
SHOULD BE DIMINISHING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DURING THE DAY.  
WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS TONIGHT...BUT WILL UNDERCUT THEM A 
BIT FOR THURSDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY WEAK RIDGING WILL BRING A DRY PERIOD FINALLY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED JUST TO THE SOUTH OF 
TN. LOWS WILL STILL BE COLD IN THE 20S WITH CLEARING SKIES AND LIGHT 
WINDS. FRIDAY DRIER AIRMASS BRINGS MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND MUCH 
WARMER TEMPERATURES WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 40S TO LOWER 50S. FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY A WEAK SYSTEM PASSES THROUGH THE REGION WITH SOME 
LIGHT SNOW OR RAIN LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY MAINLY THE 
COLDER NORTHERN PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS COLDER NE VALLEYS. 
LATER SATURDAY MORNING OR AFTERNOON PRECIPITATION SHOULD CHANGE TO 
ALL RAIN. ONLY LIGHT AMOUNTS EXPECTED. NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN LATE 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH RAIN IN MOST LOCATIONS AS UPPER AIR 
PATTERN STAYS MORE ZONAL. LOW PRESSURE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP IN THE 
LOWER MS VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MOVE NE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY 
AS IT MOVES OUT INTO THE ATLANTIC BY TUESDAY MORNING IT WILL DEEPEN 
TROUGH OVER THE TN VALLEY AND PULL MORE COLD AIR INTO THE REGION 
WITH SNOW POSSIBLE AGAIN IN THE VALLEYS. THINK ACCUMULATING SNOW 
WILL BE MOSTLY SW VA AND E TN MOUNTAINS DUE TO UPSLOPE FLOW MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH ONLY TRACE AMOUNTS LOWER ELEVATIONS. 
HIGHS SUNDAY AND MONDAY WARMER NEAR 40 NORTH TO AS WARM AS MID 50S 
AT CHA BUT COOLING TO BELOW NORMAL MID 30S TO MID 40S BY TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY AS UPPER TROUGH SETTLES BACK IN. LOWS WILL BE ABOVE 
FREEZING LOWER ELEVATIONS FOR A COUPLE NIGHTS BEFORE DROPPING BACK 
INTO THE 20S.

893 
FXUS64 KMRX 170836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST WED FEB 17 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EXCELLENT CONDITIONS FOR 
OROGRAPHIC SNOW PRODUCTION AGAIN TODAY WITH CONTINUATION OF 
NORTHWEST FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF NEW ENGLAND UPPER LOW. THE FLOW 
WILL YIELD A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVE FEATURES TO ENHANCE SNOW. THE 
FIRST WILL MOVE IN DURING THE DAY WHEN LAPSE RATE STRENGTHENS WITH 
FRIGID AIR ALOFT. STAYED WITH THE ADVISORY TO HIGHLIGHT BETTER 
ACCUMULATION IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. IN THESE AREAS AMOUNTS 
COULD TOTAL 3 TO 4 INCHES WITH LESSER AMOUNTS BELOW 2500 FT. WENT 
CLOSER TO COLDER MET MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS TODAY WITH BKN-OVC LAYER 
LIMITING INSOLATION IN HEALTHY CAA. OROGRAPHIC SNOWFALL SHOULD BE 
SOMEWHAT LIGHTER TONIGHT TRENDING TOWARD THE FAR EAST TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS AS THE NORTHEAST STATES UPPER LOW GRADUALLY PULLS AWAY.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT BEGINS 
TO DECREASE ON THURSDAY AS AN UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD OVER THE 
AREA. THERE MAY STILL BE SOME MOISTURE AVAILABLE IN THE LINGERING 
NORTHWEST FLOW...SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AND SW VA. FRIDAY LOOKS DRY AS THE RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
BUILD. 

A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY 
MORNING...AND WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WITH THIS FEATURE. THE 
FLOW ALOFT IS NEARLY ZONAL THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN BECOMES 
MORE AMPLIFIED SUNDAY AS LOW PRESSURE TRACKS FROM THE PLAINS TO THE 
OHIO VALLEY. ADVECTION OF WARM/MOIST AIR WIL BRING POPS IN AS EARLY 
AS SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT THE HIGHEST POPS WILL BE SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY 
AS THE LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. MOST OF THIS EVENT LOOKS 
TO BE RAIN...BUT THERE MAY BE SOME SNOW MONDAY NIGHT ON THE TAIL END 
BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT BUT AHEAD OF THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS.

598 
FXUS64 KMRX 170225
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST TUE FEB 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. ILN SOUNDING AND SAT PIC CLOUD
TOPS NEAR -16C. H85 TRAJECTORY OFF LAKE MI. SREF ENSEMBLES NEAR 90%
FOR CONTINUED LIGHT SNOW. WILL LEAVE ADVSRY IN PLACE FOR LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS. WINDS MAY HOLD UP TEMPS A BIT AND FCST MIN MAY
BE A DEGREE OR TWO ON THE COOL SIDE BUT TO CLOSE FOR UPDATE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO PULL 
WEAK IMPULSES INTO THE REGION AND NO CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  THEREFORE...EXPECT CONTINUED COLD 
TEMPERATURES AND OCCASIONAL LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES THROUGHOUT THE 
AREA.  SOME ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED OVER MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS... ESPECIALLY OVER 
FAVORED NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL ENHANCE 
SNOWFALL.  A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THESE AREAS 
THROUGH 23Z WEDNESDAY.  

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PERSISTENT PATTERN OF 
CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT...W-NW LOW LEVEL WINDS...COLD AIR ADVECTION AND 
LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL SET THE STAGE FOR PROLONGED SNOW 
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES INTO THURSDAY...ACROSS NORTHERN HALF OF E TN AND 
SW VA.  SOME VERY LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS STILL POSSIBLE IN OUR 
FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS...AND WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES MAY NEED AN 
EXTENSION OUT TO 12Z THURSDAY OR SO.

GFS AND ECMWF START TO DIVERGE AS EARLY AS FRIDAY...AND EVEN MORE SO 
WITH THE PATTERN BY SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY...THUS CONFIDENCE BEGINS TO 
DROP SHARPLY WITH TIME.  UPPER LEVEL FLOW FLATTENS BY FRIDAY AND I 
STILL FIND SOME AGREEMENT WITH MODELS ON A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH...COMING OUT OF THE CENTRAL PLAINS...AND PRODUCING A BRIEF 
SHOT OF LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW FOR THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS.
TIMED THIS SYSTEM FOR MAINLY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY FOR NOW.

EARLIER HPC PROGS WERE ALMOST PURE ECMWF MODEL...ALTHO GFS AND ECMWF 
DIFFER STRONGLY WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM FOR SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY. 12Z 
GFS RUN IS FASTER AND HAS NEW DAY 7 (TUESDAY) DRY...WHILE ECMWF IS 
MUCH MORE AMPLIFIED AND SLOWER...KEEPING MORE CLOUDS AND A CHANCE OF 
SNOW FOR TUESDAY.  THUS...WENT FOR A BIT OF A BLEND FOR NOW...ALTHO 
BOTH SOLUTIONS WOULD OFFER UP SOME LOW LEVEL WARMING FOR MONDAY AND 
A MOSTLY RAIN EVENT INITIALLY...BEFORE A CHANCE OF SNOW ON THE 
BACKSIDE AS THE SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE REGION.  OPTED FOR A DRY 
TUESDAY FOR NOW.

FOR TEMPS...TRENDED BELOW GFSX MOS AND HPC VALUES...ESPECIALLY 
EARLIER IN THE EXTENDED...DUE TO A LIKELY FAIR AMOUNT OF SNOW COVER 
FROM HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF EAST TN NORTH INTO SW VA.  EXTENDED 
CLOUDINESS PER SOUNDINGS AS THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LOOKS TO GET 
TRAPPED BELOW AN INVERSION...WITH A COOL NW LOW LEVEL FLOW...BOTH 
SUPPORTING COOLER THAN GUIDANCE MAX TEMPS.  TRENDED MORE IN LINE 
WITH MOS BY SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   24  40  25  46  25 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     22  36  24  41  25 /  40  40  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             22  36  23  41  24 /  40  30  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    19  31  22  36  22 /  40  40  20  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EST TUE FEB 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. TODAY...LOW LEVEL CAPE VALUES OF 40-60 J/KG ALONG WITH LAPSE 
RATES NEAR 10 C/KM WILL GENERATE SNOW SHOWERS...AND A 20 KT W-NW 
FLOW WILL ENHANCE THE SHOWERS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS MAY REACH UP TO 2 INCHES IN THE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA...WITH LESS THAN 1 INCH IN THE PLATEAU AND LOWER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN. WILL EXTEND THE ADVISORY TO 00Z THIS 
EVENING FOR SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS. IN THE TN VALLEY...ISOLATED 
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES CAN BE EXPECTED WITH NO ACCUMULATIONS. SKIES 
SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...AND WILL HAVE 
TEMPS BELOW MOS GUIDANCE TODAY. 

A CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...BUT MOISTURE DEPTH WILL BE DECREASING. SO A CHANCE OF SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES WILL REMAIN ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS...BUT 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT. BY THURSDAY THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER 
NEW ENGLAND WILL PUSH FARTHER EAST AND AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD 
OVER THE AREA...ENDING ANY CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY DURING THE LONG TERM FORECAST PERIOD
AS MODELS DISSIMILAR IN SOLUTIONS WITH ECMWF A LITTLE FASTER AND
MORE AMPLIFIED THAN GFS. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST
WHILE ADDING SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AS MODELS DEPICT AT LEAST A
COUPLE OF SHORTWAVE FEATURES DURING THE PERIOD WITH A FRONTAL ZONE
SETTING UP IN THE VICINITY OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT
THROUGH MONDAY WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY PRESSING EAST ACROSS THE MID
SOUTH. PRECIP TYPE UNCERTAIN DURING THE PERIOD WITH SOME SNOW
POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS THE NORTH WITH
BETTER POSSIBILITY OF RAIN ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. TWEAKED
TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY HIGHER CLOSER TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE AND
NEIGHBORING WFOS.

441 
FXUS64 KMRX 152010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST MON FEB 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...THE COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED OUT OF 
THE AREA...BUT THE ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH WILL CONTINUE 
TO ROTATE A SERIES OF IMPULSES THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE SHORT 
TERM.  EXPECT ANOTHER ROUND OF SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL SLIDE 
IN OVERNIGHT...GENERATING ADDITIONAL MINOR ACCUMULATIONS.  VALLEY 
LOCATIONS COULD SEE A TRACE TO A HALF INCH WITH A FEW BANDS NEAR AN 
INCH POSSIBLE.  HIGHER TERRAIN OF UP TO AN INCH WITH LOCAL 2 INCHES 
POSSIBLE.  WILL KEEP CURRENT WSW IN PLACE WHILE ACCUMULATING 
SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED.  ON TUESDAY...ANOTHER IMPULSE TRACK THROUGH.  
THIS ALONG WITH UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD BRING LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TO THE 
EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  ADDITIONALLY...BEHIND THE 
FRONT...GUSTY WINDS WILL PULL IN ANOTHER BLAST OF COLD AIR...KEEPING 
TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...EARLY PERIODS OF THE 
EXTENDED WILL FEATURE A PATTERN THAT HAS PERSISTED FOR MUCH OF THIS 
WINTER SEASON...1) CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT...2) MODERATE TO STRONG COLD 
AIR ADVECTION IN THE LOW LEVELS...AND 3) LINGERING LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE.  THUS...EXPECT SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS IN THE FAVORED 
UPSLOPE AREAS AND ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES JUST ABOUT 
ANYWHERE ELSE AT TIMES INTO THURSDAY.  NUDGED POPS UP A BIT IN THE 
UPSLOPE AREAS NEXT TO NEIGHBORING OFFICES...MAINLY FOR TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND ADDED SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN 
THESE AREAS.  BY THURSDAY...MOISTURE LOOKS TO BECOME QUITE SHALLOW 
AND THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES VERY BRIEFLY NEARLY ZONAL...SO SHOULD 
TREND TO JUST FLURRIES AT THAT TIME. 

HOWEVER...BEYOND THURSDAY...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES BEGIN TO DIVERGE 
ENOUGH THAT CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON HOW LONG OF A PERIOD A DRY FORECAST 
IS IN ORDER.  GFS AND ECMWF BOTH SHOW A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING EAST 
FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS LATE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...ALTHO TIMING AND 
STRENGTH DIFFERS...AS DOES THE AREA AND EXTENT OF ASSOCIATED 
PRECIPITATION (PCPN).  SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL WARMING TO ALLOW FOR A 
MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW SOUTH TO MOSTLY SNOW NORTH.  ADDED CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS THE REGION ON SATURDAY FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...KEPT SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MOST OF SUNDAY NIGHT DRY...
WITH YET ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM INDICATED BY MONDAY.  THIS 
SYSTEM LOOKS TO TAP MORE GULF MOISTURE AND ALSO SOME WARMER AIR.
KEPT MAX TEMPS A LITTLE BELOW GFSX MOS...UNTIL THIS SOUTHERN STREAM 
SYSTEM BRINGS SOME SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW.

169 
FXUS64 KMRX 150850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST MON FEB 15 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SURFACE FRONT IS MOVING ACROSS THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
CWA...WITH STRATIFORM PRECIP TRAILING THE FRONT. PRECIP MAY BEGIN AS 
A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW...BUT AS COLD ADVECTION KICKS IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT...IT SHOULD CHANGE TO ALL SNOW. THE BAND OF PRECIP IS FAIRLY 
NARROW AND SHOULD ONLY LAST FOR A FEW HOURS...BUT THE SNOW MAY BE 
HEAVY AT TIMES. EXPECT ACCUMULATIONS THIS MORNING ON THE ORDER OF 1 
TO 3 INCHES ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING. MIDLEVEL DRYING WILL MOVE 
IN THIS AFTERNOON...DECREASING SNOW COVERAGE AND INTENSITY...AND 
WILL LOWER AFTERNOON POPS TO A CHANCE AFTER 20Z. HOWEVER THE SNOW 
SHOULD PICK BACK UP AGAIN TONIGHT AS THE CLOSED UPPER LOW MOVES 
ACROSS...CREATING STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. AN INCREASING NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW...UP TO 40 KTS AT 850 MB...WILL ENHANCE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN 
THE MOUNTAINS. AN ADDITIONAL 1 TO 3 INCHES IS EXPECTED IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN AREAS TONIGHT. WILL NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES TO THE CURRENT WSW. OUR HIGH TEMPERATURES TODAY MAY OCCUR IN 
THE MORNING AS 850 MB TEMPS AROUND -14C ADVENT INTO THE AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIGHT.  
ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. WITH 
ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
THE NORTHERN AREAS ON WEDNESDAY. ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
LIGHT AGAIN. ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE NORTHERN 
AREAS ON THURSDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL KEEP 
THURSDAY DRY.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR 
FRIDAY. A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS BOTH PERIODS.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SUNDAY.  
TEMPERATURES REMAIN BELOW NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR  
HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

950 
FXUS64 KMRX 141944
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST SUN FEB 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED NEAR THE CONFLUENCE OF 
THE OHIO AND MS RIVERS...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
SOUTH ALONG THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL CUT-OFF 
LOW OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS (SEEN ON SATELLITE IMAGERY NEAR KANSAS 
CITY) IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY LATER TONIGHT...AND INTENSIFY THE SURFACE LOW AS IT MOVES 
EAST ACROSS KY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE STRONG 
DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP A WIDESPREAD COVERAGE OF 
PRECIP ALONG THE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODELS ARE TRENDING A LITTLE SLOWER 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND NOW INDICATE THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODELS SOUNDINGS REVEAL A 
WARM BOUNDARY LAYER LINGERING IN THE GREAT TN VALLEY UNTIL TOWARDS 
SUNRISE...SO THINK THAT SNOW AND RAIN MAY MIX IN THE VALLEY AREAS 
BELOW 2500 FEET UNTIL LATE TONIGHT. MAIN QUESTION WITH THIS SYSTEM 
WILL BE HOW MUCH SNOW CAN ACCUMULATE DUE TO THE WARM BOUNDARY LAYER 
IN THE VALLEYS AND THE QUICK SHOT OF HEAVIER PRECIP WITH THE FRONT. 
MODELS GENERATE AROUND A QUARTER OF AN INCH OF LIQUID EQUIVALENT 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z...BUT 
THINK THAT A HEAVY WET SNOW (WITH LOW SNOW TO LIQUID RATIOS OF 5:1) 
WILL LIKELY DEVELOP. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH THE CURRENT WINTER WX 
ADVISORY FOR MOST EVERYWHERE...BUT WILL UPGRADE EXTREME SOUTHEAST 
TN...SOUTHWEST NC...AND SMOKY MTNS TO A WARNING WHERE A HIGHER 
LIQUID/SNOW RATIO IS EXPECTED RESULTING IN GREATER THAN FOUR INCHES 
IN 12 HOURS (AND SIX INCHES IN 24 HOURS). WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPING BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF THE CUT-OFF UPPER-LOW BY MONDAY 
AFTERNOON...THINK THIS EVENT SHOULD TRANSITION OVER TO AN UPSLOPE 
SNOW SHOWER EVENT WITH ANY ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY 
AFFECTING THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 
HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO UNDERCUT THESE NUMBERS A LITTLE BY MONDAY 
NIGHT WITH SOME SNOW COVER EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN 
POSITIONED OVER THE EASTERN U.S. EARLY IN THE EXTENDED...AND SERIES 
OF WEAK IMPULSES ROTATING THROUGH WILL PERIODICALLY BRING IN 
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES MAINLY OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE NORTHEAST TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  AN 
UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD IN FOR FRIDAY.  A QUICK MOVING FRONTAL SYSTEM 
WILL SLIDE THROUGH AROUND THE SATURDAY TIME FRAME.  CONFIDENCE LOW 
ON TIMING AND STRENGTH...SO WILL KEEP LOW POPS CONFINED TO JUST 
SATURDAY FOR NOW AND LEAVE SUNDAY DRY.  WILL CONTINUE TO SEE 
TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST SUN FEB 14 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST ACROSS KY 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASING ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT SNOW OVER THE 
SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU SPREADING INTO SOUTHEAST TN...BUT 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD WARM TEMPS INTO 
THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...THIS SNOW SHOULD 
MIX OR COMPLETELY CHANGE OVER TO RAIN THIS AFTERNOON IN THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS BELOW 2500 FEET. WITH VERY COLD TEMPS ALOFT...THINK THAT 
SNOW WILL LINGER THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. PRECIP AMOUNTS THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE 
LIGHT UNTIL AFTER SUNSET...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF CHANCE 
POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING MAINLY TO 
REMOVE MORNING PRECIP WORDING.

.AVIATION...

VFR...BUT SOME MVFR CIGS ARE POSSIBLE THIS MORNING AT TRI. LIGHT
PRECIP...MAINLY RAIN...WILL BE AROUND THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT
CONDITIONS SHOULD REMAIN VFR. HEAVIER PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE
TONIGHT AS A FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...WITH A WIND SHIFT TO
WESTERLY AND A CHANGE TO SNOW AT ALL SITES. THIS SHOULD ALSO RESULT
IN MVFR TO NEAR-IFR CONDITIONS LATE IN THE TAF PERIOD.

345 
FXUS64 KMRX 140920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EST SUN FEB 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
CLOSED LOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL BE DROPPING SOUTHEAST 
TODAY...AND PUSHING A FRONT THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. CLOUDS WILL BE 
BROKEN TO OVERCAST THROUGH THE DAY AS MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM 
ADVECTS EAST. WHILE THE MOISTURE DEEPENS THROUGH THE DAY...LIFT 
REMAINS VERY WEAK...SO PRECIP WILL BE LIGHT. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 
CHANCE RANGE TODAY...THEN INCREASE TO CATEGORICAL THROUGH THE 
EVENING. THE BEST LIFT WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE IN 
THE LEFT EXIT REGION OF THE JET AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WITH THE 
FRONT. THIS OCCURS BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. 

PRECIP MAY BEGIN AS LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES TODAY...BUT NO 
ACCUMULATIONS OVER A HALF INCH ARE EXPECTED AS IT WILL BE LIGHT. AS 
THE STRONGER LIFT MOVES IN TONIGHT...LOW LEVEL TEMPS WILL BE TOO 
WARM FOR THE VALLEY TO GET ANY SNOW. SNOW SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE 
PLATEAU AND SW VA. COLD ADVECTION BEGINS TO LOWER TEMPERATURES AFTER 
06Z...AND PRECIP WILL TRANSITION TO SNOW EVERYWHERE. EXPECT 2 INCHES 
OR LESS BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z...WITH UP TO 3 IN THE TN MOUNTAINS. WILL 
REPLACE THE WATCH AREA WITH AN ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA. SINCE THE 
BEST LIFT DOES NOT COME UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT...WILL PUSH BACK THE 
START TIME OF THE ADVISORY TO MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY. WILL KEEP LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS 
FOR MONDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH NEARER THE LOW.  
COULD SEE ANOTHER INCH OR TWO OF SNOW ON MONDAY. THE LOW TRACKS OUT 
OUT OF THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT.  KEPT THE HIGHEST POPS FOR THE 
EVENING HOURS. ONLY LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IS EXPECTED ON MONDAY 
NIGHT. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
ON TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  ANOTHER 
WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  WITH ONLY 
LIMITED MOISTURE WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHERN 
AREAS ON WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN AREAS ON THURSDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED... 
WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR FRIDAY. A FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON SATURDAY. WILL ADD 
LOW POPS FOR SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES REMAIN BELOW NORMAL FOR THE 
PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             43  32  36  23  38 /  50 100  70  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  31  35  21  36 /  50 100  70  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  31  34  21  35 /  50 100  70  40  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              35  29  34  20  31 /  40 100  80  60  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1228 AM EST SUN FEB 14 2010

.AVIATION...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS WILL BRING
INCREASING MOISTURE TO THE AREA OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. VFR
CEILINGS ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT TYS AND CHA THROUGH THE
OVERNIGHT HOURS AND THROUGH THE DAY...WHILE TRI CAN EXPECT
PREDOMINANTLY MVFR CEILINGS OVERNIGHT RISING TO VFR DURING THE DAY.
SOME LIGHT PRECIP MAY BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE AREA IN THE
EVENING...AROUND 00Z. EXPECT THAT IT WILL BE MOSTLY RAIN AT TYS AND
CHA...AND SNOW AT TRI. WILL BRING MVFR CEILINGS INTO TYS AND TRI
WITH THIS PRECIP.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

145 
FXUS64 KMRX 132024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST SAT FEB 13 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE HIGH 
PLAINS. WITH NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SOME FLURRIES AND LIGHT SNOW OVER THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF THIS 
THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE 
CLIPPER SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS WILL QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WITH SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS AHEAD OF 
THIS SYSTEM BRINGING INCREASING MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. INITIAL PRECIP SHOULD DEVELOP BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON... BUT IT APPEARS THAT IT WILL BE LIGHT AND MIXED WITH 
RAIN ACROSS THE VALLEY AREAS BELOW 2500 FEET WHERE TEMPS SHOULD RISE 
INTO UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. PRECIP WILL LIKELY BEGIN AS SNOW ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON...WITH AN 
INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ON THE HIGHEST PEAKS BEFORE 
SUNSET. AS THE COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY EVENING...EXPECT SNOW TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA...ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INTO MONDAY MORNING. WITH REMAINING IN THE 
30S ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS SUNDAY NIGHT... 
EXPECT LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS SINCE SNOWFALL SHOULD HAVE A 
TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING. WITH VERY COLD UPPER-LEVEL TEMPS PROGGED 
WITH THIS UPPER LOW...EXPECT SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET WHERE A WINTER STORM 
WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. THIS 
WINTER EVENT WILL TRANSITION FROM A SYNOPTIC-SCALE STRATIFORM SNOW 
EVENT TO AN UPSLOPE EVENT MAINLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS BY MONDAY 
AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO 
UNDERCUT THESE NUMBERS SOMEWHAT WHERE SNOW COVER IS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES 
ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH TO OUR NORTH AND 
BRING A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS 
ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. WILL BE BETWEEN THINGS ON THURSDAY...THEN 
A WEAK COLD FRONT SLIDES THROUGH LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. MODEL 
CONSISTENCY POOR AND CONFIDENCE LOW ON DETAILS...WILL INTRODUCE LOW 
POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE THROUGH RATHER 
QUICKLY AND WILL GO DRY ON SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE TO SEE COOLER... 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   26  45  32  37  23 /  10  60 100  70  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     24  42  31  36  22 /  10  60 100  70  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN             24  42  31  36  22 /  10  60 100  70  40

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
WESTERN ATLANTIC OCEAN...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A NORTHWESTERLY 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY... 
PRODUCING SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE FAVORED AREAS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA...EAST TN MOUNTAINS...AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. DOWNSLOPING FLOW INTO THE GREAT TN VALLEY WILL LIKELY KEEP 
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS OVER THE VALLEY...AND MAY ALSO HELP TO PRODUCE 
SOME ADIABATIC WARMING.

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS 
MORNING TO RAISE POPS IN THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS...AND TO TWEAK 
SKY CONDITIONS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
