979 
FXUS64 KMRX 130900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SAT FEB 13 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE SWINGING THROUGH THE AREA THIS MORNING. 
IR SATELLITE INDICATES BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS BEHIND THE TROUGH 
AXIS THAT WILL BE ADVECTING INTO THE AREA. EXPECT THAT SKIES WILL BE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY THROUGH THE DAY...WHICH WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES ON THE 
COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE AGAIN. THE UPSTREAM MOISTURE IS NOT VERY THICK 
BASED ON THE 00Z ILX SOUNDING...BUT IT DOES EXTEND ABOVE THE -10C 
LEVEL FOR DENDRITE GROWTH. STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES IN THE 
NORTHERN PART OF THE AREA COULD RESULT IN SOME SNOW SHOWERS. WILL 
CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP NORTH TODAY. THERE MAY BE A PERIOD OF 
CLEARING THIS EVENING BEFORE MIDLEVEL CLOUDS INCREASE TONIGHT AHEAD 
OF ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH IN THE NORTHERN STREAM. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON LATE SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY. WILL KEEP THE 
HIGHEST POPS ON SUNDAY NIGHT WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE ARRIVES.  
SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ON SUNDAY NIGHT. EXPECTING SNOW TO 
ACCUMULATE ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST SNOWFALL 
TOTALS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE LOW EXITS THE AREA ON 
MONDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH NEARER THE LOW.  A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS ON WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY.  ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE 
TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON 
STRENGTH AND TIMING WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW.  TEMPERATURES 
REMAIN BELOW NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

&&

398 
FXUS64 KMRX 122025 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST FRI FEB 12 2010

.MESOSCALE UPDATE...
ADDED A FEW MORE COUNTIES ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST TN TO THE WINTER 
WX ADVISORY FOR THIS EVENING.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHEASTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH OF IT ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
THAT THE NORTHERN FRINGE OF ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIP WAS AFFECTING 
SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...AND WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE 
CURRENT WINTER WX ADVISORIES FOR THESE AREAS INTO THIS EVENING. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY 
OVER THE APPALACHIANS LATER TONIGHT...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPING 
ACROSS THE REGION ON SATURDAY. THUS...WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR SNOW 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST 
TN AND THE SMOKY MTNS. 

MODELS REMAIN IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD QUICKLY DIVE SOUTHEAST INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM BRINGING INCREASING MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS 
INDICATE SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM PRODUCING SOME 
INITIAL PRECIP BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...BUT THESE SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD 
OF ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT SHOULD ALSO WARM TEMPS INTO THE UPPER 
30S AND LOWER 40S ACROSS THE GREAT TN VALLEY ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 
THUS...EXPECT A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW INITIALLY ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS BELOW 2500 FEET...ALTHOUGH PRECIP 
WILL LIKELY BEGIN AS SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 
FEET. AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT...EXPECT SNOW TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA WITH LIGHT 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE VALLEY LOCATIONS BELOW 
2500 FEET BY MONDAY. SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS APPEAR TO BE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. AS FOR 
TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...BUT WILL PLAN TO UNDERCUT THESE NUMBERS WHERE SNOW COVER IS 
OBSERVED. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL BE EXITING 
THE AREA ON MONDAY...AND ASSOCIATED SHOWERS SLOWLY PULLING OUT. 
PRECIP WILL BE MOSTLY SNOW THOUGH A RAIN SNOW MIX IS POSSIBLE OVER 
THE SOUTHERN VALLEY IN THE AFTERNOON. ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS 
SHOULD BE LIGHT ON MONDAY WITH LITTLE TO NO ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS 
SOUTH...AND A HALF INCH TO AN INCH POSSIBLE NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES WILL LINGER OVER 
NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS ON TUESDAY. AN UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH 
WILL ROTATE THROUGH A WEAK SHORT WAVE ON WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE AND 
LIFT LIMITED AND EXPECT MAINLY A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR WITH 
CONTINUE CLOUD COVER AND POSSIBLY A FEW FLURRIES OR LIGHT SNOW 
NORTH. WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. AS FAR AS 
TEMPERATURES...LITTLE CHANGE EXPECTED AND SHOULD REMAIN BELOW CLIMO 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   23  43  26  43  32 /  10  10  10  50  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     22  38  24  41  31 /  10  10  10  50  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN             22  38  24  41  31 /  10  10  10  60  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    20  32  21  38  30 /  20  20  10  50  70

AFTERNOON ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS BELOW 2500 FEET...ALTHOUGH PRECIP 
WILL LIKELY BEGIN AS SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 
FEET. AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT...EXPECT SNOW TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA WITH LIGHT 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE VALLEY LOCATIONS BELOW 
2500 FEET BY MONDAY. SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS APPEAR TO BE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. AS FOR 
TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...BUT WILL PLAN TO UNDERCUT THESE NUMBERS WHERE SNOW COVER IS 
OBSERVED. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL BE EXITING 
THE AREA ON MONDAY...AND ASSOCIATED SHOWERS SLOWLY PULLING OUT. 
PRECIP WILL BE MOSTLY SNOW THOUGH A RAIN SNOW MIX IS POSSIBLE OVER 
THE SOUTHERN VALLEY IN THE AFTERNOON. ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS 
SHOULD BE LIGHT ON MONDAY WITH LITTLE TO NO ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS 
SOUTH...AND A HALF INCH TO AN INCH POSSIBLE NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES WILL LINGER OVER 
NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS ON TUESDAY. AN UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH 
WILL ROTATE THROUGH A WEAK SHORT WAVE ON WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE AND 
LIFT LIMITED AND EXPECT MAINLY A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR WITH 
CONTINUE CLOUD COVER AND POSSIBLY A FEW FLURRIES OR LIGHT SNOW 
NORTH. WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. AS FAR AS 
TEMPERATURES...LITTLE CHANGE EXPECTED AND SHOULD REMAIN BELOW CLIMO 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.

873 
FXUS64 KMRX 120848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EST FRI FEB 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
CYCLOGENESIS IS TAKING PLACE OVER THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO THIS 
MORNING. OVERCAST MIDLEVEL CLOUDS ARE MOVING INTO THE AREA AS THE 
SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES. THE TREND OF THE RECENT 
MODEL RUNS HAS BEEN TO SPREAD MOISTURE AND LIFT FARTHER NORTH...AND 
BOTH THE NAM AND GFS BRING PRECIP INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
AREA. FORCING APPEARS MAINLY ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE 
JET ENTRANCE REGION AND WEAK CONVERGENCE WITH THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH. 
THE BEST LIFT STAYS TO OUR SOUTH HOWEVER...WHICH SHOULD KEEP PRECIP 
AMOUNTS FAIRLY LIGHT. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS IN SW NC THIS 
AFTERNOON...TAPERING TO LIKELY IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND THE 
SMOKIES...TO A CHANCE IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY. WILL ISSUE A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR EXTREME SW NC/SE TN MOUNTAINS AND THE SMOKIES 
FROM NOON TO 10 PM AS AMOUNTS AROUND 2 INCHES LOOK LIKELY. WENT WITH 
THE COLDER MET GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES TODAY AS CLOUD COVER WILL 
BE PLENTIFUL.

ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT SNOW MAY FOLLOW TONIGHT WITH THE PASSAGE OF A 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AND LIFT 
WEAK WITH THIS TROUGH PASSAGE...BUT DECENT UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD GIVE 
A CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE OF MEASURABLE SNOW IN NORTHERN AREAS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. WILL KEEP ACCUMULATIONS UNDER A HALF INCH WITH THIS 
CLIPPER.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR SATURDAY.  A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON LATE 
SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS ON SUNDAY NIGHT 
WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE ARRIVES.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW 
ON SUNDAY NIGHT.  THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA ON MONDAY...WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH NEARER THE 
FRONT.  SNOW IS EXPECTED TO CHANCE TO RAIN IN THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEY BY MONDAY AFTERNOON.  A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  ANOTHER WEAKER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH 
IT...WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY.  HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR THURSDAY.  TEMPERATURES REMAIN BELOW NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. 
STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

OVER THE NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS...NORTHERN AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS. A 
FEW SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS 
INTO TUESDAY. WE SHOULD REMAIN BETWEEN SYSTEMS WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS. THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED...WILL KEEP A

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EST THU FEB 11 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER SOUTH 
TEXAS. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS LINGERING LOW TO MID LEVEL CLOUDS 
OVER MOST OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS MOVING NORTHEAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
REVEAL THAT A STRONG MID LEVEL INVERSION WILL LINGER THIS AFTERNOON 
ABOVE THESE CLOUDS...SO THINK THAT THERE WILL BE LIMITED VERTICAL 
MIXING TODAY. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH 
CLOUD COVER FOR THIS AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION...THESE CLOUDS SHOULD 
KEEP AFTERNOON MAXES COOLER THAN CURRENTLY FORECAST...SO WILL PLAN 
TO LOWER TEMPS IN THE UPDATE AS WELL.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE 
MORNING POPS...LOWER MAX TEMPS...AND BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD 
COVER.

045 
FXUS64 KMRX 110809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EST THU FEB 11 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAJOR SYSTEM CONTINUES TO SLOWLY 
PULL AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. SCATTERED GENERALLY 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS LEFT IN ITS WAKE CONTINUE TO TRANSLATE THROUGH 
MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT CYCLONIC FLOW WILL RELAX AND BECOME MORE OR LESS 
ZONAL...BECOMING LESS AND LESS FAVORABLE FOR UPSLOPE OROGRAPHIC LIFT 
PRECIP. THUS ANTICIPATE CURRENT SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY TO DECREASE IN 
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY BY EARLY IN THE FIRST PERIOD. WILL ALLOW 
ALL ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS TO EXPIRE AS SCHEDULED. BALANCE OF SHORT 
TERM DRY ALTHOUGH APPROACHING SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WILL LIKELY 
PRECLUDE MUCH IN THE WAY OF SIGNIFICANT CLEARING SKY COVER. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER OF GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FORECAST GRIDS ON TRACK
FOR THESE PERIODS. HPC FAVORING A LITTLE MORE NORTHERN TRACK OF THE
GULF COAST SYSTEM FRIDAY THAN THE GFS...SO NUDGED POPS UP JUST A
BIT ACROSS OUR EXTREME SRN COUNTIES NEAR FFC AND GSP. STILL DON'T
EXPECT MUCH WEATHER FOR OUR REGION FROM THIS SYSTEM...BUT WORTH A
20 TO 30 PERCENT POP ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC...INTO FRIDAY EVENING.

NEXT MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM IS THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED
COLD FRONT FOR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. GFS AND ECMWF QUITE SIMILAR AND
PREFERRED SOLUTIONS OVER THE SLOWER NAM. VERY LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES
TO GRIDS NEEDED FOR THIS SYSTEM...AS DAY SHIFT HAD ALREADY PUSHED
POPS UP TO CHANCE FOR THESE PERIODS. I WON'T HIGHLIGHT THIS SYSTEM
MUCH YET...OTHER THAN IN THE HWO PRODUCT...AS THE AIRMASS LOOKS
QUITE COLD (ALL SNOW) AND THE LIGHTER QPF FROM THE GFS LOOKS BETTER
TO ME THAN THE MORE ZEALOUS ECMWF AMOUNTS. 

OTHERWISE...STILL NO HOPE OF GETTING ANYWHERE NEAR SEASONAL NORMS
FOR TEMPS FOR THIS PACKAGE. GFSX MOS TEMPS RELFECT THIS WITH MAX
TEMPS RUNNING AROUND 10 DEGREES OR MORE BELOW CLIMO THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. I DID MAKE A FEW TWEAKS...GENERALLY LOWERING MAX
TEMPS...GIVEN STRENGTH OF COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE LATE
WEEKEND SYSTEM. HOWEVER...SOME GOOD NEWS AS I WAS ABLE TO KEEP
TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY MOSTLY DRY.

NOTE...WINTER WEATHER WARNING AND ADVISORY EXPIRING...WILL ISSUE AN
SPS TO HIGHLIGHT CONTINUED HAZARDOUS ROAD CONDITIONS AND SOME
LINGERING SPOTTY SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES THIS MORNING.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  26  41  26  44 /   0   0  30  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  22  40  23  41 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  22  40  23  39 /   0   0  10  10  10

384 
FXUS64 KMRX 101945
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST WED FEB 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID ATLANTIC 
STATES...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING SOUTH ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...GENERATING 
ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE 
UPSLOPE FLOW WILL PROVIDE EXTRA LIFT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A 
SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB...WITH STEEP LOW-LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES BELOW 850 MB AND A DECENT MID-LEVEL INVERSION ABOVE 850 MB. 
THUS...THESE SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD NOT HAVE TOO MUCH VERTICAL GROWTH 
ABOVE 850 MB...AND THINK THAT THE OVERALL SNOWFALL COVERAGE WILL 
QUICKLY DECREASE TONIGHT AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH EXITS THE REGION. 
FORECASTED SNOWFALL AMOUNTS APPEAR TO STILL BE ON TRACK...AND WILL 
PLAN TO CONTINUE THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES/WARNINGS AS PREVIOUSLY 
ADVERTISED. LATEST SURFACE OBS INDICATE THAT WINDS HAVE NOT REALLY 
REACHED ADVISORY CRITERIA IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BELOW 2500 FEET... 
SO WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY EVERYWHERE BELOW 2500 FEET. 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL ON THURSDAY...WITH SNOW SHOWERS 
GRADUALLY ENDING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING THE MORNING 
HOURS. ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP ACROSS 
THE NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO ON THURSDAY...WITH THE MODELS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT IT WILL TRACK ACROSS GULF COASTAL REGION AND 
REMAIN SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY. THE NORTHERN FRINGE OF 
ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIP COULD POSSIBLY AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC ON FRIDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR THESE AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT WILL PLAN TO UNDERCUT THESE 
NUMBERS WHERE SNOW COVER IS OBSERVED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ECMWF/GFS RELATIVELY CLOSE 
IN DEPICTION OF WEATHER DURING THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...GFS A LITTLE 
SLOWER IN PROGRESSION OF SHORT WAVE FEATURES DURING THE MONDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIMEFRAME. WENT A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF 
DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. ON SATURDAY PAINTED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF FLURRIES OR SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS THE 
NORTH AS WELL AS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE 
MODELS INDICATE WEAK SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE BASE OF 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. LONG WAVE TROF. NORTHWESTERLY COMPONENT MAY LIMIT 
ANY LIGHT QPF TO THE HIGH TERRAIN REGIONS BUT USED A BROADBRUSH 
APPROACH AT THIS TIME FOR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DUE TO UNCERTAINTY. 
FORECAST GETS A LITTLE MORE INTERESTING FROM LATER SATURDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY AS ATMOSPHERE NOT YET COMPLETE WITH THE REGION AND 
HAS MORE WINTERY WEATHER IN STORE FOR THE FIRST COUPLE DAYS OF NEXT 
WEEK. MODELS INDICATE RATHER HEALTHY UPPER TROF/CLOSED LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL PRESS EAST ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH PRODUCING THE POSSIBILITY OF MIXED PRECIP ACROSS MOST OF THE 
REGION WITH SNOW AT HIGHER ELEVATION SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. 
PRECIP WOULD MOST LIKELY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW FOR MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS UPPER LOW BUILDS EAST 
TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND LOW LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION 
STRENGTHENS BEHIND SURFACE SYSTEM. WILL HAVE TO WAIT A COUPLE MORE 
DAYS FOR BETTER FOCUS ON WHAT MAY HAPPEN LATER THIS WEEKEND. WINTER 
WILL BE GOING NO WHERE FAST MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY AND USED CHANCE 
POPS FOR MONDAY TAPERING BACK TO SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POP FOR SNOW 
SHOWERS WITH EMPHASIS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR MONDAY NIGHT AS 
AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF APPARENTLY NOT IN A HURRY TO EXIT THE EASTERN 
U.S. FINALLY WAS ABLE TO REMOVE POPS EVERYWHERE TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS TROF EXITS INTO THE ATLANTIC WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF DRY...ALBEIT COLD ADVECTION FOR THE END OF THE LONG 
TERM FORECAST.
&&

.AVIATION...STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY IN A

SHOULD KEEP VSBY MAINLY IN THE IFR RANGE AT TRI WITH LOW MVFR
CEILINGS INTO THE EARLY EVENING WHILE VSBY WILL MOST LIKELY STAY AT
MVFR OR HIGHER AT TYS WHERE MOISTURE NOT QUITE AS DEEP. FLIGHT
CONDITIONS GRADUALLY IMPROVE OVERNIGHT WITH ALL TAF SITES VFR BY
13Z AS UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS AWAY TO THE EAST
ALLOWING FOR DRIER WESTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

754 
FXUS64 KMRX 101606
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1105 AM EST WED FEB 10 2010

.DISCUSSION...
WILL PLAN TO INCLUDE EXTREME SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC IN A 
WINTER WX ADVISORY...TO BETTER MATCH THE BLIZZARD WARNING JUST 
ISSUED ACROSS THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE MTNS. WILL NOT UPGRADE THE 
EAST TN MTNS TO A BLIZZARD WARNING...SINCE THE WIND CRITERIA WILL 
LIKELY NOT BE MET ON THE WESTERN SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. WITH A 
NORTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW...THINK THAT THE STRONGEST WINDS WILL REMAIN 
ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES AND 
DOWNSLOPE ENHANCEMENT.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
MID ATLANTIC STATES...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
OVER VIRGINIA WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A NORTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A 
SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB...WITH STEEP LOW-LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES BELOW 850 MB BUT A DECENT MID-LEVEL INVERSION ABOVE 850 MB. 
WHILE AFTERNOON HEATING WILL LIKELY GENERATE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY 
AND ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS...THINK THAT THESE AFTERNOON SNOW 
SHOWERS SHOULD NOT HAVE TOO MUCH VERTICAL GROWTH ABOVE 850 MB. 
THUS...WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE WITH THE CURRENT FORECASTED SNOWFALL 
AMOUNTS AND WILL EMPHASIZE THAT THE HIGHER AMOUNTS WILL MAINLY BE 
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. NORTHWESTERLY WINDS AND THEIR 
RESULTING UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD CONTINUE UNTIL AFTER SUNSET... 
WHEN THE SNOW AND WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF 
SOLAR HEATING AND THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH EXITING THE REGION. WITH 
ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO LENGTHEN THE VALID TIMES OF THE 
ADVISORIES UNTIL 7 PM THIS EVENING.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO LOWER MAX 
TEMPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON...AND TO RAISE POPS IN THE ADVISORY AND 
WARNING AREAS.
&&

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    27  20  35  19  37 /  70  50  10   0  10

.DISCUSSION...LITTLE CHANGE FROM EARLIER TAF ISSUANCE...ALTHO CLOUDS

WHEN SOME HEAVIER BANDS OF SNOW SHOWERS ARE LIKELY TO DEVELOP. 

OTHERWISE...MOS GUIDANCE SUGGESTS THE LOWER CLOUDS WILL LIFT BY 
TONIGHT...BUT I LOOK FOR LINGERING BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS AROUND 
3000 TO 3500 FEET TO PERSIST.

955 
FXUS64 KMRX 100819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EST WED FEB 10 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VIGOROUS UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE 
TO PROGRESS EASTWARD THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. UPSLOPE FLOW 
STRENGTHENS AND BECOMES EVEN MORE FAVORABLE WITH RESPECT TO WIND 
DIRECTION DURING THE FIRST PERIOD. MODELS ALSO PROJECT LOW-LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL BE BRIEFLY ENHANCED FROM TRAJECTORY FROM WESTERN GREAT 
LAKES REGION...MAINLY LAKE MICHIGAN. THESE FACTORS ALONG WITH GOOD 
LIFT AND SOME LOW-LEVEL CAPE FAVOR CONTINUATION AND EVEN INCREASE IN 
SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY ESPECIALLY IN THE FAVORED UPSLOPE FLOW 
LOCATIONS AND OVER OUR FAR NORTHEASTERN ZONES THROUGH AT LEAST A 
PORTION OF THE FIRST PERIOD. THUS WILL CONTINUE WINTER WEATHER 
PRODUCTS AS CURRENTLY CONFIGURED. WILL ALSO CONTINUE WIND ADVISORY 
AS STRONG FLOW CONTINUES BEHIND DEPARTING SYSTEM. SYSTEM LOSES ITS 
EFFECTS ON REGION BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY FAVORED A BLEND OF THE GUIDANCE VALUES IN THE FIRST PERIOD 
WHILE GENERALLY FAVORED MAV GUIDANCE VALUES IN THE SECOND PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY
ON TRACK FOR THESE PERIODS...LINED UP QUITE WELL WITH ECMWF AND
NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS. NOT MUCH MORE THAN ISOLATED SNOW
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES FOR EXTREME NE AREAS ON THURSDAY...THEN LOOK
FOR A SRN STREAM SYSTEM TO TRACK ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES AND
POSSIBLY BRUSH SE TN AND SW NC. THIS IS ALL QUITE CONSISTENT WITH
PREVIOUS GRIDS...SO LITTLE CHANGES WERE MADE.

ECMWF AND GFS DEVELOP A STRONG NRN STREAM SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED
COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY...WITH ECMWF A BIT FASTER IN SWEEPING THIS
SYSTEM ACROSS THE SRN APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY NIGHT. TYPICALLY WOULD
EXPECT A FEW SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES ON THE BACK SIDE OF A SYSTEM
SUCH AS THIS...AND FORECAST GRIDS WERE ALREADY TRENDED THAT WAY FOR
MONDAY. HOWEVER...PER COORDINATION I DID BUMP POPS UP ON SUNDAY
DAYTIME TO CHANCE ACROSS NRN AREAS...AND WILL ALLOW DAY SHIFT TO
LOOK INTO INCREASING POPS MORE IF NEEDED.

OTHERWISE...CONTINUED A DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.
UNDERCUTTING MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS THURSDAY LOOKED GOOD...SINCE WE
EXPECT SOME SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS SW VA/NE TN/SMOKY MTNS. ALSO
...FAVORED TRENDING BELOW MOS FOR OTHER DAYS GIVEN LOW LEVEL FLOW
AND 850 MB TEMPS. THUS...NOT MUCH HOPE OF GETTING NEAR SEASONAL
NORMAL TEMPS FOR THIS WEEK.


&&

MUCH OF TODAY FOR TRI...AND POSSIBLY LOWER VSBYS AND/OR CEILINGS AT 
TIMES. OTHERWISE...STRONG AND GUSTY WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE FOR THE BULK OF THIS TAF PACKAGE...ALTHO GUSTINESS SHOULD 
DECREASE AFTER SUNSET.

748 
FXUS64 KMRX 100142 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
842 PM EST TUE FEB 9 2010

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH THE AREA...AND TEMPERATURES HAVE
BEEN PLUMMETING WHILE WINDS HAVE BEEN INCREASING. 00Z OHX SOUNDING
SHOWS A THIN LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB...BUT WITH STEEP LOW
LEVEL LAPSE RATES...SNOW SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED. FARTHER
WEST...SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CLEARING SKIES...SO THERE LOOKS TO
BE A DRY PERIOD BEFORE ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS RETURN AROUND
DAYBREAK. 

OVERALL...THE CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...AND NO CHANGES ARE
PLANNED TO THE CURRENT WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES. ONLY SILGHT CHANGES
WILL BE MADE TO ADJUST FOR CURRENT TEMPERATURE TRENDS AND TO CLOUD
COVER TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CLEARING UPSTREAM. WE WILL BE VERY CLOSE
TO MEETING WIND CHILL CRITERIA TONIGHT IN THE MOUNTAINS...BUT THIS
SHOULD BE ONLY IN THE HIGHEST PEAKS AND NOT WIDESPREAD...SO WILL
NOT ISSUE ANY WIND CHILL ADVISORIES.

WITH THE STRONG WINDS AND OCCASSIONALLY HEAVY SNOW
SHOWERS...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS APPEAR LIKELY AT TIMES TOMORROW. BUT
VISIBILITIES <1/4 MILE SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HEAVIEST SNOW
SHOWERS...AND THUS SHOULD NOT BE CONTINUOUS FOR MORE THAN ONE HOUR. A
BLIZZARD WARNING WAS CONSIDERED...BUT INSTEAD WILL BEEF UP THE
WORDING OF THE WINTER STORM WARNING TO MENTION LOWERED VISIBILITIES
WITH THE HEAVIER SHOWERS AND BLOWING/DRIFTING SNOW.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM EST WEDNESDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
634 PM EST TUE FEB 9 2010

.AVIATION...
A COLD FRONT IS MOVING INTO THE AREA AT THE MOMENT...BRINGING GUSTY
WINDS TO THE TAF SITES OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS. CEILINGS WILL ALSO
BEGIN TO LIFT...AND PERHAPS BECOME SCATTERED AT CHA...AS AN AREA OF
DRIER AIR FOLLOWS THE FRONT. BUT CEILINGS SHOULD FILL BACK IN AS
THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES OVERHEAD LATER TONIGHT. DEEPER
MOISTURE WILL BRING SOME SNOW SHOWERS TO TRI DURING THE DAY
TOMORROW. WILL HAVE MVFR CONDITIONS WITH THE SNOW SHOWERS AT
TRI...BUT WILL HAVE VFR CEILINGS AT TYS AND CHA WHERE MOISTURE WILL
NOT BE AS PLENTIFUL. WINDS WILL ALSO BE GUSTY TONIGHT AND
TOMORROW...30 TO 35 KT GUSTS ARE EXPECTED AT ALL SITES.

464 
FXUS64 KMRX 092015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST TUE FEB 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA BRINGING SNOW AND BREEZY CONDITIONS TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
WILL BUMP UP THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY TO A WARNING FOR SOUTHWEST  
VA AND THE MOUNTAINS AND LEAVE THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND PLATEAU AS AN 
ADVISORY. SNOW WILL LIMITED IN THE SOUTHERN ZONES.  WILL ALSO ISSUE 
A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA WITH STRONG WINDS PUSHING IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT.  COOLER WEATHER MOVING IN FOR TONIGHT...STAYED 
NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT THAT LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL MORE OR LESS PERSIST FOR THE 
ENTIRE PERIOD OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. HOWEVER...LESS AGREEMENT ON 
THE DETAILS.  SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS 
WILL PERSIST INTO WED NIGHT...BEFORE ENDING EARLY THURSDAY.  WINDS 
WILL GRADUALLY DIMINISH AS WELL.  FRIDAY A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
FORECAST TO TRACK BY WELL TO OUR SOUTH.  CONSISTENCY IN THE MODELS 
LACKING WITH THIS SYSTEM...AS GFS NOW KEEPS IT MORE SUPPRESSED TO THE 
SOUTH THAN THE ECMWF...REVERSING THEIR ROLES FROM YESTERDAY.  STILL 
THINK A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN WARRANTED SOUTH ON FRIDAY GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY.  WILL GO DRY SATURDAY...THEN MODELS INDICATE SOME 
ENERGY WILL DIVE DOWN FROM THE NORTHWEST...POSSIBLY BRINGING SOME 
PRECIP TO THE AREA FOR SOMETIME IN THE SAT NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY TIME 
FRAME.  HOWEVER...LOTS OF UNCERTAINTY IN THE DETAILS...AS MODELS DO 
NOT AGREE ON TIMING.  FOR NOW WILL CARRY ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
DURING THIS TIME. WILL GO DRY TUESDAY FOR NOW.  


&&

465 
FXUS64 KMRX 090825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST TUE FEB 9 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ACTIVE WINTER WEATHER
PATTERN PERSISTS FOR THESE PERIODS. I CONTINUED CURRENT WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SW VA/NRN MTNS/SMOKY MTNS FOR TODAY...ALTHO
LATEST SURFACE TEMPS AND RUC MODEL TEMPS INDICATE JUST A CHANCE FOR
SOME WINTRY MIX IN THE ADVISORY AREA. IF RUC AND NAM MODELS ARE
CORRECT IN WARMING THE LOW LEVELS AND 850 TEMPS THIS MORNING...
THEN DAY SHIFT MAY BE ABLE TO CANCEL THIS ADVISORY EARLY. 
SENSIBLE FORECAST IS FOR BULK OF THE AREA TO JUST GET RAIN TODAY.

THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL PASS
THROUGH THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A BRIEF BREAK IN THE
PRECIPITATION (PCPN). THEN AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF SNOW SHOWERS OR
FLURRIES WILL DEVELOP THIS EVENING AND CONTINUE INTO WEDNESDAY
AFTERNOON. THE MAIN CAUSE FOR THIS WILL BE STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION
...UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE ENERGY PASSING ACROSS THE REGION...AND
WHAT WOULD APPEAR TO BE A DECENT NW LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW PATTERN. 
NAM MODEL INDICATES SURFACE BASED CAPES OF 30 TO 60 J/KG LATE
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH A GOOD NW COMPONENT AND STRONG
WIND SPEEDS FROM SURFACE TO 850 MBS. 

THE TIGHT SURFACE GRADIENT AND STRENGTH OF LOW LEVEL JET HAS
PROMPTED A HIGH WIND WATCH FOR THE NRN AND SMOKY MTNS...AND A 
WIND ADVISORY FOR SW VA...BOTH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THIS EVENING
INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. THANKS TO SURROUNDING NWS OFFICES FOR
COORDINATION ON THESE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES AND WIND PRODUCTS.

OTHERWISE...MOS BLEND ON TEMPS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT LOOKED
REASONABLE...AND THEN I FAVORED THE COLDER GUIDANCE (NAM) FOR MAX
TEMPS WEDNESDAY. NUDGED POPS UP A BIT TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY IN THE
ADVISORY AREAS...WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW IS A FACTOR.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LONG WAVE TROUGH 
WILL MORE OR LESS PERSIST FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS. AS A RESULT...REGION WILL REMAIN IN NEGATIVE HEIGHT 
ANOMALY REGIME WHICH PORTENDS TEMPS GENERALLY REMAINING BELOW TO 
WELL BELOW CLIMO. PERIODIC SHORT WAVES ARE PROJECTED TO TRANSLATE 
THROUGH THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW OF THE EASTERN CONUS LONG WAVE TROUGH. 
SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM ON FRIDAY STILL PROJECTED TO REMAIN SOUTH OF 
OUR FORECAST AREA...BUT A FEW GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS INDICATE SOME 
LIGHT PRECIP MAY SLIP INTO OUR SOUTHERN TIER. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM 
INHERENTLY LOW CONFIDENCE AS DETAILS REMAIN MURKY. THUS HAVE NOT 
MADE ANY SUBSTANTIVE CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS.

.AVIATION...

WILL GRADUALLY LOWER TO MVFR THERE BEFORE 06Z AS LOW LEVEL MOISTEN.
LIGHT RAIN AND MVFR VIS/CIGS SHOULD MOVE INTO TYS AROUND 08Z. BOTH
LOCATIONS SHOULD SEE IFR CIGS...AND OCCASIONALLY IFR VIS...AS THE
PRECIP INTENSITY PICKS UP AROUND 12Z. AT TRI...PRECIP IS EXPECTED
TO BEGIN AS SNOW OR A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW AROUND 09Z BEFORE
CHANGING TO RAIN BY 14Z. A DOWNSLOPE WIND COMPONENT OFF THE
MOUNTAINS MAY KEEP CEILINGS AT TRI A BIT HIGHER...IN THE MVFR
RANGE. MIDLEVEL DRYING WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST...LEADING TO
DRIZZLE IN THE AFTERNOON AT ALL TAF SITES. A FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE
IN THE AFTERNOON WILL BRING RISING CIGS AND A SHIFT OF WINDS TO THE
WEST AT CHA AND TYS. FROPA AT TRI LOOKS TO BE AFTER 00Z.

FXUS64 KMRX 081956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST MON FEB 8 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  STILL SOME WARM AIR ACROSS 
THE AREA TONIGHT WHICH WILL LIMIT THE OVERALL HIGHEST ACCUMULATIONS 
TONIGHT.  SHOULD HAVE BETTER ACCUMULATIONS IN THE NORTHERN AREAS AND 
THE MOUNTAINS.  WILL ADD A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VA 
AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WILL BE BREEZY TONIGHT 
AND TUESDAY AS THE LOW TRACKS THROUGH AREA.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
SURGE INTO THE AREA TUE NIGHT ON GUSTY WEST WINDS.  ANY LINGERING 
PRECIP WILL QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS. LOOKS LIKE BEST TIME FOR 
SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL BE LATE TUE NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY 
AS UPPER LOW SLIDES BY JUST TO OUR NORTH.  MOISTURE WILL BE DEEPEST 
AT THAT POINT...AND ALTHOUGH WIND DIRECTION AND LOW LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES DO NOT LOOK IDEAL...STILL EXPECT SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
OVER THE NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS TUE NIGHT THROUGH WED 
NIGHT.  WINDS WILL BE STRONG AND GUSTY AS WELL TUE NIGHT AND 
WED...AND LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY AT LEAST 
FOR HIGHER TERRAIN. WILL ISSUE SPS TALKING ABOUT TUE NIGHT THROUGH
WED NIGHT.  MAY BE SOME LINGERING FLURRIES INTO THU MORNING OVER
HIGHER TERRAIN...OTHERWISE DRY THU AND THU NIGHT. HIGH LEVEL OF
UNCERTAINTY FOR THE FRI THROUGH MON TIME FRAME GIVEN POOR MODEL
AGREEMENT. GFS STILL INSISTS THAT SOUTHERN SYSTEM FRI MAY BRUSH
SOUTHERN PARTS OF OUR AREA...SO WILL INCLUDE 20 POP SOUTH FOR NOW.
WILL ALSO INCLUDE SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NORTHERN AREAS SAT
NIGHT THROUGH SUN NIGHT...AS WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY ALONG WITH COLD
ADVECTION MAY AFFECT THESE AREAS. WILL GO DRY MON FOR NOW.

849 
FXUS64 KMRX 081442
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
941 AM EST MON FEB 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...INVERTED TROUGH BRINGING SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN AL 
MOVING EAST.  WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO ADD LOW POPS THE SOUTHERN 
AREAS OF THE CWA FOR TODAY.  SHOULD BEGIN AS LIGHT SNOW THEN CHANGE 
TO LIGHT RAIN BY THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED AT THIS TIME.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COMPLEX FORECAST FOR THESE 
PERIODS AS MODELS HAVE DONE A POOR JOB OF CLOUD COVER AND TEMPS OVER 
THE PAST 24 HOURS...AND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION DEVELOPS VERY QUICKLY TODAY. NAM AND GFS 
ARE MORE SIMILAR FROM THE 08/00Z RUN IN SHOWING PRECIPITATION 
DEVELOPING OVER MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS LATE 
TONIGHT. THIS PRECIPITATION MOVES IN AFTER 06Z WITH FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SHOWING MOSTLY SNOW FOR SW VA AND MUCH OF NE TN...AND  
RAIN OR A RAIN AND SNOW MIX ELSEWHERE. PCPN TYPE IS COMPLICATED DUE 
TO SOME WARMING ON TUESDAY...SO SNOW AMOUNTS ARE UNCERTAIN AT THIS 
TIME. SOMEWHAT CONFIDENT ON ADVISORY SNOW AMOUNTS (4 INCHES OR 
LESS). BUT THE THREAT OF SNOW LINGERS WELL INTO WEDNESDAY. 

BEST COURSE OF ACTION...PER COORDINATION...SEEMS TO BE A SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR NOW...AND LET DAY SHIFT RE-EVALUATE. WE WILL 
CARRY HIGH POPS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH SOME SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
MENTIONED IN THE FAVORED AREAS. 

OTHERWISE...LOW CLOUDS WILL BREAK-UP SO LATE TODAY...THAT MID AND 
HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE MOVING INTO THE REGION. THUS...UNDERCUT MOS FOR 
HIGHS TODAY...AND AGAIN ON TUESDAY WITH RAIN AND/OR SNOW COVERING 
MOST OF THE REGION.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT UPPER LOW MOVES FROM OHIO VALLEY INTO THE MID 
ATLANTIC WITH COLDER AIR WRAPPING AROUND IT INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION AND UP SLOPE FLOW TO CONTINUE SNOW SHOWERS 
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS THROUGH THOSE PERIODS 
DECREASING WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS IN THE 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA OF 3 TO 5 
INCHES POSSIBLE. TEMPERATURES MUCH COLDER TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. CLEARING BEGINS WEDNESDAY IN THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST BUT 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST MOSTLY CLOUDY UNTIL THURSDAY. THURSDAY UPPER 
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST WITH FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL INTO FRIDAY. MODELS 
DIVERGE FROM FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH ECMWF BRINGING SYSTEM 
BY TO THE SOUTH FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY AND DROPPING A COLD UPPER LOW 
INTO THE GREAT LAKES AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOISTURE 
MOVING INTO FORECAST AREA. GFS HAS SOUTHERN SYSTEM TO THE SOUTH BUT 
KEEPS SECOND SYSTEM TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH BENIGN 
WEATHER THROUGH WEEKEND. KEPT FORECAST SIMILAR TO BEFORE WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NORTH. &&

TO SOME WARMING ON TUESDAY...SO SNOW AMOUNTS ARE UNCERTAIN AT THIS 
TIME. SOMEWHAT CONFIDENT ON ADVISORY SNOW AMOUNTS (4 INCHES OR LESS) 
...BUT THE THREAT OF SNOW LINGERS WELL INTO WEDNESDAY. 

BEST COURSE OF ACTION...PER COORDINATION...SEEMS TO BE A SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR NOW...AND LET DAY SHIFT RE-EVALUATE. WE WILL 
CARRY HIGH POPS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH SOME SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
MENTIONED IN THE FAVORED AREAS. 

OTHERWISE...LOW CLOUDS WILL BREAK-UP SO LATE TODAY...THAT MID AND 
HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE MOVING INTO THE REGION. THUS...UNDERCUT MOS FOR 
HIGHS TODAY...AND AGAIN ON TUESDAY WITH RAIN AND/OR SNOW COVERING 
MOST OF THE REGION.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
WEDNESDAY NIGHT UPPER LOW MOVES FROM OHIO VALLEY INTO THE MID
ATLANTIC WITH COLDER AIR WRAPPING AROUND IT INTO THE FORECAST AREA.
GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION AND UP SLOPE FLOW TO CONTINUE SNOW SHOWERS
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS THROUGH THOSE PERIODS
DECREASING WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS IN THE
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA OF 3 TO 5
INCHES POSSIBLE. TEMPERATURES MUCH COLDER TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY. CLEARING BEGINS WEDNESDAY IN THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST BUT
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST MOSTLY CLOUDY UNTIL THURSDAY. THURSDAY
UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST WITH FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL INTO FRIDAY.
MODELS DIVERGE FROM FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH ECMWF BRINGING
SYSTEM BY TO THE SOUTH FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY AND DROPPING A COLD UPPER
LOW INTO THE GREAT LAKES AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOISTURE
MOVING INTO FORECAST AREA. GFS HAS SOUTHERN SYSTEM TO THE SOUTH BUT
KEEPS SECOND SYSTEM TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH BENIGN
WEATHER THROUGH WEEKEND. KEPT FORECAST SIMILAR TO BEFORE WITH
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NORTH.
&&

ON FRIDAY.  WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON ITS PATH...WILL KEEP  
FRIDAY DRY.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE NORTHERN ZONES ON 
SATURDAY...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR SATURDAY IN THE NORTH.  DRY 
WEATHER RETURNS ON SUNDAY.  TEMPERATURES STAYING BELOW NORMAL FOR 
MOST OF THE PERIOD.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 061552
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EST SAT FEB 6 2010

.DISCUSSION...WARM SURFACE CONDITIONS WILL HINDER SNOW ACCUMULATION
THIS AFTERNOON. TROF OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING EAST THROUGH THE AREA. 
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL THIS AFTERNOON AS WINDS SHIFT TO WNW. DROPPED 
NE TN VALLEYS FROM ADVISORY...REMAINDER OF AREAS WILL SEE 
ACCUMULATIONS BUT WILL BE ELEVATION DEPENDENT. FREEZING LEVEL WILL 
FALL TO NEAR 2000 FEET THIS AFTN. SON 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN ADJUSTMENTS TO FORECAST 
GRIDS WERE TO DELAY THE CHANGEOVER TO WINTRY PRECIPITATION 
(PCPN)...AS 08Z TEMPS STILL GENERALLY TOO WARM FOR SNOW...EXCEPT FOR 
A FEW SPOTS SUCH AS VJI (ABINGDON). COLD AIR ADVECTION IS WORKING 
EAST FROM MIDDLE TN...AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE MOSTLY SNOW 
FROM ABOUT 15Z TODAY ON. HOWEVER...AMOUNTS FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS STILL 
APPEAR ON TRACK WITH A REDUCTION IN PRE-12Z SNOW AMOUNT GRIDS DUE TO 
LATE CHANGEOVER. UPPER LOW/TROUGH WILL SEND A DECENT SHOT OF 
VORTICITY ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...WITH STRONG COLD AIR 
ADVECTION...BUT STILL NOT A STRONG LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW. 
THUS...KEPT WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AS BEFORE...BOTH IN AREA/TIME 
AND SNOW AMOUNTS. 

DON'T EXPECT MUCH SIGNIFICANT SNOW FOR TONIGHT...BUT DID KEEP POPS A 
LITTLE ABOVE MOS POPS. MAX TEMPS TODAY WILL OCCUR VERY EARLY...AND 
MINS TONIGHT WERE ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY UPWARD IN LINE WITH 00Z MOS 
(WHICH SEEMED REASONABLE GIVEN LINGERING CLOUDS).

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORT RANGE MODELS BRING WEAK 
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL ACROSS FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH CLEARING 
SKIES AND STILL COOL TEMPERATURES MAINLY UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. 
SUNDAY NIGHT COOLER NORTHEAST WITH SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY. ELSEWHERE 
HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTING EAST AND CLOUDS ALREADY BEGINNING TO INCREASE 
AHEAD OF NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. CLOUDS 
CONTINUE TO INCREASE MONDAY AHEAD OF PLAINS SYSTEM. RAIN AND SNOW 
DEVELOP MONDAY NIGHT. BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY AS FRONT APPROACHES. SYSTEM LOOKS TO GET WOUND UP TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT WITH COLD AIR WRAPPING IN BEHIND IT AND MORE SNOW 
POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN SECTIONS. HIGHER 
PRESSURE RESUMES THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH CONTINUED COLD 
TEMPERATURES BUT NO PRECIPITATION.

.AVIATION...SCATTERED RAIN OR MIXED PRECIPITATION (PCPN) WILL AFFECT

TRI. SURFACE TROUGH IS PUSHING EAST INTO THE VALLEY COUNTIES AT THIS 
TIME...WITH A SHIFT TO GUSTY WESTERLY WINDS. THIS HAS HELPED TO MIX 
OUT SOME OF THE LOWEST MOISTURE...ALLOWING CEILINGS TO LIFT. TAFS 
WERE ADJUSTED IN THE 12Z PACKAGE TO REFLECT THIS...AND ALSO TO 
HIGHLIGHT THE WIND SHIFT AND GUSTS.  

SEEMS TO BE TOO MUCH MOISTURE TO ALLOW SIGNIFICANT CLEARING TONIGHT
AND POSSIBLE FOR A MVFR DECK TO RE-DEVELOP WITH NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EST SAT FEB 6 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN ADJUSTMENTS TO FORECAST GRIDS 
WERE TO DELAY THE CHANGEOVER TO WINTRY PRECIPITATION (PCPN)...AS 08Z 
TEMPS STILL GENERALLY TOO WARM FOR SNOW...EXCEPT FOR A FEW SPOTS 
SUCH AS VJI (ABINGDON). COLD AIR ADVECTION IS WORKING EAST FROM 
MIDDLE TN...AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE MOSTLY SNOW FROM ABOUT 
15Z TODAY ON. HOWEVER...AMOUNTS FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS STILL APPEAR ON 
TRACK WITH A REDUCTION IN PRE-12Z SNOW AMOUNT GRIDS DUE TO LATE 
CHANGEOVER. UPPER LOW/TROUGH WILL SEND A DECENT SHOT OF VORTICITY 
ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION...
BUT STILL NOT A STRONG LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW. THUS...KEPT WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY AS BEFORE...BOTH IN AREA/TIME AND SNOW AMOUNTS. 

DON'T EXPECT MUCH SIGNIFICANT SNOW FOR TONIGHT...BUT DID KEEP POPS A 
LITTLE ABOVE MOS POPS. MAX TEMPS TODAY WILL OCCUR VERY EARLY...AND 
MINS TONIGHT WERE ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY UPWARD IN LINE WITH 00Z MOS 
(WHICH SEEMED REASONABLE GIVEN LINGERING CLOUDS).

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORT RANGE MODELS BRING
WEAK HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL ACROSS FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH
CLEARING SKIES AND STILL COOL TEMPERATURES MAINLY UPPER 30S TO MID
40S. SUNDAY NIGHT COOLER NORTHEAST WITH SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY.
ELSEWHERE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTING EAST AND CLOUDS ALREADY BEGINNING
TO INCREASE AHEAD OF NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES.
CLOUDS CONTINUE TO INCREASE MONDAY AHEAD OF PLAINS SYSTEM. RAIN AND
SNOW DEVELOP MONDAY NIGHT. BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION DURING THE
DAY TUESDAY AS FRONT APPROACHES. SYSTEM LOOKS TO GET WOUND UP
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WITH COLD AIR WRAPPING IN BEHIND IT AND
MORE SNOW POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN SECTIONS.
HIGHER PRESSURE RESUMES THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH CONTINUED COLD
TEMPERATURES BUT NO PRECIPITATION.

956 PM EST FRI FEB 5 2010

EXTENDED WINTER WEATHER ADVIS0RY INTO SOUTHEAST MONROE COUNTY.

.DISCUSSION...AN UPPER LOW IS LOCATED ACROSS THE MID-MISSISSIPPI
RIVER VALLEY WITH THE SURFACE LOW REFLECTION OVER CENTRAL KENTUCKY.
A SURFACE TROUGH IS LOCATED ACROSS THE PLATEAU COUNTIES WITH
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING SUPPORTING A BAND OF SHOWERS. AS UPPER LOW
MOVES TOWARD THE AREA...VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL COOL AND
SUPPORT A CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

ENOUGH LIFT...AND OROGRAPHIC FORCING...FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
ACROSS THE ADVISORY AREA. HAVE INCLUDED SOUTHEAST MONROE COUNTY AS
WELL INTO THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. MODELS SHOW UP TO 4-5 INCHES
THERE BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ACROSS THE FAVORED
WEST-NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES MAY APPROACH WARNING CRITERIA (6
INCHES FOR 24 HOURS).

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. HAVE A GOOD NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EST FRI FEB 5 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE NE 
OFF THE NC COAST TONIGHT. UPPER LOW WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS TN TN TO 
OVER MRX CWA EARLY SAT. LOW LEVEL TROF SLANTS WESTWARD FROM SFC LOW
TO UPPER LOW. WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO TAPER OFF THIS EVE AS LOW PULLS 
AWAY. MOUNTAIN WAVE MATERIALIZED BRIEFLY THIS AFTN CAUSING A JUMP IN 
TEMPS AND SOME WIND DAMAGE. WIDESPREAD LIQUID PCPN WILL CONTINUE TO 
GET SOME UPPER SUPPORT EARLY THIS EVENING BUT QPF LOOKS TOO LOW FOR 
FLOOD TROUBLE. MOISTURE WILL WRAP AROUND UPPER LOW AS IT MOVES INTO 
AREA TONIGHT. ADJUSTED TIMING ON WINTER SNOW ADVISORY TO PUSH IT 
BACK A FEW HOURS. FREEZING LEVEL WILL LOWER OVERNIGHT AND COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SAT. INITIAL MELTING MAY HINDER SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS TONIGHT. MOISTURE IN NOT IN FAVOR SNOW GROWTH REGION 
SO HEAVY SNOW ACCUMULATION NOT EXPECTED. SOME CAPE ALONG SMOKIES 
WILL AID BRIEF SHORT OF UPSLOPE SNOWS ON SAT. TEMPS WILL COOL LITTLE 
OVERNIGHT AND BE STEADY OR FALL SATURDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN SAT NGT AND SUNDAY. UPPER FLOW BECOMES NWRLY. CONDITIONS 
WILL DRY OUR WITH TEMPS BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  AN 
INVERTED TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY. RAIN SHOULD CHANGE SNOW MONDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE TUESDAY 
MORNING...THEN BACK TO RAIN.  WILL KEEP HIGH CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
TUESDAY.  A SHORTWAVE THEN TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY BRINGING MORE RAIN/SNOW CHANCES.  WILL KEEP THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AGAIN WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE 
LINGERS.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY.  
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA ON FRIDAY.  
WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON PATH...WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW.  
STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

102 
FXUS64 KMRX 050923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST FRI FEB 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LARGE AREA OF MOSTLY RAIN 
CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING.
AVAILABLE SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND A FEW PHONE CALLS...WOULD LIMIT 
ANY WINTRY MIX TO MAINLY PARTS OF RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES OF 
VA...AND ALSO PARTS OF JOHNSON AND CARTER COUNTIES OF NE TN. THESE 
AREAS MAY STILL HAVE A FEW SPOTS NEAR OR JUST BELOW 32 DEGREES WITH 
850 TEMPS JUST BELOW FREEZING. JOHNSON COUNTY TN WAS ONLY LOCATION 
GETTING ANY SNOW OR ICE PER CALLS. AFTER COORDINATION WITH 
NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES...HAVE OPTED TO REMOVE LEE COUNTY VA FROM 
THE CURRENT WINTER WX ADVISORY AND ALSO END THE ADVISORY AT 10 AM 
EST TODAY. DOWNPLAYED SNOW AND ICE AMOUNTS SOME IN UPDATED FORECAST 
GRIDS AND ADVISORY. MODELS SHOW SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL WARMING TO 
SUPPORT THIS DECISION AS PRECIPITATION (PCPN) SHOULD BE COMPLETELY 
RAIN AFTER MID MORNING.

OTHERWISE...WILL KEEP WIND ADVISORY AS ISSUED EARLIER...AS SURFACE 
GRADIENT REMAINS TIGHT INTO THE AFTERNOON AND MODELS SHOW LOW LEVEL 
JET OF AROUND 45 KNOTS. 

MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON PCPN TRANSITIONING BACK TO SNOW EARLY 
TONIGHT...ON BACK SIDE OF EXITING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. I ALSO PREFER 
MODELS THAT SHOW LINGERING SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND A VERY SLIGHT AMOUNT 
OF LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW WELL INTO SATURDAY. THUS...NUDGED POPS UP 
FOR TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...AS PERIODS OF SNOW OR SNOW SHOWERS 
CONTINUE. HAVE ISSUED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR FAVORED AREAS 
FOR TONIGHT AND SATURDAY. THOUGHT ABOUT A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR A 
FEW AREAS...BUT THIS DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A STRONG NW UPSLOPE FLOW 
EVENT AT THIS TIME...SO KEPT SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE ADVISORY RANGE. 

SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT HIGHS TODAY AND ALSO FAVORED THE COOLER MOS FOR 
SATURDAY MAXES. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SATURDAY NIGHT
PRECIPITATION ENDS FAIRLY QUICKLY AS LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES
NORTHEAST OUT INTO THE ATLANTIC. TEMPERATURES DROP INTO THE 20S.
FORECASTED LOWS SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE. SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. KEPT TEMPERATURES BELOW GUIDANCE
SUNDAY AS COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES WITH CLOUDS SLOWLY DECREASING.
SUNDAY NIGHT LOOKS CONTINUED COLD AS HIGH MOVES OVERHEAD AND SKIES
MOSTLY CLEAR. MONDAY SLIGHTLY WARMER AS HIGH SHIFTS EAST. MONDAY
NIGHT CLOUDS INCREASE AS NEW SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. THIS
SYSTEM IS WARM ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY RAIN TUESDAY THEN CHANGING TO SNOW
TUESDAY NIGHT BUT TEMPERATURES DO NOT DROP UNTIL MOST OF THE
MOISTURE MOVES OUT. WEDNESDAY HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE FORECAST
AREA AND CONTINUES DRY THROUGH THURSDAY.
&&

RAIN AND SLEET FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

662 
FXUS64 KMRX 042015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST THU FEB 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN STREAM 
SYNOPTIC SYSTEM CONTINUES TO SLOWLY PROGRESS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS FROM THE SOUTHWEST. ANTICIPATE PRECIP TO SLOWLY ADVANCE 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AS SYSTEM PROGRESSES AND DRY LAYERS IN THE 
LOWER LEVELS SLOWLY MOISTEN. HAVE CONTINUED CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
LATE FIRST PERIOD AND INTO THE SECOND PERIOD FOR THE ENTIRE CWA. 
STILL EXPECT THIS TO BE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT BUT HAVE SOME CONCERN 
THAT ISOLATED VALLEY LOCATIONS IN THE NORTHEAST ZONES MAY HAVE BRIEF 
PERIOD OF LIGHT SNOW AND/OR LIGHT FREEZING RAIN TOMORROW MORNING. 
THUS HAVE ISSUED ADVISORY FOR SOME OF OUR VIRGINIA COUNTIES AND THE 
NORTHERN MOUNTAIN ZONES. HAVE ALSO ISSUED WIND ADVISORY FOR EASTERN 
MOUNTAIN ZONES AS 850 MB WINDS APPROACH 50 KT PER MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS. OTHERWISE...TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN STEADY OR SLOWLY RISE 
OVERNIGHT IN WARM AIR ADVECTION REGIME. DOWNSLOPING FLOW SHOULD ALSO 
AID IN TEMP RISES IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AREA OF LOW
PRESSURE TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY NIGHT. WENT WITH
CATEGORICAL TO CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCES
IN THE NORTH. WITH COLD AIR ADVECTING IN...RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO
SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT. THE BEST CHANCE OF SNOW ACCUMULATION WILL BE
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE LINGERS INTO
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE
NORTH AGAIN WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE LINGERS. THE BEST CHANCE OF
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AGAIN. HIGH
PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.
AN INVERTED TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY.
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE RAIN/SNOW ON MONDAY THEN CHANGE TO SNOW
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING...THEN BACK TO RAIN. A FRONT
TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY BRINGING
MORE RAIN/SNOW CHANCES. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH
AGAIN WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE LINGERS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY.

1000 AM EST THU FEB 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES. FORECAST APPEARS GENERALLY ON TRACK AS
SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM CONTINUES TO APPROACH THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FROM THE SOUTHWEST. RADAR MOSAIC SHOWS
PRECIP RETURNS NEARING CHA AT THIS TIME. HOWEVER...MODEL TIME
HEIGHTS DEPICT QUITE DEEP LAYER OF DRY AIR IN THE LOWER AND MID
LEVELS. THUS ANTICIPATE IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO OVERCOME THIS DRY
LAYER AND ALLOW PRECIP TO REACH GROUND. DOWNSLOPE FLOW SHOULD ALSO
INHIBIT PRECIP INITIALLY IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS.
TIMING OF PRECIP PROGRESSION IN CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS REASONABLE
GIVEN THIS SCENARIO. TEMPS ALSO LOOK REASONABLE BASED ON CURRENT
TRENDS AND LATEST MAV/LAV GUIDANCE. NO CHANGES WARRANTED AT THIS
TIME.

891 
FXUS64 KMRX 040744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 AM EST THU FEB 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTING EAST OF 
THE REGION TODAY AS THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA.  
ASSOCIATED MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ALREADY INVADING THE MRX 
CWA...WITH PRECIP EXPECTED TO PUSH INTO SOUTHERN ZONES LATE AFTERNOON 
AND REACH INTO VA ZONES TONIGHT.  WARMING TEMPERATURES SHOULD KEEP 
PRECIP AS RAIN OVER MOST LOCATIONS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  
HOWEVER...THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE A MIX OF PRECIP WITH 
OCCASIONAL PERIODS OF SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN...SOME INITIAL SNOW 
FALL IS ALSO POSSIBLE.  MINOR ICE ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE IN A 
FEW LOCATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 3000 FEET...AND WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO 
COVER THIS.  ADDITIONALLY...STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS ACCOMPANYING THE 
SYSTEM WILL BRING BREEZY TO LOCALLY WINDY CONDITIONS TO THE 
AREA...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN...AS THE SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLDER AIR MOVING IN 
FRIDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE DEPARTING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL CHANGE 
RAIN SHOWERS TO SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT.  MAY HAVE SOME 
ACCUMULATIONS...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN WILL GO DRY SUNDAY AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT AS WE SHOULD BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS.  STILL QUITE A BIT OF 
UNCERTAINTY WITH EARLY WEEK SYSTEM...WITH MODEL CONTINUITY AND 
AGREEMENT LACKING.  FOR NOW WILL GO WITH AN ECMWF/GFS 
COMPROMISE...AND BRING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN MON AFTERNOON...THEN 
CHANCE POPS MON NIGHT THROUGH TUE NIGHT...THEN TAPERING POPS OFF A 
BIT WED.  STILL WAY TO EARLY TO PINPOINT PRECIP TYPE...BUT EARLY 
INDICATIONS ARE THAT AT LEAST SOME OF THE PRECIP WITH THIS EVENT MAY 
BE SNOW.  WILL MAKE SOME TWEAKS TO GFS MOS TEMPS...MAINLY TO LOWER A 
FEW DEGREES SOME PERIODS...BUT WILL NOT STRAY FAR OVERALL.

484 
FXUS64 KMRX 032029
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EST WED FEB 3 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LOW LEVEL CAP SLOWLY ERODING 
TODAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE DECREASING AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM 
THE NORTH. THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL SHIFT TO NORTHEAST OF THE 
AREA THURSDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE 
SW. HIGH CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT. MOISTURE WILL DEEPEN THURSDAY 
WITH LIGHT RAIN MOVING INTO SW PORTIONS OF THE AREA LATE THU. TEMPS 
NEAR NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN FORECAST 
ISSUE FOR THE LONG TERM CONTINUES TO BE SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM THAT 
TRANSLATES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY. AT THIS TIME...APPEARS THIS WILL BE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT 
AS THE BOUNDARY LAYER REMAINS GENERALLY WELL ABOVE FREEZING PER 
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND TIME HEIGHTS. STILL MAJOR TIMING ISSUES 
WITH THIS EVENT WITH GFS SIGNIFICANTLY FASTER THAN THE NAM. SREF 
TENDS TO SUPPORT THE GFS TIMING. TENDED TO SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE WITH 
RESPECT TO TIMING.

REMAINDER OF LONG TERM LOW CONFIDENCE AS MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
GENERAL DISAGREEMENT AND GEFS ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO EXHIBIT WIDE 
SPREAD WITH RESPECT TO ITS MEMBERS. THUS DID NOT MAKE ANY 
SUBSTANTIVE CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT 
DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE SINCE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS WERE 
APPROXIMATELY EQUALLY SPREAD AROUND OPERATIONAL GFS MEMBER.

&&

QUIET CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT WITH THE HIGH CONTINUING  
TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES ON 
THURSDAY...BRINGING UNSETTLED WEATHER INTO THE WEEKEND.  MODELS 
STILL HAVE SOME DISAGREEMENT ON THE DETAILS...BUT GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THAT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN FROM SOUTHWEST...WITH PRIMARY 
LOW THEN SHIFTING TO EAST COAST AND MOVING AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST.  
LOOKS LIKE MUCH OF THE EARLY PART OF THIS EVENT WILL BE RAIN...BUT 
THERE IS THE POSSIBILITY FOR A MIXED BAG OF PRECIP IN THE NORTH AND 
SOME OF THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS. THE PRECIP SHOULD CHANGE OVER TO 
MAINLY SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT...AND CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY NIGHT 
BEFORE ENDING.  WILL GO DRY SUNDAY...BUT NEXT SYSTEM MAY BE 
APPROACHING BY MONDAY.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH EARLY WEEK 
SYSTEM...SO UNCERTAINTY HIGH.  FOR NOW WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
MONDAY...THEN CHANCE POPS MON NIGHT AND TUE.  PRECIP TYPE CERTAINLY 
STILL IN QUESTION FOR THIS EVENT...BUT WILL NOT GET TOO CAUGHT UP IN 
THE DETAILS FOR THAT FAR OUT.

FXUS64 KMRX 022024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST TUE FEB 2 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)....SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY)...WEAK SURFACE LOW OFF THE SC COAST MOVES NE OFF INTO THE 
ATLANTIC AND LIGHT PRECIPITATION OVER THE NE SECTIONS WILL END BY 
EARLY EVENING. TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON REMAINED BELOW FORECAST 
FOR THE MOST PART...MAINLY IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. WINDS ARE 
CURRENTLY LIGHT WITH HIGHER PRESSURE OVER THE MS VALLEY WHICH WILL 
WORK ITS WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THE 
DRIER AIR WILL MAKE FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY WEDNESDAY. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND LIGHT WINDS TONIGHT WILL ALLOW FOG TO CONTINUE AND MAY 
BECOME DENSE IN A FEW AREAS. TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY HAVE TO DROP 5 
TO 10 DEGREES TO REACH NEAR FREEZING SO PATCHY ICE MAY REFORM ON WET 
ROADS. HAVE ISSUED AN SPS FOR THIS WHICH WILL AFFECT LOCALIZED AREAS 
LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGHS WEDNESDAY WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL SOUTH BUT STILL A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL NORTH WHERE SOME 
SNOW COVER REMAINS.   

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGING WILL 
GIVE WAY TO THE NEXT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM BY 12Z THURSDAY. MODELS 
ARE IN FAIR AGREEMENT IN MOVING SURFACE LOW INTO SOUTH ALABAMA BY 
12Z FRIDAY. MOISTURE WILL STREAM NORTHEAST OUT OF THE GULF OF MEXICO 
TOWARD THE AREA BY AFTER MIDNIGHT ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND BY EARLY 
FRIDAY...EXPECT DECENT AMOUNT OF QPF IN SOUTHERN AND SOUTHEAST 
COUNTIES. UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH EASTWARD INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY 
00Z SATURDAY...WITH UPPER LOW TAKING SHAPE OVER WESTERN KENTUCKY BY 
SAME TIME FRAME. 

ELONGATED AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AT SURFACE SHOULD BE SITUATED ALONG
NORTH CAROLINA COAST WITH A SECONDARY AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ACROSS
SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY BY 06Z SATURDAY. WILL SLOWLY LESSEN PRECIP
CHANCES FROM LIKELY CATEGORY TO UPPER END OF CHANCE POPS BY FRIDAY
EVENING AND INTO OVERNIGHT HOURS. COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE
REGION AFTER 00Z SATURDAY...AND EXPECT CHANGE OVER FROM -RA TO SNOW
SHOWERS ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. 

LIMITING FACTOR MAY BE PRECIPITABLE WATER AND AMOUNT OF MOISTURE
AVAILABLE. FORECAST SOUNDS INDICATE THAT PWAT VALUES DO DECREASE
FROM AROUND AN INCH TO A HALF OF AN INCH BY 06Z SATURDAY. DO FEEL
THAT WHAT MOISTURE IS IN THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE
SNOW SHOWERS AND WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR AMOUNTS. LATER PACKAGES
MAY HAVE TO DEAL WITH SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS...BUT STILL A LITTLE
TOO EARLY TO TELL INVOLVING TIMING OF COLD AIR INTRUDING SOUTHEAST
INTO THE AREA AS UPPER TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH AND AVAILABLE LEFT
OVER MOISTURE. STAY TUNED. 

HAVE UPPED POPS SOME FOR SATURDAY WITH UPPER TROUGH SWINGING
THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION. PROGRESSIVE UPPER FLOW WILL
RESULT IN A BRIEF TIME FRAME OF UPPER RIDGING ON SUNDAY AND INTO
MONDAY. NEXT UPPER LOW AND TROUGH WILL PUSH EAST THROUGH THE UPPER
PLAINS STATES TO THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES REGION BY 12Z TUESDAY.
TIMING WITH THIS SYSTEM IS MORE DIFFICULT AT THIS POINT...AND HAVE
DECIDED AT THIS TIME TO GO ALONG WITH THE SLOWER ECMWF MODEL AT
THIS TIME. HAVE INTRODUCED CHANCE POPS FOR FA FOR -RA/-SN SHOWERS
FOR TUESDAY...AS TEMPS COULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR JUST RAIN
INITIALLY...BUT EXPECTED COLD ADVECTION LATER IN THE DAY COULD
RESULT IN MIXTURE. 

WILL GO A LITTLE LOWER THAN GFS NUMBERS AT THIS TIME FOR EXTENDED
PACKAGE.

LOOK IN THE BALLPARK...SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

MAIN BAND OF ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL SLIDE THROUGH ON FRIDAY AND HAVE

MAINLY RAIN FOR THIS SYSTEM...THOUGH AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW IS POSSIBLE 
OVER THE NORTHEAST ZONES AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS...ESPECIALLY EARLY IN 
THE DAY.  DIRECTLY BEHIND THE SYSTEM...COOLER AIR AND AN UPPER LOW 
TO OUR NORTH SLIDES THROUGH FOR SATURDAY.  THIS WILL CONTINUE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE CWA...WITH PRECIP MIXING WITH OF 
CHANGING OVER TO LIGHT SNOW.  A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE

AGREEMENT FOR THE END OF THE PERIOD.  SOME MODELS INDICATES ANOTHER

HAVE LEFT THINGS DRY FOR NOW.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

630 
FXUS64 KMRX 020245
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EST MON FEB 1 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR INDICATING A 
FEW ECHOES TRACKING ACROSS THE WESTERN FRINGE OF THE CWA...BUT 
STILL TOO DRY IN THE LOW LEVELS FOR ANY PRECIPITATION TO REACH THE 
GROUND. SO CURRENT AFTER MIDNIGHT TIMING STILL LOOKS GOOD.  CLOUDS 
INCREASING ACROSS THE CWA SHOULD HELP SLOW DOWN TEMPERATURES 
FALLING. BUT CURRENT ADVISORY AREAS STILL LOOKS GOOD.  NOT PLANNING 
TO EXPAND THE ADVISORY AREA. PRECIPITATION TYPE AND POPS STILL 
LOOKS.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK.  NO 
CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...  

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE IS SHIFTING TO THE EAST THIS AFTERNOON. A LOW
PRESSURE WILL MOVE FROM NE FROM NEAR FLORIDA INTO THE ATLANTIC
OCEAN TONIGHT/TUESDAY. MOISTURE IS MOVING NORTH INTO THE SOUTHEAST AND
WILL BRING LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES
THIS AFTERNOON ARE IN THE 40S WITH A FEW SPOTS IN THE LOWER 50S
SOUTH. HAVE RAISED POPS TO LIKELY NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS. PRECIP
TYPE IS RAIN WITH SNOW EARLY AND NORTH MIXED IN AS TEMPERATURES FALL
FAIRLY RAPIDLY EARLY TONIGHT. FREEZING RAIN LOOKS LIKELY IN THE
VALLEY AREAS OF THE NORTHEAST WITH SNOW OR FREEZING RAIN HIGHEST
MOUNTAIN AREAS. QPF AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE AROUND ONE TENTH OR LESS.
THIS COULD STILL CAUSE TRAVEL PROBLEMS IN THE NORTHEAST AREAS.
WENT ON THE COOL SIDE FOR HIGHS TUESDAY AROUND 40 NORTH AND HIGHER
ELEVATIONS TO ABOUT 50 SOUTH. WILL ISSUE ZONES AND WSW SHORTLY. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS CONSISTENT IN INITIALLY HAVING TENNESSEE VALLEY IN RIDGING
PATTERN AT LOWER THROUGH UPPER LEVELS BY EARLY WEDNESDAY. WITH MORE
MODERATING PACIFIC AIR MOVING THROUGH THE AREA...WILL GO CLOSE TO
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS FAR AS
TEMPS ARE CONCERNED. PROGRESSIVE UPPER AIR PATTERN AND SOUTHERN
STREAM WILL REMAIN FOCUS OF LONG TERM FORECAST. 

NEXT STORM SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE REGION WILL BE SYSTEM MOVING
THROUGH FAR SOUTHWEST U.S. BY THURSDAY...WITH GULF MOISTURE OPENING
UP AND PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z
FRIDAY. LEANING TOWARD ECMWF/HPC WITH NEXT SYSTEM INVOLVING TIMING
AND PRECIP. MODELS ARE STILL NOT HANDLING TEMPS WELL DUE TO SNOW
COVER. 

FROM TRI CITIES AREA NORTHWARD AND ALONG KY/TN BORDER...WILL HAVE
TO BETTER TIME PRECIP BEGINNING AND TYPE FOR EARLY FRIDAY MORNING.
NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH AT THIS TIME TO MAKE MUCH IN WAY OF CHANGES
TO GOING FORECAST INVOLVING PRECIP TYPE. WANT TO SEE ANOTHER MODEL
RUN OR TWO TO SEE SOME CONSISTENCY BEFORE REALLY MAKING MANY
CHANGES TO EXTENDED PORTION OF FORECAST. FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND
BUFKIT DATA MAINTAIN COLD TEMPS AT OR BELOW ZERO CELSIUS IN TRI
CITIES AREA AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR FRIDAY AND INTO SATURDAY. 

MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT SURFACE LOW MOVING OUT OF SOUTH TEXAS BY
12Z THURSDAY TO THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO BY 12Z FRIDAY. DO
EXPECT ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENING DURING THE DAY BY FRIDAY
ACROSS THE AREA. WILL CONTINUE BASED UPON FORECAST SOUNDINGS FROM
GFS/NAM FOR MIXED PRECIP AT THIS TIME FOR THURSDAY NIGHT PRIOR TO
STRONGER WARM ADVECTION DEVELOPING BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

MODELS ARE SIMILAR IN PUSHING SURFACE LOW NORTHEAST TO NEAR CAPE 
HATTERAS NORTH CAROLINA BY 12Z SATURDAY...WITH INVERTED TROUGH SPREADING 
BACK TO THE WEST ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA.

WILL CONTINUE WITH NEAR AND LIKELY CHANCE POPS FORECAST AREA WIDE 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...AND AM CONCERNED ABOUT CHANCES FOR SNOW CHANGE OVER 
AS COLD AIR ADVECTS SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA. A LITTLE TOO EARLY TO 
TELL INVOLVING ANY AMOUNTS AND WILL CONTINUE WITH EXPECTED CHANGE 
OVER FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT FOR THE SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST COUNTIES... 
WITH MOSTLY MIXED PRECIP AT THIS TIME.THIS WILL BEAR WATCHING 
CLOSELY. 

WILL ALSO CONTINUE WITH AT LEAST CHANCE POPS FOR WEEKEND WITH
NORTHWEST FLOW SETTING UP AND SOME SNOW SHOWERS BECOMING POSSIBLE
IN HIGH TERRAIN AND RAIN/SNOW MIX IN VALLEY AREAS. SNOW WILL BE
ALSO MORE LIKELY ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
BASED UPON LATEST FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND BUFKIT DATA ESPECIALLY FOR
SATURDAY AND POTENTIALLY INTO SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EST MON FEB 1 2010

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND MID 
ATLANTIC STATES WILL CONTINUE TO SHIFT EAST THIS AFTERNOON AND 
TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING WERE IN THE TEENS AND 20S WITH  
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ACTUALLY WARMER IN THE LOWER TO MID 30S. UPDATED 
HOURLY TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS IN THE GRIDS OTHERWISE CURRENT 
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD WITH HIGHS MAINLY 40S TO NEAR 50. HIGHER 
ELEVATION AREAS SHOULD STAY IN THE 30S WITH THE CONSIDERABLE SNOW 
COVER. CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY INCREASE BUT BE THIN MOST OF THE DAY.   
TONIGHT MOISTURE MOVING NORTH FROM A LOW PRESSURE AREA NEAR THE GULF 
COAST WILL SPREAD RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA. ALSO SOME FREEZING 
RAIN OR SNOW COULD FALL ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AREA WHERE TEMPERATURES MAY BE AT OR BELOW FREEZING AT THE 
ONSET BUT SHOULD WARM ABOVE FREEZING BY MID MORNING. NO CHANGES TO 
CURRENT FORECAST.

862 
FXUS64 KMRX 010853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST MON FEB 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE OFF TO 
THE EAST TODAY.  WEAK LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE FROM NE FROM NEAR GULF 
COAST INTO ATLANTIC OCEAN TONIGHT/TUESDAY...AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
MOVES ACROSS OUR AREA.  THIS WILL PULL SOME MOISTURE NORTH INTO OUR 
AREA...AND MAY BRING SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION.  UNCERTAINTY IS HIGH 
WITH DETAILS OF THIS SYSTEM...AS MODEL CONTINUITY AND AGREEMENT IS 
GENERALLY LACKING.  WILL GENERALLY GO WITH HPC AND FAVOR SREF 
SOLUTION...WHICH IS DRIER THAN 00Z NAM OR GFS.  THUS WILL TREND POPS 
UP...BUT WILL KEEP THEM NO HIGHER THAN CHANCE...WITH HIGHEST POPS 
OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  PRECIP TYPE IS PROBLEMATIC AS WELL.  
TEMPS SHOULD FALL FAIRLY RAPIDLY EARLY TONIGHT...THEN MAY SEE SOME 
RISE LATE.  THERMAL PROFILES SUGGEST MAINLY RAIN/FREEZING RAIN 
DEPENDING ON SURFACE TEMPS...ALTHOUGH SLEET AND SNOW CANNOT BE RULED 
OUT...ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST ZONES AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF MOUNTAINS. 
THIS SITUATION CERTAINLY BEARS WATCHING EVEN THOUGH QPF AMOUNTS 
SHOULD BE LIGHT...GIVEN POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING RAIN.  BEST CHANCES 
FOR ANY FREEZING RAIN APPEAR TO BE IN THE NORTHEAST ZONES.  WILL 
ISSUE SPS FOR THIS POTENTIAL WINTRY PRECIP.  WILL UNDERCUT SOME MAV 
TEMPS SLIGHTLY...BUT WILL NOT STRAY FAR OVERALL.    

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ECMWF/GFS RELATIVELY 
CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF LONG TERM PERIOD. EARLY WEEK SHORT WAVE MAKES 
ITS EXIT TUESDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE THROUGH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS 
IN FOR A DRY TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ADDED SLIGHT AND 
LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY 
AS UPPER TROF AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. ALSO ADJUSTED  
POPS HIGHER FOR THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY WITH MODEL DEPICTION OF 
DEEPENING NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO SURFACE LOW TAKING EAST NORTHEAST 
TRACK INTO THE DEEP SOUTH WITH DYNAMIC AND ISENTROPIC LIFT 
STRENGTHENING DURING THE DAY. MIXED PRECIP MAY OCCUR THURSDAY NIGHT 
PRIOR TO STRONGER WAA DEVELOPING ON FRIDAY. SURFACE LOW CONTINUES TO 
DEEPEN AS IT SHIFTS JUST OFF THE CAROLINA COAST FRIDAY NIGHT. 
INVERTED SURFACE TROF EXTENDS BACK ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WHILE ADDITIONAL UPPER LEVEL ENERGY DRIVES EAST FROM THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THEREFORE HELD ONTO 
MEDIUM AND HIGH CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT AS COLDER AIR SPILLS IN 
BEHIND MAIN SYSTEM. MOST LIKELY THERE WILL BE A TRANSITION FROM RAIN 
TO SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT WITH NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPING. MAINTAINED THE 
IDEA OF KEEPING POPS GOING SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AS MODELS SHOW 
ENERGETIC NORTHWEST FLOW WITH SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AND RAIN OR SNOW IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS...WITH THE FROZEN 
VARIETY MORE LIKELY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. TRENDED TEMP FORECAST TOWARD NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  34  49  29  52 /   0  40  30   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  33  47  28  49 /   0  40  40  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  32  48  27  49 /   0  30  30  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  27  43  24  45 /   0  40  40  10  10

114 
FXUS64 KMRX 010222
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 PM EST SUN JAN 31 2010

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER UNDER A CLEAR SKY. THE COLD  
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK...NO 
CHANGES NEEDED. STILL A RISK BLACK ICE TONIGHT SO WILL CONTINUE THE 
SPS GOING.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT WILL PROVIDE CLEAR SKIES AND
CALM WINDS. WITH SNOW COVER ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA...TEMPERATURES
WILL FALL QUICKLY WITH SUNSET...INTO THE TEENS JUST ABOUT
EVERYWHERE. WILL HAVE LOW TEMPS TONIGHT A FEW DEGREES BELOW MOS
GUIDANCE. WITH MELTING SNOW KEEPING THE ROADS WET AND RE- FREEZING
TONIGHT...BLACK ICE APPEARS LIKELY. WILL ISSUE AN SPS FOR THIS.

ON MONDAY THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...AND A 300 MB 
JET STEAK NEAR THE TX COAST MOVES NORTHEAST. THIS SHOULD BRING 
INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS TO THE AREA LATE IN THE DAY. WITH CONTINUED 
SNOW COVER...WENT ON THE COOLER SIDE OF THE MOS GUIDANCE...AND A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW IN THE NORTH. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SHORT RANGE MODELS DEVELOP LOW PRESSURE OFF FLORIDAS GULF COAST
MONDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS FLORIDA TUESDAY MORNING. THIS SYSTEM IS
PULLED NORTHEAST OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST BY WEDNESDAY MORNING.
MOISTURE WILL MOVE QUICKLY NORTHEAST MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.
EXPECTING MOSTLY RAIN ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS. THERE
COULD BE A BRIEF BIT OF WINTER WEATHER MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE
TEMPERATURE WARMS SOUTH. ALSO TUESDAY MORNING IN THE MOUNTAINS.
LOWS SHOULD COME EARLY MONDAY NIGHT WITH STEADY TO RISING
TEMPERATURES AFTER MIDNIGHT. TUESDAY CHANCE OF RAIN MAINLY MORNING
HOURS BUT INTO AFTERNOON EASTERN MOUNTAINS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD IN WEDNESDAY AND CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY WITH TEMPERATURES
NEAR NORMAL. THEN NEXT SYSTEM STARTS DIGGING AN UPPER TROUGH OVER
THE CENTRAL STATES THURSDAY. RIDGING SLIDES EAST OF THE FORECAST
AREA. LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MS VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT WILL SPLIT
WITH ONE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING NE AND ANOTHER MOVING FROM THE
GULF OF MEXICO INTO THE ATLANTIC BY SATURDAY. INITIALLY
PRECIPITATION WILL BE MOSTLY RAIN BUT THEN AS COLDER AIR WORKS IN
OVER THE WEEKEND BEHIND LOW OFF THE COAST. THERE WILL BE A BETTER
CHANCE FOR SNOW BOTH IN THE MOUNTAINS AND LOWER ELEVATIONS.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

GUIDANCE. WITH MELTING SNOW KEEPING THE ROADS WET AND RE- FREEZING
TONIGHT...BLACK ICE APPEARS LIKELY. WILL ISSUE AN SPS FOR THIS.

ON MONDAY THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...AND A 300 MB 
JET STEAK NEAR THE TX COAST MOVES NORTHEAST. THIS SHOULD BRING 
INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS TO THE AREA LATE IN THE DAY. WITH CONTINUED 
SNOW COVER...WENT ON THE COOLER SIDE OF THE MOS GUIDANCE...AND A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW IN THE NORTH. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SHORT RANGE MODELS DEVELOP LOW PRESSURE OFF FLORIDAS GULF COAST
MONDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS FLORIDA TUESDAY MORNING. THIS SYSTEM IS
PULLED NORTHEAST OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST BY WEDNESDAY MORNING.
MOISTURE WILL MOVE QUICKLY NORTHEAST MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.
EXPECTING MOSTLY RAIN ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS. THERE
COULD BE A BRIEF BIT OF WINTER WEATHER MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE
TEMPERATURE WARMS SOUTH. ALSO TUESDAY MORNING IN THE MOUNTAINS.
LOWS SHOULD COME EARLY MONDAY NIGHT WITH STEADY TO RISING
TEMPERATURES AFTER MIDNIGHT. TUESDAY CHANCE OF RAIN MAINLY MORNING
HOURS BUT INTO AFTERNOON EASTERN MOUNTAINS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD IN WEDNESDAY AND CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY WITH TEMPERATURES
NEAR NORMAL. THEN NEXT SYSTEM STARTS DIGGING AN UPPER TROUGH OVER
THE CENTRAL STATES THURSDAY. RIDGING SLIDES EAST OF THE FORECAST
AREA. LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MS VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT WILL SPLIT
WITH ONE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING NE AND ANOTHER MOVING FROM THE
GULF OF MEXICO INTO THE ATLANTIC BY SATURDAY. INITIALLY
PRECIPITATION WILL BE MOSTLY RAIN BUT THEN AS COLDER AIR WORKS IN
OVER THE WEEKEND BEHIND LOW OFF THE COAST. THERE WILL BE A BETTER
CHANCE FOR SNOW BOTH IN THE MOUNTAINS AND LOWER ELEVATIONS.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

DGS/TD

FXUS64 KMRX 311454 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
954 AM EST SUN JAN 31 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS ARE HANGING ONTO THE EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA A BIT
LONGER THAN EXPECTED...BUT THE TREND HAS BEEN FOR THESE CLOUDS TO
ERODE ON THEIR WESTERN EDGE. SO THE CURRENT FORECAST WORDING OF
BECOMING SUNNY STILL LOOKS REASONABLE. FORECAST TEMPERATURES ARE
CLOSE TO OBSERVATIONS...SO NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED THIS MORNING.
MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD SEE TEMPS IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S BY
NOON...WHICH SHOULD HELP REDUCE THE ICE ON ROADS IN MOST SPOTS
OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

764 
FXUS64 KMRX 310731
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 AM EST SUN JAN 31 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN AT 
THE SURFACE WITH WEAK RIDGE BUILDING IN ALOFT.  REMAINING LOW CLOUDS 
SHOULD CLEAR OUT FAIRLY QUICKLY...ALLOWING FOR A SUNNY AFTERNOON.  A 
FEW HIGH CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN OVERNIGHT...BUT STILL MAINLY CLEAR.  
SINCE THE PRECIP HAS ENDED ACROSS THE AREA...WILL CANCEL WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY.  WITH AT LEAST SOME SNOW COVER OVER MOST OF THE 
AREA...WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A BIT BOTH PERIODS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WENT WITH NAM12 IN FIRST PART 
AND GFS IN LATER PERIODS. MID LEVEL TROF STILL DIGGING A BIT JUST TO 
THE WEST BUT THIS WILL MOVE OUT QUICKLY AND BE REPLACED BY SHORT 
RIDGING FIRST PART OF WEEK. HOWEVER WATER VAPOR LOOPS SHOW THE RIDGE 
TO BE QUITE NARROW AND SO EXPECT GFS DEPICTION OF WEAK FRONT ON 
TUESDAY TO COME TO PASS. SCALED BACK POPS IN THE SOUTH AND KEPT IN 
MAINLY MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT NARROW STRIP OF FOOTHILLS. NEXT SYSTEM 
COMES AROUND THURSDAY AND DOEST NOT REALLY EXIT UNTIL SATURDAY. 
ADJUSTED POPS TO ACCOUNT FOR MOVEMENT OF SYSTEM THROUGH AREA, AND 
RAISED A HAIR BUT KEPT THEM IN THE CHANGE CATEGORY THIS FAR OUT. 
HOPEFULLY WITH TEMPS ON THE WARM SOME OF THE SNOW PACK WILL MELT OR 
SUBLIMATE AND THE RAIN NEXT WEEK WILL NOT CAUSE FLOODING. HOWEVER 
GROUND IS SATURATED AND STREAMFLOWS ARE ALREADY ABOVE AVERAGE FOR 
THE SEASON. WILL WATCH CAREFULLY.


&&

235 
FXUS64 KMRX 310215
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST SAT JAN 30 2010

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING LIGHT SNOW EXITING EAST OUT THE AREA. 
IT SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA AROUND MIDNIGHT...SO WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE PRECIPITATION FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT.  WILL KEEP 
THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING FOR TONIGHT WITH THE HAZARDOUS 
ROAD CONDITIONS FOR TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
IR SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS AN AREA OF -16C CLOUD TOPS ACROSS EASTERN 
AND CENTRAL KY...MOVING TOWARD THE SE. COINCIDENT WITH THIS 
FEATURE...THE MODELS SHOW SOME DEEPER MOISTURE AND THE 700 MB TROUGH 
AXIS. AS IT MOVES ACROSS THIS EVENING...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS OR 
FLURRIES CAN BE EXPECTED. LOCATIONS NORTH AND EAST OF KNOXVILLE MAY 
SEE UP TO ONE INCH OF ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION. PRECIP SHOULD END BY 
MIDNIGHT AS MODELS SHOW DRYING ALOFT AND MUCH SHALLOWER MOISTURE.

THE PRIMARY CONCERN OVERNIGHT WILL BE ROAD CONDITIONS. MOST ROADS 
ACROSS THE AREA ARE EITHER SNOW COVERED OR ARE SLUSHY OR ARE VERY 
WET FROM MELTED SNOW. COLD ADVECTION OVERNIGHT WILL DROP 
TEMPERATURES DOWN INTO THE TEENS TO LOWER 20S...ALLOWING THE SLUSH 
ON THE ROADS TO RE-FREEZE. 

WILL KEEP A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING FOR THE ENTIRE AREA UNTIL 
NOON SUNDAY FOR BLACK ICE EVERYWHERE AND FOR LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS 
NORTH THIS EVENING.

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE AREA WILL PROVIDE SUNNY SKIES BY 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WENT A LITTLE BELOW GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS 
TOMORROW TO ACCOUNT FOR THE SNOW COVER IN THE NORTH. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
SHORT-WAVE RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY. WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD SUNDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES COLD.
WENT BELOW GUIDANCE. SINGLE DIGITS MOUNTAINS AND NORTH WHERE THERE
IS SUBSTANTIAL SNOW COVER. MONDAY SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR WITH A WARMING
TREND WITH HIGHS ABOUT 5 DEGREES WARMER THAN SUNDAY. MONDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO MOVE EAST. A WEAK FRONT WILL CROSS THE
REGION TUESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN AND SNOW SOUTH AND
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. HIGH PRESSURE BRIEFLY REASSERTS ITSELF
WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY ANOTHER SYSTEM WHICH BEGIN DEVELOPING OVER THE
SOUTHWEST WEDNESDAY WILL SPREAD CLOUDS AND RAIN WITH SNOW MOUNTAINS
SOUTH AND POSSIBLY NORTHEAST THIRD. WARMEST DAY SHOULD BE THURSDAY
WITH RAIN MOST AREAS. THURSDAY NIGHT LOOKS LIKE A CHANCE OF SNOW IN
THE MOUNTAINS MAINLY. FRIDAY WILL BE SIMILAR TO THURSDAY. COLDER
AIR WORKS IN ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM FRIDAY NIGHT AND
SATURDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW MOST AREAS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

1210 PM EST SAT JAN 30 2010

.AVIATION...
EXPECT THAT THE CURRENT CONDITIONS AT TYS AND CHA...LOW CEILINGS
AND DRIZZLE...WILL PERSIST FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. AT TRI...A
LOW LEVEL SOUTEHASTERLY WIND OFF THE MOUNTAINS IS KEEP CEILINGS
HIGHER. BUT AS WINDS SHIFT TO A MORE NORTHERLY DIRECTION...EXPECT
THAT LOW CLOUDS WILL BECOME PREVALENT. VISIBILITIES SHOULD RISE
OVERNIGHT BUT CEILINGS WILL REMAIN LOW AT ALL SITES...PREDOMINANTLY
IN THE MVFR RANGE...THOUGH IFR WILL BE POSSIBLE. DRIER AIR MOVES IN
TOMORROW MORING...WHICH SHOULD SCATTER OUT THE CLOUDS.

AFTERNOON...AND TEMPERATURES ARE NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING...SO WILL
KEEP THE WARNING GOING IN THAT AREA. NE TN AND SW VA COULD SEE A
COUPLE MORE INCHES OF ACCUMULATION BEFORE IT ENDS.
