846 
FXUS64 KMRX 300844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EST SAT JAN 30 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HAVE HAD A MIXED BAG OF PRECIP 
OVER MUCH OF THE AREA...WITH MAINLY SNOW NORTH...AND FREEZING 
RAIN/SLEET/SNOW FURTHER SOUTH.  SOME AREAS FAR SOUTH HAVE BEEN PLAIN 
RAIN AT TIMES.  SNOW HAS BEEN HEAVY AT TIMES...AND SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATIONS HAVE OCCURRED.  OF COURSE THE MIXED PRECIP HAS LIMITED 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS TO LOWER VALUES THAN EXPECTED OVER AT LEAST 
CENTRAL AREAS...AND WHERE RAIN/FREEZING RAIN HAS OCCURRED THE SNOW 
HAS COMPACTED SO GETTING ACCURATE MAX SNOW DEPTHS WILL BE 
DIFFICULT.  MIXED PRECIP SHOULD CONTINUE INTO TODAY...WITH PRECIP 
INTENSITIES BECOMING LIGHT. TEMPS SHOULD NOT RISE MUCH...AND MAY
FALL A BIT THIS AFTERNOON. SHOULD SEE A TRANSITION TO MORE SNOW AS
THE DAY PROGRESSES. ALTHOUGH THE BULK OF THE PRECIP WILL BE DONE BY
MORNING...WILL KEEP WINTER STORM WARNINGS UP FOR NOW GIVEN
POSSIBILITY OF SOME ICE ACCUMULATION ALONG WITH THE SNOW. ANY
LINGERING PRECIP SHOULD END THIS EVENING...AND SKY SHOULD BEGIN TO
CLEAR AFTER MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AS THIS PART OF THE FORECAST 
BEGINS...THE UPPER TROF IS EXITING TO THE NE...AS A SHORT-WAVE RIDGE 
BUILDS IN.  HOWEVER...RIDGE SWEEPS RIGHT THRU AND NEXT SYSTEM IS 
ALREADY MOVING IN BY TUESDAY...THEN ANOTHER ONE FOR THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY.  

DETAILS...FOR SUNDAY LOOKS LIKE SUBSIDENCE HAS ERODED LOTS OF 
MOISTURE OUT OF THE AREA...SO EVEN THOUGH UPSLOPE WIND WILL STILL BE 
OCCURRING INTO MOUNTAINS...LOOKS TOO DRY FOR ANY ADDITIONAL SNOW OR 
FLURRIES. WILL KEEP SOME ADDED CLOUDS THERE OVER THE MOUNTAINS FOR 
THE MORNING.  FOR TEMPS WILL GO BELOW GUIDANCE ON HIGH TEMPS FOR 
BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY...FIGURING SNOW/SLEET COVER AND/OR WET GROUND 
WILL SUPPRESS HEATING.

GFS SEEMS TO BE ODD-ONE OUT ON HIGHER POPS FOR TUESDAY AS MOST 
MODELS KEEP PRECIP CLOSER TO CORE OF SYSTEM TO SE. WILL PUT IN LIGHT 
POPS IN SE ZONES...AND TAPER OFF TO NW.  

FOR SYSTEM ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...FAIRLY COOL AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...WILL PROBABLY HAVE SOME OF THE PRECIP IN THE FORM OF SNOW OR 
FLURRIES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NORTHEAST PART OF CWA AS 
WELL...AND POSSIBLY FARTHER SOUTH...WILL NEED TO WATCH AS IT GETS 
CLOSER.



&&

048 
FXUS64 KMRX 292000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST FRI JAN 29 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)
THE MAJOR SNOW EVENT IS UNDERWAY...WITH 2 INCHES ALREADY REPORTED IN 
THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. EXPECT THAT SOME OF THIS SNOW WILL 
START TO MIX WITH RAIN AND/OR SLEET AFTER 00Z. HOWEVER GIVEN THE 
EARLY ONSET OF SNOW IN THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU...WILL PUT MARION COUNTY 
INTO THE WINTER STORM WARNING. 

STRONG LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS AND AGEOSTROPHIC 
VERTICAL CIRCULATIONS IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET 
WILL MOVE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. MODELS AGREE IN OVER 1 INCH LIQUID 
QPF ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...AND WITH 
A 10:1 RATIO...OVER 10 INCHES ARE EXPECTED IN THE NORTHERN HALF. 
SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE BUMPED UP SLIGHTLY FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH. THE 
SOUTHERN HALF IS A DIFFERENT STORY AS THE NAM AND GFS SHOW A WARM 
NOSE DEVELOPING BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z WHILE SURFACE COLD AIR IS 
SUPPLIED AROUND THE SOUTHERN END OF THE APPALACHIANS. EXPECT THAT 
THERE WILL BE A CHANGE TO MAINLY SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN IN THE 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES...AND WITH LIFT REMAINING FAIRLY STRONG DURING 
THIS TIME OVER NC...OUR SW NC COUNTIES COULD SEE A QUARTER INCH ICE 
ACCUMULATION. WILL ADD EASTERN POLK COUNTY TO THE WARNING AS A 
RESULT.

PRECIP BEGINS TO END SATURDAY MORNING WHEN DRY AIR MOVES INTO THE 
-10C TO -20C LEVEL...PREVENT ICE NUCLEATION. HOWEVER PLENTY OF LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS ALONG WITH LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE FOR LIFT. 
THIS SHOULD RESULT IN DRIZZLE AND FREEZING DRIZZLE ON SATURDAY IN 
THE SOUTHERN HALF. MOISTURE ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEPARTING LOW 
AND THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL KEEP SOME LIGHT SNOW 
IN THE NORTH SATURDAY EVENING. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MUCH BETTER CONDITIONS
SUNDAY AS UPPER LEVEL TROUGH EXITS AND BUILDING RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE TAKES OVER. TEMPERATURES STILL COLD WITH SNOW COVER OVER
MOST IF NOT ALL OF CWA. CENTER OF HIGH OVERHEAD SUNDAY NIGHT AND
WITH SNOW ON GROUND UNDERCUT GUIDANCE FOR LOWS FROM 5 TO 15
DEGREES. UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD MONDAY SO HIGHS WARMER MID 30S NORTH
TO NEAR 50 SOUTH. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE A WEAK
SHORT WAVE AND COLD FRONT WILL REACH THE REGION TUESDAY. HAVE
MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM MOVES
OUT QUICK WITH RIDGING WEDNESDAY.

THURSDAY ANOTHER STRONGER STORM SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER TX WEDNESDAY
AND THEN MOVES EAST ALONG THE GULF THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. EXPECTING
THIS SYSTEM TO BE WARMER BUT SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.
DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM IT MAY
PRODUCE MORE WINTERY PRECIP IF IT FOLLOWS A MORE SOUTHERN TRACK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
909 AM EST FRI JAN 29 2010

.DISCUSSION...
WILL BE UPDATING THE WINTER STORM WARNING TO ADD A FEW
COUNTIES...BLEDSOE...SEQUATCHIE...RHEA...MEIGS...MCMINN...AND
MONROE. THE NAM CONTIUES TO SHOW A BAND OF STRONG FRONTOGENESIS
ACROSS THIS AREA FROM 00Z TO 06Z...AND NAM BUFR SOUNDINGS AT CSV
INDICATE THAT THE ENTIRE TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE BELOW
FREEZING. THE 09Z SREF ALSO BRINGS SUB-FREEZING SURFACE TEMPS DOWN
INTO THESE COUNTIES. WILL HAVE SNOW AND SLEET AMOUNTS IN THE 3-6
INCH RANGE HERE. 

TIMING OF THE ONSET OF PRECIP STILL LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. THE
PRECIP SEEN ON RADAR IS NOT YET REACHING THE GROUND IN OUR AREA AS
A LOW LEVEL DRY LAYER MUST BE OVERCOME. SNOW IS NOW BEING REPORTED
AT BNA...AND OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES WILL LIKELY SEE SOME SNOW START
AROUND NOON. BUT IT SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT UNTIL MID TO LATE
AFTERNOON. WILL BUMP UP THE AFTERNOON SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE
PLATEAU...BUT THE 3 PM START TIME FOR THE WARNING AND ADVISORY
LOOKS GOOD.

TEMPERATURES LOOK TO BE ON TRACK AS WELL...IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT
FORECAST AND LATEST MODEL GUIDANCE. 

WILL ISSUE THE NEW WSW SHORTLY...FOLLOWED BY THE ZFP UPDATE.

369 
FXUS64 KMRX 290902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST FRI JAN 29 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT IN BRINGING MAJOR WINTER STORM TO THE AREA.  SOME 
DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS...WITH NAM BEING A BIT SLOWER TO BRING 
PRECIP IN...AND SOME DIFFERENCES IN EXACT AXIS OF HEAVIEST PRECIP AS 
WELL AS THERMAL PROFILES.  HOWEVER...GOOD AGREEMENT THAT WE WILL SEE 
QPF ON THE ORDER OF AN INCH...OR MORE...AND THAT NORTHERN AREAS 
SHOULD BE ALL SNOW.  STILL MAY BE SOME SLEET OR EVEN RAIN MIXING IN 
IN CENTRAL AREAS...BUT DURING MAIN PRECIP SHOULD BE MAINLY SNOW...AS 
LIFT SHOULD BE QUITE STRONG.  FURTHER SOUTH...VERY DIFFICULT 
FORECAST WITH NAM INDICATING SIGNIFICANT SNOW FOR A PERIOD EARLY 
TONIGHT...BUT GFS SHOWING MUCH MORE RAIN.  FOR NOW WILL GO FOR A MIX 
IN THE SOUTH...BUT KEEP WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UP.  WILL DELAY 
ONSET OF PRECIP AND START OF ACCUMULATIONS A BIT...AND WILL TRIM A 
COUPLE OF HOURS OFF OF THE START OF THE WINTER STORM WARNING.  
OTHERWISE...NO MAJOR CHANGES TO THE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROF AXIS 
ALIGNED WITH SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT WITH PROGRESSIVE 
TRANSIT TO THE ATLANTIC COAST BY 12Z SUNDAY. SLIGHTLY TWEAKED POPS 
HIGHER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM EXITS PRODUCING LIGHT SNOW 
MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW MUCH IMPROVED WEATHER FOR SUNDAY IN TERMS OF DRYING 
AND BUILDING LOW LEVEL RIDGE. STILL SHOULD BE A RATHER CHILLY DAY 
WITH SOME SNOW COVER AND CONTINUATION OF CAA. UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD ON 
MONDAY AWAITING NEXT WEAK SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT DUE 
IN THE FORECAST AREA AROUND TUESDAY. STAYED WITH A LOW CHANCE POP 
WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE BRACKET FOR MONDAY NIGHT FOR POSSIBLE QUICKER 
ARRIVAL AND ON TUESDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM MAKES ITS EXIT INTO THE 
CAROLINAS. ANOTHER BRIEF BREAK IN THE ACTION EXPECTED FOR WEDNESDAY 
AS RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE REGION. STAYED WITH LATE WEEK STORM 
SYSTEM CONCEPT WHICH FEATURES ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE AND 
NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WHICH SHIFTS EAST 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH ON THURSDAY. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH 
EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
THIS SYSTEM WHICH MAY PRODUCE MORE WINTERY PRECIP DUE TO ITS DEEP 
SOUTH TRACK. UNDERCUT MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE WHICH IS TOO OPTIMISTIC 
THROUGH MONDAY WITH POSSIBILITY OF A PERSISTANT SNOW COVER 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. TRENDED 
TEMPS A LITTLE CLOSER TO GUIDANCE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       39  30  35  19  34 /  90 100  70  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  29  32  15  30 /  50 100  90  40   0

228 
FXUS64 KMRX 290301
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST THU JAN 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. TEMPS HAVE A WAY TO GO TO REACH
FCST MINS BUT CAA LOOKS GOOD. DPS FALLING INTO THE TEENS. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
A COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED THROUGH THE AREA...BUT THE PUSH OF COLD AIR 
IS TRAILING THE FRONT...ALLOWING TEMPS TO WARM INTO THE 50S. TEMPS 
SHOULD BE FALLING QUICKLY WITH SUNSET HOWEVER AS THE COLDER AIR MASS 
MOVES IN...AND LOWS ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 20S IN MOST SPOTS. 

THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TAKING SHAPE OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL U.S. 
WILL TRACK EAST AND AFFECT OUR AREA FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 
OVERALL THE MODELS ARE IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. THE 
GFS IS STILL A TAD FASTER THAN THE NAM...BUT THEIR DEPICTIONS OF QPF 
AND LOCATION OF THE STRONGEST LIFT ARE QUITE SIMILAR. THIS LEADS TO 
A HIGHER CONFIDENCE FORECAST.

A STRONG UPPER JET ACROSS THE NORTHEAST U.S. WILL PLACE THE FORECAST 
AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET FROM FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. PRECIP WILL BEGIN TO OVERSPREAD THE 
AREA FRIDAY MORNING...BUT SOME LOW LEVEL DRY AIR WILL HAVE TO BE 
OVERCOME BEFORE IT REACHES THE GROUND. SO ACCUMULATING PRECIP SHOULD 
HOLD OFF UNTIL THE AFTERNOON. IT SHOULD BEGIN AS SNOW NORTH AND RAIN 
SOUTH. STRONG AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION DUE TO THE JET WILL 
INCREASE THE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING OVER OUR AREA BETWEEN 00Z AND 
06Z. AT THIS TIME...LIFT IN THE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE IS MAXIMIZED 
OVER THE CENTRAL THIRD OF THE AREA...ALLOWIGN FOR EFFICIENT SNOW 
FORMATION. CROSS SECTIONS SHOW SOME NEGATIVE EPV VALUES ABOVE THE 
MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS...SO SOME SNOW BANDING CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED. 
BOTH MODELS CRANK OUT OVER 1 INCH OF LIQUID PRECIP OVER MOST OF THE 
AREA. THIS DOES NOT APPEAR UNREASONABLE.

THE DIFFICULT PART OF THE FORECAST IS THAT THE ZONE OF STRONGEST 
LIFT IS ALSO IN THE AREA OF P-TYPE TRANSITION...IN THE CENTRAL TN 
VALLEY. THE NAM AND GFS SHOW 850-700 THICKNESS VALUES RISING 
OVERNIGHT...WHICH COULD LEAD TO A PRECIP PHASE CHANGE. HOWEVER...THE 
STRONG DYNAMIC LIFT WILL TEND TO COOL THE VERTICAL COLUMN AIDING TO 
KEEP/CHANGE THE PRECIPITATION TO SNOW. THUS EXPECT THAT LOCATIONS 
FROM KNOWVILLE NORTH WILL BE ALL SNOW. IT WILL LIKELY BE A WET SNOW 
AS TEMPERATURE PROFILES SHOW A DEEP NEAR-FREEZING ISOTHERMAL LAYER. 
TO THE SOUTH...EXPECT THAT THERE WILL BE PERIODS OF RAIN AND 
SNOW...DEPENDING ON THE INTENSITY OF THE PRECIP AT ANY GIVEN TIME. 
AS THE 850-700 THICKNESS RISES...THERE WILL LIKELY BE A CHANGE TO 
SLEET. THIS SHOULD LIMIT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU. 

AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PULLS OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST...THE UPPER 
TROUGH WILL BE MOVING OVER THE AREA. THIS SHOULD BRING ADDITIONAL 
SNOWFALL TO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. FARTHER SOUTH THE 
MOISTURE IS CONFINED TO THE LOW LEVELS...AND LIFT IS WEAK. WILL 
TAPER OFF ALL PRECIP SATURDAY EVENING.

A WINTER STORM WARNING WILL BE ISSUED FOR LOCATIONS ALONG AND NORTH 
OF A BLOUNT-LOUDON-ROANE COUNTY LINE...AND FOR EASTERN 
MONROE...CHEROKEE...AND CLAY COUNTIES (MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS). IN 
THE WARNING AREA...5 TO 10 INCHES APPEARS PROBABLE...WITH UP TO 12 
INCHES IN THE MOUNTAINS. A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED 
FOR THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU. EXPECT 1 INCH 
SNOW/SLEET IN LOWER ELEVATIONS...WITH UP TO 3 IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL SUNDAY. AFTER COLD START DUE TO
ANTICIPATED SNOW COVER TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM INTO THE MID 30S TO
LOWER 40S SOUTH AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS WITH HIGHER ELEVATIONS
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS ONLY UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S.
CLOUDS SHOULD BE MOVED OUT WITH SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY. SUNDAY NIGHT
TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS TO SINGLE DIGITS WITH CLEAR SKIES AND
LIGHT WINDS. SOME AREAS COULD BE NEAR ZERO WITH SIGNIFICANT SNOW
COVER. MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE STILL OVER FORECAST AREA WITH WARMING
TEMPERATURES. A NEW SYSTEM SLIDES DOWN FROM THE NW TUESDAY WITH A
CHANCE OF RAIN SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40 AND RAIN AND OR SNOW NORTH OF
INTERSTATE 40. THIS LOOKS LIKE A FAIRLY WEAK SYSTEM. HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM MOVES IN FROM
THE SOUTH THURSDAY WITH RAIN/SNOW MOVING IN THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES
SHOULD WARM INTO THE 40S AREAWIDE THURSDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             30  41  32  37  20 /  10  70 100  50  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  35  30  32  19 /  10  70 100  70  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       30  35  30  32  19 /  10  80 100  60  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              25  35  28  29  15 /  10  70 100  90  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM EST SATURDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM EST SATURDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...GRAINGER...
     HAMBLEN...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...
     LOUDON...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST 
     CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...ROANE...SCOTT 
     TN...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...UNION...
     WASHINGTON TN.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 1 PM EST /NOON CST/ FRIDAY TO 4 PM 
     EST /3 PM CST/ SATURDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...
     BRADLEY...EAST POLK...HAMILTON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...WEST POLK.

VA...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM EST SATURDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...
     WISE.

.AVIATION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN FROM THE 
NORTH. WINDS WILL GENERALLY BE FROM THE NE AND LIGHT. MID AND HIGH 
LEVEL CLOUDS WILL STREAM ACROSS THE AREA IN STRONG WESTERLY FLOW 
ALOFT. PCPN WILL BEGIN TO ADVANCE NE INTO THE AREA AROUND 29/18Z.
CURRENTLY THE RAIN/SNOW LINE IS SETTING UP BETWEEN CHA AND TYS.
OVERALL VFR BUT CONDITIONS DRAMATICALLY WORSENING BEYOND TAF PERIOD.

675 
FXUS64 KMRX 281508 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 AM EST THU JAN 28 2010

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY ON OUR DOORSTEP...AS INDICATED BY THE
GUSTY NW WINDS AT CSV. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING HAVE BEEN RUNNING
WARMER THAN FORECAST...BUT COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE FROPA AND
INCREASING CLOUDS SHOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES BACK. THIS SHOULD RESULT
IN HIGH TEMPS CLOSE TO FORECAST VALUES. NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY 
     AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY 
     AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...
     LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...
     NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SCOTT 
     TN...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...SULLIVAN...
     UNICOI...UNION...WASHINGTON TN...WEST POLK.

255 
FXUS64 KMRX 280830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST THU JAN 28 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO 
TRACK THROUGH THE REGION TODAY.  RADAR SHOWING A FEW WEAK ECHOES 
WITH THE FRONT...BUT LOW LEVELS STILL DRY SO WILL CONTINUE A DRY 
FORECAST FOR TODAY.  A STRONGER DISTURBANCE IS APPROACHING THE CWA 
LATE TONIGHT.  PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL FRIDAY...SO WILL 
KEEP TONIGHT DRY AS WELL.  WITH THE INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER...STAYED 
BELOW THE MAV NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ALL SIMILAR FOR TONIGHT...SO STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
CONTINUES TO BE SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS WITH SURFACE CYCLOGENESIS ACROSS EAST TEXAS. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN PULLING THIS TROUGH EAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THE LATTER HALF OF FRIDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. SURFACE TRACKS EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN GULF COAST 
STATES...THEN OFF THE CAROLINA COAST BY SATURDAY NIGHT.

STRONG DYNAMICS WITH THE SYSTEM WITH A NORTHERN STREAM JET ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY AND NORTHEAST AND ANOTHER JET ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH. THESE FEATURES WILL PLACE THE FORECAST 
AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET FROM LATE 
FRIDAY THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. THE STRENGTHENING OF 
AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION DUE TO THE JET WILL INCREASE THE 
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WITH STRONG DYNAMIC LIFT EVIDENT ON THE 
CROSS-SECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LIFT WILL TEND TO COOL 
THE VERTICAL COLUMN AIDING TO KEEP/CHANGE THE PRECIPITATION TO SNOW.

THE MODELS DIFFER SOME IN REGARD TO THE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE 
WITH THE NAM BEING THE COLDEST. AT THIS TIME...I PREFER THE COLDER 
NAM SOLUTION DUE TO THE REASONS ABOVE. NAM SOLUTION SUGGEST A MOSTLY 
SNOW EVIDENT...EXCEPT POSSIBLY THE FAR SOUTHERN COUNTIES. PLAN ON 
EXPANDING THE WATCH TO INCLUDE THE SOUTHEAST SECTIONS (CHA AREA) AS 
WELL.

VERTICAL CROSS-SECTIONS ALSO SHOWS NEGATIVE EPV IN COMBINATION WITH 
STRONG OMEGA IN SATURATED AIRMASS...SO POTENTIAL OF SNOW BANDING 
EXISTS ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE TENNESSEE COUNTIES. IF BANDING 
OCCURS...SNOWFALL RATES WILL INCREASE. HAVE UPPED SNOWFALL AMOUNTS 
AREA-WIDE GIVEN THIS POTENTIAL.

THE SNOW WILL TAPER DOWN TO SNOW SHOWERS FOR SATURDAY.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN THE AREA FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES TOWARD THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  31  41  31  35 /   0  10  90 100  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  28  36  29  31 /  10  10  80 100  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  28  35  29  32 /  10  10  90 100  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              47  22  35  27  30 /  10  10  70 100  70 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY 
     AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY 
     AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...
     LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...
     NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...

866 
FXUS64 KMRX 280302
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST WED JAN 27 2010

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO TONIGHTS FORECAST. CLOUD COVER 
INCREASING OVERNIGHT IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT. WEAK WAA 
ALSO WILL BEGIN OVERNIGHT. INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND RAISED MINS A 
COUPLE DEGREES ACROSS SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT...A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES WILL 
MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT...THEN INTO THE GREAT TN VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY. WITH A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
CONUS...THERE WILL BE VERY LITTLE MOISTURE FOR THIS FRONT TO WORK 
WITH. SO EXPECT JUST MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS TO AFFECT THE AREA 
THROUGH THURSDAY. BEHIND THE FRONT...A COLDER AIR MASS WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT.

FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...A VIGOROUS SOUTHERN STREAM VORT MAX OVER 
THE BAJA THIS AFTERNOON WILL TRACK EAST...INDUCING CYCLOGENESIS 
OVER TX THURSDAY. THIS TROUGH WILL MERGE WITH A NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH ON FRIDAY. THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL BE IN THE 
RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A STRONG POLAR JET. THE RESULTING 
AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION AND UPPER DIVERGENCE WILL BRING 
LIFT INTO OUR AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON. AS THE SYSTEM TRACKS 
EAST...MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE LOW WILL 
FURTHER ENHANCE THE PRECIP FRIDAY NIGHT...PEAKING AROUND MIDNIGHT. 
THE GFS CONTINUES TO BE THE FASTER OF THE MODELS...WITH THE NAM 
BEING SLOWEST...BUT THE TREND OF BOTH MODELS SEEMS TO BE A SLIGHTLY 
SLOWER SOLUTION COMPARED TO PREVIOUS RUNS. 

CONFIDENCE IS HIGH THAT THE DEPTH OF COLD AIR WILL BE SUFFICIENT FOR 
THE PRECIP TO BE ALL SNOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...NORTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST VA...AND THE TN MOUNTAINS. IN 
THIS AREA...SNOW AMOUNTS OF 6 TO 10 INCHES WILL BE 
POSSIBLE...PERHAPS MORE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FARTHER 
SOUTH...THE SITUATION IS MUCH MORE QUESTIONABLE. TEMPERATURE 
PROFILES INDICATE A DEEP NEAR-FREEZING ISOTHERMAL LAYER...MEANING 
THAT ONLY SLIGHT CHANGES IN TEMPERATURE COULD MEAN THE DIFFERENCE 
BETWEEN SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OR NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. 
THERE COULD ALSO BE SEVERAL CHANGES BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN SNOW AND 
RAIN...AND PERHAPS A LITTLE SLEET...ESPECIALLY AT THE ONSET. AT THIS 
TIME...THE TRANSITION ZONE APPEARS TO BE JUST SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE. 
LOCATIONS IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY COULD SEE AS MUCH AS 5 INCHES...OR 
AS LITTLE AS 1 INCH...DEPENDING ON EXACTLY WHERE THE TRANSITION ZONE 
SETS UP. IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY INCLUDING CHATTANOOGA...ALTHOUGH 
THERE COULD BE SOME MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW AND SLEET AT THE 
ONSET...EXPECT THAT MOST OF THE PRECIP WILL BE RAIN UNTIL LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT. LESS THAN 2 INCHES IS EXPECTED THERE.

A WINTER STORM WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE CENTRAL TN VALLEY AND 
LOCATIONS NORTH...AS WELL AS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
BLEDSOE...SEQUATCHIE...CHEROKEE NC...AND CLAY NC...STARTING 2 PM 
FRIDAY THROUGH 4 PM SATURDAY. AN SPS WILL BE ISSUED FOR LOCATIONS 
OUTSIDE THE WATCH.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THOUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FEW LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA SATURDAY EVENING... 
SLOWLY EXITING THE AREA OVERNIGHT AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION.  LITTLE TO NO ADDITIONAL 
ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.  MUCH COLDER AND DRIER AIR WILL SLIDE IN 
BEHIND THE SYSTEM.  OVERNIGHT LOWS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL 
BE 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  
TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE ON MONDAY.  BY TUESDAY...TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD REACH NEAR NORMAL LEVELS AS THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVE INTO THE 
AREA.  WILL HAVE POPS AT 20 TO 30 AROUND THE TUESDAY TIME FRAME.  
DRY CONDITIONS RETURN FOR WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  32  54  31  40  32 /   0  10  10  90 100 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    31  50  28  36  31 /  10  10  10  80 100 
OAK RIDGE, TN            30  50  28  35  30 /  10  10  10  90 100 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   25  47  25  35  27 /  10  10  10  70 100 

&&

     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY

     JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...

096 
FXUS64 KMRX 270836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 AM EST WED JAN 27 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING SNOW HAS EXITED 
THE AREA.  STILL A FEW CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
CWA ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE.  THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD BE 
GONE EARLY THIS MORNING WITH DECREASING CLOUDS EXPECTED EARLY TODAY 
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. SHOULD SEE A FEW HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS TODAY 
AND TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM...BUT DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED 
TODAY AND TONIGHT.  WITH THE CLOUDS EXPECTED...WENT BELOW MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR TODAY AND STAYED NEAR THE MET/MAV BLEND NUMBERS.  
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT SIMILAR SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE IS 
DEVELOPING UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND NORTHERN 
STREAM LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER EASTERN CANADA. FIRST...THE NORTHERN 
STEAM TROUGH WILL PULL A FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY. 
MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS WITH THE FRONT IS LACKING AND WILL CALL FOR A 
DRY FROPA. HOWEVER...MAIN FEATURE FROM THIS SYSTEM IS THE COLDER AIR 
SPILLING INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS AHEAD OF SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT-WAVE.

MODELS ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT IN TAKING THE SURFACE LOW FROM 
EAST TEXAS THEN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN GULF COAST STATES. THIS TRACK 
BODES WELL FOR SNOW ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. STRONG UPPER 
JET WILL BE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE NORTHEAST PLACING THE 
FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET. 
THE IN-DIRECT CIRCULATION AROUND THIS SYSTEM WILL HELP INDUCE AN 
INVERTED TROUGH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ENHANCING FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING AND BOUNDARY LAYER CONVERGENCE. ALSO...ISENTROPIC LIFT CAN 
BE EXPECTED INITIALLY ON FRIDAY.

THERE ARE SOME FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN THE VERTICAL 
TEMPERATURE PROFILE WITH THE NAM THE COLDEST. GIVEN THE ARCTIC AIR 
POISED JUST NORTH OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND FAVORED SURFACE LOW 
TRACK...I PREFER THE COLDER SOLUTION. WILL CALL FOR ALL SNOW TRI AND 
MRX...MAINLY SNOW TYS (POSSIBLY MIXING WITH SLEET AT TIMES)...AND A 
MIXTURE FOR CHA CHANGING TO ALL SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT. PRELIMINARY 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS RANGE FROM 4 TO 8 INCHES FOR TYS NORTHWARD 
(GREATER AMOUNTS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS). FOR SOUTHERN THIRD OF 
FORECAST AREA...SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WILL VARY GREATLY DEPENDING ON 
ELEVATION. CHA SNOWFALL POSSIBLY 1 TO 3 INCHES WITH HIGHER AMOUNTS 
OVER LOOKOUT-SIGNAL MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU.

MAIN SNOWFALL WILL START FRIDAY WHICH IS OUR FIFTH PERIOD...SO WILL 
NOT ISSUE A WATCH...BUT DAY SHIFT AND DEFINITELY MIDNIGHT SHIFT WILL 
LIKELY ISSUE ONE. WILL MODIFY THE CURRENT SPS AND SEND OUT LATER 
THIS MORNING.

ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE AREA MONDAY AND TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK.
HAVE TRIMMED GFS MOS HIGHS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY DUE TO THE SNOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST TUE JAN 26 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TO 
CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE THIS 
EVENING WITH A FEW FLURRIES ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE. COULD SEE 
ANOTHER INCH OF SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS OROGRAPHIC LIFT 
CONTINUES IN MODERATE TO STRONG CAA. PRECIP SHOULD TAPER MUCH OF 
THIS AREA BY LATE EVENING. HOWEVER WILL LIKELY CONTINUE IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. DRIER AIR GRAUDALLY 
WINS OUT REVEALING SOME SUNSHINE FOR WEDNESDAY AS PRESSURES INCH 
UPWARD A TAD. CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING AGAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS A 
NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROF SLIPS SOUTHEAST INTO THE NORTHEASTERN 
U.S. DRIVING YET ANOTHER COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. AT THE 
SAME TIME AN AMPLIFYING UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL BE SHIFTING SLOWLY EAST 
OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. WEAK ISENTROPIC AND FRONTAL LIFT MAY 
ENCOURAGE A SPRINKLE OF SNOW OR LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
ON THURSDAY BUT THE MAIN PRECIPITATION EVENT WILL OCCUR BEYOND THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND CONCERNING 
MAX AND MIN TEMPS DURING THE SHORT TERM FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
MOVES TO LOUISIANA BY FRI MORNING. FRONTOGENESIS AROUND 700 MB 
TAKING SHAPE ACROSS NW PART OF MRX CWA. ISENTROPIC LIFT 
UNDERWAY...PCPN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW AND ADVANCE EAST INTO AREA THU 
NGT. BEST QPF AND WAA TAKES PLACE FRI. GFS PROGS 850 MB +3C WARM 
TONGUE WORKING NE INTO THE AREA TO NEAR TYS BY FRI AFTN. THOU THE 
POTENTIAL IS THERE FOR PERIODS OF FREEZING RAIN...BELIEVE PHASE 
TRANSITIONS WILL BE FAST SO KEPT FORECAST BASICALLY SNOW OR RAIN. 
LIQUID PCPN WORKS NE INTO THE AREA FRI THEN RETREATS SE AS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS TO SOUTH OF AREA AND CAA BEGINS TO WORK BACK 
IN FROM THE NE. THIS SCENARIO MAKES SNOW TOTAL FORECAST NEARLY 
IMPOSSIBLE AT THIS POINT FOR SOUTHERN AREAS. LATEST ECMWF IS MUCH 
WEAKER WITH THE WAA ... ALL SNOW ... BUT DOES NOT TRANSPORT AS MUCH 
MOISTURE TO THE NORTH. SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW-MODERATE. 
NORTHERN AREAS WENT WITH A 10 TO 1 ...SNOW TO LIQUID RATIO  WHICH 
RESULTS IN SNOW AMOUNTS EXCEEDING 4 INCHES FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE MRX CWA BY SAT. UPPER TROF AXIS MOVES THROUGH SAT AFTN AND 
SURFACE LOW CONTINUES TO ACCELERATE NE OFFSHORE THE CAROLINAS. BY 
THIS TIME LAYER RH DROPS OFF SIGNIFICANTLY AND STRONG CAA IS USHERED 
IN AS HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES SE TO OVER THE AREA BY SUN AFTN. WARM UP 
WILL BE SLOW AS HIGH SWIFTS EAST EARLY NEXT WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 252031

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST MON JAN 25 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...ABOUT THREE SHORT WAVE FEATURES 
WILL ROTATE SOUTHEAST AROUND THE GREAT LAKES UPPER LEVEL LOW THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. THE FIRST ONE IS GENERATING MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN AND VERY 
LIKELY SNOW AT HIGHER ELEVATION ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PARTS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. THE SECOND ONE IS BUILDING SOUTHEAST THROUGH 
INDIANA AND ILLINOIS AND A THIRD WILL KEEP A FEW SNOW SHOWERS GOING 
ACROSS THE HIGHEST TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH A GOOD PART OF THE DAY TUESDAY. STAYED 
WITH THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOST OF 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA AS LIFT WILL BE 
GENERATED BY THE SHORT WAVES AS WELL AS FAIRLY DECENT LAPSE RATES 
WHICH ARE PRODUCING A CELLULAR LOOK TO THE RADAR/SAT IMAGE THIS 
AFTERNOON. ADD TO THIS THE OROGRAPHIC COMPONENT AND THE ADVISORY 
AREA SHOULD SEE ANYWHERE FROM 1 TO 3 INCHES OF SNOW WITH THE GREATER 
TOTALS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. IN ELEVATIONS ABOVE 4000 FT AMOUNTS 
COULD BE AS HIGH AS 4 INCHES. KEPT SNOW SHOWERS GOING ON TUESDAY IN 
THESE AREAS AS THE FINAL WAVE SWINGS EAST. MOISTURE WILL BECOME MORE 
SHALLOW AND THE SHORT WAVE WILL MAINLY IMPACT THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS SO KEPT SNOWFALL GENERALLY AROUND AN INCH FOR SNOW THAT
OCCURS ON TUESDAY. MAINTAINED THE WIND ADVISORY THROUGH MID EVENING 
AS THE RATHER BOUYANT ATMOSPHERE MIXES HIGHER VELOCITY FLOW TO THE 
SURFACE. CONCERNING TEMPS WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR TONIGHT 
AND EDGED CLOSER TO THE COOLER MET MAXES FOR TUESDAY UNDER THE 
LIMITING INFLUENCE OF HEALTHY COLD AIR ADVECTION AND LIMITED 
SUNSHINE.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE AREA SHIFTS SE WED NGT. WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL ADVECT CLOUDS 
INTO THE AREA AND LIGHT PCPN WILL BEGIN ON THU. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
ADVANCES TOWARD THE AREA FROM THE SW THU NGT. TRENDED REMAINDER OF 
FORECAST SLOWER THAN THE GFS MUCH LIKE NCEP GUIDANCE. PRECIP TYPE 
WILL BE A CHALLENGE THU NGT AND EARLY FRI. A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL 
LIKELY DEVELOP N OF THE TN BORDER. SW VA WILL LIKELY SEE SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATIONS BY SAT. THE LOW TRACKS SE OF THE AREA FRI EVENING AND 
ALL PCPN WILL TURN TO SNOW AS CAA SHIFTS INTO THE AREA. LIGHT SNOW 
WILL CONTINUE TO TAPER OFF INTO SAT. TRENDED REMAINDER OF FORECAST 
COOLER THAN MEX MOS. LARGE UPSTREAM HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE CURRENTLY 
RUNNING VERY COLD AND DONT EXPECT MUCH MODIFICATION AS IT BUILDS IN 
THIS WEEKEND.

INTO THE REGION TONIGHT IN ASSOCIATION WITH TROF CURRENTLY IN PLACE
OVER THE MIDWEST. FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL MAINLY BE VFR AT CHA AND
TYS BUT LIKELY WILL BECOME MVFR AT TRI WHERE BETTER MOISTURE AND
LIFT SHOULD BE POSITIONED TONIGHT AS SOME LIGHT SNOW DEVELOPS.
POSSIBLY MOST CHALLENGING CONDITIONS FOR FLIGHT WILL BE THE GUSTY
WESTERLY WIND WHICH IS BEING AIDED BY LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY AS COLD
AIR BUILDS IN OVER THE TOP OF RELATIVELY WARM SURFACE.

&&

993 
FXUS64 KMRX 251534
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST MON JAN 25 2010

.DISCUSSION...SUPPOSE THE CURRENT FORECAST IN DECENT SHAPE WITH LONG 
WAVE TROF EXTENDING FROM THE MIDWEST THROUGH THE SOUTHEASTERN 
STATES. THE UPPER TROF APPARENTLY HAS SEVERAL SHORTER WAVELENGTH 
FEATURES ROTATING THROUGH ITS CIRCULATION. FIRST LITTLE FEATURE HAS 
BECOME ENHANCED SINCE SUNRISE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH SOME 
MODEL INSTABILITY NOTED. THIS IS GENERATING SOME LIGHT RAIN FROM 
AROUND MIDDLESBORO SOUTH THROUGH KNOXVILLE. ANOTHER MINOR FEATURE IS 
SHIFTING EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE MID SOUTH CREATING 
SOME LIGHT RAIN ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE WITH A FLAKE OR TWO OF SNOW 
FARTHER NORTH IN KENTUCKY. AND FARTHER NORTHWEST PERHAPS THE MAIN 
FEATURE OF INTEREST TO GENERATE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE VIEWING 
AREA FOR TONIGHT IS IN PLACE OVER ILLINOIS AND MISSOURI. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION GETS GOING TO A GREATER DEGREE LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND 
WILL HAVE THE GREATEST IMPACT AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE PATCHY 
LIGHT RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW SO WILL SEND WSW 
REMINDER OUT AGAIN. ALSO WILL SHIP THE WIND ADVISORY REMINDER AS 
WELL DUE TO MODERATELY TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BEING AIDED BY CHILLY 
AIR ALOFT WHICH IS HELPING TO MIX HIGHER SPEED WINDS TO THE SURFACE. 
TEMPERATURES MOST LIKELY REMAINING STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON.

&&

829 
FXUS64 KMRX 250917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
417 AM EST MON JAN 25 2010

.SHORT TERM...COLD FRONT IS MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH A 
BAND OF SHOWERS. THIS BAND WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA AROUND 12Z. AN 
UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE MID-WEST AND ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING 
AND STEEPENING LAPSE RATES DUE TO DEEPENING COLD AIR ALOFT WILL 
PRODUCE AN AREA OF SHOWERS BEGINNING BY MID-AFTERNOON THROUGH 
MID-NIGHT. A MIXTURE OF RAIN...SLEET...SNOW IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS
(ALL SNOW HIGHER TERRAIN)...THEN BECOME ALL SNOW BY LATE 
AFTERNOON-EARLY EVENING. WILL LIKELY SEE UP TO 3 INCHES FOR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...THUS WILL ISSUE A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVSIORY. 

FOR THE LOWER TERRAIN (KNOXVILLE NORTHWARD) 1/2 TO 1 INCH OF 
SNOWFALL IS POSSIBLE...MAINLY FOR GRASSY SURFACES. WINDY CONDITIONS 
CAN ALSO BE ANTICIPATED THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HAVE ISSUED A 
WIND ADVISORY ALL AREAS. WEST-NORTHWEST FLOW AND CONTINUE FAIRLY 
STEEP LAPSE RATES WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS REST OF TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.

CLOUDY AND COLD DAY IS IN STORE FOR TUESDAY. HAVE TRENDED COLDER 
THAN GFS MOS FOR TUESDAY GIVEN CLOUDS AND COLD TEMPERATURE 
ADVECTION.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THIS PART OF THE FORECAST 
STARTS WITH A COOL DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE WITH THE SURFACE RIDGE 
SETTLED INTO THE AREA.  HOWEVER NEXT SYSTEM IS ALREADY APPROACHING 
FROM THE WEST.  

TRICKY SITUATION WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS AND PRECIP WEDNESDAY NIGHT.   
WARM ADVECTION SHOULD BE GOING OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO MIN 
TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE IN THE EVENING.  BRING FIRST POPS INTO NWRN 
AREAS THURSDAY MORNING...WITH WITH WARM ADVECTION...DAYBREAK TEMPS 
AT SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL LIKELY SUPPORT RAIN VERSUS FREEZING 
PRECIP.  ALSO...SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT AT ONSET...AS DRY AIR NEAR 
SURFACE TRIES TO EVAPORATE INITIAL PRECIP.  

COLDER AIR PUSHES IN FROM NORTHWEST DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY AND 
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.  RAIN/SNOW LINE WILL BE INTERESTING...RIGHT NOW 
HAVE TIMING FOR MAINLY RAIN ON THURSDAY...EXCEPT IN EXTREME 
NORTH...BUT REST OF AREA CHANGES OVER TO SNOW OVERNIGHT.  WILL 
LIKELY SEE MEASURABLE SNOW IN MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY OVER THE 
NORTHERN AREAS.  

FOR FRIDAY...GFS RUSHES SYSTEM OUT OF THE AREA...WILL PLAN ON A 
LITTLE SLOWER SCENARIO...MORE LIKE EURO AND CANADIAN MODELS.

COLD AND DRIER AIR MOVES IN FOR MOST OF THE WEEKEND.  KEEPING SOME 
SLIGHT SNOW SHOWER CHANCES FOR NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS ON SATURDAY 
FOR MINIMAL NW FLOW EVENT THAT TAPERS OFF QUICKLY.

820 
FXUS64 KMRX 242101
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 PM EST SUN JAN 24 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LARGE SWATH OF MODERATE
TO HEAVY SHOWERS WORKING SLOWLY NORTHEAST...AND FINALLY SEEING SOME
RAINS FALL IN THE DOWNSLOPED AREAS. KEPT A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS
...BUT MAIN PROBLEM WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS. FLOOD WATCH
CONTINUES...WITH MUCH OF THE WRN AND CENTRAL COUNTIES IN AN URBAN
AND SMALL STREAM FLOOD ADVISORY. 

REPLACED HIGH WIND WARNING AREA WITH A WIND ADVISORY...AND LET THE
WIND ADVISORY AREAS EXPIRE. EXPECT WINDS TO NOT BE AN ISSUE AFTER
MID TO LATE EVENING. 

OTHERWISE...CLOUDS HANG IN AND COOLER AIR FLOWS INTO THE REGION
THROUGH THE REST OF THE SHORT TERM. THREAT FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW
LOOKS VERY SLIM...GIVEN WARM SURFACE TEMPS AND LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES.
BEST CHANCE FOR SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUSEDAY
MORNING AS AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE SWINGS ACROSS...AND STRONGEST
COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURS (SOME HINT OF NW UPSLOPE FLOW ALSO).

OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS QUTIE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED...ALTHO
DID PREFER THE COOLER NAM HIGHS TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL 
FOLLOWING DEPARTURE OF NORTHEASTERN U.S. TROF. THEREFORE LIGHT 
OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD COME TO AN END TUESDAY EVENING WITH 
DRIER CONDITIONS FOR WEDNESDAY. NEXT SYSTEM TO IMPACT THE FORECAST 
AREA WILL BE A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WHICH INDUCES A SURFACE 
WAVE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WHICH PRESSES EAST INTO CENTRAL 
ALABAMA BY 12Z FRIDAY. USED GOOD CHANCE THROUGH LIKELY POPS FOR THE 
EVENT THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. POPS PROBABLY NOT TOO BAD AT THIS 
POINT BUT THE PRECIP TYPE SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN. MIN TEMPS COULD BE A 
FEW DEGREES WARMER WHICH WOULD ALLOW FOR LIQUID PRECIP MOST OF THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER IN ORDER TO STAY IN LINE 
WITH NEIGHBORING WFO'S USED LOWER MIN TEMPS AND THEREFORE MORE 
FROZEN PRECIP. BETTER CHANCE THAT PRECIP WILL BE FROZEN...AND THUS 
IN THE FORM OF SNOW SHOWERS...WILL BE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS 
NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS WITH AMPLIFYING EASTERN STATES UPPER TROF. 
TROF DEPARTS WITH BUILDING HEIGHTS ALOFT SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY 
AND MAINTAINED A DRY FORECAST FOR THIS PERIOD. TEMP FORECAST 
UNDERCUT GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

.AVIATION...WORST FLIGHT WEATHER CONDITIONS ASSOCIATED WITH PRE-

VCNTY AROUND 19-20Z WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR PERHAPS A RETURN TO MVFR

WHILE TRI WILL BE VFR FOR 2 OR 3 HOURS PRIOR TO ONSET OF
DETERIORATING FLIGHT CONDITIONS WITH PRE-FRONTAL BAND OF LIGHT TO
MODERATE SHOWERS. KEEP WEATHER GENERALLY MVFR AHEAD OF AND VCNTY OF
SYSTEM COLD FRONT WITH CEILINGS FORMING AROUND TWO THOUSAND FEET
AND VCNTY -SHRA. WESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS ON MONDAY WITH CEILINGS RISING
TO AROUND THREE THOUSAND FEET OR HIGHER DUE TO DOWNSLOPING FLOW
INTO THE GREAT VALLEY.

     NORTHWEST GREENE...NORTHWEST MONROE...SEVIER SMOKY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 AM EST SUN JAN 24 2010

.DISCUSSION...HIGH WIND EVENT CONTINUES THIS MORNING WITH LATEST 
GUST OF 71 KNOTS AT COVE MTN FIRETOWER NEAR GATLINBURG...WHILE CAMP 
CREEK WIND TOWER HAS HAD VERY STRONG GUSTS AS WELL (SEE LSRMRX). 
AREA RADAR WIND PROFILERS SHOW SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET CURRENTLY OF 
50 TO 60 KNOTS. WILL MONITOR WINDS INTO THE AFTERNOON...TO SEE IF 
HIGH WIND WARNING AND/OR WIND ADVISORY NEED EXTENDING.

OTHER CONCERN IS FOR POSSIBILITY OF FLOODING AS MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THE COLD FRONT MAY BE SLOWING DOWN...WITH ANOTHER ROUND OF AT LEAST 
SHOWERS PROGGED FOR TONIGHT WITH THE ACTUAL FRONTAL PASSAGE. RAIN SO 
FAR HAS NOT BEEN HEAVY IN OUR FORECAST AREA...BUT EXTREME EASTERN 
AREAS MAY GET ENOUGH RAIN TO AT LEAST MONITOR MORE CLOSELY...AND 
CONSIDER A FLOOD WATCH FOR SOME AREAS IN THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE. 
HOWEVER...KMRX RADAR IS CLEARLY SHOWING THE DOWNSLOPING EFFECT OF 
REDUCING RAINFALL FOR THE CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY AREAS OF E TN INTO 
PARTS OF SWRN VA.

A CONSERVATIVE PROJECTED 24 HOUR RAINFALL LOOKS TO PUSH THE FRENCH 
BROAD AND PIGEON RIVERS NEAR NEWPORT TN (COCKE COUNTY) A COUPLE OF 
FEET ABOVE FLOOD STAGE. SEE OUR LATEST FLW PRODUCT...MORE ON THIS IN 
THE AFTERNOON AFD.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK...BUT WILL LIKELY FRESHEN THE 
HOURLY FORECAST GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS BY AROUND 11 AM EST.

733 
FXUS64 KMRX 240805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST SUN JAN 24 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER THE OZARKS...WITH ITS TRAILING 
COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE MS RIVER VALLEY. A HIGH END 
MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT APPEARS TO BE UNDERWAY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND 
THEIR WESTERN FOOTHILLS...WITH BOTH THE COVE MOUNTAIN AND CAMP CREEK 
WIND TOWERS REPORTING WIND GUSTS IN THE 70 TO 75 MPH RANGE. THE PEAK 
OF THIS HIGH WIND EVENT WILL LIKELY OCCUR IN THE MORNING HOURS AFTER 
SUNRISE...AS THE 850 MB JET (IN EXCESS OF 70 KT) MOVES ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. WITH WIND GUSTS ALREADY OVER 70 MPH...WILL PLAN TO 
BEEF UP THE WORDING IN THE HIGH WIND WARNING PRODUCT TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF 80 TO 100 MPH WIND GUSTS IN THE FOOTHILLS. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT WITH A LOW LEVEL INVERSION BELOW 800 
MB. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF SOME TSTORMS FOR TODAY 
DUE TO THE ELEVATED INSTABILITY...AND WILL EXTEND THE WIND ADVISORY 
FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA (INCLUDING THE ENTIRE GREAT TN 
VALLEY). THIS LOW-LEVEL INVERSION MAY PREVENT MUCH OF THE 850 MB 
WINDS FROM LOWERING INTO THE VALLEYS...BUT THE BROKEN LINE OF 
CONVECTION ALONG THE COLD FRONT MAY BE ABLE TO LOWER SOME OF THESE 
VERY STRONG 850 MB WINDS INTO THE VALLEYS (ESPECIALLY WITH ANY DEEP 
CONVECTION). BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS HAVE SLOWED DOWN THE 
EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE COLD FRONT FOR TODAY...WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE 
NOW EXPECTED FROM MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. THIS SLOWER MOVEMENT MAY 
ENCOURAGE SOME STRONGER CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY...DUE TO THE MORE FAVORABLE DIURNAL HEATING TIMING. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL RAISE TEMPS WELL ABOVE GUIDANCE IN THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN VALLEYS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE EXPECTED ADIABATIC FOEHN WARMING 
FROM THE SOUTHEASTERLY WIND FLOW. OTHERWISE...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT LIGHT PRECIP WILL LINGER THROUGH THE EARLY PART
OF THE WORK WEEK AS UPPER LONG WAVE TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE EASTERN
CONUS. FLOW DEAMPLIFIES BY MID WEEK AND BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL. DRY
WEATHER EXPECTED TO ACCOMPANY THIS ZONAL FLOW PATTERN. NEXT SYSTEM
APPROACHES THE REGION ON THURSDAY. MODELS/ENSEMBLES HAVE COME INTO
SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. DRY WEATHER RETURNS BY
THE WEEKEND BUT COLD AIR BEHIND SYSTEM WILL DROP TEMPS BACK BELOW
CLIMO. GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE WITH RESPECT
TO TEMPS.


&&

926 PM EST SAT JAN 23 2010

.DISCUSSION...PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENING UP THIS EVENING WITH
WINDS INCREASING ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU AS LARGE AREA OF
LOW PRESSURE EAST OF THE MS RIVER OPPOSES HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE
EAST COAST. WINDS ARE GUSTING FROM 35 TO 40 MPH ON THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS ALREADY. TEMPERATURES ARE
IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S WITH A FEW LOCATIONS IN THE EXTREME NE IN
THE UPPER 30S. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE NEAR THEIR LOWS AND BE
STEADY OR RISE THE REST OF THE NIGHT. HAVE ADJUSTED LOWS SLIGHTLY
AND THE QPF VALUES FOR THE 6Z TO 12Z PERIOD. LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS
JUST WEST OF THE MS RIVER SHOULD MOVE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS TN
OVERNIGHT WITH THE LATEST RUC SHOWING IT TO THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU BY
12Z. EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO DECREASE IN INTENSITY LATER TONIGHT. WILL
REISSUE HIGH WIND WARNING AND ADVISORY AFTER ZONE UPDATE.

FXUS64 KMRX 232038
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EST SAT JAN 23 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MOST SIGNIFICANT WEATHER FOR 
THESE PERIODS WILL BE THE FIRST 24 TO 30 HOURS...AS SURFACE LOW 
TRACKS NORTH ACROSS MID MISS VALLEY TONIGHT TO WESTERN GREAT LAKES 
BY SUNDAY EVENING. STRONG SE LOW LEVEL JET DEVELOPS AHEAD OF THE 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT...WHICH WILL PROVIDE VERY WINDY CONDITIONS TO 
THE MTNS AND FOOTHILLS (MTN WAVE) AND AN EARLY PERIOD OF DOWNSLOPING 
FOR CENTRL AND NRN VALLEY LOCATIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. IN GENERAL 
BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOW THE EFFECTS OF DOWNSLOPING WITH VERY LIGHT QPF 
FOR DOWNSLOPE AREAS...ALTHO SHOWERS SHOULD SPREAD INTO WRN AND SRN 
AREAS IN THE 06Z TO 12Z SUNDAY PERIOD. SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS MAY 
OCCUR OVER EXTREME SE TN AND SW NC...BUT BRUNT OF HEAVY RAINS WILL 
BE OVER WRN NC NORTH INTO RNK AREA.

PUSHED HIGH WIND WATCH TO A WARNING...AND ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR 
NEARBY HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER (WX) GRIDS 
LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT (WITH A SLIGHT DECREASE IN POPS FOR DOWNSLOPE
AREAS) AND GENERALLY THROUGH MONDAY. COLD AIR ADVECTION AND SOME 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WARRANTS DECREASING POPS SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. HOWEVER...COLD AIR ARRIVES QUITE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT...SO 
WON'T ANTICIPATE MUCH THREAT OF SNOW SHOWERS INTO MONDAY MORNING FOR 
NOW. SURFACE TEMPS AND LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES APPEAR TO BE TOO WARM.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EARLY PART OF THE 
FORECAST WILL FEATURE NORTHWEST (UPSLOPE) FLOW AND A COUPLE OF SHORT 
WAVE IMPULSES THROUGH TUESDAY. CANADIAN AIR AND SUFFICIENTLY DEEP 
MOISTURE WILL BE IN PLACE FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS WITH OROGRAPHIC LIFT 
REQUIRING SLIGHTLY HIGHER POP IN THE MOUNTAINS. UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
FINALLY FLATTENS OUT ON WEDNESDAY AS ATMOSPHERE PREPARES FOR THE 
ARRIVAL OF A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE. ISENTROPIC LIFTING PROCESSES 
ALONG WITH INCREASING PACIFIC AND GULF MOISTURE WILL LEAD TO 
INCREASING PROBABILITY OF PRECIP MAINLY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. 
SOUTHEAST STATES SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WITH INVERTED TROFFING NORTH 
THROUGH THE MID SOUTH WILL SHIFT EAST FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY TO THE CAROLINA COAST BY 12Z SATURDAY. STAYED IN A MEDIUM 
CHANCE POP CATEGORY FOR THE EVENT WHICH WRAPS UP DURING THE DAY 
SATURDAY AS DRIER AIR FILTERS IN BEHIND THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

MORNING OVER PARTS OF NE TN AND SW VA...GIVING WAY TO PARTLY SUNNY 
SKIES AT LEAST TEMPORARILY. 12Z RNK SOUNDING SHOWS LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE UP TO NEAR 800 MBS...WHILE OHX SOUNDING HAS THE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE MIXED OUT. 12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW A MOIST S TO SW FLOW AT 
850 MBS FOR TODAY...WHILE LATEST RUC MODEL SOUNDINGS KEEP A GOOD 
DEAL OF MOISTURE IN PLACE FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. THUS...THINK 
PARTLY SUNNY AT BEST WITH SOUNDINGS NOT SUPPORTING THE WARMER MOS 
HIGHS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. MAY LOWER MAX TEMPS JUST A BIT...OR GIVE A 
WIDER RANGE.

OTHERWISE...SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT WITH WINDS INCREASING 
AS INDICATED. WILL RE-ISSUE HIGH WIND WATCH WITH A LATE MORNING 
UPDATE TO FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS. WILL LIKELY NEED TO GO WITH A 
HIGH WIND WARNING IN THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE...AND POSSIBLY A WIND 
ADVISORY FOR SOME LOWER ELEVATION AREAS (NRN PLATEAU) AS WELL.

&&

158 
FXUS64 KMRX 230751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EST SAT JAN 23 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE GREAT TN VALLEY...WITH AREAS 
OF FOG AND LOW CLOUDS OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. SO FAR...THE 
LOW CLOUDS HAVE KEPT THE FOG FROM BECOMING TOO DENSE...BUT WILL 
CONTINUE TO MONITOR TO SEE IF A DENSE FOG ADVISORY IS NEEDED LATER 
THIS MORNING. OTHERWISE...MODELS INDICATE THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
WILL BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...POSSIBLY CREATING SOME 
BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER BY THIS AFTERNOON. WITH SOME DOWNSLOPE 
SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS INCREASING THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION PARTLY SUNNY SKIES BY THE AFTERNOON. A STRONG LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION BY SUNDAY...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING 
EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS REVEAL 
A VERY STRONG 850 MB JET (IN EXCESS OF 80 KTS) DEVELOPING ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT. WITH MODEL 
SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEALING SOUTHEASTERLY LOW-LEVEL WINDS PERPENDICULAR 
TO THE MOUNTAINS...A STABLE LAYER EXTENDING ABOVE THE MOUNTAIN 
RIDGES...AND A VEERING VERTICAL WIND PROFILE THAT INCREASES WITH 
HEIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT A HIGH END MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT WILL DEVELOP 
BY MID EVENING INTO SUNDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE WINDS SHIFT TO THE 
SOUTHWEST. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY DEVELOPING 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY...SO WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS. WITH A LOW-LEVEL INVERSION SEEN ON THE MODEL SOUNDINGS... 
THIS STABLE LAYER MAY PREVENT MUCH LOWERING OF THE STRONG 850 MB 
WINDS ON SUNDAY. ALSO...MODELS ARE CURRENTLY INDICATING THAT MOST 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR OVER THE CAROLINAS ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON...SINCE THE COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY MORNING. OVERALL...MODELS INDICATE THAT 
INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK OVER THE FORECAST AREA (MAINLY DUE TO THE 
DIURNAL TIMING OF FRONT)...BUT WITH SUCH A STRONG AND DYNAMIC 
SYSTEM...IT IS STILL PRUDENT TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING 
WINDS IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK WITH ANY CONVECTIVE LINE 
ALONG THE COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE. WITH 
SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS EXPECTED TODAY AND ESPECIALLY ON SUNDAY...WILL 
PLAN TO RAISE TEMPS WELL ABOVE GUIDANCE IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
VALLEYS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE EXPECTED ADIABATIC FOEHN WARMING. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL SLOWLY 
DEAMPLIFY BY MID WEEK. SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES EMBEDDED WITHIN 
FLOW OF UPPER LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL KEEP THINGS UNSETTLED FOR MONDAY 
AND MOST OF TUESDAY HOWEVER. TEMPS WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR CHANGE 
OVER TO SNOW BY MONDAY NIGHT. NO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION EXPECTED 
AT THIS TIME HOWEVER. MID WEEK LOOKING GENERALLY TRANQUIL AS UPPER 
FLOW BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY LATE WEEK. STILL 
CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS EVENT HOWEVER AS TIMING REMAINS 
QUITE VARIABLE AMONG MODELS. THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR 
CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST OTHER THAN TO BUMP UP POPS 
SLIGHTLY THURSDAY NIGHT FROM SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE. FOR 
TEMPS...DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE AS NO CLEAR TREND 
WAS NOTED IN ENSEMBLE DATA.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 221945
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST FRI JAN 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS IS MOVING EAST. WEAK SURFACE HIGH WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA REMAINDER OF TODAY THEN QUICKY MOVE EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. MODELS SHOW PLENTY OF LOW-LEVEL 
MOISTURE REMAINING OVER THE AREA THROUGH MID-MORNING SATURDAY JUST 
IN TIME FOR HIGH-MID LEVEL CLOUDS TO SPREAD INTO THE AREA.

ENOUGH SURFACE MOISTURE TONIGHT TO PRODUCE AREAS OF FOG. SOME OF THE 
FOG COULD BECOME LOCALLY DENSE. WILL ALSO ADD PATCHY DRIZZLE 
OVERNIGHT.

MAIN SYSTEM OF INTEREST IS A STRONG SHORT-WAFE MOVING OUT OF THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. MODELS SHOW A FAIRLY GOOD TROPOPAUSE FOLD OVER THE PLAINS 
STATES WHICH HELPS IN QUICKLY STRENGTHENING A SURFACE LOW OVER THE 
PLAINS STATES-MIDWEST. THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT AROUND THIS 
SYSTEM AND RIDGING OVER THE EAST COAST PRODUCES A STRONG BOUNDARY 
LAYER JET SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY (SOUTHERLY 850MB JET OF 75KT+)

PLACEMENT OF JET FAVORS MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
AND THE ADJACENT FOOTHILLS. WILL ISSUE A HIGH WIND WATCH FOR 04Z-21Z 
SUNDAY. A LINE OF CONVECTION IS ANTICIPATED SUNDAY AS THE 
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. WILL CALL FOR WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE WESTERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. WILL NEED TO MONITOR CHANCE OF SEVERE SINCE THE 
SYSTEM WILL BE QUITE DYNAMIC...BUT INSTABILITY IS QUITE LIMITED AT 
BEST.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROF CONTINUES TO 
SHIFT ONLY SLOWLY EAST SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS AT LEAST 
THREE SHORTER WAVELENGTH SYSTEMS WITH MODERATELY DEEP MOISTURE DROP 
SOUTHEAST AROUND THE AMPLIFIED TROF. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARM 
ENOUGH THAT ANY PRECIP WILL BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN FOR 
SUNDAY/MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY THICKNESSES WILL BE 
DROPPING IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME AND SNOW SHOWERS WILL BECOME 
MORE LIKELY AS THE PRECIP TYPE ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS A PART OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TUESDAY EVENING. 
KEPT THE FORECAST DRY WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD THURSDAY 
AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. MODELS ALL OVER THE PLACE LATE IN THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD WITH A FAIRLY HIGH DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY SO USED 
PERSISTENCE METHOD FOR THURSDAY. FOR FRIDAY...USED A LOW CHANCE 
PROBABILITY IN ORDER TO GET A LITTLE CLOSER TO NEIGHBORING WFO'S 
THOUGHTS AT THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. TRENDED MAX/MIN 
TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO IF NOT A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EST FRI JAN 22 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR LOUISVILLE KY...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED OCCLUDED FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THIS LOW 
AND ITS OCCLUDED FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING...CREATING SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SHOWERS THIS 
MORNING. THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO GRADUALLY DISSIPATE BY THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED RAIN ENDING. HOWEVER...CLOUD 
COVER SHOULD LINGER INTO TONIGHT...WITH A STRONG MID LEVEL INVERSION 
PREVENTING ANY VERTICAL MIXING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES TODAY...AND WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN FOCUS FOR THE LONG 
TERM REVOLVES AROUND THE NEXT IN A SERIES OF SYSTEMS THAT APPROACHES 
IN THE LATE SATURDAY THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY TIME FRAME. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST CONDITIONS FAVORABLE FOR POTENTIAL MOUNTAIN WAVE 
EVENT AS FRONT APPROACHES WITH STRONG SOUTHEASTERLY LOW-LEVEL FLOW
PERPENDICULAR TO MOUNTAIN AXIS ORIENTATION...VEERING WIND PROFILE
AND RELATIVELY STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER. WENT WITH CATEGORICAL POPS AS
FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE AREA. BROAD LONGWAVE TROUGH SETS UP OVER
THE EASTERN CONUS BEHIND FRONT WITH LINGERING LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE
AND COOLER TEMPS. MODEL/ENSEMBLE SOLUTIONS DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY BY
LATE IN THE LONG TERM. THUS DID NOT MAKE ANY SUBSTANTIVE CHANGES TO
PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE
SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE OTHER THAN MINOR TWEAKS BASED
ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS.

TN VALLEY AND NORTH GEORGIA. SHOWERS WILL BE MOVING ACROSS THE AREA
OVERNIGHT AS THE CLOSED UPPER LOW MOVES THROUGH...BUT DO NOT EXPECT
MUCH MORE IN THE WAY OF THUNDER. WILL MAKE SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS
TO POP...GOING HIGHER NORTH AND A BIT LOWER SOUTH...BUT OTHERWISE

196 
FXUS64 KMRX 212027
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EST THU JAN 21 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING SHOWERS AND SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA TONIGHT.  WITH SOME INSTABILITY EXPECTED 
COULD SEE SOME ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS EARLY 
TONIGHT.  BUT THE THREAT SHOULD DECREASE AFTER SUNSET.  WILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS FOR TONIGHT. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION FOR TONIGHT.  THE UPPER LOW LINGERS TO THE NORTH OF 
THE CWA ON FRIDAY...SO KEPT LOW POPS IN FOR FRIDAY WITH THE HIGHEST  
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON FRIDAY NIGHT  
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...BROAD UPPER TROF 
BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY 
DRIVING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT TOWARD 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. STAYED WITH CATEGORICAL POPS EVERYWHERE 
BUT SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE LIKELY POP 
SHOULD SUFFICE UNTIL 12Z SUNDAY WHEN IT IS BEST TO HAVE THE 
CATEGORICAL LIKELIHOOD IN PLACE AS FRONTAL LIFT PROGRESSES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. GRADUALLY DECREASE POPS WITH SLOW MOVING SYSTEM 
SUNDAY NIGHT. SEVERAL SHORTWAVES DROP SOUTHEAST AROUND GREAT LAKES 
UPPER LOW FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY PERIOD AS NORTHWEST FLOW LEADS 
TO OROGRAPHIC ENHANCEMENT OF PRECIP WHICH COULD PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS 
ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS REGIME FINALLY SHUTS DOWN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. THUS WAS ABLE TO 
MAINTAIN A DRY DAY ON WEDNESDAY AWAITING NEXT UPPER TROF AND FRONTAL 
SYSTEM. UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME RANGE REQUIRES LIMITING POP WITH 
THIS SYSTEM ON THURSDAY TO SLIGHT CHANCE. TRENDED TEMPS TOWARD NEW 
MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

-SHRA WILL DEVELOP AS THE PRESSURE CENTER NEARS THE TAF SITES LATE

122 
FXUS64 KMRX 211517
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1017 AM EST THU JAN 21 2010

.DISCUSSION...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING SHOWERS 
TO THE AREA.  RADAR COVERAGE DECREASING...SO WILL LOWER POPS IN THE 
WESTERN COUNTIES TODAY. BUT UPPER LOW STILL EXPECTED LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON SO WILL STILL KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR FOR THE WEST. 
TEMPERATURES NOT RISING MUCH TODAY.  WILL LOWER TEMPS A BIT IN THE 
NORTHERN ZONES. WINDS STILL EXPECTED TO INCREASE SO WILL KEEP WIND 
ADVISORY GOING FOR THE MOUNTAINS.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER WESTERN
ARKANSAS EARLY THIS MORNING WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
EXTENDING SOUTHEAST INTO MS AND AL. ONLY A FEW SHOWERS EARLY THIS
MORNING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDS OUT
FROM THE SURFACE LOW ACROSS KY AND TO THE NE PART OF THE FORECAST
AREA. TEMPERATURES ARE MILD IN THE WARMER AIR SOUTH OF THE
STATIONARY FRONT IN THE MID 40S TO NEAR 50 WITH PATCHY FOG IN SOME
PLACES LESS THAN A MILE. FOR TODAY THE UPPER LOW AND SURFACE LOW
MOVE EAST INTO WESTERN PARTS OF TN AND KY WITH THE LOW SLOWLY
FILLING. A PERIOD OF MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS POSSIBLE IN
THE MORNING TO EARLY AFTERNOON AS CONVECTION MOVES NORTHEAST OUT OF
MS AND AL INTO TN. WINDS SHOULD PICK UP ESPECIALLY IN THE MOUNTAINS
AS PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS. SO CONTINUED WIND ADVISORY MOUNTAINS.
ELEVATED INSTABILITY STILL LOOKS TO SPREAD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO
THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA AS FRONT OCCLUDES. TONIGHT SURFACE LOW
WEAKENS AND FILLS AND MAIN PRECIPITATION AREA SHIFTS EAST. WINDS
SHOULD DECREASE AS WELL. HIGH TEMPERATURE FORECAST TRICKY NORTHEAST
AS SURFACE HIGH BUILD SOUTH EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS AND SO KEPT
TEMPERATURES STEADY AS SOME COLDER AIR SPREADS INTO SW VA AND NE
TN. HIGHS MIGHT ACTUALLY COME IN THE MORNING IN THE FAR NORTHEAST.
TONIGHT TEMPERATURES DROP TO THE MID 30S TO MID 40S BEHIND COLD FRONT.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...OCCLUDED LOW SLOWLY FILLS 
OVER THE AREA ON FRI. CLOUD COVER AND CHC OF SHOWERS LINGERS MUCH OF 
THE DAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA FROM 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. BREEZY CONDITIONS SAT NGT/SUN. 
SOLID PCPN CHANCES FOR SUNDAY WHEN THE BEST DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE 
ARRIVES.  UPPER LOW FOLLOWS ON MONDAY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION ON SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY.  UPPER LOW LINGERS ON MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AGAIN.  COLD AIR FILTERS IN SO COULD 
SEE LIGHT SNOW IN THE NORTHERN AREAS ON MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
TUESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE FOLLOWS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  
STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. ABOVE NORMAL THRU MON 
THEN MILD COOL DOWN TUE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...

ADVISORY FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS AND SW NC FROM 15Z TO 00Z TOMORROW.
THE PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER THE MOUTAINS WILL BE TIGHTENING LATE
TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS THE CAROLINAS AND LOW
PRESSURE APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. THE NAM SHOWS SOUTHEAST WINDS
AROUND 3 KFT BETWEEN 30 AND 40 KTS.

A MENTION OF ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. THE ELEVATED INSTABILITY IS
HIGHEST OVER MIDDLE TN AND DROPS OFF OVER THE PLATEAU...SO THUNDER
WILL BE DECREASING AS THE STORMS MOVE EAST. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES
SHOULD ONLY FALL SLIGHTLY FROM CURRENT VALUES DUE TO WEAK WARM
ADVECTION.

912 
FXUS64 KMRX 202024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST WED JAN 20 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LARGE AREA OF RAIN HAS
PUSHED EAST RATHER QUICKLY THROUGH THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...
WITH BACK EDGE OF THIS RAIN LOCATED ACROSS EASTERN MOST PARTS OF
THE VALLEY COUNTIES...BUT LINGERING OVER ALL OF SWRN VA AT MID
AFTERNOON. EXPECT A BRIEF BREAK IN RAIN BEFORE AN UPSTREAM AREA OF
SCATTERED TO BROKEN CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION MOVES IN BY EARLY
EVENING. LOWERED POPS BRIEFLY EARLY TONIGHT FOR THIS SCENARIO AND
ADDED SOME MENTION OF ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. KEPT POPS GENERALLY
IN THE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL RANGE FOR OVERNIGHT PERIOD. TEMPS WILL
STAY ON THE MILD SIDE AND IN LINE WITH SIMILAR MOS MINS.

FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER AND SURFACE LOW TRACK 
EAST INTO WESTERN PARTS OF TN AND KY...WITH A PERIOD OF MODERATE TO 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS EXPECTED AT LEAST EARLY THURSDAY. NAM MODEL HAS 
BACKED OFF ON THE STRENGTH OF THE LOW LEVEL JET (MORE IN LINE WITH 
GFS DEPICTION OF AROUND 40 KNOTS OR SO)...SO I HELD OFF ON ISSUING A 
WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AT THIS TIME. SPREAD TSRA 
OVER MORE OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO THURSDAY AFTERNOON...AS A LARGE 
AREA OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY MOVES EAST INTO THE REGION AS THE LOW 
TRACKS EAST ON THURSDAY. DECENT COVERAGE OF WRAP AROUND SHOWERS
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.

NAM SEEMS TO HOLD ON TO MORE SHOWERS INTO FRIDAY...AND IS MUCH
COOLER THAN GFS FOR HIGHS. FOR NOW...I OPTED FOR A MOS BLEND ON
POPS WHICH KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND MORE IN LINE
WITH NEIGHBORS. SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT THE WARMER GFS MOS FOR HIGHS
...WHICH AGAIN BLENDED BETTER WITH ADJACENT FORECAST GRIDS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  A FRONT 
TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA FROM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. 
WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR SUNDAY WHEN THE BEST DYNAMICS AND 
MOISTURE ARRIVES.  UPPER LOW FOLLOWS ON MONDAY...WILL KEEP THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION ON 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  UPPER LOW LINGERS ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  
WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AGAIN.  COLD AIR FILTERS 
IN SO COULD SEE SNOW IN THE NORTHERN AREAS ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE FOLLOWS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  60  44  55  39 / 100 100  40  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  56  42  52  37 /  90 100  60  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  55  42  52  37 /  90 100  60  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  50  37  50  33 /  80  90  70  30  10

FORECAST AREA THURSDAY MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS...WITH SOME 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS POSSIBLE DURING THIS SAME PERIOD.

WITH FORECAST GRIDS...SO OCCASIONAL LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN IS ON TAP 
FOR TODAY. WILL CHECK HOURLY CONDITIONS AND MAX TEMP FORECAST. PLAN 
TO UPDATE FORECAST GRIDS AND AFFECTED WEB PRODUCTS BY 11 AM EST.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST WED JAN 20 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT WEATHER MAP SHOWS HIGH
PRESSURE OVER FL AND LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER EASTERN KS WITH A WARM
FRONT ACROSS KY AND MID ATLANTIC. CURRENT SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDY
SKIES OVER THE TN VALLEY WITH AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS IN WARM
ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD OF KS LOW IN ARKANSAS. SHIELD OF RAIN IS
MOVING EAST ACROSS WESTERN KY AND NORTHERN MIDDLE TN TOWARDS THE
FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME. ONLY PATCHY LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA SO FAR. MODELS FORECAST WARM FRONT TO STAY TO THE
NORTH BUT RAIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE
MORNING HOURS. EXPECTING LIGHT AMOUNTS TODAY BUT TONIGHT A NEW LOW
PRESSURE AREA WILL MOVE OUT OF THE ROCKIES AND INTO THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS. CONVECTION DEVELOPING ACROSS MS AND AL THIS EVENING WILL
LIFT NORTHEAST INTO SE TN OVERNIGHT WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN
POSSIBLE. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ABOUT ONE INCH BY THURSDAY MORNING
ARE POSSIBLE. RIGHT NOW DO NOT THINK THAT WILL PRODUCE ANY
FLOODING. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS COULD OCCUR BEFORE MORNING IN SE
TN. TEMPERATURES ARE MILD THIS MORNING IN THE MID 40S TO NEAR 50.
HIGHS SHOULD BE IN THE 50S WITH LOWS ONLY IN THE 40S TONIGHT DUE
CLOUDS AND RAIN.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ONGOING CONVECTION WILL MOVE 
NE INTO THE AREA EARLY THU. SOME TSTMS COULD PRODUCE STRONG WINDS 
AND WITH LOW FREEZING LEVEL LARGE HAIL ALSO POSSIBLE. LOW LEVEL JET 
STRONG EARLY AND WINDS IN THE MNTS WILL BE BREEZY EARLY ON THU. 
WINDS WILL BE TRANSITORY AS SURFACE LOW MOVES NE THROUGH MID TN 
DURING THE DAY. OCCLUDED SURFACE LOW MEANDERS TOWARD SW VA THU NGT. 
PCPN WILL SLOWLY TAPER OFF FM THE SW FRI AS SFC LOW FILLS.
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE BUILDS IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUING THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD. 
CONDITIONS CHANGE RAPIDLY SAT NGT AS RIDGE MOVES EAST AND LARGE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES EAST ACROSS UPPER MID WEST. LONG STRETCHING 
COLD FRONT MOVES EAST THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY WITH EXPANSIVE 
CONVECTION STRETCHING FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO THE GLFMEX. CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY MAY PERSIST ACROSS THE AREA MUCH OF SUNDAY. UPPER TROF AXIS 
LINGERS TO OUR WEST THROUGH MONDAY SO SPOTTY LIGHT PCPN CONTINUES. 
UPPER TROF AXIS AND BETTER CAA MOVES THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NGT. 
GROUND SHOULD BE RELATIVELY WARM AS PCPN CHANGES TO SNOW MONDAY NGT 
MAINLY N OF KNOXVILLE. TUESDAY TEMPS FALL TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

021 
FXUS64 KMRX 191935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST TUE JAN 19 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...PLEASANT CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
TO SLOWLY DETERIORATE THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD PER MODEL/SREF 
CONSENSUS. THERE ARE STILL SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE 
MODELS WITH GFS AT LEAST 6 HOURS FASTER THAN NAM AND SREF. TENDED TO 
FAVOR SLOWER CONSENSUS AND THUS SIGNIFICANTLY UNDERCUT MAV POPS IN 
THE FIRST PERIOD. CATEGORICAL POPS LOOK APPROPRIATE FOR THE SECOND 
PERIOD AS ALL MODELS DEPICT WIDESPREAD RAIN OVER THE AREA. IT DOES 
NOT APPEAR PRECIP WILL BE ESPECIALLY HEAVY WITH THIS FIRST ROUND 
HOWEVER WITH FORECAST QPFS GENERALLY NOT MORE THAN ABOUT 0.25 
INCHES. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT A NEGATIVELY-TILTED 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
AXIS WILL STRETCH FROM OK TO THE MS/AL COAST...AND THE NOSE OF THE 
UPPER JET WILL BE PUSHING INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY WITH THE 
LEFT-EXIT REGION OVER AL/GA. THE DEVELOPMENT OF COLD AIR DAMMING 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL RESULT IN AN EAST-WEST ORIENTED FRONT 
ACROSS NORTHERN GA...EXTENDING WEST ACROSS NORTHERN AL/MS TO THE 
SURFACE LOW OVER AR/WEST TN. THIS FRONT SHOULD BE THE FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTION ON THURSDAY. THE CONCERN FOR OUR AREA IS THAT THE 
EAST-WEST ORIENTATION OF CONVECTION TO OUR SOUTH WILL CUT OFF OUR 
SUPPLY OF DEEP MOISTURE...AND LATENT HEAT RELEASE FROM THIS 
CONVECTION WILL HELP MIDLEVEL STABILIZATION. WHILE CATEGORICAL POPS 
ARE STILL WARRANTED FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...OUR QPF WILL 
LIKELY BE LIMITED...ESPECIALLY IN NORTHERN SECTIONS. 

THE GFS SHOWS SOME DECENT SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY MOVING INTO OUR 
AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT THE NAM'S DEPICTION OF KEEPING THE 
INSTABILITY TO OUR SOUTH LOOKS MORE REALISTIC. SOME WEAK ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY MAY BE POSSIBLE IN THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS...BUT WILL NOT 
MENTION ANY THUNDERSTORMS AT THIS TIME. THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS PUSHES 
TO OUR EAST THURSDAY NIGHT...AND ALL PRECIP SHOULD END BEFORE 12Z 
FRIDAY. THE PACIFIC ORIGIN OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MEANS THAT 
COLD ADVECTION WILL BE MINIMAL AND TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN MILD ON 
FRIDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS.

A DEEP CLOSED LOW WILL SLOWLY TRACK FROM THE PLAINS TO THE GREAT 
LAKES FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT PUSHES 
THROUGH OUR AREA ON SUNDAY...AND THERE IS GOOD AGREEMENT AMONG THE 
MODELS ON THIS PATTERN AND THE TIMING. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS ON 
SUNDAY AS A RESULT OF THE GOOD MODEL CONSENSUS. WITH THE GFS SHOWING 
A 150+ KT UPPER JET PUSHING INTO THE AREA...DYNAMICS LOOK QUITE 
STRONG WITH THIS SYSTEM. ADD A 70+ KT LLJ AND 850 MB THETA-E VALUES 
NEAR 320K...AND THUNDERSTORMS LOOK LIKE A POSSIBILITY...IF NOT SOME 
SEVERE STORMS. WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF THUNDER IN THE 
CLIMATOLOGICALLY-FAVORED SOUTHERN SECTIONS. A HIGH WIND EVENT WITH 
MOUNTAIN WAVES ALSO APPEARS LIKELY SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY. 

THE UPPER JET AND DRY SLOT MOVE OVER SUNDAY NIGHT...LOWERING POPS TO 
A CHANCE OR SLIGHT CHANCE. A SECOND SHORTWAVE EMBEDDED WITHIN A DEEP 
UPPER TROUGH WILL KEEP A CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT...MAINLY IN NORTHERN SECTIONS. COLD ADVECTION AND AN 
UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL FLOW MAY BRING A TRANSITION TO SNOW MONDAY NIGHT 
IN THE NORTH AND THE MOUNTAINS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  57  50  61  46 /  30  80  80  90  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  55  48  57  43 /  20  90  80  90  50

FXUS64 KMRX 181940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST MON JAN 18 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...GENERALLY TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
TO BUILD INTO THE REGION AND FLOW ALOFT REMAINS NEARLY ZONAL. MINOR 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH PROJECTED TO TRANSLATE THROUGH THE REGION 
TONIGHT...BUT ONLY AN INCREASE IN MID-LEVEL CLOUDS IS EXPECTED WITH
THIS FEATURE. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV
GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MIDLEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS AND A CHANCE 
OF RAIN LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. THE DEPTH OF THE LIFT AND MOISTURE WILL 
BE INCREASING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE STRENGTHENS OVER THE 
PLAINS...AND WILL BRING THE POPS UP TO LIKELY. HOWEVER THE QPF 
SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT AS THE LIFT REMAINS WEAK...MAINLY ASSOCIATED 
WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT. THE BEST LIFT WILL BE LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY WITH THE PASSAGE OF A NEGATIVELY-TILTED SHORTWAVE TROUGH IN 
THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS...ALONG WITH GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE ABOVE A 
50 KT 850 MB JET. OVERALL...MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN PRETTY GOOD 
AGREEMENT...SO WILL GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS ON THURSDAY. THE 
SOUTHEASTERLY LLJ DEPICTED IN THE GFS GETS UP TO 50 KTS AT 850 
MB...SO THERE COULD BE SOME ADVISORY-LEVEL WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS ON 
THURSDAY. PRECIP SHOULD END BEFORE 12Z FRIDAY WITH THE PASSAGE OF 
THE SURFACE COLD FRONT AND 850 MB TROUGH AXIS. 

MILD TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE INTO FRIDAY AS THERE IS LITTLE IN THE WAY 
OF COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE DEPARTING LOW. AN UPPER RIDGE WILL 
PROVIDE DRY WEATHER WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH SATURDAY. 
A DEEP CLOSED LOW WILL BE TRACKING EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS 
TO THE GREAT LAKES SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. GFS AND ECMWF 
AGREE ON THE FROPA ON SUNDAY. THE WARM ADVECTION AND LLJ LOOK QUITE 
STRONG AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE POSSIBLE WITH SUCH 
A PATTERN...BUT WILL NOT MENTION THIS YET AS IT IS STILL A LONG WAY 
OUT TO FORECAST AGAINST CLIMATOLOGY.

FXUS64 KMRX 180146
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST SUN JAN 17 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED ALONG 
THE MID ATLANTIC COAST...WITH A TROUGH EXTENDING SOUTHWEST OF IT 
ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
SOME LIGHT RAIN LINGERING OVER THE MOUNTAINS IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
THIS TROUGH...BUT THIS RAIN SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE EAST AND 
EXIT THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS EVENING. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS 
THE BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUDS OVER MIDDLE TN...BUT THESE CLOUDS APPEAR 
TO NOT BE MAKING MUCH PROGRESS TO THE EAST THIS EVENING. A MID LEVEL 
INVERSION IS PROGGED TO LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT... 
WHICH SHOULD ALSO SLOW ANY EROSION OF THESE CLOUDS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. ALTHOUGH SOME CLEARING MAY DEVELOP ACROSS 
THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE SUNRISE...THINK THAT 
THIS CLEARING WILL ENCOURAGE FOG DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT. THUS...WILL 
PLAN TO MENTION MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH AREAS OF FOG DUE 
TO THE SATURATED AIR MASS. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST LATER THIS EVENING TO 
REMOVE MENTION OF RAIN...TO ADD A MENTION OF FOG...AND TO TWEAK 
TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST SUN JAN 17 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL PULL 
AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT WITH WEAK UPPER RIDGING/SURFACE HIGH

EVENING...TAKING MORE SIGNIFICANT PRECIP WITH IT.  MAY BE SOME

SHOWERS.  DIFFICULT CLOUD FORECAST...AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY BE 
TRAPPED UNDER INVERSION KEEPING LOW CLOUDS FOR LONGER THAN 
FORECAST...BUT FOR NOW WILL HAVE CLEARING FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST LATE TONIGHT/MONDAY MORNING...WITH EVEN NORTHEAST ZONES 
MOSTLY  SUNNY IN THE AFTERNOON.  WILL UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A BIT FOR 
MONDAY...BUT OVERALL WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
TO PERSIST INTO MID WORK WEEK AS UPPER FLOW REMAINS NEARLY ZONAL. 
MINOR SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...BUT IS 
NOT EXPECTED TO RESULT IN ANYTHING MORE THAN A SLIGHT INCREASE IN 
CLOUD COVER. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES ON WEDNESDAY WITH EFFECTS FROM 
THE ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT EXPECTED LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. UNFORTUNATELY...
MODELS/ENSEMBLES REMAIN IN GENERAL DISAGREEMENT WITH THE DETAILS OF
THIS FEATURE. THUS DID NOT MAKE MANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO
PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST OTHER THAN TO BUMP UP POPS TO LIKELY ON
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TENDED TO FAVOR MODEL/ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS OF DRY BY
EARLY NEXT WEEKEND BUT DID BUMP UP POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE/LOW CHANCE
SATURDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUING CHANCE POPS INTO SUNDAY AS NEXT IN A
SERIES OF SYSTEMS APPROACHES IN CONTINUED PROGRESSIVE PATTERN. FOR
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
630 AM EST SUN JAN 17 2010

.AVIATION...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE OVER TAF SITES TODAY. 
WINDS WILL BECOME LIGHT AND GENERALLY SHIFT FROM THE NE TO THE SW 
AROUND 1718/1720Z. BULK OF PRECIPITATION HAS MOVE TO THE NORTH. 
CLOUD DECKS WILL LOWER TO IFR AND CONTINUE MUCH OF THE PERIOD. 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT PCPN THIS 
AFTN. VSBY WILL BOUNCE FROM MVFR TO IFR WITH FOG AND LIGHT PCPN.

&&

.DISCUSSION...WINDS HAVE WEAKENED AND WILL BE TRANSITIONAL AS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. BEST LIFT HAS MOVED 
NORTH OF THE AREA. VERY LIGHT PATCHY PCPN WILL CONTINUE THIS 
MORNING. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH AN INCREASE IN COVERAGE MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTH PART OF THE MRX 
CWA. TEMPS WILL MOVE LITTLE TODAY. SON 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW CURRENTLY LAGGING SW OF 
SURFACE LOW WHICH IS OVER NE MS EARLY THIS MORNING. WARM FRONT 
EXTENDS EAST OF LOW ALONG SOUTHERN BORDER OF MRX CWA. DEFORMATION 
ZONE SET UP NICELY OVERNIGHT ACROSS NW PART OF MRX CWA. MODERATE 
RAINFALL HAS BEEN PERSISTENT IN THE ZONE WHICH SHOULD WEAKEN AND 
SHIFT N OF THE AREA EARLY TODAY. SE H85 JET SHOULD BE PEAKING IN THE 
NEXT HOUR OR TWO. NO OBSERVATION SITES HAVE RECORDED SIGNIFICANT 
GUSTS AS OF YET. AREA RADARS INDICATE AROUND 40 KTS AT 3-4KFT. 
OCCASIONAL WAVE LIKE SIGNATURES ARE SHOWING UP ON VELOCITY PRODUCTS 
SO LET HIGH WIND WARNING CONTINUE BUT WINDS SHOULD VEER EARLY TODAY. 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BECOMES STACKED OVER AREA TODAY AS IT MOVES NE 
WITH A WAVE DEVELOPING ALONG THE WARM FRONT EAST OF THE AREA. BY MID 
DAY WINDS WILL SLACKEN AND OVERALL CONDITIONS SHOULD BE SOUPY. 
SYSTEM SLIDES NE THIS EVENING AND WIND SHIFT AND DRYING WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT. COLD AIR ADVECTION NOT VERY STRONG BEHIND 
LOW.     

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DRY WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES 
EXPECTED MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS THE WEEKEND/S SYSTEM CONTINUES TO 
PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION.  WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...WILL ENTER INTO 
A PROGRESSIVE...UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR MID WEEK.  WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY WILL SEE SCATTERED SHOWERS AS A FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WITH 
A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES ALONG IT...SLIDES INTO THE AREA.  SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER OVER NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS INTO FRIDAY AND A 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BUILD IN FOR FOR DRY CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
901 PM EST SAT JAN 16 2010

.DISCUSSION...AN UPPER LOW IS LOCATED ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI
RIVER VALLEY WITH A STRONG JET EVIDENT OVER THE NORTHERN GULF MOVING
INTO THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE. THIS JET WILL MOVE QUICKLY NORTH TOWARD
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT WITH STRONG DIVERGENCE ALOFT
ALONG WITH INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING AN AREA OF RAIN
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WIDESPREAD RAIN...LIGHT TO MODERATE...CAN
BE EXPECTED AREA-WIDE OVERNIGHT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS UP TO 1 INCH IS
ANTICIPATED. SNOW-PACK UP AROUND 1 FOOT IN DEPTH IS REPORTED OVER
THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS (GENERALLY ABOVE 4KFT...EXCEPT FOR 3KFT
ACROSS THE HIGH KNOB MASSIF). SOME MINOR FLOODING OF SMALL STREAMS
ARE POSSIBLE WHICH CAN BE HANDLED WITH URBAN AND SMALL STREAM ADVISORIES.

WILL REISSUE THE SPS BY 04Z.

NEXT CONCERN IS THE STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET (850MB WINDS AROUND 50KTS)
LATER OVERNIGHT. WILL CONTINUE HIGH WIND WARNING FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

HAVE MADE MINOR CHANGES TO MINS TONIGHT...OTHERWISE GOING FORECASTS
LOOKS GOOD.
