480 
FXUS64 KMRX 161935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST SAT JAN 16 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...STILL QUITE A BIT OF 
UNCERTAINTY ON WHERE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK...AS GFS 
CONTINUES TO SHOW A TRACK TO OUR SOUTHEAST AND NAM HAS IT FURTHER 
NORTHWEST. LITTLE DOUBT THAT ENTIRE AREA WILL SEE SIGNIFICANT RAIN 
TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY...SO WILL GO WITH CAT POPS.  GFS NOT SHOWING AS 
MUCH COOLING ALOFT AS EARLIER RUNS FOR SUN AFTERNOON...BUT STILL 
SOME RISK THAT THERE WILL BE A CHANGEOVER TO SNOW OVER THE VERY 
HIGHEST PEAKS OF THE MOUNTAINS SUN AFTERNOON...BUT DOWNPLAY THIS 
POTENTIAL FOR NOW GIVEN WARMER DEPICTION IN OTHER MODELS AND SYSTEM 
TRACK UNCERTAINTY.  OTHER CONCERNS ARE POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING AND 
HIGH WINDS.  DOES NOT LOOK NEARLY AS IMPRESSIVE AS SOME OF OUR 
EARLIER WIND EVENTS...BUT EVEN USING A NAM/GFS BLEND LOOKS LIKE 
THERE COULD BE A FAIRLY BRIEF PERIOD WHERE MOUNTAIN WAVES COULD 
AFFECT THE NORMALLY FAVORED SPOTS...AND THE MODEL 850 WINDS DO 
APPROACH 50 KTS.  SO WILL UPGRADE WATCH TO A HIGH WIND WARNING BUT 
NARROW TIME WINDOW DOWN A BIT.  FLOODING POTENTIAL DOES NOT LOOK 
STRONG ENOUGH FOR A WATCH...SO WILL JUST CONTINUE THE SPS WHERE SNOW 
MELT MAY AUGMENT RUNOFF.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SYSTEM PULLS OUT OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SUNDAY NIGHT WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING 
NEARLY ZONAL. DRY CONDITIONS RETURN FOR THE EARLY PORTION OF THE 
WORK WEEK BEFORE MORE UNSETTLED WEATHER APPROACHES BY MID WEEK AS 
PATTERN REMAINS PROGRESSIVE. GENERAL DISAGREEMENT AMONG MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO LEAD TO QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY FOR MID 
WEEK. AS SUCH...DID NOT MAKE ANY PROFOUND CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST. LATE LONG TERM PERIOD APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME. GFS 
AND SOME OF ITS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PROJECT ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHING 
NEXT WEEKEND. KEPT THINGS DRY FOR NOW GIVEN THE TIMING UNCERTAINTIES 
AND MODEL DIFFERENCES HOWEVER.

FXUS64 KMRX 160905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST SAT JAN 16 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CONTINUES TO DEVELOP OVER THE NW GLFMEX THIS MORNING. SW-NE UPPER 
JET STRENGTHENING AND ALIGNING FROM CENTRAL GLFMEX TO S APPALACHIANS 
TODAY AND TONIGHT. LOW PW VALUES INCREASE DRAMATICALLY FROM <.50 
EARLY TODAY TO >=1.00 BY LATE THIS EVENING. GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE 
SETS UP SO WIDESPREAD RAINFALL ON TRACK OVERNIGHT. POSITION OF 
SURFACE LOW AS IT APPROACHES AREA REMAINS SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN BY THIS 
EVENING. MORE IMPORTANTLY LOW LEVEL JET POSITION SEEMS TO BE LINING 
UP A BIT EAST OF THE AREA WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF IT PUNCHING INTO 
THE SMOKYS TONIGHT. MODELS DEPICT RAIN SHADOW IN NORMAL DOWNSLOPE 
AREAS WITH BEST QPF TO THE NW AND ESPECIALLY SE OF THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT. FLOOD THREAT REMAINS MARGINAL BUT WILL MONITOR CLOSELY 
DUE TO POSSIBLE RUNOFF PROBLEMS WITH ELEVATED SNOW PACKS AND FROZEN 
GROUND. KEPT HIGH WIND WATCH AS IT STANDS AS CONFIDENCE FOR WARNING 
NOT QUITE THERE YET. ADVISORY CONDITION WINDS DO APPEAR LIKELY FOR 
THE MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT. HIGH POPS CONTINUE ON SUNDAY BUT MAY SEE A
DRY SLOT AND LOWER CHANCES IN THE MORNING HOURS FOLLOWED BY BETTER 
COVERAGE AS WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MOVES IN SUNDAY AFTN. LEANED TOWARD 
THE WARM SIDE OF TEMP GUIDANCE AS CAA HOLDS OFF UNTIL LATE IN THE 
PERIOD.     

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL 
LINGER OVER THE AREA...MAINLY NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS...AS 
THE UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY FOR THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT.  WILL BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  MOVING INTO AN UNSETTLED 
PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.  WITH POOR CONSISTENCY ON 
DETAILS...CONFIDENCE LOW.  IN GENERAL...MODELS BRING A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY INTO THE REGION AS A SERIES OF WAVES TRACK ALONG IT.  FOR 
NOW...WILL KEEP POPS AT CHANCE CATEGORY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY... 
DECREASING ON FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

FXUS64 KMRX 151935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST FRI JAN 15 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...MAINLY CLEAR SKY WILL GIVE 
WAY TO INCREASING CLOUDS AS NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES.  MODELS COMING 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH TRACK OF THIS STORM...ALTHOUGH STILL SOME 
TIMING DIFFERENCES.  WILL LEAN TOWARD A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE 
FASTER GFS AND SLOWER NAM...BRINGING HIGH CHANCE POPS INTO FAR SOUTH 
ZONE AND SLIGHT CHANCE INTO CENTRAL ZONES BY LATE IN THE DAY. WILL 
BE WARM ENOUGH SATURDAY FOR ALL RAIN...EVEN HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN FOCUS OF LONG TERM 
CONTINUES TO BE SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM THAT AFFECTS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. MODELS ARE
NOW IN BETTER AGREEMENT THAT SYSTEM WILL TRACK JUST WEST OF OUR
AREA. AS SUCH...SHOULD SEE A BRIEF LULL IN PRECIP BY EARLY SUNDAY
AS DRY SLOT IS PULLED INTO THE REGION. THIS SHOULD LIMIT PRECIP
SOMEWHAT BUT THE POTENTIAL FOR ONE-HALF TO ONE INCH RAINFALL
AMOUNTS STILL EXISTS. ALSO WILL ISSUE HIGH WIND WATCH FOR EASTERN
MOUNTAINS/FOOTHILLS FOR POTENTIAL MOUNTAIN WAVES AS PARAMETERS
APPEAR FAVORABLE AT THIS TIME PER MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS.

EARLY PORTION OF NEXT WORK WEEK APPEARS DRY BUT ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH THE REGION BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AS PATTERN REMAIN 
PROGRESSIVE. DETAILS OF THIS SYSTEM REMAIN MURKY SO HAVE CONTINUED 
TO SPREAD CHANCE POPS OVER SEVERAL PERIODS. FOR TEMPS...WHICH SHOULD 
REMAIN NEAR OR ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG TERM...GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY.

HOWEVER, STAY TUNED FOR POSSIBLY LATER DEVELOPMENTS THIS WEEKEND AS 
A RAIN PATTERN SETS UP. NOT EXPECTING HEAVY RAINS BUT A POSSIBLE H8 
JET MAY SET UP IN THE MOUNTAINS IN A THETA RIDGE, AND WITH STILL 
12-18 OF RIPE SNOW PACK ON THE APP TRAIL AND JUST BELOW, IT COULD 
CAUSE SOME HIGH-ISH WATER IN STREAMS. WILL DISCUSS WITH LATER SHIFTS 
AND SEE WHAT, IF ANY, STATEMENT SHOULD BE ISSUED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...TREND TOWARD MILDER 
TEMPS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE LONG TERM AS THE SOUTHERN STREAM 
BECOMES MUCH MORE ACTIVE. MAIN SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WILL AFFECT 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE LATE SATURDAY THROUGH EARLY 
SUNDAY TIME FRAME. TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE WARM ENOUGH FOR THIS TO BE
A MAINLY RAIN EVENT AS 850 MB TEMPS HOVER IN THE +6 TO +8 C RANGE.
SOME COLD AIR WILL WRAP IN BEHIND SYSTEM BUT IT APPEARS MOST OF THE
MOISTURE WILL BE GONE BY THEN. ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES BY MID
WEEK BUT TIMING DIFFERENCES PRECLUDE ANYTHING OTHER THAN SPREADING
CHANCE POPS OVER SEVERAL PERIODS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT
DEVIATE TOO MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

852 
FXUS64 KMRX 140810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST THU JAN 14 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES TO SLOWLY 
TRANSITION FROM FRIGID CONTINENTAL NORTHWEST FLOW TO MILDER 
SOUTHWEST MARITIME FLOW AS A SHORTWAVE SHIFTS NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. ALTHOUGH THERE WILL BE AN INCREASE IN HIGH 
LEVEL MOISTURE TODAY THERE SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT SUNSHINE TO KEEP 
SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY. THE WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE WITH 
TEMPERATURES APPROXIMATELY 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER. UNDERCUT WARMEST 
GUIDANCE AGAIN TODAY WITH GREATEST DEVIATION ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA/EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE SNOW COVER STILL IN 
PLACE. ALSO UNDERCUT WARMER MIN TEMPS A LITTLE BIT TONIGHT AS 
RADIATION SHOULD OCCUR TO SOME DEGREE DESPITE INCREASE IN HIGH 
CLOUDS.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
BEGIN TO TAKE SHAPE OVER THE NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO ON 
FRIDAY...AND AFFECT OUR AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
OVER THE AREA ON FRIDAY WILL PROVIDE MILD TEMPERATURES...WITH HIGHS 
IN THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS. CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING FRIDAY NIGHT AS 
THE LOW TRACKS TOWARD THE NORTHEAST...ADVECTING GULF MOISTURE TOWARD 
THE AREA. THE GFS BRINGS IN RAIN A BIT FASTER THAN OTHER 
MODELS...BUT OVERALL THERE IS GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOST OF THE RAIN 
WILL COME SATURDAY NIGHT. A DRY LAYER IN THE LOW LEVELS WILL LIKELY 
DELAY THE ONSET OF RAIN...AND WILL LOWER POPS TO JUST A SLIGHT 
CHANCE SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 

THE SOUTHERN STREAM LOW MERGES WITH A NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH OVER 
THE APPALACHIANS...WHICH ENHANCES QG FORCING SATURDAY NIGHT. GOOD 
AGREEMENT AMONG THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND THE ECMWF GIVES 
CONFIDENCE TO BOOST POPS TO CATEGORICAL AT THAT TIME. TEMPERATURES 
PROFILES INDICATE ABOVE-FREEZING TEMPS UP TO 800 MB THROUGH 
SUNDAY...SO THE BULK OF THE PRECIP WILL BE RAIN. COLD ADVECTION 
BEHIND THE DEPARTING LOW COULD LEAD TO A BRIEF CHANGE TO SNOW IN 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT DRY AIR QUICKLY FOLLOWS TO SHUT 
OFF ANY PRECIP. 

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS MAY AFFECT THE AREA 
ON WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING...BUT THERE IS QUITE A 
BIT OF SPREAD IN THE ENSEMBLES...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  26  58  30  54 /   0   0   0  10  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  26  54  30  52 /   0   0   0  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  25  54  30  52 /   0   0   0  10  20

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THURSDAY NIGHT
AND FRIDAY WILL CONTINUE DRY AS SURFACE HIGH AND UPPER RIDGE MOVES
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. LOWS AND HIGHS WILL BE WARMER. SKIES
WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO UPPER 50S.
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE
ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD RAIN INTO SE TN
SATURDAY AND THE REMAINDER OF THE REGION OVERNIGHT. A CLOSED
SURFACE LOW AND CORRESPONDING UPPER LOW PASSES OVER THE FORECAST
AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY WITH ONE TO TWO INCHES OF RAIN
POSSIBLE BY EARLY MONDAY. RAIN DECREASES LATE SUNDAY. MOISTURE
WRAPPING AROUND THE BACK OF THE DEPARTING LOW WILL KEEP CHANCE OF
PRECIP SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A BRIEF CHANGEOVER TO SNOW POSSIBLE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND SW VA. RIDGING BUILDS IN RAPIDLY BEHIND THE SYSTEM
MONDAY BUT ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM DEVELOPS RAPIDLY WEDNESDAY
SPREADING RAIN IN AGAIN BY THE END OF THE DAY. MILD TEMPERATURES
WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

443 
FXUS64 KMRX 130934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
434 AM EST WED JAN 13 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
WHILE SURFACE HIGH DOMINATES ACROSS MUCH OF THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S.
THROUGH THE PERIOD. THE UPPER FLOW WILL SLOWLY TURN MORE WESTERLY
AND DRY ADVECTION WILL LEAD TO QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE. THERE MAY
BE SOME LINGERING CLOUDS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THIS MORNING BUT
THESE SHOULD DISSIPATE ALLOWING FOR NEARLY FULL SUNSHINE ACROSS THE
REGION. THE INSOLATION SHOULD BOOST TEMPERATURES ABOVE 40 DEGREES
FOR THE FIRST TIME IN SEVERAL DAYS. A CLEAR COLD NIGHT IS IN STORE
AGAIN TONIGHT AS THE SURFACE RADIATES IN THE BONE DRY AIRMASS. WENT
BELOW GUIDANCE TEMPS TODAY AS COLD SURFACE WILL NEED A LITTLE
LONGER PERIOD OF RADIATION TO REALIZE FULL WARMING. ALSO ADJUSTED
MINS BELOW GUIDANCE TONIGHT IN DRY LIGHT WIND ENVIRONMENT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL FEATURE A UPPER RIDGE MOVING ACROSS THE 
AREA...WHICH WILL PROVIDE MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES THAN WE HAVE SEEN 
FOR SOME TIME. UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES BOTH DAYS...HIGHS SHOULD 
REACH INTO THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS...AND PERHAPS APPROACH 60 ON FRIDAY 
IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AS SLIGHT WARM ADVECTION SETS IN. 

CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE RIDGE MOVES AWAY AND 
LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE NW GULF OF MEXICO. ISENTROPIC LIFT 
AND MOISTURE ADVECTION AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD 
PRECIP OUR WAY ON SATURDAY...MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON. THE 
ECMWF...THE OPERATIONAL GFS...AND THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE IN 
PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...BRINGING THE 
BEST LIFT SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE CLOSED LOW PASSES DIRECTLY OVER THE 
AREA. WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY AT THAT TIME. MOISTURE WRAPPING 
AROUND THE BACK OF THE DEPARTING LOW WILL KEEP PRECIP GOING INTO 
SUNDAY. THE ENTIRE EVENT LOOKS TO BE RAIN AS THE GFS TEMPERATURE 
PROFILES ARE WELL ABOVE FREEZING EVERYWHERE...THOUGH THERE COULD BE 
A BRIEF CHANGE TO SNOW IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY NIGHT BEFORE THE 
DRY AIR ALOFT MOVES IN TO END PRECIP. MIDLEVEL RIDGING BUILDS IN 
QUICKLY BEHIND THE SYSTEM...SO WILL REMOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FROM MONDAY.  

&&


.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 130255
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EST TUE JAN 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...OVERNIGHT MINS ON TRACK. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO 
THE AREA. PCPN CHC REDUCED TO FLURRIES. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)... A FEW AREAS OF FLURRIES TO 
LIGHT SNOW WILL END DURING THE EVENING HOURS.  OTHERWISE...AN UPPER 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR THE SHORT 
TERM....BRINGING WITH IT CLEARING SKIES....LIGHT WINDS...DRIER 
AIR...AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.  SHOULD HAVE ONE MORE COLD NIGHT WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS AND LOW 20S...THEN WEDNESDAY HIGHS SHOULD 
REACH INTO THE UPPER 30S AND 40S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DIFFICULTY LIES IN 
WHETHER TO USE THE FLIP FLOPPING GFS OR THE ECMWF. WENT WITH ECMWF 
FOR MOST OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST AS IT'S BEEN MORE TRUSTWORTHY OF 
LATE. DID USE THE GFS WINDS AND FOR SOME MAX/MINS. POPS AND WEATHER 
ECMWF. AFTER INITIAL SYSTEM MOVES OUT, FINALLY, SOME RIDGING IN THE 
SPLIT FLOW FOR A WARMING AND CLEARING TREND THROUGH ABOUT FRIDAY. 
HAVE FOLLOWED MIDNIGHT SHIFT'S LEAD AND BACKED OFF THE FRIDAY-FRIDAY 
NIGHT POPS AND PUSH BACK SATURDAY POPS. NEXT SYSTEM SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY IS WEAKER THAN PREVIOUSLY ADVERTISED, SO CAVEAT EMPTOR. LATER 
IN THE FORECAST ANOTHER SHORT RIDGE DEVELOPS OVER THE OHIO-TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS, BUT WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE RIDGE AXIS ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT WEDNESDAY. TEMPS WILL COOL OFF A HAIR ON THE WEEKEND, 
AND REBOUND IN A LIMITED WAY AFTER, BACK TO ABOUT NORMAL. TEMPS 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH DURING THE DAY IN THE SOUTHERN AND LOWLAND 
LOCATIONS TO HAVE RAIN SHOWERS, WITH SNOW SHOWERS AT NIGHT. HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND NORTHERN LOCATIONS WILL LIKELY HAVE SHOWERS OR A MIX 
WHEN IT DOES PRECIPITATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
600 PM EST TUE JAN 12 2010

.DISCUSSION...WSW FOR LIGHT SNOW HAS EXPIRED. RAISED POPS FOR 
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS N PART OF MRX CWA THIS EVENING.
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)... A FEW AREAS OF FLURRIES TO 
LIGHT SNOW WILL END DURING THE EVENING HOURS.  OTHERWISE...AN UPPER 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR THE SHORT 
TERM....BRINGING WITH IT CLEARING SKIES....LIGHT WINDS...DRIER 
AIR...AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.  SHOULD HAVE ONE MORE COLD NIGHT WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS AND LOW 20S...THEN WEDNESDAY HIGHS SHOULD 
REACH INTO THE UPPER 30S AND 40S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DIFFICULTY LIES IN 
WHETHER TO USE THE FLIP FLOPPING GFS OR THE ECMWF. WENT WITH ECMWF 
FOR MOST OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST AS IT'S BEEN MORE TRUSTWORTHY OF 
LATE. DID USE THE GFS WINDS AND FOR SOME MAX/MINS. POPS AND WEATHER 
ECMWF. AFTER INITIAL SYSTEM MOVES OUT, FINALLY, SOME RIDGING IN THE 
SPLIT FLOW FOR A WARMING AND CLEARING TREND THROUGH ABOUT FRIDAY. 
HAVE FOLLOWED MIDNIGHT SHIFT'S LEAD AND BACKED OFF THE FRIDAY-FRIDAY 
NIGHT POPS AND PUSH BACK SATURDAY POPS. NEXT SYSTEM SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY IS WEAKER THAN PREVIOUSLY ADVERTISED, SO CAVEAT EMPTOR. LATER 
IN THE FORECAST ANOTHER SHORT RIDGE DEVELOPS OVER THE OHIO-TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS, BUT WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE RIDGE AXIS ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT WEDNESDAY. TEMPS WILL COOL OFF A HAIR ON THE WEEKEND, 
AND REBOUND IN A LIMITED WAY AFTER, BACK TO ABOUT NORMAL. TEMPS 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH DURING THE DAY IN THE SOUTHERN AND LOWLAND 
LOCATIONS TO HAVE RAIN SHOWERS, WITH SNOW SHOWERS AT NIGHT. HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND NORTHERN LOCATIONS WILL LIKELY HAVE SHOWERS OR A MIX 
WHEN IT DOES PRECIPITATE.

484 
FXUS64 KMRX 120834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 AM EST TUE JAN 12 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
WITH THE PASSAGE OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH EARLY THIS MORNING...THE 
MOISTURE SOURCE OF THE GREAT LAKES HAS OPENED UP ONCE 
AGAIN...BRINGING OVERCAST CLOUDS AND LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TO THE AREA. 
WHILE LARGE-SCALE LIFT WILL REMAIN WEAK BEHIND THE TROUGH...AN 
UPSLOPE WIND COMPONENT AND STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL KEEP 
SNOW SHOWERS GOING THROUGH THE MORNING. THE CURRENT FOREACAST LOOKS 
ON TRACK AND WILL NOT MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO QPF OR POPS. WHILE 
AMOUNTS SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT...LESS THAN ONE INCH...WILL KEEP THE 
ADVISORY GOING DUE TO THE POTENTIAL IMPACT OF SLICK ROADS THIS 
MORNING. 

THE DEPTH OF MOISTURE BEGINS TO DECREASE IN THE AFTERNOON AS LOW 
LEVEL WINDS OVER THE LOWER GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY BACK IN 
RESPONSE TO A BUILDING RIDGE. THIS SHOULD CUT OFF OUR MOISTURE 
SOURCE...ENDING ANY PRECIP AND DECREASING CLOUD COVER. SKIES WILL 
GRADUALLY CLEAR TONIGHT AS THE RIDGE BUILDS OVER OUR AREA. 

RIDGING OVER THE REGION SHOULD BRING THE WARMEST TEMPERATURES WE 
HAVE SEEN YET THIS YEAR...AND END THE STREAK OF SUB-FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES IN MANY PLACES. UNDER SUNNY SKIES...TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
REACH INTO THE 40S ON WEDENSDAY IN MOST SPOTS...AND APPROACH THE 50S 
ON THURSDAY. THE GFS MOS CONTINUES TO BE EVEN WARMER...BUT WILL 
UNDERCUT IT BY A FEW DEGREES DUE TO ITS RECENT WARM BIAS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
GFS/ECMWF NOT TOO DISSIMILAR ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT
DEVIATE A BIT SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS GFS UPPER TAKES A TRACK EAST OF
THE APPALACHIANS AND EXITS FAIRLY QUICKLY COMPARED TO THE ECMWF.
STAYED CLOSER TO THE ECMWF FOR THE LATER PORTION OF THE EXTENDED
FORECAST. UPPER LOW LIFTS NORTHEAST OUT OF NORTHERN MEXICO ON
FRIDAY TO SOUTH TEXAS AS SURFACE LOW BUILDS TOWARD THE LOUISIANA
COAST. REMOVED POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND TRIMMED BACK A BIT FOR
SATURDAY AS MODELS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH SYNOPTIC FEATURES.
ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES DURING THE DAY SATURDAY BUT THE MAIN
EVENT FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA MAY HOLD OFF UNTIL SATURDAY
NIGHT SO WENT WITH HIGHEST POPS HERE AS SURFACE LOW MOVES ACROSS
MIDDLE/EASTERN TENNESSEE AT THIS TIME. FAVORED GOOD CHANCE TO
LIKELY POPS SOUTH AND EAST WITH MEDIUM CHANCE ELSEWHERE.
POSSIBILITY OF MIXED PRECIP ON SATURDAY FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST
AS COLD DRY AIR WILL HAVE TO BE OVERCOME ACROSS MUCH OF THE
FORECAST AREA. USED A RAIN/SNOW MIX FOR SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY
AS MAIN UPPER SYSTEM GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST WITH LOWERING
PROBABILITIES. OF COURSE...ECMWF TRACK WOULD MEAN LESS CHANCE OF
FROZEN PRECIP WITH MORE WARM AIR ADVECTION. ECMWF HINTS AT
POSSIBILITY OF WEAK TRAILING NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE ENERGY
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY SO HELD ONTO SMALL/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WITH
RAIN/SNOW MIX. TRENDED TEMP FORECAST TOWARD NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST MON JAN 11 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A QUICK MOVING...WEAK COLD FRONT 
WILL SLIDE THROUGH THE REGION TONIGHT.  THIS WILL BRING LIGHT SNOW 
OR FLURRIES TO THE AREA.  MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE... 
MAINLY NORTH OF TYS...WITH GENERALLY LESS THAN AN INCH OF SNOW.  
UPSLOPE WILL ENHANCE SNOWFALL OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE 1 TO 2 
INCHES ARE POSSIBLE...AND A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED. 
A FEW FLURRIES TO LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO TUESDAY 
MORNING...THEN IMPROVING CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED.  TEMPERATURES WILL 
STAY BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD...WITH MANY LOCATIONS NOT 
EXPECTED TO REACH THE FREEZING MARK TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GOING WITH ECMWF LARGELY 
DUE TO FLIP FLOPPING BY THE GFS. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. SLOW MOVING DISTURBANCE MOVES 
INTO THE REGION LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AND LINGERS THRU THE 
WEEKEND. WILL POSTPONE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS UNTIL SAT MORNING AND KEEP 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING. SHOULD SEE MAINLY RAIN 
SATURDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
RAIN/SNOW IS EXPECTED DURING THE NIGHTTIME AND EARLY MORNING HOURS 
ON BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...BUT SHOULD SWITCH TO PRIMARILY RAIN 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. RIDGE BEGINS TO RE-ASSERT ITSELF MONDAY 
WITH A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS POSSIBLE THROUGH MONDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

LATE AFTERNOON IN THE NORTH. MOST PRECIP SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL THE 
LOWER LAYERS MOISTEN AFTER 00Z. RAISED POPS TO LIKELY IN THE NORTH 
AND THE MOUNTAINS...TAPERING TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH. THE LACK 
OF STRONG LIFT AND THE FAST MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM SHOULD KEEP SNOW 
AMOUNTS LOW...LESS THAN 2 INCHES IN SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS. WILL 
ISSUE AN SPS FOR THIS.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE EXITS THE CWA 
ON TUESDAY BRINGING SNOWSHOWERS TO THE AREA EARLY.  WILL KEEP LOW  
CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE 
THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MOVES 
INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO THE WEEKEND. WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. SHOULD SEE BOTH RAIN AND SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT WITH 
THE BEST CHANCE OF SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  RAIN/SNOW IS 
EXPECTED DURING THE NIGHTTIME AND EARLY MORNING HOURS ON BOTH 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...BUT SHOULD SWITCH TO PRIMARILY RAIN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             39  25  38  22  49 /   0  20  10   0   0

808 
FXUS64 KMRX 101939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST SUN JAN 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
THE OZARKS...WITH ITS VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS EXTENDING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO SLIDE 
SOUTH INTO THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WITH COLD AND DRY 
CONDITIONS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ARE 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP ON MONDAY AHEAD OF A FAST-MOVING COLD FRONT... 
WITH TEMPS FINALLY RISING ABOVE FREEZING IN MANY AREAS. AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL THEN SWING ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS MONDAY 
NIGHT...SO WILL KEEP A MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS. MODELS INDICATE ONLY 
A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH...SO WILL ONLY 
MENTION LOW CHANCE POPS WITH THIS SYSTEM. ALSO...THINK THAT ANY 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT 
AND GENERALLY AROUND AN INCH OR LESS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS THE COOLER NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD...WHICH 
HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. MODEL 
CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN POOR FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW. HOWEVER...A SYSTEM SHOULD BE APPROACHING THE AREA 
LATE FRIDAY WITH MAIN ASSOCIATED PRECIP PUSHING IN FOR THE WEEKEND. 
WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY WITH CHANCE POPS FOR THE WEEKEND. DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD KEEP VALLEY PRECIP AS RAIN...HOWEVER... 
OVERNIGHT...A MIX OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE. OVERALL...TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
BE NEAR NORMAL SEASONAL LEVELS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 100844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EST SUN JAN 10 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE 500 MB TROUGH AXIS HAS MOVED JUST EAST OF THE AREA EARLY THIS 
MORNING...AND A RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE AREA TODAY. A 
NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW CONTINUES TO SUPPLY MOISTURE FROM THE GREAT 
LAKES IN A THIN LAYER...AND AS WE GO THROUGH THE DAY...THIS MOIST 
LAYER WILL BECOME MORE SHALLOW. WITH NO LIFTING MECHANISMS TO SPEAK 
OF...EXPECT ONLY FLURRIES TODAY WITH NO ACCUMULATION IN MOST SPOTS. 
WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS. ANY 
FLURRIES OR SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD END BY THIS EVENING AS THE 850 MB 
RIDGE MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY...CUTTING OFF OUR MOISTURE SOURCE. 
CLOUDS WILL FINALLY BE DECREASING TOO...AND SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY 
CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT. GENERALLY SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE 
BETWEEN MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE WIND CHILL 
ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN PLACE FOR THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 10 AM...AFTER 
WHICH TIME TEMPS WARM ENOUGH AND WINDS DECREASE ENOUGH TO LET THE 
ADVISORY END. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY BRINGING 
SNOWSHOWERS TO THE AREA.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH PERIODS 
WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS 
AVAILABLE.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MOVES INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY.  SHOULD SEE BOTH RAIN AND SNOW FRIDAY 
NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF SNOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE CWA.  MAINLY RAIN IS EXPECTED ON SATURDAY EXCEPT FOR LIGHT SNOW 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.  A WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED 
DURING THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 091956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST SAT JAN 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS...WITH ITS VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS EXTENDING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
SLIDE SOUTH INTO THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WITH COLD AND 
DRY CONDITIONS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH AXIS WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT...SO WILL KEEP A MENTION OF SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA INCLUDING THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE ONLY A SHALLOW LAYER 
OF MOISTURE WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH...SO THINK ONLY LIGHT SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS OF LESS THAN AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE. WITH NORTHWEST 
WINDS LINGERING OVER THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT...WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL 
ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS WHERE WIND CHILL VALUES WILL DROP BELOW 
-5 DEGREES FOR SEVERAL HOURS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
BRINGING A FAST-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM ACROSS THE REGION ON MONDAY 
NIGHT. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS REVEAL MORE MOISTURE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM (COMPARED TO THEIR PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS)...SO WILL RAISE POPS 
FOR MONDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
INCLUDING THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE TO UNDERCUT 
THE MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS (WHICH HAVE BEEN TOO WARM LATELY). 
OVERALL...WILL TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND...ESPECIALLY ON MONDAY WHEN SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL 
BE EXITING THE REGION ON TUESDAY. LITTLE MOISTURE OR LIFT ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FEATURE BY THIS POINT AND WILL KEEP POPS LOW AND CONFINED 
TO NORTHERN AND FAR EASTERN AREAS. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
WILL BE IN THE 30S ON TUESDAY...AND SHOULD PUSH TOWARD SEASONAL 
LEVELS ON WEDNESDAY...THEN REMAIN THERE THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED. AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY. MODEL RUN CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN RATHER POOR FOR THE END 
OF THE EXTENDED. HOWEVER...A SYSTEM SHOULD BE APPROACHING THE AREA 
ON FRIDAY WITH MAIN ASSOCIATED PRECIP PUSHING IN FOR THE WEEKEND. AT 
THIS TIME...TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT FOR MAINLY RAIN ACROSS 
THE AREA...WITH SOME SNOW POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EST SAT JAN 9 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A DEEP POSITIVELY-TILTED UPPER TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...PROVIDING CONTINUED COLD TEMPERATURES AND SNOW SHOWERS 
OR FLURRIES OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. OUR MOISTURE SOURCE IN THE 
NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL BE THE GREAT LAKES...AND WILL SUSTAIN 
A THIN LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 900 MB TODAY. HOWEVER LIFT IS VERY 
WEAK...AND THE NORTHERLY FLOW IS NOT CONDUCIVE TO OROGRAPHIC LIFT. 
SO MOST OF THE AREA WILL SEE JUST FLURRIES TODAY...WITH NO 
MEASURABLE ACCUMULATION. THE MOUNTAINS AND SW VA MAY SEE A FEW 
TENTHS OF SNOW...BUT WILL END THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. WITH 
TEMPS CURRENTLY IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND WINDS AROUND 10 MPH THIS 
MORNING...WILL KEEP THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY GOING. THOUGH WE MAY SEE 
SOME OCCASIONAL SUN THIS MORNING...WE SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLOUDY 
OVERALL...AND LEANED TOWARD THE COLDER NAM MOS FOR TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH PERIODS WITH THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS 
AVAILABLE.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MOVES INTO THE REGION ON 
FRIDAY.  WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. A WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED DURING THE 
LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX FOR TEMPERATURES.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             28  16  33  14  42 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  24  15  30  13  38 /  10  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       24  15  29  12  38 /  10  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              22  11  28  10  37 /  30  10   0   0  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND CHILL ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

SUBSTANTIVE CHANGES AT THIS TIME.

458 
FXUS64 KMRX 082005 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED FORECAST LOWS FOR TRI
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST FRI JAN 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS...WITH ITS VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS EXTENDING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
DOMINATE THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH 
COLD AND DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUING OVER THE REGION. AREA RADARS 
CURRENTLY REVEAL MINIMAL SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD INCREASE IN 
COVERAGE TONIGHT AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AXIS OVER THE MID WEST 
NEARS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL SWING ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP A MENTION OF SCATTERED 
SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
INCLUDING THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE 
ONLY A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH...WITH STEEP 
LAPSE RATES CONFINED TO A SHALLOW BOUNDARY LAYER BELOW 850 MB. 
THUS...EXPECT ONLY LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS WITH THE RESULTING UPSLOPE FLOW...MAINLY DUE TO THE COLD 
GROUND TEMPS AND A HIGH LIQUID TO SNOW RATIO CREATING EXCELLENT 
CONDITIONS FOR ACCUMULATIONS. WITH ALL OF THIS MIND...WILL CONTINUE 
THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL CANCEL THE ADVISORY FOR NORTHEAST TN WHERE 
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE AROUND AN INCH OR LESS. BREEZY 
WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY THROUGH TONIGHT AS WELL. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO UNDERCUT THEM AND FOLLOWING A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST DUE TO SOME LINGERING SNOW COVER ACROSS THE 
AREA.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD...DRY ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE 
IN PLACE OVER THE REGION WILL BE MODERATING ON MONDAY...WITH MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS SEEING TEMPERATURES REACH INTO THE 30S. THE WARMING 
TREND WILL CONTINUE ON TUESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES APPROACHING NEAR 
NORMAL VALUES. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS THROUGH THE 
REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. MODEL RUN CONSISTENCY QUITE POOR BY THE 
END OF THE EXTENDED. A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO SLIDE 
ACROSS THE NORTH CWA ON TUESDAY. MOISTURE AND LIFT RATHER LIMITED 
AND WILL INTRODUCE ONLY LOW POPS FOR FAR NORTHERN LOCATIONS. HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGING BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. AN 
APPROACHING SYSTEM COULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA FRIDAY. CONFIDENCE 
LOW ON TIMING AND POSITIONS OF SYSTEM BUT WILL BRING IN SOME LOW 
POPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   16  28  16  31  16 /  20  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     13  25  13  28  13 /  40  20  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             13  25  13  29  13 /  30  20  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     5  22   5  27   5 /  50  30  20   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 6 AM EST SATURDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

     WIND CHILL ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 6 AM EST SATURDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1055 AM EST FRI JAN 8 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...WITH A VERY COLD AND DRY AIR 
MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL SINK 
SOUTH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION TODAY...WITH SCATTERED 
SNOW SHOWERS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY OVER 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL PLAN TO KEEP THE ADVISORIES IN EFFECT 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...SINCE SOME OF THESE SNOW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY 
PRODUCE ADDITIONAL LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN A FEW AREAS. WILL 
ALSO KEEP THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR THE MOUNTAINS... 
SINCE BREEZY WINDS THIS AFTERNOON WILL LIKELY CAUSE WIND CHILL 
VALUES TO DROP BELOW -5 DEGREES AT TIMES.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING AND TO LOWER TEMPS A 
LITTLE DUE TO THE SNOW COVER AND COLD START THIS MORNING.

287 
FXUS64 KMRX 080833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 AM EST FRI JAN 8 2010

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
IR SATELLITE SHOWS BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS JUST UPSTREAM OF OUR AREA IN 
MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY. THUS THE LIGHT SNOW SHOULD COME TO AN END 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. MOST AREAS MAY SEE SOME SUN 
THIS MORNING...MAINLY IN THE SOUTH. HAVE LOWERED POPS TO A CHANCE 
UNTIL 18Z. SURFACE OBS SHOW SNOW BEING REPORTED ACROSS IL AND 
IN...ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROPOPAUSE FOLD AND MIDLEVEL TROUGH. VERY 
COLD 500 MB TEMPS MOVE OVER THE AREA BY THE EVENING...AND THE 850 MB 
WINDS SHIFT TO A MORE NORTHERLY DIRECTION...WITH TRAJECTORIES OFF 
THE GREAT LAKES TO PROVIDE MOISTURE. WILL RAISE POPS BACK TO LIKELY 
IN THE NORTH THIS AFTERNOON. SYNOPTIC LIFT IS NOT VERY STRONG...SO 
QPF SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT...LESS THAN 2 INCHES OF SNOW WITH A 15:1 
RATIO (WHICH HAS BEEN CALCULATED AT OUR OFFICE). OF GREATER CONCERN 
THAN SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE THE IMPACT OF ADDITIONAL SNOW ON TOP OF 
ALREADY-POOR ROAD CONDITIONS. WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY FOR NE TN...SW VA...AND THE TN MOUNTAINS...AND REMOVE SW NC 
AS THE MORE NORTHERLY FLOW WILL BE LESS FAVORABLE FOR UPSLOPE THERE. 
THE ADVISORY MAY NEED TO BE EXTENDED INTO THE EVENING PERIOD TONIGHT 
FOR PORTIONS OF THE AREA...BUT WILL KEEP IT UNTIL 6 PM FOR NOW. WILL 
ALSO EXTEND THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH 6 PM 
AS 850 MB TEMPS LOOK TO BE -17 TO -14 C WITH WINDS 10-20 MPH INTO 
THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP 
THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTHERN AREAS WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE 
LINGERS.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY.  
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA ON 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY ON THE STRENGTH OF 
THE FEATURE...WILL KEEP BOTH PERIODS DRY FOR NOW.  HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.  A 
WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD. 
STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX FOR TEMPERATURES.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             27  16  29  16  34 /  10  10  10  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  25  14  28  15  31 /  20  20  30  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       24  14  28  14  30 /  20  10  30  10   0

FXUS64 KMRX 071934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST THU JAN 7 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE NEAR INDIANAPOLIS...WITH ITS 
TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THIS COLD 
FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON...AND SHOULD COMPLETELY EXIT THE AREA AFTER SUNSET. AREA 
RADARS CURRENTLY REVEAL SOME LIGHT SNOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT 
THE PEAK INTENSITY OF THIS SNOWFALL SHOULD OCCUR AROUND SUNSET. THE 
LATEST RUNS OF BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE LESS MOISTURE 
WITH THIS COLD FRONT TONIGHT...AND WITH ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WITH COLD GROUND TEMPS AND A HIGH 
LIQUID TO SNOW RATIO EXPECTED...IT STILL APPEARS THAT A FEW INCHES 
OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE BY THIS EVENING. MODELS SEEM 
TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...AND REVEAL A SHALLOW 
LAYER OF MOISTURE WITH THE STEEP LAPSE RATES CONFINED TO BELOW 850 
MB. THUS...EXPECT ONLY LIGHT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WITH THE UPSLOPE FLOW 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH ALL OF THIS MIND...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES WITHOUT ANY CHANGES TO PREVIOUS THINKING. 
WINDS BEHIND THE FRONT ARE PROGGED TO BECOME BREEZY ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT...WITH WIND CHILLS EXPECTED TO DROP BELOW 
THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY CRITERIA OF -5 DEGREES FOR SEVERAL HOURS 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. THUS...WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR LATE 
TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT 
WILL UNDERCUT THEM DUE TO SOME SNOW COVER EXPECTED ACROSS THE AREA.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WITH DRY AND SUNNY 
CONDITIONS...THE ARCTIC AIR MASS IN PLACE OVER THE REGION WILL BEGIN 
TO SLOWLY MODERATE ON SUNDAY. BY MONDAY...MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS 
SHOULD SEE TEMPERATURES REACH ABOVE THE FREEZING MARK. THE WARMING 
TREND CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES EXPECT TO BE NEAR 
NORMAL. SEASONAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED. MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH TRACK AND TIMING OF A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE REGION AROUND THE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY 
TIME FRAME. TREND HAS BEEN TO KEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT TO OUR SOUTH 
AND EAST SO FOR NOW...WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EST THU JAN 7 2010

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE 
ILLINOIS/INDIANA BORDER...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
SOUTHWEST ALONG THE MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE 
TO QUICKLY MOVE EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNSET. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SOME LIGHT SNOW FLURRIES CURRENTLY MOVING INTO THE AREA... 
BUT WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE...THINK THAT ANY ACCUMULATING 
SNOWFALL WILL DEVELOP LATER THIS AFTERNOON AS THE COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF SOME WITH 
THEIR FORECASTED PRECIP AMOUNTS WITH THIS FRONT...BUT BELIEVE THERE 
WILL BE A HIGH LIQUID TO SNOW RATIO WITH THIS FRONT. THUS...IT STILL 
APPEARS THAT A FEW INCHES OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE BY 
THIS EVENING...ESPECIALLY WITH COLD GROUND TEMPS FROM THE RECENT 
COLD SPELL. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST STILL APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL 
PLAN TO UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING AND TO TWEAK 
TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 AM EST THU JAN 7 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS AND SREF ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH TIMING AND INTENSITY OF APPROACHING SYSTEM TODAY. ALL 
HAVE BACKED OFF SLIGHTLY IN QPF ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT AS MODEL 
TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT ONLY MODEST MOISTURE AND LIFT PROFILE. THUS HAVE 
BACKED OFF SLIGHTLY ON QPF AND SNOWFALL ALTHOUGH WILL CONTINUE WSW 
FOR ENTIRE AREA. POPS DROP OFF RAPIDLY BEHIND FRONT IN SECOND PERIOD 
BUT COLD ADVECTION COMMENCES WITH TEMPS ONCE AGAIN DROPPING TO 
VALUES WELL BELOW CLIMO. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY CONTINUED TO TREND TO 
UNDERCUT MAV GUIDANCE SOMEWHAT

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ARCTIC AIRMASS PLUS 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGHINESS ACROSS THE REGION IN THE EARLY PERIODS...
WILL KEEP SOME SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES INTO SATURDAY 
NIGHT. THE FAVORED LOCATIONS WILL BE SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES...WHERE OUR 
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS ALREADY HAVE THIS SCENARIO COVERED QUITE 
WELL.

THE ARCTIC AIRMASS WILL MODIFY BY SUNDAY...BUT STILL A CHILLY NIGHT 
IN STORE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
SETTLES ACROSS THE REGION...AND CLOUDS MAKE AN EXIT. BRIEF UPPER 
RIDGING ON MONDAY...BEFORE ECMWF AND GFS DROP ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH ACROSS THE SE STATES ON TUESDAY. GFS CRANKS OUT SOME FLURRIES 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN WITH THIS TROUGH...WHILE ECMWF LOOKS DRY.
OPTED TO IGNORE THIS TRACE PRECIPITATION FOR NOW. SURFACE AND UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE BUILD ACROSS THE SE STATES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...
BRINGING DRY WEATHER AND A WARMING TREND.

FOR TEMPS...UNDERCUT GFSX MOS WHILE IN THE ARCTIC AIRMASS AND SOME 
SNOW MAY BE AROUND...THEN TRENDED GRADUALLY CLOSER TO GFSX BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK.

115 
FXUS64 KMRX 061940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST WED JAN 6 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A LEE TROUGH LOCATED ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS 
OF THE APPALACHIANS. THIS AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION ON THURSDAY...BRINGING A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY AND ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY SUNSET. SOUTHERLY WINDS 
AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA...ALONG WITH A BRIEF WARMING TREND. WITH TEMPS 
RISING INTO THE UPPER 30S ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN THURSDAY AFTERNOON... 
THERE MIGHT BE A BRIEF MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW...BUT FOR MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA IT WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR ALL SNOW. WITH COLD GROUND 
TEMPS FROM THE RECENT COLD SPELL...THINK THAT THIS SNOW WILL 
ACCUMULATE QUICKLY WITH A HIGH SNOW TO LIQUID RATIO DUE TO THE COLD 
AIR IN PLACE. MODELS SEEM TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH EXPECTED 
PRECIP AMOUNTS...AND THUS...EXPECT ADVISORY-LEVEL ACCUMULATIONS DUE 
TO THE FAST MOVEMENT OF THIS COLD FRONT. THE PEAK OF THIS SNOWFALL 
WILL LIKELY OCCUR AROUND SUNSET...AND THEN QUICKLY EXIT THE AREA BY 
MIDNIGHT. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL THEN SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY...PRODUCING SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA... 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AN 
ADDITIONAL INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE VALLEY 
AREAS ON FRIDAY...WITH UPSLOPE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS 
PRODUCING SEVERAL MORE INCHES. BY FRIDAY NIGHT...TOTAL SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS WILL LIKELY BE IN THE THREE TO SIX INCH RANGE ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS 
POSSIBLE ON THE HIGHEST PEAKS. WITH AN AVERAGE OF SIX INCHES IN 24 
HOURS NEEDED FOR WARNING CRITERIA...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE AN ADVISORY 
AREAWIDE TO COVER THIS EVENT SINCE THIS WILL BE A LONG DURATION 
SNOWFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL TREND TOWARDS THE 
COOLER NAM NUMBERS ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WITH SOME SNOW COVER 
EXPECTED ACROSS THE AREA.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROF CONTINUES 
TO BUILD SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY 
WHICH WILL KEEP A NORTHERLY FLOW IN PLACE THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND. 
THIS WILL ALLOW ARCTIC AIR TO SPILL SOUTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
KEEPING MAX/MIN TEMPS WELL BELOW NORMAL. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT ON A LENGTHY PERIOD OF NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL KEEP 
SNOW SHOWERS GOING ON SATURDAY WITH EMPHASIS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
THE OROGRAPHIC SNOW WILL TAPER OFF LATER SATURDAY NIGHT. UPPER LEVEL 
HEIGHTS WILL GRADUALLY BUILD LATER SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WITH DRY 
ADVECTION ALLOWING FOR A RETURN TO SOME SUNSHINE AND SLOWLY 
MODIFYING TEMPERATURES. MODELS HAVE SOME TIMING ISSUES WITH THE 
ECMWF A LITTLE SLOWER THAN THE GFS DEPICTION FOR ANOTHER STORM 
SYSTEM ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS HINT AT A POSSIBLE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT 
WAVE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. FOR NOW WILL KEEP POP AT SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SNOW AND/OR RAIN SHOWERS DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME RANGE.
&&

771 
FXUS64 KMRX 060808
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EST WED JAN 6 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BRIEF RESPITE IN COLD TEMP REGIME 
EXPECTED IN THE SHORT TERM AS STRONG NORTHWESTERLY FLOW RELAXES AND 
WEAK UPPER RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
ALTHOUGH SOME TEMP MODERATION IS EXPECTED TODAY...HAVE CONTINUED TO 
UNDERCUT MAV GUIDANCE SOMEWHAT AS TEMPS WILL HAVE A LONG WAY TO 
RECOVER FROM THIS MORNING'S VERY COLD TEMPS. CONTINUED ISOLATED SNOW 
SHOWER ACTIVITY FOR HIGHER TERRAIN OF NORTHEASTERN ZONES FOR THE 
FIRST PORTION OF THE FIRST PERIOD AS LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE IS PROJECTED 
TO LINGER THERE LONGER.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...CERTAINLY THE MOST 
INTERESTING AND SIGNIFICANT PERIODS ARE LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. 
TEMPERATURE PROFILE INDICATES ALL SNOW...WITH A LITTLE MORE 
PRECIPITABLE WATER TO WORK WITH INITIALLY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...
BEFORE THE ARCTIC AIR SURGES SOUTHWARD AGAIN ON FRIDAY. AVAILABLE 
MOISTURE FOR SNOW DROPS FROM AROUND 4/10THS OF AN INCH EARLY TO 
AROUND 1/10 TO 2/10THS BY 12Z FRIDAY. THIS...PLUS THE FAST MOVEMENT 
OF THE SYSTEM...SHOULD WORK TO LIMIT SNOW AMOUNTS MOSTLY INTO THE 
ADVISORY CRITERIA RANGE. WINTER WEATHER DESK PROGS...AS WELL AS 
SHORT RANGE MODELS SNOW AMOUNTS...ALSO AGREE WITH THIS BEING MAINLY 
AN ADVISORY EVENT. SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES WILL LINGER WELL INTO 
SATURDAY...BUT THE SHALLOWNESS OF MOISTURE IN THE ARCTIC AIRMASS 
WILL PUT US BACK TO THE DRY FLUFFY SNOW WE HAVE HAD FOR THE PAST FEW 
DAYS (WHICH DOES NOT ACCUMULATE IN SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS). 

AFTER SOME GREAT COORDINATION WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES...FEEL 
MORE CONFIDENT IN UPDATING OUR SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT (SPS) THAN
ISSUING A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR LATE 3RD PERIOD INTO EARLY 4TH 
PERIOD. I DID RAISE POPS SLIGHTLY IN THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS 
FRIDAY TO LOW END OF LIKELY...AND ADJUSTED SNOW AMOUNT GRID UP 
SLIGHTLY FOR 06-12Z FRIDAY.

ARCTIC SURFACE HIGH GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
EAST TO BRING ABOUT SOME DRY WEATHER AND MORE SEASONAL TEMPS EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...UNTIL THIS OCCURS...I PREFERRED TO UNDERCUT MOS 
FOR ESPECIALLY HIGH TEMPS EACH DAY...WHICH KEPT OUR GRIDS MORE 
CONSISTENT WITH ADJACENT OFFICES.

541 
FXUS64 KMRX 052010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST TUE JAN 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH 
THE REGION BRINGING LIGHT SNOW TO THE NORTHERN AREAS AND THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS TONIGHT.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THOSE AREAS FOR 
TONIGHT.  COULD SEE ANOTHER 1-2 INCHES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SO 
WILL KEEP THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING INTO THE EARLY EVENING 
HOURS.  THE BREEZY CONDITIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS COMBINED WITH THE 
COLD TEMPERATURES WILL RESULT COLD WIND CHILLS...WILL LEAVE THE 
CURRENT WIND CHILL ADVISORY GOING FOR TONIGHT.  THE SHORTWAVE SHOULD 
SHOULD EXIT THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING SO WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON DRY FOR NOW.  TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE IS RELATIVELY CLOSE FOR 
TONIGHT...SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL 
AGAIN.  FOR TOMORROW...STAYED A BIT COOLER THAN THE MAV NUMBERS FOR 
WEDNESDAY...BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM...WITH EASTERN TROUGH AND COLD 
PATTERN PERSISTING THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  UPPER LOW DROPPING 
SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL BRING A SURFACE 
TROUGH/COLD FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA SOMETIME IN THE THU/EARLY 
THURSDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. MODELS STILL HAVE SOME DISAGREEMENT ON 
EXACT TIMING...BUT LOOKS LIKE WE WILL SEE A BAND OF SNOW MOVING 
ACROSS THE AREA...WITH MOST LIKELY TIMING THU LATE MORNING INTO 
EARLY THU EVENING.  BEST FORCING SHOULD OCCUR OVER A FAIRLY BRIEF 
PERIOD...SO THINK ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE...BUT AT 
THIS TIME A GENERAL 1 TO 3 INCH TYPE SNOWFALL LOOKS POSSIBLE BY LATE 
THU NIGHT.  SINCE WARNING CRITERIA SNOW LOOKS UNLIKELY AT LEAST FOR 
MOST OF THE AREA AT THIS TIME...WILL NOT ISSUE A WATCH...BUT WILL 
ISSUE AN SPS OUTLOOK.  SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER ESPECIALLY HIGHER 
TERRAIN INTO SATURDAY OR SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN SHOULD BE DRY SUNDAY.
LOW CONFIDENCE FOR THE EARLY WEEK PERIOD...AS MODEL AGREEMENT AND 
CONTINUITY POOR.  FOR NOW WILL SIDE WITH THE GFS AND KEEP THINGS DRY 
BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  MAIN ADJUSTMENTS TO GFS MOS TEMPS WILL BE 
TO  GO LOWER ON SOME HIGH TEMPS...INCLUDING THU.

FXUS64 KMRX 050750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EST TUE JAN 5 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PERSISTENT WEATHER PATTERN WITH 
COLD ARCTIC AIRMASS AND SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO SQUEEZE OUT 
SNOW FLURRIES AND OCNL SNOW SHOWERS OVER SW VA AND PARTS OF NE TN.
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK...AS NOT MUCH MORE THAN FLURRIES 
NOTED THIS MORNING OUTSIDE OF OUR ADVISORY AREAS. DIFFICULT TO KNOW 
HOW MUCH LIGHT FLUFFY SNOW MAY HAVE ACCUMULATED OVER SW VA AND NE TN 
SO FAR...AND IN THE SMOKIES. SNOWFALL EARLY MONDAY MORNING WAS AS 
DRY AS I HAVE SEEN...LYING ON ROADS AND GRASSY AREAS...BUT LITTLE IF 
ANY WATER EQUIVALENT TO STICK MUCH. CONSIDERING THIS...FEEL THAT ANY 
SNOW ACCUMS IN THE ADVISORY AREAS WILL BE LIGHT AND GENERALLY IN 
LINE WITH CURRENT FORECAST GRIDS.

WILL ACCEPT THAT LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES OVER SW VA AND 
EXTREME NE TN TONIGHT WON'T REALLY AMOUNT TO MUCH...AND NOT EXTEND 
OUR WINTER WEATHER (MISERABLE WEATHER) ADVISORY BEYOND TODAY. DID 
DECIDE TO ISSUE ANOTHER WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR THIS EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT FOR THE SMOKY AND NRN MTNS OF EAST TN.

OTHERWISE...UNDERCUTTING GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS LOOKS GOOD FOR YET 
ANOTHER DAY...AS WE STRUGGLE TO SEE LITTLE IF ANY SPOTS WARM TO 32 
DEGREES OR BETTER. CLOUD COVERED AREAS HAVE NOT DROPPED QUITE AS 
MUCH AS MOS HAS SUGGESTED FOR MINS...SO I MADE A FEW TWEAKS TO MIN 
TEMPS FOR TONIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LONG WAVE TROUGH AND 
NEGATIVE HEIGHT ANOMALIES WILL PERSIST OVER THE EASTERN CONUS 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. ANOTHER 
VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE AND SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON THURSDAY. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
COLD ENOUGH TO SUPPORT AN ALL SNOW EVENT BUT MODELS INDICATE THIS
SYSTEM WILL PROGRESS THROUGH AREA QUITE RAPIDLY WHICH SHOULD LIMIT
SNOWFALL POTENTIAL. SNOW EXPECTED TO TAPER TO SNOW SHOWERS BY
THURSDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE SWINGS THROUGH
THE AREA ON SATURDAY BUT MODELS DEPICT MOISTURE TO BE LIMITED WITH
THIS FEATURE. AMPLITUDE OF LONG WAVE TROUGH RELAXES BY LATE IN THE
LONG TERM PERIOD SUGGESTING MODEST TEMPERATURE MODERATION.
NEVERTHELESS...HEIGHTS STILL PROJECTED TO BE LOWER THAN CLIMO AND
THUS TEMPS EXPECTED TO REMAIN BELOW CLIMO. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY
TENDED TO CONTINUE TO UNDERCUT MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

PREDOMINANTLY VFR...BUT MAY LOWER TO MVFR FOR A PERIOD DURING THIS
TIME. CHA SHOULD REMAIN VFR THROUGH THE PERIOD...THOUGH CEILINGS
WILL BE OCCASIONALLY BROKEN TO OVERCAST ABOVE 3 KFT. EXPECT
IMPROVING CONDITIONS AFTER 18Z TOMORROW AS DEEPER MOISTURE EXITS
THE AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST MON JAN 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE REGION BRINGING SNOW TO THE AREA. SNOW INTENSITY SHOULD 
INCREASE TONIGHT AS THE DISTURBANCE APPROACHES.  WILL KEEP THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES IN NORTH AND MOUNTAINS WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS 
AVAILABLE FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WILL SEE THE HIGHEST SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS...WILL KEEP THE CURRENT WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY GOING AS IS.  ANOTHER COLD NIGHT EXPECTED FOR 
TONIGHT ALONG WITH BREEZY WINDS.  WILL KEEP THE CURRENT WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY GOING FOR THE MOUNTAINS AS WELL.  STAYED BELOW THE 
MAV GUIDANCE WITH THE COLD AIR AND SNOW EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
IN OVERALL PATTERN FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...WITH PERSISTENT 
TROUGHING IN THE EAST KEEPING A COLD PATTERN IN PLACE.  
HOWEVER...THERE ARE DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS.  GFS IS FASTER THAN 
THE 12Z NAM AND 00Z ECMWF WITH THE DIGGING UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED 
REINFORCING COLD FRONT THAT ARE FORECAST TO AFFECT THE AREA THURSDAY 
INTO FRIDAY.  THINK A COMPROMISE IS IN ORDER...SO WILL CARRY CHANCE 
POPS EXCEPT LIKELY PLATEAU COUNTIES FOR THU...THEN LIKELY NORTH AND 
CHANCE SOUTH FOR THU NIGHT.  DEEPER MOISTURE SHOULD BE DEPARTING 
FRIDAY...SO WILL BACK OFF TO SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
VALLEY AREAS...WITH CHANCE MOST OTHER AREAS.  SHOULD ALL BE 
SNOW...AND RIGHT NOW STILL LOOKS LIKE MOST AREAS WILL SEE AT LEAST 
SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATION. HOWEVER...STILL TOO MUCH UNCERTAINTY AND 
TOO EARLY FOR ANY WATCHES OR ADVISORIES.  SHOULD HAVE SOME LINGERING 
SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES INTO THE WEEKEND...AND WILL GO DRY ON MONDAY 
FOR NOW.  WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A BIT FOR HIGHS 
WED...BUT OVERALL WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS FOR THE 
PERIOD.

474 
FXUS64 KMRX 041522
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1022 AM EST MON JAN 4 2010

.DISCUSSION...SNOW FALLING AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE...WILL BUMP UP POPS 
AND SNOW AMOUNTS A BIT FOR TODAY.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
FORECAST ON TRACK. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...BUSY SHIFT SO WILL KEEP AFD 
SHORT. MODELS TRENDING A LITTLE DEEPER ON MOISTURE TONIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY...WITH SOME LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE COMPONENT TO WINDS...PLUS ONE 
OR TWO VORTICITY MAXES/SPEED MAXES TO CLIP SW VA AND NE TN.

THIS ARCTIC AIRMASS IS VERY COLD AND DRIER THAN A TYPICAL WINTER 
AIRMASS...SO WE EXPECT A DRY/FLUFFY SNOW WITH A REALLY HIGH SNOW TO 
LIQUID RATIO...THUS COULD SEE SOME ADVISORY SNOW AMOUNTS MET BY 
TUESDAY MORNING (OR EARLIER?). GOOD COORDINATION WITH NEIGHBORING 
NWS OFFICES ON INCREASING POPS TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY FOR THE FAVORED 
AREAS. OPTED TO ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES
...PLUS YET ANOTHER WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR OUR NRN AND SMOKY MTNS 
ALSO FOR TONIGHT THRU NOON TUESDAY. 

OTHERWISE...SOME STRAY SNOW FLURRIES AROUND THIS MORNING...BUT THE 
MOISTURE LOOKS QUITE SHALLOW FOR MUCH MORE THAN FLURRIES UNTIL 
TONIGHT. GFS MOS MAX TEMPS LOOK WELL OUT OF REACH GIVEN PERSISTENCE 
IN THIS COLD ARCTIC AIRMASS...SO KEPT HIGHS BELOW GFS CLOSER TO NAM 
MOS. LOWERED MTN MINS A BIT FOR TONIGHT...WHILE SIMILAR MOS MINS 
LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT. SAME REASONING AS BEFORE FOR UNDERCUTTING 
WARMER HIGHS ON TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY CONSIDERING POTENTIAL FOR A 
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION AND CONTINUED COLD AIR ADVECTION.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING NE TN AND SW VA STILL HAVE DEEP ENOUGH MOISTURE 
WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY PASSING THROUGH FOR LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS 
BUT NO SIGNIFICANT ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS. LATER WEDNESDAY DRIER 
AIR AND SLIGHT RIDGING WILL WARM TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES BUT ONLY 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY EXPECTED TO GO BRIEFLY ABOVE FREEZING. 
LATE WEDNESDAY UPPER LOW DEVELOPS ACROSS NORTHERN PLAINS WITH WEAK 
LOW PRESSURE AREA ACROSS MID MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE 
WILL SPREAD RAPIDLY EAST INTO TN VALLEY OVERNIGHT. ATMOSPHERE 
BECOMES SATURATED BY MORNING WITH SNOW DEVELOPING AND THEN TAPERING 
OFF THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE SOUTH. FLOW BECOMES NW BEHIND FRONT WHICH 
SHOULD PASS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WITH ADDITIONAL NW FLOW TYPE 
SNOWFALL FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WITH ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY 
MOUNTAINS AND NE AREAS. SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MOISTURE BECOMES 
VERY SHALLOW SO KEPT THIS TIME PERIOD DRY ALTHOUGH TEMPERATURES 
STILL COLD. GFS NOT AS STRONG WITH THURSDAY/FRIDAY SYSTEM AS 24 
HOURS AGO AND NOT PRODUCING SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ABOVE ADVISORY LEVELS 
SO WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY WATCH FOR NOW. HOWEVER THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
OF SNOW FROM THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
NE WILL LIKELY PROMPT A WATCH TO BE ISSUED BY TUESDAY.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 040922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EST MON JAN 4 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...BUSY SHIFT SO WILL KEEP AFD 
SHORT. MODELS TRENDING A LITTLE DEEPER ON MOISTURE TONIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY...WITH SOME LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE COMPONENT TO WINDS...PLUS ONE 
OR TWO VORTICITY MAXES/SPEED MAXES TO CLIP SW VA AND NE TN.

THIS ARCTIC AIRMASS IS VERY COLD AND DRIER THAN A TYPICAL WINTER 
AIRMASS...SO WE EXPECT A DRY/FLUFFY SNOW WITH A REALLY HIGH SNOW TO 
LIQUID RATIO...THUS COULD SEE SOME ADVISORY SNOW AMOUNTS MET BY 
TUESDAY MORNING (OR EARLIER?). GOOD COORDINATION WITH NEIGHBORING 
NWS OFFICES ON INCREASING POPS TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY FOR THE FAVORED 
AREAS. OPTED TO ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES
...PLUS YET ANOTHER WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR OUR NRN AND SMOKY MTNS 
ALSO FOR TONIGHT THRU NOON TUESDAY. 

OTHERWISE...SOME STRAY SNOW FLURRIES AROUND THIS MORNING...BUT THE 
MOISTURE LOOKS QUITE SHALLOW FOR MUCH MORE THAN FLURRIES UNTIL 
TONIGHT. GFS MOS MAX TEMPS LOOK WELL OUT OF REACH GIVEN PERSISTENCE 
IN THIS COLD ARCTIC AIRMASS...SO KEPT HIGHS BELOW GFS CLOSER TO NAM 
MOS. LOWERED MTN MINS A BIT FOR TONIGHT...WHILE SIMILAR MOS MINS 
LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT. SAME REASONING AS BEFORE FOR UNDERCUTTING 
WARMER HIGHS ON TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY CONSIDERING POTENTIAL FOR A 
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION AND CONTINUED COLD AIR ADVECTION.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING NE TN AND SW VA STILL HAVE DEEP ENOUGH MOISTURE 
WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY PASSING THROUGH FOR LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS 
BUT NO SIGNIFICANT ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS. LATER WEDNESDAY DRIER 
AIR AND SLIGHT RIDGING WILL WARM TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES BUT ONLY 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY EXPECTED TO GO BRIEFLY ABOVE FREEZING. 
LATE WEDNESDAY UPPER LOW DEVELOPS ACROSS NORTHERN PLAINS WITH WEAK 
LOW PRESSURE AREA ACROSS MID MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE 
WILL SPREAD RAPIDLY EAST INTO TN VALLEY OVERNIGHT. ATMOSPHERE 
BECOMES SATURATED BY MORNING WITH SNOW DEVELOPING AND THEN TAPERING 
OFF THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE SOUTH. FLOW BECOMES NW BEHIND FRONT WHICH 
SHOULD PASS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WITH ADDITIONAL NW FLOW TYPE 
SNOWFALL FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WITH ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY 
MOUNTAINS AND NE AREAS. SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MOISTURE BECOMES 
VERY SHALLOW SO KEPT THIS TIME PERIOD DRY ALTHOUGH TEMPERATURES 
STILL COLD. GFS NOT AS STRONG WITH THURSDAY/FRIDAY SYSTEM AS 24 
HOURS AGO AND NOT PRODUCING SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ABOVE ADVISORY LEVELS 
SO WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY WATCH FOR NOW. HOWEVER THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
OF SNOW FROM THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
NE WILL LIKELY PROMPT A WATCH TO BE ISSUED BY TUESDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  25  15  29  15  33 /  10  30  30  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       27  16  29  15  33 /  10  20  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              24  15  24  15  30 /  30  60  60  10  10 

&&

NC...NONE.

     TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...
     NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...
     SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

CEILINGS WILL BE MVFR AT BOTH LOCATIONS AROUND 08-09Z. THE LAYER OF

CEILINGS SHOULD REMAIN THROUGH THE MORNING...RISING TO VFR IN THE

FXUS64 KMRX 032033
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EST SUN JAN 3 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...COLD AND DRY AIRMASS REMAINS IN 
PLACE TONIGHT. SECONDARY UPPER TROF SWINGS SE INTO THE AREA ON 
MONDAY. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE ACROSS N HALF OF MRX CWA.
MOISTURE IS LIMITED BUT SNOW GROWTH IS IDEA SO SCT SHOWERS AND 
FLURRIES ON THE INCREASE IN THE AFTN MAINLY ACROSS SW VA. COLD
TEMPS CONTINUE BUT WINDS WILL LOWER ENOUGH OVERNIGHT TO LESS THAN 
WIND CHILL CRITERIA. HOWEVER WIND CHILLS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS WILL 
BE COMMON.

.MID TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...COLD TEMPERATURES 
WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW FOR SW VA AND TN MTN AREAS.   
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD GENERALLY BE LESS THAN ONE INCH WITH HIGHER 
AMOUNTS ON THE NORTHERN TN/NC BORDER AND IN NORTHERN SW VA.  STAYED 
BELOW MEX GUIDANCE ON TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY.  WITH DEEP MOISTURE INDICATED... 
WILL BUMP UP POPS TO 50 PERCENT FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.  
UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...KEPT CHANCE 
POPS OVER THE  CWA ON FRIDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  
KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE IN FOR SATURDAY FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS AS THE 
UPPER LOW LINGERS.  THE LOW EXITS THE AREA BY SUNDAY...SO WILL KEEP 
SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.  BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR MOST OF  
THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

806 
FXUS64 KMRX 031531
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST SUN JAN 3 2010

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME LINGERING LOW CLOUDS ACROSS 
SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN...ALTHO VERY LITTLE RADAR RETURNS NOTED 
EXCEPT TO OUR NORTH OVER W VA. WEAK IMPULSES IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT 
MAY ADVECT SOME SCATTERED MID TO HIGH CLOUDS INTO THE AREA LATER 
TODAY. KEPT IN A MENTION OF FLURRIES FOR SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN FOR 
LATE TONIGHT...BUT LOW LEVELS APPEAR TOO DRY FOR MUCH MORE.

OTHERWISE...THE DRY ARCTIC AIRMASS IS STILL THE DOMINANT FEATURE. 
UNDERCUTTING GFS MOS HIGHS YESTERDAY WAS A GOOD MOVE...AND WILL GO 
SLIGHTLY BELOW GFS AGAIN TODAY (CLOSER TO COLDER NAM MOS). MOS 
GUIDANCE FOR MINS TONIGHT LOOKED GOOD AND WAS CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

WILL CONTINUE THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR THIS MORNING...BUT HOLD 
OFF JUST YET ON ISSUING ANOTHER ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT. WINDS DROP OFF 
A BIT...SO CRITERIA (5 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW ZERO) MAY NOT BE MET 
EXCEPT FOR A FEW SPOTS IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...NW FLOW TYPE SNOWFALL EVENT 
SHAPING UP FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
ROTATES AROUND COLD UPPER LOW OFF NE COAST. ARCTIC AIR KEEPS 
TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING. SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE IN 
THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND SW VA. WEDNESDAY LOOKS TO BE A DRY DAY AND 
SUNNY AS SLIGHT RIDGING MOVES INTO TN VALLEY. A SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
PRODUCING SYSTEM DEVELOPS WEDNESDAY OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
PLAINS. GFS TRACKS A LOW PRESSURE AREA ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
THURSDAY AS SNOW MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THURSDAY NIGHT THE 
FRONT PASSES THROUGH WITH WRAP AROUND SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE FRIDAY 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT BEFORE SKIES BEGIN CLEARING SATURDAY. GFS SHOWS 48 
HOUR SNOWFALL MAY BE 6 TO 8 INCHES BY SATURDAY MORNING. HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TO 50 PERCENT THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL NEED TO WATCH 
FURTHER MODEL RUNS AND MAY NEED TO ISSUE A WATCH BY MONDAY FOR SNOW 
THURSDAY.  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  28  13  28  13  29 /   0  10  10  10  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST SAT JAN 2 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...STRONG SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO RIDGE INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW. AIRMASS
BECOMING EXTREMELY DRY AND COLD. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL REMAIN STRONG 
ENOUGH TONIGHT TO RESULT IN WIND CHILL VALUES 5 BELOW ZERO OR LESS 
ACROSS NORTHERN AND MOUNTAINOUS AREAS TONIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY. 
TEMP/DP FORECAST CONTINUES BELOW MOS GUIDANCE WHICH IS STILL 
CATCHING UP TO LOW READINGS. LAKE MICHIGAN MOISTURE MAY STREAM INTO 
NORTH AREAS AT TIMES WITH LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH ON 
TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE LINGERS.  HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  A TROUGH ENTERS THE 
AREA ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
OVER THE ENTIRE CWA ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD 
BE OF THE AREA BY SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY.  BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  
STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

709 
FXUS64 KMRX 021255 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
755 AM EST SAT JAN 2 2010

.DISCUSSION...QUICK UPDATE DUE TO ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VA AND NE TN. MODELS NOT HANDLING WHAT NATURE IS SENDING
OUR WAY THIS MORNING...BUT MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO BE GONE AFTER
THIS MORNING...SO ONLY RAN WINTER WX ADVISORY THROUGH NOON.


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDINESS OVERSPREADING THE 
NRN 2/3RDS TO 3/4THS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WHILE COLD 
AIR ADVECTION AND SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE MAY SQUEEZE OUT 
FLURRIES OR A FEW SNOW SHOWERS. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOK RIGHT 
ON TRACK WITH LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES NEEDED.

OTHERWISE...MAIN CONCERN WILL BE COLD WIND CHILLS THIS MORNING...
AND ALSO AGAIN TONIGHT INTO MID SUNDAY MORNING. WILL UPDATE WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY FOR EARLY TODAY...AND ALSO ISSUE ONE FOR TONIGHT AT 
THIS TIME. STRONGER WINDS TODAY...BUT COLDER TEMPS TONIGHT AND EARLY 
SUNDAY WITH STILL 10 MPH OR BETTER WINDS LINGERING IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. 

COLDER NAM MAX TEMPS LOOKED BEST FOR TODAY...WHILE A MOS BLEND 
LOOKED BEST FOR TONIGHT...DUE TO LINGERING CLOUDS IN NE AREAS 
WHICH COULD AFFECT MIN TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD WEEK AHEAD AS COLD
UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES OVER THE EASTERN STATES AND RIDGING STAYS
FAR TO THE WEST. HIGH PRESSURE WITH VERY DRY AIRMASS SUNDAY AND
MOST OF SUNDAY NIGHT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SOME FLURRIES NE AREA AS
SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATES AROUND CLOSED UPPER LOW OFF THE NE STATES
AND INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. THE ECMWF SHOWS
THIS ENERGY CONTINUES MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THE GFS
KEEPING MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT DRY WITH MOISTURE AND SHORT WAVE
ENERGY MAINLY TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP FORECAST
UNCHANGED WITH CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS EASTERN MOUNTAINS OF TN AND
PART OF SW VA MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT BUT AMOUNTS SHOULD BE
LIGHT. MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM DEVELOPS BY MID WEEK WITH INCREASING
MOISTURE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING BY THURSDAY
MORNING CONTINUEING THROUGH FRIDAY. GFS BRINGS SYSTEM IN THURSDAY
WITH WRAPAROUND SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. IT SHOWS THE
DEEPEST MOISTURE ALONG THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE
ECMWF DEVELOPS SYSTEM A LITTLE MORE WITH A SOUTHERN STREAM AND
SLOWER ARRIVING MAINLY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. BOTH SCENARIOS
SHOULD GIVE THE REGION MAINLY SNOW WITH HIGHS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY
LOWER TO MID 30S SOUTH AND MID 20S TO NEAR 30 NORTH.


&&

SURFACE WINDS SHOULD DEVELOP AFTER SUNRISE...BUT I LOOK FOR VFR 
CONDITIONS AND DIMINISHING WINDS BY THIS EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EST FRI JAN 1 2010

.DISCUSSION...COLD AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER INTO THE AREA AND WILL 
BRING OVERNIGHT LOWS DOWN INTO THE TEENS AND 20S.  SOME SINGLE DIGIT 
READING ARE EXPECTED OVER HIGHER TERRAIN AND WITH A BREEZY NORTHWEST 
FLOW...WINDS CHILLS OF -5 TO -15 ARE EXPECTED.  THEREFORE...A WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THOSE AREAS.  ADDITIONALLY...A WEAK 
WAVE IS SLIDING THROUGH TONIGHT,...AND THIS COMBINED WITH THE 
UPSLOPE FLOW MAY GENERATING AREAS OF FLURRIES OR LIGHT SNOW IN 
NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS.  ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD REMAIN BELOW AN INCH.  
ALL ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
607 PM EST FRI JAN 1 2010

.AVIATION...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE MID MS/LOWER OH VALLEY REGION
MAY BRING SOME BROKEN CEILINGS TO TRI AND TYS TONIGHT. OBSERVED
CEILINGS IN THAT AREA ARE IN THE MVFR RANGE. THE LIFT WITH THE
TROUGH APPEARS TO WEAKEN AS IT APPROACHES...SO EXPECT CEILINGS TO
BE MARGINAL VFR/MVFR AT TRI TONIGHT...WITH VFR CEILINGS AT TYS. CHA
WILL LIKELY JUST SEE SCATTERED CLOUDS. WINDS MAY BE GUSTY TOMORROW
AS THE CLOUDS EXIT AND MIXING ENSUES...WILL HAVE GUSTS UP TO 22 KTS
AT TRI.

797 
FXUS64 KMRX 012039
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EST FRI JAN 1 2010

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...STRONG UPPER JET WILL 
MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA OVERNIGHT INITIATING A RECURRING THEME AS 
EAST U.S. TROF INCREASES IN AMPLITUDE THROUGH THE PERIOD. NW FLOW 
PERSISTS AS AREA REMAINS BETWEEN LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO THE 
NW AND LARGE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE TO THE NE. H85 TROF MOVE SE 
THROUGH THE AREA LATE TONIGHT. H85 TEMPS DROP TO BELOW -10C ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN MRX CWA WITH COLD CORE NEAR -18C ACROSS SW VA. WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY TONIGHT WILL BE NEEDED AGAIN SAT NGT AND WILL LIKELY 
BE EXPANDED IN COVERAGE. OVERALL TREND HAS BEEN SLIGHTLY COOLER AND 
DRIER THROUGH PERIOD SO SNOW THREAT LOOKS MINIMAL WITH ACCUMULATIONS 
LIMITED TO UPSLOPE AREAS. FCST TEMPS BELOW MOS GUIDANCE AND WELL BELOW 
NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH ON 
MONDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE IS PRESENT.  ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH ON TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
TUESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AGAIN WHERE THE BEST 
MOISTURE LINGERS.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  A TROUGH ENTERS THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO 
FRIDAY.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS OVER THE ENTIRE CWA ON THURSDAY AND 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED 
FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 011508

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST FRI JAN 1 2010

.DISCUSSION...COLD AIR ADVECTION BEGINNING TO MOVE IN WITH EARNEST.
TEMPS WILL STAY STEADY OR FALL TODAY. POPS REMOVED SINCE UPSTREAM 
MOISTURE LIMITED. A FEW FLURRIES POSSIBLE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD AIR ADVECTION IS LAGGING A 
BIT THIS MORNING...WITH SURFACE TEMPS APPARENTLY STILL ABOVE LOWER 
30S ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION...EVEN AS MILD AS LOWER 40S IN MANY 
SPOTS (SE TN/CENTRAL VALLEY/SW NC). WEAK RADAR RETURNS LIKELY SOME 
LIGHT RAIN...WITH PATCHY DRIZZLE PERSONALLY NOTED ON DRIVE TO WORK 
EARLIER. W TO NW SURFACE WINDS HAVE HELPED TO DISSIPATE AREAS OF FOG 
AND ALSO ALLOWED FOR CLOUD HEIGHTS TO SLIGHTLY IMPROVE FOR TAF SITES.

MOISTURE BECOMES INCREASINGLY SHALLOW BY MID TO LATE MORNING...WITH 
SUFFICIENT COLD AIR ALOFT ARRIVING TO SWITCH PRECIPITATION TYPE TO 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES FOR LATER TODAY. HOWEVER...TOP OF THE
LINGERING MOISTURE LAYER DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE COLD ENOUGH TO 
SUPPORT SNOW GROWTH TODAY. KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR 
TODAY...WITH LOW POPS IN OUR HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS OF NRN PLATEAU/ 
SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES. 

POTENTIAL UPPER AIR DISTURBANCE SEEMS TO BE PROGGED FOR TONIGHT... 
WITH A BRIEF RESURGENCE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FOR SW VA AND NE TN. 
HOWEVER...NOT A STRONG NW FLOW UPSLOPE SCENARIO INDICATED...SO I 
BACKED OFF POPS A BIT AND LOWERED SNOW AMOUNTS IN FAVORED AREAS TO 
ONLY AROUND ONE INCH OR SO. 

OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS LOOKED REASONABLE AND FOLLOWED IN GENERAL...
ALTHO HOURLY TEMPS TODAY WILL NOT FOLLOW A TYPICAL PATTERN...AS 
MAXES MAY OCCUR EARLY.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN 
CONTINUES SATURDAY WITH COLD AIR COMING SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA. 
UPPER LOW OVER PA MOVES NE OFF THE NE COAST BY SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL 
CONTINUE CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN SW VA AND FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS 
OF SMOKIES AND NE TN MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL 
MID 20S TO MID 30S. SATURDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY 
CLOUDY AND MUCH COLDER IN THE TEENS EXCEPT SINGLE DIGITS SW VA AND 
MOUNTAINS. FORECAST AREA BETWEEN SYSTEMS SUNDAY WITH SKIES SUNNY AND 
COLD. MONDAY AND TUESDAY KEPT FORECAST UNCHANGED. COLD UPPER LOW OFF 
NE COAST BRINGS SPOKES OF ENERGY AROUND THE BACKSIDE WITH ENOUGH 
MOISTURE FOR MORE SNOW SHOWERS NE TN AND SW VA. THE PERSISTENT LOW 
FINALLY MOVES AWAY AND HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS ANOTHER COLD DRY DAY TO 
THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A MORE SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN 
SYSTEM BEGINS TO DEVELOP OVER TX WEDNESDAY WITH ADDITIONAL 
DEVELOPMENT IN THE GULF WEDNESDAY NIGHT OVER THE GULF. THURSDAY 
SHOULD SEE SOME WARMING SOUTH FOR RAIN AND SNOW BUT STILL COLD 
ENOUGH HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NORTH FOR MORE SNOW. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             41  24  35  18  37 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  20  30  14  30 /  10  20  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       37  21  30  14  30 /  10  10  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              35  19  25  11  26 /  10  50  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 010914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EST FRI JAN 1 2010

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD AIR ADVECTION IS LAGGING A 
BIT THIS MORNING...WITH SURFACE TEMPS APPARENTLY STILL ABOVE LOWER 
30S ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION...EVEN AS MILD AS LOWER 40S IN MANY 
SPOTS (SE TN/CENTRAL VALLEY/SW NC). WEAK RADAR RETURNS LIKELY SOME 
LIGHT RAIN...WITH PATCHY DRIZZLE PERSONALLY NOTED ON DRIVE TO WORK 
EARLIER. W TO NW SURFACE WINDS HAVE HELPED TO DISSIPATE AREAS OF FOG 
AND ALSO ALLOWED FOR CLOUD HEIGHTS TO SLIGHTLY IMPROVE FOR TAF SITES.

MOISTURE BECOMES INCREASINGLY SHALLOW BY MID TO LATE MORNING...WITH 
SUFFICIENT COLD AIR ALOFT ARRIVING TO SWITCH PRECIPITATION TYPE TO 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES FOR LATER TODAY. HOWEVER...TOP OF THE
LINGERING MOISTURE LAYER DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE COLD ENOUGH TO 
SUPPORT SNOW GROWTH TODAY. KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR 
TODAY...WITH LOW POPS IN OUR HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS OF NRN PLATEAU/ 
SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES. 

POTENTIAL UPPER AIR DISTURBANCE SEEMS TO BE PROGGED FOR TONIGHT... 
WITH A BRIEF RESURGENCE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FOR SW VA AND NE TN. 
HOWEVER...NOT A STRONG NW FLOW UPSLOPE SCENARIO INDICATED...SO I 
BACKED OFF POPS A BIT AND LOWERED SNOW AMOUNTS IN FAVORED AREAS TO 
ONLY AROUND ONE INCH OR SO. 

OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS LOOKED REASONABLE AND FOLLOWED IN GENERAL...
ALTHO HOURLY TEMPS TODAY WILL NOT FOLLOW A TYPICAL PATTERN...AS 
MAXES MAY OCCUR EARLY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN
CONTINUES SATURDAY WITH COLD AIR COMING SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA.
UPPER LOW OVER PA MOVES NE OFF THE NE COAST BY SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL
CONTINUE CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN SW VA AND FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS
OF SMOKIES AND NE TN MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL
MID 20S TO MID 30S. SATURDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY
CLOUDY AND MUCH COLDER IN THE TEENS EXCEPT SINGLE DIGITS SW VA AND
MOUNTAINS. FORECAST AREA BETWEEN SYSTEMS SUNDAY WITH SKIES SUNNY
AND COLD. MONDAY AND TUESDAY KEPT FORECAST UNCHANGED. COLD UPPER
LOW OFF NE COAST BRINGS SPOKES OF ENERGY AROUND THE BACKSIDE WITH
ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR MORE SNOW SHOWERS NE TN AND SW VA. THE
PERSISTENT LOW FINALLY MOVES AWAY AND HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS ANOTHER
COLD DRY DAY TO THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A MORE
SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN SYSTEM BEGINS TO DEVELOP OVER TX WEDNESDAY
WITH ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE GULF WEDNESDAY NIGHT OVER THE
GULF. THURSDAY SHOULD SEE SOME WARMING SOUTH FOR RAIN AND SNOW BUT
STILL COLD ENOUGH HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NORTH FOR MORE SNOW.
